author: {'steamid': '76561198847902512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1712446959}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a charming pinball/metroidvania platformer game which follows the story of a cute little beetle named Yoku, who becomes the postmaster of Mokumana Island, an island which is under attack by a mysterious threat. 

It is such a charming and beautifully-illustrated game. I think that should be where any review about Yoku's Island Express starts. This expands the game's appeal to new audiences, because the cute artstyle really helped me over the line in terms of buying this game.

The world design is clever, with many pinball springboards located around the map allowing you to access parts of the story. I have learned a very valuable lesson in playing Yoku's Island Express, and that is the fact that I suck at pinball. I'm simply not very good at it, but I am in love with this game, because it isn't so much a game as it is a charm offensive. 

I don't usually care about a game's soundtrack either, but I have really enjoyed listening to this game's soundtrack. If it matters to you, the game's trailers feature quite a few pieces of music that are in the game.

Normally, a game like this wouldn't blow me away. There are simply too many of them to do so. But this one has, because it is near-perfect. The visual design, the gameplay, the audio design, all of it, is absolutely impeccable and it has made Villa Gorilla a team to watch in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041118099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 356, 'playtime_at_review': 1610, 'last_played': 1712276708}

author: {'steamid': '76561198385335806', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 987, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1711813072}
review:
没想到年轻人第一款打通关的类银竟然是三维弹球，手残党觉得比奥日好玩。
角色丰富有趣，故事简单易懂，不存在谜语人。
没有死亡惩罚，游泳不会淹死，没有限时破关，除了有些地方用炸弹要反复找角度、个别箱子暗道机关藏得非常阴险（？）以外，可以说是非常休闲愉快的游戏体验了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055534336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 536, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1711938882}
review: This is a amazing game. If you are like me and love pinball and metro-vanias, get this game now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088085293', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1709421008}
review:
Sehr süßes kleines Metroidvania. Die Kombination aus Pinball und Plattformer funktioniert super, wird aber nie wirklich komplex, da wär auf jeden Fall noch mehr drin gewesen. Dafür strotzt das Spiel vor Scharm und vom Artstyle bis zur Musik passt hier alles einfach zusammen. Allein das Backtracking wird durch die teilweise unskippbaren Pinball-Rätsel etwas zum Krampf. Insgesamt hat es mir sehr gut gefallen, auch wenn ich mit der Hauptgeschichte nach knapp vier Stunden schon wieder durch war.
Wertung: 78/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198065186307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1710683984}
review:
点数：8/10
日本語完備

ピンボールと探索型アクションを組み合わせたゲーム。
ゲームの舞台は南の島で、陽気そうなキャラクターが数多く登場。
BGMの質も良く、世界の雰囲気は非常に良い。
主人公は自力でのジャンプすら出来ないが、
至る所に設置されているフリッパーを使う事で移動が出来る。

ゲームとしては体力も残機もゲームオーバーも無く、
主人公を穴に落としても僅かにフルーツ（ゲーム内通貨）が減るだけとペナルティは無いに等しい。
このため、攻略を楽しむゲームというよりは探索を楽しむゲームとなっている。
ただし、ゲーム内容はどこまでいってもピンボールのため、
フリッパーで狙った場所に飛ばせないと同じ場所をグルグルと回り続ける事になる。
いずれは先に進めるとはいえ、技術か根気は必要。

author: {'steamid': '76561199136204263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 128, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1711578585}

author: {'steamid': '76561198353291626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1709936600}
review:
8/10.
Pinball metroidvania.
A unique take on the genre and a true hidden gem. Published in 2018 amidst the metroidvania revival, I finally played this game in 2024. I was initially hesitant, but my aversions were quickly allayed. 
You play as a dung beetle pushing a ball and can only move horizontally. All the vetical mobility comes in the form or, you guessed it, pinball!!
The atmosphere of the game is just fantastic, with a cute art style and great upbeat soundtrack. 
The exploration is a joy, since the island environment is so varied. There are plenty of collectibles and upgrades to make the experience rewarding. There are also plenty of fun and quirky characters to interact with, some of whom give you side quests to spice things up.
The exploration is mixed in with pinball sessions, which basically takes the place of combat in other games in the genre. You are rewarded in these sessions with fruits, which is the currency of the game, mainly used for unlocking jumping pads for traversal.
My only gripe with the game is that towards the end, the backtracking starts to get a little tedious, since there are sometimes mandatory pinball sessions in the way.
Would recommend to anyone who looking for a unique take on the genre and an all around fun time.

The one exception is the 'grappling hook', which moves way too fast for me to reliably use and sets up way too many challenges that take far too long to reset if you fail. Fortunately, these are mostly optional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198423282408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1712045564}
review:
通关了，总结就是和奥日差不多的赛博可乐，玩的时候很爽，适合手残党。
弹珠游戏和银河恶魔城的结合很新颖，场景好看，氛围也很舒服。
地图设计得有银河恶魔城的味道。
引导方面，个人觉得还可以，至少这个游戏没怎么看攻略，自己玩就可以打通关，说明引导也是设计得还行的。
剧情嘛，老套但是boss我是没猜中。
原价买不值得，但是打折十几块钱，还是不错的，虽然比不上奥日空洞等top银河城，但也值得买来玩玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970527026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1709438775}
review:
Truly a brilliant and magical game.  Think of Ori cross with pinball and you get Yoku's Island Express.

I had so much fun with this game and can wholeheartedly recommend it to pretty much anyone.  It can be a little tight with the timing for those looking to get all the collectables, but even the casual gamer will likely find a lot of joy with Yoku's Island Express.

It's beautiful, the sound design is excellent, and it is simply fun to play.  A metroidvania for those who would like a more bit-sized world full of complex level design.  

Brilliant!

author: {'steamid': '76561199553962809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7528, 'last_played': 1709408356}
review: An open world pinball game  XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198090109480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1709385640}
review:
Fun, casual, open world pinball game. You navigate by pushing the ball around and using the pinball flippers in the terrain. There are also rooms that are laid out like a traditional pinball machine, where you have to hit specific points before you can continue. You're also constantly collecting fruit that serves as a currency for unlocking flippers that lead to new areas.

You do quests to advance the story and gain a few abilities. Some of the optional collectibles require a bit of puzzling.

There is no failure state. The backtracking gets a bit annoying if you're going for 100%. It took me 10 hours to get all achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275058353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1709002992}
review:
Fun little game. It has a little bit of platforming and a little bit of metroidvania. You are a beetle pushing a stone around trying to deliver letters and help some island inhabitants.

The cool thing here is that it is that a lot of the platforming is done via pinball levels, which are integrated into the landscape throughout your journey. Some get annoying, especially as you need to hit the ball in the exact perfect place later in the game. But, they are all fairly short (minus the repeated attempts to hit the mentioned perfect placement).

One thing I really like is that there really aren't any normal enemies that hurt you. The pinball levels have some spikes in the gutter that eat up your fruit (which is both your health and currency). Some of the pinball levels have a boss that you have to hit a handful of times. But, the normal navigation has no normal enemies.

This is definitely worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055091370', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1708965600}
review:
Zwykło się mawiać, że bez sensu jest wymyślać koło na nowo, bowiem trochę niedorzeczne jest tworzenie czegoś, co od bardzo dawna dobrze działa i funkcjonuje bez zastrzeżeń. Z zupełnie innego założenia wyszli natomiast twórcy, którzy postanowili wziąć się za klasycznego pinballa i absolutnie zrewolucjonizować podejście do tej, bądź co bądź, legendarnej już gry, której fenomen według kronik sięga nawet wczesnego średniowiecza, a w formie zbliżonej tej znanej nam z salonów gier aż do 18 wieku. My skupimy się jednak na świecie wirtualnym, gdzie ponad 30 lat temu powstała rozpropagowana przez Microsoft wersja, która wylądowała na dyskach każdego z posiadaczy Windowsa XP. Cel zabawy? Za pomocą dwóch “łapek” umieszczonych u dołu stołu odbijać metalową kulkę od różnych elementów komputerowego stołu w taki sposób, by zdobyć jak najwięcej punktów i nie pozwolić, by żelastwo spadło na sam dół pomiędzy kontrolowane przez nas łopatki.

“Co tu niby można ulepszyć?” ktoś mógłby zapytać i byłaby to wątpliwość absolutnie słuszna, którą pewnie ja również uznałbym za właściwą. O ile sam pomysł rzeczywiście nie został szczególnie zmodyfikowany w swojej (nie)doskonałości, o tyle ktoś, kto postanowił ze wspomnianej wcześniej pinballowej sfery uczynić uwiązany atrybut żuka gnojarka, za pomocą którego poruszamy się po wyspie, rozwiązujemy zagadki, wykonujemy akrobacje i przeżywamy przygodę w otoczeniu iście rajskich widoków… naprawdę, czapki z głów przed pokładami kreatywności. Bo właśnie na tym polega cała rozgrywka - jako sympatyczne zwierzątko dostajemy za zadanie przejąć schedę po poprzednim listonoszu, przy okazji zostając uwikłanymi w podstępną próbę zniszczenia tej magicznej krainy, którą oczywiście próbujemy powstrzymać, przy okazji nienagannie wywiązując się ze swojej służbowej roli.

I tak, wiem co zapewne sobie pomyślicie: przecież już na pierwszy rzut oka widać, że to jakaś kompletna dziecinada! Musicie mi wierzyć na słowo, że przez pierwsze piętnaście minut też byłem o tym święcie przekonany, ale z każdym przetoczonym metrem docierało do mnie, że to nic innego jak bardzo uniwersalny projekt, który ma do zaoferowania dokładnie tak samo wiele treści młodszym graczom, co tym bardziej doświadczonym. Znajdziecie tu właściwie wszystko, od zawiłości fabularnych, przez zręcznościowe wyzwania wymuszające na nas wielokrotnych powtórzenia trudnych odbić, aż po fabularne plot-twisty oraz dodatkowe misje, których nieoczywiste rozwiązania prowadzić będą do naprawdę ciekawych pomysłów na dalsze perypetie. Poziom trudności nie jest przesadnie wysoki, ale ukończenie produkcji na 100% wymaga naprawdę sprawnej ręki, sporej dozy odkrywania i poszukiwań, a także wprawnego oka i solidnego refleksu. Generalnie za każdym razem siadałem do tego z ogromną chęcią do odkrywania i pstrykania w kontroler, o co absolutnie wcześniej bym się nie posądzał.

A jeśli nawet nie porwie Was sam pomysł, to zawsze zostaje oprawa graficzna, która bynajmniej nie odstaje od samego konceptu. Jasne, bywa miejscami zbyt przekolorowana, nazbyt wyrazista i generalnie odrobinkę plastikowa, jednak w momentach gdy autorzy chcieli by robiła wrażenie, to nie można jej niczego zarzucić. Mapa jest zadziwiająco przestronna, po brzegi wypełniona pnączami, bajorami, jaskiniami, tunelami czy niezależnymi postaciami, a praktycznie każda cząstka tej flory i fauny spokojnie funkcjonuje sobie w obrębie swoich własnych animacji czy reakcji na nasze działania. Do tego wszystkiego dochodzą zróżnicowane biomy, kreatywne urozmaicanie poruszania się za pomocą wyrzutni, platform lub armat czy też chociażby monstrualnej wielkości żyjątka pełniące rolę lokalnych bóstw, których zadaniem jest dodawanie wszystkiemu solidnej dawki mitycznej atmosfery. Jak dla mnie, o wiele zbyt ambitnie, by pomyśleć o tym jako o grze dla dzieci.

Jedyny mankament którego się na dobrą sprawę dopatrzyłem, to ten związany z dość żmudnym poruszaniem się po wszystkich lokacjach. Jasne, niespieszne toczenie głazu po pagórkach, korytach, wzniesieniach czy nawet płaskich pustyniach to bardzo oryginalne podejście do tematu, jednak gdy po raz dziesiąty musimy dostać się z lodowych szczytów do umieszczonych na samym dnie, wulkanicznych podziemi tylko po to, by porozmawiać z jakimś lokalnym przyjemniaczkiem, to mina trochę nam potrafi zrzednąć, tym bardziej, że przy okazji czekają na nas przeważnie pomniejsze platformowe wyzwania albo konieczność wyboru właściwej drogi, by niepotrzebnie nie krążyć w kółko. Projektanci co prawda również dostrzegli problem i spróbowali walczyć z nim za pomocą dosyć nietypowej alternatywy dla szybkiej podróży, która choć miła dla oka, to jednak nie jest szczególnie praktyczna i momentami wprowadza jeszcze więcej zamętu, ze względu na to, że i tak musimy dotrzeć do konkretnych punktów, by w ogóle z niej skorzystać. Ale cóż, zawsze to więcej okazji do odkrywania.

Tytuł zacząłem więc pełny obaw o jakość, właściwą dozę balansu i dojrzałość prezentowanych treści, a skończyłem niezwykle zadowolony, zachwycony wręcz nieszablonowym podejściem do tematu, trzymając kciuki za powstanie jakiegoś godnego następcy. Jest to zadziwiająco wielowątkowa pozycja dla właściwie każdej grupy docelowej, od zwolenników niedzielnego grania, przez fanów zręcznościowego naparzania w klawisze, aż po tych, którzy lubią po prostu eksplorować i spokojnie zdobywać poukrywane w różnych miejscach znajdźki, dopóki na liczniku nie zobaczą stempla stuprocentowego wypełnienia progresu. Wydaje mi się, że jeżeli nie jesteście jakimiś bucami z kompleksem męskości albo desperacko nie szukacie wyłącznie okazji do postrzelania, to naprawdę warto dać szansę takiej relaksacyjnej przygodzie w iście wakacyjnym klimacie, bo dla mnie wygląda to na absolutny must have pomiędzy platformerami, zwłaszcza w połączeniu ze Steam Deckiem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997700544', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1707640356}
review:
Its funny and interesting, but too often it makes you do precision platforming and the game is really not made for that. The "slug jumping" required to try and collect a few wickerlings is the worst movement mechanic i've ever had to do in a video game, it's purely random a lot of the time.  Surely there were better ways to implement that, like letting the player hold a direction when exploding the bomb to go in that direction, or the opposite of that direction.

you can beat the game without engaging with that mechanic, so i'll still recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047442570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1707825629}
review:
I started playing this game on a whim after having bought it and relegated it to the depths of my never-ending backlog. As such I didn't really have any expectations going in. Colour me surprised when I discovered I had a gem on my hands. Not that it's a very hidden one but a gem nonetheless.

Yoku's Island Express is a metroidvania in every sense of the word. You're given a large but limited area to navigate which will gradually expand as you unlock new abilities and finish puzzles which you're then encouraged to backtrack through to explore hidden and previously locked areas. In these areas the game excels. The titular island is large enough to feel expansive without it being disorienting or tedious to traverse through. Furthermore, the puzzles littered across the island all build wonderfully on the mechanics introduced throughout the game, never feeling too difficult or impossible. I will admit this might be a turn-off for some people as the game hardly offers any challenge apart from the, at times, finnicky controls. This is especially true given the readily available quest markers on your map that guide you on your way whenever you feel lost. 

Speaking of controls, however, where Yoku's Island Express sets itself apart from it's competition is in its gameplay. Unlike more traditional Metroidvanias and platformers Yoku's structures its puzzles and traversal mechanics around a pinball inspired system. In other words, instead of jumping, gliding, sliding, and whatever else you might find yourself doing in other Metroidvanias, here you'll find yourself launching yourself and your ever-present ball into key fragments, pinball-bumpers, and plenty of fruit. As tedious as a system like this may have become ln the wrong hands, Villa Gorilla's team of developers have thankfully managed to craft a truly unique and seamless traversal system that never overstays its welcome.

Where the game suffers a bit is in its presentation. Although the game has a charming art style and ear-worm inducing musical compositions something about the character models and visual effects feels a bit cheap. That's not to say the game doesn't look and sound good, 'cause it does, but I personally believe it's missing a certain thing or two that could have pushed it over the edge.

If you're a fan of Metroidvanias and want something a little bit different or perhaps a little less challenging this game should be right up your alley.

Can't wait for the Yoku's Island Express DLC for Pinball FX.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082232878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1707466940}

author: {'steamid': '76561199489464860', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1706928077}
review:
游戏好玩，质量不错，非常推荐。
整体评价：有些超出预期，看名字是送快递，实际是勇敢快递员不畏困难拯救小岛。我个人感觉上是“弹球版类银河恶魔城”，或者叫“弹球版空洞骑士”也行，哈哈。
核心玩法：弹球为核心玩法，操作非常简单，所有关卡的设计都围绕弹球展开，游戏难度整体【轻松】，boss难度也比较简单，因为游戏没有【死亡机制】，所以基本不会有挫败感，游戏没有死亡机制从设计上其实是挺合理的。
优点：操作简单，角色可爱，游戏画风清新，这游戏玩起来【很放松】。
缺点：赶路稍微有些麻烦，比如以普通玩家视角（比如我）来看，即使到通关了，对弹球本身的操作还是没有达到“挥洒自如”的状态，所以在游戏中如果走错路了，好些时候你必须把之前的关卡再次走一遍，会有些麻烦。

玩之前我是没想到屎壳郎也能做主角，屎壳郎推“球球”，实际玩下来感觉设计非常合理，这小屎壳郎还挺可爱。

author: {'steamid': '76561198094479567', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1705772364}
review: Yoku’s island express is an incredibly innovate and gripping experience with very little flaws. At its standard price it’s well worth it but the game is consistently reduced to pennies allowing for a weekend long game experience. The pinball twist consistently shines within the world without outstaying its welcome. Issues certainly arise in some of the music (especially the final boss wtf) and the abrupt ending. If you want to 100% this game I strongly suggest looking at the achievements first, I went in blind, decided to 100% the game and was unfortunately met with my final achievement detailing a mechanic I’d never even realised was there. Overall a fantastic experience considering those are my only gripes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020212412', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1706815844}
review:
[h1]A duet of flippers in the dance of gaming whimsy.[/h1]

Yoku's Island Express is a truly unique game, combining game mechanisms in a way I hadn't seen or imagined enjoying before. It's a charming open-world pinball adventure with delightful soundtracks complementing each zone. This cozy experience has become an unforgettable gaming memory, one I plan to cherish and crave for a long time.

The game impresses with excellently crafted level designs, clever pinball systems, diverse visual themes for each zone, a light lore background, enjoyable quests, secret optional challenges, and cute art styles. These aspects evoke a glorious nostalgia for the simpler times in my childhood.

My only criticism lies in the somewhat underwhelming rewards of secret challenge missions and quests. Despite the effort invested, rewards often translate to collectibles, extra currency, or minor upgrades with limited utility. While not a major drawback, it could be disappointing for players expecting more substantial returns.

Despite this, the game's well-crafted platforming puzzles, though not particularly looking challenging perhaps due to the cozy visuals, reveal surprising polish and a well-balanced difficulty. For anyone who still has doubts on it being a platformer, you'll be surprised at how well it scratches the platforming itch. A must-play for any gamers and a certified cozy experience.

[QUOTE] Thanks for reading my review! Check out my new and growing curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44848079]Puggo Curates[/url] for more of my short reviews! Leave a comment/question or even add me to discuss and I'll be happy to engage :) [/QUOTE]

author: {'steamid': '76561198076290934', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1706463664}
review:
Uno de los juegos más originales, creativos y divertidos que he jugado nunca.

Yoku's Island Express es un metroidvania mezclado con pinball. Puede sonar raro y hasta absurdo, pero funciona de maravilla. Todo el mapa está diseñado como si fuera un pinball gigante donde deberemos superar obstáculos y recoger fruta que nos servirá para desbloquear nuevas rutas para llegar a todas partes.

Es uno de estos juegos que no se parece a ningún otro y lo convierte en algo único. Y aunque sea fácil y corto, se disfruta cada segundo hasta terminarlo.



El juego trata sobre un escarabajo pelotero llamado Yoku, que llega a una nueva isla llamada Mokumana para ejercer su nuevo trabajo como jefe de correos de la isla.

Sin embargo, nada más llegar encuentra que el dios de la isla está herido y deberá salvarlo llamando al resto de los jefes de la isla con el fin de salvarla de una malvada entidad desconocida llamada el Matadioses.


Como ya he dicho antes, toda la isla está diseñada en forma de pinball, con sus propias ideas creativas para que el juego ofrezca más mecánicas que solo golpear la pelota de Yoku con las paletas.

A diferencia de un pinball tradicional, aquí no va de acumular puntos, pero será importante recoger la fruta, ya que sirve como la moneda del juego.

El juego no es muy difícil. No son muy grandes las penalizaciones por caer la bola entre las dos paletas entre otros posibles fallos. De hecho, si te quedas sin fruta y caes no pierdes nada. No hay una pantalla de game over.

El juego no quiere ser desafiante, sino todo lo contrario. Un juego relajante donde vas acumulando fruta, consiguiendo objetos útiles, conociendo nuevas áreas y personajes, hacer misiones sencillas y todo en un viaje lleno de vistas preciosas en una isla tropical con música de playa tranquila.

Vamos, que quiere ser un juego chill y no un reto hardcore. No esperes algo como Hollow Knight o te va a decepcionar mucho.












En resumen:

Un juego totalmente único, relajante y muy divertido.


Si te gustan los metroidvania y el pinball es un juego muy recomendable. Te lo puedes pasar en un fin de semana, incluso si vas a completarlo al 100%. Es una experiencia muy chill llena de personajes agradables, gráficos bonitos, música tranquila y contenido suficiente para que las pocas horas que dura sean muy disfrutables.

Como dije antes, cuidado con los que buscan un reto. Esto, aunque sea un metroidvania, no tiene la alta dificultad de un Hollow Knight, Blasphemous o Dead Cells. Es un juego MUY FÁCIL Y MUY CORTO, y aunque eso no lo haga malo, tenlo en cuenta, sobretodo si eres un jugador hardcore que domina este género.


Gracias por su lectura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198810410202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1708171618}
review:
핀볼에 길찾기 퍼즐을 햡쳐 놓은 짬뽕 게임.
앞으로 쭉쭉 나가는 게임은 아니고.. 맵의 이곳 저곳을 수십번 반복해서 찾아가도록 만들어져 있다.
퍼즐 자체는 쉬운 편이지만.. 핀볼의 공을 원하는 방향으로 날릴 수가 없어서 통과 하는데 오래 걸린다 ㅠㅠ
핀볼로 원하는 지점을 정확히 맞추는 것에 자신 있으면 게임도 쉬워진다.
수집요소와 맵 이곳 저곳을 일부러 찾아가게 만드는 퀘스트도 존재한다.
핀볼게임을 오래 오래 해볼 생각이 있는 사람만 해보길 추천

추가... 
 숨겨진 상자와 공등의 아이템 위치를 전부 찾았음. 근데.. 못 먹음.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199590659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 540, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1706202395}
review:
the game was ok
a unique game that I never played before (metroidvania + pinball) but it's very short
the aesthetic is cute and the music if sometimes great specially the main theme but what bothered me the most was the traversal. Sometimes I just wanted to go back to the previous area and it was a SLOG.
In my play-through I talked to an NPC who said something about teleportation and I think there might be fast travel in the game but I only encountered that NPC by the very end of the game and I still had to do a quest in order to (probably) unlock it. Fast travel would have gone a long way in this game.
I'd say get it on sale, it's nothing special but you can kill some time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198968750561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1705427162}
review:
I was looking for a relaxing game to play in Steam, and I stumbled upon Yoku's Island Express on sale. An adventure pinball game can't be that quite addicting, can it? Oh boy, the first time I played this game, I couldn't stop playing. I enjoyed the unique gameplay it had. I wanted to explore every location in the map. I enjoyed the feeling of finding lots of secrets and getting collectibles. I can't stop swinging my head listening to the soundtrack of the game while admiring the cute NPCs I talk to. I just couldn't stop.

There are just times where there are lag times when using the beeline, probably since the area is being loaded. The endgame or 100% completing the game can also be slightly frustrating for some, especially getting some of the collectibles can require precision and a bit of luck.

Overall, just play the game. I love it very much. Worth the bucks, and pretty achievable for achievement hunters, too. Low-key, I'm gonna miss this game. I honestly quite sad uninstalling this game after playing. I want more :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198000445428', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1705064933}
review:
[h3]The pinball metroidvania where all vertical movement, combat and puzzles are games of pinball. It just works. 7/10.[/h3]

Some standouts:

[list]
[*] Super innovative gameplay that pushes the metrioidvania genre
[*] Great amount of collectables and side quests, which meaningful rewards and map hints if you need them.[spoiler] I love the ability upgrades you get: the double vacuum, the fast dive fish, faster movement and a bigger wallet. All useful but non-essential perks[/spoiler].
[*] Creative unlockable abilities. None of your standard "double jump" and "attack that destroys rocks". [spoiler]I bet there isn't another metroidvania with a slug vacuum?![/spoiler]
[*] Fun and innovative fast travel system. [spoiler]The Bee Line lets you move around quickly, but also lets you access new areas in the process[/spoiler].
[*] Actually good cosmetics system! I normally never care about this, [spoiler]but combining colours to make different balls, and then using those ball costumes to solve side quests is a lot of fun[/spoiler].
[*] Neat art style and music
[/list]

Some flaws:

[list]
[*] In true pinball style, it's difficult to precisely control the ball, which unfortunately means that you can get stuck with puzzles where you've solved [i]how[/i] to do it, you just haven't been able to execute the exact right flip yet. Sometimes it takes 5 minutes of retrying to get the flip right, which can get a bit frustrating.
[*] Movement is quite slow (outside of fast travel), which can make backtracking a bit annoying, especially combined with the fact that you have to re-do certain pinball puzzles each time you pass through them
[*] Not enough fast travel entry points. It's kind of like a train where you can get off at any stop but only get on at a very small number of places. I see no real reason for this.
[*] Not enough of a pinball tutorial. This might seem stupid for pinball pros, but I bought this game with very little pinball skill, and only realised half way through the game the essential play pattern of "passing" the ball from one flipper to another by gently raising the first flipper. I wish this were taught by the game.
[*] The [spoiler] slug jump puzzles [/spoiler] are particularly frustrating type of late game puzzle where you [spoiler] have to grab a slug from one place, then speed over to another place to use the slug's explosion to give you a jump you wouldn't normally have. There's nothing inherently wrong with the puzzle design, except that each time you mess it up, you have to take another 5 minutes returning to the slug generator, generating a slug, picking up a slug, getting to the jump point, positioning the slug, only for the imprecise aiming to let you down.[/spoiler]
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 12499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12499, 'last_played': 1654215568}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review: 有趣的弹球银河城。这个游戏核心是赐予切线方向冲量！包括球桌扳机键、聒蝓与抓住食肉花的甲虫。在较高速度下实现精确操作还是偶有难度的，有时候我玩得血压有点高，也许可以给我来个子弹时间。球桌重复度还是蛮高的，到了结局boss战操纵多体没看出必要性（顺带一提，我是指假结局//我只完成了假结局）。蜂道在第一次乘坐时令人愉快，但实际略微粗糙。进程强烈依赖任务驱动，且较多任务是通马桶型的（不愧是屎壳郎主角）。但总体而言很有创意。xbox手柄扳机键阻尼好舒服，这游戏用舒适手柄玩会比键鼠玩好玩很多，必然。

author: {'steamid': '76561198011135747', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1704830936}
review:
Overall the gameplay is fun.  The artwork is amazing and the music is charming.  I barely have anything negative to say.  But I want to list a few things that bothered me.

* Failing certain actions will set you back too far.
* Sometimes it is hard to exactly hit the ball on the right spot.
* The hook mechanic is completely idiotic.  I was tearing my hair out from the amount of missed swings.  Whoever fine-tuned this deserves to whipped with the hook.  Not only is the time window too small but the camera is also wobbling.
* Snails have a similar issue.  It is just impossible to see where exactly you're aiming at.
* What about quest log?

author: {'steamid': '76561199229695450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1705211290}
review:
From the little I have played I can tell you that the game oozes personality, the music slaps and Yoku is the cutest. It's definitely worth getting it and that's coming from someone that doesn't even like pinball. Definitely money well spent!

UPDATE: After having finished the game and gotten all of the achievements, my only complaint is traversing. Sometimes it became annoying having to move from one side of the map to the other. Being able to fast travel close to the beelines (the fastest means of transportation in the game) would have been nice. That being said, I still think that the game is worth giving a chance. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992022417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1705765943}

Platformer-ügyességi-logikai-flipper?

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198148401542', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1703840419}
review:
[h1]Where do you think you're going Postmaster? This is my pond![/h1]

[b]Yuko’s Island Express[/b] is a [b]metroidvania[/b] as well as a pinball game. This odd combination of two genres works surprisingly well, and I'm surprised at how much I have enjoyed my time with this title. This is a very casual game that allows you to turn your brain off for a bit and just have fun.

[h1]Pros and Cons[/h1]
[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Enjoyable gameplay that combines metroidvania with pinball
[*]A few side quests to keep the player occupied
[*]Collectibles to discover
[*]Extremely fun boss fights
[*]Excellent soundtrack
[*]Beautiful art style
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]The gameplay remains the same throughout the game, nothing new is added
[*]Backtracking is a bit bland and repetitive
[*]The final boss is very underwhelming
[/list]

[h1]Story[/h1]
The story starts out with [b]Yuko[/b], who has just moved to the Island named [b]Mokumana[/b] as its new postman. There he finds out that the island is dealing with an unfortunate climatic event thanks to the island's deity falling under a curse thanks to the [b]god Slayer[/b]. Now, [b]Yuko[/b] must find the [b]Chefs[/b] of each tribe and call them to help their deity so the island can prosper.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3129710482
The story for the game is nothing too deep, but it’s still enjoyable. The cast of characters are charming and likable, with each tribe having something unique, helping to make each one feel distinct and varied.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The gameplay for [b]Yuko’s Island Express[/b] is remarkably interesting and well thought out. You can move [b]Yuko[/b] left and right but to jump, you will need to go to a [b]flipper[/b]. These [b]flippers[/b] can move you in a different direction depending on where the [b]flipper[/b] is placed. 

There will be sections in the game where you will be put into a [b]pinball-like[/b] section of the game. In this section, you will have to collect these stones to unlock a door or switch to activate something to move on to the next area.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3129712364
While you are doing this, you can collect fruit to help you out on your adventure. At first, you can only collect up to one hundred fruits, but eventually, you can upgrade your wallet to collect more. You can use fruit to unlock more [b]flippers[/b] to locate secrets, unlock a fast travel spot, or buy items and upgrades. 

You don’t have to worry about dying in the game but there is a consequence of getting hit too much, and this can actually screw you over on a certain side quest. I initially thought this was part of the game's main story design, but it is not.

There are a few side quests for you to do throughout the game that are fun. Since you are a postman, you need to do your job of delivering packages or mail to people. You will be rewarded with fruit upon doing so, which can help you buy stuff of course. There are a few other tasks that you can do to help on the island, and you will be rewarded for doing them as well. There are also a few collectibles to acquire which can help you complete quests on your adventure.

In addition to jobs, there are boss fights that you will have to complete. There are only three total, and I had a lot of fun doing the first two. Fighting them was unique as I never really knew how a boss fight would work in a pinball game, but the developers really nailed the implementation of these fights.

I do have a few issues with the game. The first issue I have is with the repetitive gameplay loop. Nothing new is ever added such as varying modes to help mix up the experience, so the fun can start to get stale after a while. On the other hand, the game is only a few hours long, so this shouldn't be a huge problem on your first playthrough.

Backtracking is another issue that was poorly executed. I know backtracking is a core element in [b]metroidvanias[/b], but this game just has nothing to look forward to when backtracking. I say this because even with the upgrades you get, they don’t feel like upgrades to me, as they do not enhance gameplay in a traditional sense such as powerups or skills, but instead will simply grant you access to areas or the ability to open things. This felt odd to me for a game in this genre.

Finally, there is the final boss of the game, which was a big disappointment for me both in terms of how challenging the fight should be, as well as the plot twist. Not only was the fight a cakewalk (despite the game not having a game-over system) the plot twist was a last-second one that came out of nowhere but when it did, it felt empty.

[h1]Graphics and Performance[/h1]
The art style is gorgeous, with a hand-drawn look that is very colorful. I love how the areas look and feel like an actual island. I tested the game on an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB, AMD Ryzen 5 1500X Quad-Core Processor 3.50, and 16 GB of RAM, I experienced no issues while playing and the game ran well.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3129722945
I would also like to add that the soundtrack is well done, and I was surprised at how well it was handled. Each song sounds unique with a nice tone, making you feel like you are in the wild.

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
I was impressed with Yuko’s Island Express, as it offers a fresh take on the [b]metroidvania[/b] genre. If you are looking for a nice fun chill game, then this is one you should seriously consider, albeit a little short at only 3-5 hours long to fully complete the story. I would wait for a sale when buying the though, as $22.79 CDN is a bit much for what is offered.

[quote]The Chiefs live all across the island, you should ask them to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/5297658/]Life Needs a Little Sin [/url] for their good quality reviews[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197992723591', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1704222247}
review: The pinball mechanics are really well done and add a good twist to a metroidvania. Loved the setting, the game play and the music. There is a bit of back tracking but just as it becomes tedious fast travel options become available. My only complaint is that the paddles are not pressure sensitive to the analog triggers. So, directing the ball (the dung) is a matter of paddle positioning only. All in all, I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a different take on the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040904595', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1704136607}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a delightful fusion of genres as it mixes classic metroidvania with pinball mechanics. In fact, whole game world feels like one giant pinball cabinet with flippers, bumpers, kickers, slingshots and ramps seamlessly integrated into scenery. 

Not gonna lie: despite it being super cute, colorful and full of good vibes, at times it felt frustrating to play. Maneuvering through certain areas might require precision and timing that can occasionally lead to moments of trial and error, where you know how to solve a puzzle, but this darn ball just won't fly where it is supposed to.

Overall, it is a charming and inventive game that successfully blends two unlikely genres. It has a colorful world, inventive gameplay, and a bit of lighthearted humor that adds a layer of whimsy to the experience.

A unique experience. Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197972986072', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1703177728}
review:
Probablemente de las reseñas mas cortas que escriba.
Te gusta Ori?, compra Yoku Island Express pues es prácticamente de la misma calidad que Ori, pero cambiando las plataformas por mecánicas de Pinball. Recuerda un poco al mítico Sonic Pinball de la Megadrive pero añadiendo faceta de metroidvania. 
Realmente bastante injusto que Ori se haya llevado tantísimas buenas criticas y ventas, y Yoku apenas ni se le conozca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264025583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1703421764}
review:
Yoku's Island Express es un juego muy original, ya que es una curiosa mezcla de plataformas con pinball (mezcla que, aunque pueda parecer extraña, funciona a las mil maravillas). Los controles funcionan perfectamente, muy pulidos, y la dificultad está bien ajustada. La historia principal dura unas 5-6 horas (completarlo todo calculo que en torno a las 10), y tanto el apartado visual como el audio cumplen notablemente.

En definitiva, es un juego, por encima de todo, divertido de jugar (como los antiguos plataformas), y si te gustan los metroidvanias es una muy buena opción debido a lo novedoso de su propuesta. 

PD: Después de completarlo, me sorprende que haya pasado tan desapercibido.

(*) Funciona perfectamente en la Steam Deck.

✪✯✪✯✪✯✪ [h3]7.8 / 10[/h3] ✪✯✪✯✪✯✪

author: {'steamid': '76561198053793287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1931, 'last_played': 1702913819}
review:
This is one of my absolute favorites:
 - It's a great take on flipper gameplay,
 - it's absolutely beautiful.
 -  it has a soundtrack that good it featured in my Spotify Wrapped the year I discovered it.
 - Responsive and comfortable input with mouse and keyboard as well as controllers.
 - It's big and has multiple paths/parts in the story you can work in parallel - so if you ever get stuck, you can just switch to a different part and come back later with fresh eyes.
 - It's fun even on replays and it's family friendly. I've had this hooked up to a TV and younger children where cheering on their older siblings and having fun just watching. Equally fun was watching grandparents trying their first controller.

It's all around a very, very beautiful and you can feel the love put into making this every second.



And to all this, add the randomizer: Just shift they key items randomly around the map. There's no guarantee this even remains solvable, but it usually is - if you count liberally applied speed running techniques, exploits and shady shenanigans as "solvable". It's a whacky, completely insane challenge mode for the time when you're finished with the game but just don't want to put it down because it's too good.

I will never spend as much time on Yoku's Island as I did in stuff like Skyrim, Stellaris or Cyberpunk. But I love it more than all of them combined.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998839445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1702709589}
review:
[h1]ちゃんとおもしろい・・・です！[/h1]
終始のんびりとしたちょうどいいサイズの変わり種ゲーム(5~8h)
ひとしきりメトロイドヴァニアの有名どころを遊んだ後に珍味として手を出すのが良い

[h3]ゲームプレイ[/h3]
たしかにピンボール×メトロイドヴァニアしている。ちゃんと面白くなるのか不安になりながらプレイを始めたが、安心できる出来だった。
終始のんびりしておりスピード感や刺激には欠けるが、ビジュアルや音楽および世界観と相まって不思議と不満に感じない。

[h3]その他[/h3]
・キャラデザは一見するとカワイイ系だがよく見るとちょっとこわい。目の感じ？。日本人だからそう感じるのだろうか。
・音楽もほんわかしている。一部シリアスなイベントとBGMが合ってなくて笑ってしまった。
・メインキャラは激突などで「きゅっ」とか「ぷゅ」といった音を出すが、時々邪魔に感じる。（ごめん...）

author: {'steamid': '76561198016404452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1702770947}
review: This is an incredibly charming metroid platformer. There is no combat and movement is almost entirely based around pinball. If you like exploring and some pseudo physics puzzles, you'll really enjoy this. You of course have the usual unlocks of exploration and movement and more to find. The art style is lovely, the music pleasant. You also might think hearing its pinball means it'll be a lot of wacky physics, but the point at which you hit any of the bumpers has a largely predetermined path, but the bumper has multiple points on which to hit, and you can plan for it. You should play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034574711', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1702450597}

review: I'm glad this game exists, because the gimmick is nifty and the presentation is charming. But equally, I found myself frustrated by the imprecision of the pinball paddles as a mechanism for getting from point A to B. Can't help but feel pinball platforming isn't actually fun, and I kinda hope it's never attempted again (at least not without major changes).

author: {'steamid': '76561198822982305', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1701523588}
review: Ich kann es nur empfehlen! Es hat eine süße gute Story. Durch die Musik ist es auch ein sehr entspannendes Spiel. Es gibt auch genügend Nebenquests, die man aber nicht zwingend machen muss. Es ist einfach gehalten, dass auch Anfänger und Kinder es meistern können. Es ist schön und niedlich gestaltet und man merkt, dass man sich viel Mühe bei dem Spiel gab. Alle Achivements sind einfach zu erreichen. Es hat mir sehr Spaß gemacht, es zu spielen. Auch der Modus Randomizer ist auch eine interessante Erfahrung. Für mich persönlich war es eher etwas langweilig, da ich schon alles kannte. Es ist aber eine interessante spaßige Abwechslung. Man sollte diesen Modus aber sehr aktiv spielen, da man sich merken muss, wo man schon war und wo man erst später weiter machen kann. Wenn man zu lange Pausen einlegt, fehlt einem dieses Wissen und man sucht alles erneut ab. Ich würde aber sagen, dass das Spiel definitiv seinen Preis wert ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165479646', 'num_games_owned': 1099, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1695480065}
review: Yoku’s Island Express est un jeu de flipper en monde ouvert. Le jeu offre une expérience immersive de flipper, avec des graphismes colorés et une bande-son entraînante. La structure du jeu, qui rappelle les jeux Metroidvania, ainsi que la variété des missions proposées. Enfin, le jeu offre une grande rejouabilité, car chaque mission peut être abordée de différentes manières.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039155737', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1701285038}
review:
Incredibly unique and entertaining game. Not very challenging though, other than your aim in pinball. It's very easy to sit and have fun with this game, even if you're not 1 of the genres shown off. 

+Story is easy to follow and quite nice actually. Small twist.
+Great characters that felt unique in their own way. Dialogue makes each distinct
+Playful music and visuals that fits the themes and areas

Listen, it's a short game that you can get through in a weekend, and I think everyone deserves to take a break and play something easy and fun. At the very least, it left me satisfied with the time it took to play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107558042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1701179953}
review: Cool take on the rogue like genre. The pin ball mechanic is something new but adds rng to the platforming and can be frustrating when you know how to proceed but can't hit the perfect angle on the channel or hidden path.

author: {'steamid': '76561199551279959', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1700887384}
review:
[h3] Yoku's Island Express [/h3] is a delightful game that seamlessly blends pinball and platforming in a tropical paradise. You play as Yoku, a cute dung beetle who arrives on the island as the new postmaster. Your job is to deliver mail to the island's inhabitants, who are facing a mysterious threat from an ancient god. Along the way, you'll explore the island's secrets, meet its quirky residents, and immerse yourself in its pinball-inspired gameplay.

Playing the game is a joy, utilizing flippers and bumpers to bounce, roll, and launch Yoku across the island. The physics and controls are smooth and responsive, complementing the clever and creative game design. Discover hidden areas, collectibles, and puzzles that challenge your skills and logic. The inclusion of a fast travel system allows easy navigation around the island.

Impressively, the game's graphics and sound create a vibrant, immersive atmosphere. The colorful and charming art style features hand-painted backgrounds and animations. Additionally, the upbeat and catchy music, along with a variety of tunes, perfectly match the game's mood and theme.

Engaging storylines and characters add to the game's charm and humor. Uncover the island's history and mystery through a simple yet intriguing plot. Each character has a distinct story and quest, contributing to the overall experience.

While Yoku's Island Express excels in many aspects, its length and replay value might disappoint some. Completing the game in a few hours and lacking strong incentives for replay could be considered drawbacks. 

Overall, Yoku's Island Express offers a unique and relaxing experience in a beautiful world. It's inclusive for players of any age or skill level, promising smiles and enjoyment. I highly recommend it to enthusiasts of pinball, platforming, or adventure games.

[b] I'd rate this game a 80 out of 100. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198418664526', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1622162673}

author: {'steamid': '76561198156297008', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1700578770}
review:
Honestly, I can't understand what everyone seems to like about this game.
Sure, pinball mechanic is clever, but it's still pinball... I mean you literally almost have no control over your character, and most of the time you just watch it bounce for 15 seconds straight without taking any action.
I guess this is one of the cases where I should have tried the demo before buying

author: {'steamid': '76561198004594788', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1700685034}
review:
[h2] 뿌뿌뿌~~뿌뿌~~~뿌뿌뿌뿌뿌~~뿌뿌뿌뿌~~ [/h2]

핀볼과 메트로배니아라는 신박한 조합.
과연 잘 어울릴까? 핀볼이라는 게임으로 재밌게 즐길수 있을까? 걱정했는데 저는 재밌게 즐겼습니다.
약간 위화감 드는 그래픽도 금방 적응되었구요. 난이도도 핀볼이라 너무 쉬울줄 알았는데 생각보다 집중해서 플레이 해야할정도의 적당한 난이도 입니다.

이런 메트로배니아게임을 하다보면 후반에 맵이 너무 방대해져서 퀘스트를 위해 이동하는게 너무 지루하고 멀게 느껴지는데 맵도 너무 방대하지 않고 적당한 크기라 지도로 보면 멀어보여도 벌의길(지름길)과 그냥 직접이동해도 생각보다 금방 도착하는점도 좋았습니다.

할인할때 구매하신다면 볼륨도 만족하실수 있을거같아요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265285847', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1700792555}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is one of those amazing surprises in the gaming world. Who would've thought that mixing metroidvania with pinball could work so well? And man, it's fun! The game takes you through all sorts of different places on the island - beaches, jungles, snowy mountains, caves, and even hot springs - all while you're basically playing pinball.

The story's cool too. You help out the island's residents and uncover secrets along the way. But what really stands out is the game's visuals and music. Each place has its own vibe, and the soundtrack fits perfectly, adding a special touch to each area.

From my experience, it's been a while since I had so much fun with a metroidvania. The game is beautiful, engaging, and just challenging enough. It's one of those games that you relax into. I highly recommend it, especially if you're new to this kind of game or for kids.

There's a bit where things can get slightly repetitive, but that's hardly a real issue. "Yoku's Island Express" is one of those games you don't want to end. Worth every minute ⭐

author: {'steamid': '76561198145182373', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1675897879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198235814654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1705141031}
review:
PROS :

- Very original - when did you play a beetle pushing a ball across a jungle that's basically a giant pinball table?
- Relaxing (you can't die), it's a comfort game
- Super simple : no leveling up, no weapons, no fights, no complicated inventory (hardly any inventory at all, for that matter)
- Direct to the essential : gameplay. Super short dialogs, no cutscene.
- Pretty graphics
- Just one super giant stage, not a succession of stages
- No loading time
- Suited for children

CONS :

- Your character has 0 charisma and is mute. You're just the little thing rolling the ball.
- Probably too simplistic... the many secrets don't really have any impact on your adventure, as there's no weapons, no leveling up or anything. They're mainly fruits (the local currency).
- PNJ animation is next to inexistent

author: {'steamid': '76561199494911253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1700027944}
review:
面白いし、以下に記載する、苦手要素が気にならない人には、オススメできる。


一度「難易度高すぎる」と思って、開始１０分以内で返品していたけど、数か月以上経過して、デモ版をプレイ→製品版を購入した。（以前、これは無理だろ…と思ったところは、違うアプローチをしたらクリアできる、実際には難易度が高いわけではなかった、と、デモ版で判明した）

デモ版では、わからなかったけど「グロい表現」があり、楽しさより、ストレスが上回ったので、プレイを断念。
人によっては、全く気にならないだろうけど「なめくじ（なぜか真っ赤）」を「破裂させる」表現があり、それが、サブクエストかメインクエストかわからないけど、進行に必要だったり。
（そこをクリアして手に入る「道具」があり、それが、また、別の箇所でも要求され…みたいな）

血しぶき（ではないけど）が、飛び散る、そして、「ぐしゃ」っというような、嫌な、破裂音もしたりする、私基準では「グロい」表現があり、そこを「こういう、グロくてストレスな箇所は、一時的かも…」と、多少ガマンして、攻略した後に
「エラー」（バグ？）とかで、強制終了になり、
「かなりストレスな、グロい表現があるところを、ガマンしつつ攻略したのに、それが、全て消えた」
という、また、そこを攻略する前から、１からやり直し…みたいになり。

グロい（個人的に）表現が全く気にならない、みたいな人には「低価格」（セールなら）かつ「長時間遊べる」かつ「システムもよく出来ていて、楽しめる」（ピンボールと探検要素が、上手く融合している）
シリアスは少なく（たぶん。序盤をやった上では、そういう雰囲気）気軽に楽しめる、アクションアドベンチャー、として、オススメできる。

けど、自分のように「グロい表現は避けたい」「頑張って攻略しても、エラーやバグで、データが消える（進行が消える、直前のセーブからになる）とかは、かなり、ストレス」みたいな人には、オススメできない。

客観的には、オススメできるに、入る、７５～８５点ぐらいの、出来の作品だったから、オススメするを選択した。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025518269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1682171530}
review:
This game relies heavily on you liking pinball and being extremely good at your timing to use the flippers to move around the world. If you don't feel confident in having those things, I wouldn't recommend it. A really unique concept that just wasn't enjoyable in execution for me from being too strict. I recommend you try to demo first.

The timing and angle that is needed to play most of the game is so precise, that most of the game I was just fighting to barely get anywhere. Eventually after 5 hours I couldn't do it anymore. I wasn't having fun and was ripping my hair out from tedium. There is no margin for error. Most of the game requires perfect timing to get your ball in just the right spot, slowing the adventure aspect and pacing down with it. For me it was like playing Metroid if you could only move around the entire game with convoluted Shine Sparking the entire game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993406990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1698646665}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010851317', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1698599364}
review:
This game is adorable. Whenever I'd fail a given board, I'd spend a moment to just sit in the shooter lane. Yoku will lay on their back until pressing left or right, where-then they'll get up, smile again, and keep rolling the ball as if nothing bad happened.

This game feels like it came from a game jam where the producers threw darts at a board and the darts landed on "metroidvania" and "pinball". It became my Steam Deck game while traveling, and it plays great on the deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247674872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1697521568}
review:
I really loved this game: the pinball mechanics make it so new and fresh, the length and complexity is just right, the world has the right size and going around never feels like a chore (if you are not going for all the collectibles). The art style and the music are also very relaxing and sweet, making this a perfect title to chill without an excessively simple or slow game. 

With the collectibles, getting some of them can be annoying because you just need to try again and again to do some things, and each retry can take a while. I did some, and I found it fun and rewarding, but for the ones that felt like too much work I just did not care. None of the objects important for the main storyline was like that. 

Definitely worth picking up if you like pinballs and you finally want a decent game using them, or if you are just looking for a chill platformer that feels a bit different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258079325', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1697873352}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088935457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1697828978}
review:
Fantastic game. Creative mixture of pinball and adventure gameplay. Beautiful art and music. Metroidvania style exploration, with plenty of content after completion of the story.

Highly recommend, even if you don't have a lot of experience with pinball.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255193699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1698380377}
review:
Weird Metroidvania game where you explore an island filled with talking animals using pinball mechanics as a new postman. It actually works way better than expected. At first it might seem hard, but it's worth it once you GET it. The additional abilities you get actually work with the pinball mechanics too. 

Has a cute, relaxing vibe. Not too long, but satisfying. Cool music. The island is beautiful with lots of secrets. Parts of the story can surprisingly get really dark. 

I actually liked it better than Ori once I've figured out the mechanics. And I thought I didn't like pinball. 

Likes: ALL THE CHARACTERS
Dislikes: The pinball mechanic at first, further mechanics that aren't actually explained well, the lack of sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331638993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1697248463}
review: Yoku's Island Express just isn't really for me. I'm not sure if I enjoy pinball, and after playing this game, I'm still unsure. Overall, I disliked the pinball sections in this game. My first gripe with them were they felt so small, there wan't a lot to do in each. Second, I dislike how the paddles have exact points where you launch to. Each paddle only had a few paths that you could be launched along depending on the part of the paddle, rather than having it be actually physics based. Because of that, it never felt like I was getting better at pinball, it was just trial and error checking each portion of the paddle until I went down the right path. The platforming is fine, I even enjoyed some of it, however the biggest flaw with it is that if you mess up, you'll go flying across the map, meaning each time you fail you have to travel back over to the start of the platforming section. This problem is only made worse by the fact that you move so slowly in this game. It's very pretty and I liked what it was trying to do, but I feel like it missed the mark in several ways. 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198090938080', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1696029793}
review:
Yoku's Island Express offers a truly unique platforming experience that sets it apart from the crowd. In this game, you won't find traditional jumping mechanics; instead, you control a charming beetle equipped with a ball that allows you to enjoy pinball gameplay!

The pinball-style gameplay is both fascinating and enjoyable, featuring a smooth and engaging flow. While it does incorporate some RNG, the more you become accustomed to it, the easier it becomes to navigate the challenging pinball levels. It doesn't feel unfair; it's more a test of skill, aligning with what you'd anticipate from a platformer. A quick tip: don't forget that you're not just a passive ball; you can use the beetle to make adjustments when necessary.

The game's visuals and art style are adorable and fit the theme perfectly. The BGM complements the experience exceptionally well, creating a cohesive and enjoyable atmosphere. Personally, I found the main theme with vocals particularly captivating.

Completing this game to 100% can be a challenge, as expected from a title offering optional content. However, if you're not particularly concerned about achievements, I managed to finish the main storyline in 5.6 hours while working on other objectives. So it should take even less for those solely interested in finishing the game.

That being said, if you're like me and strive for all achievements, be prepared for a few frustrating moments. Some collectibles, especially those involving the usage of explosive slugs, can be a real pain to obtain. Also, here's a pro tip: as you play, make sure to activate all the scarabs you come across. Trust me, it'll save you from having to backtrack like I did just to find and activate scarabs in areas you've already visited. It can be a bit frustrating, so stay on top of it to make your achievement hunting smoother.

My sole complaint pertains to the game's lack of customizable controls. While the default control scheme isn't overly complex, I would have appreciated the ability to tailor them to my personal preferences right from the start, ensuring a more comfortable gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561199017042209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1696761343}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025176715', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1695127058}
review:
I haven't quite collected everything like I would like to, but I don't think that'll change my opinion. I love Yoku's Island Express! It's such a fun little game brimming with charm. I'm glad I crossed paths with this one and hope more people can do so as well.

I think it's important to know my background: I'm not great at pinball. I grew up around grimy arcades and have played tons of pinball, but never got it down. That said, I thought the pinball stages that are included in here are great. Really bite sized and comprehensive. Every once in a while I'd feel a bit braindead, slamming the ball in the exact same spot 12 times in a row. But that's a me problem! And despite that I had a wonderful time.

There's something really magical about the combination of genres that Yoku's Island Express (YIE) is able to pull off as well. Using fruit to unlock new areas, new areas unlocking new abilities, and having an objective across a big open map all works SOOO well. Every little loop of gameplay is perfectly refined and harmonious with one another. It's really made me want to check out more "casual" metroid-vanias.

I think some people might look at how little it takes (by way of playtime) to reach end credits, but I thought it was perfect. I estimate that I probably have another 3 hours to get all the collectibles for the "true-ending", and on top of that the game ships with a randomizer! So there's a lot of potential for replayability.

Overall I don't have any complaints with Yoku's Island Express. It's such an excellently casual and cozy game, I believe that just about anyone that picks it up will have a really fun and relaxing time playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085581712', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1695817711}
review:
[b]Incredible[/b], a pinball metroidvania, something I never would have thought existed.

It is perfect for casual gaming as it is short enough to be in love with it without feeling that is too little and not to long to end up boring. [spoiler]5-7h for beating the game, to 9-10h to 100%.[/spoiler]
It really surprises me that so few people have played it, or so it seems, as it's hard to get to know this game.

Colorfull.
Good map.
Good power ups.
No bugs.
No glitches.
Loads Fast as ****.

I'm really happy with this game.
If needed, I would rate it [b]7 / 10[/b].

I gotta be the best postman in Mokumana Village.

author: {'steamid': '76561199022165805', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1703186090}

Yo antes era un chucho moribundo hasta que me compré esta maravilla, que juego que juegazo.

¿Que dos cosas podemos combinar para crear el mejor juego de la vía láctea? Se preguntó el equipo desarrollador de este magnifico videojuego. La respuesta te impactará.

METROIDVANIA + PINBALL, ERA OBVIO, LA SOLUCIÓN ERA ESA DESDE EL PRINCIPIO

No es un simulacro, repito, no es un simulacro, haz rodar tu bola y golpeala, debes encontrar al matadioses y salvar la isla, ¿A que esperas? ¿A que esperas sinvergüenza? QUE LO JUEGUES YA

author: {'steamid': '76561198330829286', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1705378622}
review:
I just finished everything in this game( in just under 10 hours for those who care) and holy shit what a good game! I hadn't been that immersed in a game in awhile. The pinball mechanic is really fun and well executed! A bunch of stuff to do and collect without feeling too grindy( slight exception to the scarabs, they can be a bit much if you dont grab them along the way) The atmosphere is cute and endearing, with a small amount of darker tones in there. Think Ori vibes but more light-hearted. Everyone says its a great game, but I enjoyed it way more then i was expecting too. Super worth a play if you saw the mechanics and went meh, like i did at first, or you just forgot about it or something.

Cheers

review:
I never knew I needed a 2D platforming Metroidvania pinball game, but I had a blast playing Yoku. The art style felt a little jarring in the first moments but grew on me and repeatedly impressed. The Metroidvania elements are strong and blend surprisingly well with pinball (?!), but it's really the gameplay that lets this game shine. It's simply a joy to explore and play a bunch of mini tables along the way.

It's an absolute steal at the prices this title dips to and plays wonderfully on the Deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10153, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1639208343}
review:
[h1]
为什么会有推球的瓢虫啊！这熟练的动作，真的不是屎壳郎吗？
[/h1]

九个小时主线通了并顺带完成了部分支线（还没全完成）显示进度为76%。
进过包，可以某宝买key，两三块左右即可到手。
即使是原价买我仍然觉得物有所值，玩完不亏。当然，买的key就觉得大赚特赚的感受。
推荐一试，92/100，我给一个很高的分数评价。
优点：
1，基于三维弹球的玩法进行的魔改，上手简单，玩法有趣；
2，难度不算太难，比Ori简单，死亡惩罚也只是水果（就相当于钱啦，还可以反复拿刷的，除了刚开始可能缺水果，后期不用主动去拿都基本上都是足够挥霍的），对手残党很友好；
3，画风挺不错的，辨识度很高，也很喜欢这样的风格；
4，音乐不错，很轻快，在我手残的时候明明很焦灼却可以安抚平静我的心。
不足：
1，指引部分不是特别满意，大的任务会给提示，一些细小的（比如孢子那个虽然有文字说明但是需要自己找地方）还是不太行；
2，一些隐藏的key是玩法机制的改变，但也往往带来吐血的郁闷，或许可以考虑用其它一些方法再略加指示一下；
3，地图跑路很难受，虽然后期可以用蜂线但相对来说那个的解锁还是偏晚的，使得全程跑腿重复内容太多，而且一不小心可能还走错路/迷路。

author: {'steamid': '76561198880067626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1695549528}
review: Mir gefällt das Spiel sehr gut. Es ist schön bunt, es kommen immer neue Dynamiken dazu, überall kann man kleine Geschicklichkeitsspiele oder Rätsel lösen. Das tolle dabei: man braucht nur 5 verschiedene Tasten (links, rechts, Aktion, blau, orange) Es hat mich ein bisschen an Ori erinnert. Auf jeden Fall auch kindgerecht.

author: {'steamid': '76561199512387485', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1700644202}
review:
Yoku is a really impressive and leaves an everlasting impression game, you can see its really made with love and really lots of effort put into it.

The very first time I played it, I was frustrated because I dont really know where to go, how to control the flippers, but thats really just my lack of skills.

But despite my lack of skills, I still managed to perfect the game; huge thanks to the wonderful guide creators. Huge blessings to them

This game requires some effort to 100%, but it is not overly tough to 100% it either; so really huge kudos to anyone that does manage to 100% this :) :)

Playing it for the second time, I enjoy every moment, minus less frustration because I know what to do, haha

A little sidetrack, there's another game I enjoyed it after playing it for a 2nd time, it is Donut County; I appreciate the story plot, gameplay more (some essence / elements which I have missed the first time)

Overall for the both times of playing Yoku, I did love this game

Sincerely and genuinely from the bottom of my heart, thank you devs

author: {'steamid': '76561198434804910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1693166337}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116551445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1693147590}
review:
Before getting into the actual game, I just want to say that the animation of the beetle following the ball in the pinball sections is a little jarring. It’s not a super big deal, but did none of the developers look at this and think ‘maybe we could make it look less like the beetle is getting strangled?’. Does no one else see this? Is it just me who though the protagonist was hanging themselves for the first few minutes of gameplay? Anyway…

A fast and fun little pinball game. The aesthetics are charming and despite the fact it’s based on pinball, luck has very little role in playing the game. It’s engaging but not particularly difficult and, other than the cost of a few minutes of the player’s life, very forgiving of failure. Exploration is a significant part of the game, with neat little factions to interact with as you move along your merry way. Overall, a good, chill game.

review: 画风手感无敌好，很可爱很杀时间的游戏。虽然有的地方比较辛苦需要操作（乱按）好多次才能成功，但总体上我认为是我买的最值的游戏之一，并不很低龄，因为真的很多地方需要去思考一下多尝试一下的，前期有些地方需要自己来回跑图，但慢慢就会解锁更多的操作方式和道具，在厌倦之前出现新鲜的元素还是不错的，本来收集癖跑图跑的有点恼火，玩了几小时才算是豁然开朗了，相信后面还会有更有趣的部分，不用担心自己手残，手残只是会花更多时间罢了。低折入血赚！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198098640215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1692493908}
review:
Cute but very arrogant. Way too many instances of needing very exacting and draining maneuvering. Let's take the chest just above the God Egg as an example. In order to get it you gotta do a slug bounce but it has to be exactly placed otherwise you just hit the invisible floor but also you have a very good chance of doing a 360 no chest and having to do it yet again. 

So if you like tedious but cute games then this is the game for you. Plus Pinball metroidvania is pretty damn unique

review: I bought it because someone compared it to Sonic Spinball, and there's definitely a comparison. I'm not sure how else to describe this pinball-adventure game. You run around the island, bouncing on bumpers and getting flipped by flippers. There's tons to explore and many collectibles to discover. Lots of things to unlock. It's a ton of fun to bounce around, though it could have benetiftted from a quick-warp instead of the streamlined "Beelines" - Fun though they are, they're kinda slow, especially for a game where you want to backtrack and explore.
