review:
I hate replaying games.  I CAN'T STOP REPLAYING YOKU!!! I've bought this game on console and PC, it's that damn great!  If you like exploring and Metroidvanias/Platformers with a good storyline, sweet graphics, and an adorable protagonist, you'll love Yoku too!!!  Extra bonus if you like pinball!

Don't even get me started on the music!!!!!  Sooooooooooooooo good!!!!

Try Yoku's Island Express - you won't be disappointed!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198144007114', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1691017947}
review: A swell time Quite

author: {'steamid': '76561198169486891', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1690938688}
review:
OK, first, [b]let me buy the soundtrack you cowards![/b] There's some good bops in this game, I have money, and would like to give some of it to you in exchange for having the music readily available to me. Please make that a thing that I can do. Thank you.

Ahem, with that out of the way, let me ask you a question: Have you ever thought to yourself "What if metroidvania, but also [u]pinball[/u]?"

Well then you, hypothetical person, have some weird ideas. The good news is that you've found the perfect game for you! Also, it's actually pretty good!

Given it's somewhat offbeat premise, Yoku's Island Express actually works surprisingly well. The controls are responsive and it has a surprising level of challenge in places. Not a super high skill ceiling, this isn't the 'Dark Souls' of anything, but enough challenge to where if you 100% it you'll feel like you've accomplished something. Particularly if you normally kinda stink at pinball... like I do.

The bright and colorful environments mixed with the chill, tropical music make this a very happy sort of a game. I think I bought this one mostly for the art as it makes me feel very warm and happy. The early areas really do feel like a place that I'd love to vacation. Possibly even a place I'd like to live.

Yoku's also has some foreboding environments as well, and while there isn't really any "danger" it does a good job of giving a sense of being in an unwelcoming place when you venture into the darker parts of the map. There's a sense of ancient mystery to the deep caves which contrasts with the sunnier surface and adds to the island's mystique. Really solid art direction all around.

That said, I can level a few small complaints against it. The main one is traversal. In contrast to most metroidvania style games, getting around the world doesn't become more fun the further you get. There's still some real hard-to-reach areas that are well off the path of the fast-travel option. And since there are segments that always require your pinball skill to get through, going back through to get all of the collectibles can be a bit of a slog at the end. Adding another fast travel line or two would fix this with minimal effort I feel.

There's also the occasional bit of indie jank with how some things work, notably the slugs. There are some areas where the devs made it so that they pop when you get out of the area they're supposed to work in... but also some where they don't. I wasted a LOT of time on impossible slug-jumps only to later find out that there was an easier way to get where I wanted to go. Frustrating.

Also, as far as writing goes this game kinda fails. It feels like it wants to have a real story and deep lore but just kinda... doesn't. It has elements of those things, but never connects them in a meaningful way. Yoku's starts with TWO excuse plots, which in itself is fine, but then adds enough good set dressing to end up feeling like a missed opportunity.

But all in all this is an enjoyable little indie game that's absolutely worth your time and money to play.

review: Very fun arcade/metroidvania game with pinball mechanics. Interesting blend

author: {'steamid': '76561198329394252', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1690600430}
review:
6张卡牌，31个成就。
        主线剧情：5小时左右；主线剧情和支线：8小时左右；完美收集：12小时左右。
        一款优秀的非线性的横版独立冒险弹球游戏，可爱漂亮的画风加上独特的剧情，还有好听的音乐，玩起来很舒服。
       唯一的缺点便是视角的锁定有些奇怪，尤其是后期会经常发生变化，具体表现为画面的突然放大和缩小，容易让人丢失目标，不过死亡惩罚微乎其微，感觉很适合多人游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198068957488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1702677464}
review:
Vous vous poserez surement beaucoup de questions si je vous le dit mais j'y vais: metroidvania flipper.

Tout est dit je crois... Ce je est un savant mélange entre ces deux genres, et il parvient suffisamment à jongler entre les deux et les mélanger pour que le plaisir soit présent. Les gâchettes de la manette vous font contrôler des flippers dans des phases ressemblant à de la plateforme/exploration dans des couloirs/labyrinthes où à des combats lorsque les espaces sont plus dégagés.


Yoku's Island Express est une très agréables surprise où l'exploration est bien présente et où les arènes de combat ont laissé place à des tables de flipper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005120199', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1690571088}
review:
This is a super fun, unique fusion of gameplay with great art/animation, solid controls, and just enough collectibles and secrets to scratch my completionist itch without getting annoying.

Plus you get to roll poop around

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1689503017}
review:
If anyone would have told me that a mashup between Pinball and Adventure could work well, I would be very skeptical, but this game really delivers it. 

You play as Yoku, a dung beetle who is the new Post Master of the island Mokumana. For the first time, taking "Deliver Item X to Person Y" quests fit the adventure scenario. But the game goes beyond that - there is a greater plot which I will not spoil.

The game has a lot of exploration and collectibles. It has a few puzzles but it is never frustrating. The art is awesome and the world is immersive. The achievements were awesome and it worked out-of-the-box on Linux via Steam Proton.

A great surprise, specially considering that I went in this game blind!

review: Cute little metroidvania. The pinball idea is fun and works well, but some mechanics can be a little frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992862621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1685801229}
review:
A metroidvania game that is based around pinball. Who would have thought that could work!?!
But it is actually a very nice experience. I never ever play pinball but this was very well made and I enjoyed the 10 hours it took to get 100% of the game. 
If you see this for sale and you like Metroidvania games then be sure to pick it up!

Oh there is 1 ability later in the game which is a bit tricky to use. The sling ability. Takes some time to get good with it but there is a trick to pause the game when you are using it so then you can time it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046063822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1689975433}
review: Excellent game, very original on platforming. The gameplay is well developed and responsive. There's very rare frustrating moments. Just the area that has to be accessed through attaching and detonating slugs can be annoying at time. It's a short but good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280592372', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1689941306}
review: I think its overwhelmingly positive review status stems from the fact that it's hard to say this is a bad game. It's a very safe 6-7/10. The aesthetics are cute and it deserves its props for having a unique take on the Metroidvania genre. With that being said, if you're looking for a Metroidvania game and you have a few options to choose from, I'd recommend going with your other options first. This is a good game for those who are starving for more in the genre or really want to see something done differently. Otherwise, it's a good game but better games exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079066562', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1692144861}
review:
An extremely fun game. 
I bought this game looking for a pinball game that was something beyond just you standard pinball arcade cabinet, and I got exactly what I wanted! The game is way easier than real pinball, but real pinball is really unforgiving, so that's a good thing.

The controls are intuitive, the game play is a blast, the story is good but not intrusive, the music is great, the art is cute, what more could I ask for?

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199026122846', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1689521211}
review:
9个小时全成就，效率惊人。
从各方面来说都算完美的游戏，无论是画面，音乐，玩法都在佳作线以上。作为唯一一个将弹球与类银河城结合起来的游戏，却显得意料之外的成熟：作为类银河城，地图设计与隐藏收集做的相当出色，一方面是因为地图中充满了标识，使任务线容易辨认，轻松了获得新能力→前往新地点这一基本过程；另一方面是因为水果在前中期需求量较大，会给探索提供动力，而整张大地图有足够的近路供往返，便使得收集时的跑路变得格外轻松，进一步消解重复劳作与往返探索的疲惫感。作为弹球游戏，主线流程将玩法发挥充分，相当休闲有趣，而支线及收集也有相当一部分具有挑战性，可以说是做到了轻度与深度（其实也只是一些稍微进阶的操作）的统一。
虽然是弹球游戏，多多少少会有一些rng要素，但大多数关卡都可以通过使弹球在弹板的不同位置起跳来一定程度上使操作具有稳定性，所以此游戏也可以套用那句游戏圈经典名言“菜就多练练”。
吹毛求疵的点就是深度不足，在我这里玩法没有深度便难以上9分，即便如此，此游戏依然是神作未满，佳作以上的评价，在我玩过的类银河城里与阿尔法环境站并列第二。
8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199087961605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2401, 'last_played': 1690203938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198823682255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2023, 'last_played': 1688605864}
review:
[h1]高品質まったりサイドビュー探索アクション[/h1]

これはあくまでピンボールを模したプラットフォームアクションであって、物理演算では絶対にそうはならんやろみたいな露骨な補正が随所に適用されるので、私のようにピンボールにまったく関心を持たない身でも波長さえ合えば楽しめます。いちいち食われたり食わせたり郵便物を叩きつけたりする小児的なユーモアが、なんか心に沁みてしまいました。

クリア後に解放されるランダマイズモードは、ニューゲーム時に殆どのアイテムの配置を入れ替えて開始するものです。最初の浜辺を例に採ると、無作為さはおそらく以下のように調整されています(推測につき間違っているかもしれません)
[table]
[tr][th]難易度[/th][th]確定で取得[/th][/tr]
[tr][td]ノーマル[/td][td]茸か毒茸、千里眼[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]ハード[/td][td]茸か毒茸[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]ベリーハード[/td][td]無し[/td][/tr]
[/table]
通せんぼしている奴の頭突きをすかして森に進むような「最高峰のスピードランテクニック」をベリーハードは前提しており、グリッチ無しだと茸を拾えなかった時点で詰みます。

探索に関わるアイテムしか存在しないこのゲームでアイテムをシャッフルすると、けっこうダイナミックに攻略ルートが変動します。たとえば山にしか行けそうにないが橋を直せない、未開通のファストトラベルを逆走しようにもナメクジバキュームはゴリラ像の中にある、ここから入れるルートがあるんですかみたいな感じで、このあまりにも居心地がよい世界に長く浸りたい私にはハードランダムは実にちょうどいい湯加減でした。
ベリーハードには興味が湧かず触っていませんが、極論すれば詰むまでに[spoiler]ピヨピヨ笛[/spoiler]を引けるかどうかだけの勝負になるんじゃないでしょうか。

author: {'steamid': '76561198069689721', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1689037305}
review:
Este juego es realmente único.

Siempre me gustaron los Pinball, nunca me imaginé la mezcla entre Pinball y Metroidvania. Y este juego no solo mezcla esos dos géneros si no que también lo hace a la perfección. Al principio cuesta un poco engancharse porque parece que te estas perdiendo y como que te abruma el mapa y todos sus pasadizos. Pero después de un par de sesiones todo encaja y ya se disfruta al máximo.
El arte visual tiene personalidad, la música también. El gameplay es ingenioso y requiere habilidad y reflejos. Los momentos fuera de las secciones de Pinball, las de exploración, son igual de buenas. Muchos personajes por conocer, muchos objetos por recojer, batallas de jefes, secretos, aspectos que encontrar, atajos y herramientas para comprar, etc.

No hay otro juego para compararlo. Así que por lo que es: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198275655828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1688327396}
review:
Yoku's Island Express idea of metroidvania x pinball weird mashup is surprisingly effective.

The game has a cute little premise, despite the story itself being very superfluous to the game, about being a postie. It invites you to explore everything, the game is big enough to where the transportation system is necessary but not too big as to feel annoying to traverse. The only thing rule thing I'm not sure about is the deaths. In some of the stages the trough is spiked and after enough damage you die, but what is "enough damage" seems random and arbitrary to me.

The game does look nice. The natural environment are 3D as their perspective does slightly change, while everything else is 2D. Some of the character animation are clearly that Photoshop tool that makes it look weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261292871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1688355030}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is an incredibly cute and unique game. Do you like pinball? If you do, you'll like Yoku's Island Express, as it combines the exploration and ability gathering features of the Metroidvania genre with pinball, something you won't get anywhere else. The game has a simple story and an easy difficulty. There's also no dying in this game, the worst punishment for failure is having to redo a small segment or losing a little bit of money. The controls are also very simple, using the arrow keys to roll Yoku's ball, the enter key to interact with NPCs, and the left and right shift keys for the pinball flippers.

There are, however, two problems I have with the game. The first is that some of the NPC voices can get very annoying very quickly. The second much bigger problem is its length. It took me about four hours to complete the main story and another four to 100% it, and I went into the game blind. Even though it has a built in randomizer which gives it replayability, $20 is too much to ask for a game that only lasts eight hours, no matter how fun it is. Luckily the game can go on sale for as low as $3.99 (which I bought it for) which is more than worth it.

Overall, Yoku's Island Express is a fun and unique game with a playstyle you can't find anywhere else, but its length is too short to justify its price, so get it while it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239059784', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1683163621}
review: Very interesting for a few reasons. For one, it's art style and general mood is very reminiscent of some games found on the Wii and Wii U eShops. It's sort of nostalgic to me. I don't think it would've been my first choice, but it does give the game a certain identity that I can appreciate. Secondly, this is, like, secretly a Sonic the Hedgehog game. Momentum based gameplay with a little ball shaped character, and big open world populated by pickups that are lost when you take damage. Just a something I noticed. Not my favourite, but if you like pinball this is the closest pinball gets to a narrative, open-word experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072026315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1687912417}
review:
Cool game.  Some tedious backtracking on side content, but basically none in the main game, which seems like fair play to me.

It was a great idea to have the highlighted arrows on the flippers so people who are bad at pinball like I am can have a substantially easier time aiming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067448673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1687875236}
review:
非常非常非常棒，甚至抢走了我塞尔达一天时间！

银河城+弹珠台，故事上相对贴近奥日，美术好评加分，地图设计优秀加分，扮演屎壳郎大大大加分！

虽然十个小时左右就能全成就，但事实上游玩过程体验相当完美，动作元素和弹珠台完美结合，我一个不爱玩弹珠台的也觉得非常享受。非要鸡蛋里挑骨头的话…那就俩结局要看两遍完整字母表有点难受这一个了。

强推！

author: {'steamid': '76561199061457634', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1690250578}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983940372', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1695363014}
review:
Still working towards 100% but worth just for the main experience of the game/story, even if collection/completion isn't your thing.

Adorable, satisfying hybrid of metroidvania and pinball platforming. And pinball puzzles. And pinball boss fights. It sounds strange but controls and flows super well in the first game of its kind as far as I know.

Great music, character voices (and collection goals for that matter) that are reminiscent of the best old Rare titles, superb art design. It's hard to find fault with this title, and that's really special given it's the developers' first game.

Will have my eye out for a sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023951163', 'num_games_owned': 3255, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1678240926}
review:
В очередной раз искал медь в завалах своей библиотеки, а нашел золото.

Геймплейно - Метроидвания, скрещенная с пинболом на большом тропическом острове с различными биомами. Основные механики - игра в пинбол на различных мини-аренах, если их можно так назвать, поиск секретов, коллекционных вещей и улучшений, выполнение поручений персонажей, прохождение сюжета. Игровой процесс невероятно приятен и не отпускает до самого конца, постепенно усложняясь и добавляя новые маханики и битвы с боссами.

Графика - На удивление очень приятная картинка в целом, цветовая гамма, рисовка и персонажи в частности. Разделение же игрового мира на биомы не дает декорациям наскучить. 

Аудио составляющая также на высоте. Под каждый биом соответствует свой эмбиент, отлично подходящий месту действия.

Сюжет - Довольно простой и добрый с твистом в конце. Игре более чем подходит. Побочные же задания по большей части просты, но от того не менее интересны и почти всегда подкреплены диалогами. Ах да, тут довольно много персонажей, они колоритны и запоминаются, чего от подобной игры совсем не ожидаешь.

Итог - Лучший симулятор пинбола, который в который я сыграл к 2023 году, можно сказать, что это квинтэссенция данного жанра: интересная история, увлекательный геймплей, приятная графика и отличная музыка. 

10 пчелайнов из 10

review:
Wonderful and delicious game. It has two of the best features of any game:
1) You cannot die. The difficulty comes from the way you deal with situations and find the paths inside the levels. 
2) You cannot save. The game saves automatically and it just goes on without the annoyance of manual saving.
I usually don't like coloured little animals and stuff like that, but this game is so fantastic that I passed on my personal taste.
It deserves a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038293557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1910, 'last_played': 1697445747}
review:
[h1] Pinball Island Adventures [/h1] 

Is what I would describe this casual pinball style game. You play as Yoku, the cutest little dung beetle ever, attached to a pinball so you move by rolling your ball left or right and using the pinball flippers scattered throughout the island to launch yourself for some height.

The game is more of an exploration type of game. The pinball mechanics serve as an interesting way to move around the island while your main goal is to explore new areas and find collectibles. There are some traditional pinball table styled areas, but regardless of which area you are in, you have control of Yoku rolling his ball as long as you are on the ground which makes it possible to adjust your ball even during these pinball segments.

This isn't really needed to progress but the extra control of the ball cuts some of the tedium of lining up tricky shots although the ball can still fall straight through the hole as in every unlucky pinball moment. Even then, the game is very casual friendly as there isn't a life mechanic so you can keep launching back up for another try while losing really nothing.

This can be a bit of a bummer for pinball fans who like the score aspect of most pinball games. Things like score bumpers and bonuses only give more fruit which is quite easy to max and serves little purpose by the endgame when you've unlocked most things that require a high amount of fruit. This made backtracking through pinball tables not as fun as it could of been when there was nothing more to gain.

However, For those who can't get enough of the exploration aspect even after completing it 100%, there seems to have been some randomized item update that lets you start the game again but with different item locations for some replay value. This gave me even more hours of enjoyment because even though the map itself isn't changed, the power up items in different locations made finding alternate routes to places still enjoyable.

There's even a somewhat ridiculous hard mode that took into account speedrunners know how to break games and the devs just rolled with it allowing the item randomizer to move essential progression items to absurd areas that only speedrunners know how to sequence break to. It took learning 3 of these tricks to 100% a hardmode playthrough myself, though it is really more of an extra mode as you get nothing for a 100% hardmode unfortunately.

Overall, Yoku's Island Express is a very fun and charming pinball styled exploration game. I just wish there was a way to get his cute little postman hat you lose at the start of the game as a completion reward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003365989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1708817469}
review:
Adorable and addicting
I got hooked on this quirky game. Most of the puzzles were at just the right difficulty level for me, though FYI I am a little uncoordinated so some may find the pinball puzzles to be too easy. There was so much to explore in the game world that I seldom felt completely stuck. I also loved the visual style, sound effects, and music, and these aesthetics made the (admittedly repetitive) map traversals more manageable. Overall, I got so immersed that it felt completely normal to bat around a beetle, tethered to a ball, vacuuming up exploding slugs. I completed the main quest and one of the major side quests, and it feels like time well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044215397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1685530656}

author: {'steamid': '76561198207168643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1685049681}

author: {'steamid': '76561198211515949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1685312276}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is finally a interesting and fresh take on the Metroidvanias, not just exchanging the setting but also overhauling the whole gameplay in the process. Funnily you play a [i]Postman[/i] which inherently means you have to collect items and deliver post.

[b]At its core Yoku's Island Express is a Pinball Machine.[/b] Luckily it doesn't have the typical [i]traps[/i] many Pinball Machine have which makes it an ideal game to just sit down and have some fun without being to annoying to play. Though it has quite some other mechanics to challenge timing and hand-eye coordination it never feels unfair.
It is no wonder it is highly rated!

author: {'steamid': '76561198124518351', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1679264303}

author: {'steamid': '76561198437673046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1685116662}
review: This game is a fun solo player game with a pinball type mechanic that you'll see through the game. I highly recommend it if you want a challenge and a goofy story. There is no order of events that is essentially required to follow so you're able to do what you want, when you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048338365', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1684877792}
review: Fun spin on metroidvania genre. Short but enjoyable main storyline and mostly fun collectables for 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020567638', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1684720937}
review:
Quite an unusual combination, but they end up nailing it! It starts a little bit slow but once you unlock some basic mechanics, it really clicks. The game fleshes out the mechanics enough but don't stretch them too thin! It has the perfect length.

I'm not really a fan of the metroidvania genre because I tend to get lost and hate backtracking, but this one hooked me for its 8-ish hours.

Go for it!

Edit: Also, a perfect game for the steam deck! (got 6 hours of battery time and runs smoothly)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025035050', 'num_games_owned': 7580, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1685840218}
review:
This is an attempt to blend pinball mechanics with platformer/castlevania (if not outright metroidvania) mechanics.
Sadly, it fails.
It is bright and cute and colorful and cheerful, but ultimately the two gaming styles just don't mix. The fast action of pinball only happens in very brief bursts, interrupted by the platforming action - and the platforming action is hampered by the inclusion of the pinball mechanics.
Once the very brief pinball-style sections are completed, you have to move forward with the story as a platformer. But this part is hampered by sections where you have extremely limited movement done by slooowwly rolling your ball in very short segments, like walking... and then unlocking new areas, which you have to do either by "purchasing" passes with fruit you've gathered during the pinball sections, and/or drop down into another little pinball area... either a new one, or more likely repeating one you've done MANY times already, to gather more fruit. The result is a constant start-and-stop switch, but worse - the pinball segments are separated by huge drops and catapults, so you may have a platforming section almost complete, a few fruit short of buying the pass... and then get hurtled far away, with much effort needed to get back.

Complicating this is that the pinball parts, in addition to being tiny constrained areas that you have to unlock exits from, have little to no ability to use "english," you can't really alter the course of the ball - everything is on rails, and paths are limited - some areas literally have only TWO paths for the pinball, meaning you find yourself endlessly and mindlessly repeating the same simply flipper/rebound motion, hoping to god that SOMETHING changes... there seem to be hidden bumper mechanics, because eventually it seems something DOES happen, which at best just lets you escape the little trap you're in.

At which point you're just back to backtracking into the other little pinball section traps, OR rolling along the short stretches of "platform-style" hoping you find something you missed.

And the whole game itself - the platforming adventure which is the whole point of it, is pretty much linear also, meaning you HAVE to do these endless repetitions to manage to move forward with the game. As a result, you spend most of your time just repeating the long-ago-completed areas over and over and over just to hope SOMETHING changes.

This can be a fun game if you get it VERY cheap on sale and play with half your brain as a time-killer, but mostly it's a failed exercise - or perhaps a successful demonstration that pinball and platformers just can't be mixed.

I cannot recommend this game unless you get it super cheap and think of it more as just an experiment than a truly well-thought-out game, despite how much effort clearly went into it. That effort shows in production, which is top-quality... but not in gameplay mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198843421548', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1684676700}
review:
本质是个3D弹球，个别判定需要注意，但收集舒服，惩罚较小，整体算是一个挺好玩的小品级作品，后期可能存在一定折磨，但好在很少，且流程较短。
开蜂道有被惊艳、爽到，可惜不能中途上车，略微残念。但跑图还是很快，很舒服。
后期个别地方需要脑洞大开一下，但注意下 地图开口、隐藏弹板、善用蛞蝓爆炸，也是能解出来的。就是个别地方可能对爆炸方向有一定要求，小小折磨你一下。

圣甲虫（就是关卡中有黄色充能条，最后展翅的雕像虫子）最好边打就边开了，因为只剩10个的时候才会显示剩下的，否则后期只能看攻略了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198106511544', 'num_games_owned': 1627, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1684099443}
review:
[b]Sights & Sounds[/b]
- It's a bright and colorful game. The visuals almost always trends towards cute and cheery
- The music follows suit. Most of the songs are fun and tropical sounding
- Although the sound design for the game is above average overall, I just wish the pinball sounds had a little more punch

[b]Story & Vibes[/b]
- You're a little bug who rolls around a ball that for some reason has become the new mail carrier on a tropical island. Some nonsense involving the island's god getting attacked by the big bad goes down, and it's the mail carrier's responsibility to fix that for some reason
- It's really not a story-focused game. It's mostly just set-dressing for the novel gameplay

[b]Playability & Replayability[/b]
- There's really not much out there like this. I suppose some people may want to compare it to Sonic Spinball, but this is pretty different. The entire map is interconnected, and you unlock new areas using pinball mechanics to progress
- That's the long and short of it. There's plenty of familiar table concepts like bumpers and flippers, but the game adds enough twists to the formula to keep things interesting
- My only complaint is the reuse of the "break crystals to unlock new path" concept. I would have appreciated just a little more variety for making new paths within the table sections
- The map is fairly huge and easy to get lost in, particularly if you fall from a great height. It can feel pretty discouraging to lose a bunch of progress if you haven't unlocked fast travel to where you're heading

[b]Overall Impressions & Performance[/b]
- It ran perfectly on the Steam Deck. The camera largely did a good job zooming in on the action, but there were a few times that would have benefitted from a larger screen
- There's so much extra content, but I didn't feel motivated to continue. I felt like 4-5 hours was enough. I think I would have gotten a little bored of it had I bothered with all the sidequests and post-game stuff

[b]Final Verdict[/b]
- [b]7/10[/b]. A fantastic and fairly unique gameplay concept with great presentation that is just long enough. And hey, if you really like it, there's several hours of extra content beyond the final boss

author: {'steamid': '76561198356159806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1684474077}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002391387', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1684384681}
review:
you wouldn't think pinball and platforming would mix but yoku makes it work. sure there are going to be times you miss a shot and need to try ten or twenty times but that's pinball baby!!!! and its not dissimilar to missing a jump in a platformer and needing to clamber back up.

great soundtrack, fun writing.

some of the collectibles are a little fussy but they're entirely optional. i would rush to buy a sequel on day 1

author: {'steamid': '76561198200505222', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1684347385}
review:
albeit a bit on the short side, this game was a phenomenal experience.

even though it's labeled as a pinball-metroidvania, i was expecting a much more linear and shallow experience like Ori and the BF.  although the story is nothing grand, it was actually a well designed metroidvania.

the level design is top-notch.
it starts a bit linear with a clear objective, but it doesn't take too long for you to realize you're smack-dab in the middle of metroidvania, left with multiple choices of pathing and progression.

everything really flows in this game.  the exploration to see "how" things can end up leading back to different places was quite neat.  including, but not limited to, fast-travel.  yes, there's fast travel, but it becomes a bit more than just a point to point system.

the pinball is rather fun and rewarding.  unlocking items, pathing, secrets.  it's nothing too difficult, but there's a good variety of challenges through-out the game.

random +'s:
1. i've had zero complaints about the controls.
2. i can switch audio sources mid-game, and it works.
3. for a game that has a generally happy tone to it, there were some darker tones that came rather unexpectedly.  it was fresh for the setting.
4. 8 hours is only completing the story.  it is not 100%.  there is also a randomizer mode, though i haven't tried that yet.

if you liked Ori and the BF, you'd likely love this game for it's style.
if you hated Ori and the BF (like me), you'll still likely love this game because it's an actual metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219382563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1517, 'last_played': 1683053172}
review:
全実績解除したのでレビューします。
カジュアルに楽しめる、緩めで可愛い雰囲気と世界観のピンボールです。

全体的に癒される感じで心が和みます。操作していて楽しく、住人の依頼をこなすことで
行動もよりスムーズになっていきます。

たまに飛ばしたいところまでなかなかうまく飛ばせずにイラッとすることがあることと、
実績にこだわる場合は少しシビアな調整が必要になります。
他に少々気になる点としてはギミックに対しての導線が弱い気がするので、いつ進める様になる場所なのかモヤッとする場面はありました。

気になる点を書きましたが、キャラやBGMも良く、価格以上に楽しめる作品のためお勧めです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992085306', 'num_games_owned': 10373, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1679378353}
review:
最近遊んだゲームでは一番感触が良かった。（そもそもあまりゲームをしていないと言うのはあるが）

昔、セガサターンに七ツ風の島物語というゲームがあったが、
あれに近い雰囲気の南国風の島を舞台に、移動やギミック解除をピンボールで行い島を探索していくという
ありそうで無かった（と思う）組み合わせで作られたゲームになっている。
ゲームオーバーが存在しない緩い難易度になっているが、この独特の雰囲気に浸れるなら人かなりアリだと思う。
暖かい穏やかな日にやると、更に没入度が上がって良いかもしれない。

review: Si estás buscando un juego divertido y con una jugabilidad fresca, que te permita explorar un mundo colorido y conocer personajes únicos, Es el juego que estabas buscando. Lo malo, es que se me hizo muy corto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094195986', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1680310922}
review:
It's a fun game to pass time with. Everyone talks about the unusual combination of genres, and it is indeed quite refreshing. Platforming with pinball adds a bit of chaos and makes it fun. It can probably be formally classified as a metroidvania, but honestly, it's just a pinball platformer with a non-linear map. There are only two upgrades that are necessary to unlock more territories and progress the story. Yes, you are going to run around the map back and forth, but otherwise the story is actually quite linear.

It's also a pretty lighthearted story: yes, you're saving the world, but the presentation is so cute and all the characters are so childishly funny that it's hard to take seriously. Actually, that was the only turn-off for me initially because for a while it was quite hard to focus on the story and remember the names of the key characters or places.

Overall, it's nothing groundbreaking, but just a fun, lighthearted game to pass your time with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072094217', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1682799602}

author: {'steamid': '76561198837953409', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1638709647}
review:
A very interesting take on the metroidvania genre! I did not expect a 'pinball' game to be particularly engaging, but Yoku sure did not disappoint! Lovable characters, nice little story, cute artstyle and plenty to explore in the fairly big world. It doesn't have any irritating grinding bits, so you can safely try to get all the achievements in one playthrough. The game doesn't overstay its welcome, at around 12 hours to 100%, ensuring that you enjoy every minute spent in the game. I would love to see more games of this style!

8/10 : Toot Toot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993424254', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1681804161}
review: Прошёл [b]Yoku's Island Express[/b], и она любопытная. Дурашливая, не серьёзная, иногда (в хорошем смысле) внезапная, а главное - экспериментальная. И суть этих экспериментов не в бездумном генерировании случайных концептов и “куч идей”, a в проверке необычных сочетаний максимально прямым способом. “Механика перемещения по метроидвании на базе пинбола” - дословно описывает суть геймплейной инновации, моментально даёт понять расклад и при этом оставляет достаточно неопределённости и вопросов “как?”, чтобы не отбивать желание попробовать. “Пожиратель богов, клан ниндзя и культ монахов-астронавтов на тропическом острове миленьких говорящих животных” - звучит противоречиво, но складывается в свой развлекательный тон и не беззубый, но совершенно “безопасный” мини-сеттинг. “Одолеть древнее зло, возглавить атаку ассассинов на гигантского паука, починить двигатель космической ракеты, управлять добывающей установкой, разносить почту, и всё это управляя (по большему счёту) только правым и левым бампером игрального автомата” - занятный вызов, преодолённый успешно, наравне с главным: “сделать головоломку ощущающуюся как экшен и экшен, ощущающийся как головоломку”. Весь этот академический интерес - не единственная причина рекомендации. При всё при этом - это хорошая и развлекательная игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024820628', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1681756817}
review:
What a cute little hidden gem! 

This is a true metroidvania game, except it is PINBALL allright. So... there is no "combat", as u get used to in metroidvanias, but there is a pinball mechanic of our little bug, so the whole game is about exploring the island and opening hidden areas with our ball bouncing. There is a story, lovely characters, a whole bug world with sidequests, and a very cute main hero. 

Pros:
- Nice graphics
- Pinball mechanic is FUN!
- The music is chill
- The game not overstays its welcome, the main story is about 3-4 hours, but there are TONS OF STUFF to do if u want to continue the challenge
- good exploration feel

Cons:
- There were some pinball puzzles, that were a LITTLE frustrating, but nothing too problematic

author: {'steamid': '76561198212467701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14134, 'last_played': 1669789115}
review:
Pinball metroidvania game is good and extremely fun to play. With the pinball flippers acting as shift keys, it is welcome to lay back and simply enjoy pinball for pinballs sake. As seen from my normal amount of time spent playing the game, I have 100%'d it and then proceeded to 100% it on the other two files it provides, and then went back to 100% more files on the extremely enjoyable item randomizer they have naturally included within the game. The base game is enjoyable enough to complete, but hunting down the games secrets and fully unlocking every pinball section is a delightful mix of rewarding and challenging that never fails to entertain me despite having hunted it all down multiple times. 

It is in my eyes entirely worth the 20$. It's cute, it's fun, the music is good, and the gameplay is better. Please try it out if you have the time.

review: 메트로바니아의 구성을 따르지만 적을 죽이고 다니고 그런게임은 아님. 정말 섬을 탐험한다는 느낌에 초점을 맞춘게임. 그냥 돌아만댕기면 지루하니 핀볼요소를 접목시켜 게임의 도전적인 재미도 추구하고 있다. 하지만 핀볼요소가 난이도가 높지는 않지만 메트로바니아의 구성을 따르는만큼 필요한 아이템이나 과일수가 모자라서 이 지역 저 지역 왔다같다를 해야하고 길을 잘못들었을때 핀볼을 다시 해야하는 구간이 많기 때문에 짜증을 불러일으킬수도 있다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025802185', 'num_games_owned': 2180, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1680995560}
review:
[h1]Pas mal Yoku[/h1]

D'un certain point de vue, Yoku's Island Express est un échec. En effet, il est (du moins à l'heure où j'écris ces lignes) l'unique fruit du studio suédois Villa Gorilla, fondé par Jens Andersson et Mattias Snygg en 2013 (deux anciens de chez Starbreeze), et dont l'un des objectifs était initialement de… publier un jeu par an. Si on ajoute à ça le fait que le studio n'a plus rien publié depuis et que de toute façon, concernant les trois têtes derrières le jeu dont il est question aujourd'hui, deux (Mattias Snygg et Linus Larsson) ont fondé un nouveau studio, Wych Elm Games, et que le dernier (Jens Andersson) est parti rejoindre MachinesGames, les développeurs des derniers Wolfenstein, autant dire qu'on n'en a plus à attendre grand-chose de Villa Gorilla.

Ça, c'était pour vous refroidir d'emblée, ne me remerciez pas. Dorénavant, réchauffons-nous un peu et parlons du jeu. Pour résumer simplement l'identité du titre, Yoku's Island Express est un mélange audacieux entre jeu de flipper et metroidvania, le tout sous couvert d'une identité graphique rappelant fortement les titres développés via le UbiArt Framework (Child of Light, Rayman Origins et Legends par exemple) ou encore Seasons After Fall du studio Swing Swing Submarine (on notera d'ailleurs que les développeurs ont eux-mêmes créé leur propre moteur, ce qui a encore moins aidé à développer le jeu rapidement).

Derrière ce concept original et qui aurait pu s'avérer casse-gueule en résulte un titre qui tient très bien la route. Les décors sont variés, agréables à parcourir et les musiques sont sympathiques. Le scénario est bien plus faiblard certes, mais on ne joue clairement pas à Yoku pour cela. Metroidvania oblige, on obtiendra plusieurs améliorations lors de notre périple afin de pouvoir accéder à certaines zones inaccessibles jusqu'alors.

Bien que j'aie pris beaucoup de plaisir à parcourir l'aventure, le plus gros problème du jeu reste quand même son faible contenu. Autant, je ne suis pas un adepte du « plus c'est long mieux c'est » (hum hum), autant Yoku m'a laissé un peu sur ma faim. Au niveau de sa durée de vie, comptez 5 heures pour arriver au bout de l'aventure et 10 pour atteindre le 100 %. C'est déjà peu pour le genre, mais en l'occurrence, en plus de manquer d'une ou de deux quêtes supplémentaires, ou encore, de se terminer plutôt abruptement, Yoku manque d'un tableau de flipper vraiment épique afin de clôturer l'aventure. À partir de là, une simple déduction s'impose : je n'ai pas trouvé les tableaux de Yoku's Island Express très intéressants alors que pourtant, je suis loin d'être un fan du genre du jeu de flipper. On sent qu'en plus de vouloir rendre leur titre accessible au plus grand nombre, que les développeurs ne voulaient pas rendre les allers-retours trop chiants (parce que c'est déjà un peu le cas en l'état), et qu'ils ont donc fait en sorte qu'on puisse facilement passer d'un tableau à un autre ou s'en échapper facilement… mais en se contentant de tableaux aussi simplistes, le titre donne clairement l'impression qu'il n'atteint pas la moitié de son potentiel.

C'est d'autant plus frustrant que, vu que Yoku's Island Express ne connaîtra probablement jamais de suite (ou au mieux par des développeurs différents), qu'on ne saura jamais jusqu'où ils auraient pu aller.

Cependant, encore une fois, l'ensemble fonctionne très bien. Oui, Yoku n'est pas parfait, oui, il m'a laissé un peu sur ma faim… mais cela dit, il faut tout de même avouer que le titre se révèle assez original pour que je vous le recommande. Et puis bon, ça ne dure que cinq heures quoi. Même si cela ne fera qu'accentuer votre frustration une fois le titre terminé, vous êtes sûr au moins de ne pas trop perdre de votre temps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976483333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1705807377}
review: It's a pinball adventure! Feels like everything I love about games like loco roco, sonic spinball, devil's crush, hollow knight, with a bit of amanita design flair on the graphics. If that all means nothing to you, all you need to know is it's a charming open world pinball platformer adventure with satisfyingly hidden collectables, unlockable movement mechanics that will have you seeking to return to areas you've been before, a surprisingly cosmically horrific story and setting, and some gorgeous painterly art, rendered in a style that's an absolute treat to look at. If you like pinball even a little bit, wrapped up in some grander tight and focused game design, this game is for you

author: {'steamid': '76561198816226841', 'num_games_owned': 2267, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1680672072}
review:
第一次见到把类银河战士恶魔城与弹球结合在一起的游戏，还是挺新鲜、挺有意思的。
流程较短，boss战也很简单，通关大概需要6小时，全收集不知，画风类似于奥日，地图目测应该只有其一半大小。
在通关后其实就已经比较鸡肋了，支线给的奖励要么是提升货币上限，要么给个新颜色的球，有些宝箱来之不易结果里面居然只有3个菠萝（30块钱），通关后的体验是欠佳的。
另外游戏时经常会出现一些闪屏，略有一点影响体验。
个人游戏评分：88/100
个人总评分：89/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198268196167', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1680582151}
review: Yoku's Island Express is a charming little indie metroidvania. Though not especially long (you can 100% the game in around 10 hours), it's very enjoyable to play, and the pinball mechanics help bring a fresh take on the genre. There are a few puzzles which I feel could've been more clear, but overall the game is well designed, and unless you're going for completion you're unlikely to get stuck on anything. The game is also great looking, especially for a low budget indie game, and stands toe-to-toe with stuff like Ori and Hollow Knight. Overall a great game, and one which any fan of metroidvanias (or pinball!) should definitely pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314432311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1680651222}
review:
本体は虫・・・じゃなくて玉の方。
キャラと画風がなんか自分の好みではなかったのでスルーしてたけど最高のゲームでした。
主人公はフンコロガシのような虫で
最初はもしかしてずっと玉をくっつけて移動しなきゃならないのかと思ったのですが
むしろ玉の方が主人公でした

だけど虫がくっついてて玉を転がせるので普通のピンボールとは違って多少の位置とスピードを調節できる所があるのが特徴的だと思いました。
しかも玉を直接目標にぶつけなくても近くで吹くだけで物に干渉できたりアイテムを回収出来たりするピヨピヨ笛というシステムもあってそれも便利で楽しいです。

セーブポイントがいたるところに配置されててちょっと止めたい時にいちいち探す手間が無い所も親切だと思いました。

２Ｄアクションとピンボールが好きな人は買いです。
正直、画面が広くキャラが小さいので大画面でのプレイをオススメします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198061838660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1680551426}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968698087', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1683134301}
review:
Great game if you enjoy pinball and open world games. Transitioning between platforming and pinball puzzles work very well. The story is cute and characters have enough persona to do the job. I played this game together with my kid (almost six). We had a lot of fun and it brought me joy to hear his screams and cheers while we progressed.
Considering it's a indie title I have nothing bad to say about this little gem. Pacing is nice, nothing feels tedious. Music rocks you into a nice Caribbean relaxed mode and of you go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314652319', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1541019812}
review:
I love me a good metroid-vania, this game is loose in that description (and I feel many are for the current era, a more apt genre-name may be required) however this was such a fantastic ride and I enjoyed every moment of it.

Admittedly I thought I'd 100% the game and still believe I obtained the largest wallet but my achievements list begs to differ on this matter. Either way this isn't a big deal, as I missed 100% all (I guess relics in the game), I would love to come back and get those completion elements another time but alas we all are limited in our life on this planet and I feel that achieving that would be fleeting/constricting against other important aspects of life, as such I don't imagine I will do so.

However, this is a game I have recommended to a lot of people and will continue to do so, it's got subtle aspects that could usher and individual into the metroidvania genre, whilst also fulfilling that niche of an adventure pinball game. Heck knows how many games can state they fill either of those voids ey??

Recommended 100% (you don't need an interest in either a metroid-vania or a pinball game to enjoy the cutesy story/adventure of this bad-boy)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990194469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1682191927}
review: Fun and unique though I don't usually like pinballs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995216704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1680462158}
review:
Never thought that a Pinball-inspired Metroidvania would ever be a thing.

It's an easy game however the main loop (pun intended) gets repetitive after a while. Music is very chilled with jazzy and funky tunes. The plot is your average "nice world has gone to hell and it's up to you and your fellow people to restore order". Interesting and charming cast of characters, varied art and world design, refreshing gate and key mechanics. Achievements isn't overbearing and you can finish the game in one save. Clocked about 14 hours with a little bit of help with achievement hunting. Art style is always interesting to look at. There is no combat or violence in this game except if you count hitting bosses with your ball or sucking up explosive slugs to destroy walls. Sometimes funny dialog happens. The only gripe with the game is, you will have a hard time to get your ball in certain areas but other than that, it's a good chill game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1680448054}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express is basically a pinball metroidvania, and it’s awesome. It ticks all the boxes for what makes a great metroidvania: a great interconnected world to explore, locked areas only accessible with a later upgrade, and great level design. The main difference is that you cannot jump. Instead, you must use flippers that are scattered everywhere.
Most of the map consists of open areas to explore. Since there’s no combat, the genre combat rooms are replaced with more traditional pinball tables. These 2 genres are perfectly blended; however, the pinball mechanics can get annoying when you’re required to make more precision shots. Not only that, but a later upgrade also requires good timing to execute properly, and it can get frustrating if you’re constantly missing. Sometimes it’s just not fun to play.
The art and music are great and charming. The game isn’t too long, clocking at around 5-6 hours just for the story. Aiming for 100% will at least double that time, and moping up everything feels good for the most part. There’re 2 exceptions. Pinball tables have extra challenges that aren’t immediately obvious, and some will require a lot of precision, although at least they aren’t timed. The other one is that you’ll need to use an upgrade in an unintuitive way for a few collectibles. And even when you figure it out, it’s still hard to execute it properly. Maps are available, but you must find them first. Still, it’s not a hard game to 100%, just a bit annoying at times.
In the end, I mostly had a good time while 100% the game. The game is fun overall, but the frustrating parts will stand out a bit. While I disagree that this is a great game or a must buy, it’s still pretty good and I can recommend it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031491341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1680263589}
review:
Excellent game!
Movement and pinballing is so fun. The game has lots to explore and collect. The collectables are sometimes just out of reach, making you really think about how to use the game's unique mechanics to access everything.

The only pinball game I had played was Windows XP's Space Cadet 3D Pinball, so I wouldn't say I'm big into pinball. But I got great at Yoku's really quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561199186386634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1679974925}
review:
Amazing little game. If you like platformers and have the slightest enjoyment in playing pinball, this is an excellent choice. The story is average, but the fact there is a story at all is a plus, as the main focus is the actual mechanics of the game which feels fun and unique the whole way through. Additionally, almost all the the little secrets and collectibles actually feel rewarding to find, as some are in your face but you can't reach them until later and some are pretty well hidden, it's a very good mix in that regard. The music is very calming and fits the background well, and mixes multiple genres like ska, reggae, blues, hip hop, and some jazz to create a very content feeling throughout. 

I personally recommend playing it the way that feels best to you. I tended to zigzag, I would get distracted and go off and do something before eventually coming back to the main story. And I loved it. It's not a very long game, someone could beat it in a day or two or playing, but it was an excellent adventure all the while.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974994987', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1679971498}

review: An utterly charming, but brief experience. Fair warning though, if you don't like Pinball or lack patience, you will probably hate this game. Because about 90% of it is Pinball-Platforming (i.e. Sonic Spinball). And with that comes all of the annoyances of playing Pinball. So if you can deal with spending up to 20 minutes or more at times, simply trying to get to the next table/screen, you will probably enjoy this one. $20 is a bit steep for what you get here, but definitely grab this when it's on one of the frequent steam sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163813229', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1679198525}
review:
This game is criminally underrated and should be tried regardless of the weird combination of genres. It's a metroidvania + pinball game and on paper it sounds super weird but the game is fantastic. I beat the main story in about 10 hours(but that was also with me finishing every quest and trying to get every collectible) and I think its the perfect length. There's enough secret areas and stuff to explore I wouldn't want it any bigger. Most of the quests in this game are "go here get this, bring it back" but that's okay because in between is pinball mini games you get to go through to get said item. There also isn't many quests so its not that bad. The story was cute and the boss fights were unexpected but worked very well, but I think the exploration was the best part of the game.

My only complaint is having to use the slug ability for some collectibles. Basically, you can vacuum up slugs and they will explode to unlock areas or send you flying and some collectibles are locked behind having to make a jump. More specifically having to get to vertical areas it just makes it the most unreliable tech ever.. I spent over 40 minutes on one section just because it would fling me different directions every single time... 

Other then that the game is a hidden masterpiece and during the time of this review its on sale for $4 and it is soooo worth the money.

review: if you like pinball and want an actual story to guide you on your journey through bumpers and flippers, then this is the game for you! The artistic choice is one that is light and refreshing. The different biomes are both interesting and unique. The levels are forgiving and reward skill at the same time. There is no death in the game making it very friendly for little gamers or newer gamers who struggle with timing and rhythm. Its a relatively simple but enjoyable game. The quests DEFINITELY don't drag on and reward you with new game mechanics along the way (metroidvania style). While its a solid entry for its genre, but definitely not mindblowing. More of a nice chill game to play on a Sunday afternoon. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199113500749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1672983085}
review:
A Metroidvania pinball game. It's a really unique idea, and they actually execute quite well. You have a lot of options in where you choose to go, providing some nice non-linearity. There were times when I went through a region to end up somewhere I recognized and had one of those "a-ha" moments of understanding how the regions connect. The pinball sections are self contained with more traditional movement between pinball sections. There were some pleasant NPCs, an aesthetically pleasing environment, and enjoyable music to round out the experience. Also, don't worry if you're mid-game, there is some fast travel as the game goes on (much needed, as your walk speed it quite slow).

This was a fun and extremely unique experience. Definitely worth the time to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198362496959', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1694346647}
review:
月包的key，所以不是原价购入，算是意外之喜。
画风非常可爱，玩法也很独特的一款小游戏。地图设计也很有趣，一整张大地图里嵌入各个小副本，整体看着赏心悦目。
主要就是主角（虫子）推着球滚啊滚，以及通过弹球玩法飞速移动，途中收集水果气泡（积分），并解锁封锁的弹球板。因为是弹球，所以没有“死亡”，被尖刺刺了是减分，但因为弹着弹着总会得到分，所以并不是多大的损失。整体使用的按键非常之少，只有左右shift，左右箭头和enter，对我这种手残党来说很亲切。
目前非常喜欢

---------14个小时过去了----------
目前已经通了主线，还有些收集没拿到。途中也遇到了一些坑，容我碎碎念一下子。
太空修士的火箭那里，我每次企图通过弹珠弹上去，都会被一个刺猬一样的东西顶出来，我以为是让我躲开，还费劲得尝试用炸弹把自己炸起来，没想到，是在那个刺猬出来的时候弹一下弹板，把它顶上去——视线都去看刺猬了，根本没注意到那个啊！
和小家伙们打敌人的那关，描述是说先把水晶打掉再用刀，我就傻愣愣得一直打水晶，还以为是耐久啥的。后来才发现是要把小人的弹珠弹到指定位置，orz。
打蜘蛛的那关，是先滚过两边，让它收起腿，再带着炸弹打中间。

review: Ein Flipper-Adventure. Echt mal was ganz anderes. Und es ist zudem noch sehr liebevoll gemacht und absolut anspruchsvoll und herausfordernd an vielen Stellen. Das hier ist ausnahmslos eine echte Perle unter den Spielen. Großes Lob an die Entwickler.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975632889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1677869822}
review:
Yoku's Island Express
Ein 'Pinball Jump&Run Sonic-Metroidvania'  ...ohne Jump. 

Dafür dass ich Jump&Runs oft nicht mag (z.B. Super Mario oder Sonic, sind mir irgendwie zu eintönig), mochte ich dieses Spiel sehr! Vor allem die Flippermechanik lockert das Spiel  als Mini-Spiel ständig auf. 

Man steuert wie bei einem Jump&Run Ameise mit einem Ball nach links oder rechts. Es ist also kein reines Flipper-Spiel wie z.B. 'Rollers of the realm'. Man kann zwar nicht direkt springen, dafür gibt es an vielen Stellen Flipper-Bumper, die man wie bei einem Pinballspiel als Sprunghilfe nutzt. Dadurch kann man dann doch springen und manchmal schießt und wirbelt man durch Röhren, als würde man ein gutes Sonic Spiel spielen. 
Zugleich löst man Puzzles und kann nur mit neuen Gegenständen durch bekannte Türen und in neue Höhlen vordringen (Metroidvania).

Die Grafik ist süß und knuffig, die Rätsel meist eher leicht. An zwei Stellen habe ich doch Youtube bemüht. Leider gleich am Anfang, weil ich einen Bumper übersah, mit dem man seine Ameise nach unten in den Boden schießen kann. Diese Mechanik wurde vorher nicht erklärt. Sonst sind alle Mechaniken im Spiel gut und intuitiv verständlich. 
Immer wenn eine Mechanik droht langweilig zu werden kommt eine ganz neue hinzu, so dass es mir Spaß damit machte auch alte bekannte Gebiete neu zu erkunden.

Die Geschichte und die NPCs Quests sind abwechslungsreich und machen Lust weiter zu spielen, so dass ich mich mehrfach darauf freute abends weiter spielen zu dürfen.

author: {'steamid': '76561199009572631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1674257381}
review:
This is an adventure game with some heavy pinball elements, but you could also call it a pinball game about an island adventure. 

I liked the artwork, the music, and the different characters that were introduced to explain why specific puzzles were part of the game mechanics. 

The island has a lot of secrets to discover, giving it a lot of gameplay value beyond the central story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284944547', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1344, 'last_played': 1678000068}
review: 终于全成就了，不得不说这是个非常优秀的独立游戏，弹球玩法+银河恶魔城非常有创意，难度应该比其他恶魔城都要低得多，主打一个休闲，比较花时间的点在于收集元素，柳条、宝箱、喷头、邮箱、火炬、圣甲虫等等，只要进度达到100%就能全成就了。弹球操作应该是比较简单的，而且没有战斗不会被折磨（有boss战，但不是直接攻击boss，而是操作弹球击中特定机关来攻击boss，boss也不会攻击），主线任务和支线任务还是比较丰富的，单纯通关也就几个小时，唤醒神明后再收集完柳条去解锁火炬可以触发真结局，去下面孵化那个卵中的不知名神兽就结束了。还有游戏的美术和音乐也非常nice。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971936419', 'num_games_owned': 2270, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1666538003}
review:
For starters, was good on Steam Deck, and while it wouldn't be my first choice of game to play if I'm at a full-on computer, it was a good casual one to be on the go with.

Overall challenge-wise, there are certain quests or collectibles where I did eventually give in and resort to looking up guides/hints. And similar to how Portal 1 flips from "this is the game" to "nah, that ~2/3 of the game was just the tutorial, NOW you're playing the game." the parts of this game which feel like "all cylinders are firing" happen pretty late, and end up feeling relatively short as a result.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995186057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1677465925}
review:
A great spin on pinball with plenty of unique cheerful twists. The exploration and mini-tables are easy to understand, and is very forgiving with trying as many times as needed. It had a very metroidvania feel for ability unlocks, backtracking, and hidden areas. 

It can feel a bit overwhelming in the middle once you have all of the objectives available with so much exploring to do. Just have to focus on one goal at a time, and you'll learn every corner of the map and get everything completed. A few minor mechanics needed for 100% completion were not taught in the basegame and took a bit of googling after finishing the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105375764', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1691251748}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001258350', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1676858703}
review:
Fun short game combining metroidvania and pinball gimmicks. Unlike some metroidvanias, this one is fun right from the start. If anything, the abilities you unlock are a bit tedious, but in the same way pinball can be tedious when you retry 10 times to get the correct angle. So if you hate pinball games this game won't be for you. I'm not a die-hard pinball fan but still had a good time since deaths don't matter, there are arrows on the paddles that helps with aiming, and you can manually adjust the ball on the paddles by pushing it around.

The soundtrack is relaxed and pretty catchy. It's annoying how the first ability is a party blower, it's super loud and clashes with the vibe of the game. 
The story is just enough to justify exploring the map. Dialogue is short and doesn't get in the way. You visit the whole island to fill mailboxes, help a few people, and save their world. It's weird that the game makes them return to their status quo despite the island clearly having more deeply rooted issues that remain untouched at the end. I guess you're just a bug after all.

My one gripe with the game is the overworld map. Once you've explored all areas you'll have a few fetch quests to do (but most aren't mandatory) and you'll have to refer to the map often to find your way around. But the map is awful. It's a screenshot of the game so the readability is bad, it doesn't let you zoom in, the paths are unclear, and the icons are hard to find. It made post-game completion annoying to complete but I still enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037670149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1694816656}
review: Wonderful pinball adventure game with an amazing soundtrack. I'm especially happy about the game difficulty because it manages to be challenging without ever really being punitive, and the overall satisfying gameplay makes it perfect to chill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004346647', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1676604756}
review:
Its a fairly short Metroidvania; I 100% completed it in just a few sessions.  But I did enjoy my time with the game.

+The music is alright.  A few catchy tunes here and there.
+Art style and character dialogue is pretty cheery, was smiling the whole way through.
+The pinball physics feel a bit simplified, easier to approach than a traditional pinball game.  I feel the game is more enjoyable because of it(I don't hate Pinball, but those games can be very unforgiving at times).
+I had a glitch-free experience through my play through.
+Built in randomizer for those who enjoy that.  -I didn't :s
+I feel $20 is already a fair price, but the game does go on sale quite a bit if your on the fence about it.

=Fairly casual difficulty.  There is no "fail state", most of the game felt like a quick breeze to play through.

-Overworld travel is slow.  Later you unlock fast travel "bee lines" for quick, central access to major areas, but I found it annoying how few entry points there were to it; especially when there were clear spots that *could* have been an entrance.  It emphasizes how slow Yoku moves on the ground when outside pinball areas.
-Aforementioned short playtime.  And the post-game content isn't very rewarding or interesting.

4/5 Maybe would have enjoyed randomizer more if overworld travel wasn't so slow.

review: I don't remember if I got this for free or from a bundle, and I first started playing it without even looking at the store page. It turned out to be a fun mix of a platformer and pinball game that got me hooked really quickly. It plays very well on the Steam Deck, and the soundtrack is great. My only criticism is that it's easy to get a bit lost sometimes on what one needs to do or where one needs to go next, especially if one is not paying attention to what the characters say. Traversing the world, at least initially, can sometimes feel a bit too slow, and if you aren't paying attention like I sometimes didn't, you could end up spending a bit of time just going back and forth - which isn't too bad as exploration is rewarded, generally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056902770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1676371023}
review:
[b]What I expected:[/b] [i]A cute bug game with pinball[/i]
[b]What I got:[/b] [i]A metroidvania about slaying gods and preventing the apocalypse[/i]
[hr][/hr]

Jokes aside, [b]Yoku’s Island Express[/b] is what happens when you aren’t afraid to combine genres and have both the inventiveness and competence to make it work.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Yoku arrives to an island to be it’s next postman, you’ll navigate the island to deliver mail and deliver news about happenings, collecting items and doing side-quests in the meantime.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
As the trailer shows, the main gimmick is that this beetle protagonist is tethered to a ball that can be flung around in a pinball-style manner, this isn’t a way to rack up points but it’s used to solve puzzle and platforming challenges.

The relatively large, interconnected map and amount of extra content really makes this title shine.

[h1]X-Factor[/h1]
Graphics are something you’d see in a children fairytale’s book and work very well with the overall atmosphere.
[hr][/hr]

There are no negatives that I can think of about this game besides that’s not your genre, but you should know that by looking at a trailer for it, wholeheartedly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561199475859335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1676209607}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016632416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1673832667}
review:
I loved most everything about Yoku's Island Express.  The same alchemy that went into mixing a Dung Beatle, pinball, mail delivery, fruit, and a tropical island went into mixing pinball with a Metrodvaina.  None if it should work or make any scene, but it is in fact, fantastic.  The game is cute casual and whimsical to say the least.  There is no death, damage, or danger.... save missing a bumper and landing someplace half a map away.

As much as I loved the experience with this game, there are clearly a few rough edges.  The biggest being that there is too much pinball.... trying to move across the map is fantastic and interesting the first time... but it becomes exhausting going back and forth repeatedly.  Luckily there is a fast travel system.  Unluckily, it is also almost as frustrating as traveling on foot.  It only goes a few places, and is really clunky to use.  My second criticism is that, most of the upgrades feel all but useless.  Sure, there are a handful that open up new areas, but most are just minor upgrades to the traversal unlocks or are only useful a couple times.  It just made for underwhelming progression.

Even with a few rough edges, this game was a breath of fresh air.  I wonderful combination of things I never would have put together, that somehow turned into pure gaming magic.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who thinks this combination sounds at all entertaining.  If it does seem like your cup of tea, play the demo and I'm sure you will be hooked.  I got this game on sale, but had I paid the full current retail of $20 I think I still would have been happy with my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038713122', 'num_games_owned': 1082, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1675721376}
review:
I have a few big issues with this game, which makes me not want to recommend it. There is a lot of backtracking, especially if you want collectables. This can be very tedious, as the route you have to take to reach a given place on the map can be confusing, causing you to reach detours and dead ends on accident. 

The game also requires an annoying amount of precision for a lot of the pinball "arenas", and will punish you by wasting time if you miss. Almost felt like playing "Getting Over It" at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198827449208', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1708289304}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010287346', 'num_games_owned': 2802, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1674984025}
review:
[h1]A fun and enjoyable game that combines platforming and pinball mechanics in a unique way.[/h1]

The ball mechanics are seamlessly integrated into the gameplay, making it easy to learn and control. The visuals and sound design are immersive. With an open-world design, featuring different environments such as jungle, ice, and dessert, that players can revisit after discovering new abilities. Overall, the game offers a decent amount of challenge and plenty of content to enjoy.

[b]The price is reasonable and an even better value if on sale, considering the amount of gameplay it offers if you're looking for a fun and unique experience.
.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198373121909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1672672367}
review: This game is stupidly fun. If you like pinball, this game is something you should give a chance. It takes some getting used to with the physics and how the mechanics work and it's pretty open world, so you can reach certain places when you don't need to go there yet, which allows you to get certain items early. The music is fun, the story, I kind of overlooked the story most of the time, though. Some of the controls are a little bit awkward, especially with the Sootling rope and the slug vacuum, but that's okay. The art style is also really pretty. I feel like I was pretty close to the end of the game, but then I ended up being asked to deal with these very large and very gross-looking spiders. I have serious arachnophobia, so I never got to finish the game, which is really unfortunate. Unless you're an arachnophobe, you should absolutely try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199038100689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1674693148}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993623008', 'num_games_owned': 2500, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1673862802}
review:
This game can be summarized as Metroidvania meets Pinball.


Fun game, took me about 8 hours to finish and 4 more hours to 100%. The mechanics are pretty solid (the swinging mechanic is a bit hard to control but fine overall), the exploration is fun and there are no super hidden spots/items on the map that requires a wiki to 100% the game.

The story isn't anything special and pretty much forgettable.

Overall a solid 8/10, must play for Metroidvania fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000478212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1673802111}
review:
A really excellent, enjoyable (and original) game. 

I played it in two "blocks" of time. The first part, I got to something like 50% completion (of all the collectables, etc.) and defeated the final boss. After that, I took a few days break and then worked through the rest of the collectables. Both phases of the game were fun and challenging in their own way. 

I probably won't play it again now, but  the timer says I got 16 hours out of it for 100% completion, so good value for money too. Very suitable for any small people you might have in the house and best played with a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056365904', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1673674127}
review:
This is a fairly cute and easy going game. I found it to be perfect when just chilling out and I SUCK at pinball so that's saying something!

The characters are charming in look alone; as there's not a huge amount of dialogue; and the soundtrack is really pleasant. 100%ing the game did prove some challenge both because of my lacking skill in pinball games but some of the collectables are also hidden pretty well or difficult to get to! Sometimes both at the same time!

I'd certainly say this was worth the fun little romp that it was.
