author: {'steamid': '76561198053783918', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1649023381}
review:
Yoku's Island Express to niezwykle oryginalna gra, łącząca elementy platformówki z elementami pinballa. Fabuła gry kręci się wokół młodego dungoneera, który przemierza wyspę, rozwiązując zagadki i pokonując przeciwników, korzystając z mechaniki pinballa. Grafika jest kolorowa i bardzo przyjemna dla oka, a muzyka dopasowana do klimatu gry.

Plusy:
[list]
[*]oryginalna koncepcja połączenia elementów platformówki z pinballa
[*]świetnie zaprojektowana grafika i muzyka
[*]ciekawy i interesujący scenariusz
[*]wiele różnorodnych zadań do wykonania
[/list]
Minusy:
[list]
[*]niektóre elementy gry mogą być trudne dla początkujących graczy
[*]niektóre sekcje gry mogą wydawać się powtarzalne
[/list]
Podsumowując, Yoku's Island Express to niezwykle oryginalna i interesująca gra, która łączy elementy platformówki z elementami pinballa. Oferuje ona ciekawy i interesujący scenariusz, świetnie zaprojektowana grafika i muzykę oraz wiele różnorodnych zadań do wykonania. Yoku's Island Express jest grą wartą polecenia dla tych, którzy lubią oryginalne i nietypowe pomysły.

[h1]Dziękuje za przeczytanie mojej recenzji na temat gry Yoku's Island Express, jeżeli ta recenzja ci się spodobała, przydała podczas zakupu lub poprawiła ci humor - zapraszam do rozdania nagrody lub pozostawienia oceny pod recenzją.
Zapraszam również do przeczytania [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/HyperSonic0/reviews]moich recenzji na temat innych gier[/url].[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198016120529', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1673612229}

author: {'steamid': '76561199239431634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1672902242}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is an odd and charming pinball Metroidvania adventure.

I...honestly don't know if there's much more to say. That pretty much sums it up. It combines the ability-based platforming exploration of a Metroidvania with the fiddly clickety-clackiness of pinball. That may not be for everyone, but it's not badly executed for what it is.

To spare you some frustration: when you gain the ability to hold explosive slugs, press LT and RT together (as opposed to what the instructions say) to ensure you actually can. This will make more sense when you get to that point.

And if the concept of this game intrigues you, you should get to that point. This is a fun way to spend some time, even if getting through the pinball environments can take longer than ordinary platforming exploration. With that understanding, this is definitely a game I would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053572064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1682794426}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140856835', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1662140695}
review:
[Pay-to-Play] I was on the fence about writing a review for this game because it is a love-hate relationship for me for this game. But this game is really too impactful to not leave a review for it. It took me 18h to get all achievements (with 7h of idling time). TLDR ver below~

Heads up, this is going to be a long review with some personal ranting mix in it :P
(if you do not want to read my rant just skip to Part 2 xD)

[h1] Part 1: Personal Experience / Rant [/h1]
Honestly, it was pure coincidence / fate of playing this game and what made me pick up this game?
Well, I wanted to join a group and one of their requirement is for us to beat the game of our choice; and I picked this game so I had the motivation and badly wanted to complete it.

I encountered problems very early into the game, getting soft-locked / stuck so I was very bumped out. So I made a post on how I was getting stuck.  Thankfully, there is someone who saw the post and  is very helpful and experienced and she gave me tips and  resolved the soft-lock. We became good friends and I am very thankful to her ^_^

[b]Basically, if we do not have enough fruits to proceed; we can save and then refresh and the fruits will spawn again.[/b]

Ironically, the post I've made had also attracted the attention of another user. 
He was friendly in the beginning; but then things got bad/ sour between us. Said person was remorseful and he has apologised for his actions and I forgive him but I do not plan on having a friendship with him again

To anyone curious, it was something like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1954050/Memory_Shards/]Memory Shards[/url] 
Well not to a T, but the idea is there: to not force your ideals onto anyone

Okeyz, my personal rant is over, now onto the gameplay~

[h1] Part 2: Talking about the Actual Gameplay [/h1]
So..why is this game a love-hate? well; I was getting stuck at some parts / maps and at 1 point I was in the same action / loop for 20 minutes. So it was really frustrating. Turns out I can simply restart back to the last checkpoint to save me some time, lol. And also, it was only until nearing the end game that I realise the slider's power (they will be glowing / highlighted) can impact the power and direction the pinball is going. So.. all along I was just blindly flipping and hoped for the best without noticing the slider's power :P

[h1] What made this game good / worth it? [/h1]
This is a very innovative pinball + Adventure game; the music is really soothing too~ You can see the devs has really put a lot of efforts into the game as the map is really big and when I truly completed it; I really yearn for more, but eventually all good things will come to an end.

This game has been on the back of my mind for a long time and not writing a review for it is simply not doing justice for this beautiful game.

[b]I love it, I hate it (the annoying parts), Most importantly, I didnt want to end it :') [/b]

TLDR; Verdict: Yes, this game is 100% worth it.

Tags: [Pinball] [Adventure] [Beautiful] [Exploration] [Puzzle-like] [Love-hate] [Eargasm]

author: {'steamid': '76561198111594185', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1660169852}
review:
Oyunun ana hikayesini yaptım, yan görevlerle uğraşmadım.

Oyun bir şey haricinde güzel. Oda haritada gezmesi. Oyunun ucu çok açık. Ve hata yaparsanız ölmüyorsunuz. Bu yüzden örnek vermek gerekirse haritanın sağ ucundan düşerseniz düştüğünüz yere geri gelmek için bayağı uğraşmanız gerekiyor. Oyunun ana hikayesini oynarken bir sıkıntı değil çünkü oyun yapacak etkinliklerle dolu, bir diğerini kenara koyup başka bir şeyle uğraşmaya başlıyorsunuz ama spesifik yan görevlerle uğraşmayı zor kılıyor. 

Bu sıkıntı haricinde oyun dört dörtlük. Hoş müzikler, tatlı görseller ve pinball oynanışlı bir metroidvania. Metroidvaniaları seviyorsanız oynamanızı şiddetle tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009907854', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1672547969}
review: Pinball Metroidvania. That's all I needed to be drawn in, and it sure does capitalize on the idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043268673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1672511380}
review:
Easy to recommend.
It's ~8 hours (up to 20 to 100%), casual and 100% gameplay (no padding/time wasting).

[h1]Gameplay(9/10)[/h1]
It's pinball, but in open world and you get a few power-ups along the way. It doesn't have any mindblowing mechanics, but what's there is polished.

Few more notable things include
[list]
[*] Metroidvania style map progression and shortcuts (i.e. get powerup to reach new places).
[*] Optional objectives (like delviering mail, quests and such).
[*] Has some puzzles that don't have the most obvious solutions
[/list]

[h1]Achievements (10/10)[/h1]
Fairly nicely done. 
What's there CAN feel challenging, but the game does a fairly good job at guiding you and road to 100% completion is all either gameplay or puzzles There's no padding, speedruns, "new game plus" or other nonsense achievements, that just waste your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026663817', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1667479789}
review:
To me, this is one of those games that seem perfect on paper and yet you find yourself just not wanting to play them all that much. At first I thought it's amazing: pinball, but the ball can leave the table and go on a crazy adventure over many different tables? That's fresh and very interesting! And then I played it, and, well...

For one thing, I don't like the setting. Very subjective thing; I guess I'm just not a fan of tropical jungles. The animals are cute, and so is Yoku - but the reggae-ish tropical chillax simply isn't my vibe. I'm a bear! It's far too hot and humid for a creature like myself.

Next - the pinball gameplay. I have two complaints here. First is that the tables feel very railroad-based, rather than accuracy based. Shoot the ball into that tunnel and the rest will happen on its own. That's just no fun. And second - it's hard to control. Since the flippers (paddles) are essentially the only things you can control - as it should be, it's pinball - you'd expect to be able to have more control over how hard you hit the ball. But it almost felt binary to me. It's either up or down. Hitting the button hard doesn't make the ball launch faster. Or maybe it does but my crappy controller just couldn't do it, I don't know. Granted, there [i]is[/i] some degree of control you have there, but overall I found it lacking and even frustrating at times.

And... that's about it, when talking about flaws, really. The rest is pretty much what you'd expect from a quality metroidvania. Ability-locked paths, forks in the road, some minor quests, I think there's even fast travel (didn't get that far)... and of course the wonderful, colourful world. Everything is very pretty. Sadly, the aforementioned problems made me lose interest in it all.

I'd say play the demo, see if the vibe checks out for you. I didn't expect to not like this one, seeing as I'm a sucker for unconventional experiences, but sometimes things just don't work. I don't think it's a bad game at all, but I can't recommend it if I didn't like it, now can I?

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42922988/]Curator Page[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198082764480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1672081744}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is unlike any metroidvania you have ever played. It mixes metroidvania like progression with pinball plaforming. It works insanely well thanks to how well the controls and the map design is. 
Artstyle, characters, writing and musics are all incredible and most importantly the game is extremely fun and addictive. World is fun to explore and you get rewarded for every place you check. It also has some collectathon feel to it and it excites you by sprinkling some mystery behind your rewards.
As soon as you pick up the game, you see how much passion and creativity developers poured into it.  I strongly recommend you to give it a shot. Yoku needs your help to deliver some mails.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025779198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1671928104}
review:
Yoku's Island Express es una sorprendente mezcla de estilos entre metroidvania y un juego de pinball. En él manejaremos a un escarabajo pelotero que llega a una isla con la misión de convertirse en el nuevo cartero.

Pros:
- Mundo abierto con multitud de areas y sin ninguna carga entre ellas.
- Mecánicas de plataformas sin realizar saltos.
- Apartado visual llamativo.

Contras:
- Las mecánicas de pinball pueden dificultar repetir ciertas acciones.
- El viaje rápido no es todo lo rápido que podría ser.

Conclusión: Yoku's Island Express es un gran metroidvania que incluye todo lo bueno de ese género (mapa abierto, exploración, evolución del personaje para llegar a mas zonas) con unas mecánicas de pinball que recuerdan vagamente a los Sonic clásicos (aunque no tienen nada que ver, aquí ni se puede saltar). Tiene algunos combates con jefes pero no enemigos al uso con lo que no tiene un sistema de combate en sí mismo. El juego no es difícil (diría que ni se puede morir en sí), lo que lo convierte en un metroidvania perfecto para jugar relajado, explorando su mundo.

Puntuación: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037950334', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1629547264}
review:
I like pinballs in general but I find pinball games that only has some tables and a hi-score to get boring after several dozens of minutes.

This gives a real sense of adventure, the game is also really forgiving and you can choose the 3 paths in any order so each playthrough can be different (well, at least in 6 different ways).

In short this is how I would've considered Metroid Prime Pinball and Sonic Spinball to be back then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163107074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1671553151}
review:
The game is good but it has some flaws and those are terrible. I only recommend this game if you don't care about your time.

- The map is huge and there is no fast travel. There's a kind of fast travel but not enough to be useful. You have to go to specific points that take you across the map in real time and these are not even in all the map, just a few spots. Not a good design.

- The gameplay is based on physics like a pinball machine. This is not bad but some things are just too tedious. Most of the time to reach a certain place inside the pinball mini-games you have to be lucky the physics are in your favor and you don't end up bouncing around until you make it.

Because of these issues getting all the secrets becomes a chore.
The rest of the game is great. The art is good and the rest of the gameplay too. Only play this game if you don't care about moving around in a tedious way.

author: {'steamid': '76561199153269839', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1671485672}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969481314', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1670708777}
review:
Imagina um jogo que mistura metroidvania com pinball. Não parece que funcionaria, né? Pois é, mas funciona e não só funciona, como funciona muito bem! Em Yoku´s Island Express o jogador assume o papel de um besouro rola-bosta, que em vez de rolar esterco, rola uma bola de pinball, e chega de barco para ser carteiro em uma ilha tropical.

Na ilha tropical o jogador tem que cumprir vários objetivos para os personagens do local, todos desenhados a mão e muito carismáticos, incluindo o personagem principal controlado pelo jogador. Não só os personagens são muito interessantes visualmente, como todo o mapa parece cuidadosamente criado para que cada região tenha a sua própria identidade, de modo que jamais o jogo se torna monótono, mesmo quando se tem que ir e vir nas mesmas áreas.

O jogo ainda tem alguns colecionáveis e desafios, todos bem divertidos. Yoku´s Island Express foi uma grata surpresa para mim, ainda mais que é muito barato em promoção, paguei menos de 10 reais. Vale a pena demais! Espero que os desenvolvedores estejam trabalhando em uma continuação, porque essa receita funcionou muito bem.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198067265072', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1670845943}
review:
[h1]Yoku's Island Express[/h1]

I didn't know what to expect, but what I got was a cute, casual, and extremely fun Metroidvania game that's easy to get lost in. Approximately 10-15 hours of gameplay to 100%. Some mechanics can be a bit annoying at times, but that's to be expected when the concept is based on pinball! The flower spinning mechanic still gave me nightmares at times.

Nonetheless, Yokus Island Express is the perfect game to just sit back, get your controller out, relax, and explore the whole island in a session or two. I rarely have as much fun playing a game to 100% with all collectibles as an achievement hunter. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561199002134052', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1680969722}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052846700', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1670914200}
review:
Pinball and Metroidvania is a good combo, apparently. The story is good fun, the character writing and designs are great (loved the frogs). Plenty of fun side-quests and post-game content. Linear pinball levels would have been impressive enough, but creating a working metroidvania world-space is mind-blowing. The fast-travel-gondola-system keeps it all cohesive.


My main complaint would be that the 3rd boss (in the snow-peak) is a pretty underwhelming boss-fight with fairly unclear mechanics. I'm still not sure why some hits did damage and some didn't, as it wasn't telegraphed as well as previous fights. This was exasperated by the level design, where the player could very easily fall back down into prior pinball chamber, and would then have to shoot Yoku back through a very narrow pipe to return to the boss-encounter. A shame as the previous two fights/trails were great, and I was excited for another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025458087', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1670378762}
review:
A wonderful game full of charm and unique game play that caught me by surprise. The game is centered around a mix of pinball and platforming that give tit a feel like I've yet to see before. There's the aspect of exploring and grabbing collectibles and then progression in parts depends on mastering a unique "table" embedded in the environment. 
    I've played through the game twice, with the second being a 100% run, and had slightly different experiences both times due to gaining familiarity with how the game works. I would advise new players to come back for collectibles in an area later if they encounter a table with a particularly tricky exit and to really study your map to minimize having to go through tables again when you're just trying to get from A to B. Otherwise it can be tedious at times to get to certain locations in the map.

    I love this game, and will likely do another 100% run at some point. It is absolutely worth the price of admission and your time. At least check it out on a sale.

 Some Flaws:
- The fast travel system REALLY needs more access points. The drop off points are plentiful, but dropping off in the chain to pick up a collectible can cost you a chunk of time back tracking to get back on the beeline. Some fast travel beelines like Ivory Peaks are just not worth it to get off if your destination is the top.

- I was NOT a fan of the Juicer table/side quest. Specifically I was NOT a fan of the 1 attempt rule. It's possible to reset the checkpoint to before starting, but its also just as easy if not easier to forget and exit the table and then be forced into a save. NOT COOL! I don't mind restarting a table from the beginning as a challenge, but being locked out completely because of an honest mistake is incredibly harsh! The area contains 2 Wickerlings and 2 Scarabs which could cost you being blocked from a 100% run. This happened on my first run. It really makes a super cool table and challenge more stressful than it needs to be.

-The Scarabs could of been better explained, especially unlocking the ability to find where the remaining ones are. It would of been nice to see them tied into the existing store rather than them just existing.

-Not a big deal, but I think the profile percentage completion is bugged. I collected every collectible and did everything I needed to for 100%, but it still just shows 97% even though I've gotten all the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888370', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1635566573}
review:
It’s like Ori and the Blind Forest, but pinball.

Never thought I needed some pinball wizardry in my life until Yoku. This game really makes you FEEL like a pinball. 

I feel kind of bad for the makers of this game. They probably put their heart and soul into making something they had a vision for and all people keep talking about is just how the name sounds like Yoshi.

It surprisingly is a lot more of a Metroidvania than some of the other games out there that claim to be. Definitely true to the Metroidvania genre, while somehow fusing pinball into it, seemlessly. It reminds me of Sonic spinball plus Metroid. It is very neat, if you like metroidvanias or pinballs you will have a blast.

I loved it. It’s casual enough for you to engage with it every day, even if you only have 20 minutes to play. Frequent save points make it a perfect game to play if, like in my case, life gets in the way of gaming very often.

It’s entertaining, cute, not too difficult, and it will keep you engaged. The game is absolutely wonderful. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys fun and happiness. Worth every penny and then some, IMO. Good grief though, what kind of zany, crackhead game will they think of next.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027453870', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1668880862}
review:
A Charming Mixture of Metroidvania and... Pinball! 

Yoku's Island Express is a platforming adventure mixed with pinball, developed by Villa Gorilla. It features a full blown adventure that mixes the addictive gameplay of pinball seamlessly with a fleshed out world and most surprisingly, a story! It's a game I had gotten from a free promotional long ago, most likely Humble Bundle, and while I was looking for games in my backlog to play, I picked it up and enjoyed it all the way through!

Gameplay of Yoku's Island Express is quite interesting. Being a pinball focused game it doesn't simply just place you in a progression of game boards to play though but instead provides a living and breathing world that feature pinball segments, including a challenge to complete to proceed to the next segment. They're seamlessly integrated into the environment and has a nice smooth difficulty curve. The Island is almost non-linear allowing you to just explore around to proceed the story or just look around for collectable. Similar to a Metroidvania, the game uses the concept of slowing introducing new mechanics that encourages players to revisit old areas once they have the new abilities for collectable and etc! Now the Pinballin' itself is extremely solid, each board feels district from another giving you a decent challenge to get though and collect various fruits and items from bouncing around. You have all the classic pinball aspects like bumpers, metal rails, and all sorts of flippers to bounce Yoku around. And while the game does provide instances of precision aiming, it's counteracted by not having a harsh penalty to falling in the gutter, only losing some fruits. The last thing to note of is, Boss Segments! Indeed, the game has boss fights or in one case, a plot related challenge. Which exist to mainly test the player in terms of persistence, as there is no penalty to falling in the gutter. They often help to mark a point of a exciting end to a series of pinball segments and overall were a amazing inclusion, if a bit underwhelming in raw challenge. 

As for style, the game looks absolutely beautiful. With amazing visuals again integrated into the pinball features, really giving that atmosphere without breaking the gameplay at all. The character design is also quite interesting, taking a mix between original species and pre-existing animals, a concept I honestly hadn't seen before. And speaking of which the world building provided in this game is a lot more than I was expecting, like I was genuinely enthralled with how well thought out the story is for such a unique title. Soundtrack is also swell to listen to, fitting each respective area perfectly and also still giving off a calming vibe throughout when necessary.

Overall, Yoku's Island Express was such a pleasant surprise coming from my backlog of games. It's mix of pinball gameplay with the Metroidvania-like world tied together with a decently crafted world is absolutely amazing. For about 5 hours of gameplay to the end and around 8 hour to get to 100% it absolutely earns by recommendation for anyone looking for a unique platformer or people who just enjoy some good ol' pinballin'

author: {'steamid': '76561199198934251', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1669946174}
review:
Juego conseguido en bundle, muy por debajo de su precio original.

Es un gran metroidvania que combina el pinball como mecánica para superar desafíos y explorar el mapa. La historia es bien sencilla, y no se entromete mucho durante el juego, así que puedes comenzar a explorar al poco de iniciar la partida. El descubrimiento del mundo está muy bien manejado, ofreciéndote pistas y ayudas en el mapa para ir notando adónde podrías ir. No es un juego muy difícil, fueron muy contadas las veces en las que no supe qué hacer. Dónde más se dedica tiempo es en esos puzzlez en donde debes dar con el personaje a un lugar de difícil acceso, siendo aquello lo único que podría considerarse frustrante... Aunque si estás familiarizado con los pinball, no será ningún problema estar atascado un rato en uno de los desafíos

Totalmente recomendado a amantes del pinball, aunque deben considerar que el pinball es una parte importantísima del juego. Si no te gustan los pinball, quizás hay que mirar otros títulos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198896831485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1668469364}
review:
This game is a perfect example of how the word "metroidvania" has been overused and misused to trick gamers into buying a game without going onto Youtube and watching videos of the gameplay beforehand. THIS GAME IS NOT A METROIDVANIA GAME!

It is a cutesy dutesy pinball game wrapped around a 2d slightly platformy game. That's it. It is not a straight up pinball game, and not a straight up platforming game. And it is nothing like metroidvania games. I am not understanding where all these positive glowing reviews came from, unless these people got the game for free or were paid to review this game this way. Why is this game $20?? It constantly goes on sale for $4 and I feel that is even too pricey. 

This game is waaay too boring and easy to play to be entertaining to a true metroidvania gamer, or even a teenager for that matter. But it also has too much reading and requires too much precision controls to be fun for a young child to play. This reminds me of an old school SEGA game that wanted to capitalize off of the Sonic craze, but the dev team didn't put the right time and effort into it. And then the game just sat on the Blockbuster shelf all the time until you came in late on a Friday night and couldn't find anything else, so you rented it and played it for 30 minutes and then sat at home bored for the rest of the weekend. 

My personal gripes... it takes way too long to load the screens during gameplay. So there is no fluidity to the movement. There are forced paths that you must take to get from one area of the stage to the next, so it just requires you to basically fall to a certain area of the stage and then everything automatically moves for a few seconds. Also, if you miss your path you have to repeat the same play over and over, and it gets very boring... especially because the controls are so delayed you have to guess a good second before you are ready to do something, pressing the button beforehand in hopes that the timing is correct. 

The game just isn't any fun. But maybe it would be for a small child. But not one that cannot read very well.  I wouldn't recommend that I myself buy it as a child. But maybe a 7 year old that is a good reader... maybe they would like it.

But it is offensive that so many people call it a "metroidvania" game... because IT IS NOT A METROIDVANIA GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198450876555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1668391151}
review:
Yoku's Island is a bite sized Metroidvania. The gameplay is unique, mixing exploration with pinball and all done well, so it's very fun. You come across upgrades frequently also, so the game never gets old. For completionists, this game provides enough extra stuff for you to find, but it's never excessive. You see, one of my main gripes with games is when they pat out the game with pointless and boring extra content. Yoku does not do that, and its commendable.
Other aspects worth pointing out are the music, which is lovely, the graphics, which are lovely, the sound design, the character designs, pretty much everything is lovely. 
If you ask me, a 8-11 hour game doing EVERYTHING is worth your money, you don't spend too much time or too little time. 
Great little addition to my collection and a game I do not regret playing it. Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198003949636', 'num_games_owned': 2662, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1668236179}
review:
Premise is pretty novel, a metroidvania, pinball game. I enjoyed what I played. Story is cute, controls are responsive and it is pretty neat to see your exploration options change as you get new powers. However, it is a lot of pinball, and if you are like me and find pinball boring or frustrating after a half hour or so, then this may not for you. The random feeling of hitting the ball in pinball, at times, the narrow timing for certain boards and the way that currency is used(I at times wondered why even charge me to open this) held it back for me. If you like pinball and metroidvanias, there is nothing like this out there.

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058420171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1666238218}
review:
It's cutesy pinball with some eldritch stuff going on in the background.  Do you have a pinball game on your computer?  If not maybe you should consider fixing that.  The game is about as long as you're going to want it to be, unless you just can't get enough pinball in your life.  There's enough little side quests to fill up the game without become tedious.  The story is queer enough to be interesting.  It's different.

They do a lot with the pinball thing.  You have to actually intentionally do things rather than just smack the ball before it falls in the hole.  They do a lot with the mechanic and do it relatively well.  The cost of failure is pretty low while the joy of playing a pinball machine is pretty well captured, making it a low stress game.  

Exploration is generally pretty fun.  The zones are creative and distinct.  It's almost like a metroidvania  in that as you go to different areas you find different tools that act as different modes of navigation that let you access different areas.  At the same time I never felt stuck.  I feel like the game was pretty well tested.  At some point I got to a point where I couldn't go any further without learning how to swim underwater.  There was a character there who spelled everything out.  It said something like, "looks like you need to learn how to swim.  You're going to need to find a fish.  I bet you there's one somewhere hidden over in (this place)."   The character was probably patched in after enough people during testing had trouble find it.  I think it was a good decision on their part because that particular item would have been so much more difficult to find than any of the other items and I don't feel the disparity for the one particular item was intended.  You could tell that they found an unintended disparity and corrected it.  I think it shows a level of care put into the design of the game.

If you don't like the concept of the game then you probably won't like the game, but if you do then I think you will.  I think they did a good job with it.  The pinball levels are fun.  The world is a joy to explore.  The sidequests are interesting puzzles and go beyond fetching.  It's light-hearted with a fun and weird story.  And you really ought to have a pinball game somewhere on your computer anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041905005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1666059179}
review:
Super glad I gave this one a try! Fun metroidvania with a positive tone, unique mechanics, and a vibrant interconnected world. The pinball mechanics were pretty cool, and felt surprisingly natural for the genre. The devs did a fantastic job integrating these mechanics into the world design, and it shows! The main story is short but sweet, and Yoku leaves many optional side quests to keep you coming back to its world.

The music and art style are both fantastic, with each section of the island having its own atmosphere. To be honest, I wasn't really sold on the art style from the screenshots, but playing it is a whole different story. This is a beautiful game, period.

Finally, Yoku has one of the most genius fast travel systems I've seen: the beeline! Suffice to say, it's a travel system that works perfectly for making a big map feel tightly connected, and it takes advantage of the pinball mechanics perfectly. Would love to see something like this in more MVs, since it allowed for fast travel without any loading screens and actually opened up some more options for exploration.

Would recommend this unconditionally to all MV fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845227186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1708769555}
review:
This is the most original, well-done of all games I've played, only Breath of the Wild and xenoblade 2 exceed it-and perhaps the best all ages game I've played except My Brother Rabbit.  Art: Stunning, Soundtrack, wonderful, and gameplay is both familiar and completely novel, with several modes of special travel and a very silly fast travel mechanic.  I detected references to fiction (including Sir Terry Pratchett!) and other references that I'm sure people younger than me might recognize that I did not catch.  Charming would be the best way to describe the game .

I even discovered a visual artifact that I couldn't find anything online about!  I wrote to team i7 team and got a response from the folks at Villa Gorilla (after a bit, it's an older game, after all) that indeed the One-and-a-half tulips are an artifact shown only on one map view, accidentally left behind during game development.  I can't remember the last time I discovered an anomaly that others hadn't found first :)

I still enjoy a playthrough now and then when I want to be enchanted for a couple of hours.  The only game  with more re-playability is Breath of the Wild--which is still re-playable 5 years later as well.  I'm jealous if you are experiencing Yoku for the first time...

NOTE:  I recently discovered there is an update including a random mode, the team at Villa was aided and abetted by some gamers whose speedruns can be found at discord and twitch.  I've started doing speedruns and it's truly re-invigorated my play of the game, so I can't say that BOTW re-playability exceeds it now :)
Thanks to xWiNg to introducing me to the update and speedrunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561199261831609', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1666875249}
review:
[h1]万能的邮政局长 [/h1]
开始感觉一般般，弹珠弹射没什么吸引力。但你真正上手后你就会发现真的超级有意思！天知道BOOS战用弹珠打也能这么热血！剧情有意思，难度也简单。而且不存在死亡，被陷阱扎到只是会掉几个水果。总的来说相当有意思！

[h1]Almighty postmaster [/h1]
At first it felt so-so-so, marbles were not very attractive. But once you get started, you'll find it's really super fun! God knows BOOS can be so bloody with marbles! The plot is interesting and the difficulty is simple. And there is no death, being caught in a trap will only drop a few fruits. Overall quite interesting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198207895409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1665906684}
review: An undoubtedly original game, and the first game in a while I've felt motivated to complete to 100%. The melding of pinball with adventure/upgrade gameplay makes total sense and it's amazing that it hasn't been done before. The design of the pinball tables sprinkled throughout the map is fun and dynamic, so the pinball gameplay never gets old. The normal travel between the dedicated tables is also engaging too though, with tons of secrets and creative twists on the movement mechanics. The game is a good length in my opinion, leaving you wanting more when you finish the main storyline but not being so long that you're sick of it by the time you get 100%. My only real complaint was that there were some issues in stickiness of controls for me, but that could be due to me playing it on Linux through Proton, I don't know.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149222284', 'num_games_owned': 1907, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1664831482}
review:
Sometimes you see or get a game that looks so simple and silly, but when you play it it becomes this great and addictive game. Yoku's Island Express is such a game.

Yoku's Island Express is an unique combination of pinball with an open world platformer. Yeah, it is as weird as it sounds, but it works quite well. You play as a small beetle attached to a ball who delivers mail. At least that is how you start your journey. While going around the open world pinball machine you meet a lot of weird and funny characters in a cute art-style. The game has a main story arc to play trought with plenty of side quests and secrets to be found along side it.

The gameplay is simple. You move around and you controll the flippers. As the progress the game you can unlock new abilties to help you reach places you couldn't before. Even so the game plays as a more relaxing and casual game. 

Yoku's Island Express is a really fun game well worth the praise it gets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010867235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1664692478}
review: I hadn't played a pinball game in at least 10 years before picking this up on recommendation from a Reddit comment, so i had no expectations. After a few hours i was in love. Tight controls, wonderful art, fantastic music, fun little story; it really does have it all! It gave me the same feelings of utter joy that Hollow Knight and Ori did. If you liked those games do yourself a favor and pick this great game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018648018', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1664592490}
review:
From the "Stand with Ukraine" Humble Bundle.

You're not gonna find much else like Yoku's Island Express in terms of metroidvanias. Pinball gameplay with charming visuals, decent story & stellar animation make this a pretty stand-out niche game. The music is also good enough to melt into the background as you play, immersing yourself in the world it has to show you. Alongside a cast of whacky characters, it's a refreshing take on the genre that'll be very worthwhile to experience. Just prepare for some intense learning curves as it is pinball after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067697256', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1698919787}
review:
The game is family friendly with a clear story of helping friends and beating baddies. But there is so much more to this fantastically fun and artistic game. Get lost, explore, get to know the locals in the many different scenes you find yourself in and most definitely have some fun along the way.

It simply is wholesome and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011570168', 'num_games_owned': 2238, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1665281786}
review: A delightful and innovative game. The pinball mechanic works very well and is integrated into many areas of the game.  The art design, music, sound effects, even the simple quests all hit the right notes. The only sour note is if you try to backtrack, either for collectibles, a quest, or to see where you can get to with a newly acquired gadget. Even if the map allowed you to zoom in further, you would still be looking at a lot of paddles, ramps, shoots, etc, some of which are hidden by design, and wouldn't be able to tell which way to go unless you remembered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159014827', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1662934971}
review:
Pinball as the base of a game just doesn't work for anything but a short, arcade-style highscore game.

And for a metroidvania like this, it's even more egregious. The art, characters, and soundtrack are all cute - but the gameplay is just frustrating pinball paddling, and that's jut not fun at all.

If you're *really* into pinball, this is probably the game for you. Same if you're into cute, charming games, and casual games.

But if you're more into metroidvanias and/or gameplay, give Yoku's Island Express a pass, as the gameplay is just occasionally tapping a trigger button and hoping the physics engine works for once.

author: {'steamid': '76561199063754398', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1664569520}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027997441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1662459673}
review:
I bought it because it highly rated with a tag of Metroidvania style.
Def not a metroidvania!

It is a pure pinball based adventure game. Once you've played the first hour you've played everything the game has to offer. Great idea for a game, but unfortunately not great game.

Wanna play pinball like the good 'ol days? You're better off playing the Microsoft freeware one.
I'd only recommend buying this if it is heavily discounted gift for someone in primary school.

review:
老是高血压，可能是我不擅长弹球吧....
没掌握好时机就要重来，有时候掉下悬崖之类的还要重新爬。
特别是蜂道，要是在半路按回车掉下去就上不去了....当场心肌梗死。
还有一些宝箱和那个洋葱根(?)的获取对耐心和操作的要求太高了....（可能只是我菜）
银河恶魔城是很不错，但是加上弹球跑图感觉挺难受的......

author: {'steamid': '76561198117345880', 'num_games_owned': 1661, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1662710739}
review: Very fun metroidvania with pinball mechanics!  It's funny, usually 2D platformers can be a hard sell for me, and I've tried 3D "marble roller" platformers and didn't care for them, but this game seems to skirt any issues I have with these two types of games and manages to keep things fun!  I typically felt pretty in control of the ball, and there wasn't really any penalty for falling other than wasting a few seconds and losing some fruit, so the game lets you do things at your own pace (no missables as well).  Highly recommend this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034237851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1662242394}
review:
A friend gave me this game, and I loved it. Clocked in at 94%, so I guess there might be some ball color options that make npcs hand you stuff left. Else I did get all the items visible on the map and reached the end.

Only really had issues with two things, and one was figuring out what ball color to get into the juicer again, and the other was being blind to a hidden bumper in the snow area. So I think the game was a moderate challenge to complete.

Incorporating some metroidvania and pinball mechanics together was quite brilliant and served for a lot of fun. Of course the usual frustration with bouncing in a bad way straight into the gap between the flippers and taking a "death" was annoying, but it didn't look like the game cared for it more than perhaps some achievements?

author: {'steamid': '76561199167729456', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1647129876}
review: Ce mélange de métroid-like et de flipper est juste une idée de génie. Les graphismes et l'univers que l'on parcourt sont absolument somptueux, vraiment c'est un régal pour les yeux. Le jeu n'est jamais punitif et j'ai adoré compléter la carte. Le mood général est très reposant contrairement au gameplay parfois vif. Foncez, c'est du caviar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123050314', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1662304009}
review: Amazing and full of charm from the start. I never expected that i would become this invested in a game about a dung beetle, but here i am. There's just so much more to this game than just the gimmick of A dung beetle used as a pinball-ball. It's fantastic in every way. The artstyle is super pretty and along with the incredible soundtrack, this game creates a hell of an atmosphere. Even the world and the story kept me invested all the way through! I am so glad that i found this gem! This is now one of my favorite indie titles, and it will stay that way for a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248385986', 'num_games_owned': 2447, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1661136734}
review:
[b]  [h1] Yoku's Island Express [/h1]
Pinball oyunu ile hikayeleştirip açık dünya oyunu yapmışlar ve gayet başarılı olmuş.

[h1] Hikayesi [/h1]
Önemli olduğunu düşünmüyorum ama inceleme uzun gözüksün diye yazayım dedim. Biz galiba bir bok böceğiz ve postacılık yapıyoruz. Bu oyunda görevimiz bu ada da postacılık yapmak ama adaya girdiğimiz zaman bir farklılık fark ediyoruz, yerlilerle konuşuyoruz ve adaya lanetlendiğini söylediler biz de onlara yardım ediyoruz.
 Yan görevler de var ama çoğunlukla lanetle alakası olmayan yan görevler.

[h1] Oynanış [/h1]
Pinball tarzında bir oyun yapmaları farklı bir tecrübe edinmeme sağladı ve oldukça başarılıydı.
 İstediğimiz yöne gitmek için fırlatmamız gereken ayar, oyunun özel kendi mekanikleri, sorunsuzca gidebildiğimiz; gelebildiğimiz yollar, haritanın ayarları kusursuzca işlemeleri ve oyunda tıkanma kalma sorunları yaşamıyorsunuz ama tabi atmak istediğiniz ayarı tuturamadığınız bir çok zaman olcak ve buna doğal olarak sinirleneceksiniz.
 Oyun da görevler yaptıkça özellikler kazanabileceğiz bu özellikler sayesinde de haritaya olan erişimimiz çoğalacak.
Oyunda bir yerden bir yere gitmek çok kolay ve bunu hem fast traverlar yaptılar (çok eğlenceli bu arada) hem de oyunun haritasında bazı bölgelerde özel mekaniklerle ([u]haritanın mekaniği[/u]) ile ayarladılar, oyunda bir yerden bir yere gitmek çok basit.

[h1] Harita [/h1]
Haritasını çok beğendim her türlü konsepten faydalanmışlar (dağlık, yer altı, orman vb) ve her bölgenin de kendi özel görevleri oluyor, kendi özel özellikleri oluyor. Oyunda hiç bir yer aynı değil yani oyunu oynarken ''bu az önce oynadığımın aynısını'' havasını vermiyor.
 Oyunun haritası klasik metroidvania oyunların büyüklüğüne benzer ama öbür metroidvania oyunlardan ayıran 2 şey var ilki bir yerden bir yere gitmek çok kolay ikincisi ise pinball olması :D

[h1] Not: [/h1]
Not olarak çok özel bir şeyler yazmam gerektiğini düşünmüyorum. Oyunun indirim de iken alın 6.40 tl yapıyor almanızı tavsiye ederim indirimsiz 32 tl de hak eden bir oyun aslında

author: {'steamid': '76561198825959705', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1661351556}
review:
Ótimo jogo, mesmo se você nunca tenha jogado pinball ou não goste (eu particularmente não sou muito fã), vale muito a pena comprar esse jogo que tem um preço super em conta, com certeza seu valor é muito baixo comparado a quantidade e qualidade de conteúdo aqui. É divertido na maioria esmagadora do tempo, somente algumas partes são um pouco irritantes, tem uma OST leve boa e variada, além da arte ser algo maravilhosamente lindo. Recomendo a todos que gostam de metroidvania ou querem uma jogatina mais casual.

O JOGO É MUITO BOM MESMO SÉRIO EU RECOMENDO PARA UM CARALHO COMPREM ESSA BELEZURA POR FAVOR

author: {'steamid': '76561198241404910', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1650391923}
review:
Biedny Yoku
W grze Yoku Island Express wcielamy się w małego żuczka Yoku, który zostaje nowym listonoszem na wyspie. Listonosz na tej wyspie to jednak posłaniec między całym światem. I tak jedno zadanie wymaga zrobienie kilku innych itd. Ostatecznie trzeba uleczyć Boga wyspy z pomocą trzech strażników. Mechanika gry to cos nowego: połączenie klasycznego flippera z platformówką. I gra się naprawdę przyjemnie. Niektóre poziomy wymagają trochę więcej wprawy, ale jest okej. Mamy dużo postaci niezależnych, które mają swoje historie. Gra jest króciutka, ale przyjemna w rozgrywce. Dodatkowo przyjemny soundtrack w klimatach wyspiarskich oraz ładna kolorowa grafika. W moim mniemaniu 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1660079698}
review:
Ich bin nicht mit den allergrössten Erwartungen an Yoku's Island heran und wurde mehr als positiv überrascht. Denn das Spiel macht schlicht und einfach Laune und war eine wunderbare kleine Spieleerfahrung.

Das beginnt schon beim erfrischenden Spielprinzip. Man ist ein Mistkäfer mit Mistkugel, der sich mit dieser Kugel durch die Welt fortbewegt. Und ein Grossteil dieser Welt besteht aus Flipper-Mechaniken. Und das macht einfach Laune. Ja, ich mag Flipper eigentlich, bin aber a) oft zu schlecht dafür und b) wird mir der immergleiche Flippertisch schnell langweilig (mit Ausnahme dieses alten Windows-Flippers, den ich bis zum gehtnichtmehr gespielt habe...). Und genau hier trifft Yoku's Island Express genau den richtigen Ton.

Das Spiel hat durchaus seine herausfordernden Abschnitte, ist aber weit davon entfernt ein schweres Spiel zu sein. Auch der Frustfaktor ist sehr tief, da es kein Game Over gibt und nur einen Abzug von Früchten (die Spielwährung), wenn man herunterfällt. Wer eine echte Flipperherausforderung sucht, ist hier also falsch. Dafür ist das Spiel perfekt für alle, die einfach ein wenig flippern wollen.

Denn Yoku's Island Express ist ganz klar ein Spiel, das vor allem Spass machen soll. Und das schafft es hervorragend, nicht nur durch das Gameplay. Dazu kommt auch ein hervorragender "Gute-Laune"-Soundtrack, mit dem das spassige Gameplay unterstrichen wird. Oben drauf kommt eine nette Geschichte mit witzigen Figuren und Begegnungen.

Auch der Umfang stimmt. Wer durch das Spiel durchrusht wird es in 6-10 Stunden gut durchbekommen. Ich habe ein bisschen mehr auf der Uhr, weil ich noch alle Collectibles gesammelt habe und das endgültige Ende erreichen wollte. Nicht weil ich mich dazu gezwungen fühlte, sondern schlichtweg, weil das Gameplay spassig war.

Fazit: Wer ein Gute-Laune-Spiel sucht und der Flippermechanik nicht völlig abgeneigt ist, dem ist Yoku's Island Express herzlich zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1660470945}
review:
¡Un metroidvania pinball! Muy original y adorable, relativamente sencillo y corto pero con muchos secretos que descubrir (yo no hice mucho más que la historia principal). Normalmente, fallar un disparo no implica perder, como suele pasar en otros juegos de pinball, sino que la bola vuelve para otro intento, así que aunque pueda haber partes algo frustrantes por requerir disparos difíciles, no importa mucho fallar.

Muy recomendable a quien busque algo distinto.

review:
F#cking amazing, its kind of a metroidvania, but it kinda stretches the genre. this should genuinely be on your wish list (if not your library) i got it from a humble bundle, but i would honestly pay full price for this gem.
I plan on 100% it.

Ok so for the actual review, its a colofull and happy game with cool pinball mechanics, the characters are super lovable,  i really dig it. 
However ive had one thing that annoys me, sometimes the pinball sections can become a tiny bit frustrating, mostly when you have to go through a little spot and you need to time it perfectly.


Still, go buy it.

9.6 out of ten - amazing

author: {'steamid': '76561198114192005', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1660080828}
review:
[h1]Excellent[/h1]

Aussi beau qu'un "Ori", aussi coloré qu'un "Rayman", un humour qui rapelle un peu "Guacamelee", l'originalité de ce titre est que c'est un métroïdvania mais où le côté plateforme est remplacé par du... flipper.

Oui, je sais, ça peut paraître déroutant écrit comme ça mais c'est pourtant bien fun.

La map est sympa, les personnages bien ancrés dans cet univers assez original. L'avancement se déroule sans grosses difficultés, les mécaniques du jeu sont faciles à appréhender.

On passe un agréable moment, environ 7h pour l'histoire principale sans se stresser et le double pour les chasseurs de succès qui veulent le 100%.

Il mérite sa place dans votre bibliothèque de jeux ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198070894238', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1659560520}
review:
I went into this game with high hopes and initially it looked like they were met. Everything about the game shined with quality, but there was major problem that I faced - I found the gameplay very tedious and grating. If you are not a fan of pinball, do not expect your opinion to change playing this. I will not thumb this game down as I can see the love and care put into it, and I understand that this is a ME problem. Be warned though, if you are bad at pinball, avoid this game at all costs...

If you liked this review, check out my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28344664/]Steam Curation page![/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1659302612}
review:
Il gioco brilla di personalità ed è molto simpatico, fisica della pallina e meccaniche pinball sono un misto tra ciò che è stato visto in NightSky (2011) e Metroid Prime Pinball. Gli schemi a volte possono essere frustranti, fortunatamente niente che non si risolva in più di 10 minuti di gioco e ci sono molti punti di salvataggio, è perfetto per fare una partitella veloce e chiudere poi il gioco. 
Per essere un metroidvania comunque ci sono pochi powerup e si finisce in 8h scarse, senza considerare le secondarie che sono perlopiù collezionabili.
Avrei molto gradito un fast-travel migliore di quello implementato dato che alcuni percorsi sono un po' tortuosi da navigare.
La colonna sonora è molto canticchiabile e storia e personaggi sono solo un pretesto, ma funzionano e sprizza di quella "magia Nintendo" colorata e simpatica.
Consigliato, specialmente se in saldo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161590466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1659299576}

author: {'steamid': '76561198803481184', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1659473286}
review:
谁会拒绝在送信的途中来一盘紧张刺激的三维弹球呢
地图设计和风格上有奥日的味道
玩法上也有自己的想法
没有跳跃只能用蛞蝓就非常的折磨
关卡难度不大，卡通画风非常可爱
建议先通关把该拿的技能都拿了再全收集
不然回头路走到你想吐
全收集整个流程十小时左右
精品小游戏

review: 这是我玩过最好玩的弹珠游戏没有之一！！！刚开始可能会觉得有点幼稚和无聊，但是从走到邮局之后就变的有意思起来了！几条支线内容非常丰富，还有探索和解谜都非常好玩~！玩到后面简直停不下来，音乐和画风都很棒，五颗星强烈推荐！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198201589742', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1659158593}
review:
妈滴必须好评，忒好玩撩
13小时白金，都给自己打出自信来了，难道俺其实很擅长三维弹球？？

游戏模式真的很有意思，画面音乐也很可爱，每个小地方其实都是经过精妙计算的，并不是想象中的完全随机，而且yoku也可以推球球，比普通的弹球更灵活了，还能避免卡住的尴尬情况
蛞蝓的转动让俺更坚信这游戏一切都是计算好了的……就还蛮神奇的！总有一些意想不到的可爱小机关，玩着永远有新鲜的感觉~

剧情上，鹅，不窝心就行了，这种游戏就不要追求剧情了… NPC的设计都很可爱！！配音也很可爱，[strike] 蜂后俺喜欢你啊[/strike] 流程上俺还是怀疑它是线性的，因为有些道路只有拿到特定道具后才能通过，虽然大地图是一体的，好像哪里都能探索的样子，实际上有先后顺序的。难度不高，boss战也很简单，就是轮数多了稍显乏味（bos战总共也没几场就是了）

有人说中期缺钱，俺没遇到过水果吃光的情况，永远顶着上限。。总而言之就是没因为这个卡关
通主线完全可以不看攻略，等打得差不多了如果打算收集的话，可以小描一眼。个人看法是，攻略也就给个思路，这游戏谜题也不难，基本一点就通，还是自己琢磨比较快乐

费劲的地方是那个bb一千次（俺没这个习惯啊）[strike] 最后搞得手都酸了[/strike] 和收集全部圣甲虫，它这虫子只有在剩下最后10个的时候才有高亮提示，阿巴阿巴阿巴，早知道平常多跟它较较劲了
跳结尾动画的时候游戏时间大概11小时，收集度80%，后面多花了俩小时白金，它这大地图虽然很贴心，但是隐秘通路是不标的，搞得俺这老年痴呆有点忘事儿，不然还能更快

最后讲一下缺点，其实也没啥，就是这游戏跟144Hz刷新率有点不合，建议玩的时候调回60，不然频繁切窗口非常容易闪退，俺这边大概闪退过前后4次吧，还好存档点多，否则有你难受的

总之推荐！推荐！推荐！

author: {'steamid': '76561198301691990', 'num_games_owned': 1208, 'num_reviews': 1048, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1659074904}
review: Yoku's Island Express: good for kids, trash for me

author: {'steamid': '76561198028527727', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1659353454}
review:
The game is very good, I just don't think the "Overwhelmingly positive" rating accurately reflects it.
It looks and sounds gorgeous, and the world and setting are really unique.
But the gameplay was not something I greatly enjoyed.

Well, that isn't entirely accurate, either. I generally really liked the pinball mechanics, both in the closed-off and the open world sections.
But when this mechanic breaks, it gets really, [i]really[/i] frustrating.
If you made a mistake

Also, it wasn't until the very end of the game that I realized pressing Start, Restart from Checkpoint was instantaneous. It would have saved me so, so, so much time if I knew.
I'd wager 25% of my playtime was boring backtracking, and I could have cut it down to 10% if the game had taught me to use it.
Or, if maybe it wasn't a menu option, but instead mapped to a button. Something that would take very little effort, as there are plenty unused ones on the controller.

And the big issue with all this is bad backtracking.
Because the player doesn't have enough movement options, movement is boring.
That's fine when you're exploring, but, as this is a metroidvania, backtracking is needed quite often. Way too much for how repetitive it is. Even if you're just going for the story, and not 100%.

With the controls, you can really only do four things - for the most part.
Roll left, roll right, orange bumper, blue bumper.

The latter two of these buttons are completely contextual - even if frequent - so they barely matter for the general feel of the controls. Not to mention that there are secretly two types of bumpers in the game. Ones which push you in whatever direction you are as you touch it, and ones which shoot you in a preset way.
I understand the need for these two, but some visual distinction is sorely needed between them.

And the former two are truly terrible. Yoku is slow at rolling the ball, and he often needs extra time to turn around. And any time you leave the ground, you lose control. Completely.
No slight adjustment, no double jump, no gliding. Not even looking around, ffs.
Which is especially infuriating when you're stuck for an extended period 1) in the air after a high jump, or 2) bouncing between surfaces.

Pinball machines don't allow any more control either, but their designs don't require it. This game is very open, and you have to be very precise quite frequently. The controls should reflect that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970768971', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1659145797}
review:
If somebody told you that a developer decided to combine Metroid-vania style exploration with pinball mechanics and Nintendo cuteness, you could be forgiven for being skeptical.  But after playing this game for a few hours, I'm happy to report that it all comes together really nicely.  Yoku's Island Express is a refreshingly unique experience and it is fully worth checking out.

In the game you play as a little guy who is tethered to a pinball.  Other than slowly moving left or right on a flat surface, you can't move a whole lot on your own.  So, you have to rely on the various plungers and pinball flippers that have been placed around the world to navigate the map and reach new areas.  Along the way, you solve some puzzles, acquire new abilities, and explore a whole bunch of lovely and interesting locales.  This is a very well designed game and its mechanics play together very nicely.  The pinball portion of the game isn't done realistically, but rather it has been calibrated to be quite easy.  As a pinball lover I still felt very much at home during these portions of the game.  

Overall, I highly recommend this one for Metroid-vania fans who are looking for something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024423322', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1658846615}
review:
Seriously, metroidvania meets pinball? Who came up with that crazy idea? It sounds like some gimmick project from a game jam. With that in mind it was laying in my library (thanks to Humble Bundle) for quite a while.
But the many exceedingly positive reviews made me want to give Yoku's Island Express a try. And heck yes, it's so much fun.

If there's one thing I would criticize then it would be the rather slow movement outside of the pinball segments for most of the game. After unlocking shortcuts and getting used to the map you will naturally be able to navigate through the island faster but until then it sometimes felt a bit slow, but that's already nitpicking in my opinion. Oh yeah, and the Island Express part should definitely have been more in the focus when it's literally in the title of the game.

If you are not sure whether this game is your cup of tea or not then try out the free demo. For me, it was a pleasantly surprising gem that deserves more attention. It's got a very relaxing, feel good atmosphere and soundtrack, lovery art and tight gameplay.
I would gladly play more of it if the developers were able to refine and develop this idea further. I think they got a very solid fundament and an idea of what the community would love to be added.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995495338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1659703779}
review: I make this short. My wife played through this game. Since I couldn't get her to play through other games this means this one is great for beginners. She played it on Steam Deck and was having a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091383808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1658909191}
review:
Whoever came up with the idea of combining Metroidvania with pinball is a mad genius. It works way better than it has any right to.

----------------------------------------------

Updating my review for more depth after completion because this game is amazing and deserves it. I can't recommend it enough. Binged the entire thing to 100% in just two sittings because I couldn't stop playing it. It's just such a satisfying experience all the way through. Some minor criticisms like certain areas being a bit frustrating to navigate through until you unlock certain abilities/shortcuts, but certainly nothing that ruined the experience. 

If I had to call something out, it'd be that there were A LOT of collectibles that were not at all clear how you were supposed to get them. Most of these have to do with a somewhat-hidden mechanic of one of your abilities that's never really explained but also never becomes needed for mandatory progression, so it's very easy to go the entire game without ever figuring out exactly how it works. It all becomes super obvious once you understand what's going on, so maybe this was just me not being observant enough, but I feel it's at least worth mentioning.

Overall I loved this game and I can only hope that the devs decide to make a sequel sometime in the near future, because pinball Metroidvania is a genre blend that I never realized I needed in my life until I got it, and now that I'm done with it I desperately want more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056614026', 'num_games_owned': 1866, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1659108769}
review: I haven't gone too far. But this is an interesting mix of a metroidvania side scroller and pinball game. The graphics and controls are great. And it is quite fun to play. It may throw some people off with how differently it plays at first, but you get the hang of it pretty quickly. I recommend this to pinball and side scroller fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561199248305971', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1658672895}
review:
[h1] 体験版をやることをオススメします [/h1]
とても楽しくて斬新な、完成度の高いゲームです！
……ただし、同時にダメな人には本当にダメなゲームでもあります。

主人公は基本左右に歩くことしかできないけど、
マップの至るところにあるピンボールの機構で飛んだりして進んでいきます。
これがとても斬新で、面白く、もどかしくもあります。

なんせメトロイドヴァニアで何往復もする小部屋を通るたびにピンボールをやるようなもので、
ササッと進めるひとは問題ないのですが、
なかなか進めない人には非常にストレスになると思います。

そこ以外では、適切なマップの広さ、ほんわか可愛いキャラ、音楽、アートワーク等
たいへん素晴らしいゲームですので、ぜひ体験版をしてみてください。

review: Ive never really been all that good at puzzle platformers, but this game is intuitive with a decent yet rewarding challenge that had me saying "yes!" out loud when I got something after a few tries.  Its an open world platformer that plays like a giant pinball machine.  Unique concept and loads of fun.  There's a nice little story with short quest lines throughout the world, collectibles, and permanent powerups that has you returning to previous areas once you gain more abilities.  Would definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195346257', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1656481595}
review:
I believe a metroidvania's most important qualities are its story, its world, and the how the character interacts with them. The story in Yoku's Island Express is honestly quite terrible. It's not even bad in the funny way... it's just horrendous. But if you can ignore the soulless plot like I did, then this game is actually quite phenomenal. The pinball movement mechanic is ingenious, precise, and perpetually fun. The movement capabilities unlocked later in the game follow suit. I'd recommend you try this game out, even if you just return it after an hour.

Also this game is relatively easy to 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561197994554952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1658528953}

author: {'steamid': '76561198148184948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1658525863}
review:
This game brings back memories of me drawing complex platform levers on computer paper taped together.  Yoku's Island Express is my childhood come to life with modern graphics and pinball mechanics!

The theme is cute but lacks any real depth.  However, it does a good job of tying everything together.  Instead of just completing a random task, you are helping a group of space monks launch their rocket into outer space.

I could see myself coming back and "completing" this game again in a year or two.  It was fun, not too stressful, and an overall happy experience that takes me back to my childhood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123138150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1657726529}
review:
THIS IS THE MOST FUN I HAVE HAD IN A LONG TIME.
I was concerned that the pinball metroidvania mesh up would be gimmicky and outstay its welcome, but this couldn't be further from the case. The mechanics meld seamlessly into the world, and playing through the story is simply a delight.
The game does not take itself too seriously, it is a lighthearted and fun experience, but it is very well polished and extremely fun. I enjoyed the world design, the music, the story, the quirks and jokes, and how it all fits together.
A metroidvania where you can't die and can't jump, who would have thought!

author: {'steamid': '76561198891120761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1657726964}
review: Wow. I gotta say it was ingenious of them to incorporate an adventure puzzle game with pinball. Who knew that it would be so fun? The art design is beautiful. This game was a real treat and exactly what i needed. Beating the main story was fun but not super tough, however, this game is full of secrets and challenges that will really push you if you want to completely 100% it. I'm so glad my buddy told me to buy this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068097283', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1678877708}
review:
I did not finish the game and think it does have its problems, but overall its just so charming and the pinball mechanics are such a fun idea that I will still gladly recommend this game to everyone. Suprising amount of content on a very large map, which brings me to one of my problems. Outside of the stations, which only bring you from 1 point back to the hub (And not every Area has them) there is no fast travel and you can often get lost searching for your objective. Some Puzzels or parkour passages can also be kind of anoying if you are as impatient as me. As an example, one of the first Bosses features a small pre-bossfight area were you have to defeat small spiders. If you defeat them, you are taken to the real boss, but you can still fall down pretty easy and are now back in the pre-boss area were you have to hit the tiny hole in order to get back into the fight.
Those complains aside, still a very great and creative game, will come back to it if i have the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098493361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1657349542}
review:
Adorable game that is fun at every turn. Not too long or overwhelming; a nice change of pace after a huge open world game. I love the pinball element, it's something completely different that makes this game really unique. And there's enough to collect to keep completionists engaged. I loved this game so much I played thru a second time immediately afterward.
Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198997217411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1657595600}
review:
Esse definitivamente é um dos melhores metroidvanias que já joguei até hoje, se não O MELHOR (real dessa vez).

O que mais se destaca nesse jogo é sua gameplay, ao invés de jogar como seu clássico metroidvania ou jogo de plataforma, você joga meio como se fosse um jogo de Pinball, você não pode pular DIRETAMENTE, mas você aperta os botões de gatilho do seu controle pra usar os coiso doido lá de pinball pra tu poder pular, o que abre portas pra um ótimo level design, e meu amigo como o level design é fantástico.

O level design, por ter sido feito com base nos seus movimentos base, terão muitos desafios de plataforma em formato de pinball é claro, e é muito divertido navegar pelo mapa pulando de lado a lado enquanto consegue frutas (o dinheiro do jogo) e suga lesmas pra quebrar rochas especiais, sim AS VEZES pode ser um pouco frustrante, mas no geral, a parte plataforma do jogo é simplesmente perfeito.

Ah é verdade, os upgrades! Eles são extremamente distintos de outros jogos do gênero, pois ao invés de termos coisas como pulo duplo, dash, corrida, ou qualquer coisa do tipo, temos fitinha de assoprar de festa de aniversário pra estourar coisas, sendo um elemento fundamental do jogo, o aspirador de p-- Digo lesmas, peixe pra poder nadar, e etc. Eles são igualmente divertidos de se usar.

As artes são... Bem, só de olhar uns prints dele por aí tu já percebe o que eu ia falar aqui, mas a arte é tão incrível que as vezes os npcs parecem que são 3D, quando não são.

Trilha sonora muito legal também, ela é bem atmosférica e relaxante, e por não ter inimigos normais, é muito fácil achar as músicas lindas, dando destaque pras músicas do jardim das lesmas e as montanhas geladas.

Mas é claro, não podemos falar de um metroidvania sem citar o fator EXPLORAÇÃO que compõe o gênero, esse jogo faz exploração muito bem, apesar de ser mais como um collectathon do que um metroidvania, mas extremamente divertido de explorar o mapa, pecando um pouco na parte das recompensas, pois a maioria são apenas wickerlings, mas os itens úteis são realmente úteis, tipo o upgrade pro aspirador de lesma e o peixe, e mais divertido ainda é explorar o mapa, devido aos citados desafios de plataforma, mais as beelines que funcionam tipo os barris do DKC.

No geral, pra mim, ele é uma obra-prima dos metroidvanias, se o jogo estiver sale, eu te faço questão de comprar esse jogo, pra mim ele é melhor do que os grandes titãs dos metroidvanias indies tipo Hollow Knight, Blasphemous e etc.

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985654160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 408, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1652720339}
review:
Was... ist... das...???

Hier geht's zu meinem Waetsch's Play:
https://youtu.be/xTlgcv085pQ

Yoku's Island Express ist ein Paradebeispiel von einer Perle, die man in seiner Bibliothek finden kann. Die Grafik ist ausgesprochen putzig gezeichnet und animiert, die Charaktere und Umgebung komplett abgedreht. Es erweckt so ein bisschen ein Eindruck einen Jump 'n' Runs, bis man dann zu flippern anfängt. Das Flippern fühlt sich aber so natürlich an, dass es einfach komplett passt. Ja, es ist ja logisch, dass ein Käfer mit einer Elfenbeinkugel auch mal von Bumpern durch die Gegend geschossen wird. Was auch immer der Entwickler genommen hat, es muss gut gewesen sein :-)

Folgt mir auch gerne bei Steam:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41912197-waetschs-play

review:
It's a fun game with relaxing aesthetics. But there are couple things about it that could be improved to make the experience better. The first is to add a teleport to reduce the repetitiveness of having to go through the same obstacles when traversing the map. The second is to improve the way the swinging works (slootling leash).

This is a very unique game due to the pinball gameplay. I think one of the most comparable games is Ori, but there is no game quite like this one.

review:
ピンボールを題材にしたメトロイドヴァニア。そんなに大きくない島の中を、あっち行ったりこっち行ったり。まあまあ面白かった。
ボリュームはそんなに多くなく、ストーリーは５時間、やりこみ要素にもう５時間で計１０時間ほど。定価だとちょっと高いかなあという印象。
けっこうしっかりピンボールをやることになるのだが、画面が固定されなかったり、演出で揺れたりして、視認性の悪さが気になった。
ピンボールに馴染みがないと理解できなさそうなパズル要素がある。
