author: {'steamid': '76561198811872881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1652672221}
review:
I can see why people would enjoy this game, but I do think it is overrated. This game regularly goes on sale for around $5 and I would say that this game is worth it at that price point if you want to kill some time on a Saturday afternoon. But it's more like you're buying a $5 proof-of-concept than a full game.

At first, the gameplay is nice and shows you how metroidvania and pinball can work together, but after the first hour or so, the game does very little to improve on the experience. It feels like the game has a lot of potential and a lot to offer, but you will be heavily disappointed if you expect the game to get significantly better.

I suspect most people liked this game because it gave them a nostalgic blast from the old free pinball games on Windows computers. If you are after that experience, this game is for you.

Otherwise, this game does very poorly on the two genres it combines: pinball and metroidvania. Actually, I would argue this game also combines a third genre, walking simulator, because that's what you'll be doing for a third of the game.

As a pinball game, it has rather simplistic pinball mechanics and there aren't that many pinball areas in the game. You'd think there would be an upgrade that unlocks more movement options during pinball sections, but there isn't. Nor do they make the arenas more interesting or difficult as the game goes on. The final section of the game was especially disappointing and it gives a feeling of "that's it?". It doesn't feel like the development was rushed. Instead it feels like the developers were just done with the game and wanted to move on from this project.

As a metroidvania, the game barely counts as a metroidvania. As in, if there was a checklist for what counts as a metroidvania, the game does the bare minimum to tick all the boxes. There are barely any upgrades, very few platforming challenges, and there's nothing that would keep the gameplay interesting (like a stealth mission, escape sequence, combat, puzzles).

This is why I say the game is kind of like a walking simulator. Between the pinball arenas and rare platforming challenge, you spend a lot of time walking between places and doing fetch quests, and there's no way to run or dash or jump. Limiting movement to just flippers means it's hard to make walking around interesting. Flashy, shiny animations happen on the screen while all you did was press a flipper to get from point A to point B.

Given that the game seems lacking on each aspect it combines and that the developers seemed to have abandoned the game at the end, it feels like a prototype for a spork. A spork kind of works as a spoon and kind of works as a fork. It combines both functions, but it does everything poorly. This is why I say the game feels like a proof-of-concept. Maybe if this game was refined and improved by a larger company, it could be a 10/10 game, but as it currently stands, it feels like a project put together to present to a larger company in hopes of getting more funding to be developed into a full game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038123440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1643579542}
review:
Short version:

Pros:
+ Adorable presentation and art-style
+ Satisfying gameplay
+ Cool power ups and upgrades
+ Great soundtrack
+ Fun collectathon
+ A lot of extra content and secrets

Cons:
- A few frustrating sections

“Long” version:
[u]Yoku’s Island Express[/u] is a puzzle-pinball adventure game developed by Villa Gorilla and published by Team17 Digital Ltd.
You play as a cute beetle named Yoku, the new postman (postbeetle?) for the Island of Mokumana; you must deliver packages, solve mysteries and save the island from its inevitable doom.

Let me get this out of the way; I adored this game. I think it borders on perfection.
Granted, I love beetles. That is the main focus of my career IRL but, still, this game is great.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725325691
Unlike many other puzzle/pinball games, [u]Yoku’s Island Express[/u] features a lengthy story-mode. While not necessarily “deep”, it is very enjoyable and cute. I feel like adults will enjoy it for what it is but kids will most likely love it; everyone is friendly and joyful, a nice change of pace – there is no violence here.

Gameplay is where [u]Yoku’s Island Express[/u] shines.
When I first started the game, it did feel a tiny bit awkward. Yoku carries a giant ball around and you control it by pressing left or right; Yoku just follows the ball.
You soon start getting launched around and Yoku holds onto the ball for dear life and that was quite funny to see – although I felt rather sorry for the poor insect. But do not worry! Beetles have a chitinous exterior which protects them from fall damage!

Not only can you control the ball, but you can also control the pinball flippers scattered throughout the island. These will launch you at high speeds and that is how most of the traversal takes place.
You occasionally get dropped into “arenas” that work as isolated pinball tables and also a few boss fights. These are expertly spaced out, I never found them obnoxious.
There are some sections that can take a bit longer, which can be frustrating, because they require two or three precise shots in a row/in quick succession.
Beyond that, you cannot really lose. You can lose a minimal amount of currency and, considering it respawns, it is not a big deal. The game is quite forgiving but still fun.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2733714520
[u]Yoku’s Island Express[/u] looks absolutely amazing. The art direction does some real heavy lifting to elevate this game above its competition.
The character design is delightful and there is this hard-to-describe warmth to the visuals. The colors are bright, the environments are lush and the characters are adorable.

When it comes to sound, the game features some good effects, but no voice acting, just some gibberish during dialogues (picture [u]Banjo-Kazooie[/u], not [u]Yooka-Laylee[/u]).
The soundtrack, however, is masterfully crafted; will you listen to it after you are done playing the game? No, I do not think so. But is it good? You bet! It is great!

You can finish the story in about 7 hours, adding around 3 more for collectibles. Speaking of collectibles, this game is a bit of a collectathon – you have countless side quests that grant you upgrades to your abilities.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2725323815
For such an affordable price, I can recommend [u]Yoku’s Island Express[/u] to pretty much everyone. It is great for parents who are looking for a game to play with their kids but also for adults who want to chill and have an innocent good time.

Not sure if it is a hidden gem, but I sure see it as such.

Final score: 9.5 out of 10.

If you enjoyed this review, please consider following my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7792954-GGN-Reviews/]curator page[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198028647392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1656093245}
review:
I'd like to preface this by saying I never write reviews. 

I got this game for free during the Ukraine humble bundle, I didn't touch it for a very long time but I recently had surgery and needed something to keep me entertained while I recover. I decided to give this game a shot thinking I could play it for an hour or too and stop after I got bored, probably to never touch it again. 

Boy was I wrong, this game is incredibly charming, the art is beautiful, and the game play mechanics are very refreshing as I've never played a game like this. I know I received this product for free but I honestly would have loved to pay full price for it. I haven't had this much fun playing a casual game in a long time. 10/10 would recommend. My only gripe is that the map can be a pain to get around when you are revisiting areas but it's honestly not that big of a deal, they have built in a lot of mechanics to make traveling a lot easier for most of the map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003082630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1655928814}
review: I thought this would be a 5-minutes-I'm-bored title, turned out to be a 10-hours-I'm-a-happy-dung-beetle-tooting-my-party-streamer-with-dungy-abandon.  My only gripe is after completing the main quest, when exploring the map for its various secrets, getting around can be a hassle.  But those are the breaks of having to lug a ball of poo 5 times your size.  It affects mobility.  It's the character's own insistence to do so.  If you aren't prepared to delve into the mind of a dung beetle and really explore the psychology and have true kinship with your dungball around a campfire, then you won't truly know the benefits of life as the truly majestic dung beetle, latin name Dungus Beetelus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996624574', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1655921640}
review: Cute metroidvania but the main mechanic of puzzling, battling, and traversal is pinball. How much you like this game will depend on how frustrated you get with pinball and having to hit exact shots. At 6 hours for the story it doesn't overstay it's welcome and the world is varied and interesting enough I may go back after the credits to clean up some of the side quests I missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218942507', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1655919914}
review:
好游戏，但还是着重强调一下不足吧。
打弹球太久容易腻，游戏的收集品几乎只与探图有关，和核心玩法打弹珠关系不大；弹珠打久了比较乏味，因为设计较为单一，比不上纯粹的弹球游戏。
剧情薄弱，虽然和同类游戏相比还不错，但也不要抱太大期望，因为这游戏的卖点就不在剧情上。

当然不足只是相对的，在同价位同类游戏中，这游戏已经称得上优秀了，如果以折扣较高的方式入手，即使不喜欢打弹球也不亏的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063449210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1702600208}
review:
I absolutely love Yoku's Island Express, It grabbed me right at the title screen and had one heck of a great time through the normal run of the game going in blind. Then during my playthrough a dev for the randomizer, 
 xWinG came in my stream chat and taught me some fun things and tricks in the game and also did the randomizer and enjoyed it as well so I very highly recommend the game if you like fun cute pinball with a metroid-vania element.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164831891', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 785, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1655247831}
review: Olha, fazia um bom tempo que não me divertia tanto: adorei a mistura entre metroidvania e pinball, gostei da arte gráfica e da música. De aspectos negativos: o sistema de viagem rápida é um pouco complicado, pq não engloba todas as localidades do mapa (é necessário ir a um ponto específico para viajar a outro), além disso, as mesas de pinball são razoavelmente simples. De qualquer forma, é um dos jogos mais agradáveis que experimentei nos últimos tempos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293765626', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 456, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1655208311}
review:
정가 20,500원 고퀄리티의 핀볼게임

작성자는 우크라이나 관련 기부팩에 구성되있는게임이어서 플레이해봄.

기대감이 없어서 그런지 은근히 꿀잼이었던게임

핀볼을 싫어한다면 별로인게임이겠지만,

은근히 인게임내 브금도 좋고 그래픽도 좋은 힐링분위기의 고퀄리티 핀볼게임이다.

스팀 도전과제는 31개 다른게임대비 크게 어렵거나 정말얻기힘든 뭐 그런도전과제는 없음,

스팀 트레이딩카드는 3장 획득 가능

좋은말만 쓴거같지만 괜찮은게임이다 라고 생각해도 스팀 정가로 만약 구매할것이냐?

물어본다면 글쎄...플레이해봤으니 솔직히말하자면 약 60%이상 할인일때

고민해볼것같다.

추천

author: {'steamid': '76561197960509634', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1655061731}
review:
Whod've thought that a platformer based on a pinball mechanic would be so intriguing?

There's a couple of points which could do with a save point or a hint in the right direction, and the "bee-lines" (fast travel) definitely need to be easier to get to and move between.  There's a lot of back and forth for no real reason.

But I completed the main storyline with only minor frustrations.

Very well suited to the Steam Deck, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247307592', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1654923670}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is not a perfect creation, but its creative gameplay conceit and unpretentious charms make it an experience which is well worth the short while it takes to beat it. The integration of pinball and metroidvania is not one I think anyone would have seen coming, but it is one which I think the developers explored to its fullest potential here. The map is carefully crafted, with the dedicated pinball "tables" never reaching beyond a light exercise. Those unfamiliar with pinball will probably get frustrated with trying to fling precise shots to begin with, but the game never asks too much of you, and after a couple hours I was comfortable in most situations.

Movement in this game outside of the pinball sections is undeniably slow most of the time, and I will wholeheartedly agree that backtracking is the most tedious part of the game. The circuitous nature of the world starts to grate when you have to go to a certain point repeatedly, and the fast travel system could have stood to have a couple extra onboarding points, if not an additional track altogether. I think the devs realized this and made the wisest decision they could have: they made the game small. 

Those almost-eight hours of playtime I racked up, what most would consider the playtime to merely finish a short game, are all the time it took me to get 100% completion. Opening the map at the game's onset might surprise players for how much of the map is already visible. When you get tasked with the game's main thrust and are given three points to get to, you might expect there to be something afterwards; some kind of second half. But...no. There is no "pulling back the curtain" moment, no part where the game pulls a Rayman Origins and makes you do it all again. To simply get to the end of the game would probably take no more than 4 hours for most decent players. While this might be a point of concern if you want your wares to have a minimum amount of hours of playtime, I think this works in the game's favour.

Having such a small map means, firstly, that secrets are never too daunting to collect. Unless it's very clearly a point you need a new ability to traverse, you can always find the way to it nearby. In my experience, I didn't have trouble recalling the spaces which needed the new abilities since you can pretty reasonably just about memorize the whole map. Secrets which I found asinine were few and far between. Secondly, the game doesn't overstay its welcome. A behemoth world filled with the brim with pinball and slow backtracking would have overstayed its welcome; the world as it is is just the right size to stay endearing the whole way through. Frankly, I think any more and I would have started to sour on it.

The actual metroidvania elements are, fittingly, as small as the game itself. There are only a few abilities in the game to collect and only a few questlines to follow. These quests are pretty much just variations on collectibles; the only meaningful difference is how many degrees of separation the game puts into them to pretend otherwise. Still, they're fun little distractions from the rest of the game and making a dung beetle stuff letters in a mailbox never gets old. Only when you turn your sights to cleaning it all up could the shotgun blast of map markers make the traversal required tedious. Your mileage will vary on this, of course, depending on how thorough you've been throughout the game.

The abilities, unfortunately, are were I had the most consistent issues. [spoiler]The exploding slugs never felt quite right to me. Collectables which required me to use them as a jump were uncomfortably imprecise, and vacuuming them up seemed inconsistent. The first dive fish you receive could have stood to be faster. Sootling on a leash is a fun concept, but unfortunately you just spin too fast for the amount of precision the game expects you to wield with it, and so most of the sootling flower sections had to be done repeatedly. It got pretty annoying. To cap it all off, the game gives an upgraded slug vacuum and dive fish as quest rewards you won't see until the end of the game. It's pointless by then anyways, but I literally do not understand what I'm supposed to gain by holding two slugs instead of one. [/spoiler]

One area where this game isn't small, however, is its presentation. Each piece of the map is lovingly rendered with distinct artwork. The characters are charming and silly. The music, which is mostly a wonderful listen, gives me distinct latter-day David Wise vibes. It all sums up into a wonderful package which meant that the act of exploring the island and being part of the world wasn't ever dull. The amount of heart and passion the devs clearly put into this game is staggering and it makes it incredibly endearing. The only comment I have on it is that, of all things, this is a rare game where they could have really used a basic proofread of the script. There were many points in the game where punctuation was missing from dialogue or an occasional spelling error or style fault slipped in. It's not a big issue, but it brought me out of the experience.

Overall, Yoku's Island Express is a wondrously silly and breezy experience with a clever twist on the metroidvania formula. Its sensibilities make it a delightful snack of an experience which lasts just as long as it needs to. Some of the finer details are lacking and backtracking can be onerous, but I can never say I was unhappy when playing this game. It's just too much wholesome fun!

[b]8/10[/b]
[b]Excellent[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198111952890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1655059909}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1655487523}
review:
Yoku Island's Express is a pinball platformer. You start off as a little bug with a ball arriving to become the Postmaster of the island. The final objective of the game is to save the god of island, Mokuma, and defeat the hidden evil devouring god.

Gameplay-wise, mouse and keyboard. LEFT RIGHT ARROW KEYS to move left and right. There is no jump button. SPACE allows you to blow a party blower to break objects and wake NPCs up. 

The SHIFT key is essential to completing the game. It controls all the flippers and bumpers in the game.You have to tap the SHIFT key to vacuum slugs and spin around carnivorous plants.

Conclusion, do try Yoku's Island Express. While the keys have a small problem, the game is quite good. Your hidden evil devouring god is weird, it doesn't make any sense the way the story plays out. 

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Interesting Pinball Adventure
Quite nice.

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. The Vacuum
By default, I did not know you have to press SHIFT. Since it doesn't automatically pickup slugs. There is a potential for the game to stall at a certain level.

2. The Juicery
Is there a need to lock it down after 1 try?

3. Short Game
Really quite short for an adventure game (<10 hours). Even so, only 27.3% completed the main quest. So, I get a feeling it got boring for the players after the slugs. 

"Tastes like chicken
Suck up a slug with the Slug Vacuum"

At this point, you made the game frustrating and boring. 

[h1][b]SUGGESTIONS[/b][/h1]
1. Get rid of Vacuuming the Slugs with SHIFT
To collect a Slug and then blow it up is annoying and is an additional difficulty with no reward. (It's the stupid SHIFT key). It would be easier to just pick up the Slug automatically by colldiing with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859203629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1655078523}

author: {'steamid': '76561198205411996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1654908073}
review:
6時間程でストーリークリア。収集は30～40％くらい？全部やるとしたら12時間くらいかかりそうですかね。

ピンボール題材にした非常に良く出来たゲームだと思いますが、いかんせん操作難度がめちゃくちゃ高いです。

デスペナほぼ無し、体力無限、ミスのリカバリーが容易、のためカジュアルなゲームになってるとは思いますが、望みの箇所にボールを弾く際、ボールを止めずにやる場合は誇張抜きでフレーム単位での操作が必須になります。
一応、他のピンボールゲーと違い、この作品の主人公はPVのように移動が出来るのと、ボールを弾くやつの上を通過する際ガイドが出る（白く光る）ので、ボールを止めて微調整しながらやればある程度飛ばしたいところに飛ばすことも出来るかなと思います。

個人的には、方向ガイド（飛ぶ方向に矢印を出すなど）があったり、難易度の変更などがあればより良かったかなと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198222733848', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1654446949}
review:
非常有趣地将弹球游戏与类银河战士玩法进行结合，玩法十分新颖有趣，轻快明亮的画风，不错的操作体验与精妙弹球的关卡设计。经典的类银河恶魔城地图设计，有些足够的探索空间。

整体难度较低，11小时左右就全成就通关了，死亡惩罚几乎为0，鼓励玩家更多的尝试不一样的操作。

整体在后期全收集上来说，跑图稍微有些麻烦，蜂线只有3条无法覆盖全图。

author: {'steamid': '76561197980864252', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1693691802}
review: Game is fun, but has unskipable credits and DOES NOT SAVE after the final boss until you watch them. This ruined the whole game for me. I'm sure you worked very hard on this but if this is huge waste of time. I  can't even get them to run in the background.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058438997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1654853768}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033910034', 'num_games_owned': 3900, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1654572325}
review:
Highly recommended.

I always loved the idea of a game disguised as a pinball machine. This has a ton of neat locations, cute story, great art style and smooth controls. Your journey is fun filled and suitable for all ages. The price for the length is my only mark down, but it's on sale a lot so that is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317657128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4555, 'last_played': 1653516200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968981708', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1652031774}
review:
I have beaten it. Don't misunderstand the game, it's a pinball game. A Pinball game with some minor platforming mechanics. This may be a little bit irritating to some people, but it's NOT A METROIDVANIA! Also it's not a Platformer. It's a Pinball game. And it was mostly fun on that. If you realize that, you can align your expectations and roll with them.
I enjoyed the game in the end, when I realized the game for what it is, and appreciate the heart put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085774720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1653813430}
review:
[h1]- 推荐 -[/h1]

[h1]前言！[/h1]
《Yoku's Island Express》是一款融合了弹珠机制与平台跳跃的开放世界探险游戏。新手邮差Yoku只身前往孤岛去支援前辈，就此在岛上展开了送货之旅。如果你喜欢弹珠类游戏，不妨来试试本作，可爱漂亮的画风加上独特的剧情，还有好听的音乐，玩起来很是舒服。

[h1][quote=]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]　欢迎关注 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287879]网易UU鉴赏家培养计划[/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]　来这里找优质游戏、开黑日友、白嫖UU时长卡　[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]　加速Steam社区、游戏记得用UU哦_(:з」∠)_　[/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]
[/quote][/h1]

[h1]体验！[/h1]
玩家所操控的主角是一只小瓢虫邮差，带着一颗球作为交通工具，会被不断的弹来弹去，以来到不同的地区派信。在各个场景里，玩家可以控制场景中的弹珠式机关来推动主角的圆球前进，并解决任务。同时也需要收集所掉落的水果和符文碎片，以解锁新的弹珠台和机关，并到达更多的区域。

在类银河战士恶魔城式的地图中收集道具和解锁路径，是一种非常有创意的游戏模式。游戏在前期的时候，因为缺乏某些道具，而无法把途中的水果都收集全，对于收集爱好者来说，会忍不住的想把游戏肝下去。

本作最特别的机制就是能够操作关卡的机关，把主角推或射到任何的角落。整体玩起来比较新鲜，不管是移动、战斗、飞行，还是快速通道，所有的东西都是建立在弹珠台的设计之上。这也跟关卡驱动进行了极好的融合，让玩家不停的对游戏设计的移动轨迹感到新奇。

关卡方面，是利用玩家获得的技能来区隔玩家所能到达的区域。完全是类银河战士恶魔城式的设定。关卡驱动也让玩家会因为进入一个新的地点而感到有趣，让你想不断的探索挖掘游戏世界还藏着什么有趣的秘密。

令人感到意外的是本作竟然有着一个完整而别致的主线故事，喜欢奇幻作品的玩家很可能会收到剧情上的惊喜。除了基本的故事结局之外，还存在额外的真结局，让人感觉很是圆满。

游戏玩起来很悠闲，弹珠的死亡惩罚轻微到可以忽略不记。但游戏的地形比较复杂，容易迷路，有时需要花很长的时间才能移动到目的地。另外，个别物品的取得方式极有难度，追求100%收集的玩家可能会稍有挫折感。本作的重玩性不太大，一次通关加上100%收集大约需要十五个小时左右。

镜头算是个小问题，某些地方他们会固定镜头让你感觉真的像是在玩弹珠，但有的地方又让人觉得该固定的却没有固定。弹珠的轨迹比较曲折，镜头有时一直锁定主角，当主角在移动时就明显的让人感觉有点晕。在中后期到处找东西的时候，不停移动就会特别的明显。

[h1]结语！[/h1]
优秀的创意和关卡设计，还有精彩的BOSS战和反转的剧情，以一个创新式玩法的冒险游戏来说，本作体验非常棒。喜欢弹珠类游戏的玩家，本作就是必玩之作，可趁特价时入手，但即使原价购买也不会失望。

author: {'steamid': '76561198103874486', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1654266836}
review: Cute puzzle platformer with pinball mechanics, I see a lot of people saying it's metroidvania, but i don't know how much that is true since most shortcuts are only useful once or not at all. But yeah, gameplay is solid, music is chill, atmospheric, artstyle is colourful and most of all, the difficulty is just relaxing - no timed puzzles, no real failure state, just go at your own pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561199002978610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1591735328}
review: It was during the first weeks of the pandemic that I got back into gaming after a hiatus of more than 20 years. My last excessive gaming experiences were going back to the Amiga 500, my reflexes were completely rubbish - I would be turning 47 in that year - and I was new to using a controller, also. This game really changed a lot for me, I fell in love with gaming again because of this, Stardew Valley and The Witcher III. That of course means: This game is not overly challenging, it is a chill and relaxing experience filled to the rim with a sunny, friendly and charming spirit. The pinbal mechanic is a lot of fun, the music sets the mood nicely and the graphics are beautiful. There aren't many games like Yoku's Island Express for the PC. This is just a wonderful easy going game, that will leave you a happier person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003330630', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1654234278}

author: {'steamid': '76561198401083756', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1654181906}
review: Fun, cute and relaxing game. Haven't played a pinball game since the one on old Windows, it was really nostalgic to play again!! Not being punished harshly for "dying" in the game also made it more of a fun game than a challenging one, which is kind of what I wanted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380635846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1654426137}
review: This is fun game,

author: {'steamid': '76561198295786669', 'num_games_owned': 903, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1656473163}
review:
The pinball mechanics are inherently shallow, and the only form of challenge you'll find in the entire game is in the annoyingly precise timings to hit the paddle or release a spin to launch yourself into the perfect spot, making it feel really tedious, All characters make really annoying noises with no individual volume slider for them. And the swimming controls are really dumb.
But the world is designed so well, with so many intertwining paths, secrets to find, and shortcuts to open, making you travel everywhere. It all comes together to make the game a collectathon satisfying enough to make me 100% the game, which as you can see by my achievements I almost never do. This game could have been great if the movement mechanics were better, but what's here is still really good. 4/5

And having the buttons for the colours swapped from what they are in Portal constantly messes with me.

review:
Платформенная приключенческая игра  - пинбол, в целом очень красочная и занимательная. 
Круто что есть Демо. Поиграв, понял что стоит купить. 

Скорее всего я свернул где то не туда и выполняя часть достижений находил артефакты, которые явно уже не нужны, ну или игра не до конца сбалансированная.

Есть механика раскрашивания шарика, несколько раз она помогала пройти квест.

author: {'steamid': '76561199085205848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1652668496}
review: Great small game

author: {'steamid': '76561198202648511', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1653957476}
review:
An extremely cute, relaxing game! I love how they combined pinball with an adventure-style gameplay. Never thought that a game like this could be so dynamic and fun! It doesn't get boring at all, and you can stop or start whenever you want. There are plenty to explore on this island and many subplots throughout that reward you tremendously for a job well done! They truly think about every interaction!

Can't wait to see more of this type of gameplay. This is definitely a worthwhile buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198109180130', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1654117676}
review:
this game is really great, must play. fantastic art.
i've been playing pinball games since msdos and i can easily say this is the best pinball game i ever played, but its much more than just pinball ofcourse, its more a sidescrolling platformer than a pinball game, which is great, most of all the atmosphere of the cute forest creatures fantasy is a perfect combination i really like

author: {'steamid': '76561198239864500', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1652225373}
review: Honestamente eu só adquiri esse jogo porque me pareceu fácil de platinar, como geralmente são os jogo do gênero metroidvania, nem reparei que havia uma mecânica de pinball inclusa. E olha, que grande surpresa! Personagens carismáticos, cenários lindos e um nível de excelência em level design surreal. Não sei de onde surgiu a ideia de misturar Pinball (Puzzle), Metroidvania (Plataforma) e Mundo aberto (RPG), gêneros e subgêneros que vão em direções opostas, de forma tão fluida e divertida. Logo após concluir o jogo eu imediatamente procurei por algum parecido mas não encontrei, nem acho que irei, Yoku's Island Express é uma experiência única.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040411748', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1654093794}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014527651', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1653879131}
review: I stumbled on this game without any info about it and was so surprised by how much I loved it. This game really helped me through a rough patch in my life. It is filled to the brim with whimsy and fun. One part metroidvania, one part pinball, and all magic. I loved every second. I got every single achievement and I haven't done that since my 20's. I high recommend this game if you like either of the two genres it pulls from. If I have anything to knock points of it would be the map. It has only two levels of zoom and neither are close enough. This really only caused me issue when I was already done with the story and got stuck trying to find tiny pathways and routes to the last items I needed. This is an easy recommendation. Get it and have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198341272796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1657465490}
review: A lot of fun! Relatively easy, I got through the main quest line without online help, and I'm not a very experienced gamer. I did look up some stuff for the side quests and for collecting the last wickerlings, and on some of them I had to try again, and again, and again, to get the timing right, because I found the grappling mechanic difficult to time right. Still, I heartily recommend, both for adults and children.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213132683', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1678372837}
review:
Estimated 100% Completion time: 9-10 hours.

A fantastic, wholesome little Metroidvania-style platformer with unique movement mechanics in the form of pinball bumpers. There's never any stress related to dying or failure, as the game doesn't punish you for it. The gimmicks such as being a small postman armed with a party popper were excellent, and the game never failed to bring me joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072329735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1653529966}
review: Joguinho muito gostoso de passar o tempo. Sempre gostei de pinball e nunca imaginei que veria uma aventura com essa jogabilidade. Vale a pena a experiência. Recomendo muito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021340301', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1652299545}
review:
One of the best pinballing adventures out there!
Definitely recommended if you're a fan of pinball and metroidvania games.

Strong, neutral and weak points:
+ Game/story puts a smile to your face
+ Nice visuals
+ Good soundtrack
+ Varying pinball gameplay (pinball bosses!!)
+ Massively improved levels and flow over the original game
- Not all gameplay elements are well explained (directional snail launches)

Playtime (completionist): ~10 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198069059316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1653136270}
review:
[b] 「メトロイドヴァニア＋ピンボール」[/b] って
　なんだよ？！

そうです。。
でもやってみるとその通りなんです！
そもそもこの発想がすごい。

自力でジャンプもできない、
多分、お話をすすめても
ビーム的なものなんか出せそうにない。
玉をころがすだけが特技のフンコロガシ。
いわば、ずっと初期モーフボール状態。。。

このちんちくりんな主人公が自分の分身となる
ことに抵抗をおぼえるかもしれませんが
大丈夫です！

そのうちマップが広がるのが楽しくなり
ムキになってフルーツや根っこを集め出します
島民のどうでもいいお願いをききながら
島中を転がり回って、飛ばされまくって
おせっかいを焼きまくります。

このまんま
この島でずっと郵便屋さんをしててもいいかな
と思うようになります。。

review: I've played this game for about 3 hours and I can already say that I highly recommend it! It's a pinball metroidvania!!!!  It's done really well. The game looks gorgeous(ori levels gorgeous), the characters are adorable and it's just so much fun playing pinball as you help creatures out and explore the island.  Such a creative game, I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198844580535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1653027795}
review:
发小推荐的游戏，让我沉迷4天刷完了全成就。
剧情版3维弹球，童年记忆，喜欢各个场景的音乐！强烈推荐！
小岛上是各种各样捉妖记里的“胡巴”...
爬树非常痛苦...不过慢慢也习惯了...
最后的大结局神蛋孵化以后有点丑，一开始以为会是凤凰，后来看来看去感觉像一只苍蝇？

author: {'steamid': '76561199227320885', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1695497815}
review: 我技术不太好，很多弹珠是看运气的，所以很多时候有点坐牢，痛苦，成就太难了，我不能全成就，难受。boss什么的还好最难的是成就，为了完成成就跑图的时候也头皮发麻，虽然有缆车一样的绕图设施，但是很多时候下来就很难上去了，其他时间很快乐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055006289', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1630490936}

review:
This game is MAGIC!!!
Honestly I was saying "eww" when I saw pinball tag, but everything works together seamlessly.
LOVE the jungle design and level feeding one pinball zone into the next.
Honestly it's a lot like Sonic Spinball from my childhood, which was my Jam, except that there are a little bit more open world segments and talking to characters for fetch quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355365685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1677113228}
review:
HERMOSO JUEGO! Plataformas, pinball y personajes cutes. ♥
Terrible mezcla. Lo que lo hace de una jugabilidad magnífica y muchisimos retos mientras vas recorriendo los caminos, entre las misiones principales y las secundarias. 
Además de que todos los recorridos de la isla, están llenos de diversión pura, y cada reto superado va añadiendo mecánicas y habilidades que lo hacen cada vez más sorprendente y entretenido.
RECOMENDADÍSIMO. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114331792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1653236455}
review:
I've been itching for a pinball adventure game for years and nothing has ever really scratched that itch until now. 

Yoku's Island Express does so seemingly effortlessly and with a cutesy charm that I love in any adventure game. The soundtrack fits perfectly and level/table design is great. The game is forgiving enough to be suitable for all ages, yet there's a few tricky shots that will still feel like a challenge. 

It really does feel unique - sure there's influence from cutesy puzzlers like Loco Roco and Pikuniku, the bubbles remind me of Little Big Planet and obviously there's the heritage of pinball tables (real and virtual) through the decades - but the combination of genres makes Yoku one of the freshest games I've played in ages. 

It's genuinely hard to stop smiling while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971042589', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1653855450}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110240493', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1614287707}
review: Disclaimer, the controls are digital; meaning the only variable underlying your trajectory is where the character is on your paddle; so you can't control the strength of your shots. This caveat out of the way, you're left with a very creative metroidvania with a great soundtrack, a great feel and great progression. You're missing out if you're hesitating.

author: {'steamid': '76561199030367024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1652968276}
review:
Le pari fou mais ô combien réussi de faire d'un flipper une véritable aventure !
C'est vraiment plaisant de faire progresser Yoku et sa bille à travers cette île en open world, pour venir aide à ses habitants. Le désir d'exploration n'a rien à envier aux RPG les plus connus.
À quand le démineur en monde ouvert ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198008929552', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1652622678}
review:
Metroidvania meets pinball. It's pretty cute and fun to play, not very long on top of that so it doesn't overstay its welcome. The only criticisms I have are:
1) the slug explode mechanic (when you're not in a "pinball area") is jank AF. So jank that I actually initially dismissed it as an intended mechanic to reach some spots (but you will need it if you're going for the 100%)
2) a few optional areas are pretty obscure to find the entrance for (can't be that I'm *that* blind right?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198269134448', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1652535756}
review:
非常轻松休闲的游戏 弹珠台+类银河战士恶魔城
从弹珠台来说，游戏以开放世界为大主题里面插入了各种小的弹珠台地图，全程衔接紧凑且玩起来很有意思，boss战和能力收集也与弹珠台紧紧相连；
从类银河战士恶魔城来说，地图设计十分精彩，不同区域之间连接的很丝滑，立体性非常的强，更重要的是把能力拓展和弹珠台相挂钩非常的新颖。

总之就是非常好玩，力荐！

[spoiler] 偶尔会被弹球搞得血压飙升╮(╯▽╰)╭ [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197960817851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1656800530}
review:
I've only played for a few hours so far but the game is really nice so far. The pinball game mechanics works great :-)

It somehow reminds me a bit of Steamworld Dig in the way the game world is themed and designed.

By the way the pinball game mechanics is not entirely new since it was used in Adventure Pinball: Forgotten Island.

I am thinking that the name "Yokus Island" and the theme is a bit too close to Nintendos Yoshi's Island though.

Edit: Now that I have advanced some further in this game and discovered some new mechanics (soothlings) and bosses it does also remind me a bit of playing Ori and the Blind Forest since for example you will become able to grab onto plants and navigate mid-air.

author: {'steamid': '76561199058111952', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1723, 'last_played': 1671186198}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007540163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1652515484}
review:
Yoku is the type of game you didn't really know you needed until you actually got your hands on it. At least that's how it has been for me. I've had my eye on it for a while, but just never really pulled the trigger on making the purchase, until today. It's a cute adventure game where you solve puzzles and move around the world via pinball style bumpers. It really just...works. All the music I've encountered so far have been total ear worms and the whole game world is a visual feast for the eyes. 

I would highly recommend checking it out if any of the above sounds like something you'd be in to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117775085', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1652176226}
review:
메트로바니아에 핀볼이 들어간 참신한 게임.

특이하게도 이 게임은 새로운 장소나 이벤트, 전투 등 대부분의 요소를 핀볼을 통해 진행합니다. 그것도 매번 다른 새로운 핀볼맵을 가지고 오죠. 또한 맵을 탐험할 때에도 이 게임만의 기믹에 핀볼을 조합한 색다른 방식으로 진행합니다. 핀볼 게임이 가지고 있는 고유의 재미가 매트로바니아와 합쳐졌으니 재미가 없을 수가 없는 조합입니다. 깔끔한 그래픽은 덤이구요.

아쉬운점은 게임의 문제보단 핀볼 자체의 문젠데, 공을 원하는 곳으로 보내는 것이 쉽지 않다는 점입니다.  어디로 공을 보내야 할지 뻔히 보이는데 자꾸 빗나가는 제 공을 보고있으면 혈압이...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970330601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1652122798}
review:
Chilliges, niedliches und innovatives "Roll-'n'-Run" mit Pinball-Mechanik und Sidescrolling, viel Sammelbarem, diversen Rätseln, abwechslungsreichen Schauplätzen und einigen schrägen Charakteren/Kreaturen. Alles findet auf einer riesigen Karte ohne Ladepausen statt. Durch Nebenmissionen verdient man sich neue Fähigkeiten, mit denen zuvor unzugängliche Areale erkundet bzw. zuvor unerreichbare Sammelobjekte erlangt werden können.
 
Abgesehen von der manchmal etwas fummeligen Steuerung ist Yoku's Island Express sehr frustarm. Bei (den seltenen) Bildschirmtoden darf man direkt an Ort und Stelle weitermachen. Manch ein langer Lauf- bzw. Rollweg kann zeitweise nerven, allerdings steht im Spielverlauf ein sehr lustiges Schnellreisesystem bereit. Anfangs war ich aufgrund der spärlichen Grafik-Optionen irritiert. Doch obwohl das Spiel auf 60 fps begrenzt ist und man kaum etwas einstellen kann, lief es hier von Beginn an einwandfrei und flüssig (System: Ryzen 7 3700X, 32 GB RAM, Radeon 6800 XT, NVMe-SSD).

Ich wurde jedenfalls sehr positiv von Yoku's Island Express überrascht und hoffe, dass die Entwickler es nicht bei diesem toll gelungenen Erstlingswerk belassen werden.

(Gespielt unter Windows 10 und mit Xbox-Series-X-Controller.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198314840949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1652088252}
review: Opravdu milá a originální záležitost. Kombinace metroidvanie a pinballu je opravdu něco naprosto unikátního a funguje to skvěle. Hra navíc vypadá krásně a celá se nese v takové milé a uvolněné atmosféře. Vlastně ani nemůžete nějak umřít nebo výrazně selhat, takže je to opravdu pohodová hra. Až na ten zdejší grappling hook, ze kterého se mi z nějakého záhadného důvodu dělalo vysloveně zle. Jen je trochu škoda, že sebrání všech collectiblů vyžaduje naprosto nepředstavitelné kousky, takže se o to asi ani nebudu snažit a věřím, že takových lidí bude víc. Ale tak alespoň mají opravdu schopní pinballisti nějakou výzvu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069065539', 'num_games_owned': 2224, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1651957112}
review:
[i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] is a 2D platformer. An indie Metroidvania unique due to its pinball mechanics, this title offers a plenty pleasing four hour main campaign for players to breeze through. One of the most casual Metroidvanias on the market, this will make for some zen gameplay sessions outside of the few annoyingly unpredictable endgame mechanics. Give this one a try if you're a fan of pinball or smooth Metroidvanias.

You play as Yoku, a little red beetle with a relatively giant stone sphere tethered to your hip. Upon arrival to this strange island to serve as its new Postmaster, you encounter a ton of challenging terrains that can only be overcome by slingshotting yourself across the bumpers and flippers throughout the world. Amass an array of powerups, abilities, and allies as you make your way across the island delivering mail, aiding the residents, and uncovering the insidious plot that seeks to destroy the island for good!

[i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] can essentially be summed up in just two words: "pinball Metroidvania." The pinball aspect is the most prominent element of the experience, as this game's platforming challenges come in the form of pinball levels, namely having to aim and hit certain areas in the level terrain to progress. The game design is quite tight to account for the often janky nature of pinball physics: many of the seemingly open areas are actually operate under strict invisible pathing as the player ricochets about, giving that satisfying rush of fast pinball action. If anything, gameplay can feel on-rails at times due to the limited amount of true free movement the player is allowed, though this is preferable to broken and unpredictable physics interactions.

As a Metroidvania, [i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] delivers what players would expect. Progress across the world map is gated off to when certain abilities are acquired, as are unlockables and pickups tucked around every corner. Sidequests and bosses also await to challenge players looking to do all the game offers. The fast travel system manages to cut down on the time spent backtracking from the midgame onwards, while integrating hidden secrets of its own. While the game's lore is pretty shallow and the cast of characters are one-note, some charming scenarios and a catchy soundtrack will keep you pushing onward through the platforming challenges.

Where this game otherwise stands out from its Metroidvania peers is in its difficulty: [i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] is perhaps the easiest, most casual Metroidvania out there. Fruit operates as this game's currency, though it also doubles akin to [i]Sonic the Hedgehog[/i]'s rings: taking damage only subtracts 2-4 fruit, which are very easily replenished throughout the world. As such, there is no fear of death and little risk to the platforming. If anything in this game constitutes challenge, it's certain segments of the pinball levels, which as with normal pinball can depend on the player hitting the pinball on a flipper's "sweet spot" to land in a certain corridor. Sometimes it's difficult to gauge how exactly a certain corridor is accessible, though with little risk it just falls to the player to calmly experiment with different angles of attack to land the best shot. The exception to this is a certain lategame strategy only required for completionists; because it involves free aim and doesn't utilize pinball mechanics, it feels very cheap and random compared to the rest of the game's platforming.

[i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] succeeds at delivering a game befitting of its tropical island setting: in a Metroidvania landscape full of soul-crushing ultrahard games, this one awaits to let players kick back with a simple premise and satisfying pinball gameplay. Whether you aim to complete the main campaign in roughly four hours or stick to 100% completion in over eight hours of content, you're got many a challenge to bounce and bop your way around. Take the express trip to this pinball paradise whenever you're feeling up to some pinball action. [i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] gets an A-.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030328898', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1653422883}
review:
It's pinball! It's a Metroidvania! What more could one want‽

PRESENTATION: The game doesn't overstay its welcome (5.5 hours for the main story to 11 hours to 100%, according to HLTB). The painterly art and world design are fun and well-lit, and music is enjoyable and fits the tone of each area. (Except the final boss track, which is... an interesting choice. It's not a bad piece, just unconventional.) The story is generic and the dialogue, while cute and sometimes humorous, isn't anything standout. The animations for NPCs and the world are simple and limited, but by no means feel stilted; they get the job done.

MECHANICS: The pinball mechanics themselves are straightforward enough for anyone to grasp, though hardcore pinball enthusiasts may find the tables' challenges/puzzles to be too simple. The additional mechanics (e.g. the exploding slugs) are shown, not told, to the player. The map is divided into a lot of small, discrete table areas, rather than having large and complicated tables akin to what one would find in an arcade. I like this aspect, as it means the goals of each table/area are very easy to read. It definitely feels like an appropriate balance of pinball and adventure, than if it were made as one genre with the mechanics of the other shoehorned in. The abilities one gains aren't numerous, which may be a good thing (less backtracking to weird areas) or bad (simpler game overall). Mechanics are shown, not told, to the player, and the player is forced to use new abilities immediately in low-stress areas. The physics can be pretty forgiving in certain places, serving to make the player's life easier. Even when it's noticeable that the physics are doing impossible things, it serves to help the player get where they want to go, rather than randomly punishing them for slight mistakes. I am only mediocre at pinball, and the difficulty felt just right; overcoming a challenge is a proud accomplishment, but tables aren't so hard to make one shut off the game. The difficulty of the Metroidvania exploration/collectible-hunting is similar, with no items in such weird or hard-to-reach places that make one think "How was I supposed to figure that out?". (Well, there is one exception, because the game doesn't really ingrain in players that [spoiler]tooting the horn pops slugs[/spoiler], making one item seem unobtainable.)

MINOR, POSSIBLY IRRELEVANT THOUGHTS: Games should make the simple act of moving the character around to be entertaining. I can't deny that I delighted in watching poor Yoku get yanked around by the ball; the physics driving the beetle's movements are fun to watch, but not distracting from the ball's movement. Also, dung beetle. So cute. I got really frustrated at the grappling-hook mechanic when item-collecting. However, I'm bad with that same movement mechanic in other games, so I cannot say that it was implemented poorly here. There is no true fast travel, making backtracking mildly annoying. The world isn't so large, though, that it takes terribly long to get to a destination. The map is just a zoomed-out version of the regular screen, with vibrant and easy-to-read icons, which makes it easier to see areas one would want to revisit without having a glaring 'unopened doorway here' sign. The game does not allow key binding changes. It's perfectly playable with a keyboard, but the controls take a little longer to get used to than if using a controller.

[b]SUMMARY:[/b] Just a satisfying game. It set out to be a unique blend of two seemingly disparate genres and it balanced them well, all wrapped in an endearing package. If you're at all a fan of video-pinball, Metroidvanias, game design regarding how quirky mechanics can be done [i]well[/i], or just want a fun little video game, Yoku's Island Express will be a worthwhile experience. I can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130351763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1651289853}
review:
Yoku's Island Express blends "metroid-vania" and pinball in an unexpectedly perfect way. Its is just the right amount of challenging that makes it fun to play all the time. I rarely put it down until I beat it :)

*Got game as part of a bundle so I did not pay full price. But I think it deserves the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010620527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1651412220}
review: 本以为是个普通且带一些稚气的游戏，一直在仓库里吃灰，五一假期被翻了牌子，结果整整占用了我两天的假期时间，通关+成就收集，可玩性还是不错的，收集类的成就很有趣味的，寻找、解密、收集，收集控是无法拒绝的；如果喜欢桌上弹球，那这个正适合。

author: {'steamid': '76561198058131563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1651522463}
review:
Normalerweise mag ich solche Spiele nicht aber das hier ist so richtig gut gemacht!
Ich hatte es bei Humble in nem Packet dabei und dachte mir, gibste dem ne Chance und spielst halt Mal eine halbe Stunde rein. 

10 Stunden sitz ich jetzt drann und es ist durchaus wiederspielenswert, weil man sich ja immer noch verbessern kann. Ein tolles Spiel, für Kinder und Erwachsene! 

Normalerweise hasse ich Kontroller/Gamepads, wie sonst was aber für das Spiel habe ich freiwillig eins benutzt. Man braucht eigentlich nur drei Tasten. dennoch hat es das Spiel manchmal in sich. 

Ich kann es absolut empfehlen! Kinder ab 8 Jahre (darunter würde ich einem Kind eh nichts elektronisches zum Spielen geben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287020664', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1651251690}
review:
Tips：
1.骷髅帮制作果汁不给你进了不用怕，到后期 去喷一个骷髅帮的颜色（致命喷头）就能进去了
2.爬行喷头+甜味喷头=大黄蜂球（“适合自己蜂服”，可以跟妖娆的蜂后见面）
3.进去亡灵，守卫会拦着你，回去喷红色喷头就好了
4.成就“足够了”的触发条件是 “嘟嘟发声1000次” （吹吹卷，按回车）
5.用好蛞蝓（爆炸的方向跟粘的方向相反）可以取到很多意想不到的地方
6.圣甲虫不是一个东西，它是在每个关卡里面的需要收集的灯（一个四个灯的，按键就会转的圈圈），触发一定次数之后，它的翅膀会慢慢展开（展开后类似于萤火虫），这个不在进程里，进程100%之后再收集也可以

画风很可爱的三维弹球游戏
轻松愉悦（全成就党除外，有几个地方是真的难）
音乐不错，不同场景的特色也做出来了
难度也不算太难，死亡惩罚也只是水果（可以反复刷，除了几个地方买藏宝图和眼睛需要比较多，后期基本都是满的），对手残党很友好
而且不存在不能重复获取的地方（除了骷髅帮果汁店，但是后期也是可以进去的）

但是
1.地图能不能做个放大啊。。后面看路线真的眼睛要看瞎了，有的地方还不显示的，过去之后发现没路了
2.遇到能看到但是拿不到的柳条或者宝箱，百度一下就有了，很多人跟你一样的困惑，有攻略的

2022.4.28 结局 拯救莫库玛
2022.4.29 真结局 孵化金蛋
2022.4.30 全成就  14.7h

author: {'steamid': '76561198017053502', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1673034016}
review:
Yoku is a pinball game with metroidvania and exploration elements. Surprisingly, there is a plot, and it is a good one, with funny dialogues along the way and a deeper message.

The art is gorgeous, but is mostly static, so the game can run in relatively old PCs.

This game is guaranteed to give you hours of fun. When i started it, i couldn't stop until i got 100%. And because of its uniqueness, i can see myself coming back to it in a couple years to achive 100% again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009970425', 'num_games_owned': 1374, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1651055476}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979282685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1650940170}
review:
I enjoyed this a lot. If you're looking for a hard pinball challenge this isn't that, it's a very forgiving game. If you want to 100% all the collectibles there's a few tough actions, but there's no "lose" condition, just "try again" conditions. The story's cute, the game mechanics are very functional (maybe not realistic pinball, but you can make sense of how it works), lots of nice smooth transitions in the UI. I didn't find any situations where you can get irreconcilably trapped, and even if there were, there's "restart from checkpoint" which works instantly, that would make that not too painful. No loading time transitions, just one long smooth experience.

The keyboard controls are a little awkward, trying to be like pinball with left-shift right-shift to trigger paddles and buffers, combined with arrow keys and enter, means you end up with one key on your left hand and everything else on your right - it would make more sense to me to just do arrow keys on the right and like A and D or something for the paddles.

author: {'steamid': '76561199199807576', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1650624972}
review:
有趣，有创意的弹珠类游戏
在epic领过，又在py上买来key支持一下
画面：较好
游戏性：较强
剧情：不错
音效：不错
手感：很好

author: {'steamid': '76561198360963560', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1652898961}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198081323567', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1650662049}
review: A charming 2D platformer with great sound design, fun music, and an innovative premise. I call it a platformer, but the gameplay is more akin to playing a gigantic pinball machine. The player character pushes a ball around with them everywhere, and the player can fire various pistons using the right and left controller triggers to send the ball - and the character with it - flying around the map to explore and find new destinations. Gradually, you unlock power ups which allow you to access new areas, not unlike in a metroidvania. It sounds complicated, but it’s extremely intuitive. The frame rate is capped at 60, which takes some points off, but otherwise it’s brilliant fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982541301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1650525527}
review:
A pinball game done right. But don't let that fool you, it's not only that. The metroidvania format suits the system surprisingly well.

This game does the tutorial right: it's almost absent. You learn the game by playing it. The gameplay itself is quite relaxed and in fact, you are not punished too much for "losing the ball" to the pinball pit. Then again, there are many interesting puzzles to get collectibles in the game.

I [u]highly recommend[/u] this game if you are looking for a relaxed good mood game with quite unique mechanics. I would have played more of this, but I ran out of content.

If you are into achievement hunting, this game can be quite easily be done 100% without looking any guides. You can expect the playtime to be around 10h.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055204242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1650512229}
review:
[h1]特色[/h1]

-彈珠台X橫版過關,成為拯救世界的郵差小蟲蟲吧! 

遊戲中,玩家所操控的小蟲蟲會被不斷的彈來彈去,以此來通過不同地區派信;同時,玩家也需要收集台面上所掉落的水果,或是符文碎片,用來解鎖新的彈簧台和機關,以到達更多區域.

-豐富,有趣的關卡設計和道具
如上文所說,遊戲會有多種不同的版面,隨著遊戲推進,蟲蟲會獲得不同能力,如吸附炸彈蝸牛,游泳等.令玩法充滿驚喜.

-廣大的天空地圖

 [h1]優[/h1]
-創意的遊戲設計及關卡設計(彈珠台X橫版過關)
-精彩的BOSS戰設計
-反轉的劇情


[h1]缺[/h1]

-遊戲玩法融合度較低

彈珠台的部分,要求玩家集中在控制兩邊的彈簧上,或是看著彈珠的走向;但這遊戲同時也需要玩家操縱小蟲走去不同地方解任,兩種遊戲機制不太可能同時進行(一個是靜態畫面,一個是動態畫面,無論是在操作上和畫面上對玩家來說有點吃力…)
-雖然有捷徑能幫助玩家遊走整片地圖,但地圖真的是太大(常常要跑來跑去,每要都要把之前玩過的彈台再玩一次)
非專業評分:7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050019099', 'num_games_owned': 9144, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1630871548}
review: Yoku's Island Express perfectly blends Metroidvania & platformer with pinball game. While this sounds absolutely crazy on paper, the game actually plays incredibly smooth and fun. The various collectibles thrown in for good measure are also quite fun. While backtracking is an integral part of a Metroidvania game I found it a little bit tedious here, because the map while being interesting and varied is too convoluted in places. All in all, Yoku's Island Express is a great Indie game with an innovative idea and superb gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1647375235}
review:
[code]Puedes ver más reseñas como esta en la mentoría [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Metroidpinballvania[/h1]
A priori, puede sonar bastante raro mezclar dos géneros como los metroidvania y los pinball, y a buen seguro lo primero que se viene a la cabeza es que es algo que nunca podría salir bien. Sin embargo, Yoku’s Island Express está aquí para demostrar que realmente todo puede llegar a ser posible en el mundo de los videojuegos si se plantea de manera inteligente, entrañable y divertida.

En Yoku’s Island Express controlaremos a un escarabajo pelotero que ha llegado a una isla para ser el nuevo cartero de la misma, pero nada más se reúne con su antecesor se da cuenta de que la isla ha sufrido el ataque de un ser malvado sobre el dios que sustenta el bienestar de la misma. En ese momento, empezaremos una misión llena de imaginación, magia y petacos.

El juego funciona de dos maneras bien diferenciadas. Una primera en la que desplazaremos a nuestro entrañable amiguito de la manera usual, izquierda-derecha, como si de una aventura al uso se tratase. La segunda será mediante el uso de diferentes petacos repartidos por toda la isla y que los usaremos para ir desplazándonos por los diferentes entornos de la isla.

Como buen escarabajo pelotero que es, nuestro cartero irá con una bola como compañera inseparable, pero en vez de ser una bola de estiércol, será una bola de pinball. Es bastante divertido ver al personajillo empujar su bola de pinball mientras se desplaza por el escenario y para nada se hace algo pesado o molesto. Además, tiene una cara bastante graciosa y nada más empezar la aventura nos darán un matasuegras para utilizarlo a modo de corneta que también es bastante gracioso.

La parte dedicada al pinball es muy divertida y entretenida, está llena de dinamismo y está perfectamente integrada dentro de la aventura. No solo se basará el sistema en aporrear los petacos para seguir avanzando, sino que tendremos que cumplir misiones utilizando este sistema, e incluso será un modo para enfrentarnos a los diferentes jefes finales que pueblan la isla de Yoku.

Como buen metroidvania que es, ciertas zonas estarán bloqueadas a nuestro paso al principio de la aventura, y solo después de haber adquirido ciertos poderes podremos acceder a ellas. No serán muchos, pero sí serán bastante originales.

Además, la historia es bastante entretenida y presenta situaciones muy originales y entrañables, haciendo que la experiencia sea muy entrañable y entretenida. Como tal, el juego no es excesivamente complejo y el hecho de que nuestro personaje no pueda morir hace que todo sea bastante amigable. Sin embargo, esto no significa que vaya a ser un paseo.

Pocas veces he tenido que mirar tanto un mapa en un metroidvania, ya que los caminos son realmente enrevesados en algunos momentos, los relacionados con los circuitos pinball principalmente, pero eso no hizo sino que la aventura fuera mucho más divertida.

El mundo de Yoku te presentará situaciones en la que no podrás evitar esbozar una sonrisa, con unos personajes realmente curiosos y entrañables, y que provocarán que en más de una ocasión te encuentres en situaciones que te sorprenderán muy gratamente.

A esto hay que añadir que su aspecto gráfico es bastante agradable, presentando unos entornos de buena calidad que utilizan unas tonalidades pastel que le sientan realmente bien al juego. Su música, además, acompaña perfectamente durante toda la aventura, aunque no es algo que realmente destaque en ningún momento.

Por último, el juego no es excesivamente largo. En unas 12-13 horas podrás completar toda la aventura con todos los logros. No es una duración excesivamente larga para ser un metroidvania, pero cuenta con dos finales diferentes, y no excluyentes. Es decir, primero tendrás un final por completar la misión principal, y luego podrás seguir jugando para obtener el segundo final si encuentras diferentes objetos para que se desbloquee el final real, por decirlo de alguna manera.

En definitiva, Yoku’s Island Express es una auténtica joya en lo referente a su planteamiento y originalidad y por la diversión que proporciona en todo momento. Si te gustan los metroidvania y los pinball, a buen seguro que la experiencia te resultará realmente entretenida e inolvidable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043472327', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1650058835}
review:
Charming game.

If you ever played a pinball game, and be it space cadet, give the demo a try. 
It's basically a metroidvania platformer with pinball mechanics.

A tip.. at one time you will unlock something where you swing. It's hard to aim so a trick: Hit esc/pause while still holding the swing button. if you're in a good position, let go of the button and resume, else keep holding it and try again.

If you want to 100% it, get a scarab map (easily found) and tick off those you have. It's easy to overlook them and the game only gives you map markers once just 10 are left. For any other collectible (besides one where there are just 5, so easy to look up at the end if you're missing one) you can unlock ingame maps

review: Oldukça tatlı ve yaratıcı bir oyun ^^ Hiç düşman ve şiddet olmadan da çok güzel oyunlar olabiliyormuş örnek olmuş oldu. Ori tarzında harita sistemi, harita içinde serbest gezebilmek ve yan görevler mevcut. Pinball'dan esinlenilmiş olması ayrıca hoşuma gitti ve yazılımcıların mekanik konusundaki hesaplamalarına hayran kaldım. Pinball'da bazen üst üste aynı hareket oluyor uzun süre. Burada onu kırmışlar. Üst üste birkaç kere aynı hareket olsa da sonrasında oyun tasarımıyla bu tekrar bir şekilde kırılıyor. Mekan, prop ve karakter tasarımları ayrıca güzel. Özellikle kaynana dili oyuncağı olması ve onun ses efekti harika ve tatlı olmuş. Genel olarak müzik ve tasarımla oyunun içine giriyorsunuz. Çerezlik, tatlı, keyifli vakit geçirmelik bir oyun ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198097879609', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1649727830}
review:
[h1]TLDR: 9/10 Pinball through a beautifully designed island with physics-based platforming, great music, and a decent story.[/h1]

[b]Actual Review (Censored Spoilers):[/b] After getting a game code from a bundle my friend bought, I went into this game completely blind hoping it was worth it since it looks like a 99¢ app store game. I was completely surprised at how much I actually loved it. I had no idea it would look, sound, play, EVERYTHING this amazing and I can't believe I have this much to say about it.

First off, this game is a pinballer. And not only that, it's a 2D, physics-based, METROIDVANIA pinballer. I've never played a pinball-based game before let alone a metroidvania pinball game (is that even an actual subgenere? Guess it is now.) but honestly It works way better than if this was a traditional platformer as it wouldn't have the same charm or unique level design.

Gameplay wise, It's pretty refined. Pinball in general seems to be a game all about reaction time and precise aim which oddly enough my FPS experience from other games translates over pretty well. I guess it's fair to call this somewhat of a puzzle game because in between the platforming/navigating sections theres big rounded rooms that look pretty much exactly like IRL pinball boards only more horizontal, where you'll do most quests and plot-related stuff like boss fights. Yeah, imagine having boss fights in your pinball game. Every one of them are really fun and easy to understand what to do as well.

Storywise, it's ok. The worldbuilding is top notch but the overall plot is pretty standard metroidvania stuff. [spoiler]It's the "go to various places and collect/summon item/character" progression line. The final boss fight and overall ending are kinda rushed and not to the same quality the rest of the game is at. They also put in a twist villain at the very end who had no prior clues or foreshadowing save for a single character from a side quest who vaguely warns you about it if you talk to them after finishing the quest. I actually finished that side quest after beating the story cause I didn't know how to finish it lol).[/spoiler]

Lastly I gotta talk about the OST. The music slaps so unnecessarily hard and it's amazing. The first few areas of the game really suckered me in with how out of the blue the quality of the music was. And it's not the music genres you'd expect out of the cutesy-looking art style and premise this game has. Definitely a criminally underrated OST.

So yeah, Definitely worth playing. There's just enough content to last a dozen hours or so and barely any of it feels like a slog to get through if you plan on getting 100% and all achievements. Give it a try, it's worth even more than full price. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197974684590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1649706623}
review:
How on earth could I not see this game earlier?

Its exactly the kind of newschool-metroidvania I like, plus I like good pinballs.
I dunno if you can die at all - I think I did not try hard enough. You don't need skills or tooooo much brain to finish this game. Its totally cute and relaxing. Just what I love.

What did not taste so well is the Extro. Beside you can't skip it, it shows very clearly that the biggest team of people involved in this game are neither the Designers nor the Programmers but the marketing experts. 
Unluckily you realize it even during the game since it has technical bugs causing the game to crash for the whole session until you restart your PC, when you swap to another app during play. Also sometimes the camera does not move to the right position and you can't see where you are going anymore.

Dear marketing Rock Stars: a game gets even better critics and sells more often if it runs stable and has no bugs. So mayyyyybe it would be a good idea to invest just 1 or 2 days of additional manpower to check and repair BEFORE you sell it?
Such hard bugs would be a reason for me to give a negative review... normally. But I honor the work of the rest of the team. So, today is your lucky day. ;)

I would not pay 20 bugs for the "Team17" in it (anymore), but I would pay 10 for the game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219239107', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1710446355}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063237740', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1649536315}
review:
A mashup between Ori, Getting Over It, and Pinball without ever feeling like it's trying to be anything but itself.  A bit rough around the edges, but packed full of charm that make for a really pleasant, casual experience.   

[h1]Value[/h1]
Paid the sale price of $3.99.  Around 5 hours to complete the main story and then another 5 finishing up collectables.  At the sale price, this is an absolute deal and 100% worth it.  The standard asking price of $20 is a bit too steep for my taste, and would wait for the sale (you should be doing this for all games).

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
[b]Visuals[/b]
This game achieves exactly what it's going for: "charming".  
Characters and scenery appear to be hand-drawn, giving a children's book feel to the entire game.   Each "zone" has its own unique feel, with connecting areas transitioning between zones perfectly.  

[b]Sound[/b]
The music in this game is on point, changing for each zone.  It's never cartoonish, and remains in the background allowing the rest of the game to shine through. 

[h1]Premise/Story[/h1]
Yoku's Island is absolute insanity, and I love it.  You're a dung-beetle - who works at a post office - and uses a party blower as a primary attack, delivering mail to various woodland critters and "Where the Wild Things Are" style monsters.  You must help save the island dwellers' Lovecraftian deity who is under attack by an unknown entity.  

As nuts as the above paragraph is, it never feels unnatural and Villa Gorilla should be applauded for not only thinking outside the box, but making a new box entirely.  

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
I went into this thinking that it was a pinballer with some platforming action, and was pleasantly proven wrong.  
This is quest-driven gameplay that comes through NPC dialog.  You will collect fruit to unlock environment objects and upgrades. There are collectables hidden throughout the world that may require certain abilities you haven't unlocked yet.   

Much of the game is played like a platformer, with pinball paddles being used to navigate the terrain.  Certain sections will zoom the camera out and allow for traditional pinball play.  Never got old to me.

[h1]Negatives/Frustrations[/h1]
[list]
[*] Certain pinball courses aren't at 100%.  [b]Most[/b] are, making the ones that suck stand out. I also found it weird that you can still control Yoku while inside a pinball section, so there are some where you are trying to platform around the paddles inside the course.  I would prefer these sections to provide a "break" from the standard gameplay and remove character control.

[*] Getting around takes longer than necessary. It's a big map. A lot of the map is stacked vertically, and it can be confusing when determining how exactly to get from point A to point B.  Sections that you'd think would be connected horizontally may actually require traversal vertically first.  I never really [i]learned[/i] the map.

[*] The minimap in this game is really neat.  It zooms out and provides a full view of the actual screen, rather than a different screen entirely.  But assets may not load properly, indicators may disappear/reappear seemingly at random, and you are locked at a certain zoom distance. Main quests have large indicators, along with certain collectables, but NPCs (which you need to find for unlocks) are hidden entirely.  This, mixed in with the point above, can be frustrating when going for 100%.

[*] Some collectables are hidden behind assets.  This is a big no-no to me.  Most are cleverly hidden but still visible, but some are literally hidden behind a bush that you can't see.  Feels like a guide is required, which I'm not a fan of doing. If getting around was a bit faster I'd be more inclined to look for them myself.  I only needed 5 more, but when you have no idea which 5 (out of 80) it can become a slog. 
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
If you're into casual platformers and are not a fan of the 1000s of pixel art style ones, this game is a perfect fit.  The sale price makes it a no brainer.  Good game.
