author: {'steamid': '76561198046013803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1672908241}
review:
Completed 100%, all achievements.
It was fun, which is tough to come by sometimes.

The slugs are frustrating when they explode without the time-slow effect. Otherwise, it can be annoying to miss your target over and over, as yoku often shoots off in specific angles that are *close* to what you want.

SPOILER FOR SOME PUZZLES: I found the slugs incredibly creative. It took me some time to realize the slugs don't truly send you off at random angle, though I feel silly to say I thought that the angle I was pointing my joy-stick would matter.
I also feel like I didn't notice the scarab goal until the end of the game. I thought they respawned when I restarted the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108658021', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1698709673}
review:
[h1][b]"Man, Ori And The Blind Forest is pretty dope but I really wish I was playing Sonic Spinball right now." [i]-Somebody[/i][/b][/h1]

This is basically Yoku's Island Express in a nutshell. It's not overly hard at all, and there's little to no penalty for failure at any point in the game, but it presents a casual kind of fun that lets you just turn your brain off and enjoy a calming, unique fusion of pinball and platforming. It's good for de-stressing. If you need a game like that in your library, then Yoku's Island Express is worth looking at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044600440', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1688677668}
review: Pretty great, could use some fine tuning and generally feels like you miss shots you should have got but that just be I'm bad at pin ball, if you guys ever wanted to i think this would make a great steam deck game

author: {'steamid': '76561198055288336', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1650032777}
review:
Hey Kinder wolltet ihr schon immer einmal Ori, aber als Pinballspiel spielen? Nein, dann kann ich euch auch nicht helfen.
Wenn die Idee sich für euch verrückt anhört, dann muss euch sagen, ja das Spiel ist spielbar und funktioniert, aber iregendiwe fetzen tut das Ganze nicht. Anders als Ori das durch seine dynamische Steuerung zum durch die Welt rennen einlädt, fühlt sich per Pinballmachine von Ort zu Ort zu kommen fast schon wie Schneckentempo an. Auch sich zu merken zu welcher Stelle jetzt welcher Weg im Flipper führt ist mühsig und man kommt nicht voran. Die Optik ist knuffig und passt zum Kinderspiel, denn anders als bei Ori würde ich behaupten, dass dieses Spiel Erwachsene eher wenig begeistert.

Vielleicht liegt es daran, das ich als Erwachsener dieses Spiel nicht wirklich schätzen kann, für mich ist Yokels lahmer Inselexpress in allem was es tut nur pures Mittelmaß.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015295368', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1649238735}
review: Es ist das beste was man mit dem Pinball-Konzept hinkriegt. Schönes Level- und NPC-Design, guter Soundtrack und echt süße Aufmachung. Leider ist die Core-Mechanik halt Pinball, was grenzwertig überhaupt als Spiel durchgeht. "Um die Wette würfeln" hält sicher mehr bei Laune und lässt sich besser kontrollieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974022186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1402, 'last_played': 1686067832}
review: Great fun and very enjoyable most of the time but some parts are just a bit too tricky for what is meant to be a relaxing game and making your way through the map can be slow and frustrating. If the devs listened to negative reviews and comments and tweaked those few things it would be an easy 10 / 10. But for me it's a 8.5 / 10. Highly recommended if you are prepared to take the time and practice the tricky moves, especially if you want to get 100 per cent and get all achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319585895', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1649594799}
review:
Pros:
+ Pinball-platformer in a Metroidvania setting with a great deal of interesting mechanics.
+ Cheerful and fun to play, with really satisfying physics.
+ Cute cartoonish animation featuring beautiful sceneries of a tropical island.
+ Islandish and exotic soundtrack which goes very well with the art. Some tunes during boss fights seem to be out of place, though.
+ Can customise your pinball in a dozen of appealing fashions.
+ Fruits are the currency in this game, and they are gratifying to collect.
+ Mostly casual to play. No death penalty or whatsoever.
+ Short and focused. The main plot lasts less than 10 hours and finishes before the gameplay gets old. After that, there are still a couple of side quests and collectibles.
+ No achievement is missable or requires a second playthrough.
+ Has with a fully functional map, which is essential for a Metroidvania.

Cons:
- The fast travel system is designed to be something similar to metro lines around the island with a central interchange, which is really cool and is a pleasure to travel with. However, you can get off at any station but only hop on at some stations, which adds travel time.
- Some collectibles are placed in hard-to-reach position. Getting them is really rage-inducing for the game being so casual elsewhere.
- Difficult to 100% the game without any guide.

Verdict:
Recommend. We could really use more cheerful games like Yoku's Island Express!

author: {'steamid': '76561198963810920', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1649089248}
review:
Alright game. It was fun for the first 2 or 3 hours but i just got bored after that and the gameplay started to get repetitive to me.
I really hated the Ice area and that is where i think i just started to not like the game that much. I really hated the swinging on flowers.
You swing too fast and you have no idea where you are going to land. Boss Fights where meh and not fun. More tedious then anything else.
The game was not for me i guess, i know people love this game but i just could not enjoy it. I just found it to be meh by the time i reached the credits
50/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198399079728', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1649048216}
review:
4時間ほどプレイ、とりあえずメインストーリーのみクリア。
やり込めばまだまだ楽しめるピンボール＋メトロイドヴァニア。

ゲームオーバーが存在しないので誰でも時間を掛ければクリアはできるだろうが、ピンボールということで割とシビアにタイミングを合わせないと先に進めない場面が多く、上手い下手でかなりプレイ時間は変わりそう。
マップは広大、グラフィックも音楽も良い、探索してエリアを広げていくメトロイドヴァニアとしての完成度もかなり高い、と圧倒的好評も頷ける完成度。とりあえずのクリアまで一気にやり切るくらいには面白かったです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971885160', 'num_games_owned': 1968, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1648787708}
review:
As others have said, this is a mashup of a metroidvania and pinball.  You are a cute little dung beetle and you can infer what the "pinball" you roll around actually is. :-)  It's really fun and has charming characters and locations.  

I've recently fallen in love with metroidvanias and I've never been a huge pinball player, but the game did give me some fond flashbacks to playing the pinball game that came with Windows 95.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979897308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1650854578}
review:
A very cute, brightly colored pinball-style adventure game. I haven't one of these in years, not since the Game Boy days. Has a typical zelda-esque adventure style it seems; big "open" 2D world, main mission to get 3 X's and complete pinball-related challenges along the way, side missions to unlock new gear along the way that opens new areas - you know, standard stuff, but done in a very fun and relatively unusual way.

I'd never heard of it before the Stand With Ukraine bundle, but I'm glad I did!

author: {'steamid': '76561198247009986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1648707736}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a cute game with quite an interesting makeup; Part metroidvania, part pinball. While parts of the game can be frustratingly challenging at times (especially for people like me who are honestly not so good at pinball), the tropical soundtrack does a phenomenal job of keeping the fun going. I am confident that this game would fit well into a challenge-based collection for all ages.

Story                 6.5/10
Value                 8.4/10
Music                 9.5/10
Challenge           9.6/10
Setting                7.0/10
Collectibles         7.3/10
Replayability       4.8/10
User Interface      6.8/10
Game Stability     9.8/10
Character Design 7.4/10

Overall Score       7.7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198992273428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1649462913}
review: This game is a mix of platformer and pinball. A very fun game to play on your own with a cute story, graphics are great and the 2D map is pretty big. This is the type of game where you start playing and hours go by without you even being aware of it. I highly recommend this game, it really is a lot of fun. I wish there were a lot more Yoku games in the Steam Store because I would definitely be buying them and playing them. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198097932599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1646043401}
review: Surprisingly fun combination of (lightweight) Metroidvania and pinball. I'm a sucker for Metroidvanias and I consider pinball to be meh, but the mix really worked for me. The game ticks the main Metroidvania boxes I was hoping for: mostly, it's really satisfying to navigate through the game world with increasing ease, and finding all collectibles is fun and accessible. At the same time, the game leaves out "deeper" systems like skill trees that I didn't end up missing at all. The pinball part works well, and mechanics like multiball are integrated into the missions in fun clever ways.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197982212049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1648384724}
review:
Putziges Metroidvania mit dem besonderen Kniff, dass man sich hauptsächlich mittels Pinball Paddles und Bumpern fortbewegt. Leider fühlen sich die teilweise etwas unpräzise an und so kann schon mal etwas Frust aufkommen, wenn man zwar weiß wo man hin muss, aber der kleine Mistkäfer einfach nicht den richtigen Weg einschlagen will und ständig in die gleiche, falsche Ecke donnert.
Zwischenzeitlich dachte ich ich könnte das Spiel deswegen aus Frust nicht beenden und würde es halbfertig in der Versenkung verschwinden lassen. Am Ende hat es mich dann aber doch immer wieder gepackt und nach ein paar Versuchen oder einen kleinen Pause hat der süße Yoku dann doch immer den Weg eingeschlagenen den ich für ihn vorgesehen hatte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974851112', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1652595357}
review:
The phrase used to introduce me to this game was "Pinballvania." What you are basically getting out of this game is your Metroid/Zelda/Castlevania-style "abilities as keys" gameplay, across a wide 2D map to explore, except that instead of fighting monsters and collecting weapons, you are getting around with a wide array of pinball flippers, and recruiting cute little animals to get new abilities.

If that hasn't already got you interested, I'm not sure what would.

review: Yoku's Island Express is a fun short little romp of a game with a cute art style and interesting gameplay.  It is a MetroidVania mixed with Pinball of all things.  This surprisingly works and is fun. There are some times where you cannot get the timing on the paddle to go up to a specific point and it does become frustrating but once I got used to it, it was a blast!  I recommend you pick this game up just for the interesting gameplay alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561199058467185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1668971868}
review: Yoku's Island Adventure puts a spin on the metroidvania-platformer formula by adding a pinball-like mechanic to its open-world. The main character can't jump, but can be boosted by the paddles around the world. This feature along with the standard upgrades makes it a unique and fun experience. Plus, its fast-travel system is my favorite of any video game. If you like pinball and/or metroidvanias this is a terrific game to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065182954', 'num_games_owned': 3667, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1704620948}
review:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3133781243
Мабуть, найкраща гра в категорії інді, в які я, мабуть, грав. З перших ноток геймплею, саундтреку та графіки, сильно відштовхує до Rayman Origins. Але пінбол і вільна карта відразу дають зрозуміти, що це натхнення авторів, не більше. Гра досить цікава, барвиста та у своєму стилі навіть складна. Благо, є такі фішки, як: телепорт, крутилка і плавання, що сильно розігріває інтерес до гри, особливо, якщо навіть не підозрюєш про такі фішки перед початком гри, як я свого часу. Не дивлячись на те, що пінбол, як жанр, мені особливо ніколи не подобався, але! завдяки тому, що тут все в одному – набагато цікавіше. Загалом нахвалювання зайві, рекомендую обов'язково до покупки та проходження! Не відкладайте на полицю "на потім" - швидше грати та кайфувати від цього світу!

10/10 без зайвих роздумів!
Для отримання всіх досягнень - використовуйте цей посібник, дуже допомогло! https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2173201692

СЛАВА УКРАЇНІ! ГЕРОЯМ СЛАВА! СЛАВА НАЦІЇ! СМЕРТЬ ВОРОГАМ! УКРАЇНА ПОНАД УСЕ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046484533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1690996312}
review:
All in all it's a good game. The concept is unique, a metroidvania pinball game, and the art is nice.

The audio is hot garbage though. Music is obnoxious, it's a weird style of DJ scratch and Island reggae or something, hard to pinpoint, but they like to include random laughs in the track that are... odd. The party popper (your main attack that you use to break stuff) grates against my ears each time it's used, which is often. Finally someone on the dev team or audio team or somewhere decided it would be brilliant to make the characters do those animalistic grumbles that are universally hated in every game they appear in (see Yuka Laylee for a prime example).

But if you ignore the audio it's a beautiful, fun, and unique experience I would recommend to anyone.

review: Me parece un juego increíble. La mecánica me parece muy original y entretenida. Como amante de los pimball y los juegos de plataformas, esto ha sido todo un descubrimiento. No es excesivamente complejo de jugar, aunque te propone algún reto bastante entretenido. Engancha desde el minuto cero. La estética es preciosa y los personajes entrañables. Me ha encantado ir por la isla descubriendo secretos y la forma de conseguir esas dichosas raíces imposibles de coger jaja. Creo que debería tener más reconocimiento, el juego es una maravilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047800991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1647818389}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000524957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1647805664}
review:
A combat-free metroidvania pinball game with nice art, good music, and a very charming overall vibe. It has all the modern affordances you'd expect from a metroidvania -- the map automatically marks every collectible/unlockable you've seen but not picked up and you can buy/find maps of all the thing you haven't found yet. A bit too much pinball for my liking, but that's a me problem rather than a problem with the game.

The one genuine problem with the game is that is has the absolute worst grappling mechanic, which is a combination of not having any air control at all (this is a pinball game, you have to aim your shots) and the Nintendo Switch being the lead platform (the Switch has binary triggers, while PC gamepads have analog triggers, and the screwy way the game implements analog triggers makes precision control impossible). For the particularly tricky grapple sequences I suggest switching to the keyboard for its binary control and remember that you can pause the game and restart from your last checkpoint in midair after you've flubbed a launch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198823680854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1647644619}
review:
Super fun game! Reminded me of the Ori series, story and environment-like, but with this original mix of platforming and pinball gameplay and a less dark, more funny and sunny mood. The game is entertaining without usually being hard: the challenge is literally that of a real pinball!
That is also, at times, the only and main downside: sometimes trial and error is required and the success of an action can feel not entirely up to you, but more to chanche; that is especially true when working with exploding snails. But it's a minor detail, go get this game without fear!

review: I had never would have thought that the idea of a pinball game made into a metroidvania could be so well executed. Pretty swell game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146841834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1647971331}
review:
Après trois heures de jeu voici un court avis personnel sur Yoku's Island Express : c'est génial, foncez ! 
Les graphismes sont superbes, la bande sonore excellente, le gameplay est chouette et mixe flipper-plateforme-metroidvania. C'est super mignon, frais, léger, agréable.
De petits bugs sont à signaler mais rien de bien méchant, le travail réalisé sur ce jeu est magnifique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198443412995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1647517951}
review:
Yoku's Island Express é um filhote de "ori & the blind forest" com uma máquina de pinball.

quando eu via esse jogo recomendado nas listas de metroidvania eu não dava nada por ele. nossa, como eu tava errado!

jogo ganha pela simplicidade, com visual muito agradável e boa trilha sonora. 
tem uma mecânica de pinball que anula coisas clássicas de metroidvanias, como pulo duplo e dash, mas que torna o jogo interessante e muito divertido.
é pouco exigente em termos de habilidade, perfeito pra colecionar todas as coisas durante ou no pós jogo 
 sem muita frustração pra liberar o final alternativo

recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970846787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1647233164}
review:
Not a very difficult game, but the spin on platforming, metroidvania, and pinball mechanics make for an interesting game.

Pros:
- Nice soundtrack
- Light-hearted storyline, albeit nonsensical.
- Good controls. No input lag or other issues with the controls.  Use a controller if possible to utilize the triggers for the paddles.

Cons
- Not a fan of the horn sound effect when you press A... and you press it alot.
- It would be nice if the game pointed out what the scarabs are early on in the game. I ended up backtracking a lot after finishing everything else in order to clear these, as I had just assumed they granted fruit. Thankfully if you are going achievement hunting in this game, they do highlight the scarabs on your map once there are only 10 remaining (but it really should be an item you can find or turn on after the main story).

author: {'steamid': '76561198810794524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1646477787}
review:
Jogo divertido, com bons gráficos, simples mas, para mim, não essencial. Achei em parte confuso encontrar certos trilhos para os objetivos mas compensava a minha falta de orientação pelos desafios encontrados. Bom jogo, recomendado e divertido. A história, apesar de simples, é satisfatória e fácil de acompanhar. O que achei mais original foi a sua jogabilidade que mistura plataformas com os famosos flippers, o que lhe dá um toque único. Vale a pena experienciar esta aventura de Yoku.

Na minha opinião 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358098222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1655013646}
review:
I was very excited about this game at the beginning, but as progression came, my initial enthusiam kinda dropped down... Don't take me wrong! It's a good game, easily recommendable, but having to put a lot of effort to climb the hill, just to reach there and need to go back down to collect something and then do the climb up all again, time after time, it got into me and not in a good way...

But the idea of the concept of combining pinball with metroidvania and having a light story it's pretty cool.

I also suffered a lot with motion sickness though, through the play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027948825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1646143952}
review:
This game really surprised me.
It was on my wish list for ages.
And yet I knew nothing about it.
A pinball/platform/metrodivania game with it own style.
Never crossed my mind.
There is a lot of things to do in this game.
And it's really fun.
Eventually you will get stuck in some flower part... but I know you can do it.
If you like those styles and wish to see with an amazing artwork and music together this game is for you.
Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994707247', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1645593776}
review: Delightfully charming game built on the unique premise of a pinball metroidvania. Does a good job of respecting players time by making nearly every collectable visible on the map if you collect the requisite map upgrades. World essentially consists of open world traversal and closed system pinball game. On the overworld the visuals are charming and the map gives that satisfying sense of completion as you unlock shortcuts. The world building is also somewhat interesting all considering. The traversal itself however is rather dull, mostly consisting of moving left or right or occasional bumpers for vertical movement. The pinball sections themselves are entertaining, though as someone who isn't too fond of pinball it ends up tiring towards the end. Some mechanics including but not limited to the pinball require too much precision at certain times. Otherwise its a pretty neat game...C+/B-

author: {'steamid': '76561198046595924', 'num_games_owned': 4787, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1644511995}
review:
My Video Review is available here:
https://youtu.be/2gkFQb7v-Gc

Have I enjoyed playing Yoku's Island Express? The answer is positive. At least most of the time. I really like the positive relaxed atmosphere of the game, sense of humor, many original refreshing ideas, variability of the environment, user friendly controls, beautiful graphics, relaxing music and sounds. What I do not like so much are confusing game map which causes tiresome wandering sometimes and creeping stereotype that come sooner or later despite all original ideas in the game due to the simple game mechanics. Maybe some RPG elements would make it more motivating yet. And of course the local co-op would suit the game as well. Relaxed atmosphere makes the game suitable for family playing but as many puzzles are not so trivial and you need to read to know what to do I would only recommend it for school aged kids. 

Pros:
- relaxing atmosphere
- sense of humor
- refreshing ideas
- environment
- controls
- audiovisuals

Cons:
- confusing map
- creeping stereotype
- absence of dubbing

Yoku’s Island Express is definitely not a flawless game but as it has many features making it suitable for playing by fellow Gaming Fathers and their families I am giving it Thumbs Up and VideoGaming Father’s Index 7+ out of 10 - recommended with some discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005956944', 'num_games_owned': 2878, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1644805287}
review:
Daha fazla inceleme için [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/41912299-Ali-Uygur-Sel%25C3%25A7uk/] Steam Küratör Sayfama bakabilirsiniz. [/url]

[h1] Pinball ve Metroidvania Mekaniklerini Birleştiren Oyun [/h1]
40 yıl düşünsem bir oyunda Metroidvania ve Pinball mekaniklerini birleştirerek ortaya çok başarılı bir Puzzle-Platform oyunu çıkacağını düşünmezdim. Birbiriyle çok alakasız diyebileceğimiz bu 2 oyun türünü harika harmanlıyor Yoku's Island Express'te ve ortaya çok yaratıcı, yepyeni bir oynanış mekaniği koyan bir puzzle-platform oyunu çıkıyor. Oyun haritası tamamen bu pinball mekaniği düşünülerek yaratılmış. Bir zıplama tuşu olmayan karakterimizi ileri geri götürerek hareket ettiriyor ancak haritada onlarcası bulunan pinball çubukları ile dikey hareket kazandırıyoruz. Pinball mekanikleri sadece harekete değil oyunun hemen hemen her anına yedirilmiş. Boss savaşlarından tutun, yan görevlere bazen kendimizi bir Pinball aletinin içinde buluyoruz ve ilerlemek için bazen küçük bulmacaları çözüyor bazense edindiğimiz başka özellikleri kullanıyoruz. Oyun bir Metroidvania oyunu olduğu için bize çok sayıda farklı özellik kazandırarak oyunun her aşamasında daha önce açamadığımız bölgelere gitmemizi, yeni gizemler çözmemizi istiyor.

[h1] Hikaye [/h1]
Yoku adı verilen sevimli yaratık ile gittiğimiz adada "posta görevlisi" olarak işe başlıyoruz. Amacımız adanın farklı sakinlerinin hem iletişimini sağlamak hem de adanın koruyucusuna musallat olmuş kötü canavarı alt etmek. Oyun basit, yer yer mizahi bir hikaye sunuyor bize. Çok sayıda farklı karakter, renkli bölümler ile hikaye olarak basit ama bazen platform bazense bulmaca olarak zor engelleri aşmaya, adanın dört bir yanına postaları bırakmaya ve görevlerimizi tamamlamaya çalışıyoruz.

[h1] Ori and Blind Forest Esintisi [/h1]
Oyunun hem görselliğinde, hem harita yapısında hem de görevlerinde açık bir Ori and Blind Forest esintisi var. Bu oyunu oynayanlar (ki oynamadıysanız muhakkak oynayın) Yoku oyununun da temel yapısını, atmosferini, insanı rahatlatan yapısını çok seveceklerdir. Tabi karşımızda Ori kadar duygusal bir hikaye ya da o oyunda olduğu gibi şahane müzikler yok. Daha açık tonlarda, daha mizahi, basit bir oyun var karşımızda ancak yukarıda bahsettiğim oynanış mekanikleri ile diğer pek çok Metroidvania-Platform oyunundan ayrılıyor Yoku.

Puzzle-Platform oyunlarını seviyorsanız bu oyunu kaçırmamalısınız. normal zamanlarda 30 liraya yakın bir fiyatı indirim dönemi 6 lira civarına düşüyor, 6-7 saat normal tamamlama süresi, %100 başarım elde etmek içinse yaklaşık 12-13 saatlik bir oynanış gerektiriyor.

[b] Artılar [/b]
+ Pinball ve Metroidvania öğelerini harmanlayan yaratıcı oynanış
+ Renkli oyun dünyası ve karakterler.
+ Basit ama bu tarz bir oyuna 'cuk' oturan mizahi hikaye anlatısı.
+ Rahat ve dinlendirici.

[b] Eksiler [/b]
- Oyun elinizden tutmuyor. Bazı olayları çözmek için ciddi kafa yormak ya da sağdan soldan bakmak gerekiyor.
- Müzikler çok basit.

[b] Puan [/b]: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198994656196', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1644644426}
review:
简言之，这个游戏就是

[b]三维弹球的玩法+银河战士的地图[/b]

没了。感觉挺有意思。
总体来说没啥问题，剧情中规中矩且符合画风，几个新机制的加入也与主玩法比较协调，
唯一的问题可能就是结尾太平淡了？

原价感觉可能略高了，但14块钱入手是绝对值的。
 [spoiler]另：这个游戏没有跳跃键，空格是背包，地图是TAB，挡板是左右SHIFT,再加上左右移动键（可以用ad）和回车键，就这么多 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198209143072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1627936176}
review:
An absolutely amazing game! 

It is the perfect combination between classic pinball and a Metroidvainia. It is such an innovative creation with very smooth gameplay. The story, art, and characters are also incredibly cute and interesting.

I honestly have nothing bad to say about this game, definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141955322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1644347433}
review:
自分にとってはピンボールはSATUBATUゲームセンターの片隅で意味不明に無限にエクステンドボールさせて遊ぶ虚無のひまつぶしだったのでこのふわふわキラキラファンタジーはあまり受け入れられなかった。
とはいえ丁寧に作ってあると思う。
簡単に言えば、脱出系アクションゲーとピンボールギミックをつないだもの。
それなりに面白いけど何があっても死なない詰まない様子にだんだんむずがゆくなってくる

棘に落ちたら一撃でしぬんだよおれたちゲーマーは！！
ああ、余裕でつなげられるはずの玉を磁石で無理やりフリッパーの隙間に誘導されてゲームオーバーになるあのくされピンボールたちがなつかしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001559751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1644795279}
review: Fantastic game so far. A great combination of platformer and pinball, so if you like either of these, you'll be hooked. Would highly recommend trying this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198991391176', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1643923283}
review:
This is a gem, don't miss it.

It's strange to have played a Metroidvania pinball game but that's what this is, and it's unique for it. I doubt this would have survived a kickstart as it's a bit too weird for a platformer and not pinbally enough for a sim, but sometimes you don't know you what you want until you have it.

It plays like a platformer without a jump button. Flippers in the environment get you moving about from zone to zone. The levels are broken up into designated pinball table-like areas and connecting pathways. There are some familiar pinball challenges such as bumper targets and rail tricks that add to completion. On the MV side of things, progress is gated by abilities as expected, all of which are pinball themed, and completion challenges will have you far enough out of your comfort zone to cause a few head scratches.

There are a couple of irritations which I'd like to see a potential sequel address - some areas don't need to be returned to such as many of the tables, and I'd like to be able to lock/unlocked them - mainly because navigating can be a little confusing and a wrong turn will lead you back into a pinball table area, which can take a while to get back out of. Also, because of the MV nature, there's a lot of backtracking, which is normally ok for the genre, but it hurts this game as knowing where to go is much easier than getting there when you are flinging yourself off of flippers - getting from one side of a room to another can take 4 or 5 attempts and a lot of swearing, and once you're there, you've forgotten where you were going next. The map could do with a further zoom level as well.

In all though, this is a grand old time. The theming is fine, it's bugs doing bug stuff on a little island. There are many fun variations on mechanics, a variety of collectables and rewards, it runs at 60fps and look good.
Basically it's good, so get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970944083', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1593346300}
review:
Flipper mit eine ordentlichen Brise Metroidvania und der enthusiastischste Postkäfer den man sich vorstellen kann. Der Typ ist dermaßen stark motiviert die Post zu verteilen... Das ist einfach nicht mehr feierlich.

Sehr clever zusammengestöpselte Welt. Fröhlich anzuschauen und gewaltfrei. Abgesehen davon, das der Käfer an der Kugel hängt und somit regelmäßig durch die Gegend gekickt wird. Aber auch das findet er großartig. Durch nichts zu erschüttern dieser kleine Liebling... Fantastisch!

Quasi ein Flipperspiel für Harte und Weiche. Dieser süße Käfer kriegt euch alle knuffig.

Fazit: Motivierend krabbelig!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165823754', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1572796247}
review:
[h1]Metroidvania oraz Pinball[/h1]
- To absurdalne połączenie jest jednym z najlepszych jakie mogło kiedykolwiek powstać. Poruszamy się [b]uroczym robaczkiem[/b] z przyczepioną kulką. Poza toczeniem się, jedynym sposobem aby móc się poruczać to używanie [u]flipperów[/u] rozrzuconych po całym świecie.

Zwiedzamy [u]wielki i otwarty świat[/u], zdobywamy nowe umiejętności, wykonujemy zadania i idziemy coraz dalej. Gra jest pełna [u]sekretów, znajdziek i easter egg’ów[/u]. Możemy nawet odblokować kolorki dla naszej kulki, z którymi wiąże się parę tajemnic. Mamy również dostępne [u]wiele achievementów[/u] do odblokowania.

A to wszystko wrzucone w [b]PRZEPIĘKNĄ oprawę audiowizualną[/b].

Gra jest bardzo łatwa i przeznaczona dla wszystkich.

Czasami pojawią się nieliczne bugi i inne błędy, nie wpływa to natomiast w żaden sposób na odbiór gry. 
Jednak największym minusem gry jest to, że jest ona [u]bardzo krótka[/u]. To zabawa na 6-8 godzin, a jeśli ktoś chce ją ukończyć na 100% to zajmie mu to około 10-12 godzin. Warto jednak kupić ją w promocji i cieszyć się nawet przez te kilka godzin.

[hr][/hr]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027480683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1642487620}
review:
It's generally good for a relatively chill and not very long metroidvania with a pinball overlay.
Some parts are finicky, the sootling leash most notably (use the inventory pause to make your life easy), and at least 1 achievement is just silly and I refuse to do it.

Not amazing, but a decent game for the asking price, and unlike pretty much anything else you'll play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028021725', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1642109584}
review: Short and sweet pinball collectathon. Doesn't overstay its welcome. Cute characters and customization options. Excellent music, seriously it's so good. Getting 100% takes 10-12 hours probably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143205230', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1641997265}
review:
通关打卡！没有全收集强迫症的话不到10小时就可以搞定。
核心玩法 = 三维弹球 + 类银河战士恶魔城。
操作用到的按键不多，通篇也没有战斗（几处boss战更像是解谜），但大道至简，游戏内容丰富，难度曲线合理，关卡设计和地图设计的质量都太高了。
不要被画风骗了，点开之前以为是个少儿益智游戏，运行后才发现是精品。这波是老少皆宜，全年龄段通杀。

另：
这居然是这个开发组的处女作，可怕。
看了下开发者名单，整个项目里居然只有一个关卡策划，可怕。

author: {'steamid': '76561199220353797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1641754341}
review:
Gra została mi polecona przypadkiem, ale po obejrzeniu kilku materiałów dostępnych w Sklepie (i zorientowaniu się, że akurat jest na przecenie) byłam wystarczająco zainteresowana, więc stwierdziłam, że dam jej szansę. Nie jestem w stanie wyrazić słowami jak bardzo się z tego cieszę. Pochłonęła mnie całkowicie i przy okazji trochę rozregulowała zegar biologiczny, ale to nie szkodzi. Nie żałuję ani jednej sekundy spędzonej w świecie Yoku, ponieważ z każdą chwilą (i odkrywaniem coraz to większej części mapy) słyszałam w głowie "Dobra, lecimy dalej!" i to była świetna motywacja. 
Soundtrack bardzo szybko i mocno na mnie zadziałał. Już po 2 godzinach rozgrywki wiedziałam, jaka muzyka zacznie lecieć, gdy pojawię się w konkretnym miejscu. Czasem po prostu przypadkiem gdzieś przechodziłam, żeby tylko posłuchać jakiejś nuty. Sam główny bohater jest przeuroczy. Nie chcę tu zbytnio słodzić, ale naprawdę mocno urzekają mnie gry, w których grafika pięknie kreuje postacie (lub nawet ich cechy charakteru), a tutaj ciężko tego nie docenić. Były chwile, w których po prostu zatrzymywałam się, by móc podziwiać mimikę danej postaci lub ponownie odtworzyć dialog i wyłapać wszystkie zabiegi dźwiękowe, które zostały użyte przy tworzeniu jej głosu. 
Jeśli masz kilka godzin czasu i ochotę na dobrą przygodę, daj szansę Yoku!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080045733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1641923167}

author: {'steamid': '76561198102939917', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1641729853}
review: 7小时通关。画面清新，怪物都很萌很可爱，但是分辨率有点低，很多东西看不清楚。银河城和三维弹球结合的作品，弹球部分看似创意十足，但实际打起来操作精度要求很高，多次试错才能打准，包括爆炸蛞蝓和转转花，经常在一个地方卡半天打不准导致血压飙升，而且这种挫败感贯穿游戏始终。前期略无聊，后期能够潜水后顿时好玩了起来，但经常打不准，再加上通关后一脸茫然逛了1个小时地图结果啥也没收集到，放弃全成就。

author: {'steamid': '76561198976892081', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1641714167}
review:
A Pinball Metroidvania starring gaming's second most lovable dung beetle.
 The weird genre combination works way better than it has any right to and one doesn't need to be a pinball wizard to enjoy it, I'm not great at pinball and managed to enjoy and 100% it. It's certainly a unique game as a result if nothing else. 
  It's a very pretty game too, with a vibrant color palette. The music is more focused on setting the tone than being memorable not that that's a bad thing, that's usually par for the course with metroidvanias, and the tracks that do stick out absolutely slap, a great soundtrack overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009261292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1653676829}
review:
This game is just delightful. I don't know how else to describe it. This is an incredibly refreshing take on the metroidvania genre and I think the difficulty is just about perfect. Good music. Good writing. Satisfying gameplay.

Really solid overall. I fully intend to 100% this game and I will enjoy doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030213356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1641442531}
review:
メトロイドヴァニア系とピンボールを合わせたゲームです。
説明だけでは伝わりにくいのですが、ピンボール要素がアクションパートを占めているので斬新ではありました。
ただ長くプレイしていくうちに"Getting Over It"の苦しさが出てきます。
全ての実績を獲得するためにはかなりマゾいことをしないといけません。
ゲームそのものは難しいわけではなく、ストーリーも子供向けにしては楽しめました。

ときどき無性にピンボールを遊びたいって気持ちがわくならこのゲームはおすすめです。
メトロイドヴァニア要素もしっかりあるので値段以上に楽しめるゲームですよ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198080339618', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1702225459}
review:
Connaissez-vous le genre Metroidvania ? Vous savez, ces jeux de plate-forme généralement 2D et non linéaires, où la progression se base sur l'exploration et la découverte d'améliorations permettant de progresser plus loin dans des zones déjà visitées au préalable ?

Saviez-vous que ce genre pouvait fusionner avec le genre flipper/pinball ? Hé bien, moi aussi, je l'ignorais, jusqu'à ce que je découvre ce Yoku's Island Express. Et, sans pour autant avoir pris une grosse claque, j'ai été très agréablement surpris par ce jeu. Une ambiance toute mignonne, une OST clairement sous cotée, mais surtout, un level-design qui fait que la recette fonctionne à merveille !

Petits bonus : un scénario qui, sans être transcendant, a le mérite d'être là et de se renouveler et quelques secrets éparpillés ici et là pour rallonger un peu la durée de vie. Vous en aurez pour une bonne dizaine d'heures pour tout trouver, et franchement, je l'ai pas vue passer. Si vous cherchiez un jeu qui propose quelque chose d'original, foncez tête baissée !

author: {'steamid': '76561198364093863', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1641027009}

review: One of the most innovative MetroidVanias I've ever played. Unique, whimsical and never boring or tedious. I liked the music and the art style just as much as the gameplay. The pacing was good and you never felt forced to a single path. The inclusion of the pinball style gameplay was put together very well and the physics felt on point. I'm looking forward to any sequels.

author: {'steamid': '76561199134903682', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1640147917}
review:
[h1]絵本のような世界感で気軽に楽しめるピンボールアドベンチャー[/h1]

[b]良いところ[/b]
・世界観やキャラクターが絵本のようにかわいらしく癒される
・ピンボールパートは割と本格的で楽しい
・悪く言えば「ボリュームは少ない」が、よく言えば「手軽に楽しめる(実績コンプも楽)」
　個人的には後者のようにポジティブな印象を感じた。

[b]悪いところ[/b]
・長距離の移動が面倒くさい
　ビーライン(ファストトラベル的なやつ)をもっと手軽に使えたらなと思った。
・一部ギミックを使いこなすのに慣れが必要
　振り子ジャンプのタイミング
　ナメクジを爆発させる角度 など
・主人公のアップグレードの入手時期が遅いものが多い
　果物(=お金)が必要ないくらいやり込んだタイミングで「果物の取得量2倍」
　水中の探索がほぼ完了してるタイミングで「水中で泳ぐ速度アップ」 など

[hr][/hr]
濃厚な対人ゲームやAAAタイトルにちょっと疲れたという人におすすめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561197988273699', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1640116789}
review:
I got this game for something like $5. Didn't expect much as it barely even registered that I purchased it, and so it sat in my library for months. 

This game should not be $5. While it's not a masterpiece, it's astoundingly well done, highly polished, and unique. The devs really hit on something with the pinball-oriented traversal mechanics. They knew exactly how long to make the game so it didn't get stale, and collectibles and tasks were placed perfectly so that I only had to spend maybe 30 minutes after beating the final "boss" finishing up my 100%. 

I love the island aesthetic, the music, and the world design. This game may not be my GOTY, but you're doing yourself a disservice if you don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099829033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1640018141}
review: 第一个达成100%完成度的游戏，真的太有意思了，感谢制作组。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001571219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1639964693}
review:
An excellent game.
Explore a colourful island full of beautiful characters, interesting challenges, and great game mechanics. The pinball tables are neatly interwoven with an exploration aspect, and a fun story. Fulfilling the requirements for all the achievements is challenging, but not overbearing. The music and graphics are fabulous.
Most of the powerups are forgettable, and some backtracking paths are a bit long, but considering how well the game plays these are neglectable worries.

author: {'steamid': '76561199123093816', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1682404601}

i personally love metroidvanias and pinball, so when i saw this game on the eshop, I gladly bought it and 100% completed it, then a couple month later i see it on steam and decided to buy it again and have been enjoying my time, just as much as my first playthrough. It's just a fun little game to zoom around in and be the best mail bug every seen.
The ribbon eel at the star of the game is F@$%ing terrifying though... (and the reason i had to google if the game was a psychological horror...)
overall a chill game to play   :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054936039', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1639333440}
review:
Análise feita depois de terminar o jogo, sem completar os 100% (foi completado com 61%), agora em 2021

O jogo tem uma premissa simples de pinball já utilizada em vários outros jogos, como Sonic, Devil`s crush e Metroid, com o twist de exploração de um jogo metroidvania. Isso dá ao jogo uma maior capacidade de gameplay, já que a fórmula de pinball pura para videogames é bem limitada e não permite muitas variações. No jogo há alguns pontos de plataforma também, porém bem escassos e que merecem destaque por serem apenas pinceladas e não algo muito explorado.

Yoku tem uma duração de jogo curta podendo ser facilmente completado em uma jogatina entre 2 e 4 horas a depender de seu desenvolvimento do jogo, porém conta com a possibilidade correr atrás de vários itens que ficam espalhados pelo mapa para completar 100%, o que eleva a quantidade de horas do jogo bastante, algumas dessas quests com toda certeza exigirão precisão e paciência para serem completadas, porém não são incrivelmente cripticas já que a maioria dos pontos é bem localizado no mapa.

Sobre o mapa esse foi o ponto mais interessante do jogo, quem já jogou bastante metroidvanias sabe o backtracking, o ato de ir e voltar ao longo do jogo, fica tedioso e as vezes trava o desenvolvimento da história e narrativa, em Yoku isso é algo que resolveram com um mapa que pode ser acessado a qualquer momento além de lunetas que dão uma visão completa da área que vc se encontra, para quem não possui mais a paciência de ficar explorando, se perder, ficar confuso e não saber pra onde ir, Yoku é pra vc.

As mecânicas do jogo como já ditas são simples e intuitivas, ao longo do jogo vc acaba ganhando alguns poderes extras que ajudam a solucionar alguns dos quebra cabeças e tem acesso a novas áreas, porém são poucos, até pela duranção do jogo, maior parte do ponto ao explorar uma "caverna" vc simplesmente ficar controlando bumpers e resolvendo problemas de liberar passagens e destruir blocos. É limitado mas funcional e não fica cansativo.

A história do jogo está presente, não é algo complexo e com reviravoltas mirabolantes, mas funciona para o jogo, não é um jogo que vai te causar uma grande impressão nesse departamento.

Onde o jogo brilha é na direção de arte em geral. Música, os gráficos e ambientação são de um nível absurdo e cheios de personalidade, mesmo a história não sendo empolgante, a personalidade e trabalho colocado em cada personagem visualmente marcam bastante e esse sim é um ponto que você vai lembrar e ter marcado por um longo tempo. Nunca imaginaria que um besouro rola bosta seria tão divertido de se controlar e explorar um mundo que é extremamente bem desenhado e criado. 

Com tudo isso dito, para fãs do gênero de metroidvania Yoku é um sopro de ar novo e que deve ser jogado, sendo obrigatório para qualquer fã do gênero. Para os fãs da esola de jogos indie dos últimos 10 anos, temos aqui mais um jogo que é fruto desta e deve ser jogado também.

Pode não ser o melhor jogo, mas durante as horas que estiver junto dele não tem como não se divertir e ficar feliz com a resolução dos problemas, ao som de uma trilha sonora impecável e com artes de cair o queixo. Jogão!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038213368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1638928066}
review:
Pinballvania!

Very unique and creative metroidvania style game. If you're into the genre then you'll feel right at home with this one.

I have no idea how the creators came up with this concept nor why it works so well. The only thing I can think of is that they were playing Sonic Spinball on Genesis and decided to expand on idea. It's actually fairly similar to that game.

Gameplay wise, it doesn't function like any other metroidvania out there. There is no jumping, no attacks, no skill tree, no real enemies and no dying. You can freely move around by pushing your little pinball around and all "platforming" is done by means of pinball flippers. If you aren't good at pinball games this might be a good way to start. There aren't any consequences for falling between the flippers other than losing a little bit of the very abundant currency or falling down to a lower part of the pinball table. This being said, if you don't like pinball or are not good at it you may also find this to be an annoying game because it is loaded with pinball platforming.

Level design is actually done very well. There are many areas to explore and the common roster of locations are seen here (Grassy plains, snowy mountains, deserts, caves etc.) Each area has a few pinball tables in it to complete tasks which make up the missions of the game. These pinball tables are pretty standard but fun nonetheless. They aren't too complicated and you can usually make out what needs to be done after a quick glance. After a while, however, the tables being to kind of blend together. While the tables themselves have different layouts the goals are always the same. Flip yourself around the table to break open new paths, smash crystals to collect keystones for new paths, fly past spin things to open new paths. While there isn't much variety in the tables themselves it never gets boring since each table is fairly quick to complete.

Another big part of metroidvanias is upgrading. This game doesn't offer a merchant or an armorer to upgrade your arsenal like you'd expect. Any upgrade you get is normally found by completing quests in the game. There are a few new abilities you can get but for the most part you'll just be slapping yourself around on  the tables from the beginning until the end. There is a currency in the game but it isn't used to purchase much. There are some guys peppered about the map that you can buy some items from like maps of where to find collectables but other than that, it's mainly used to unlock new flippers used to access new areas. 

Secrets, all metroidvanias have secrets and so does this game. They aren't the most cryptic or even clever secrets you've seen but they're still fun to find and collect. Most secrets hold a chest which can hold anything from a wallet (increases your currency capacity) to a new skin for your little pinball you lug around. Unlike most metroidvanias, you can get through the entire game without collecting a single one. Whereas most games, finding secrets can help you upgrade your arsenal or give you more maximum health and stuff like that, this game is absent of all that. This brings us to the next section....

Difficulty. This game is really easy. Like I said before there is no death. You can't even get hurt. It's strictly pinball with no penalty. The worst that can happen to you is you fall from a great height and have to climb back up to where you were Getting Over It style. It's fine though. Not all games have to be challenging and it's actually kind of cool to play a casual metroidvania when most of them base their whole identity on the difficulty. 

The game is also very short. If you just advance through the main story you can beat this game in a couple hours or maybe less depending on your traversing and pinballing skills. I'd imagine a speedrun of this game could be done in like 20 mins. 

Music and artistic design is also very well done. The art has a hand drawn look to it and everything is pleasant and colorful to look at. The music is kind of neat. The tracks themselves are well written and range from tropical island music to this sort of house music trip hop sound. My favorite thing about the music is that it's all played by one band. Each song has the same instruments in it and sounds like an album recorded during a session. It's not something I've really heard in a game before. Usually each track will be an individual with each instrument made to suit the scenario. I thought it was neat.

Anyway, cool game. Check it out if you like the genre, pinballing or want to try something new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840023671', 'num_games_owned': 7153, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1640162957}
review:
A Metroidvania-pinball hybrid isn't a thing I ever expected to exist, but Yoku’s Island Express feels like a breath of fresh air in a genre that’s felt crowded as of late. It’s fun, adorable, and wonderfully unique while still satisfying the things I love about 2D platformers. Even if its pinball paths occasionally got frustrating to navigate, I enjoyed every minute I spent with its charming, secret-filled campaign.

Yoku’s Island Express creatively fuses a traditional Metroidvania game with pinball mechanics in a way that feels surprisingly natural. You take control of a tiny beetle postmaster named Yoku, pushing around a ball and making deliveries on a large open-world island. There’s a fairly straightforward but cute story to follow, alongside a hefty amount of side quests, hidden collectibles, and other distractions.
I really enjoyed these contained challenges, and they are used in clever ways. Many have doors you need to unlock by collecting purple gems on the table before you can progress further — so instead of just being about getting points, you’re trying to make specific shots to free the gems from crystals or spinners. Other tables can take the shape of epic and difficult multi-ball boss battles, which are some of the coolest challenges available.

Before I unlocked the adorable Beeline fast-travel system, I did find myself having to retreading the island’s core paths to and from the hub town fair bit. Replaying the same tables each time I wanted to go through an area got a bit repetitive because navigating a table isn’t as simple as hopping through a completed area in a traditional platformer. Instead, it requires a series of shots with tight timing to proceed, so barely missing multiple times in a row hurts the flow of moving through the world and could be frustrating when I returned to areas looking for secrets.
But it’s hard to stop smiling when playing a game this peppy, and personality is overflowing out of every corner of Yoku’s Island Express. There’s no combat outside of a few bosses, and the tool you get to break open certain objects is a party-blower noise maker that you can make Yoku adorably spam as you run around. The cutesy Animal Crossing-style voices, cheery music, and lovely painted art style (which has some of the cooler background parallaxing I’ve seen in a 2D game) make being in this world a joy, and that helps temper the frustration.

The island’s quirky inhabitants are also amusing to meet, and often send you on side-missions as elaborate as the main story — it wasn’t uncommon for me to have four or five different things I could be doing at any given time. One townsperson wanted me to spread mushroom spores around the island, while another asked me to bring back baubles that I could use to customize the look of my ball.
While the campaign smartly doesn’t overstay its welcome — it took me about six hours to complete, including some distractions — collecting all 80 of Yoku’s hidden Wickerlings, finding all of its chests, and completing some other simple missions like delivering letters made me want to keep playing even after the credits rolled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067351021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1638253004}
review:
This is a really good game, it just isn't for me.

I was having a lot of fun with the game until I wasn't. I think most of us have played a game where we experience that weird, sudden halt of enjoyment -- the first time I got stuck in a particular part of the map, unable to angle the ball /just so/ in order to get free of a puzzle room, that was the start of the end for me. I kept going, I beat the game, but there were just too many of those moments. The pinball mechanic to this game is absolutely fascinating and I think it's incredibly cool...but I guess I just suck at pinball a little too much to enjoy it. 

I'd recommend that anyone who is on the fence definitely give the demo a try. I did have fun, but I probably won't come back to the game a second time -- and that's on me, not on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116738523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1638251799}
review:
There's a good reason people light up whenever this game is mentioned. It is an incredibly fun and addicting pinball-styled metroid-vania with lots of love and care put into it. Amazing visuals and music paired with fresh mechanics and fun puzzles, this game really has it all.

My only issue with it is the traveling from one side of the map to the other in search of collectibles and Scarabs, which are both tiresome and oddly complicated for an otherwise fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076812244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1638181175}
review:
This is a pinball Metroidvania.  If that sounds like the sort of game you'd like to play, then you will not be disappointed.

It is gorgeous and atmospheric.  That atmosphere is bright and inexplicably charming.  You play a dung beetle out to rescue Cthulhu, and yet the game just makes that part of its charm.

It does require precision timing, but is nevertheless forgiving.  (It keeps a death counter, but you get infinite retries at the pinball puzzles and losing a ball doesn't cost you any progress.)  There are plenty of optional objectives for the completionist but I 100%ed the game within 12 hours.  If you'd rather have a longer game for your money, pick it up on sale; it's old enough now that it occasionally gets very deeply discounted.  For what it is, though, it is a unique experience which doesn't overstay its welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140926356', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1638478733}
review: This game has two things going for it. The first is that it's cute. This is obvious from the trailers and screenshots. The other is that it's brain dead. I don't mean that as a criticism, in fact this combo makes it the perfect game to play when you're feeling depressed. And I know that some day, maybe tomorrow, maybe in 30 years I'm going to need this. And I think there should be more games like this one. I've no problem with the cupheads and meatboys of the world. In fact the latter is the best game ever made, fight me. But some day hopefully not soon, I'll be having some form of mental breakdown, and this will be my comfort food. And for that, from the bottom of my heart, thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031635264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7225, 'last_played': 1702148528}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a tale of a postmaster dungbeetle with adorable art.
Firstly a pinball game, secondly a platformer, you flipper around the island helping residents and making friends.
Unlock more abilities to find even more secrets!

And the best thing? After you have completed the game, you can play it again with the new official Randomizer
Forget everything you knew about the play-order and find crazy new solutions to previous solved puzzles.

Pros:
A buttonpress for a partyhorn! HONK
Good pinballer
Adorable art
No fixed playthrough order
Replayability with the randomizer (on 3 difficulty levels)
Active (speedrunning) Community, finding more ways to play

Cons:
Simplistic storyline
Lots of casual playthrough backtracking

review:
Pinball metrdoid-vania platformer. It works very well for some reason. I don't even like pin ball and I loved this game.

Gameplay is relaxing. The characters are pretty charming.

It controls well. There is a lot to explore and a lot of collectables. This game is worth the fully price. If it's on sale, there is really no reason to pick it up.

I really don't have anything negative to say about this game. It is a solid experience.

review: Fantastically cute and relaxing game, if you enjoy pinball it's probably one of the best but even if you don't it's probably still very good. Looking forward to what else this studio will make since I was blown away by the high quality of the game, music, graphics and above all, gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008172394', 'num_games_owned': 1251, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1564914004}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express spojuje všechny věci co mám rád do jednoho balíčku!!
- Pinball
(Flipper)
- Plošinovka, Arkáda
- 2D Krásná grafika
- Metroidvania
- Pošťák Ondra
(Hlavní postava, dalo by se říct, že je i Ester jako Kickback)
- Pohodové tempo
- Karibskou hudbu
- Optimální herní délka
- Postavy
- Vtipné vylepšení
Takhle bych mohl pokračovat do aleluja...

Verdikt: Yoku’s Island Express jsem měl v seznamu přání dlouho, vlastně od vydání. Jen jsem nevěřil, že to opravdu bude až takové jak se sama hra presentuje. Když pak Yoku’s Island Express přihodili k Hunble Monthly, bylo to pro mě jako vyhrát BINGO! Popravdě, ještě lepší!! 90%

Hrano v roce 2019

author: {'steamid': '76561198271646453', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1637778584}
review:
Incredible puzzle platformer with pinball-like mechanics. 

If you make a 100% playthrough and get every collectable, which is doable because you can collect items that show the locations of collectables you can finish the game in around 15 hours of playtime, if you just try to achieve the normal ending I'd say around 8 hours is what you'll need.

It is a really enjoyable experience tough and the gameplay is varied and interesting throughout the whole 8 to 16 houur playtime. I can only recommend the game especially if you like puzzle platformers or are interested in collecting and finding every nook and cranny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997599402', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1636903632}
review:
Over all a pretty solid game. I wouldn't give it as high a praise as some 7/10? maybe 8 or 6-5 if you aren't a fan of the genre.
 I went in pretty blind because I remembered want to play it, but it sat on my back log for quite some time. So initially the pinball core mechanic was a bit of a surprise. Which went from oh that's neat to ... oh not again :( some layouts are fun others are tedious. Others scream filthy casual at you by only allowing one try :\ I think overall some layouts are just too tight of mechanics with luck being the deciding factor not skill.
The exploration side is pretty well done. If you don't like backtracking this game isn't for you. I don't know of any 2d exploration games that don't have backtracking, but this games has it and it is a lot better than most. I don't mind it and I think the game keeps it rewarding, and when it's not you have the fast travel network. Finding hidden passages or finally finding out where that tunnel goes is pretty satisfying.
The art, story, and music really get you vested in the game. This is what kept me coming back for more even though other elements had me frustrated enough I would have stopped on lesser games.
Lastly, the elephant and literal black mark. The grappling hook. The physics, speed, and skill required are all wrong. While I do feel there is a skill component unlike some of the pinball shots. At least for a casual, the movement is right at the edge of human detection and my reaction times just aren't that tight. I am not sure when this became a trope of the genre (ORI has a similar issue) but I don't remember the 2nd gen console games being this tight. 
Okay second lastly, I think the game does an okay job selling it but could be a bit better. You can really start to feel sorry for Yoku getting bounced around all the time. I think there are some elements that help sell that they are having fun, but the rag doll physics also make you feel you are literally paddling the poor beetle. If you are really empathetic towards living creatures this might be a bit much.
So conclusion 6-7/10 for me. I am a fan of the genre, but several luck/skill walls leave a sour taste with little to no reward feedback for completing them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049051362', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1636855239}
review:
It was fun until the grappling hook was introduced. I found the rotation on the hook to be way too fast for my brain to track, and that made the game incredibly frustrating for me, since I went flying to all random directions every time I used the hook. [spoiler]Climbing the last tree[/spoiler] felt exactly like playing Getting Over It. 

I would probably rate this positively if there was an option to slow down the grappling hook rotation speed. Finished the game, but my brain hurts and the last hour felt like a chore.

Graphics, music and world/map are all nice, pinball is mostly OK, story is OK. It's just the damn grappling hook.

review: 这是一款屎壳郎推粪球的小游戏（瓢虫送快递啦），新来岛上的邮政局长在送信的过程中利用弹球探索地图打boss，画风清新。游戏性还不错，流程也合适。原价不推荐，e宝送过，值得一玩，steam的key也很便宜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198034353101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1636194914}
review: 这款游戏又让我想起了当年window xp的Pinball弹珠游戏，加入了解谜和收集元素玩法，更加有意思了，总之是一款相对轻松休闲的好游戏，没有固定的探索路线，没有太多的玩法提示，如果足够聪明的话不看攻略通关完全没问题，但是想要全成就，em······还是找视频或去贴吧看帖子吧，（成就系统做的还是可以的无非就是全收集和全探索，游戏过程中会给出或自己买入可以显示还未收集的具体位置）不需要刻意的去做成就，通关之后一样可以做。友情提示：yokus会游泳了之后记得去深海探索一次!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098581392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1636252707}

author: {'steamid': '76561198320006683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1640510033}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086823807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1636145991}
review:
Ce jeu est un régal pour les gens comme moi qui se disent "et mais si on me dit d'aller à gauche, pourquoi j'irais pas voir à droite". Il y a beaucoup de chose à voir, et à explorer. Je pense que l'histoire peut etre un peu courte si jamais on ne fait pas les quêtes additionelles, mais ça serait se priver d'une belle partie du jeu. 

En bref un petit jeu sympa d'une dizaine d'heure ou on ne voit pas le temps passer. Un seul petit malus pour la carte qui pourrait etre peut etre plus clair avec du texte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261881798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1631918263}
review:
Overall this is a GREAT game.

I've had it in my library for A LONG time but just recently I've decided to play it, more out of boredom than anything else, and I'm REALLY glad I did.

The game is gorgeous. The background, the music, the colors, the characters... everything works perfectly together and every section and action just pops out of the screen. 

It's not hard per Se. However I have to say that some parts frustrated me a little because I don't personally like pinball mechanics all that much. Some sections can tire you or frustrate you as you need to hit the bumpers at juuuuust the right moment, otherwise is repeat after repeat. Luckily this doesn't happen too often so you'll tolerate a couple of repetitions here and there.

There's also tons of exploration. Every nook and cranny of the map is an experience waiting to be discovered. You'll backtrack a lot and experiment many different routes but you'll also get rewarded one way or another every single time. Every time you pick it back up you're bound for a new adventure

All in all, this is a game that I can blindly recommend. It's fun, it's pretty, it's easy, it'll give you TONS of hours of gameplay and you'll enjoy the ride

Go for it

author: {'steamid': '76561198105343738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1635027214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054476162', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 982, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1635036724}
review:
クモのボスを倒すところまでプレイしての感想。おすすめしないにしているがゲームの出来も価格設定も良いと思う。ピンボールやタイミング系のアクションパズルが好きな人にはおすすめ。一方、キャラを思い通りに操作するのが好きな人にはおすすめできない。自分は合わなかった。かなりピンボール寄りのゲーム。

実績解除を見るに好きな人はずっとやる雰囲気で、苦手な人は最初の方で脱落しているイメージ。合う合わないがはっきりしている。デモ版を数回繰り返して遊べたら合うんじゃないだろうか。

最初はバンパーを操作して「ピンボールだ！」という感じで新鮮だったが、慣れてくると自キャラ移動速度の遅さとピンボールのもどかしさをストレスに感じてしまった。特に複数画面から構成されるボス戦はダルい。ピンボールらしい感じだし上手いタイミングで操作できればなんてこと無いはずだが、思ったとおりに飛ばない球のストレスがすごい。ボスを倒しても達成感を感じることができなかった。

良いゲームだとは思うがおすすめはしない。良いゲームではあるんだよ…

author: {'steamid': '76561198326547937', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1632086448}
review:
这简直是个宝藏游戏哇！我是错过了e宝免费过来打折买的，仍觉得超值！
游戏画风可爱游戏性也强，收集要素多还能换装，关卡设计也有意思而且不难，就和热评说的那样瞎几把按就行了总能过，这游戏真的一点都不输奥日，把弹球元素加入恶魔城真的给人眼前一亮的感觉，整个游戏流程几乎没有缺点，现在这种有特色还好玩的游戏真的不多了，真的非常好玩，快买！

author: {'steamid': '76561198013088993', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1633696231}
review:
An extremely endearing metroidvania with pinball mechanics, in which you essentially control the ball via a small beetle named Yoku who pushes it around his tropical island home, with the assistance of the myriad pinball flippers scattered throughout the world.

It’s clear a lot of love and attention went into the presentation and mechanics, with a great artstyle and music, varied locales to explore, and a polished set of movement mechanics that when put together make for a pleasant romp with only the rarest moments of frustration. Recommended.

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198986410175', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1634205901}
review:
This game is simply gorgeous. I turned this game on at about 12:30 and found myself playing until I finished the main quest of the game if you will. It's definitely short and there are a couple sections that aren't the most clear or are slightly frustrating but if you're just looking for a cute came to spend 5-6 hours in then this is definitely something for you. And if you're the kind of person who likes to hunt down all of the different collectibles and achievements like myself, there's even more to do as I am still working through the list. 

Overall I would highly recommend picking up this game just for that fun and relaxing feeling in contrast to a lot of the high energy stressful games that I and others play. This game just had me smiling most of my playthrough and was a super nice change of pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198986569114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1634061828}
review: Yoku's Island Express es un juego con una mecánica que hacía tiempo que no jugaba. No miré las etiquetas cuando lo compré por querer ir sin expectativas y pensaba que sería un metroidvania como otros. Pero en el momento que vi la curiosa jugabilidad del pinball y el cuidado tanto estético y sonoro, me recordó a esas tardes donde cogía el ordenador y me ponía a jugar al 3D Pinball - Space Cadet sin saber exactamente de qué iba. Hacía muchísimo tiempo que no perseguía con la mirada una bola y a la vez coordinar con las palancas. Sin duda este juego en mi opinión consigue transmitir la "sensación" de volver a las recreativas (con unas mejoras obviamente visibles)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044350662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1634149919}

author: {'steamid': '76561198283116440', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1633876273}
review:
好玩！性价比很高！常年进包的包货了~
主要玩法是三维弹珠，没有跳跃！一开始很不适应总是习惯性按空格…
主线剧情不长，甚至最后有反转；支线剧情丰富，完成都会有相应的成就。
探索收集要素是有趣的，不过全收集会有些磨人（如果你时机都能把握准确的话当我什么都没说orz

成就党友好！（圣甲虫那个稍微有点麻烦）
要说缺点，大概就是弹跳时机掌握不好可能会耗费一定时间，
以及跑图会有些麻烦，全部蜂线开启之后会方便些。

总的来说是一款休闲小游戏，喜欢三维弹珠的话不妨一试！

author: {'steamid': '76561198015381217', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1633864192}
review:
Imagine if Hollow Knight and an old pinball machine had a kid. The result would be this game.

Gorgeous graphics, fun, and not overly difficult is how I'd describe it. The main story is a bit on the short side, but there's a few side-quests and plenty of collectibles to find too. All in all, I'd recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273917237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1633811617}
review: Fun game, quite short but most metroevenias are, was initially expecting a very easy game but it had some challenging sequences yet nothing too punishing, Had to play twice cause there was some bug with the post quest which didn't work, but actually it was even more fun the second time, so the bug was a "feature" also the music was very enjoyable.The concept is also fresh, in terms of combining generes (metrovenia + pinball).

review:
This game is a lot of fun.

It's cute and charming and at it's heart is really a kind of metroidvania (which I love). Controlling your character throw pinball levels is actually lots of fun. If you don't like pinball at all I could see it getting old, but I never once stopped enjoying the game as I played it.

Not at all a very big game, 5-6 hours to finish it, maybe 7-8 to collect everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037654489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1646407728}
review: I am a compulsive sale shopper here on Steam.  I have alot of games that I have played once, or not even once.  I was curious about how this open world pinball game played.  It is very different from other titles- refreshingly original to play.  Somehow it scratches a "Bionic Commando" itch from the old NES days- having to time the swinging just right.  The controls feel satisfying. There is some mild punishment for failing, but nothing like Bennet Foddy or Jump King- makes the accomplishment rewarding too.

author: {'steamid': '76561199175031158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1633243182}
review: Schönes Spiel für Gelegenheitsspieler, mit ca 16 Stunden Spieldauer, mit einem einfachen Spielprinzip, lustigen Figuren, einer witzigen Story, aber gleichzeitig einer sehr großen und komplexen Welt und teilweise unlösbaren Aufgaben. Nach ca 80-90% erreicht man das Ende, trotz zahlreicher ungelöster Aufgaben. Hat Spaß gemacht! Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198099274185', 'num_games_owned': 1833, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1638106223}
review: Pretty decent game, with the exception that i find it to be too difficult in places. Would give neutral rating if i could. The idea is fun, pinball combined with platforming. But the confusing map design and difficulty just takes away some of the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199180523588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1633325014}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125239017', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1621869547}
review:
[h1]Жучок с большими шарами. [/h1]
(на самом деле с шаром) 

Случайно наткнулся из-за скидок и метки "метроидвания". Годный платформер с механикой пинбола (что-то оригинальное). Сам мир, конечно, выглядит похуже, чем в ори и полом рыцаре, но зато персонажи необычные и красиво нарисованные, плюс их много. Игра проходится быстро, поэтому не успеваешь заскучать. Как только привыкаешь к одной механике, игра тут же демонстрирует что-то новенькое. Головоломки простые, но увлекательные. мир хочется исследовать в поисках секретов. Отзывчивое управление, хороший левел/саунд дизайн. Вот файты с боссами, конечно, не очень, да и мало их. Хоть мир и интересно исследовать, вот только вознаграждает часто юзлесными вещами или предметами для коллекционирования/достижений. Часто флипперы странно подкидывают шар, многие пинбольные головоломки похожи друг на друга (хотя это больше проблема самого пинбола), но платформинг мне понравился больше, а систему с пинболом можно было сделать дополнительной, хотя тогда теряется оригинальность проекта.
Оценка: 4/5
