review: This brings the nostalgia of pc pinball games but its like they matured with you - which is exactly what you need out of a game.  This game also has a surprising amount of mystery - mostly in the beginning, and it doesn't amount to anything too crazy, but it's a cool aspect none-the-less.  Great short play, was able to nearly 100% it in 8 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968849949', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1632675884}
review:
This is essentially an adventure themed pinball game. If you like pinball and could enjoy a refreshing colorful island landscape with hawaiian? styled music, go ahead and get this game. It isn't too long (main story could be done in about 5,5 hours), but the collectibles do add some length if you are so inclined.


It was free on EGS, and i got it for a dollar from a fanatical bundle. While I might not shell out 20 dollars for it, I'd say its a good buy at around 5-10 dollars.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971685964', 'num_games_owned': 1700, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1632669672}
review:
You're a dung beetle, arriving in a beatiful island, ready to go with your ball.
And suddenly you're appointed as the new official postman. 

But the island has secrets and its inhabitants need your help, to prevent darkness to rule it. 

So, armed only with your ball you begin your journey tilting around platforms, jumping and flying from one pad to another in order to help everyone and restore peace.

Yoku's Island Express is an elegant and brilliant open-world metroidvania like game where you control this little beetle. Your main task is to help all the characters along the way by completing quests. These ones will give you unique abilities or they will contribute to the story.

Platforming is particular, because most areas are designed like a flipper, and you will be constantly use pad, bumpers in order to progress in the game.

Like all classic metroidvania style games, you can complete some missions in any order. Specific quests require certain abilities (that you unlock throughout the game) and you can travel back to areas if you missed something. 

The only fallback that this game has is its pinball physics. Sometimes it's fuzzy and you will be cursing a lot in order to shoot the ball in the right spot.

Anyway, it is a fun and engaging game. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009443460', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1632618068}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024506507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1632603909}

author: {'steamid': '76561198301345206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1681044908}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a charming Metroidvania game with pinball styled game play mechanics. The story is fairly straight forward, the island is fun to explore, and there are plenty of extra missions to complete. The main story is only a few hours long.
I love the soundtrack and graphics, and I was genuinely surprised by this game since it had been on my wish list for several months until it went on sale for about 80% off. 

Overall, I would recommend Yoku's Island Express. Don't be to quick to judge it because it's about postal service!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119026161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1577291504}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966628135', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1632431803}
review:
It's a rare game that makes me want to leave a review. It's an even MORE rare game that makes me want to 100% it and get all achievements. On it's face, pinball + metroidvania sounds bizarre, like something the boss' stoner nephew would come up with during a product development meeting, but everyone is afraid to tell him no. How could this possibly work???

Well, it does work, and it works great. I loved this game from start to finish, and while some of the trick shots can be frustrating at times, I know it was me screwing it up. The art and music are excellent, and while the story doesn't do anything new, it's enough to keep you entertained while you explore the island, which is the real draw here. I can't imagine how hard it was to design, but everything makes sense and connects where you need it to.

I hope this game was successful enough to warrant a sequel because I will buy that full price day one! What an excellent game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198850888839', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1632341911}
review:
This is a really cute game with a great concept, and at points it's quite fun. The problem is that the pinball mechanic is often far more frustrating than it should be. It can take many, many tries to get something to work when there's no evidence of why it's not working in the first place. Unlike an actual pinball machine, which uses real physics, this game has 'physics' that are not nearly as predictable and don't equate to what it would work like in reality (in terms of where on the paddle the ball is when you hit it in order for it to go which direction, among other things). This makes it very frustrating. I ran into too many of these things too often that I eventually gave up.

I also wish it had some kind of quest tracker. There's a thing you're supposed to do after getting past the first obstacle (dragon in the water), and after a little bit, I couldn't remember what it was, but when I looked around the map, I didn't see the marker that I thought it used to be, so I was like, "Eh... I guess I completed it?" Since I couldn't even remember what the quest was by that point, this hardly gave me the sense of satisfaction that it should have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4500, 'num_reviews': 1010, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1626150548}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express is a game that hasn’t been played by many people on PC. I assume it’s been doing better on the Switch, since you generally see that audience talk about it more over there.

But they’re missing out, I’m telling you. Yoku is a metroidvania where you, as a little creature named Yoku (makes sense), deliver mail and parcels to its inhabitants.
Shortly after your arrival things start to go amiss and it’s up to you to fight evil, all the while making your deliveries and helping people out with other requests.

The island is quite big with different kinds of biomes and you get to walk around freely until you reach a point where the access is blocked. In order to get over these obstacles you usually need to complete a quest or acquire an item, like a true metroidvania.
The biggest gameplay aspect isn’t really it being a metroidvania, but rather the addition of pinball areas where you can flip and bounce around, collecting fruit, destroying objects and unlock secrets and as well as take different routes toward different goals and objectives. And there are a lot of them, all with different designs. No shortcuts were taken when they made these.
These pinball parts of the game are very unique and almost always fun to play, except for a few instances where you just can’t seem to get the ball towards the right destination. But maybe it’s my lack of pinball skills causing this.
Quests can be accepted and seen on the map where they’re clearly marked. Even though it’s not always clear where you should go or what you should do, too much handholding would lose some of its magic.
And it’s not a long game by any means. Finishing the main story should take around 6 hours and you can add a few hours to that number to complete of the quests and find all of the collectibles. So you can see why it would lose some of that magic.

Visually Yoku looks stunning with highly detailed 2D art, all smoothly animated. There’s no lack of weird and funny characters or lush environments. There’s always something nice to see.
The music fits the tropical theme of the game and the characters speak some kind of gibberish so I can’t really speak about the voice acting. But it all sure sounds like it fits the game’s attitude.

So if you haven’t played or heard of Yoku’s Island Express until now then you’re really missing out. It’s a game that any so-called gamer should’ve played. You can’t call yourself a gamer and not play unique and fun games. It’s all part of being a gamer in the first place. So in order to correct this you should buy it, play it and love it. And then let me know you agree by liking or replying to this review.

You’re welcome!

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197972096521', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1631075301}
review:
If you enjoy Sonic Spinball, you will enjoy this game.

An incredible combination of pinball and metroidvania, with a beautiful arts style, enjoyable characters and great music to tie it all together.
The difficulty curve is spot on and even at full price, this game is well worth it.

Played on Linux with a Steam Controller, and it worked flawlessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995741939', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 68, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1711756607}
review:
Fantastic, unique mixture of metroidvania and pinball! I couldn't peel myself off for 2h when I started it.
The pinball parts aren't really "pinball" in a way where you get few balls and massive gaps; the 'boards' are the way you traverse the world. Sometimes, you just push the ball you're tied to, and sometimes, you just jump into a board.
There's huge amount of boards on the map, and they're all fun and unique, and as you gain 'metroidvania abilities', they are used on the boards to clear the paths.

All in all - worth every penny. Get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165957782', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1631235774}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025197398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1632698999}
review:
A pleasant experience.  I'm certain that the "physics" are mostly based on pre-determined paths that the ball can go on, and which path you get depends on your speed and where you hit with the paddle.  This makes it much less frustrating than it could be, if it had been purely physics-based.

The characters and story are charming and child-friendly, and you are able to get maps later on that point out everything that you might be missing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838122617', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1578433446}
review: Everybody knows how to play pinball, right? I hate pinball but I didn't feel like I was playing a pinball game. My direction sense is very bad for metroidvania but this game didn't overwhelm me. The story is rich and interesting (and wholesome!). The graphics are simple but cute. This game is definitely good for your girlfriend/wife who doesn't play games really well. Or your friend. Or yourself *cough cough*.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030459447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1631130281}
review: Just fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197992476962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1631192651}
review:
トゥルーエンドまでプレイ。結論から言うとおすすめ。

かなり面白い。雰囲気も良いし操作感もよい、レベルデザインも練られていると思う。

ただ、メトロイドヴァニアの探索成分と、ピンボール成分が、やや喧嘩している。
マップのほぼ全てをピンボール的なギミックにしているせいで、思うように移動ができない。
マップを見て「すぐ近くのA地点に行きたいのに、行き方がよくわからない」ということが頻発する。まあ、それを前提としたデザインにはなってはいるが、「探索は、自分の行きたい方向から、順番に、虱潰しに進めたい」ので、そこだけは好きになれなかった。

あと若干の説明不足というか、「あえて説明しないで、プレイヤーに気がついてもらいたい」みたいなのがある。ちょっと注意。

あとは言うこと無い。メトロイドヴァニアとピンボールを混ぜた、良質のゲーム。

author: {'steamid': '76561199080823225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1631061671}
review: 7.5/10 somehow mv + pinball is a match made in heaven, this was super cute and very fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197999238790', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1621397928}
review:
The best open-world pinball game out there. Also probably the only one. But that should not take away from its accomplishments!

Yoku's Island is really well-made and charming throughout. The layout of the world at the larger scale and the "tables" at the smaller scale are all expertly crafted. There are collectible power-ups which you need to progress in certain areas, but fast-travel mechanics make it fairly painless to backtrack. This is the mark of any good metroidvania - it makes you explore and gives you freedom to choose where you go, but also does not irritate.

The storyline is pretty basic in a way that is super fitting for this type of game; it need not be more complex.

Music is also soothing and not too monotonous, thanks to the various tracks in different regions of the world.

Above all else, it's honestly just plain fun. When it comes to judging a game's "fun", it depends a lot on hard to define aspects like "good" level design, reward mechanics, and overall cohesion. A game is more than the sum of its parts, and while each of the parts are excellent on their own, Yoku's Island stands out for being exceptional as a holistic package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066271099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1631039111}
review:
Typically in a Metroidvania when you acquire a new ability it makes controlling your character more fun. Two major upgrades into Yoku and I feel like the opposite is true. If you have poor timing using the various abilities is a huge chore that often makes otherwise simple tasks a nightmare to carry out.

The game is super cute, but if you aren't good at pinball it feels like the game is constantly punishing you for tiny mistakes, sometimes by way of "Getting Over It"-style plummets to earlier areas.

Update: I decided to keep playing and got the credits to roll. Normally with a Metroidvania I try to go for 100%, but this game just never clicked for me. The mechanics are really frustrating and obtuse at times, and some things are very poorly explained by the game, like how you can use the A button to drop off at the different stops on a beeline instead of going all the way to the end, or how you can use A to prematurely detonate slugs. These are not remotely intuitive, especially since the game never actually requires you to take advantage of them and is perfectly content to explain other mechanics.

Also the plot is really dumb.

Update 2: It's the next day, and I have an RSI from mashing on the right trigger on my controller so much trying to get the damn grappling hook to do what I want. This game has officially been downgraded from travesty to hate crime. Do not play this game. I don't care how cute it is. I don't care how novel the concept of a pinball metroidvania is. I watched the world record speedrun for 100% in this game yesterday, and even that guy, who should be the greatest Yoku's Island Express player on the planet right now, struggled with the controls throughout the entire run. If you value your time, if you value your money, or if you have any sense of self-preservation whatsoever, do yourself a favor and remove this game from your wishlist.

review: Lovely hand-drawn Metroidvania, in which most of the movement is done via Pinball mechanics.  Large world, multiple abilities that allow the world to open up and shortcuts between sections for quicker travel.  Loads of collectibles to find (or ignore), and a novel story.   Replayability is low though...  that is, except the latest patch added a randomizer mode which makes you progress through the map in different routes each time due to the abilities you unlock at different times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968777643', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1555766525}
review:
I played this game a few years ago with my gf when we were on a holiday trip to Crete. We had some bad-weather-days, so we played this game, and it instantly lightened the mood with it's chill and positive soundtrack and holiday-like athmosphere. So, if you're in a bad place right now, just try this game, it will lighten your day! 😊 The gameplay-mechanics are so fresh and interesting that they will keep you entertained for so long that you will likely end up getting this game to 100%.
BTW, I definitely have play this game for more than 4.4 hours (as currently listed below my review). I was likely offline most of the time when playing it.

review: This remains one of my favorite games both in the Metroidvania and Pinball genres.  The story is sweet if minimal but the pinball gameplay is spot-on.  There's lots to like here if you're a fan of either genre and it's exceptionally polished and well done, bright, rewarding, and 'juicy' with plenty of colorful pickups that actually translate into unlockables, skill improvements and standard MV area gating.  Even if you feel the price to be dear, I really recommend the game if you can find it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116482292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1610213363}
review:
【言語】日本語
【難易度】普通
【実績難易度】一部難しいかも
【実績コンプリート時間】11時間

[h1]万人向けピンボールRPG[/h1]
非常によく考えられた、今までにない新しいピンボール体験ができるゲーム。Steamストアのタグには「メトロイドヴァニア」と書いてますが、本当にその通りでメトロイドヴァニアのようなオープンワールド。キャラクターの成長により行動範囲が広がる楽しみ、そしてピンボールとしてのギミックやワクワク感が、どれも丁度良くミックスされたゲームです。これはよく思いついたなぁと感心しました。


[h1]美しいグラフィック[/h1]
ゲームも素晴らしいですが、まず目に付くのはその美しいグラフィックです。背景のバリエーションがとても豊富で自然の中を自由に冒険している感じがとても素晴らしい。メトロイドヴァニアと言えば、ダンジョン・洞窟・城などが多いと思いますが、このゲームはすべて自然環境の中を自由に移動できます。綺麗な海・自然豊かな森・雪が降る山脈などが舞台となっているので、映像を見るのもとっても楽しいです。
また登場人物も動物がモデルとなっていますので、物凄く可愛くて癒されます。子供でも安心して遊べるゲームです。


[h1]楽しいゲーム性[/h1]
主人公キャラクターはある程度自由に操作ができます。村の中などではコロコロと玉を転がしながら動物たちに話を聞いたり、ちょっとしたミッション等を受ける事もできます。

ですが基本となるのはやはりピンボール。エリアには程よくピンボールステージがあります。ジェットコースターのようにビューンと移動したり、ギミック満載のエリアを見るのも楽しい。また「○○して欲しい」というお願いを聞く事もあり、その場合もピンボールで解決していきます。

そしてこのピンボールゲームも決して難しいわけではなく、どちらかと言えば難易度は低め。また完全な物理演算が働いているわけではなく、やや嘘くさい動きをします。好みが分かれるかもしれませんが、これが非常に操作しやすくストレスのない作りになっています。
例えば通常のピンボール台の場合、"右上のレールに乗るように跳ね返したい時"があるとして……何度フリッパー (ピンボールを打ち返すアレ) を動かしても行けない！微妙にルートが外れる！という経験をした人がいるかもしれません。ですがこのゲームはある程度補正がかかるので、吸い込まれるように指定のレールにボールが行ってくれます。進むべき道にはある程度行きやすいよう補正がかかっていますので、ストレスが無い作りになっています。この補正機能はゲームデザインに合っていて素晴らしいと思います。

もう1つピンボールと言えば一番下に落ちてしまった時ですが、この場合もゲームオーバーはありません。少しお金 (フルーツ) が減るだけですぐにフィールドに戻ってこれます。この点もストレスがまったくありません。


[h1]操作性[/h1]
キーボードとコントローラーのどちらでも可能。方向キーで主人公(ボール)の移動。LRボタンやSHIFTキーでフリッパーの操作です。
上記の補正機能もありますので非常に操作しやすいです。またフリッパーがボールの位置で光るようになっている機能には驚きました。これは文章では伝わりにくいかもしれません。このフリッパーが光る場所により「この辺りにボールが飛ぶ」という予想がしやすいです。本当に細かい部分までよく考えて作ってあると思います。

さらにピンボール中でも主人公をある程度は動かす事もできるので、逆方向に入力すると速度がゆっくりになります。この点もプレイヤーに優しい作りになっています。

ひとつ気になったのはピンボール以外の移動時で、少し移動速度が遅いです。マップを長距離移動する時もあるので、目的の場所を行ったり来たりする場合は多少面倒だったりします。


[h1]メトロイドヴァニアとしては[/h1]
ピンボールエリアは非常に考えられていて、ギミックも沢山。それでもカジュアルという絶妙なつくり。ではメトロイドヴァニア部分はというと、こちらも完成度が高い。
ピンボールなのにどんな装備品が？と思われるかもしれませんが、お金を沢山持てるようになるバッグ。物を破壊するものから高く飛べるようになるアイテムまで結構色々とあります。またやり込み要素の隠しアイテムもありますので、遊んでみるとしっかりとメトロイドヴァニアしてるなと感じました。


[h1]少し気になったとこ[/h1]

[b][u]　■ ストーリーがほぼない[/u][/b]

これはどの探索ゲームも似たようなものだと思いますので、マイナス点ではないとは思います。何をすればいいのかという大まかな指示はでますが、それはゲームの最終目標です。基本的にこのゲームはマップを自由に探索するゲームで、ある程度どのエリアでも自由に行くことができます。
アクションゲームと違って、敵が強いからこっちのエリアは後回しだなぁ……という考えも浮かびにくいので、マップが広すぎて自由度が高いというのは、人によっては好き嫌いが分かれるかもしれません。色んな場所に自由に行ってみたいと思う人はハマるでしょう。
でもどこに向かえばいいのかわからないので、何をしてどうすればクリアできるのかという明確な道しるべがありません。もしかすると投げ出してしまう人もいるかもしれません。
探索大好き。冒険大好きな人は大丈夫だと思います。


[b][u]　■ 微妙なワープポイント[/u][/b]

移動速度が遅いのもそうですが、マップが広いのにワープポイントの様なものが少ないです。一応高速移動装置？があるのですが、瞬時にパッっと遠くに移動できるわけではありません。後半になるにつれて移動に時間がかかります。


[b][u]　■ 一部のアクション[/u][/b]

ネタバレになるので詳しくは書きませんが、一部のアクションはやや操作にクセがあります。クリアはできると思いますが、隠し要素を含めた完全攻略を目指すならば多少慣れが必要です。


[h1]実績[/h1]
実績はやり込み系のみ。ゲームクリア後には同じセーブデータで続きからプレイする事ができます。つまりマップ達成率100%を目指せば実績コンプリートできます。
ただし隠しアイテムなどを探すのはやや難しい。どのように取ればよいのかがわからなかったりします。意外な方法だったりしますので、多少考える必要があります。

また実績の【[spoiler]完璧屋さん：すべてのスカラベを有効にする[/spoiler]】は困る人も多そうな実績。解除率も一番低いです。全体的に親切な作りのゲームですが、これはちょっと面倒なやり込みになっています。


[h1]最後に[/h1]
ほぼ100%やり込んでからクリアして1周10時間程かかりました。続きから残りの実績を解除して11時間。
ほんの少し気になる部分はあるものの、ゲームのマイナスポイントとなる部分はほとんど無いと言えます。非常にクオリティが高い作品。ピンボールという誰でも遊べるゲーム性に探検する・冒険する楽しみをプラスしたのは斬新であり素晴らしい。グラフィックも綺麗で癒されますし、最後まで満足度の高いプレイが楽しめました。
チェックポイントも多めなので、少しだけ遊びたいなという時にも最適。重たいゲームはしんどいけども、軽くゲームでもしようかな？という気分にさせてくれます。
実績などは気にせずにカジュアルに遊ぶのならば、ストレスはほとんどないでしょう。子供～大人まで誰でも楽しめるゲームだと思いますので、興味を持たれた人はぜひ遊んでみてください。

author: {'steamid': '76561198834025025', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1629983064}
review:
[h1] 캐쥬얼 힐링 핀볼 매트로배니아  [/h1]
귀여운 딱정벌레 섬의 우편부 Yoku는 우편을 배달하다 (본업) 어쩌다 섬을 사악한 적으로부터 구하게 되는데.. 
(이렇게 보니까 뭔가 말이 안되는데..?) 

#특이한 컨셉이라 좋더라 
무려 핀볼입니다. 핀볼. 모르는 분들도 많으실텐데요, 가끔 오래된 주점이나 아케이드가면 구석에 핀볼 머신이 있곤 했어요. 화면 하단에 왼쪽/오른쪽으로 공을 쳐서 올릴 수 있어서 이리~저리 툭툭 치면서 원하는 곳으로 넣는 게임이죠. 현실 핀볼은 항상 공이 멋대로 튕기면서 돌아다니는지라 좋아하지 않아서 당황했지만 게임에서는 매트로배니아랑 접목하니까 재밌었습니다! 안 좋아하는 분들도 꽤나 재밌게 하실 수 있을 거예요. 신선합니다. 

#힐링.. 힐링이 필요해 
요쿠야,  너는 개똥벌레냐 딱정벌레니? 똥(?) 같은 볼을 굴리는 걸 보면 개똥벌레인것 같은데...
작은 발로 바삐 움직이며 잔망스럽게 볼을 굴리는 게 참으로 귀엽습니다. 귀를 즐겁게 하는 음악과 배경도 이뻐서 천천히 즐기면 힐링이 됩니다. 너무 쉽다구요? 저처럼 도과를 하시면 조금은 매운 맛으로도 즐기실 수 있어요. ㅎ 볼도 여러 가지 색깔의 페인트를 얻어서 다른 뽈을 만드는 재미도 있습니다. 

단점이라면 초반에 핀볼에 익숙하지 않아서 당황할 수 있고.. 순간 이동이 없어서 맵 끝에서 끝으로 가려면 조큼 답답할 수는 있습니다. 대포(?) 같은게 있어서 조금 빨리 갈수는 있지만 정거장이 많지 않아요~ 하지만 힐링 게임이니까요, 조급하지 않게 천천히 즐기시면 오케이!추천합니다! 



[quote=author] 도전과제는 어렵지 않습니다, 엔딩을 보시고도 돌아다니면서 업적 달성하실 수 있어요. 그래도 모든 업적 중에서 가장 까다로운 업적이 있다면 바로 이거예요. 
Perfectionist   
Activate all Scarabs
맵 중간 중간에 핀볼을 튕기는 구간들이 있는데 자세히 보시면 나비 고치(?) 모양의 Scarabs들이 있습니다. 특정 방향/순서로 뽈을 튕겨주시면 얘네들이 게이지가 차면서 나비가 됩니다! 수십 개가 있는데 나중에 뭐 놓쳤는지 찾아다니려면 꽤 귀찮습니다. 가능하면 꼼꼼히 미리 챙겨주시는 것을 추천합니다. 저는 몇 개 놓쳐서 유튜브 확인하면서 다시 했습니다. 그래도 할만합니다. 


[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198096710330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1594675085}
review: It's the type of game that makes you wish for a sequel. Yes, it's got problems. Late game quests/activities can get kind of tedious and sometimes the pinball maps aren't the best, but what it's doing at its core is so unique and fun that you can easily look past those few gripes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312431304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1629584236}
review:
TL;DR -- Nice concept, bad execution.

I came to this thinking it would be a Metroidvania (with a pinball twist) but the problem with that is, the massive map cannot be zoomed it, so you find yourself leaning into the screen to see where things are.

There are a lot of bullshit barriers, for example, at the top of the icy mountain, I wanted to roll off to the right to the lower area. The game decided to put a little inch-sized wall so I couldn't - instead I had to go back to the left and redo the multiple pinball mazes I had just accomplished just to back to where I was. And just to remind you, every time I went through a pinball "room" I would miss the shot 15 or so times before hitting the perfect angle just to move to the next room. I've spent hours watching the ball go up around and back after a wrong hit. My play time for 100% could have been 9 hours instead of 14.

The "fast travel" is only accessible from maybe 5 places on the map so naturally I have to take time to travel... to the fast travel??? and in the end I would have to travel further because it doesn't reach most of the map.

The perfectionist achievement - while not hard (because there are no deaths) is something that cannot be done without a guide because nothing on the map is marked for this. Oh sorry, it is marked when you have collected all but 10 (of 50) of these collectibles. So there is a guide when you no longer need it.

Speaking of no longer needing - there are 2 meaningful upgrades. The rest are completely worthless and only recommended if you are going for 100%.

This game plays, well, like pinball. You know pinball, the game where you dump your coins into and watch as the ball seemingly does everything except what you want it to do? The great thing about the tabletop pinball machines is the high score multipliers and the clanking mechanical sounds. This game has neither. There's potential for a good game here but the opportunity this time was missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027358747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1628026729}
review:
Surprisingly good implementation of a very strange idea. 

While I recommend it mostly because of the novelty of a pinball Metroidvania, it is really well made for what it is, with nice environments, good music, charming characters and the most shocking twist ending in gaming history.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176960491', 'num_games_owned': 1793, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1629655500}
review: Have you ever thought about combining Ori and the Blind Forest and a pinball game? No? Me neither, but the result is SURPRISINGLY GOOD. I enjoyed the whole game more than I thought and the pinball aspect isn't just a weird gimmick. The story is well thought out and the game is a very enjoyable experience. The scarabs are a pain and the wickerlings are annoying. Try it!

review: I love pinball. There is something mechanically that is really satisfying about getting your timing right and hitting shots. This game is a joy to play as it offers that sensation with the added bonus of having a beautiful color palette, wonderful music, and stellar character design. If you want the best pinball platformer since Sonic Spinball, try this.

review:
我以为三维弹球是个很无聊的游戏，直到我玩上了这款。

review: Cute little adventure where you navigate you're way around an island by using pinball mechanics. Doesn't take too long to get used to the controls, though it can get a little frustrating when you need to aim for a particular spot. Worth a look, controller recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025611643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1628983358}
review:
The static art is lovely but it's got that dumb puppet joint style of animation. The music is nice but generic. The pinball idea sounded really cool but the execution just never fell into place for me. Beat it 100% except for one extremely repetitive pinball related achievement in a bit less than 10 hours and most of that was fighting the pinball tables. It felt so arbitrary whether or not I could hit the ball a certain way.

This is not a metroidvania. Yes there are two platforming upgrades but they don't "open up the world" so to speak. You get them so early it's not even that limiting.

Also, I feel bad for Yoku. He gets bonked around so much the "drain" thorns are nothing compared to the brain damage or crushed organs he must have gotten over the course of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402093458', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1628772982}
review:
蛮好玩的3d弹球游戏，不过难度比较小，然后的话地图很恶心，我通关前想全收集，就是有些东西找不到，
没有空洞那样的明确地图商人，收集品很难找，有些地方能看见宝箱但没有提示，解密困难，
有些宝箱可以吸蛞蝓炸上去，有些宝箱完全不知道怎么走，而且网上攻略不全，
柳条收集也比较麻烦，有些地方真的很难发现，我只收集到83个。
关键是通关了都没办法拿到收集品地图，很烦，没有古墓丽影友好。

author: {'steamid': '76561198263182469', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1628322656}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035100973', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 766, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1587558780}
review: Pretty unique idea, but the pinball gameplay did not do it for me at all. I just found it incredibly tedious and repetitive pretty quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049169980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1628698208}
review:
A charming and imaginative platformer/pinball mashup. No jump button here - if you want to go up you can use the flippers found throughout the metroidvania-style map (i.e. it's huge map of interconnected zones with various shortcuts opening up as you explore more and gain new abilities).

Music and art are top quality and the physics model is just about realistic enough to make the pinball work while still being fun and accessible to those who might not be pinball wizards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023112042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2285, 'last_played': 1631582520}

author: {'steamid': '76561198814435336', 'num_games_owned': 1472, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1644570904}
review:
九个小时主线通了并顺带完成了部分支线（还没全完成）显示进度为76%。
进过包，可以某宝买key，两三块左右即可到手。
即使是原价买我仍然觉得物有所值，玩完不亏。当然，买的key就觉得大赚特赚的感受。
推荐一试，92/100，我给一个很高的分数评价。
优点：
1，基于三维弹球的玩法进行的魔改，上手简单，玩法有趣；
2，难度不算太难，比Ori简单，死亡惩罚也只是水果（就相当于钱啦，还可以反复拿刷的，除了刚开始可能缺水果，后期不用主动去拿都基本上都是足够挥霍的），对手残党很友好；
3，画风挺不错的，辨识度很高，也很喜欢这样的风格；
4，音乐不错，很轻快，在我手残的时候明明很焦灼却可以安抚平静我的心。
不足：
1，指引部分不是特别满意，大的任务会给提示，一些细小的（比如孢子那个虽然有文字说明但是需要自己找地方）还是不太行；
2，一些隐藏的key是玩法机制的改变，但也往往带来吐血的郁闷，或许可以考虑用其它一些方法再略加指示一下；
3，地图跑路很难受，虽然后期可以用蜂线但相对来说那个的解锁还是偏晚的，使得全程跑腿重复内容太多，而且一不小心可能还走错路/迷路。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067278116', 'num_games_owned': 2185, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1628441603}
review:
[h1]Я вам посылку принес. Ток я вам ее не отдам[/h1]
Приехал почту разносить и на пляже валяться, а меня заставляют по всему острову носиться и всех спасать, включая местного бога и богояйцо - что ж ты за бог такой, если тебя жук-почтальон спасает? А в остальном мне все понравилось:  катать шар, играть в пинбол, собирать фрукты, доставлять письма и посылки  - именно о такой работе я мечтал, когда решил плыть на этот остров. Еще и местный бог теперь у меня в долгу, буду на нем кататься в свободное время.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134754192', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1628435122}

author: {'steamid': '76561198994779720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1628434336}
review: 画风超级可爱，bgm也很悠闲，但是掌握不好技巧的话就只能靠一点点的概率加上亿点点的运气过关了（网上攻略貌似很少，建议去百度贴吧：叫“尤库的小岛速递吧”），全收集时的跑图可太难为我了

author: {'steamid': '76561198017530698', 'num_games_owned': 2114, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1630223920}
review:
An extremely unique blend of games that works out better than you might expect. 
The island is incredibly enjoyable to traverse and explorer, secrets are mostly hidden in fun and fair ways, the mechanics they introduce such as the leash and slugs are used in very fun ways and can get you to places you might not expect with some creativity. The exploration parts of the game make perfect use of the fact you're a pinball, and much of the island feels very handcrafted to give you that pinball feeling even in simply moving up or down. 
The actual pinball tables range from pretty good to painful at times, as they require some pretty decent precision. Maybe I'm out of my element, but the physics on the tables felt wonky a lot of the times, leaning more towards Yoku's momentum rather than where on the bumper you hit him, which didn't play well with needing to slot myself into one of 5 tight lanes, all bunched together. I'm not sure if you're aware, but most would not consider pinball to be a precision sport. This led to some unneeded frustration, but thankfully there's virtually no consequence to failure.
The art style/direction was pretty spot on. An interesting blend of 3D environments and mostly 2D characters, with a fair number looking more sinister and creepy than you might expect from a game like this. The music fits right in with a mostly tropical feel, a good use of "tropical doo-wop" vocals, and a couple stellar mood pieces such as the mountains and caves tracks. Give it a listen, even if you don't buy this game, pretty underrated.
The collection and secret hunting aspects were overall pretty enjoyable, with the few side quest being out of the way enough that it feels rewarding to find and do them, but not so out of the way that you'd never find them to begin with. The upgrades they give were mostly lackluster, but the journey was reward enough. Some of the secrets were tedious if not just frustrating to obtain, especially if it involved the use of [spoiler] slugs, to boost yourself around [/spoiler] but I still ended up 100%'ing the game, only resorting to a guide once or twice to basically confirm what I already suspected.
Overall, I'd say this is a very underrated gem, and despite having my eyes on it for a couple years now, it's only now that I finally get to playing it thanks to a friend for alerting me that this game has a randomizer. After playing it all, I can see a randomizer working VERY well for Yoku, so be sure to check that out if it interest you. Easy recommend if you enjoy both pinball and light metroidvania/puzzle platformer elements, you'll get a cool 5-9 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350055096', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1628211139}
review:
Good game. Some fetch quests sending you back and forth across the island become a bit of a drag, but the ease of the bee lines and just how generally fun it is to shoot and fling yourself around pretty much make up for it; I really enjoy the pin ball aspects. 
Some of the items you get pretty late, but it depends on in what order you decide to actually finish quests.
The musics pretty good with out being too repetitive, I actually left it on instead of muting it like most games.  

my only real nitpick would be that after 15hrs, no icons left on my map and 100% steam achievements... it still says I'm only 97% complete. I'm sure i just missed going back to talk to some one, but I don't really wanna spend 5 more hours blindly tracking down one conversation.

author: {'steamid': '76561199147100725', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1628607771}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009067278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1628080215}
review:
As a fan of both pinball and metroidvania's, this game just didn't grab me, and I can boil that down to one reason: weight. Pinballs are heavy, and feel heavy while playing, their inertia is the heart of the mechanic. Yoku is floaty, like a platformer protagonist, and doesn't seem to have that crucial weight that lets you fire the ball from just the right part of the flipper. I know that instead we can have Yoku push the ball...but it just isn't doing it for me. 

Beautiful and innovative game let down by an uncanny valley pinball feel. 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198084642323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1627841611}
review:
It's fun! There's no jumping, but flinging yourself around the island with pinball paddles turns out to be an excellent means of transportation. There are lots of secrets and joy to be found in this game.

Precision is required in some places. In general Yoku's Island Express is not too difficult and relies equally on figuring things out and handling the ball properly. Some optional challenges are harder than the main quest, though.

This game is non-linear and you can complete the main quest and side quests in almost any order.

author: {'steamid': '76561198394680546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1656131653}
review: 好玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198009715261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1627769755}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a cheerful and lighthearted game that mixes the level design ideas of metroidvania games with pinball mechanics used for most of your traversal and what very little combat is involved.  It is very forgiving and fairly simple throughout most of the game, further adding to the laidback and carefree vibe of the game.  There is no life meter, and you cannot die.  There is also no time pressure.  So feel free to enjoy it at your own pace.

+Simple but fun pinball mechanics used liberally throughout the game world.
+Very forgiving and laidback, no pressure whatsoever beyond that you put on yourself.
+Great music that adds to the happy and carefree atmosphere
+Some of the optional collectibles can be genuinely difficult to reach for those looking for more of a challenge.

-The game is rather easy; anyone looking for a more challenging experience won't find that here.
-I wish it were longer.  Even fully completing the game only took me 10hrs.  I did very much enjoy my time on Mokumana, but I sincerely hope to see a sequel that takes longer to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198435296761', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1627736613}

author: {'steamid': '76561198380212817', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1635692587}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970435091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1627479905}
review:
A raiz de jugar Ori and the blind forest descubrí el amor por este tipo de juegos. Si bien  Yoku's Island Express no llega a la excelencia del título mencionado cumple sobradamente en todos los aspectos, tanto visuales como técnicos e incluso narrativos. Simpática historia con un toque de Pinball que dota de originalidad este increíble juego. Si te apasionan los metroidvania este juego es imprescindible. 
A destacar, que si eres una persona como yo sin mucho tiempo libre, este juego tiene muchos puntos de guardado, presenta un desafío suficiente para sentirte satisfecho con el progreso sin dejarte frustrado por horas en ningún nivel. 
Y por si no estás convencido todavía, mencionarte que es el único a por el que he ido a completarlo al 100% con todos sus logros. Es una maravilla!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061722503', 'num_games_owned': 1331, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1626601561}
review:
Yokus Island Express ist ein Mix aus Metroidvania und Pinball Spiel. 
Darin steuert man Mistkäfer Yoku dank in der Welt Verteilter Flipperhebel durch die Wälder Berge und Höhlen der Insel Mokumana.
Dabei erspielt man sich dann Power-ups die das Movement erweitern und einen in Alten Gebieten neue Wege ermöglichen. 

Durch die Kombination aus dem Tropisch angehauchten  Soundtrack und dem schönen Artstyle kommt dabei selbst bei den wenigen Stellen, an den etwas mehr Präzision beim Flippern gefordert wird, kaum Frust auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198852419686', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1627282192}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095027549', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1627024991}
review:
Open-world pinball is certainly not something you see every day, but this game acts on this unique concept very well. A great story, memorable characters, fun mechanics, and a great art style make this a very fun game to play.

Although the description sounds a little weird at first, the best way to describe the gameplay in this game is simply "open-world pinball". In this game you control Yoku, a small dung beetle with a ball. Although you can walk along the ground as you would in any normal platformer, the majority of your movement will be done by whacking the ball with the various paddles and bumpers around the environments to collect fruit, complete quests, and explore more of the island. The mechanics feel solid and it's quite satisfying once you get the hang of the pinball mechanics.

The story is very cute. It was quite fun to watch Yoku roll around the island with his never-ending smile while trying to help the islanders around him and save the island. The way the story progresses in a few areas does feel a tad bit weird, but I suppose that comes with the territory when you're telling a story using pinball mechanics. For the most part though, the story is told very well and it's a pleasure to experience.

The game features fantastic hand-painted visuals as well, which look superb, and was not necessarily what I was expecting from a pinball game, but was very welcome. It also ran well, and the only issues with bugs I had were a few areas where it appeared that I did things out of order somehow, which made some character dialogue not make sense (such as referring to things I'd already done). This was a very minor issue though, and there were not issues outside of this.

[b]TL;DR[/b] This is a fantastic open-world pinball game, with great pinball mechanics, a surprisingly good story, memorable characters, and fantastic visuals. I would highly recommend this game for anyone who enjoys pinball or anyone who's willing to give a game with a unique concept a go, as this game does not disappoint.

review: Es muy divertido y original, estilo Metroidvania con zonas que se desbloquean según vas adquiriendo habilidades, las zonas se completan como si fueran mesas de Pinball, por lo que le da un aire fresco al género, al menos diferente. Es asequible en dificultad, tirando a fácil, aunque a veces las físicas de la bola hace que se te descontrole y acabes lejos del sitio donde querías ir, pero en líneas generales, fácil. Gráficamente está bonito, gráficos como pintados, muy colorido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993304005', 'num_games_owned': 5486, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1626313478}
review:
A heartwarming, charismatic, and radiant action-adventure game that is filled to the brim with lovely ideas that revolve around a unique combination of mechanics.

Positive:
- All characters are cute, charming, and imaginative. The game world is fantastical but tasteful, making it an alluring playground for players of all ages.
- Making a Metroidvania platformer out of pinball mechanics is different and extraordinary. Traversing the game's environment feels remarkably novel.
- Delivering mail and helping others by completing quests is endearing and satisfying. Everything comes together really well.
- Unlocking special abilities is thoroughly gratifying and performing them is consistently fun and interesting.
- Most quest markers are clearly visible throughout the world map and most known points of interest can be relatively easily spotted by zooming in.
- For those interested in such side ventures, there are plenty of collectibles to catch and secrets to unveil, with some places being difficult in figuring out how to reach.
- Exploration is continually rewarded, as there is always something new to find, new areas to discover, and mysteries to investigate.
- Each and every activity is well thought out and very much worthwhile to take part in (including all of the achievements). There is no filler content and never a dull moment.
- Performance is great, with very rare frame drops, despite a lower than desirable capped frame rate.

Neutral:
- Specific options are not available. One can toggle between fullscreen and windowed, change the resolution, switch the texture quality between "normal" and "low", alter the music and sound effects volumes, and customize the vibration strength.
- The story is adorable and engaging, but it really is nonsensical and innocent. Quests, enemies, and surroundings all appear harmless.
- Getting lost and not knowing what to do next is in the nature of the genre, and this game has its fair share of such moments.
- There is a certain level of ambiguity for certain aspects of the game. Most of these situations eventually become clear as one progresses through the game, but for some time, they remain totally unexplained.
- Traveling long distances can be an occasional nuisance, since the playable beetle cannot jump. At times, a wanted ledge, for example, is nearby but one must go a certain distance away in order to reach it.
- Once the story portion of the game completes, the player is allowed to spend more time in the world tying up loose ends and concluding unfinished ordeals.

Negative:
- The frame rate is capped at 60. Although it cannot be changed, this limitation does not get in the way of the gameplay.
- Sometimes one may happen to become stuck in places around the game world due to obstacles that require being accessed from another side. The only way to move forward, in such cases, is to restore a save from a previous checkpoint. This means that the player may potentially lose several minutes of progress.
- The game starts with the mouse cursor at the center of the screen every time. This does not go away automatically and must be manually moved away from the action.

Overall rating: 4.5/5.0

author: {'steamid': '76561197973941388', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1626059981}
review: I've been stuck at home with a cold and ended up playing this for 12 hours in 2 days, and I can honestly say it's soothed all my discomfort away.  I just now finished unlocking my last achievement (and I NEVER have the patience to 100% games), and my only regret is that I have no more pinball left to play.  The gameplay is simple enough to feel fluid and intuitive, but with enough twists (such as the grappling hook and bombs) on top of the standard pinball mechanics to make something fresh and entirely the game's own.  There ARE a small number of collectibles that are so finicky to collect that it feels borderline mean, but those are few in number and all entirely optional; everything else, while at times challenging, is rarely frustrating.  This is a game that WANTS you to enjoy every flip, jump, and noisemaker toot.  From the beautiful soundtrack, to the fluidity of movement, to the vibrant colors and lovely island vistas, Yoku radiates joy in its design, and I can't remember the last time I had this much raw FUN playing something.  Maybe that's just the cold meds talking, but really, if you're on the fence, give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119297007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 410, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1629147557}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072550691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1626034993}
review:
I love the combo of metroidvania and pinball but the rest of the game mechanics are poorly developed. The main character moves painfully slow. I thought my computer was lagging at first but noticed that everything else moved at a normal speed. It was just my character that was walking/swimming/falling at a glacial pace. That combined with everything being very far apart and inaccessible via fast-travel makes this very frustrating to play. I think over half the time I've played has just been backtracking. God help you if you fall from up high and have to get back to where you were. 

If you want to fill the Ori-shaped hole in your chest then give this a try or just replay Ori.

review: Tout à fait charmant et très réussi graphiquement, ce mélange de metroidvania et de jeu de flipper qui semble sorti d'une combinaison de genres tirés aléatoirement fonctionne très bien. En dehors de certains passages qui demandent un timing extrêmement serré, le jeu s'explore et se boucle assez rapidement mais sans être ni trop long, ni trop court pour ce qu'il a à proposer. Une franche réussite !

author: {'steamid': '76561197967399452', 'num_games_owned': 1236, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1625409728}
review:
La fusion entre un Metroid et une table de flipper… ça fait bizarre dit comme ça.
Le jeu a une courbe de difficulté très accessibles; les challenges les plus difficiles sont bien évidemment à la fin, et ne sont pas excessivement longs afin de ne pas frustrer le joueur.
Pour le reste, les environnements sont superbes et les contrôles très rapide à prendre en main.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987890405', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1625374563}
review: This game was super good. I absolutely love the characters and their designs. The gameplay is simple and not too challenging. It is a little on the short side (I managed to get 100% of the achievements with my playtime), but I don't think that is a negative thing here. I think the game did what it wanted to do and didn't overstay its welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409390572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1630700221}
review:
I've only tried a few Metroidvanias before, but none of them really caught my interest. However, a friend recommended Yoku's Island Express, and the pinball idea looked fun, so I gave it a shot. 
Fantastic decision.

Yoku sees you set forth as a beetle postmaster on a tropical island, exploring around as you help people out, all while collecting many goodies along the way. Everything is tightly woven together, making backtracking easy, and the pinball mechanics are a blast to use. There's a few upgrades later that give you extra options and open up new areas, and none of them feel underutilized. It's a shorter game, but if anything, it's better for it, as nothing overstays its welcome.

Edit: A new randomized mode was recently added, which gives you a random unlock when collecting one. This covers pretty much everything you'll pick up, and unless you turn off the logic, is still built to avoid softlocking you behind a progression gate. It's lots of fun and a great way to replay the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182282971', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1625319340}
review: I'm not the biggest pinball fan, but this game caught my eye somehow. Even with a basic premiss (fetch and deliver stuff around the map), it is clever and fun, with cool characters and an unique and relaxing soundtrack that made me happy while making Yoku bounce around haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561199092078408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1642387169}
review: 某些卡关简直是。。。。。我觉得这可能就是在折磨自己。。。垃圾。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075868257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1625289585}
review:
It's a very well made game with unique gameplay, but be warned that the main quest line is only about 5-7 hours long (even less if you're actually good at pinball).
After you've done the main quest and a few side quests, what remains is just a collect-a-thon, and some of the achievements sound like they were invented purposely to try your patience.

I'm fairly certain that I'd be disappointed with it had I bought it at full price, but on sale it's a good deal.
The main reasons I'm giving it an upvote are the unique gameplay and the sheer level of polish on the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447278228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1625046768}
review:
Un jeu de flipper bien sympa. Les graphismes sont beaux et la musique assez cool, donc l'immersion est réussie.
On se sent un peu perdu au début, surtout devant l'enchaînement de flippers et de labyrinthes de plate-forme. Cette impression passe une fois arrivé au village et où on commence saisir la trame du jeu.
Les contrôles sont simples et la dynamique de la balle prévisible. Une fois le coup de main acquis, il est facile de viser pour activer des interrupteurs.
Seul bémol: la méthode d'acquisition de certains collectibles n'est pas évidente et est aléatoire à mettre en oeuvre. Mais ce cas n'est valable que pour 5-6 objets, donc concerne plutôt les completionistes et les chasseurs de succès.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049156087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1624800559}
review:
ピンボールメトロヴァニア
100％コンプリートまで12時間ほど遊べた
決してカジュアルゲームではない
主人公はフンコロガシの郵便配達員ヨク、と持ってる玉
地面にはボタンに対応した青と黄色の弾き棒（フリッパー）が何個も設置してある
フリッパーのどこで打つとどっちに球が飛ぶか考えながら目的地に球を運ぶゲーム
トゲに落ちると通貨代わりの果物が減るがゲームオーバーは特に無い
むしろトゲに落ちまくることがイベント発生フラグなのでミスは気にしなくていい
ストーリーはフンコロガシが辿り着いた島の神が神食いに狙われているので島の3勢力の長に助けを求める話
ゲームは一日一時間とかぬるいこと言ってると慣れるだけで終わる
3つの長を村に連れてきたら地図持ったハムスターに報告するとラストバトル
キャラの体力アップとか特にないので無視してアイテム集めを始めてもボス倒してもほぼ一緒
キャラが可愛いらしいがBGMはおしゃれ
100％コンプリートしたいときは千里眼があれば普通にできる、入手場所をググるといい
時限イベントとかは特にないっぽいので良心的
自由にジャンプはできないので届かないところのアイテムは大体ナメクジ爆破で飛ぶしかない
カメの上の藤の根はマップ右上側にある池の隠し通路から取るやつ
久しぶりに良いゲームだった
もしトロフィーコンプを狙うなら最初から全てのスカラベを起動させながらプレイしたほうがいい
日本語あり、箱丸コン対応

author: {'steamid': '76561198061254669', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1624637570}
review:
«Метроидвания» скрещенная с «пинболом»
 Что? Почему? Зачем?
Безумцы! Экстраваганты! Молодцы!

Запускаешь с мыслью «пару минут на посмотреть, а дальше жду карточки». Буквально через 5 минут мысли сменяются на размышления о пути, который закрыт туманом и даёт лишь направление десятком заданий. Фантастические существа причудливы внешностью и поведением. Они рассказывают о невероятном и встраивают нас в глобальную историю острова. Незатейливая музыка наигрывает приятные ритмы и подловит на ощущении, что ваша голова уже покачивается в такт. 

Разносим письма и посылки, спасаем мир. 
Мы всегда связаны с нашим... комочком навоза. Может и другая консистенция, но несколько персонажей довольно уверенно говорили о том самом. Именно шарик нам очень необходим для преодоления сотен преград и путей. Мир наполнен флипперами, бамперами и прочим содержанием пинбольного стола. Некоторые места будут ярко выражены формой стола. Это отдельное место, где у нас будет задача расчистить место, нажать всякие рычаги и просто проскакать куда повыше. 

Самое важное — управление не вызывает никаких проблем. Приемлемый уровень вызова играет бросает при желании пройти её на 100%. Периодически нужны нестандартные решения, но решаются улучшениями и подручными средствами. Немного раздражали перемещения с толканием шара снизу вверх. Подглючивает, но не смертельно. 

Игра подходит вашему ребёнку и ребёнку внутри вас. 
Очень приятная. Ну, нельзя её пропускать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053596735', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1624398092}
review:
V životě mě nenapadlo, že bych někdy narazil na lepší pinball než Space Pinball ve starých XPčkách. Hra je o malém broučku Yoku, který je přivázaný ke kuličce a se stal pošťákem na ostrově, kde má doručit psaní do všech poštovních schránek. Zdá se to být jednoduchý úkol, ale ne všechna místa jsou jednoduše dostupná a je potřeba přemýšlet, nebo svoje pohyby správně načasovat a to dělá hru velmi chytlavou a zábavnou.
Pojednoduchém principu a odpočinkové hratelnosti hra vyniká po audiovizuální stránce - zde si může podat ruku s Amanitou. Nebo spíš se omluvím Amanitě, ale tento styl se mi líbil ještě víc.
Jediné, u čeho si povzdechnu je "chudák Yoku", jak je stále přivázaný ke kuličce a zažívá s ní všechny nárazy a pády a musím říct, že jich bylo. Divím se, že to celou dobu vydržel a nenadával více, nebo že to nevzdal a hru neodisntalovat za mě, nebo že nezničil PC.

PS: Hru jsem měl delší dobu v seznamu, co odehraji, a malé poděkování patří Panu Vávrovi, který o ní pozitivně mluvil a tak se dostala na řadu dříve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141237686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1624638840}
review:
Overall enjoyed this a lot! Cheerful little game, inventive and fun gameplay and the pinball physics feel good. Just enough collectaquest elements and a right-sized world for the character speed. I'm sitting at true end and 90% completion at 8 hours, for scale.

Caveats: Areas might be a little opaque if you don't "speak" pinball (lane markers, switching indicators with flippers, spinners, etc). If you're struggling to figure out what to do in the "board" areas, it might help to take a look at some gameplay of a "real" pinball machine, they're all referencing common design elements of conventional machines.

My negatives (speedrunner who used to hang out at a pinball arcade after work in grad school): movement outside of pinball style feels markedly worse. I have thumb tendon issues and finding out I had to mash A to swim when I got that ability was rather unwelcome - everything else feels fluid, why add mashing there? I'd personally want another challenge board or two in the game because the few that are in the game are brilliant - the boss battle boards are cool but can only be done once, the optional juicery board is fun but doesn't have a meaningful reward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037176619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1624483276}
review:
- Ajude Yoku em sua aventura, com personagens mágicos e fantásticos! Uma mistura de jogo de plataforma / metroidvania com elementos pinball! Simplesmente genial na minha humilde opinião. 

- O jogo é simples e curto, mas feito na medida certa. Você não enjoa desse game até o final.

- As batalhas contra os boss são legais e criativas (apesar de super fáceis), porém em um contexto geral o jogo é divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134219338', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1624578668}
review:
10/10, which I do not give lightly. The great concept and perfect execution is what makes this pinball adventure exactly what they were going for. The game is 2D but the scenery has a beautiful 3D aspect in the background and foreground. The music is great and that all ties the gameplay together for an enjoyable experience to anyone who enjoys pinball in any capacity whatsoever. The kicker here is that the pinball mechanics have a moderate but discrete amount of aim assist, so unlike real pinball where your ball can hit a wall or edge and just fall uneventfully, Yoku always gets sent towards something of interest on each "table" and it still requires aim but just leads to much less dead-ball time so even shots that don't go where you want still hit a ramp or bumper or something. The exploration definitely benefited from much playtesting where the traversal is enjoyable but when you open a shortcut or new traversal tool it feels even better getting across the map.
The boss fights are unexpectedly intense while preserving the fun tone of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198415727723', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1624273147}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086796541', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 1291, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1702649692}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028357488', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1630651108}
review:
ピンボールと、メトロイドヴァニアが見事なまでに完璧に隙間なくきっちりと寸分の誤差もなくピッタリと融合をはたした今作それがYOKUs island expressだ、どうもです数年に一度出る出ると言われ続けた幻の初作品にて秘宝神ゲーが出ると言われているがYokuが見事に大役をやってのけた、何が凄いかってそりゃおめぇピンボールだけでもよぅ100％、メトロイドヴァニアだけでもよぅ100％、いつもの2倍のジャンプがくわわって200％だ、よくもまぁこの2つ組み合わせたうえで神ゲーにまで仕上げたよね、その発想はなかったわ～。
各ボス戦も変化に富んでいて面白く、隠しステージ、MAP、アイテム集め等、検索も超たのしいキャラもPSの迷作MOONを彷彿とさせるキモかわ系ですべてにおいてケチのつけようがなくプレイ中はオラ、ワクワクがとまらなかったぞ、〔操作してて気持ちよくエレクトしっぱなしで←これが一番大事〕
処女作にして完璧超人を開発したVilla Gorilla今までにないまったく新しいジャンルのピンボールヴァニア。
いくら文章やトレーラーでオモロイドといってもやっぱりいじくりまわして、こねくり回してしゃぶってコリコリしないと伝わらないだすな、そろそろ3年か．．．2の発表きそうなヨ・カ・ン　快感

author: {'steamid': '76561198023548388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1577748085}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025102926', 'num_games_owned': 1729, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1625078915}
review:
I really liked the game... until I tried to get to Ivory Peaks and had to use the Leash thingy. That one basically needs a lot of luck to get it right, you have to get it right many times in a row, and if you don't you're back to the beginning. It works out initially since it didn't have that many steps, and occasionally there was room for error by walls guiding you, but eventually they ramped it up to a level that I couldn't handle, completely stopping my progress.

I tried it for 3 days, doing other quests in between, until I ran out of other quests to do because not everything is marked on the map and navigating blindly in the hope of finding the quest spot is tedious at best. There's also the possibility that I'm still missing abilities.

Other than that, the game is kind of nice. Having a platforming adventure with pinball mechanics is unusual for sure, and it made the game less boring than pinball games :-) There isn't much of a story, though. It looks great, sounds great, and the pinball sections aren't all that difficult because they game wants you to complete them eventually -- I haven't encountered timers, or "traps" resetting progress on a table, so no matter what you'd eventually hit the thing you need to hit.

Unfortunately, if I can't complete a game because they decided to put in a huge difficulty spike means I can't recommend it, obviously. Use at your own risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999905905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1623933836}
review:
I can't even remember why or when I got this game (possibly a Humble Bundle) but I tried it out at a loose end one day, not expecting much, and was immediately impressed. The gameplay is novel (a blend of platformer and pinball) and feels fun throughout (with a couple of brief frustrating sections - which seem mandatory in platformers!). 'Boss' battles feel interesting but never too hard, and map exploration and collecting is fun. The story and presentation is done well. Overall a great little game.

My one criticism is one can occasionally struggle to find the way to the next part of the game, which can be compounded when trying to mop up the final collectables; even with the Beeline, finding your way back to certain places on the map can become a chore (there was one section with a circuitous path that I kept forgetting!), but this is a minor quibble in an otherwise fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367894395', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 713, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1623943731}
review:
타이틀 이미지만 보고 Team17에서 배급하는 다른 게임인 Yooka-Laylee 시리즈인 줄 알고 라이브러리에 갖고 있으면서도 관심이 없었는데, 며칠 전에 전혀 다른 게임이라는 걸 알게 됐고 너무 흥미로워 보여서 해보게 됐습니다. 

딱정벌레목 풍뎅이과에 속하는 쇠똥구리가 모쿠마나 섬에 우편 배달부로 일하게 되면서 섬의 평화까지 되찾아주는 게임입니다. 메트로베니아에 핀볼의 게임성을 더한 게임이라는 개성을 넘어, 운이 좀 없는 "오리와 눈 먼 숲" 이라고 느껴지는 수작입니다.

수채화 같은 아트와 아기자기한 음악은 처음부터 눈과 귀를 사로잡고, 다양한 모습과 성격을 지닌 귀여운 NPC들은 게임 세계에 호감을 갖게 합니다. 메트로배니아의 재미를 느낄 수 있는 야무진 맵 구성과 짜증스럽지 않은 동선도 좋고, 맥락에 잘 어울리는 스킬 구성도 마음에 듭니다. 메인 스토리만 따라가면 5시간 이내에 엔딩을 볼 수 있을 만큼 짧지만, 서브 퀘스트와 수집 요소까지 모두 챙기면 적어도 두 배의 시간은 필요한 알찬 구성의 게임입니다.

다른 게임으로 오해하고 뒤늦게 즐긴 게 미안해질 만큼 재밌습니다. 메트로배니아를 좋아한다면 매우 추천합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968988584', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1659062679}

author: {'steamid': '76561198225371500', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1622884822}
review:
ピンボール初心者（子供含む）にこそおすすめしたい一品。

島全体がピンボール台になっており、そこらじゅうにあるフリッパーがすべて左右どちらかのボタンに反応する世界が楽しい。ボール(＝主人公)は自力で左右に動くことができ、フリッパーの端ギリギリから打ち上げるなどの微調整がやりやすい。失敗時のペナルティは緩く、所持金が少し減るだけで何度でもリトライできる。だからといって簡単すぎることはなくゲームを進めていくとそれなりの歯ごたえはある。
気軽にピンボールの楽しさに触れることが出来る上、背景もキャラクターも可愛らしく子供にも安心しておすすめできる。クリアまでのプレイ時間は短めだったものの、プレイ時間の大半は集中力が要るので感覚としてはたっぷり遊べた。
操作方法はゲームパッドの左右トリガー・キーボードの左右シフトどちらにも対応しておりどちら派もニッコリ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198258467884', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1623798745}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993298158', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1623745323}
review: My absolute favorite pinball-based metroidvania starring a dung beetle! This game is relatively short, but packs a lot of fun in all the same. I found it mostly relaxing, with the only frustration coming from misunderstanding how optional secrets were intended to be obtained. Despite that, I liked it well enough to go back and find almost all of the collectibles. The story and art style are both cute, and this may work well as a game for older kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101474409', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1623760495}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059775984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1625433074}
review:
This is the most heartwarming game I've played in a long time. You're a little ant with a ball who delivers letters and interacts with things using a party whistle! *fweee*

If you're wondering how metroidvania and pinball works together, they've somehow combined them seamlessly. Walking around is low-stress and you get to enjoy a wonderful environment and soundtrack. The actual pinball is varied, regularly introducing new mechanics, but never forcing you to stay in one place too long (although I found out I'm much worse at pinball than I remembered). The backtracking with abilities makes sense and is satisfying rather than time-wasting, especially because the artwork is so full of joy.

Buy this game, buy your friends this game, everyone should spend some time as an ant delivering mail with a party whistle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219711905', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1607138713}

author: {'steamid': '76561198352884943', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1623611311}

author: {'steamid': '76561198286599696', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1623416325}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a very fun metroidvania where the gameplay is similar to that of pinball tables.

That alone makes this a very unique and refreshing game, along with the absolutely joyous atmosphere surrounding everything that happens in it. The ability upgrades are quite unique and the way fast travel is handled is very cool too, although the placement of the bee lines don't quite make sense sometimes, and it would be nice if you would be able to hop on at any cannon, not just the outsides.

It's all very cartoonish, to the point where it fails ever being competitive. This is a strictly casual game (not including raging at the slugs). Getting the achievements (mainly the scarabs) is a bit grindy as you have to backtrack to every table in the game just to get the scarabs, as they aren't something you will go for right away.

In the end, I have some minor issues with the game but it was an enjoyable experience overall and as metroidvania's go this is one that is underrated and you should pick up. Do buy it on sale though.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030643073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1622953220}
review:
Pinball Metroidvania. 

Yeah you heard that right. It's a short, cute, highly creative game and I don't know where else you're going to find something like this. The art is great, it sounds great, the game is pretty fun. If you wan to play a pinball metroidvania, I highly recommend you play this game. 

There are some slight downsides, mostly with some of the systems at the fringe of the game. Some of the mechanics built around getting secrets and janky and poorly thought out. The game is maybe a little too easy and there aren't any boards that are impressive. None of this wares though since it is a short game.

 It has five to six hours of play time for beating it and 8 to 9 for 100%. 

Fun game 7/10

review:
[h1] Flip Through a Beautiful Island [/h1]
An unusual combination, [b]Metroidvania and Pinball[/b], seems to make the core mechanics of this game refreshing and fun. In true Metroidvania fashion, the game has a few abilities and the Pinball flippers contribute to most of the game's mechanics other than the basic movement to the left and the right. The story is childish but a fun time. If you like the pitch you will love the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975761700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1622597207}
review:
This game is a fantastic surprise. I know it has good reviews, but I was even more impressed playing it. I don't think a mixture of pinball and adventure platforming could be made better on a first game. The world and characters are have a perfect presence. They are a charming addition, as is the story, but they don't weigh the game down. You just keep on pin-balling through the game and having a good time. I played the game straight through. My main disappointment is that I played through it so fast. 

I hope there is a sequel, with more abilities and a larger world!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998117884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1612662366}
review:
Pros:

- Good music
- Nice art style
- Well optimized

Cons:

- Gameplay is fun for 10 minutes then gets old fast. Every section of the game that involves actual gameplay and not just walking around is repetitive.
- Most of the game is centered around travelling and walking around is very slow. There's no way to speed up your character. There's 'fast travel' but it's terrible and covers only some parts of the map
- There's no real progression in the game. No upgrades, no skills, nothing significant that increases as you play.
- The pinball mechanic largely relies on timing and luck

Aside from the nice artwork, the world is empty and lifeless, there's no motivation to explore it.

I don't find the characters interesting at all, they feel forced and don't seem to have any real purpose.

Overall, very boring.

В коллекцию однозначно!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006332787', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1622148299}
review:
[h1] Too Long; Didn't Read [/h1]

This game is like a doctorate in fun, everything is so cute and it has a great flow.
I know metroidvania and pinball sounds weird, but once you start playing it immediately makes sense.
It took me about 12 hours to 100% and now that it’s over I feel empty inside and want more.
I highly recommend trying this one out!

[h1] Not Long Enough; Did Read [/h1]

You control Yoku, a cute little dung beetle that rolls his ball around but can’t jump, instead you’ve got flippers and paddles scattered everywhere that you use to traverse the map.

Because of this and the fact that [i] some [/i] paddles have sort of a “scripted” trajectory you can only go where the game wants you to, so movement is very deliberate and smooth.

And then you’ve got the "pinball areas" which use all the same elements you've used so far but in a somewhat enclosed space where you just go crazy and have to complete objectives in various ways to advance.

The open world and enclosed spaces are all interconnected in the same way you'd expect from any other metroidvania and the map reminds me a lot of that of Ori and the Blind Forest.

You progressively unlock a fast travel mechanic called the Beeline which eventually covers around half of the map, it has several pick up spots where you could hop on and drop off in any stop along the way.
The Beeline may be lacking a bit in coverage of lines and pick up spots, but it makes up for it with also being used to get to certain places and items you couldn’t access otherwise.

Besides the main story you've got many side quests, abilities and collectibles, one notable collectible type are the scarabs, located in the “pinball areas” you have little stone scarabs that you need to charge by performing multiple passes over until they bust open and spill all their fruit (currency), you don’t get anything special from them in particular but there’s an achievement if you collect them all.

Overall, albeit short this game amazing and crazy fun.
Definitely worth the full price, and if you catch it on a discount you shouldn’t miss it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101733344', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1622180111}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053754931', 'num_games_owned': 2188, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1622091244}
review:
[b]Metroidvania de Pinball aunque no te lo creas[/b]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36430761-KurareMHM/][quote]Para más recomendaciones hace click wachin[/quote][/url]

Me negaba a pensar que un juego puede considerarse Metroidvania si no tenia combates de ningún tipo, pero este juego me cerro el ort0 
La primer hora parece un juego de puzzles de pinball y ya, pero cuando termina lo que seria el tutorial se vuelve un Metroidvania incluso mejor que varios famosos, el escenario es solo 1 escenario GIGANTE, no hay pantallas de carga, no es tedioso recorrer los escenarios como suele pasar, no te perdes, los atajos son divertidos de usar, el explorar también. Realmente el desbloquear habilidades me hizo darme cuenta que podría haber tenido enemigos si quería el juego, pero era innecesario y hubieran simplemente sido un elemento que entorpecía la experiencia de exploración y agregaba de forma artificial horas al juego. 

Un juego muy relajante y muy bueno la verdad, me hizo redefinir mi concepto de meotridvanias la verdad.  No gana un Goty pero vale la pena, eso si, te tienen que gustar los puzzles, en lugar de plataformeo hay pluzzes basicamente. Luego el resto de exploración, desbloquear zonas y habilidades, etc son del genero

author: {'steamid': '76561198116486796', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1630741641}
review:
難度中等，趣味性很棒。非常推薦入手遊玩。

以下是遊玩時的重點提醒，無劇透
1.球才是本體，所以穿衣服是給球穿，在對話時NPC給的建議都是在提示你球的噴塗上有固定的款式才能過關，這需要你找到特定的噴頭才行。
2.水果基本上用不完，每個關卡都能拿大量水果，所以不用太省。
3.所有支線都沒有負面的劇情，所以盡量觸發沒關係。
4.如果你希望100%全成就，每個關卡都有分布幾隻甲蟲，在打關時甲蟲會逐漸發光直到張開翅膀就代表開好了，全地圖甲蟲全開是一個成就，所以希望100%那麼一開始在每個關卡都建議盡量把甲蟲全開完。

author: {'steamid': '76561199008057487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1622096023}

review: Fun concept of pinball implemented in a story game

author: {'steamid': '76561198420187841', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1633156075}
review:
有趣，好玩，休闲。音乐和美术风格很可爱，场景设计也很不错。
玩法是街机弹珠台加上半开放世界。我是6个多小时通关，9个半小时全成就（全收集），这之后甚至有点怅然若失，感觉还想再多些内容。打折买的，十几块我觉得血赚。半价左右就很值得入了，如果你怀念当年的三维弹球或者想来一个可爱的休闲小游戏。
如果打完剧情想全收集的话，建议先做魔术师和蘑菇的任务，这两个给的都是还算有用的强化，然而我是全收集玩才去交的任务。。。都没怎么体验到
