author: {'steamid': '76561197972299640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1621886826}
review:
This game is an adventure platformer with pinball mechanics. You play as a small beetle which is tethered to a ball. The one doesn't affect the other to a great degree though, and the "perspective" switches between the ball and the beetle automatically. The beetle really only comes into play when the ball is'n actively moving, and his job is to push it around.

You move between areas by playing pinball, and these sections can span several "tables". The main elements of the pinball part of the game is recognizable from actual pinball, but there's plenty of creative variety and unique elements. You are rewarded fruit by making shots or a series of objectives. If the ball drains you lose some fruit. It's a very forgiving game in this regard. I never managed to run out of fruit, so I'm not sure what happens if you run out. Some tables are harder than others, but generally by no means hard. Some shots can be difficult, especially those where you have to bring a "power-up" from one place to another.

Our beetle friend finds himself washed up on a tropical island, and it appears he's the next postman. It soon becomes clear, however, that not all is well in this little paradise, and it's up to you to save the day and help creatures with their problems along the way. Oh, and of course you have to deliver some mail and packages. You don't have to follow any specific path except in the beginning, but some areas are harder to reach that others. There are plenty of places to discover and treasures to loot. There are plenty of save points spread around.

All in all, it's a very charming game, and it's fun. It's generally a bit too easy, I think, but there are some difficulties also, especially if you want to get all the collectibles and achievements. It's mostly child friendly, but there is some slight sinister elements also. There are a few annoyances, but nothing major. The game runs fine, and it has a good atmosphere to it. The characters have "gibberish" vocals, which is a bit of a shame, but understandable from a developer point of view. I ran the game on a rather weak machine, but I had to select the option to run the game in full screen to avoid lag. The preference isn't saved, for some reason.

This one definitely gets a thumbs up from me. There could have been a bit more content, maybe, but what's there is mostly good. Expect somewhere in the range of 7-12 hours of gameplay, depending on how much of a completionist you are, and if you have to return to areas for quests after you've been there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077050936', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1635091761}
review:
Metroidvania×三维弹球

+能力方面做出了自己的特色，基本抛弃了常见的平台跳跃要素——至少主角自始至终都不能跳。
+即便操作手段被限制，地图设计依然富有多样性和层次感。
+染色拿门卡的机制比隔壁supraland要完整且有趣得多，但最后用到的场合不多。
+使用蜂道快速旅行时的演出和音乐很棒。

-隐藏要素基本依赖蛞蝓。
-完美主义者。

9.1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025057564', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1669605919}
review: This is an amazing Pinball adventure that keeps you asking for more. It is very child-themed, and is somewhat easy to play, but don't expect to complete the game in a couple of sittings. This is a very long, fruitful adventure, and every time you feel like you've mastered it, something new comes along to challenge you. My only criticism is that it really is just a hair difficult for kids to play, despite being heavily themed for PG gameplay. Many difficulty barriers probably need past Pinball experience to progress, which is an uncommon genre today. If you want a game that may age with a kid a bit, though, this should be a strong option. It is also very enjoyable for older users who treasure the gameplay over storyline, as this Pinball adventure will be quite the challenge to complete, with a few other fun mechanics to freshen up the gameplay as you move along.

review:
8時間30分程で全実績解除
メトロイドヴァニア＋ピンボールのゲーム
ピンボールなので、ジャンプは無く横移動のみ
ピンボール部分がかなりシビアに感じました。

実績は、基本、閃きと根気でなんとかなります。
少し、高い所はなめくじを爆破させて、ジャンプします。
入れない所はボールの色を変えます。(ジュースはドクロ、ハチはミツバチ、赤とんがりは赤)
キックバックは、最後、雪山の隠し洞窟にいるので許せば実績が取れます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100871281', 'num_games_owned': 4297, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1621615380}
review:
不错的冒险游戏，

注意1：主角不会跳！主角不会跳！主角不会跳！
一些看上去需要跳上去的地方，附加都会有虫子吸，调整好角度吧主角炸上去。

注意2：整个游戏只有一个卡关的地方，就是骷髅帮的果汁店，那儿有2个柳条和2个圣甲虫。如果你第一次就把果汁灌满而4个收集没拿的话就删档重来吧，后期拿了骷髅球来，NPC也只是给你几个水果而不会开门的，惨痛的教训啊！正确的做法①第一次就收集个4个然后灌满果汁，不过我没成功过②进去收集，不灌果汁，失败门关了后就走，后期拿了骷髅球再来开门。

注意3：有个隐藏关和成就在弹珠里掉下荆棘50次后，拿红球去开启，大家应该不会漏掉吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072244684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1623964949}
review: Pinball meets Metroidvania, an interesting idea and well executed. The gameplay is fluid and feels good, the game looks great and the soundtrack is nice! It also doesn't take too long to beat (it took me around 11 hours to get 100%) which is a big plus for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168495633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1621198027}
review:
Pog böceği Yoku, işsizliğin hat safhada olduğu bu dönemde, sonunda bir iş bulur ve postacı olmak üzere Mokumana Adası'na yolculuğa çıkar. Adaya geldikten kısa bir süre sonra burada işlerin hiçte yolunda olmadığını farkedecektir.
Metroidvania tarzının pinball ile birleştiği bu oyun oldukça eğlenceli ve sevimli. %100 başarıma ulaşmaya çalışırken sıkılmadığım nadir oyunlardan. Oynamanızı kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047983970', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1621403127}
review:
Соник Пинболл + Рейман
Если эти две игры вам греют душу,то вы на нужной страничке в стиме.
Что нужно знать - игра зашкаливает милотой, здесь нельзя умереть,сюжет это борьба со злом,а ещё дают роль почтальена и ты действительно будешь бегать по всей локации ради посылок и писем (это даже понравится).
Геймплей тут прост - это платфер метроидвания на основе пинболла.
Музыка очень милая и приятная а картинка очень насыщенная и порой динамичная.
Игра очень расслабляет, здесь нет адреналина, но в этом её прелесть.
Есть минусы в плане маловато боссфайтов и небольшая продолжительность (никто не мешает правда собрать все коллектоболсы после сюжета).
По итогу - замечательная игра. Цена со скидкой была просто смешная. Просто грех такую прелесть не взять)

review: Metroidvania + Pinball ??? I too scoffed at the idea but it pulls it off perfectly. The pinball traversal is fast and fun, unlike most 'vanias which if were honest are mostly slow and stiff till the late endgame. In Yoku the whole focus is on movement through this pinball world and it works great with a bucket list of collectables and power ups to keep things cool. Games visually perfect as-well. Give it a spin!

review: Muy buen juego, con mecánicas simples pero divertidas, y que requieren gran dominio. El juego cuenta con un arte gráfico precioso, una agradable banda sonora tropical, y a mi consideración una duración decente. Los logros están bien propuestos, accesibles y nada surrealistas, no soy de completar todos los logros y aquí lo logré sin mucho problema. Sin duda una buena decisión de compra para los amantes del pinball.

author: {'steamid': '76561199063269904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1675221939}
review: Yoku's Island Express is a super cute, pinball platformer game with easy mechanics, a simple story line, and pretty music. It is super fun and you'll find yourself burning through time without even realizing it. Although the game is simple, it can be a little challenging and it may take you a few times to get past each little puzzle. The worst thing about the game is that you may accidentally fall all the way down through the progress you made and you'll have to bounce yourself all the way back up. But, that is part of the journey! I do not think I would buy this game at full price, however, buying it on sale (especially the $3.99 sale) is most certainly worth it. I would definitely be interested in a sequel of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199138005283', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1621693895}
review:
一个敲好玩的类恶魔城+弹珠游戏，几块钱买个key绝对赚到。
简直爷青回，还记得当年的太空军校生，几个人抢电脑一玩玩一天，轮流刷新排行榜，有时候都能撕起来XDDD
任务路线不是线性的，地图内容的设置很多样，探索自由度高，画风可爱，题材结合又很新颖。发射、掉落、得分！再发射、再掉落、再得分！我是一只快乐的小小鸟ヾ(✿ﾟ▽ﾟ)ノ如果音乐做的能更出彩点、更贴合游戏风格些就完美了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198353953553', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1621263977}

author: {'steamid': '76561198176675135', 'num_games_owned': 3350, 'num_reviews': 2843, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1621169302}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分【7.5分】[/h1]
这是一款开放世界的弹珠游戏，手绘画面十分精致，玩法非常新颖，操作上用弹珠来取代平台跳跃，同时玩家可以自由探索岛屿上的各个区域，完成任务的路线并不是固定的。
弹珠台在国外十分流行，国内却鲜能先到实物，本作在本质上就是一款弹珠游戏，请根据个人喜好决定是否入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989766649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1621173761}
review:
Where do I start with this one.. So, it truly is a perfect hybrid of pinball and metroidvania in which you play an adorable dungbeetle simply loving his job as a postman working on what I assume is Cthulhu’s uncles tropical island. You begin the game by easing into the intricacies of pinballing only to add more and more abilities to your repertoire and soon enough you will be hoovering up explosive sludges and beelining (in this game it is litteral) along the landscape while screaming in pure joy. 

Story, gameplay, artwork and character design is fantastic and I was never a huge fan of pinball to begin with. It also manages to capture the utterly ridiculous state the Swedish post delivery service is in at the moment with a drab cynical flair that I think is highly unintentional.. 

Highly recommended on all accounts, Yoku is one helluva bug!

author: {'steamid': '76561199158173797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1663024073}
review:
Wow. What an absolute delight of a game. I got Yoku's Island Express in the Earth Day Humblebundle, not knowing much about the game at all. I started playing on a whim and have been completely obsessed! 

The art is incredibly charming and what drew me to the game in the first place. All the different game zones have a distinct feel that is well executed in visuals, puzzle design, and soundtrack.  The npcs are funky and quirky in their design and dialogue. The music is beautiful and really gets you into a groove to power through the puzzles. Trick shots are easily my favorite part of the game. They range widely in skill, timing, and knowledge of in-game mechanics in order to pull off and the most stubborn ones are immensely satisfying when you nail them. 

I could literally go on forever about how great this game is and how much I enjoyed playing it to completion. If you're unsure or even on the fence, I would urge you to give it a go as it has easily become one of my all time favorite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043905366', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1620679817}
review:
I've heard an awful lot about Yoku's Island Express as a recommendation for indie games. I've got to say, it is an indie gem of it's own that's not to be overlooked. The premise of this game is that you're a dung beetle who's job is to be the postmaster of an island filled with an assortment of creature characters. Your job isn't just to deliver letters and packages, but as well as just do general favors around the island. There is a threat that risks losing the island and it's up to you, to fix it.

The uniqueness of this platforming metroidvania, is it's implement of pinball mechanics. In that being, you'll come across many parts of the island where there is pinball flippers, bumpers, pads and railings for you to explore with. All the while collecting fruit to unlock more bumpers to use and other methods to get yourself around. It is rather a very intriguing feature that's well put in a game that sounds awkward on paper to do.

The visuals are pleasant to indulge in, the sound and music is practically chill to relax into and the overall package of the game is rather fun. My only takeaway is that sometimes, the pinball physics may kinda make you annoyed. The kind of physics where no matter how precise you are with the flipper, you're going to go that direction and there are only three available ways for you to flip with. I've had a moment where I kept shooting off and ramming into just the edge of platform multiple times. Though, it's not as aggravating since you're able to influence the movement by moving your character around, it just takes patience in doing so.

Rewarding, engaging and overall good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166937235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1612289036}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974618029', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1570747586}
review:
Daniel Vavra (Mafia , Kingdom Come) LOVES THIS GAME.

There are still two traditional Czech computer game paper magazines on the market. In one of them called Level, every month Daniel Vavra has a two-page opinion chapter called Hell's Pit. In the recent issue of the magazine (Level 298) he scolds that AAA games are very average these days, only a few with original ideas, many of them have dumb gameplay and level design. He gradually criticizes basically all the games he saw or played this year. Days Gone. Death Stranded. Crackdown 3. Anthem. Rage 2. Wolfenstein: Youngblood. Control. Even trailer for The Last of Us 2. And then he continues with this passage:

---
"And then I was looking on Game Pass for something my daughter could play, so it wasn't too violent and it looked nice and not a kitsch. She chose something from the picture with a name you can't remember, called Yoku's Island Express. It is an open-world platformer somehow mixed with pinball. And you can't die in it. I played with my daughter and when she went to bed I played it for 4 more hours alone, because it's absolutely awesome.

Technically it's brilliant. It is not done like most similar games from tilesets, but the whole giant world is hand-painted. But when the drawings start to move, they are a bit 3D, the light works in them and so on. And even though you cannot die, it's hard. But just so much that you'll never be stuck long enough to make you bored, it keeps you entertained. I haven't played such a good game in a long time.

Because today's world is a mess, of course, this absolutely godly, beautiful, original, fun game went through unrecognised, with most people preferring to beat off to the millionth copy of moronic franchise made by multinational corporation, looking for something that simply is not there."
---

So here you are. 
Not exactly my review, is it, yet a review by a proper game designer.
However I agree completely with Dan (played it on the other account).

author: {'steamid': '76561198269558170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1619924438}
review:
主线差不多10小时，全成就再加几个小时。
总体来说还蛮有意思，就是赶路很反人类，捷径不够多，很多地方想二次穿过还得玩一遍弹珠看脸。
荡秋千比较反人类，有几个地方要连续荡，我甩了半小时差点砸手柄。
蛞蝓炮弹本来挺有意思的，但是那个方向真不好确定，经常赶着时间跑到点上对方向的时候炸了。吸尘器的升级也没看懂，一次吸两只蛞蝓有啥用。
成就方面别的还好，完美主义者简直反人类，剩余圣甲虫数量还很多的时候大地图上压根不提示你的，只有自己满地图摸到只剩10个以下了才会显示哪里哪里还有甲虫。
蜜蜂大炮真好玩，我能玩一天。

author: {'steamid': '76561198024340430', 'num_games_owned': 2082, 'num_reviews': 7498, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1619825264}
review: SONIC SPINBALL BUT WITHOUT THE HORRIFYING GAME OVER MUSIC

author: {'steamid': '76561198273673030', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1634050536}
review:
爆好玩，各方面超出预期。
买的时候看Steam主图以为尤库是只鸟，游戏开始看到形象好像是蚂蚁，结果汉化都是叫小瓢虫，玩到70%才意识到这不是屎壳郎吗？球跟身子绑着绳子就没反应过来。
游戏风格很接近奥日的类银河城冒险游戏，流程以一张大地图中的【不断探索→重复收集道具→完成任务获得新能力】来推进剧情，特色是以三维弹珠取代普通跳跃为主要玩法的平台弹跳游戏模式，能把屎壳郎推的球跟弹珠结合真的挺新奇的，前期有个喇叭可以交互，之后可以吸蛞蝓当作炸弹用，也可以下水探索，后期有个煤球可以当钩爪吸住花来荡。基本没什么难度，也没有失败惩罚（只有统计次数），顶多让你退一步，时长也不会折磨人，很休闲。我很喜欢蜂道大炮的跑图方式，虽然没有设计成传送门那么便捷但是很有个性。
手绘画风可爱而鲜亮，NPC丰富有趣，不同部族有各自的小故事和任务，骷髅帮、太空教士等……BOSS也都是萌萌哒，加上轻快的BGM，海风和岛屿的氛围浓郁，特别合家欢。
收集这块比探索复杂，成就收集品拿到地图后基本都有标注，宝箱比较好发现但是不一定好拿，邮箱相对容易，柳条算是无限的水果之外的主要收集品，藏得比较深，十个柳条可以点个火炬，全亮后可以孵出个像海马的神兽带你遨游天际（相当于隐藏结局吧）。比较有意思的是球能收集五种喷漆，还可以两两结合成新图案，有的可以用作身份证明。最容易错过的可能是弹珠图里的甲壳虫印记要点亮，好像要在当前区域地图上才会显示蓝色标记，因此不看成就挺难注意到的。种蘑菇也是件挺麻烦的差事，只有提示地点，要找找地图上的一滩泥。

author: {'steamid': '76561198312410765', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1619722042}
review: This game is fun. It's a simple pinball game with a puzzle element mixed into it. My main complaint is that the game is short. I 100% it in about 11 hours and beat the story in even less time. The story is very simple. The music is nice to listen to. Each environment has a unique feel and are all visually different from each other. The gameplay is simple. There are a few mechanics that get unlocked like a metroidvania, but overall, the gameplay is very simple. The world map is fairly small despite looking large. This game is worth checking out when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055813366', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1619531587}
review:
[h1][i]No dobrze zacznijmy od tego, że uwielbiam Pinball'a

  Wszystko zaczęło się od Windowsa Xp i darmowego 
"3D Space Cadet Pinball" 
Yoku's Island Express jest: "wymieszaniem" elementów zręcznościówki oraz pinballa.

W grze wcielamy się w żuka - listonosza, który za pomocą swojej magicznej "kuli" za zadanie ma
dostarczyć przesyłki odpowiednim osobom.
 Oczywiste jest, że podczas swojej podróży 
napotkamy na nie lada przeszkodę, ale to nie powstrzymuje 
Nas, by osiągnąć wybrany cel.

Sama Fabuła jest przyjemna dla oka, świetny bajkowy styl graficzny oraz wspaniały klimatyczny soudtrack.
Jestem szczęśliwy, iż miałem możliwość spróbowania sił i ukończenia Gry w 100%, 
wspaniale się przy tym bawiąc.

Team17 potrafi rozpieszczać graczy swoimi grami i było tak w przypadku tego tytułu.
Polecam więc tę gre i mam nadzieje, że i Wam przypadnie ona do gustu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122143729', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1630905317}
review: Somehow Yoku's Island Express has squeezed its way into my number one game of all time slot. The first time I played the game, I played through the entire game in one sitting until 7am and then slept through all my classes the next day. That's certainly an argument for it being a great game, but then I did something I've never done before with a game: I played through it again at least once, if not twice a year, every year, on three different systems to date. Yoku is both a pinball game and a metroivania and also neither of those because that would be reductive. The map is comprised of numerous individual mini tables connected and linked by tunnels and flippers into a magnificent adventurous world. The soundtrack is phenomenal, something I listen to regularly, and the art and environment is so pure and wonderful it's impossible to not fall in love. Other games have made me cry, or cheer, or whatever else, but somehow no game has made me Feel™ like Yoku does every time I play it. My only complaint is that the game is so unknown that there is no merch or sign of a sequel anywhere. If you like Ori and the Blind Forest or just joy in general, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994127301', 'num_games_owned': 1899, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1619295095}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990355473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1619269800}
review:
La verdad que ha sido una grata sorpresa!! No tenía demasiada fe en este juego y me ha demostrado que estaba completamente equivocado.

Consigue hacer de un juego de pinball una experiencia muy amena, con historia mediante, con personajes que van hilvanando sus misiones secundarias con la principal de una forma que no desentona en nada.

Gráficamente es muy colorido tanto en escenarios dentro de un mismo mapa para diferenciar las zonas, como en los propios personajes. Musicalmente está compuesto por una canción por zona que acabas silbando o tatareando
Es poco rejugable, pero sí tiene muchos coleccionables y misiones secundarias que alargan un poco el juego. Personalmente pienso que le falta algún modo adicional que pueda alargar el juego, como algún modo arcade donde conseguir la máxima puntuación posible, pero tengo claro que no es el objetivo del juego, si no que quiere contarnos una historia, lo cual hace de forma sublime.

Muy recomendable!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971880699', 'num_games_owned': 2849, 'num_reviews': 419, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1618924085}
review:
Duration: 5 hours for the main campaign/story.  Still lots of collectables to find, but I think I'm done. 

Yoku's Island Express surprised me.  It's a run around and collect stuff, solving platforming puzzles etc.  The twist, which I didn't know when I started, was that instead of fighting and jumping.... you are a pinball! 

The game alternates running around with the joystick and using the left and right triggers to operate the flippers found throughout the world.  I like pinball, so I enjoyed Yoku.  Sometimes I got a little confused where to go next, but the helpful characters in the village usually gave a hint.  Finishing the whole story in just over 5 hours, obviously it wasn't too hard.  The Polynesian style music was also enjoyable.  

Worth playing.  7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121272715', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1618924699}

author: {'steamid': '76561199015513645', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1618943077}
review:
15時間ほどでほぼすべてのアイテムを収集してエンディングを迎えました。
ピンボールと謎解き要素?を足した個性派なアドベンチャーゲームです。
独特な世界観に惹かれるものがあって良いです。一度通った場所は途中から使える”ビーライン”というものでスムーズに移動できるのでストレスなく楽しめました。

ピンボールは後半シビアになってきますが、そのころには慣れているので心配はいらないでしょう。
収集アイテムやサブクエストなどもあり、やりごたえ抜群でした。
一人でサクサク進めたい方や、新しいものに触れてみたい方にお勧めしたい作品です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198017664566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1618594484}
review:
아기자기한 핀볼
이거 한줄로 정리가 되는 게임
스토리는 요쿠섬에 새로운 우채부(대충 이것저것 다하는 직업, 세상쯤은 구하고도 남음)가 되어 섬을 탐험하는것
그래픽은 언럭키 오리 라 해도 될 정도로 아름답다
ost가 열대섬의 느낌을 완벽하게 살려 게임 내내 흥겨운 느낌을 준다
핀볼을 붙혀놓은 게임 디자인은 극한의 독창성을 가져온다
문제? 너무 쌈마이한 감성의 게임이라 접근이 힘들고 맵이 너무 넓다
힐링... 보단 갬성적인 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198876069044', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1616089791}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354114117', 'num_games_owned': 2891, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1618064355}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is an unusual combination of a typical metroidvania game with a pinball/flipper, which sounds unbelievably silly, but turns out to be extremely successful. The developers, the Swedish studio Villa Gorilla, had a very interesting idea for their game. The pinball element is very nicely woven into the main game, we never feel like we suddenly jumped to another game. All the "tables" have a place and a specific task, many of them optional as paths to additional secret passages or areas. 
Yoku's Island Express has a fabulous graphic design. Mokumana Island is simply beautiful, starting from the initial forest-jungle locations, through more desert / swampy parts of the game, to snow-capped peaks and dark caves. Hand-drawn graphics looks dazzling and although not everyone may like it, especially the feeling of "watery" surroundings, it impressed me no less than the graphics of the Ori and the Blind Forest. The music is as nice as the graphics, although no song stayed in my memory as in the mentioned Ori.
Great game, that I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1617934444}
review: Well, I don't know how to rate "Yoku's Island Express."  On one hand, it's a very well done platformer/pinball crossbreed,  On the other, it's a platformer/pinball crossbreed.  In general, I don't like platformers.  And, crossing it with pinball just makes it even harder for me to get around in it.  I managed to get about 5 hours into it before I just gave up because I'm incapable of playing it.  If you like platformers, I'd say go for it.  But, for my use, I'm sorry to say that I'm not recommending it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313597525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1681206643}
review:
ピンボールはあんまりやったことなかったけどこれは楽しかった。
クエストはわりとおつかいだけど、かわいいキャラとの
ほのぼの会話のおかげで癒されてよい。

ボールの塗装によって行ける場所や解決できる問題があるのは、
ヒントがなくて分かり辛かった。攻略調べるとでてくるかもね。

難易度的にもちょうどいい感じかなと思いました。
実績全解除はけっこうたいへんかも。

author: {'steamid': '76561198073499959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3209, 'last_played': 1686663859}
review:
Youku's Island Express is a difficult game to describe in terms of genre. How does pinball metroidvania sound? Yeah, made me raise an eyebrow as well. So, how does that even work?

You control a dung beetle (a newcomer to Mokumana Island, acting as a newly appointed postmaster) 
tirelessly rolling his ball left and right. When you come across a flipper, you can use it to propel the ball (which is attached to your protagonist by a piece of string) into the air. This is the pinball part. So how about metroidvania?
The island of Mokumana is rather big, with plenty of folks needing your help, mail to deliver and secrets to uncover. Progressing in the game unlocks new abilities, which in turn open up previously inaccessible parts of the map. And it actually comes together as a fun and charming little game.

I've gotten this game for my kid for less than 2$. Turned out to be a surprise hit with both of us. It's a casual game through and through, virtually impossible to lose (at worst, you can get stuck on a pinball puzzle or a jump sequence, while the game is casual, it doesn't play itself) and pretty much no violence (unless we count exploding snails). I'm definitely recommending it if you want something entry level, or if you just want to chill playing pinball humming along to a funky tune. The visuals and audio are really relaxing and I'd be hard pressed to find anything to hate about Yoku. Maybe one or two jump sequences with the leash stretched my patience a bit. Check it out if you're up for some relaxing pinball with a bit of exploration thrown in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110358927', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1617773717}
review:
Mükemmel bir oyun.Xbox game pass'te vardı. İlk olarak orada oynayıp bitirmiştim. 1 yıl sonra Steam de karşıma çıktı ve bu oyuna verilen parayı hak ettiğini düşünerek satın alıp tekrar oynadım. Şunu söyleyeyim ki harika oyun.Metroidvania ve Pinball karışımı bir oyun.
Oyun içeriğinde her şey öyle güzel dizayn edilmiş ki mükemmel. Oynanış çok eğlenceli.Oyun içerisindeki diğer karakterler ve çizimleri gayet güzel.Renklendirme,harita tasarımı,oyunun yapısına göre oluşturulan bölümler tasarımlar,bir yerden bir yere gidiş,size verilen aletleri işleyişi, yan görevler vs harika.Her puzzle çok iyi.Hersey birbiri ile bağlantılı. Hikayesi de gayet güzel. 
Basarım almakta öyle zor değil. 
Kesinlikle onayınız. Eğlenceli ve emek ile hazırlanmış bu oyunu deneyimleyin.
İyi oyunlar.
100*100

author: {'steamid': '76561198025197811', 'num_games_owned': 1754, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1692221918}
review:
A wonderfully unique platformer/pinball hybrid. I don't like pinball games but I still loved this.

It's not without it's issues though: fast travel points take too long to get back to, you often have to do things repeatedly because the precision required is overtuned, and the grapple swings around too fast.

Recommended for platformer fans looking for something novel, but not for players who feel frustrated easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149487351', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1612731020}
review:
This game is just fantastic.
Bought it on Switch too so Steam hours aren't all.

Just buy it its super fun. 
Do you like pinball? Its a pinball adventure game. 
Do you not like pinball? You will.

You collect fruit to unlock obstacles in the world and progress forward (pretty linear). There are pinball boards/challenges integrated into the world, and just finding them feels fun. There are some hidden bonuses that encourage you to explore and see where you can pinball to. And some simpler bonuses like... walking left and uncovering a cave.
There are plenty of characters you encounter, but their dialogue is brief and well written (I generally hate reading dialogue but I like this game's). 
Ultimately the game is just really well paced and polished. If you hit a wall and fdon't have the fruit to progress you just backtrack a bit , find a pinball area and play it a bit to see where you missed fruit (you essentially spawn fruit on the board by doing things that would get you points in most pinball games, then collect the fruit by passing over it. Its just fun and simple).

Highly recommended. Instantly fun and hard to put down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1552748388}
review:
Plateformer/pinball/Metroid-like, tout un programme.

Et c'était super bien. Un peu court, un début un peu chiant et un level design global assez plat, mais au delà de ça la recette fonctionne très bien, ce petit mélange de jeu de flipper et de plateforme, c'est du plaisir. Pas besoin d'être un crack au pinball pour s'en sortir, on peut pas mourir et il n'y a jamais rien de très difficile. L'exploration est agréable, avec pas mal de zones différentes et bien marquées les unes des autres, d'autant que graphiquement c'est réussi.

Une belle découverte, clairement pas le jeu de l'année mais super agréable à jouer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983211883', 'num_games_owned': 2196, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1615758995}
review:
[b]I couldn't believe those genres can be put together and succeeds![/b]

Developed by Swedish indie studio Villa Gorilla, Yoku’s Island Express game is a metroidvania-style pinball adventure, in which you play the part of Yoku, an adorable little beetle.  This mashup of genres succeeds despite being an uncommon combination, and seriously I hope they start a new franchise, because I want to play a lot more of this. The final result is a charming, delightful, and wonderfully satisfying experience.

Yoku arrives on Mokumana island, ready to start his new job as a postman. Sadly, things start falling apart pretty quick, as the island's god figures were attacked by something called the God Slayer. As a consequence, our cute beetle was tasked with bringing all the leaders together to health the last god alive. Yoku can walk along flat surfaces or gentle slopes, but unlike most platforming games, he can’t even jump. Instead, the flippers, launchers and bumpers widely present across the island are his main method of moving from one location to another. Moreover, late on the game, you gain new abilities like climb or swing that comes in handy.

This superb 2D world is filled with distinct areas (such as lush jungles, dark labyrinths, snow-covered mountains, underground caves or underwater temples) that are basically small pinball tables we need to beat to keep on our adventure. In parallel, the game-world is plenty of secrets, collectibles and side quests that it's worth to investigate, as they unlock new areas and rewards. The game also counts with Steam achivements. Most of them are fairly straightforward but occasionally you'll encounter frustrating collectibles that are almost impossible to grab unless you own insane skills. Probably this ridiculousness, is the only negative point on the game.

Moving onto the art-style, the background scenery is just as beautifully detailed as the foreground. Every environment of this large open-world island is perfectly accompanied by its sound design which gives everything a unique atmosphere. There are a wide range of NPCs on each area as well, each of them with their own dialogs and style.

All in all,  here you are a simple but cute story to follow, alongside a great amount of side quests, hidden collectibles, and other distractions along the adventure. The mixture of genres are difficult to describe but good indeed, and flippers and bumpers make uncovering this wide island a ton of fun. You won't came across something similar for a while, so take this opportunity to play this unique and innovative game.

Je recommande chaudement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069402855', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1615471813}
review:
I'm giving the game a thumbs up but I'll be honest. By the time I was down with it I actually hated it. Pinball-Adventure is a rare genre combination, the artstyle is unique and bright, good music. It's overall a great game, but those controls, ugh. 

Can't walk a straight line without having to dick around in a pinball maze for an hour. Considering how often the game wants you to backtrack, how few fast travel options it has, and the fact that if you do not have those skill shots down to perfection you can very well end up wasting an hour inside the same section was just down right infuriating. 

I'm not saying it's a bad game, I'm saying personally, by the end of the day I was fucking pissed off with it. Clearly this is not the type of game for me because by the end of the day I wanted to toss it out the window, monitor included. Yuku's Island is well made and I can see a lot of people enjoying it so I do recommend it for people, especially those who like pinball action. 

Oh a personal level though, just fuck this game. I want nothing more to do with it personally.

review: 从玩法到地图设计到画面都非常优质, 游戏流程不长, 13小时就能全成就了, 但是游戏体验很好, 原价不亏打折血赚的佳作.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124839501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1623037065}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a delightfully fresh take on the Metroidvania genre. It's colorful, friendly, and absolutely enjoyable. The sense or progression and exploration is incredibly well executed.

A small part of me wishes the game was slightly more challenging. For instance, there's really no way to "lose" a boss battle, it's just a matter of how long it takes you to win. But at that same time, I really enjoyed a more casual experience compared to the difficulty of some other games.

Although I finished the main campaign in around 6 hours, there are still a lot of extras that will keep me playing this for several more hours. You can often get this game on sale for 80% off. It's worth the regular price of $19.99 and is an absolute steal at the sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968830351', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1614905414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107796536', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1597, 'last_played': 1626014344}
review:
好玩

非常适合脑残的人玩这个游戏，无脑就对了

author: {'steamid': '76561197962630190', 'num_games_owned': 3518, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1614510536}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a mashup of Metroidvania and pinball. And it works pretty well!

It's charming, has engaging core mechanics (as long as you enjoy pinball), and is pretty well paced. Solid all around. The biggest weakness is that navigating can be a little convoluted.

It's not going to win over any pinball haters, but if the core concept sounds interesting you'll probably enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026011389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1624136797}
review: Just as a quick note, I played most of this game when the internet was down because of a storm, so that's why my gametime seems small. But wow. I just finished this game. It's phenomenal. The gameplay is addicting, the puzzles are challenging but not impossible, the characters and writing are fun and witty, and the music. My goodness the MUSIC. What I thought was a cheery song now gets me emotional, especially since *potential spoilers ahead* you don't hear it in its entirety until the very ending. Also, I thought this would just be a fun, chill little game, but the story was actually pretty intense at times, and held a surprising amount of depth. This game is for anyone and everyone. I'm going to go back and get every single achievement now, and I only have 6 left!

author: {'steamid': '76561199097165769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1708224663}

author: {'steamid': '76561199113881678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1614717549}
review:
En pocas palabras... se trata de un juego de pin ball en el que tienes que ir desplazándote por un poblado lleno de escondites y pruebas, ayudando a todos los habitantes hasta... acabar contra el mal!!
Muy entretenido, buena banda sonora, gráficos, historia... lo recomiendo 100% y os animo a que hagáis todos los logros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140435102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1633535075}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express is precision and timing requiring sidescroller that features plenty pinball-like levels, after upgrading with quest items ability to break some stones, swing on plants, dive under water and stationary quick travel cannons.

The story is presented by bubble monologues with animal-like voices. It's a solid fantasy world and well written.

The environments are rather lively, NPCs are animated though static, effects such as earth shaking, water splashing and other sound/visual effects make an exciting title.

You are limited by points that you can increase and there are plenty to lay about or respawned at pinball-like areas.

The difficulty comes from the design itself, I often got stuck in one area that seemed to have obstacles all around it but I was missing items in inventory that would give me additional abilities.

Then I would proceed just to get stuck with a similar problem, until I earned the quest item. At first, the world seemed semi-linear, however you will open more ways to all sides, push a stone into water, activate quick travel transport or unlock a jump button.

Furthermore there are collectibles and treasures. I got stuck somewhere in the late game. This should be considered a preview of what I could achieve in 7 hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287659989', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1614602092}
review: 很好的一款休闲 杀时间的弹球游戏，画面唯美，音乐轻松 操作简单  瞎鸡儿按就行， 打折的时候很便宜  买了你一定不会失望的

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1614586758}
review:
This is a console ported puzzle platformer with a unique twist.  Instead of the usual platformer gimmicks, pinball machine mechanics are used. 

The pinball mechanics are interesting, but also hit or miss.  It's like playing a dozen pinball tables in the space of a few minutes, with no time to get the hang of any of them.   Also, a lot of compromises have been made for consoles here.  The controls are okay but not great.  Graphics are limited to 1080p, too low quality for modern PC gaming standards.   It's a shame to see once more consoles making gaming worse for everyone.

There's also an inexplicable $20 USD price tag, for a 2D console platformer.  The same price would get you a game rendered in 3D with proper PC support, like Monster Hunter World or DooM Eternal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971191767', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1614420622}
review: If the idea of pinball mixed with Metroidvania sounds like fun to you then I'd recommend this. Personally I'm not a big fan of (or particularly skilled at) pinball games in general so wasting a lot of time trying to get the ball to go where I wanted (especially within a time limit) hurt the experience. Overall it's a decent metroidvania but imo your mileage will depend on how much you enjoy the pinball aspects. As for me just finishing the main quest is enough, I can sleep easy without 100% completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972114870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1705745423}

author: {'steamid': '76561199052153790', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1626649143}
review: Um jogo que é uma mistura de plataforma 2D com pinball, muito original e divertido! Os desenvolvedores conseguiram unir com maestria a jogabilidade dos dois estilos! O besouro comanda os movimentos em 2D e na hora do pinball o cenário é que direciona a bolota de cocô que fica presa no besouro por um linha! Mas tudo bem bonito e colorido, nada nojento! Recomendo demais o jogo e parabenizo os desenvolvedores pelo ótimo trabalho!

author: {'steamid': '76561199032121171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1614657937}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065350753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1614188492}
review:
Like others say, this game is pinball metroidvania. Which is fun! I like pinball! Cute game, great soundtrack, fun premise. Aim and timing puzzles were fantastic, and I enjoyed most of the areas I was able to get through. I tried to like it, but one mechanic in particular made me lose all interest.

The inane slug vaccuum was impossible to get to work for some reason, it seemed like sheer luck every time I got it to work. It's a frustrating, and unfortunately major part of the game. I tried it on both keyboard and controller, but neither seemed to work. Not sure if it's user error or mechanical controller issues, but I tried so many different ways and it was never forgiving. So, unfortunately, I do not recommend this game if you don't like pinball or potentially frustrating mechanics.

review:
It's a metroidvania crossed with pinball. It very, very much feels like playing in the biggest pinball machine ever conceived. If, like me, you can't play pinball to save your dang life, the metroidvania/platformer elements aren't going to be able to carry it for you. It's a good game, but not for everyone, especially if a continual serious of fiddly timing based puzzles is going to annoy the crap out of you.
Refunded after however long I spent on it... because clearly NOT my jam. Add me to the list of other negatives, all of which seem to have the same sentiments.

review: This game is fun. I've been playing a lot of other games recently where you select a quest, run a million miles, watch a slow cutscene, run some more, kill a boar, run back, etc. Games with daily log-in requirements and chores. Those are nice but this is an actual "game" you can actively play. I'd boot up the game and just enjoy myself for 30-60 minutes. There's lots of secrets and they are well-integrated. I got 100% after 12 hours, which is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960476102', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1613770343}
review:
The second best bug-based metroid-vania after Hollow Knight! and that's not to take anything away from this game.
Such a delightful experience, so whimsical and charming and pure joy to play.
Like many good games in this genre, you will feel lost at start but quickly become very familiar with the map as you get more tools to traverse the island.
Truly innovative gameplay ideas, fantastic soundtrack, genuinely funny, and doesn't overstay its welcome.
10/10 perfect game!

author: {'steamid': '76561199080165071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1610480639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142760884', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 405, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1613696245}
review:
What a genuinely wholesome, creative, innovative, short-and-sweet little game. It's clear that the developers crafted this game with a whole lot of love (and poop jokes). Games like these, where there's tons to collect and nothing achievement-wise that is missable, are right up my alley. I can't possibly imagine someone playing this game all the way through and actually disliking it.

It took me a little bit to get hooked on this game, but once I'd invested a good portion of time into it, I was set. It's a pretty small world, but new abilities keep the levels fresh and filled with tons of secrets throughout. Very fun game to do collectible cleanup in after finishing the main story.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198254254467', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1613636171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006047685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1676584284}
review:
Absolutely charming, beautiful and uplifting game! I never played pinball that much, can't say that I'm a fan - but the kind of "jump and run / pinball with elements of metroidvania" mechanic in this game is really fun! For me it's a fresh and new experience and I love how the mechanics work. Gameplay is really smooth and feels very satisfying. Bright, colorfull, joyfull, uplifting game! Very creative, imaginitive world, really fun to play. Comparable to good Nintendo games. So - if you feel a bit down, play this game - it will cheer you up :)

Update after 10 Hours Play:
It get's better with more hours, feels deeper and definately has a strong aspect of exploration. It's metroid-like nature is undeniable and yet it's also very original and often charming in it's interpretation. The game-play mechanics feel brilliant and it's very satisfying to get more skillful at using them and trying out all the nuances as well as getting upgrades and new abbilities, which then open new, hitherto inaccessible, areas and parts of the map.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985378191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1613288478}
review:
В начале игры есть задание: отнести жучку инструменты, чтобы он починил сломанный мост. Всё хорошо, отдал инструменты, прошёл через мост дальше. Уже половину игры осилил, и вот, по сюжету надо снова пройти через этот мост. Подхожу, а жучок говорит: "Мост сломан, принеси мои инструменты - починю". Смотрю ему за спину - мост на месте! И даже рыба на мосту лежит, отдыхает. Иду через мост... и падаю! Возвращаюсь снова - падаю! "Ладно, - думаю, - принесу тебе инструменты, благо, помню, где они находятся". Прихожу, а инструментов нет.
Падам-падам-пум!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161615681', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1633780383}

author: {'steamid': '76561198298931605', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1590239275}

author: {'steamid': '76561198815748328', 'num_games_owned': 2991, 'num_reviews': 710, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1636901944}
review:
"What if Super Metroid's Morph Ball sequences were an entire game?" said [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Worms_%28series%29]Team Worms[/url] in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elevator_pitch]an elevator[/url]. "Can it have a cutesy toddler-friendly theme?"  "Sure!"

I would have said "[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sOUoNy7EmPA]get off my elevator[/url]", but now it's here, I'm digging it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804707359', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1613315891}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009381925', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1613096862}
review: Yoku's Island Express is the adorable pinball metroidvania I didn't know I wanted. The island is beautiful and and relaxing to explore as there is no death or significant punishment for mistakes. I wasn't sure how much I'd like a game based on pinball, but I was glad I gave it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198978932639', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1673070217}
review:
10小时打完全结局，就差一个打全金甲虫的成就没拿，真的不好肝，找时间会肝出来的。
绝对是我今年目前玩过的最好玩的游戏了，说他休闲娱乐吧，其实又很肝
玩法简单易上手，打折史低入手真香，14血赚70不亏
对弹球类游戏感兴趣的朋友们快入手了
有手柄和没手柄是俩游戏，建议配一个手柄，LT和RT让你找回小时候玩弹球的快乐
8说了，继续肝成就了

author: {'steamid': '76561198014981760', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1612931554}
review: This game was not compatible with my computer (I think it was Windows 7 issue?) which was super disappointing.  Got my computer updated so was finally able to try it...and its amazing!  I've never played a game like this before.  It is a 2D platformer RPG with pinball mechanics, and its done incredibly well.  It is open world with unlockable character upgrades with levels somewhat revolving around each (kind of like a Zelda game), but at the same time its a fairly casual game...you don't have to worry about dying or taking too long in boss fights.  The biggest danger really is falling off of the upper areas back to the beach you started on -_-....I did that a few times.   I highly recommend everyone give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067006537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1533551939}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068701313', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1666036510}
review:
My girlfriend loves the game, I haven't played it yet because she hogs the PC to play this game. I watch her play and I am amazed by the fresh and honestly innovative take on platformers. The pinball parts can be challenging at times but never feel unfair. The art style is beautiful and cute, vibrant colours really turn it into eye candy. The game offered around 10 hours of quality game time, no bugs (no pun intended) or glitches encountered and just feels like a complete game. In a time where AAA companies push out broken ass shit for absurd prices, this game comes at a very humble price. It deserves more praise, more attention and I would even buy it at 80€, because it is that good.

P.S from the girlfriend: I especially loved tröööting all the way! Super darn cute

author: {'steamid': '76561198094803808', 'num_games_owned': 4070, 'num_reviews': 5384, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1612383139}
review:
i love the idea of the game but almost no ball control, all about the angle that you hit the ball and its always somewhere on the tip of the flippers 
ooh cool you did that thing you have been trying to do for the last 7 minutes, do it 10 more times to get past this part
could be more fun if they put in tilt or something to give more ball control?
+ story
+ art style
+ music
- crashing for no reason
- spending half an hour trying to land the same jump
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031396069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1612064191}
review:
A truly beautiful game with a lot of heart.  Sweet graphics and lovely music.  The gameplay can be as precise and careful as you need it to be, but it's also very forgiving if you just want to mess around (or if you aren't very good at pinball).

[b]WARNING, however[/b]:  there is NO WAY to turn off screen shake, and I got so motion sick during "rumbly" underground parts of the game that I needed to take a Gravol.  The game is [b]not great with accessibility[/b] just generally.  The default keybindings are awful and can't be changed;  there are no mouseovers ;  there is no journal to keep track of quests (they want to keep everything coded visually/symbolically and "in-world", which is really pretty and cute but annoying to keep track of when you just want information).  If you have motion sickness, if you're left-handed, or if you have any disabilities, I don't recommend spending your money on this game!  But it is a very sweet game if you take those warnings into account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129912215', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1612217265}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065482987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1611943266}
review:
Un bon petit jeu, un mélange de jeu de plateforme, de flipper, et d'un insecte qui ressemble à cafard ou un scarabée, je ne sais pas. Le jeu est globalement assez simple et très peu punitif, mais il est vraiment plaisant, et son petit univers fait mouche. Dans les jeux que j'ai joué par le passé, le gameplay ce rapproche vaguement de ori et de tout ces jeux en 2d ou il y a une part d'exploration dans un monde ouvert.
Le jeu est assez court, compter entre 6 et 10h pour finir le jeu normalement, et une douzaine d'heure pour 100%.
jeu que j'ai acheté en promo. j'en est largement eu pour mon argent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348900030', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1611446733}
review:
Nobody asked the developer of this game to violently grab the platforming genre by the balls (somewhat literally) and combine it with pinball of all things. At the very most, that just sounded... interesting I suppose? But no part of me was expecting to love this weird little genre-confused love child quite as much as I did.

Yoku's Island Express approaches each aspect of itself with a refreshingly positive attitude from the upbeat music to the Banjo-Kazooie style of dialogue. Pinball absolutely shines here as well, as left and right bumpers are mainly how you traverse through it's world. It's fast, satisfying and incredibly forgiving as there is no lives, no death and no respawning to be found in this game. It's also a Metroidvania that will find you back tracking quite often through old portions of the map to further the story or find upgrades. I love Metroidvanias, though I did not love it here. I found going through the same portions of the map quite tedious once I was familiar with the pinball sessions along the way. The design does work in the game's favour, it just doesn't have the same quality of games like Hollow Knight.

All in all, Yoku's is a rare gem with a unique twist that didn't get stale to me even after beating the game 100%. I highly recommend this to any one who loves platformers. Period.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121920425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1615003965}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960608243', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1611374282}
review:
[h1]The Short[/h1]
Metroidvania pinball. It really is a precisely accurate description.
Charming visuals too.

[h1]The Long[/h1]
[i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] is a pinball / Metroidvania hybrid that's straightforward in its pinball-gameplay design and also quite beautiful in its visual design.  The game world is laid out like a Metroidvania environment: you explore around an island, going places as you choose, with new locations becoming available as you discover/gain/unlock the skills to reach them.  Instead of facing ever-respawning enemies that hamper your travel, the environment is instead build like different pinball boards that you navigate by using the flippers.  The entire island is [b]not[/b] one big pinball board, rather you can walk freely through a lot of navigable places, finding your way to the entrances of what are essentially mini pinball boards scattered throughout the island.

As pinball is the core gameplay element, most people who would enjoy this game will need at minimum some level of engagement with pinball itself.  If pinball frustrates you, you'd have a grating time trying to force yourself through the game environment, and though all the other elements of the game easily pass the bar they probably won't be worth any painful grind for you.

Which is to say, this isn't a story for the ages.  Do understand that it's plenty good, fits the visual tone, has delightful humor, and goes beyond just being there for the story's sake.  Easily it's icing on the sweet, delicious cake if you enjoy the gameplay.  I was rather reminded of [i]Ori and the Blind Forest[/i] in many ways, visual and story combined, but this otherwise doesn't soar to quite the same heights.

Problems are few.  I have only sniggles with minor design decisions, in particular [spoiler]the puzzle elements that involved coloring your ball, which I felt didn't have adequate hinting[/spoiler] and [spoiler]the sootling swinging being too quick enabling consistent accuracy[/spoiler].  Nothing I would ever stew over, and I've forgiven worse games for more serious missteps.


For the investment, [i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] is basically a 100% purchase for any pinball aficionado, and most everyone else will find it worth their while for [i]some[/i] price, again provided that pinball isn't your mortal enemy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115445182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1639822510}
review:
Si vous êtes comme moi, vous êtes tombés par hasard sur Yoku's Island Express et l'avez acheté après avoir vu les tags «metroidvania» et «pinball». Résumé de mon expérience:
+ Gameplay combinant pinball et exploration fonctionne plus que bien et est très amusant.
+ Les graphismes sont hyper beaux, comparables à Ori ou Donkey Kong Country Returns.
+ Le personnage contrôlable est un facteur bousier. UN FACTEUR BOUSIER!

Les seuls points négatifs que j'ai pu trouver:
- Les chemins ne sont pas toujours évidents et il peut être mélangeant de savoir par où passer. 
- [spoiler]La fin du jeu aurait pu être davantage imaginative et intense.[/spoiler]

Conclusion: achetez définitivement ce jeu

author: {'steamid': '76561198029903975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1611291066}
review:
This is the kind of game where you're always lost and trying to figure out what they want you to do/go next. It starts out being pretty obvious, but then it gets bigger. That means you have to revisit a lot of areas that you already worked. Thats never much fun. There's a lot of revisiting. There's a map, but it isn't much help. You can't zoom in on things on the map and its hard to tell how to get from one area to another until you're actually there. The fast travel is weird and so far hasn't taken me anyplace I need to go. I did have fun exploring and finding my way through some of this.

The animations are nicely done. (I'm especially thinking of the cow washing the sootlings) Lots of interesting, trippy creatures to visit but  a lot of them are not so special. Just some dumarse fluffball with some insipid dialogue.

 The pinball action works somewhat. It has a tendency to send your ball to the same place over and over. Hitting targets is dependent on taking lots of shots and getting lucky. Its tiresome, especially if you've returned to the same place for the sixth time. Unless you're a genius you're going to be revisiting some of these pinball things 50 times.

The pricing was very good. At 80% off its a deal. I prefer to play games where I know what to do and I need to build something to defeat something or I have to figure out how to infiltrate something. This is not that type of game but its one of the better revisit that pinball thing you got tired of three days ago games on the market.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999729825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1611345474}

author: {'steamid': '76561199127168666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1611001001}
review:
[b] TL;DR [/b]
A pinball-based Metroidvania that totally works, is totally fun, and does have enough going for it in tone and challenge to avoid feeling like you’re in the kiddy-pool if you happen to be a grown-up.

[b] Gameplay [/b]
In case you didn’t know Yoku’s Island Express is Metroidvania meets pinball, and, despite how it might sound, it works really well. The game is made up of quests that will take you, a cute ball-rolling beetle, all over the island. Areas are traversed either by rolling, pinball bumpers & flippers, or beelines (the game’s fast travel) and moving around is generally really fun unless you’re trying to get to an area that requires a particularly precise flipper flip, that can occasionally frustrate. 

As you travel around, you’ll meet a host of weird island inhabitants who will tell you more about what you’re doing and point you in the right direction. Once you’ve arrived at a main area, there’s usually a contained pinball board for you to beat before the next thing in that area unlocks, and in true Metroidvania style, you’ll be receiving items or info that will let you backtrack and access other areas that were previously unreachable leading to plenty of lightbulb moments of relief when you’re at a loose end.  

Aside from collecting and unlocking new areas the game also features a few boss fights, all within pinball boards, and they were all decently absorbing.

When I played the demo, I thought the novelty of the pinball-based traversal would wear thin, but after I decided not to buy it for that reason, I found myself thinking about it and I felt compelled to see if the mechanic could carry a whole game, and it can!

There’s a tonne of stuff to do – after the main quest I found my completion percentage at 49%; the island is [i] packed [/i] with secrets, collectables, and side quests. I still have so much to find, and, due to the games charming locales and NPC’s, I’m really looking forward to getting to 100%.

[b] Narrative [/b]
The narrative is quite cool for a game that’s obviously aimed at children. Your beetle, Yoku, is the new postmaster of the island, and, while I thought the game would leave it there, it surprised me with a broader central plot. There’s a huge deity living at the centre of the island that has been attacked by a mysterious God Slayer, underground ruins featuring clues to ancient island lore, a cult of space monks determined to blast off, and so many characters with different objectives & perspectives; even the dichotomy of faith and science is explored through dialogue. I was very impressed how much depth was contained in this story about a happy-go-lucky beetle postman. 

[b] Graphics & Atmosphere [/b]
The graphics are nice – the island is a joy to explore. From its creepy and dark underground & submerged sections, though the lush jungles to the snowy mountain peaks, the whole thing is so charming to look at. 
I play a lot of cutesy games, not because I like them, in fact – I really dislike cutesy atmospheres, but it’s just such a mainstay of the puzzle genre that I can’t totally avoid them, but, while I was expecting the atmosphere in Yoku to be non-stop saccharine overload, the mood has a really nice strangeness, and darkness to it. The deities in particular are really uncanny and sinister looking, and there’s an ominous quality to a lot of the areas, and plenty of humour that’s adult accessible. It wasn’t too safe and childish for my taste at all, I’m glad I didn’t let the first impression put me off. 

[b] Sound [/b] 
Yoku features some really cute music; a lot of the areas have jazzy themes that reflect the character of the environment: the darker areas have a sombre bassline and stripped back production, and the lighter, happier areas have music in full swing. It wasn’t quite Donkey Kong Country levels of quality, but definitely solid and charming platformer music, all recorded with real instruments, so it sounds great.

There are two audio elements that might grate a bit. One is the talking of the characters, they have a Peanuts-esque style of emitting odd broken-trumpet sounds as they speak, and while I found most of them at least bearable, and some really endearing, there are a few which annoyed me slightly. Secondly, I found my immersion breaking occasionally when the cacophony of flipper sounds overpowered the soundscape.

[b] Challenge [/b]
I’m not going to rail against the challenge too much. Sure, you just lose a tiny bit of currency if you fall through flippers into thorns, and you restart exactly where you are, the bosses cannot hurt you and wait patiently for the coup de grâce, and some areas can be overcome by just mashing the flippers – but it’s obviously a game designed for children to be able to pick up and play. There are enough puzzling locations of obscure collectables to decently engage adults, it isn’t totally devoid of challenge, and, if like me you suck at navigating through Metroidvanias, just getting to the next area is a decent puzzle in itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208774369', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1613322664}
review:
Comecei a jogar Yoku's Island Express esperando que ele fosse só uma distração leve, mas encontrei um jogo de mecânicas viciantes por conta da mistura de plataforma e pinball, e que além disso tem um mapa enorme com inúmeras possibilidades de exploração. Sem contar os personagens carismáticos, a trilha sonora divertida, e a sagacidade dos desenvolvedores na tarefa de distribuir os itens escondidos no mapa (uns fáceis de pegar, e outros que você precisa ser criativo, e algumas vezes paciente, pra conseguir). 

A [b]única[/b] coisa ruim foi que, depois de terminar a história do jogo, meu jogo bugou, [spoiler] na ponte que dá pra Ivory Peaks: ela aparentemente estava ali, construída, mas quando eu passava por cima, caía direto. [/spoiler] mas foi um bug que rapidamente encontrei solução, nos fóruns de discussões, e pude passar mais horas jogando esse jogo e alcançando os achievements. Joguei por 15 horas e jogaria mais, caso houvesse novos updates adicionando mais coisas, então nada mais justo que deixar super recomendado esse abracinho apertado que é Yoku's Island Express.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015326061', 'num_games_owned': 1980, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1610908556}
review:
[h3][b][u]Short Answer:[/u][/b][/h3] A unique combination of metroidvania and pinball, filled with charm throughout. A few issues are present in terms of mechanics and how it explains them, so go in with patience and a willingness to experiment and explore. A ton of fun to play through the main story and most side quests, but 100% completion can be tedious for not a lot of payoff. If you like metroidvania games and pinball, definitely give it a go. The free demo should give you a good idea of what kind of game to expect.

[h3][b][u]Long Answer:[/u][/b][/h3] [i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] tells the story of a little dung beetle who takes up a job as postman of the isolated Mokumana Island, helping the locals with a variety of problems before stumbling into a quest to reawaken a sleeping god. It's a game that utilizes a very unique and unexpected combination of genres: metroidvania--complete with open world exploration and puzzle platforming--and pinball. There are a few mild issues in its execution, but overall it's something that's way more fun than I expected.
[list]
[*][b]The pinball gameplay is really fun, but the physics can take some getting used to.[/b] Pinball rooms can get a bit frustrating to navigate at times, especially when precision is needed to reach certain parts of the map. Failure is forgiving enough that this never becomes too much of a problem, but it can make some challenges drag on past the point of being fun if you're prone to mistakes.

[*][b]Exploration is fun[/b] and opening new paths and shortcuts feels super satisfying, but [b]it's easy to get lost[/b] and you will find yourself consulting the map a lot--not a huge problem, just something to keep in mind.

[*][b]The main story is pretty simple, but there's a lot of subtle worldbuilding[/b] through NPC dialogue and environmental Easter eggs that hints at a deeper lore just beneath the surface of what's presented--something a part of me hopes Villa Gorilla expands on in the future.

[*][b]The artwork is amazing throughout[/b], with a ton of variety between areas and NPCs filled to the brim with unique details and charm. [b]The music holds an equal level of charm and variety[/b], and it never reaches the point of being annoying despite how often you'll find yourself hearing some of the tracks. 
[/list]
Overall, it has a lot of positives going for it, but there are a few negatives that I do feel need to be explained. Depending on how you tackle side quests, [b]some of the game's later upgrades will come so late to the point where they no longer feel useful[/b] since you've already gone through most of the content where it could've been helpful (e.g. [spoiler]the Skvader, the upgraded Slug Vacuum, and half of the wallet upgrades[/spoiler]. The game is mostly good about walking you through its mechanics, but [b]there were a few secondary mechanics that I felt could have been better explained[/b]--mechanics that I stumbled onto by accident only to discover how important they were to 100% completion. [b][u]Minor spoilers ahead[/u][/b]:
[list]
[*]The Noisemaker you receive early in the game is used for interacting with a lot of the world, from breaking pots to waking NPCs, but can also be used to pop item bubbles from a slight distance away from your ball. This happens when the bubble is in the sound wave when you use it, and this is especially useful when Yoku can be flung towards collectibles that are just out of reach.

[*]The physics of the Slug Vacuum. Another early upgrade, it lets you suck in explosive slugs to then be used to break things blocking your path. The slugs can be popped manually with the Noisemaker button, but the game doesn't explain that the direction you're propelled when doing this is based on the direction the slug is facing on your ball. It's a crucial mechanic to reaching many of the game's secrets and can be difficult to figure out if you're not paying attention and experimenting with slugs outside of the rooms they're used in.

[*]Ball Sprinkles, a collection side quest for unlocking new ball colors/designs. What I initially thought to be something purely for cosmetic purposes ended up being a tool needed for accessing new areas and completing certain side quests. It's possible that its use for interacting with the world was more clearly explained and I wasn't paying attention, but it ended up being something I only realized after experimenting with the color combinations for fun mid-game and finding something that matched a side quest I was stuck on. Pay close attention to NPC dialogue and remember to check back on this place every once in a while to see if anything you can make here looks usable elsewhere.
[/list]
[b]The game is fun to see through to the main story's end, but 100% completion can take a lot of that fun away if you're not patient with it.[/b] Completion consists of finishing the main story and all side quests, as well as unlocking all collectibles: ability upgrades, wallet upgrades, chests, wickerlings, and activating scarabs found during pinball games. Some of the puzzles to get to things can be a bit obtuse, and certain scarabs or physics-based puzzles can make you feel like you're fighting against the game engine to get them. They're by no means the worst things to get, but as I said before, you will need patience. If you're stuck, try talking to old NPCs and see if they have something new to say, and don't forget to retread old ground when new tools are unlocked. The reward for total completion is minimal, so don't expect a huge payoff for doing every little thing.

[b]100% completion took me around 12 hours[/b], and I enjoyed it overall despite what the difference in length on my positive and negative breakdown might imply. It has way more going for it than against it, and by the end I still felt it was something I could easily recommend. [b][u][i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] is unique and overall well-executed, and the problems it has are minor enough that you should have no problems seeing the main story through to its end--though you'll have to use your own judgement to decide if it's worth completing beyond that.[/u][/b] If you're still on the fence, give the demo a try. It takes you through the first section of the game, and it should give you a good idea of what you're getting yourself into. I'm a little upset that it took this long for this one to show up on my radar, but I'll be keeping an eye on Villa Gorilla to see what other unique ideas they bring to the table going forward.

[quote]For more game reviews, check out my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42524563/]Curator page[/url]![/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198038657288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1610877034}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist der absolute Wahnsinn und zwar im positiven Sinne.
Das ganze Spielprinzip fesselt einen so unglaublich einfach, dass man am liebsten alles auf einmal erkundet und Freischaltet. 
Selbst die Errungenschaften möchte man bei diesem Spiel vollständig freischalten, das es an sich relativ einfach geht und dabei auch wirklich sehr viel Spaß macht. 
 
Ich habe mir dieses Spiel im Sale für grob 3€ gekauft, das waren die besten 3€ meines "Gamerlebens". 

Falls ihr ein paar Euros übrig habt und dieses Spiel im Sale ist, solltet ihr es unbedingt kaufen.

review: Yoku's Island Express is what you get when you combine pinball with a Metroidvania game. The game is incredibly fun and the art style is very nice.
