author: {'steamid': '76561197988039425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1618449641}
review:
Read more of my short essays on video games at [url=strategineer.com] strategineer.com [/url]

Time stood still as a new kind of old evil ravages the world as we know it, freezing us in time and space, while we clutch our crosses in fear. Sadly, God is dead and we killed him. In a time of unprecedented irrationality, ignorance and stupidity, it's been difficult for me to stay sane in these trying times.

It may or may not be too late for our world. Only time will tell. In the meantime, I plan to stay sane by escaping (responsibly) into worlds that are less fractured and absurd than ours.

Now that I've hooked you with an edgy introduction, let me talk to you about a goofy, fun and happy game called Yoku's Island Express.

In the game, you play as a dung beetle named Yoku. You and your boulder land on Mokumana Island, where you've been given a job as the island's new Postmaster. You start your adventure by delivering mail but you soon become responsible for caring for the island's inhabitants. Along the way, you also become the hero that saves the island from an ancient evil known as the God Killer.

What makes Yoku's Island Express special is how you control Yoku (and his boulder) and how the island is built. You have control over two things: Yoku's boulder and the pinball-esque paddles that are scattered all across the landscape. By moving Yoku's boulder and flinging it around with the paddles, you can explore the interconnected world of Mokumana Island, meet its people and uncover its many secrets. As you explore the island, you acquire new abilities that allow you to explore more of the island and so on and so forth.

Moving Yoku and his boulder around while discovering the beautiful island made me happy. The quirky characters I met always managed to make me smile with their goofy dialogue and expressive animations. The many pinball table-esque arenas provided enough of a challenge to keep things interesting without becoming frustrating.

These arenas reminded me of the many hours I spent playing 3D Pinball on my family's first computer. This might explain why Yoku's Island Express resonated with me so deeply. During my time with the game, on more than one occasion, I felt a sense of calm and oneness wash over me as I rolled my boulder around. I felt a sense of purpose that has been hard for me to find in my day to day life, especially this past year in lockdown. The creatures living on Mokumana Island needed me and, it seems as though, I also needed them.

I've played video games my entire life, at school I made small games, I spent a few years making "real" games as a job and it's only recently that I've finally distanced myself from video games, in my professional life at least. I've always loved video games but, as I've grown older, I've become more jaded. It's been harder and harder for me to find games that really click with me.

I'm glad I took a chance on Yoku's Island Express because it was able to, temporarily, reawaken a childlike sense of wonder in me. It turned back the clock, and made me feel as though I was still the wide-eyed child, sitting cross-legged in front of the CRT TV in my family's basement for hours on end. It also reminded me of a simpler time, when all of us had much less to worry about.

Yoku's Island Express is much more than the sum of its parts. I loved moving around the island, I loved discovering its secrets, I loved talking to the beings living there and I loved helping them. It's clear that a lot of love was poured into every facet of the game, and I felt that love reflected back onto me as I played it.

More than anything, right now, I crave meaningful connection. Through playing Yoku's Island Express, I felt deeply connected to the developers of the game. Through my writing, I've tried to reconnect on a meaningful level with video games and rekindle my passion for them.

And, I hope that by sharing my love of this game, and others, with you, I've been able to connect with you in some way too, however small that connection might be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970491922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1611497912}
review: One of the most joyous games I've played in a long time.  Lovely blend of platforming and pinball that sounds bonkers but just works.  The physics are really good and you need to hone your timing and pinball skills to reach all the secrets.  What's nice is it doesn't punish you for making mistakes so you can just experiment and take on the challenges as they come along.  Beautifully designed world that unlocks in pleasing and surprising ways creating shortcuts and additional routes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059666268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1610750263}
review: I took my time with this game explored everything I could without looking stuff up online. I got to 93% completion and as the credits rolled through I found myself wishing there was a second game or more to this game because it was amazing and had way more depth than I had thought initially and I had a blast playing it. I hope team 17 continues making amazing games like this one. I recommend this game to anyone who wants a fun, relaxing and rewarding platformer It was a delight from beginning to end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021305677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1610780472}
review:
Successor to Sonic spinball, now with less clunky controls, smoother gameplay, better camera zoom out, and less sluggish movement. 

Only recommended if you like a challenging but relaxing metroidvania map as a pinball adventure of fetch quests with an above average writing, with hints of a dark undertone of nature taking its course. There's no way to die, just a small penalty to your (coin) fruit counter to unlocking more springs to open up the map and purchase map and wallet upgrades.

The only downside is the music, Its great when your exploring but when it comes to bosses or later cutscene's its forgettable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198860469032', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1610715063}
review:
14块钱入手的好游戏，我觉得赚爆。
9小时白金奖杯，唯一我要吐槽的一点就是我最后孵出来的是什么东西？我不是很能理解
以下是我对想要获取白金奖杯的玩家一点建议（应该没有剧透）：
1.游戏没有传送方式，唯一的就是蜂道，所以建议走的时候就把东西全点了，这样子以后就不用了来来回回的一直跑了。
2.柳根尽量看到的全拿到，圣甲虫——就是那个完成了给你很多水果的东西，像甲虫一样——尽量看到的全完成，因为有个成就就是这个。
3.很多地方是你吸了红蛞蝓（或者说是蜗牛，能理解就行）之后，要出关卡走一段路之后，靠着红蛞蝓爆炸的反作用力炸上去的。（这点我一开始怎么想也想不到，后来因为一次偶然才发现的）
4.钱包有上限，所以尽快升级钱包就成了首要之举（虽然用钱的地方也不多），在一些宝箱里或者是有任务的npc做完任务给。
5.看到蜂道一定要开，这能节省你很多时间。
6.尽情享受游戏，享受被折磨。

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017277630', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1610685315}
review: Enjoyable, original, lovingly crafted game. The nature of the pinball gameplay leads to some frustrating or tedious repetition, but for the most part the exploration and puzzle solving feels good. Great-looking environment packed with secrets. Cute characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000853151', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1684561212}
review:
Real comfy game. Art style is pleasant and the music is amazing. You play as a dung beetle (that rolls a ball instead of a ball of crap) that goes around a giant island as a postman. Gameplay consist of pinball puzzles and quest all over the island. Really nice game!

Tip: When using the slug vacuum, you can roll the ball to rotate where the slug is on the ball before it explodes so you can blast yourself into a specific direction that you want. This wasn't made clear in the game, so it was tedious to reach certain secrets (You can also use the horn to explode the slug early).

author: {'steamid': '76561198073838112', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1610637020}
review:
Simply wow. This game is a beauty. The story is rich, the visual art is magnificent, and the music is perfect. I haven't felt this engaged in a game in a long time. It's the first game I've played that incorporates pinball mechanics, and I absolutely love it. Would recommend to anyone, especially since it's on sale right now (4€ WHAT????). This game is definitely worth the full price though. 
I finished the story in around 4 hours, and I've been doing additional quests since then and discovering new areas and more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561199023799732', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1610627094}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009384790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1610493503}
review: Malheureusement malgré un support manette complet, il n'est pas possible d'actionner le flippers de manière progressive. Peut importe la pression que vous mettez sur RT / LT, il n'y a pas d'entre deux. C'est vraiment dommage dans ce jeu et personnellement ça m'a fortement déçu. J'ai aussi l'impression qu'il y a peu de haute résolutions disponible si vous jouez à 1080p. Enfin je regrette que les phases hors des flippers soient moles. Hormis ces points, le jeu est bien fait, le level design est vraiment interessant et le concept est plutôt original. Avec les promos sur le jeu, il est actuellement à moins de 5€. Pour ce prix, ça vaut vraiment le coup. Sinon vous avez la demo pour vous faire un avis. Aucun doute que ce jeu plaira a d'autre, les reviews positives sont toutes aussi valable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068242942', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1610220275}
review:
[h1]Оказывается я очень люблю пинбол![/h1]
[spoiler]ну или просто жуков-навозников[/spoiler]

Для тех, кто собирается выбить все достижения в игре советую самому изучать мир. Мало того, что игра к этому активно подталкивает, так ещё и поощряет. За фрукты и за выполнения квестов вы откроете на карте расположение корешков, скарабеев и сундуков нужных для получения всех достижений. Сама же "платина" выбивается за [spoiler]15[/spoiler] часов с минимальным фармом для её получения и не успевает надоесть за это время.

author: {'steamid': '76561198809282019', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1601401651}
review: 哈哈，两年前喜加一抽的游戏居然在商店刷到了。这个游戏质量很高。小时候棒棒鸡上有一个魔力弹珠的游戏那时候玩的不亦乐乎。跟赌博一样。现在这款游戏加了解谜元素和剧情画风可爱，玩法更加丰富。是个休闲好游戏。只不过我打开没完多久，等我把学习任务和其它佳作玩完会回来好好游玩一番。

author: {'steamid': '76561198142651163', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1610420163}
review:
Recomendo o jogo apenas se você curte jogar um pouquinho de zoeira e terminar a campanha, se você curte fazer 100% NÃO COMPRE.
A proposta é muito legal: Um metroidvania com pinball, cara, que demais! Se você não se apega a mecânicas funcionais, gosta só de terminar o jogo, esse game é muito bom. Ele mostra sua cara ao tentar fazer 100%. Você precisa fazer caminhos sob limite de tempo extremamente precisos e esse jogo é um festival de programação porca quando se trata disso. Você vai passar horas pra conseguir acertar uma coisinha mínima e simples, tudo isso porque depende da boa vontade do jogo as coisas funcionarem.
Foi extremamente frustrante e nada divertido fazer 100% nesse game, não teve um pingo de dificuldade, foi bem fácil, porém programação não é pra qualquer um. A desenvolvedora demonstra isso muito bem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069010159', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1610294614}
review:
小品游戏，4小时够你打完主线

角色不能跳跃，所有类似跳跃的位移都需要借助跳板来进行
绝大部分的关卡设计也都和弹球桌有关，非常新颖，梦回3D弹球
音乐很不错

缺点是如果你不喜欢弹球桌这个特色的话，后面几关挫败感比较严重，尤其是需要你连续借助弹球桌完成n个目标的时候，游戏性上（至少我玩到的部分）没有降低弹球部分难度的方法，很想摔手柄。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053361524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1625935699}
review:
TL;DR: Fun, fun, fun 10/10 

I feel compelled to write this review because this game is a gem and I don't think enough people have played it. I would put it up there with the likes of Ori. The story isn't as emotionally driven, it's more fun and cartoony but in all other aspects I think it's just as good. 

The game is perfect in nearly all aspects. Music is fantastic, the world is gorgeous, the story is fun, but where the game really shines is in it's game play and level design. It's a platformer/metroidvania/pinball game. It's fun and unique.

If you're bad at pinball like me, you might think this game is going frustrating and in a few parts of the game it is. BUT, even though it's sometimes frustrating and challenging because you can't seem to hit that 1 spot, the game still manages to feel fun, because there isn't really a way to die in the game. You just get to bounce yourself around the board till you manage to get it right, and it's rewarding when you do. The game also has a few boss fights and every single boss encounter is unique, well designed and really fun. 

Really every single aspect of this game is fun. It does everything right that it sets out to do. It's a 10/10. Even the fast travel in the game is designed in a way makes it fun to use.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977886469', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1647665700}
review:
Who knew the world needed a pinball based Metroidvania so badly? Fun gameplay with good artwork. As someone who sucks at pinball, that element was easy to pick up.

The music is mostly chill, with a really good track or two. It would have been nice to have a little more variety and maybe some up tempo songs. The final boss track though, is horrible, and doesn't fit the rest of the game or the scene at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178546610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1609472354}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express is a wonderful and criminally undiscovered gem. This game is so much more than it looks like. Amazing, visually pleasing aesthetic, great sound track, unique game play mechanics, memorable characters that you care about, and a complex and interesting open world complete with well written lore and exposition that relates to the story. It even has plenty of well done side quests and end game content. I truly loved playing through this game. 

I would describe this game as a 2d open world puzzle rpg with pinball thrown in and it all works so well. I highly recommend this game to any indie game fan who is open to fresh experiences.

author: {'steamid': '76561199074746823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1609447658}
review:
Pinball meets metroidvania. Yoku's Island Express is what a game has to be, fun! Cute characters and a big map to explore plus things to do.  Original gameplay and relaxing time. I recommend it, yeeah.

Un juego relajante pero sumamente divertido. Jugabilidad buena y original. PINBALL se fusiona con mapa metroidvaniano. Buen apartado musical y artistico con aspecto gracioso y colorido, personajes monos y un buen puñado de recados por hacer en la isla. Explora, mejora habilidades para acceder a zonas nuevas o secretas... Me ha encantado, muy entretenido y divertido. Para todas las edades. Superrecomendado. A jugar!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008091739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1599918347}
review:
YIE is metroidvania type game where the main character is a beetle toting around a ball, essentially dictating that all movement in the game is based on rolling. This feature allows for a unique type of adventure where classic pinball-type physics are employed.

Pros:
[list]
[*] Wonderful art.
[*] Smooth physics. The pinball aspect was done very well.
[*] Nice character progression and area access through item acquisition.
[*] OK story and characters.
[*] Can be bought for a few bucks on sale.
[*] Proper game-length.
[/list]

Cons: 
[list]
[*] I personally found the flower-spinning jumps (sometimes requiring up to 5 or 6 in a row), much too complicated for a game of this nature.
[/list]

On the whole, there isn't too much to say. This is a wonderful little game.

Overall: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031166761', 'num_games_owned': 2261, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1609260147}
review:
Metroidvania con elementos de pinball... o pinball con elementos de metroidvania? Qué se yo, solo soy un gnomo.
A veces las físicas en el aire pueden ser un poco molestas cuando se intenta ser preciso y ojalá me hubieran dado un upgrade de velocidad mucho antes ya que el movimiento terrestre se siente bastante duro. 
El arte es consistentemente lindo y la música está a la par. Aunque es dificil no pensar en el Ori, que le pasa el trapo en estos aspectos.
Aun asi es muy divertido AGUANTE EL PINBALL LOCO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053924290', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1609391578}

author: {'steamid': '76561198274142905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1609160666}
review:
I would like to meet that very first guy who came up with the idea: "we could make a metroidvania but with pinball stages instead of fighting and platforming". You are a genius my friend!
First, I was a bit skeptic by the structure of the game but when I start playing it every doubt dissolved. The mix of the two genres works perfectly smooth, thanks to the neat and detailed development. As a big fan of metroidvania games, I  can easily say that the metroidvania gameplay feeling is perfectly respected, with lot of smart exploration and backtracking. 
Big plus also for the colorful graphics, music and atmosphere, with lot of funny charachters to meet on the island. Definitely not (only) a kids game, but one of the well-hidden gems in the metroidvania genre.
The only major downside is the longevity of the product, which requires around 6-8 hours to be completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013723081', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1607820408}
review:
Hello friends,

Welcome to my review of Yuku's Island Express. In this game, you play as a small dung beetle who takes over for a pterodactyl in delivering the mail for a island. The game itself is a mix between rpg elements and pinball mechanincs. The storyline is pretty straight and linear, but you can explore the island at your own leisure. You also get abilities or items that can help looking around the island. They can help you explore the island fully. Be aware that some collectibles in the game require a special trick that is not mentioned. This is the slug explosion trick. Basically, a explosion that propels your character over obsticles. Anyways, here is my PRO/CON list:

PROS:

- A fun game.
- Great artwork and a nice soundtrack. The artwork is similiar to raymon series.
- Lots of collectibles.
- Puzzles mixed with pinball action.
- Nice storyline.


CONS:

- Sometimes the pinball mechanics of the game are hard to use and hard to get used to.
- The fact that the "slug explosion" method is never mentioned in the game, so it is up to the player to discover how to use it. They should of at least explained a bit about it.
- I wish there was more of the game..it was fun. Maybe a sequel in the future?


I do recommend the game because it is quite fun. If you also like pinball games, this will also be fun for you. I think this game would be great for young children and hard core achievement hunters too. There are things in the game that both group of players will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815452008', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1621613304}
review:
绝对意义上的好游戏。
艺术风格和收集系统让人想到乐克乐克，全图逐渐获取能力逐渐开放的设定更像银河城，主体解谜部分则是弹珠台。
很可爱，很有趣，无意打开结果一口气玩了半个下午……

author: {'steamid': '76561198101237260', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1607591516}
review:
Très bonne surprise que ce [b]Yoku's Island Express[/b]. L'histoire nous fait incarner un cafard relié à une "boule" et qui devient postier sur une île peuplée d'étranges créatures mais très amicale (OK, ça vend pas du rêve présenté comme ça, mais c'est loin d'être le pire scénario auquel j'ai joué...)
Le mélange plateforme/flipper fonctionne parfaitement. Moins féerique qu'un [i]Ori & the Blind Forest[/i]. Moins action qu'un [i]Hollow Knight[/i]. Mais on y retrouve des idées communes (les insectes, les "monstres") ainsi qu'une DA magnifique le tout saupoudré d'une ambiance chill et une super BO.
Comptez environ 7 heures pour l'histoire principale. Rajoutez 2 à 3 heures pour chasser les succès restant. Un peu court pour les 20€ demandé mais l'expérience est rafraîchissante.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2114, 'num_reviews': 1251, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1607463161}
review: A combination pinball game + Metroidvania about a cute bug named Yoku trying to deliver mail and solve problems for the locals on an island. It's a unique genre blend, but you're going to have a hard time if you don't enjoy pinball or if you don't enjoy Metroidvanias. I fall more into the second category, and really wanted to just do the pinball segments without having to navigate my way around a huge map or backtrack when I found new equipment that would open up previously closed off areas. Not for me, but if you're in the venn diagram of people who love pinball and Metroidvanias definitely check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084223806', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1607207868}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a very fun and extremely addictive game mixing the elements of a platformer and a pinball game.
Lush visual style and pleasant music provide a relaxing experience, so, if you are interested in metroidvanias, but you are put off by generally dark visual style and hardcore mechanics, this game may be just perfect for you.
Definitely worth spending a couple of evenings on (or 10+ hours, if you're a completionist like me).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1666990811}
review:
When I started playing computer games around 1985, I would have never guessed that at one point in the future I'll play a pinball game with a dung beetle as main character. Yet here we are with Yoku's Island Express - which is not only a pinball game, but also a unique kind of metroidvania, where you can't attack and you can't jump. But, you can be the pinball. Sounds crazy? It is - in a very, very good way.

Our hero Yoku arrives at Mokumana Island on his ball as a raft (which, consequently, can't really be dung, can it?), in his new appointment as Postmaster. Things go pear-shaped even before he lands on the island - he has to find out that the islands god (or similar), Mokuma was viciously attacked, island affairs are in disarray, and the post office is in tatters anyway. All this can't hurt Yoku's sunny disposition, as he rolls up his sleeves and sets out to set everything right - and by everything I mean not only Mokuma's situation and the post office, but seemingly every single problem anyone has on the island. Which is plenty.

Yoku's quest of relentless gooddoing is a perfect little gem in the sea of aggressive gaming content - nothing against that, but sometimes it's simply good to see something radically different. With beautiful, radiant visuals, excellent sounds and one of the best soundtracks in recent years, Mokumana island is a place where you can always visit, relax, and make some progress in the story, enjoying some of the weirdest mix of mechanics in gaming history. The island is a big open-world map, with some positions locked to story progress. Yoku enthusiastically pushes his ball around, and instead of jumping, he can make use of pinball bats to scale heights. But that's not all the pinball there is in the game - there are some 20 small pinball tables at various places in the island, completing which gives us further navigation options, or items. And so on - typical pinballvania, isn't it?
Actually, a mix of game mechanics like this is very hard to do right, and the other big thing about Yoku's IE is that the creators did a terrific job in creating the gameplay, which is always fluid and quite often rewarding. Also, the game boasts an almost insane level of polish, which is something you'd expect from Team 17, however, Yoku is the first game by the small studio Villa Gorilla - not that the developers were newbies, of course.
The final piece of the puzzle is the slightly wacky, slightly self-ironic but never offensive humour, which completes the experience of total, relentless fun.

It's rare to find a game so perfectly executed to its premises as Yoku's Island Express. It's not ambitious in its story, but it indeed is in its choice of mechanics, and maximizes the audiovisual experience. Very highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063353632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1607227001}

So it's on the short side, but it's a delightful metroidvania. Fun exploration, pinball-style gameplay, and beautiful art direction. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025522562', 'num_games_owned': 1499, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1607173721}
review:
Oh yeah! This is an great platformer that uses pinball as the main gimmick. It's cute, the controls are good, the map is huge. The map contains different "levels" but it's all parts of a seamless world. You get quests that you need to fulfill to proceed in the game so there is a bit of backtracking. But after a while the world opens up with shortcuts and a quick travel feature.
I highly recommend playing this game. I don't think you will regret it if you like platformers and pinball.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313759899', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1607091468}
review:
终于全成就了，游戏是个好游戏，音乐轻松画风可爱，玩法又颇具创意，不过作为一个银河恶魔城 like 游戏，并不算休闲，对强迫症兼手残玩家来说，需要考虑下是否有耐心为一个成就反复跑图和抠一点操作细节。

以下是一些快速入门 tip，可能影响自己探索游戏的乐趣。

游戏中有三项特殊能力：吸附蛞蝓（可以破黑紫色的石头）、吸附山竹？（可以去往一些特殊路径）以及潜水，除了潜水之外，其他能力跟随主线做就会解锁。

因为没有跳跃，很多上不去的地方可以利用蛞蝓爆炸的冲击力反弹上去，方向是可以控制的，蛞蝓吸附在球那面的反方向就是爆炸时会冲过去的方向。

前期比较重要的是扩充背包，可以更多的攒下水果，卖背包的小兔子没水果它会先给你背包，可以后面有的时候再还。水果的花费上，弹板解锁分 30 和 80 的，一般 80 的更重要，可能没有代替路径；4 条蜂线，一定要优先解锁！！能节省很多来回跑图的时间，蜂线每站都能下，中间站 enter 就能下车。

柳条和圣甲虫是密集分布在全地图的收集要素，全地图可以分为四块区域，每个区域有一个柳条位置查看器，不要错过宝箱和可以对话的小生物；圣甲虫几乎在每个大型弹球关中都有，点亮每个附近的小按钮或者机关直到圣甲虫的翅膀打开，没有激活的圣甲虫在地图中会用蓝色圣甲虫翅膀标识出（似乎需要全图未激活个数小于 10 个）。

最后，社区中心里有很多高质量的指南~enjoy~

author: {'steamid': '76561198070727709', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1682712536}
review:
Das 8/10este Spiel, das ich seit langem die Freude haben konnte zu spielen, einfach schön: 
Entspannend - aber nicht langweilig oder repetitiv 
herausfordernd - aber nicht schwierig 
freundlich - aber nicht zu infantil
Die Map teilt sich in thematisch einfach unterscheidbare Abschnitte auf sodass verirren praktisch unmöglich ist, und die bis jetzt knuffigste Möglichkeit des Quicktravel (Die Bienenlinie, die man jederzeit auf der Strecke verlassen kann) macht Schnellreisen einfach - ohne dabei einen Ladebildschirm zu aktivieren. 

Kurz:
knuffig, feelgood und entspannend. Ein Steal im Sale für alle, die nach einem langen Tag abschalten möchten!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980892571', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1605621742}
review:
Yoku's island Express is a pinball-style platformer game with a nice simple story attached to the gameplay. You are a new postermaster to an island that is under a crisis. You have to deliver mail and resolve the problem the island is facing. It will take around 5 hours to complete.
Pros:
+ Pinball style gameplay
+ Beautiful art style
+ Well-designed island.
+ Nice puzzles 
+ Villain reveal took me by surprise.

Cons:
- Might be short for pinball lovers. You can complete it in 5 hours.
- Final ending was meh.
- Should have had more boss battles.
- Very few challenging puzzles

This game is worth your time if you like pinball style games and platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212880515', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1605784123}
review:
最大的亮点：弹球+银河恶魔城
最大的缺点：弹球+银河恶魔城

首先不得不说，这两种游戏类型的结合，令人耳目一新；游戏的关卡设计独具匠心，弹球关卡中的每个挡板、地形都有其存在的意义；画面和音乐也十分优异。

然而，作为一款弹球游戏，其操作极其依赖反应速度，对我来说难到吐血：很多时候知道应该在什么位置触发挡板，但就是无法在正确的时机操作。成功的感觉的确很爽快，但在操作失败时没有任何正反馈，只能一遍又一遍地等待角色复位、盯紧打击时机、然后再次失败……当你的失败次数远远大于成功次数时，不免十分烦躁。更糟糕的是，很多路径的通过也需要依靠弹球，一招不慎就前功尽弃，于是我这种菜鸡玩家几乎连走路都走不动，自始至终都在弹球的泥潭中挣扎，探索地图的想法也被完全挫败。

最终，原本优秀的画风、音乐、设计都被抛在脑后，我的眼前只剩自己喷出的一口老血……我在游玩一个半小时后只完成了 17%，卡关，遂弃坑；昨天我觉得自己又行了，拾起来又玩了半个小时，结果还是没能推进一步，只好彻底放弃了这款游戏。当然，“难”的游戏有很多。关键问题在于，作为一款定位为短流程、偏休闲的游戏，却让我感到前所未有的精疲力竭、再也不想启动游戏，完全不符合我的期望。

总之，这是一道好菜，可惜不对我的胃口。对于像我一样的玩家，我只能给出“不推荐”。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027933044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1605819775}

author: {'steamid': '76561198130785162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1605816686}
review: Качественная игра. Местами сложно. Атмосфера расслабляющая, типа "не воспринимай все всерьёз". Успокаивающие мелодии и приятная на глаз графика совмещены с пальце и мозголомным пинболом. Это интересное сочетание, особенно, если вам нравится пинбол.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281538359', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1605695820}
review:
玩了三小时。卡在了某个地方，然后看攻略。才发现，原来我三小时只完成了别人30分钟的进度。。

——————————————————第二天更新———————————————————

算是第一次接触这种弹珠类游戏，之前也比较喜欢横版闯关类游戏。尤库这游戏给我的感觉就像是雷曼的配乐风格＋奥日的地图探索机制。就是没有奥日那么硬核，这很好。

反正对于强迫症患者来说，这游戏的搜集机制就是一个噩梦。只能抑制住自己那全收集的欲望了。。。不然要肝死在这里了。

游戏的优点有很多，例如玩法以及画面和音乐。尤其是画面和音乐是我特别喜欢的。不记得自己当时多少入手的，反正打折买就是血赚。原价入也不亏。

然后就说一说我认为的一些不足吧。我认为唯一的的不足就是跑图方面了，虽说有蜂道，但是蜂道基本上就是起点到终点。中途下车就没得回头路了。还是要有传送机制比较好吧。省去了很多不必要的跑图时间。

OK，就说这些~~~尤库的小岛速递，总体来说我认为还是挺好的。尤其是画面和音乐。另外玩法方面也不错，以前没玩过这种的可以一试。总之就是喜欢横版闯关类的玩家我都推荐你去玩一玩。

我又来了。。。突然想起来，还有很重要的一点没说，那就是。玩这类游戏，一定要用手柄啊！一定要用手柄啊！一定要用手柄啊！

讲真，玩这类游戏如果不用手柄，体验直接减半（可能都不止）。所以我墙裂建议，一定要用手柄玩！

——————————————————第三天更新——————————————————

我居然全成就了！！！我居然全成就了！！！我我我太激动了！！！

哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈~~~印象中除了小黄油那种动动手指就能全成就的游戏，其他达成全成就的游戏就只狼和尤库的小岛速递两个！但是只狼是开修改器达成的全成就，所以全凭我自己达成全成就的游戏就仅此一个！！！

留个纪念哈哈哈哈哈哈哈，尤库是个超可爱超有趣的游戏！

author: {'steamid': '76561198170899422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1605160679}
review:
This is such a simple and fun little game. It isn't incredibly long, but it feels full without getting too tiring or grind-y. If you like pinball, you'll probably like this game, and if you think pinball is boring and overrated, you STILL might like this, because that's how I typically feel. I'm not sure that the game has a lot of replay value, but I think this might be one of the rare games that I'd play a second time just for the mechanics.


I streamed the game for a friend and she shared a lot of the same feelings about how some simple elements (like getting launched around the Bee-line) were well made, and how the game was very positively and controlably stimulating.
I also think that the game does a fantastic job of making itself fun and carefree. I thought it was difficult enough to provide a challenge for players who like that. I also was very pleased that the game doesn't punish you harshly for doing poorly. This is such an overlooked element that detracts from enjoyment and accessability in other games, and Yoku's Island Express handles it very well.
The game runs very smoothly (I recommend playing on a gamepad if you have one) and the art, music, and overall design are wonderful. The characters are cute, and well made. The way you play and meet characters really makes sense and feels natural, even though it really shouldn't make sense at all. You're a far-flung dung beetle being tossed around an island after all. It seems like there were so many thoughtful choices put into this game. 

From a more critical standpoint, I was incredibly refreshed by the break from white colonialism and cishet hegemony that this game provides. You could look up some more thorough reviews yourself if you're interested, but I found the game to be devoid of those sort of harmful structures compared to almost any other game. I was really able to relax and unwind and just feel pure joy while playing. I can't speak for how well any cultural references are handled, but at the very least, there were no racial charicatures, no jokes at the expense of cultural traits, and no instances of appropriation that I could recognize. The only red flag was the treatment of the little puffball critters, but even then, it was at worst mildly dodgy.

The only thing that I wish had been incorporated a little better would be the use of the baubles and ball decorations. There are a couple small puzzles with the decorations, but I think they could have "sprinkled" them in a little more. It was a very cute element. Still, I can definitely understand and respect whatever reasons that they didn't incorporate the ball decorations more.

If you're on the fence about this game, just get it. I would be surprised if anyone didn't enjoy this game. I'd give it a 10/10. I wanna simp for this game. It might not end up being your favorite game ever, but I do think it'll find a nice warm spot in your heart to cozy up to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071998760', 'num_games_owned': 1328, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1605374536}

author: {'steamid': '76561198230629972', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1611941396}
review:
ストアページからも察せれるが難しさやボスの攻略等を楽しむ作品では無い。可愛らしいキャラクターやほのぼのとした世界を楽しむゲーム。
タグにメトロイドヴァニアと書かれているが紛れもなくメトロイドヴァニアです。
ピンボールをやった事があり、嫌いでなけれオススメできます。

ピンボールの挙動が繊細（ちょっとした角度の違いで飛ぶ位置がぜんぜん違う）すぎて、飛ばしたい場所に行かないストレスがあるが、そこはピンボール初心者の意見かもしれない。逆に言えばピンボールのクオリティが高いとも言える。
ちょっとした謎解き（パズル）要素もセンスが良かったと思います。
続編を希望したい作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561199050152389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1606089740}
review: This game satisfies my interest in exploration in games when I want a "chill" game. The music is continuously calm, you don't have to worry about getting ALL THE THINGS in a first pass because inevitably you haven't discovered a trinket that will help you get something in an area. All the characters are very adorable. To boot, there is actually a plot line AND pinball mechanics! I keep describing this game to people as Sonic Spinball, but relaxed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318533002', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1605065940}
review:
类恶魔城+三维弹球，童年回忆集合，是个有趣的小游戏。美术风格和音乐也很优秀，史低14血赚。
缺点可能是流程较短，12小时可以除圣甲虫外全收集了，另外剧情有些老套，或者说也可以说可爱？

author: {'steamid': '76561198173201543', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1604899717}
review:
Sehr schönes kleines Game wo viel Liebe drinnen Steckt, die Pinball-Elemente gefallen mir sehr, erinnert mich leicht an alte Donkey Kong Zeiten von der Aufmachung her.
Jump'n'Run, puzzle und hübsche Grafik schmecken einfach zu gut, und im Stream hatte mir sogar jemand von Speedruns erzählt die er bei diesem Game macht, also für die Profis unter euch versucht euch doch mal daran.

Fazit: Empfehlung

author: {'steamid': '76561198056886605', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1605026817}
review:
Hallo Zusammen,

Yoku's Island Express ist eine super süßes und enspannendes Spiel für alle Altersgruppen. 

Als Postmeister Yoku muss man in diesem 2D Plattformer sich über eine riesige Inseln flippern! Ja richtig! FLIPPERN! Als kleiner Käfer ist man mit einer Schnurr an einer Flipperkugel befestigt und muss verschiedene Aufgaben erfüllen, welche man überall auf der Karte von den Inselbewohnern erhält. Das Spiel hat eine leider recht einfache, aber sehr süße Hauptgeschichte und zahlreiche kleinere Nebenaufgaben.

Es ist absolut zu empfehlen um es mit den Kindern zu spielen oder alleine. Es ist eine sehr gute Mischung aus Rätseln und Geschick. 

Eine absolute Empfehlung! 

Spieldauer: 
Hauptgeschichte: 11 Std.
100%: ca. 15 Std.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5710, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1604979806}
review:
I sat on Yoku's Island Express for a very long time before playing it, having been off-handedly recommended to me by only one person.  Then I finally put it on my HDD and fired it up.  I probably did this whole thing over the course of three days.

Yoku's is one part Metroidlike and one part pinball game.  Wait, don't go!  It works, trust me!  You play as Yoku, a dung beetle who rolls an egg(?) instead of a ball of poop.  For whatever reason, you become the postmaster of the island and well, it turns out the whole island is in disarray and it's up to you to deliver the mail... and also save the island from collapse.  Look, it doesn't matter.

The game is, like most Metroidlikes, spread out across a single interconnected map with several biomes and progress is ability-locked, so you need to go find upgrades to access new areas - as expected.  The twist is that there's a huge pinball element to the game as not only do you control Yoku as (s)he pushes a ball around, but also all of the island's flippers/bumpers which are either yellow, blue, or both.  These are all over the place and respond to you at all times and while you explore, you will find yourself rolling into actual small pinball tables all across the island.  Most of these are puzzle challenges that ramp up in difficulty as the game progresses (but not by a whole lot) and lead to upgrades that unlock more sections of the map.  Draining on these tables doesn't really hinder your progress and it's incredibly difficult to die... at least I assume you can die, but truth be told is I never died once during the entire game.

In short, Yoku's Island Express is accessible and totally stress-free.  There can be some frustrating moments from time to time, mostly in figuring out how to best traverse the convoluted map, but that mostly plays into the endgame and really only if you're a completionist.  For the most part, anyone familiar with video game pinball will be absolutely comfortable here as that as about as hard as the challenge ever gets.  Don't get me wrong, there are some pretty twisted pinball sections, but nothing is out to get you and there's no reason to fear any danger.

Oh, and the real charm of the game is that everything is lovingly-crafted 2D artwork and it's got an oddly-surreal feel to it as the myriad creatures you encounter in the game rarely have a real-world counterpart.  The game has a kooky charm throughout, reflected in its art design as well as in its gameplay.  There's really nothing quite like it and it definitely deserves your attention.

For comparison, I'd say I get a big Supraland feel out of Yoku's as it is very much focused on exploring and having fun instead of stressing out over what to do next and how to survive.  It's super chill and it's a real good time.  It's one of those rare cases where the story doesn't need to happen because it's so much fun just playing the game.  If you like finding all the hidden stuff tucked away nooks and crannies, this is your game... unless you don't like pinball, but let's be honest - who doesn't like pinball?  Soul-less devil people, that's who!

author: {'steamid': '76561198193531813', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1604992450}

author: {'steamid': '76561199069783906', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1604437678}
review:
Yoku's Island Express ingeniously flips its pinball arcade roots to organically conceive an innovative Metroidvania that, whilst is absent of consequential challenges, delivers the necessary goods with assured confidence and composure.

WHAT I LIKED:
+ The postman always rings twice. Yoku, a dung beetle permanently attached to a ball comprising of all sorts of stuff, becomes a postmaster on a thriving island and must deliver letters to certain characters in order to prevent a looming calamity from occurring. The playing controls Yoku, which in turn moves the ball around the island. No jumping. No sprinting. The majority of traversal is managed by manipulating pinball paddles to guide Yoku's ball, and consequently Yoku himself, through ramps, bumpers and a plethora of tracks within the substantially luscious open-world location. It's an incredibly unique blend of two genres, and one that works effortlessly in supplying fun without resorting to excess perseverance.
+ Mokumana in all its stunning glory. The island to which Island Express is set in is varied and interconnected, as all good Metroidvanias should be, and is filled with an abundance of collectible Wickerlings and upgrades to specific equipment. However, its beauty comes from the picturesque water-coloured backdrops that give life to the island. From the snowy tundra mountains of Ivory Peaks to the thick dense foliage of Gorilla Woods. The best of the genre produce an organic free-flowing world, and Mokumana sits among the best by designing its world around the pinball mechanics without making them look disarranged. 
+ Please insert coin. Yoku is bounced, flipped and tossed around like a raw patty on a smoky barbecue. The incorporation of pinball mechanics in a two-dimensional side-scrolling platformer should not work. But, here we are, and it does so magnificently. These interspersed segments test the player's classic arcade skills whilst also embedding the various special abilities that Yoku comes across as he searches the island high and low for mailboxes. For example, vacuuming up slugs which can then be used to explode Yoku's clump of stringiness and change his trajectory, or to obliterate boulders. Several optional scarabs also add further challenges by enabling the player to complete certain manoeuvres within the pinball areas, maximising this mechanic's potential even further. Flip those flippers!
+ The postmaster really is a fungi. Dispersing various mushrooms across the island to find suitable habitable conditions, recovering ancient fragments of a statue, juicing up the juicery and loads more! Island Express is open-world, and therefore a plethora of side-quests are available which will reward Yoku with some incredibly useful items. Diving underwater being one of them...
+ Squish that spider! The main story somehow involves boss battles where Yoku must fully pelt the ball into the bosses' weak points. Whether it be a giant spider, igniting a space rocket (we'll count that...) or a flying...indescribable creature with claws and substantial grimacing? Either way, they are cleverly merged with the pinball mechanics, newly introduced abilities and pack a wholesome amount of charm.

WHAT I DISLIKED:
- Who knew being a dung beetle being employed as a postmaster would be so breezy? Yoku's Island Express is definitely aimed for the casual audience, lacking in any real challenge. Failing to flip Yoku's ball will result in loss of fruit, the basic currency of the game, and an instant restart in the same area. The abundance of fruit consequently relinquishes any fear of loss. Missed activating a flipper? Boom! Here's another chance, and another...and another. The only real challenge is learning the geography of Mokumana, however thanks to the detailed in-game map and unlockable bee-lines (essentially fast travel points) this is made easier. It's not a major critique, as many will seek to have a relaxing yet fun time with Island Express, but those searching for real challenge are unlikely to find it here.

VERDICT:
8/10 wallet upgrades

author: {'steamid': '76561197994326050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1604830712}
review:
[b]Innovative platformer/metroidvania with great mechanics and beautiful graphics. [/b]
It's super easy to get into and the fact that you don't have to worry about dying makes the game quite relaxing to play. I do wish the bossfights were a bit more challenging and varied and that it had some sort of run away time challenge like these types of games often have, but all in all a great game. 

[b]Easy buy if your into platformer games![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042821778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1604868221}
review:
This game has a huge, open map full of beautiful vistas, odd characters and charming ball-rolling gameplay. If you're at all a fan of metroidvanias, I highly, highly recommend this game. For you completionists out there, 100% the game is fairly fair and fun, there is enough direction that I didn't need to use a guide, but you have to be thorough!

Thanks for the pleasant and enjoyable experience, Villa Gorilla!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1604477778}
review:
An adorable little indie game, that should not take you more than a couple of days to finish. Basically, a mix between the classic (yet not famous enough!) Sonic Spinball, the metroidvania and adventure genres, and maybe some puzzle/click/action style games like Amanita Design or PopCap. A bit too easy and light, but overall a beautifully well drawn, casual Pinball game by this Swedish studio. I look forward to a more challenging follow up or their next game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198893483535', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1604474775}
review: Out of all the metroidvania games I've played, this is definitely the most unique while still pulling off a satisfying and charming world with great gameplay. It's got some fun characters with a charming art style and relaxing music, but the gameplay is extremely well made. Utilizing pinball into world navigation and progression is no easy feat, especially considering how unpredictable it can be. They really got it down to a science with the size of each path you can hit the ball down with it still requiring good timing, but never infuriating. There's also points where you might flick yourself into the middle of an area with bumpers that are set up to hit you in a specific direction. This could be extremely problematic, but they took it all into account, making it always send you where you want it to. This game is a one of a kind and honestly doesn't get enough attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087816058', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1604339288}
review: An alright game. Pinball and Metroidvania mash-up is definitely unique, and although the game can be frustrating at times, it does not overstay its welcome. With some tweaking and fleshed out story, the possible sequel has every possibility to be a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964845606', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1604337795}
review:
Cute little game.
The artwork is great and the music is perfect for setting the mood for a little cute game to finish over the weekend.
The game is quite short and can be finished within 5 hours if you are fast. There are loads of things to collect and the puzzles to solve, the solutions aren't too hard so you can figure out 95% on your own without having to look it up.
Moving around the map can get a bit anoying untill you unlock fast travle but the castlevania style fits perfectly with the pinball gameplay.
The game is an easy recommend but check out the clips on the steam page to see if the gameplay is to your liking. The basic gameplay loop is the same throughout but with the short playtime it doesnt get tedious before it is done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990674644', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1603209319}
review:
Отличное, уютное, концентрированное и не очень длинное приключение, а она дает именно ощущение приключения на тропическом (экзотическом) острове.
Оригинальная механика пинбольного приключения (особенно необычно в метроидвании), харизматичные герои, хорошие диалоги и сюжет и просто офигенная музыка (второй раз из всех моих игр мне хочется купить еще и саундтрек).
Единственное что челенжа она никакого не создает, все просто и в потоке.
Короче, советую всем!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017086570', 'num_games_owned': 1433, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1603818491}
review:
A metroidvania mixed with a pin-ball mechanics. I believe I never felt bored by this game's creativity and charm. I'll say that the developers put lots of love into the creation of this game, which reminds me of the likes of Iconoclasts, Hollow Knight, Aquaria, Steamworld Dig, and it would be very remiss of me not to mention the obvious inspiration from Ori.

PS. This game also reminds me of the joy I felt when I played Locoroco, trying to create the perfect Loco House lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982272331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1603153339}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043262862', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1603137061}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025510154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1565468208}
review:
Mid-rez 2D pinball platformer RPG.  You're a dung beetle who, complete with your favorite dung ball, has arrived at an island, where you immediately are handed the job of island postmaster.  Navigate the island via your dung ball, deliver the long-delayed mail, and discover the island's secrets.

This is not a pinball game in the classic sense of digital pinball games.  This is a platformer that uses pinball mechanics to navigate the map.  There are bumpers to bounce off of, the occasional flipper to launch yourself with, chutes and targets and rollovers.  But you are not the ball...you are the dung beetle tethered to the ball as it goes flying all over the place.  Which, among other things, means you have some influence over the ball even when it's standing still...you can slowly push it to either side, shove it off edges, get it over some bumps with a running start and so on.  There are ways to modify your ball, which you'll need for specific missions and situations.

Plotwise, you're taking over from the previous postmaster who had apparently really fallen down on the job.  Mailboxes dot the island, and there are achievements for how many you can find and access.  Packages await delivery to rather-hard-to-reach places, introducing you to inhabitants that can help you understand some of the bigger issues the island is having.  Other inhabitants have missions for you, such as reaching the top of the island's peak (because it's there, of course), working out some political issues that are blocking your route, finding peoples' lost thingies, etc.

I admit, my initial reaction was originally "Ooooookay...", but I wound up enjoying it.  I found it challenging and amusing.  I did complete the main story, but i currently haven't found all the findables.  I got it in a HB bundle; the current store price of $19.99 feels a little steep but not outrageously so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399103617', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1705184914}
review:
Recomiendo este juego por el mero echo de que me lo compre en rebajas pensando que iba a ser un árcade "normalillo" pero, al ir avanzando, me di cuenta de que era mas que eso, siendo una mezcla de metroidvania con pinball, juego de correos, coleccionables que encontrar y una isla que se basa en cañones poco seguros para desplazarse por ella.

Si te gustan los juegos de pinball y los metroidvania TIENES que jugar a este juego, los fusiona con una exploración satisfactoria y unos pinball con puzles simples pero increiblemente adictivos y divertidos de resolver.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990036156', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 506, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1602446175}
review:
Wow, what a ride this game was. This takes the idea of games like Battle Pinball (Bandai Namco's super robot wars spinoff) and Pokemon Pinball and makes a metroidvania without borrowing from another franchise. This is a truly unique experience and something that will never happen again so make sure to add this game to your list of things to do before you die.

Do note that this game will not run well on nvidia optimus, you will need to get rid of optimus and switch to discreet in the bios if you have a laptop with nvidia optimus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023154119', 'num_games_owned': 5242, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1600801989}
review: Metroidvania i pinball. Połączenie, które brzmi niedorzecznie, a działa bardzo dobrze. Przemieszczamy się robaczkiem z przyczepioną kulą, ale nawet nie da się skakać - by dostać się gdziekolwiek, trzeba używać flipperów. A na szczęście cały świat jest nimi najeżony. Pomysł świetny, wykonanie niezłe - parę godzin miłej zabawy z ładną otoczką i przyjemnymi nutami w tle, odprężające. W sumie jedyna wada, jaka przychodzi mi do głowy, zaczyna dokuczać dopiero przy próbie wymaksowania wszystkiego - przedostawanie się do niektórych miejsc przez bardzo precyzyjne strzały może się z czasem zrobić irytujące, przydałoby się więcej dodatkowych bumperów np. za zaliczenie sekwencji, by nie zmuszać do powtarzania przy kolejnej okazji. System szybkiej podróży też jest taki sobie, bo niby daje możliwość dostania się w wieeeeele miejsc i jest nawet kreatywny, ale niestety, choć jest masa punktów docelowych, tak miejsc, z których da się rozpocząć podróż na skróty, jest śmiesznie mało. Znowu: to męczy tylko jak chce się zebrać wszystko. I tak warto poświęcić czas, przejście na 100% zajęło mi niewiele ponad 6 godzin (a jak ktoś lubi spoilery i poradniki, da radę i w 3).

author: {'steamid': '76561198177730535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1611916043}
review: Love this game so much! I'm terrible at almost every game including pinball but it only took me a couple of hours to get really good at using the pinball paddle system. Yoku is so adorable, everything is so pretty to look at and the music and sound effects are awesome. You can also ignore the tasks you are given and go play, or do tasks in your own order, and once I had completed the game objectives, I could still go around playing in the game finishing off little tasks and exploring, or just playing the pinball sections over and over. SO worth the money, I would have paid more for it if needed now that I know what it is like. I don't have the skill or the patience to play any of the other games I have bought on steam for very long, but I could play this game over and over from the start and enjoy it each time. BELIEVE ME YOU WANT THIS ADORABLENESS IN YOUR LIFE!

review: This game is such a blast to play. What a creative spin on the platformer. Cute art style, engaging story, fun music, and just the right amount of challenge. I sincerely hope they make a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981107149', 'num_games_owned': 1620, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1520, 'last_played': 1603496598}
review:
This is the best pinball game on Steam. There is a wonderful variety of pinball layouts to play. I loved maxing out all the boards and exploring the island. It's a great mix of genres.

I enjoyed it so much I wanted to keep playing it to 100% it after beating the final boss (something I rarely do). I spent almost 24 hours on if during my first playthrough. I've also started playing it again on a new save file to re-experience it's joyful play.

Highly recommended for those who enjoy pinball and those who would enjoy a very well developed Metroidvania variant.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992291521', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1601387313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198113908136', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1641086565}
review: Yokus Island Express e um joguinho bem legal se vc estiver procurando por algo bem casual, misturando elementos plataforma com pinball e metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199764311', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1601945438}
review:
In short, it's a lovely and fun game with pinball as its core mechanic.

In more detail. The soundrack is captivating and coresponds to the area of the map you're in, to further immerse you into the whole atmosphere of the Mokumana island. The color palette is vivid and makes the art style quite pleasing to the eye. The story is well writen and you won't be stuck wondering where to go next. You play as Yoku, a dung-beetle who just got appointed as the new Postmaster on the island, and you've already bitten more than you can chew. Even though the core mechanic of the game is pinball, it doesn't get repetitive because you still move around the map and get other tools to aid you in the quest to save the island,  and deliver all the mail of course!

I do recommend buying this game, it's awesome and more than worth it considering all the fun I had. (And I'm not even done with all the side missions yet)
Great job Villa Gorilla team, you've made an amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049944492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1569352088}
review:
Very fun adventure game. a bit fetch-quest heavy, but all around nice and chill game.

It's a niche gem in the pile of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998674840', 'num_games_owned': 1747, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1670968143}
review: Probably one of the best games of all of 2018. It's full of charm, life and energy and it really manages to make its unusual concept of merging metroidvania and pinball elements work. I'd played it on Switch originally but I went back and did everything again and then some. Sometimes the fast travel system feels like it could have used more access points so you can skip some of the cleared tables faster, but at the same time it's probably still clearable in about 8-15 hours and there's really nothing else like it. Definitely one of my favourite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018040930', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1600910304}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022516049', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1673760839}
review:
Reminds me of Banjo-Kazooie, except instead of Banjo, there's a beetle, and instead of Kazooie, there's a ball that represents sh** that a dung beetle pushes around, and somehow this concept resulted in a platformer involving an entire large 2D map full of pinball movement.

My only complaint is that the pinball smacker-doos weren't taking advantage of my Xbox controller's pressure sensitive triggers. Unless they were and I somehow didn't notice the entire game. Or there was a setting I could've changed to make that happen. That would suck if I ignored that the whole game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992620025', 'num_games_owned': 962, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1600650445}
review:
Had a great time playing Yoku as a chill with a podcast game. The story is not particularly engaging, so ignoring a lot of it and just paying attention to the few set piece moments is sufficient. I often stopped playing to focus more on other games, but liked Yoku enough to come back and finish it.

Partway through I starting playing this hot seat with my five year old. He loves it. It's beautifully colourful. He can do a lot of the traversal through the world (especially the Bee line) and I can take over for the puzzles. It's not scary (there are some large monsters, but they're always partly obscured and aren't presented as terrifying). Now we're trying to collect everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305894160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1600407595}
review:
this is a pinball game but not like the traditional pinball game, it combine adventure, rpg and pinball, to me it is new and i really like it

this game's graphic is so good it is cute and interesting,music is great that can help you feel relaxed,npc and boss fight is funny

but i need to tell you this game have a lot of potential that should be in this game but here you can't find,to me this game is a semi-finished products

first is color pin ball,i suggest it can add element or functional features in there, like i go a dark area then i can change to a  pin ball which had lightning features that can help me light the place up, or maybe i need to go to a place have lava, i can change a pin ball to be a ice one to help me go some place, or some place had a hidden treasure it need to climb up some palce to get it, not like now only require by achievement task 

second is the 360 circle flower thing, at first it is interesting then is bad experience the circle speed is so so so so so so fast, that is not friendly to hand-eye coordination people

third is the map can't zoom in zoom out in a proper place, either too big or too small some times you want to find some but the map is too small or big

overall this game can buy, if you are relax style player, normal player is also welcome, but for challenge player or technical player this game maybe too easy for you

author: {'steamid': '76561199011883303', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1631908888}
review:
This game, in short, was unique, beautiful and fun. The developers did an amazing job.

A unique blend of metroidvania and pinball, Yoku's Island Express allows you to explore a tropical island, with mountains, caves and deserts.

The art style was beautiful, with bright colours and a watercolour-like style.

The gameplay was addictive and fun, you travel around the island using pinball bumpers and rails.

The soundtrack was lovely and calm, matching the environments.

Lots of collectibles: chests, side quests and ball styles.

Overall: I completed the game 100% in 12 hours. Was sad when it finished :(

Great game, anyone who's looking for a casual, easy game should definitely buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103925199', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1595673002}
review: An incredibly strong concept that doesn't wear out its welcome. Fantastic game for pinball fans, metroidvania fans, or anyone who is willing to play a game just to see how it can make a concept this wild work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084802391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1599866071}

author: {'steamid': '76561198345860329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1599614999}
review:
참신하고. 다양한 서브퀘스트가 있지만 복잡하지 않고 네비게이션이 친절해서 크게 어렵지는 않다. 다만 핀볼방식으로  진행되는 부분이 많은데 마음대로 컨트롤이 잘 안되기때문에 열받는 부분도 가끔씩 있지만.. 그래도 대부분은 적당한 난이도라서 크게 어려움은 없다. 
아쉬운점이 딱 하나 있다면 마지막 보스전이 너무 싱겁다는 점.. 
메트로베니아 장르로서 필요한 요소를 충실하고 담백하게 담고 있다. 
뭐든간에 굉장히 참신한 진행 방식을 담고 있다는게 게이머라면 한번쯤 해볼만한 게임이라고 생각함!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019576097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 322, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1688860175}
review:
[h1]This tastes like Christmas morning, like old Rareware games.[/h1]

A unique masterpiece. If anyone ever had tell me Pinball and Metroidvania are great together, I would have made fun of this idiot. Now I would be the stupid one. This works so damn well, the soundtrack is a killer, feels like a hawaian afternoon at the beach. Puzzles are amazing, navigation overall is great indeed, they even had a boss fighter. There are no short of collectibles, all fun to look for, never feeling boring or lame to back track. I can't stress enough how much you need to play this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053935010', 'num_games_owned': 1102, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1599181766}
review:
A short and sweet metroidvania with a unique style. Definitely deserves more love! 

Effectively a pinball game set in a metroidvania world without over-complicating things, You play as a lil dung beetle delivering post pinging around across the map meeting a whole host of inhabitants on a pleasing island. Aesthetically the game is gorgeous, the ost is great and the game is mechanically solid and easy to understand. Overall it's a pretty chill game. 

I'm looking forward to seeing what the devs produce next

author: {'steamid': '76561198034928324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1596056284}
review:
Yoku's Island Express è stato una sopresa, ci ho messo un po per inquadrarlo, l'ho comprato pensando fosse un platform, ma invece era un Platform-Flipper-Esplorativo.
Esteticamente sublime in Yoku's Island Express  impersoneremo un piccolo scarabeo postino, che con la sua piccola sfera di "pietra" verrà incaricato dagli abitanti dell'isola di svolgere alcuni compiti per loro.
La trama poi si evolverà a tal punto che dovremmo salvare il dio guardiano dell'isola ma rimanendo pur sempre coerente con il proprio stile.
Analizzare il gameplay è qualcosa di complicato, un po Loco Roco un po Flipper, Yoku's Island Express  riesce a mischiare talmente tante varietà di giochi che si crea uno stile autonomo e unico, riuscendo in 4-5 ore di gioco a tenerci incollati senza sessioni troppo facili o difficili, invogliandoci a esplorare l'intera isola alla ricerca delle sue zone segrete.
Tecnicamente fluidissimo e ben realizzato riesce a mantenere una costanza in termini di prestazioni dall'inizio alla fine senza problemi.

Consigliatissimo a chi ha voglia di un gioco fuori dagli schemi, semplice e coinvolgente senza essere troppo impegnativo.

Pro:
- Divertente e colorato
- Gameplay particolare e "innovativo"
- Ottima traduzione in italiano

Contro
- Elevato Backtracking

author: {'steamid': '76561198096663928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1587925226}
review:
Серия самых коротких рецензий:

Отличная

P.S.: Расшифровка:

Трэш — знакомиться с игрой рекомендуется исключительно тем, кто в диком восторге от описания, скриншотов и продолжительности. Остальным, из контакта с этой игрой, только тыкать палкой, как ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ку на дороге.

Так себе — в основном, эта игра предлагает меньше, чем вы увидите из описания и скриншотов. Рекомендуется только тем, кому вышеперечисленные критерии окажутся «зашибись».

Нормальная — неплохая игра своего жанра. Сами судите по описанию, скриншотам и продолжительности. Игра, примерно, соответствует своему наполнению.

Хорошая — весьма неплохой представитель своего жанра. Многие могут найти тут «свой шедевр». Зачастую, игра приятно соответствует своему описанию и скриншотам.

Отличная — эти игры, зачастую, превосходят свои первые впечатления, основанные на описании и скриншотах (в расчёт не берём репутацию, ибо «тот кто знает, тот поймёт»). Хорошие представители своего жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044695454', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1597581022}
review:
First impression: game is great, unique and creative! But as story goes it becomes boring, repetitive and sometimes frustrating. Most of the time you spend traveling areas you had once discovered. Story is quite short. I have the feeling that the concept of this game was bit deferent then final version. Anyway, it have great potential. I suggest wait for second part, I’m sure series will be continued and players suggestions are going to be listened.

Main problems:
-slugs (please make them detonate manually at least)
-fast travel 
-some arenas are hard to escape, others too easy (especially when you come back to collect scarabs)
-some mistakes are too costly (during gripping jumps)
-secrets should be more about the puzzle not run against time

author: {'steamid': '76561198007614870', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1597108020}
review:
A unique twist on a medroidvania platformer. It is very much a platformer, but where you have to do pinball in order to make progress. However, it still feels like a platformer when figuring out how to progress. The map is fairly open and you get to explore where you want fairly early. It only has abilities gating your way, but that is normal for the genre. There were a few times where I was not sure where to go, but it was not frustrating only minor backtracking.

It also has a cute, upbeat style that I really enjoyed. I would recommend it for platforming fans looking for a gentle experience that provides a twist, or those new to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1597094684}
review:
[h1]Sonic Spinball meets Ori and the Blind Forest[/h1]
Got this game in a bundle, didn't expect much, but was pleasantly surprised. [b]Yoku's Island Express[/b] is indeed a metroidvania, it features a large interconnected world and you gradually acquire new abilities to unlock more areas and gain access to a plethora of collectibles, there are also many NPC's and quests to do. BUT... it's also a pinball game. How does this even work? You play as a little beetle dude who pushes and rides a ball (like a scarab), you can walk but you can't jump, you use flippers and bumpers instead. It's a pretty neat idea and it works very well. Eventually you will unlock swimming, grappling etc, but the core gameplay loop will still revolve around carefully propelling your ball using flippers and bumpers which are placed everywhere in the world. I'm not too big into pinball games and it's been a while since I played one, so there was a bit of a learning curve at first, but the game is very forgiving. There's no fail state, you can't die, if you "lose the ball" (basically fall down and hit spikes) you will lose a tiny bit of currency which can be regained almost instantly. Still, the game features quite a few tricky puzzles and even boss fights but it never gets too crazy. The graphics are full HD hand-drawn art with some tasteful 3D seamlessly blended in. Think Ori but on a bright tropical island instead of a gloomy forest. The developers themselves say they took inspiration from Studio Ghibli's works.

I'd recommend playing on an Xbox/Playstation controller as the game makes heavy of analogue controls, both the stick for controlling Yoku's speed (which is used in place of tilting that you would do on a real pinball machine) and the triggers for controlling the force of flippers. Playing on the keyboard is possible but will be much less precise which might lead to some frustration.

The game will take you about 8-12 hours to clear, depending on how good you are at pinball games and whether you go for 100% completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086578121', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1597534143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106939391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1596553191}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is relaxing fun. It also seems to cure hangovers and make people happy. If you need something to cheer you up, buy this game.  Let's explore the ups and downs of the game (+, +/-, -, ?):

+Everything looks smooth, colorful and awesome. The art style is perfect and all different terrains are a joy to look at.
+A happy and cool dung beetle is way too cute and awesome.
+The controls are simple and they work perfectly. A nice balance of pinball and platforming.
+There's so much stuff to collect that I thought it would be a pain in the ass to collect every collectible... but it wasn't! Finding and collecting stuff feels good.
+The soundtrack is very catchy! I find myself humming the village theme almost every day.
+I had a horrible hangover while plying some parts of the game and the game worked as a perfect cure. I felt so much better after playing the game.
+/- The story is a story. It's pretty easy to forget while playing the game. A simple story for a simple game is fitting, I guess.
+/- The game is pretty short and I'm not too sure about the replayability. After I was done with the game, I can't say I feel the need to come back to the game.
+/- It's almost impossible to run out of fruit you need to collect and failing in the game doesn't really matter. You can just keep playing.
-I wish it was more cryptic and challenging. Everything is just smooth sailing from the very start until the end. You always know what you need to do. Almost all solutions are super simple. I know this is a relaxing and a chill game, but still...

Yoku's Island Express is a super nice and relaxing experience that can be a bit too easy and chill for some. However, everyone should at least try the game and find out if it's really for them. A smiling hero postman is something we all need, and deserve. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968776319', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1586248291}
