author: {'steamid': '76561197969025704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1596156465}
review:
This game is a lighthearted treat to play. Yoku has a great theme that has a fun air of whimsy about it the whole time. The art and music are really great and work well with the overall game. The main feature here is the pinball system and it definitely makes you want to keep playing it and other pinball games when you get the hang of it. 

The only knock against the pinball system is that very early in the game it can feel like a slog to get from one area to another and having to force your way through pinball zones that you've already done, so it can feel like a speedbump initially. The game does open up though and it feels very nice and fluid to fast travel around.

There's lots of collectibles and fun areas to explore and cute characters to interact with. The game isn't too long, but feels just right for what it is. The ending feels a little tacked on, but the game overall is very solid, entertaining, and just a nice and casual feel good time.

review: Really fun pinball game. Art and style is well executed, super cute! Played with my 6 year old son, he loved the game. He was able to play but got a little hard for him later in the game, we still played through the whole game together. With me doing the boss battles and playing most of the time later in the game. He still enjoyed it a lot. Story was interesting enough, lots of cute characters. I didn't expect that I would enjoy this game as much as I did, but I saw how great the reviews were and got it on sale at a steep discount. Game is a little short, completed the story in 8 hours. Not sure I would spend the full price, simply because of how short it is, but on sale I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113581790', 'num_games_owned': 2363, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1594002734}
review:
This is easily the biggest surprise for me this year, this game is great! On first though you might think “Combining pinball and platforming doesn’t sound like a good idea”, but when you play it, you realize that it’s crazy that more games haven’t explored this combo!

The gameplay is quick and smooth, the controls feel great, and to top it all off, there’s a charming art style with likeable characters.

The only fault of the game is that the main story can be completed in around 6-7 hours (or 4-5 if you know where to go), this does end up feeling a bit short and also seems as if it was made short on purpose as the final boss ends up being quite boring, making the ending feel like beating just another normal foe in your way. 

However overall this is quite a great game! I easily recommend it to fans of platformers, or just general pinball fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052353642', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1595553925}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991693294', 'num_games_owned': 1246, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1594477819}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067491340', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1678006588}
review:
Looking at game title picture summed up this game really well: A happy beetle with a ball flinging around in an adventure.

Yoshi's Isla... Yoku's Island is a hybrid pinball and metroidvania platformer game. At first when hearing the word pinball, you probably think it would have pinball tables with ramps, bumpers, goaling for high score and bottom drain leading to game over, and it might've scare some people off. Luckily, developers have intended Yoku's Island as casual, open world adventure as its main priority with occasional flippers and mini tables scattering around the whole island.

Although when Yoku's Island pinballing required precision aiming, the game never punish you for failing and encourage to keep trying until you can pass through onto next area. As a result, gameplay is friendly for every type of player whether you're new to pinball or a legendary pinballer.

The rest of the game follow a simple metroidvania format. There are collectables, treasure boxes and secrets scattered around, some may be unreachable until later in the game. 

Not all abilities are pinball related. Yoku can later swim, swing around carnivorous plants and, reinforcing game's tone, a party blower... 

The story of the game is simple with addition of side quests along the way. If you're expecting sophisticated story, then it's not here, this game instead focused on Yoku's journey rather than its destination. 

The whole island's atmosphere is very vibrant and cheerful. Game's visuals is very colourful and made me stare at my screen as if I were sucked into game world. I also loved most of soundtrack, largely because like gameplay, they're combined with other genre such as hip hop, 80s video game, jazz and so on. I haven't heard a catchy theme music in a long time, something I wished more games should try.

So far my favourite aspects in Yoku's Island are introducing new concept of playing pinball integrated in an adventure game. Soundtrack and visuals are one of my favourite in a game so far.

What don't I like? 

Honestly for what's given, I can't find any major fault. Any issues I have are all minor, and no way affects my overall impression of the game:
- Slug mechanic was bold for pinball table mechanic, but needed extra pointer as a slingshot mechanic for normal gameplay too
- Leach mechanic, although fun, need to slow down to ease aiming
- Map needed variable zoom
- I am normally a patient player that can deal with backtracking no matter how tedious it was. I don't even care if it doesn't have fast travel. But I can understand people didn't like pinball table being integrated as pathway. Perhaps more shortcuts or fast travel may solve this.

Despite having no major issues, I felt that Yoku's Island is missing a third sprinkle, as in, I wanted little bit more. Examples like having one more area to extend gameplay, have more use of abilities, or seeing Yoku being hilariously hurt to set the tone further. Falling into lava just simply result in ball bouncing back, when Yoku could've instead shown getting burnt and scream. 

I recently came back from another metroidvania game that left me feeling shocked and I couldn't get my head off about it. Then I was thinking of playing a calmer game, and I forgot I have Yoku's Island on my library. This game was my medicine all along. It was extremely fun and beautiful all the way, and maybe I want to play it again and again in the future. 

I want to thank all devs for creating this innovative game. and I normally wouldn't want to ask for a sequel or a similar universe game, but please do.

Recommended for everyone who are looking for metroidvania platformer and wanting a taste of pinball. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971046572', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1595195905}
review:
Played through again and have now completed 100%. I didn't come across the bug again this time, though I took care not to do what I thought triggered it.

Still enjoyed playing through again, didn't feel like a chore, so I think that goes to show what a good game this is.

Original review below:

This is a great and fun game, but there is a game breaking bug related to the checkpoint system.

If you trigger an event and then during gameplay, reload from a checkpoint (that was saved prior to triggering the event) then the event cannot be re-triggered.

i.e. I'm at 96% completion, but the chest I opened has not triggered 100% open chests, and the item it contained is not in my inventory. The chest in game is showing opened, so I can't trigger 100% chests opened, and I can't get the item that it contained.

Looking at the bug report chat, there are other players with similar problems, Team 17 has replied to say they'll talk to the developer about it, but two years later, no apparent fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076219837', 'num_games_owned': 3116, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1591291563}
review:
Escuché mucho sobre este juego: "una mezcla entre pinball y metroidvania", "una experiencia única", "uno de esos juegos que si eres fanático de los metroidvanias, te debes a ti mismo jugar"... y... debo admitir que son cosas que si le aplican a este juego, es un concepto único e interesante que ningún otro juego te puede ofrecer, pero no es tan divertido como pensé que lo sería, los poderes y habilidades que desbloquean no te hacen mas poderoso, simplemente te permiten progresar a la siguiente parte del mapa y personalmente adoro el hacerme mas fuerte y eficiente en los metroidvanias, cosa que este juego no ofrece. En los demás aspectos, este es un juego decente, considero que si esperas mas un juego de pinball que un metroidvania, disfrutarás mas de este titulo.

¿Lo recomiendo?
Si, como curiosidad para los fanáticos de los metroidvanias y como un must play para los que disfrutan de los juegos de pinball.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152831707', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1594160917}
review: This game is amazing and a pinnacle of good game design. It's a Metroidvania with Pinball movement, and like every Metroidvania I play, I find the best ones like Hollow Knight, Metroid, etc. to about the quality of unlockables and how it adds new layers of exploration to a world you'll return to over and over. Villa Gorilla put great effort into making these unlockables feel super good. Other then that, mechanics are clean, the world is gorgeous, music slaps, sound effects are wonderful, layering is great, puzzles are quality and a-plenty and the only ones I didn't like were the ones that forced you to explode the slug just right - loved the rest of the puzzles though. With the pinball paddles you have to line your shots just right and that can be tedious but the game frequently rewards your misses with fruit which is an essential currency to progressing. There were a couple chokepoints where I needed to grind a little bit before progressing but it wasn't so bad. Bosses were great, NPCs and world were memorable especially for a Metroidvania which is a series I find notorious for having forgettable stories. Humor was tasteful, level design was smart, for a time saturated with fast travel I found this game's "equivalent" to be considerate to your time but also not boring and opened up even more goodies by jumping off "early." All in all there's lots to love about this game. Wouldn't recommend it to players who struggle with and don't like pinball mechanics, but I never thought I'd love a Metroidvania where you can't jump as much as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312078727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1699166079}
review:
It's fine.

Yoku's Island Express is a unique mix of traditional Metroidvania platformer with the traversal mechanics of a pinball game. I think that true pinheads might end up disappointed by the relative shallowness of each of the game's "tables." Moreover, the game's pinball challenges are extremely forgiving, which is all but necessitated by the lack of familiarity that even experienced gamers have for pinball handling (and the ball physics here aren't particularly realistic anyways). 

Although I generally like the concept of the quick travel system, it is not robust enough and does result in a good deal of backtracking for missed collectables.

I think that I was hoping for more pinball from this hybrid game. In practice, the overall game experience isn't all that different from a more traditional Metroidvania game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037345057', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1593986749}
review: In most metroidvania games, getting a new form of movement (here, the "sootling leash") is supposed to open up new areas AND feel satisfying (or fun, or make you feel free or powerful). Here, the timing of using the swing coupled with the relatively short distance you need to position yourself in order to grab on leads to an enormous amount of frustration. This game is cute, with lots of charm and I love the art and story ... but this horrible design for moving around has ruined the fun for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972467400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1593970281}
review:
It's pinball and a metroidvania. If you enjoy either of those things, you're probably going to enjoy this.
Certainly not a difficult game as there is no death, but sometimes an easy game is just what you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198436891842', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1593959430}
review:
这类型最喜欢的游戏，也是第一个想要努力达到全成就的游戏！
  好玩是真的，虐也是有一点（对于本手残党来说），比起其他类银河战士恶魔城的游戏来说，这款游戏基本没有打斗（通关方式不同）这也是我很满意的一点。个人不擅长像茶杯头，空洞骑士那样操作性高的游戏，所以这个游戏真的满足我对类银河战士恶魔城游戏的喜爱和不想打架的两个要求！
  玩了14个小时，前面基本都是自己探索做任务（特别有意思），主线完成后我的游戏进度也才68%，后面的时间都是在解锁成就和完成支线任务。100%进度不容易，完成后还挺有成就感的。
  虽然我不会专业的测评，说的都是自己的想法，但真的希望能有更多人发现这款好游戏！

author: {'steamid': '76561198160374076', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1593961581}

author: {'steamid': '76561198957921881', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1593956468}
review:
[h1]ℙ𝕚𝕟𝕓𝕒𝕝𝕝 𝕚𝕟 𝕒 ℙ𝕝𝕒𝕥𝕗𝕠𝕣𝕞? 𝕎𝕙𝕠𝕖𝕧𝕖𝕣 𝕙𝕒𝕕 𝕥𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕚𝕕𝕖𝕒 𝕚𝕤 𝕒 𝕗𝕣𝕖𝕒𝕜𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕘𝕖𝕟𝕚𝕠𝕦𝕤![/h1]

Here we are; it's 2020 and the one thing you thought could never be possible has happened. Pinball inside a Platformer with an actual storyline, collectibles and characters. When we say "Pinball", we usually refer to those arcade games that you get into, play as much as you can to beat your previous highscore and then exit. Yoku's Island Express transcends that basic notion into something ridiculously good. It's the story of a beetle mailman who goes into an island to deliver some letters, only to be entangled in the island's affairs and finds himself in a position where he can help the island's inhabitant in ways other than delivering their insect-related letters. There are furries running about, rabbits, ninja looking people, frogs and snow bears to meet, but instead of regular sections of platforming after each checkpoint, you find yourself in Pinball sections, where you have to push your ball into small corners of the screen for objectives to advance, unlocking more and more of the wide map as you progress. The game is a ton of fun and especially if you're a fan of both Pinball and Platformers you'll find yourself enjoying this game more than you think you should (haha). The artstyle is amazing and personally reminds me of YokaLaylee and the Spyro Reignited Trilogy (don't know if any of these are related, but they are so similar graphically) 
The only disadvantage I found while playing was how short the game was. I would have loved more sections to play through and definitely more sidequests (maybe in a sequel).

All in all, the game is a lot of fun but if you're not a fan of Pinball I would advise against getting it since the whole premise of the game seems to be based on Pinball mechanics much more than on Platforming mechanics. Welcome, Postman... Here's your Postman Badge, now get to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047454339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1577431700}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014309440', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1593708888}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987115229', 'num_games_owned': 1613, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1593870926}
review:
I've played many virtual pinball machines and they never work that well. The physics feel weird because they try to emulate realworld machines and it's always a bit too static. Yoku's island express solves all of these problems by gamifying a pinball machine even more. It's also a great introduction to pinballing in general since the game is on the whole very easy, so don't feel discouraged to try this out if you're new to it.

Honestly there's not that much more to say about this game other than you should try it if it looks even remotely interesting! There are fun side quests and  collectibles as well other than just the main goal of getting through the game. So it does feel fresh and varied alll the way through. It definitely doesn't overstay its welcome, even if you go for 100% the map.

My only "complaint" is that I wish there had been a few more larger singlescreen "machines". Most of the time you're travelling between many small screens instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053717246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1593871560}

author: {'steamid': '76561198812780074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1632880948}
review: Meu que jogo legal, estava com mt receio antes de comprar, sempre achei que fosse um joguinho de criança, mas meu que jogo maravilhoso, relaxante, música ótima, historinha legal, não me arrependi nada de comprar, e uns dos melhores metroidvanias que já joguei na vida, que coisa gostosa de se jogar, explorar a ilha, agr é rumo platinar esse jogo, ele é rapido, mas pra quem gosta de explorar tudo, vai umas horinhas. Recomendadissimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027177776', 'num_games_owned': 3656, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1593814535}
review:
Such a wonderful gem! I just finished getting all the achievements and I'm absolutely in love with Yoku's Island Express. The aesthetics, gameplay and overall design of the game are incredibly charming and it's more than worth it checking this out.

The pinball mechanics are on point, there's no randomness when it comes to getting stuff done and progressing through the game even though sometimes it might look like it. I'll say some aspects of the game are hidden and let you wonder what's going on, for example- fall down the brambles a few times and you'll see a haunting cutscene. However, honestly, some other things beneficial to the player could've been explained better, like the scarabs or the ball designs that are scattered around the game. You can connect the dots but I had to resort to guides for a few things. (beesuit? yeah right)

The metroidvania style is not bad, but it made me sigh multiple times due to the backtracking having to redo so many of the already done pinball "boards", in which, a few in particular can be extremely boring and if you're impatient, frustrating as well. After you progress enough it is possible to go through the game just fine due to so many shortcuts and of course the wonderful fast travel mechanic implemented here.

Yoku is a cute lil fella and every other NPC has a charming personality, but I will say no one is particularly memorable, however the grunts and noises they make are hilarious. 

I highly recommend this game if you're in for a somewhat casual challenge! If you're in for 100%ing this game then make some time, be sure you have some patience in you because you'll need it.

Pro-tip? Slugs are the key for many of the otherwise "unreachable" collectables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077437959', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1616645803}
review: Super fun and cute combo of pinball and metroidvania, two genres I'm not a huge fan of otherwise and that I wouldn't have expected to go so well together. Short enough to finish in a couple days with enough meat on its bones to feel complete. Good amount of optional collectables with the tools to make collecting them not feel like a chore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053008883', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1593791388}
review:
This is an absolutely fun and innovative hybrid of pinball/platformer in a metroidvania map that you don't want to miss. Metroidvania elements are executed masterfully so Exploration and puzzle solving are pure joy with a taste of mystery. plus everything is accompanied with gorgeous musics and artworks.
The only negative thing about the game is that due to pinball mechanic sometimes backtracking foe completionists like me becomes tedious or frustrating even with the innovative fast travel mechanic.
and you should probably wanna know that its a short game and making it 100%, will only takes about 10-15 Hrs. which is fine by me but can be surprising for some people.
Considering how small the development team and how good the game is, I hope that you give it a try and if you like it, then support the devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025404790', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1592618796}
review: Jogo muito bom pra quem curte metroidvanias e quer algo diferente do tradicional, conquistas fáceis e interessantes de fazer. Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042091755', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1654381476}
review:
After 100%ing it I can safely say this game is basically perfect for what it does. It's an odd combination of Metroidvania (Albeit lightly) and a Pinball game. I honestly didn't think I'd like it this much but I did. 

The music is very catchy and fits the atmosphere well. The graphics are nice and cute. The NPCs are not super fleshed out but memorable enough due to their funny sounds and appearance. 

If you enjoy cute stuff, pinball games and metroidvanias then you'll surely love this. 100%ing it was really a blast and finishing it felt rewarding. 

The ONLY thing I didn't ''like'' or rather, think was a bad mechanic in a sense. Were the fruits which were greatly limited by your wallet space. 90% of the time I ran around with a full wallet and picking up fruits felt bad since it's just going nowhere and felt wasted. 

I think the whole having to pay to unlock bumpers stuff could've easily been abolished completely and the game would be improved because of it. By no means a true negative thing as it's just a minor issue, but a design flaw in a way. 

Other than that the game is perfect in my eyes. Just felt good playing through the whole thing. It's just a very nice feel-good experience. 

9.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004817259', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1656012529}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971757081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1593579109}
review:
A beautiful world that was made not only as a platform game, but as a pinball style mix in with it.
Everything is crafted with a lot of attention to detail and making sure that it's easy enough for that combination to work really well.

The characters are adorable.

It's difficult to create something that's new in the genre. Even more surprising when it's this much fun, so cute, plays well, and beautiful all at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003676837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1593631457}

author: {'steamid': '76561198341026798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1630642278}
review:
这个剧情画风和操作，让我玩的时候总会想起奥日和三位一体。
配乐也不错，有一场boss战BGM居然是爵士乐[spoiler]，之前的boss战没开声音不知道。[/spoiler]
稍微肝一肝，全成就还是很容易的，对手残非常友好。
优质的休闲游戏，10/10

I LOOOVE PINBALL!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025301649', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1593513395}
review: An absolute gem of an open world adventure metroidvania platformer using heavily-enjoyable pinball elements containing beautiful artwork and a plethora of secrets and collectibles to keep you coming back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970421727', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1593545341}
review: I'm mostly terrible at platformers (let alone metroidvanias), but make it into a pinball game and I have half a chance. Yoku's Island Express is cute, entertaining, charming and just generally utterly delightful. So creative and colourful, this is not the sort of thing I normally play but it has completely captured me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003896212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1593496306}
review:
A really charming game that integrates pinball into the metroidvania genre. Strong pinball mechanics that aren't too difficult, a pleasing aesthetic, nice soundtrack, good amount of hidden secrets, and a decent story all combine to make this game a gem.

I estimate I finished in 12 hours and spent 5 more going back and getting the remaining collectibles, secrets, and achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017426654', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1666537896}
review: Should I compare it to every pinball experience of my life or every metroidvania? As a pinball game it is clearly the most interesting of them all, including real ones. It is a pinball adventure and you can't beat that. As a metroidvania great, too. Quality work. Nintendo level. This is what Metroid Pinball should have been.

author: {'steamid': '76561199039231062', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1593699906}
review: 快十小时通关，真的很有趣的休闲游戏，不过有的地方真的很繁琐。但是玩下去就会沉浸其中。准备继续玩到全成就结束，强烈推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198093999076', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1630855571}
review: 非常有趣，而且很休闲，平台跳跃和弹球的结合，也很有创意

author: {'steamid': '76561198048886585', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1593623673}
review: One of the strangest ideas for a game that I can think of - combining a Metroidvania-type platformer with a pinball game - turns out to be one of the most delightful surprises I've experienced recently. The characters are incredibly charming, the art and animation is gorgeous, and the gameplay is super fun. It's also one of the few games where I've really enjoyed getting all the collectibles I can. Overall, if you're at all a fan of either genre this game blends together, I think you'll enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992239712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1593374799}
review:
Good clean fun - the story and the gameplay align perfectly together.  You're a cute bug pushing around a pinball and you bounce your way around the island helping out the inhabitants.  I loved the story and completed it in about 7 hours.

Traveling around the island can be a bit tedious as it's not always easy to understand where you need to go to get where you need to go.  You also can't zoom in enough to be satisfied with determining that either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179841553', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1705627388}
review:
Pinball games have never interested me that much, but the incredible open world design of this game makes it so much more interesting than any average pinball game. The gameplay isn't very difficult as there isn't too huge of a punishment for falling between the flippers, making it a relatively fun and relaxing adventure, even for people that aren't very good at pinball, such as me. 

The art is also incredibly beautiful, and I kept finding myself jamming to the wonderful soundtrack as I played. In the end, this game was an absolute blast to play, and my only wish was that it was longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159515081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1593333595}
review:
〇詰まった人へのアドバイス

【横フリッパー・風車・スイッチ】
跳ね上げたボールを横から叩いて方向転換する場面が中盤以降に出現する。
進めないなと思ったら、通路の横にフリッパーがついていないか要確認。
ほか、笛で風車を全て回す、スイッチを全て点灯させるなどの条件が必要な場所もある。
ピンボールステージの中にある点灯スイッチはフリッパー操作により点灯位置が動いて行くので、
良く見ながら狙おう。

【なめくじ】
中盤以降、もっとも多く使うであろうスキル（？）
なめくじ屋クエストクリア後、赤いなめくじにボールが近付いた際に
なめくじが「ヴァー」と唸るようになるので、唸り始めたらフリッパーボタンを押して回収。
フリッパーボタンを押したまま近付いても回収できないので注意。
また、回収したナメクジは実行ボタン（コントローラーであればＡ）で爆発可。
Ａを押さなくても一定時間で爆発。メトロイドの丸まり爆弾に似ている。
ボールについたなめくじが爆発すると、なめくじがくっついていた側と逆側に爆風でボールが飛ばされる。
これを利用する場所では、ボールになめくじをつけてから、地面でつけた側を下にしてＡボタン。

【会話】
「！」がついているキャラはストーリー進行など重要な情報を語るキャラ。
必須の会話を忘れずに。

【ビーライン】
イベントクリアによって使用可能になったら、マップのひまわりマークが出ている場所で果物100枚を連打支払して開通。
ビーライン上の移動はフリッパーボタン。途中下車はキャンセルボタン。

【ピンクの花】
後半、相性の良いススを「ススひも」で入手（入手は、相性の良いスス付近でＡボタン）すると接続可能になる。
接続方法はなめくじに似ていて、花が「シャー」と言い出したらフリッパーボタン。
回転の勢いがついたタイミングでボタンを離すと、回転方向に移動できる。

●総評
都合10時間で踏破。良質なサントラに味わい深いグラフィック、
ピンボール好きにも納得の内容で、最後まで楽しく遊べた。
続編が出たら続編も買いたい。

[spoiler] 蜘蛛の子の住処探しは最後まで出来ず。残念。
また、ボールのタイプごとに特殊スキル（遠くても花に紐が届く、蝋燭の”火”に紐づけ出来る等）があると良かった。次作が出るなら、手持ちの色を変えながら進んで行くステージが欲しい。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030531755', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1529627259}

author: {'steamid': '76561198344249293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1590455382}
review:
Jogo muito divertido!
É uma mistura de metroidvania com pinball que deu muito certo.
Possui um enredo simples e agradável de fundo, num mundo grande e repleto de tarefas a serem realizadas em idas e vindas. Novas habilidades são descobertas durante o gameplay, permitindo que áreas antes bloqueadas possam ser acessadas. Os personagens são carismáticos e a arte é maravilhosa.

Valeu muito cada minuto jogado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014752796', 'num_games_owned': 1685, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1709226428}
review: Pinball and metroidvania might sound like an odd combination (and to be honest, it kind of is) but as a lover of both, it scrathes both itches sufficiently. Also it's 80% off as of the summer sale of 2020 so you don't really have much to lose even if  it's gonna be in your backlog forever

author: {'steamid': '76561198371407041', 'num_games_owned': 1388, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1587578888}
review:
15h全成就通关
大概就是一个小瓢虫邮递员在四处送快递的同时解决了小岛危机的故事，结局有反转（预料之中）。玩法新颖，结合了弹球与冒险探索。不只是关卡巧妙，不会出现莫名其妙的卡关，而且全地图都充满了细节，细心探索会有很多小惊喜，小隐藏。有许多伏笔和彩蛋，在后期解锁能力后出生地也要重新探索。
游戏中给出的提示并不多，仅会在地图上标注任务地点，路线需要自己摸索，要留意npc对话。
不是虐手游戏，但也有许多技巧，比如控制炸弹方向，在关卡内控制自身位置等，就不多赘述，自行探索。
推荐。是原价入也不亏的好游戏。
补充: 攻略推荐B站反面橙，声甜，详细。

author: {'steamid': '76561198123467343', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1603897220}
review:
挺有意思的一个小游戏，全程大概也就五六小时就能跑完
刚开始会觉得"三维弹球为什么能这么难?!"
上手后就会变成"三维弹球为什么能这么好玩?!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197985396953', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1592880312}
review:
It took me a while to get into Yoku, but its a nice little casual game with good visuals and a great soundtrack. 
I'm not really a fan of pinball games and to be honest a lot of the pinball stuff was my least favourite part of the game ("that's the hook though", I know).

Great job Villa Gorilla and Team 17

author: {'steamid': '76561198110940991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1592788970}
review: I loved this game as the concept is brilliant. It mashes Ori level design with pinball mechanics and it works extraordinarily well. The story is fun if not a bit short. However, there are a number of side quests that can extend your play through if you are craving more. On top of that, there are plenty of collectibles and secrets that had me striving to gain all achievements without feeling like a huge chore. Most of the music is catchy and top notch quality as well. I highly recommend this hidden gem if you like games like Ori or Hallow Knight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023548671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1592734397}
review:
Ce jeu est une variante du concept de Metroid-vania = on revient à des lieux déjà visités avec des compétences permettant d'accéder à de nouvelles zones et secrets.

Mais le gameplay lui-même est basé sur le jeu de flipper ! Deux gachettes permettent d'activer des tremplins pour propulser la balle que notre personnage, une sorte de scarabée-bousier, pousse avec lui tout au long du jeu.

C'est vraiment pas dur, même si de temps en temps on va avoir un peu de mal (c'est du flipper, tout le monde n'y est pas doué) mais en général ça passe quand même.

Il y a de nombreux petits secrets à découvrir, de petits recoins bien cachés permettant d'obtenir quelques secrets. Plusieurs quêtes avec un petit peu de réflexion (juste du "comment atteindre tel endroit avec mes capacités ?), quelques trucs à collecter (et je suppose une deuxième fin déblocable ainsi). 

Sinon, c'est mignon, coloré, avec des musiques assez douces mais entraînantes pour avoir une ambiance ukulélé...

A essayer, c'est vraiment sympa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393379789', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1634475852}
review: 见到有好友添加愿望单了，赶紧过来写几句。 此游戏大部分时间花在两件事，找路，以及想办法走到这个路上。 别的游戏只要往那条路走就完事了。 这个游戏不行。这个游戏你是一个球，你不能走路，明明就在眼前的路，你就是走不过去，要利用惯性和弹力，找准角度弹进去。 累。肝。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025052370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1592606402}
review:
You know what I love about pinball? Almost everything. The satisfying thrill of slamming a button and watching a flipper send a giant ball-bearing careening between flashy bumpers and through chutes, the twitchy joy of reacting to a sudden bounce, the intellectual challenge of planning every move half a second in advance as your thoughts and reflexes vie for control, the gorgeous and garish themed tables; it's all loads of fun.
But you know what I don't like about pinball? The limited balls/lives system. It's a relic of the golden age of arcades, when a limited number of lives was designed to siphon as many quarters out of your pocket as possible to feed your Frogger or Bally habit.

Luckily we are now in the age of video games on personal computers, and game companies don't need to keep you spending on lives; they've already got your money just from you buying the game (take note EA). So I'm pleased to report that Yoku's Island Express doesn't have a life system.

I digress.
You control Yoku, a cheerful little dung beetle on an island filled with all kinds of colorful characters. Or rather, you control Yoku's ball, and he just comes along to roll it around. (The composition of the ball is a bit ambiguous, but since it's buoyant in water, I'm tentatively sure it's not actually dung.) Gameplay-wise you're basically playing a MetroidVania type platformer, unlocking new areas and secrets by gaining new mobility powers (grappling, diving, slug-wrangling), with one notable difference: you cannot jump. Instead, you roll along, relying on controllable bumpers to catapult you up and down.
And then occasionally you'll mosey into a well-delineated pinball table, where you ease off the left and right arrows and switch to the left and right shift keys to control the paddles. The tables have pretty clear objectives, can usually be exited and returned to at your leisure, and are varied and creative in their structure. Some require precision shots, others demand split-second timing, and a few really get your noggin joggin'. There are three (3) boss encounters, none of which explain their mechanics in advance, but all of which can be easily learned; I'd say that they are themed respectively around consistent accuracy, managing multi-balls, and finesse in timing. And of course, you can't "lose" any of the tables; if you go into the drain, you either lose a few fruit (the local currency) or have to do a little platforming to get back.

Oh yeah, there's a story too. It's not too complicated, and I could tell who the (disguised) Big Bad Evil Guy was basically as soon as they were introduced. But it's got some charm. I beat it in about 7 hours, and that included a lot of faffing about.

Basically, it's got the snappy pinball action of Space Cadet (sorry to hit my fellow Millennials in the nostalgia, but it's true) with the Pacific Island aesthetic and some story themes of Moana, the level design and music quality of Guacamelee, all with lush visuals and NPCs that act and talk kinda like characters from Pokemon.
I love it even if it is on the short side. [spoiler](That's what she said.)[/spoiler] Pick this one up as soon as it goes on sale; you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009752238', 'num_games_owned': 953, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1592461778}
review:
This was a very unique and fun indie game. The best way to describe it would be platforming metroidvania with tons of pinball elements. Being that I love pinball games, I was instantly surprised and very happy to jump into this game.

The story is pretty silly. You are a little beetle who has just washed onto the shore of an island to begin your new job as the postman! As you make your first delivery, you realize that the god of the island was attacked and you need to bring the island elders together to help save it and the island. Can a lowly beetle postman save the island AND deliver the mail?

The first thing I fell in love with was the visuals. This game is packed full of wonderful tropical colors and each section of the island has its own color scheme. From the snowy mountains, to the dark underground caverns, there is so much to visually love in this game. 

As stated before this game has a lot of pinball elements. A good portion of this game will have you using flippers and paddles to help you get around. Thanks to the simple color code of paddles and flippers, it's easy to get used to traveling about the island. You'll find yourself in pinball "stages" as well, collecting items to progress to the next part, or using power-ups to find secrets and destroy obstacles. You may get stuck on some stages for awhile since, just like actual pinball, there will be times you need to hit a certain path and it'll be challenging to get the right angle to progress. This is not a slight on the game, since you can manipulate the ball a lil, it's just the way pinball games work.

You will also be traveling the island a lot via platforming, You cannot jump, so using the paddles, bumpers, and more is a fun way to get around. The reason I added the metroidvania to this review is that you will gain objects and power-ups to help you get around. From swimming to grappling, you will gain a fair amount of abilities and then be able to go back to previous areas to find new treasures and new sections to explore. I had so much fun finding more areas and new things to see.

There are a lot of inhabitants on the island and most of them will give you quests. Some net you currency to buy things and others give you really good items to help your journey. There's even collectibles for you to find, hidden all over. There's a lot to do and a lot of fun to be had if you're up for the challenge.

Final verdict? Play this game if you like pinball and platforming games. It's very fun and simple to pick up and I had a great time with it. The game will run you about 9-10 hours roughly. Probably a lil more if you want to %100 it (I finished at about %75), There is so much charm and fun to be had with this game and you don't wanna miss it. Thanks for reading!

TL:DR: A fun metroidvania pinball game with great controls and lots of island to explore. Be warned, if you don't like pinball games and some of the frustrations that come with them like trying to hit a particular spot, this game may be a problem for you. Otherwise, it's a great time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272475158', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1592320964}
review:
这是一个纯通关可以一天打完的游戏。但是要全成就的话，最好一开始就找圣甲虫，不然还要重新走一两遍地图。这游戏只有蛞蝓吸尘器，潜水鱼，和灰虫子带子这三种道具，如果有够不到的收集品，想办法用蛞蝓炸上去。
（另：我离线打了好几天才全成就，steam显示58分钟）
+ 画面好看
+ 弹球好玩
+ 手柄震动很爽
+ 几乎没有死亡惩罚，宝宝难度
+ 阖家

· 音乐还成
· 剧情，阖家游戏不需要剧情[spoiler] 弑神者竟被连锁蛞蝓重创，蛞蝓永远滴神 [/spoiler]

- bug频出（例1：在雪山有个箱子那里的蜂道中途下车，然后从特里克的房子旁边掉下去的话，会导致修桥任务重置，主角直接穿过桥掉下去而且桥上有个冲冲。例2：红球任务接不到，我看了攻略才知道下面有个蛋。例3：安巴巴的碎片会重新刷出来）
- 汉化机翻
- 蛋疼的奖励设置。花十分钟才打开的箱子里面却只有水果，贼气人了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198117853906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1592439433}
review:
I didn't think I'd start this game now, I was only taking a look because it's a fairly short game, and at first I was a bit on the fence, but it grew on me. I like the visuals a lot (it reminds me of Ori and the Blind forest), and the music, and I like pinball. I think I'm just not a fan of Metroidvanias (that's what threw me off at first), but I caught myself thinking about playing this game when I was doing other things, which is rare.

The traversal is not very good. I think it's a bit slow, especially for a Metroidvania (but there's the Beeline, so...). Also, I felt lost at times, not knowing what to do or where to go next, especially when the time came for me to get the "Dive Fish". I had to look it up on the internet. I think I'd end up discovering where it was, but it may have taken some time, and I was not willing to spend my time like that. But thinking in hindsight, that was the only time I felt really lost. The other times I found my way out fairly easily.

I think there's a problem with tone at the end (the music doesn't match the scene) and the whole thing comes out of nowhere, but that's the only other complaint I have about it. It's a good game and I'm glad I bought it and played it.

It is very short, which I like, and I can see myself coming back to it eventually to do some other errands. Maybe not now. In the future.

review: I adore this game.  I wish it was longer.  Yes, there are some moments of confusion (fairly standard in metroidvanias, though!), and there are areas of the map that are not well served by the fast travel mechanism.  It can therefore be a bit tedious to get back to certain areas when you realize you missed something.  Still, this is one of the most unique and fun experiences that i've had in a long time.  Buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275315905', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1591047898}
review:
This game is one that I did not know I needed in my life until I played it. I read some reviews mentioning pinball and thought "how does that work, some like a gimmick?"...well it totally works! I was pleasantly surprised by the fun and wholesome aesthetic as well as the good/catchy soundtrack. I learned about this game when looking up similar games to Ori. There are definitely some Ori vibes in this game, in the best way. I would highly recommend to anyone that enjoyed Ori and miss playing Space Pinball 3D on Windows XP.

--PROS--
-story/dialogue
-pinball mechanics
-soundtrack

--CONS--
-replayability, once you have beaten the game there are small quests to still complete, but did not bring me back into the game.
-sometimes there is no way to skip the pinball segments, they are fun, but sometimes get in the way if you just want to explore.
-fast travel, to my knowledge there is none and sometimes exploring involves lengthy backtracking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131451071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1591960631}

Muy divertido y más si te das el tiempo de terminar la historia y luego  descubrir como recolectar todas las raícez y los tesoros. También terminar las misiones.

10/10 y es para toda la familia

author: {'steamid': '76561198255265123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1591733294}
review:
Diseño y música bastante agradable, para echar un par de horas hasta que te lo pases está bastante bien. Es un juego tranquilo, como podría serlo un Harvest Moon.

La historia sencillita, llegas como sustituto de un pelícano que está hasta las narices de trabajar allí, y te comes de paso el marrón de tener que ayudar al guardián de la isla a recuperarse de un ataque.

La mecánica de mezclar exploración con pinball está bastante bien (no es pinball 100% del tiempo), aunque hay algunas veces que los flippers lanzaban la bola donde no debían.

Bastante recomendado para echar un buen rato, la verdad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001251929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1592182003}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141400402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1651183887}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express is an innovative take on the Metoridvania genre that creates an amazing interconnected world with pinball mechanics.  The typical atmosphere of a Metroidvania is gloomy and lonesome but Yoku presents a casual experience full of vibrant characters and color. The difficulty is low because of the no ‘death’ penalty when one falls in between the flippers but this is not a criticism; the low difficulty made for a delightful experience I would recommend to anyone and this game provides much needed variety of game-play for a Metroidvania game while keeping crucial exploratory elements.

For the boss fighters out there, this game may disappoint. Although the boss fights suited the game-play well and felt important, they did not differentiate much from the typical game-play when there is no boss present. I never felt a sense of danger near a boss and therefore it just felt like another puzzle rather than a fight. I believe adding more hazardous bosses might have damaged the overall experience so I can not criticize this fact heavily, but this game is not for those wanting that boss fight experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994664811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1645450320}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996362449', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3070, 'last_played': 1595331524}
review:
Game mechanics are solid and fun and the entire premise of the game is unique and interesting. Definitely worth playing. The game gets frustrating when you want to 100% all the collectibles as there are few items that require some luck (not skill) of getting them. But it is very doable if you summon a little patience.

But the PC port of the game is a little clunky and would have deserved more polish:
* Mouse cursor is always visible but you can not use mouse for anything.
* Window mode is only available if your desktop refresh rate is 60hz
* It runs at fixed at 60fps which is FINE but I would have liked higher framerates.
* VSync is enabled by default and while you can disable it in the config file I would not recommend it due to massive tearing as GSync will not activate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046584670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1591452821}
review:
Imagine the space pilot from the windows XP pinball game had a child with Simon Belmont and what you get is this little gem. Takes roughly 6 hours to beat and 11 hours for completionist. For the low price of 3$ you really get your money's worth. 
The only flaw I see is that the music becomes boring after a while and the plot of the story is laughable. But gameplay wise and fun wise I would definitely recommend it! I don't regret buying it and had a lot of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115159714', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1591492771}
review:
好玩就完事了

author: {'steamid': '76561198147704463', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1592209396}
review:
《尤库的小岛速递》（下简称《小岛速递》）
还在推进度，先说下开荒的感想

本来以为只是又一个和奥里系列风格相似的银河城，亲身体验过后我需要为自己的judging by cover道个不是）

弹珠游戏与银河城的结合十分新颖，从打过第一个弹珠台的时候就有被惊艳到。《小岛速递》是多数做老玩法衍生与结合的游戏里表现相当不错的一款。

场景与角色美术，还有音乐风格都很清新（不包括我还没探索的地图），制作也十分精致，游戏流程的视觉反馈做得很好，拾取部分物品的顿帧很有爽快感。是个玩起来十分休闲不累的游戏（不包括后续的流程）。感觉设计者很巧妙地把经典银河城里的常见元素做了符合游戏本身设计感的替换。比如近战攻击在这里变成了吹派对炮，好是可爱。

最主要，弹珠机制实在是有点童年回忆加成，感觉狂扣扳机键就好像回到了二三年级的信息课）

目前为止对游戏还挺满意的，通关之后再来补充更多信息/

author: {'steamid': '76561198038701561', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1591138352}
review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
[i]Yoku's Island Express[/i] is a pleasant mix-up of exploration, collect-a-thon, and pinball. While travelling and back-tracking can be a little long-winded, there's clearly considerations in the design that helps smooth things over a bit.

[h1]Neither Rain Nor Snow[/h1]
The toughest part about making a pinball game is preventing the game from feeling repetitive. By nature, pinball games are closed-circuit arenas that expect players to do things over and over again to unfold layers of the game. While many games go for the "shove more mechanics in there" approach, I think [i]YIE's[/i] alternating between exploration and pinball was a lovely idea. In particular, the ability to fold the pinball machines into the feeling of exploration was extremely well done. The game never feels like it pauses so the player can do some pinball; instead, players may revisit the same sections multiple times to unlock new exits as the game progresses.

In terms of mechanics, the game does a good job of travelling light. There aren't really gimmicky one-off mechanics and what is in the game definitely gets used to their potential. However, I found the game was a little obtuse in explaining some of it's mechanics, especially some of the lesser used ones. The mixing of ball colors, for instance, didn't feel adequately explained and the use of slugs to propel oneself also wasn't immediately obvious. However, these are small negatives compared to the many positives [i]YIE[/i] does have and shouldn't sour an otherwise well-made game. 

[h1]Breakdown[/h1]
[b]Pros[/b]
[olist]
    [*][b]Show Me The Money:[/b] [i]YIE's[/i] map is one of the best I've seen. It communicates where objectives are without revealing too much and always allows the player to plan ahead. As the player progresses, the ability to unlock locations of missing collectibles prevents the "collect-a-thon" part of the game from being frustrating.
    [*][b]A Chatty Place:[/b] This isn't really a character driven game, but what bits of character building the game does do is well done. Even minor characters are all quite expressive, each with their own personalities and genuinely interesting. Dialogue is sparse, but what is there never feels extra.
[/olist]
[b]Cons[/b]
[olist]
    [*][b]Thick or Thin?:[/b] a few of the mechanics in the game lack a bit of the consistency the rest of the game shows. The horn sometimes clears out Sootlings, but other times not; the exploding slugs and scarabs are never properly taught; and other little bits and pieces of info just aren't well communicated. The player always eventually learns about them anyway, but a short "hey, you can do X with this mechanic" tip can go a long way when used sparingly.
[/olist]

[b]Score[/b]: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1591057436}
review:
An incredibly cute and charming game that mixes crisp visuals, a great soundtrack, metroidvania platforming gameplay and pinball together to create an interesting and different take on the genre. As a small bug wanting to become a postmaster, you explore an island, solve pinball challenges and get new equipment to explore more areas, metroidvania style.

The pinball segments are just like you would expect if you ever played pinball - not always accurate, but still fun and exciting enough to give it another go. The game is never too difficult since you can not really die anyway, so pinball sections are just a matter of timing and retrying. There are a few annoying sections that are mostly coming down to accuracy in some pinball sections as well as with one equipment piece that lets you rotate around flowers; you usually have to let go at one exact point to make it to the collectible or across gaps, but swing way too fast to make an accurate guess most of the time. But, again, you can't really die, so any annoyance is just in having to retry some sections a couple times.

Really though, it is a good time and it mixes metroidvania and pinball into an exciting and freshly different game. It is a definite recommendation from me for all ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984932332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1709431382}

author: {'steamid': '76561198099556024', 'num_games_owned': 2065, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1590976272}
review:
Yoku´s Island Expres es un metroidvania divertido e interesante como ningún otro título. Vila Gorilla, formado principalmente por 3 personas, ha sido capaz de desarrollar el videojuego perfecto para introducir a un nuevo jugador al género. Por otro lado, para aquellos valientes, capaces de terminar juegos como HollowKnight, Momodora y AxiomVerge con los ojos cerrados y las manos atadas mientras saltan a la comba, Yoku será un bien merecido y agradable descanso. Si algo busca Yoku, es ser una obra accesible, donde todo jugador pueda maestrar sus mecánicas sin quebraderos de cabeza. Consigue esto gracias a un pequeño conjunto de "leyes de mundo", que pueden aplicarse a funcionamientos que a simple vista no podrían ser más distantes. De esta forma, el jugador entiende cada nuevo desafío sin necesidad a ser penalizado o bombardeado con decenas de tutoriales. Conseguir un diseño de nivel que permita este flujo continuo de movimiento y rápida toma de decisiones sin llegar a ser caótico ni simplista, es algo que tiene mucho mérito. Sobre todo al hablar de un género con mapeado y mejora de personaje tan enrevesado como suelen tener las entregas del género. Por desgracia, este acercamiento al metroidvania trae consigo sus mayores problemas. Estos serían la moneda ingame, en este caso frutas, y las mejoras que tu personaje recibe tras completar contenido adicional. 

Las frutas se consiguen en base a tu rendimiento en los niveles y se utilizan como limitador. De esta forma se anima al jugador a rendir mejor y a intentar conseguirlas todas, por no decir que estos limitadores ayudan a crear una sensación de progresión sin aterrorizar al jugador. Por desgracia, ha sido implementada de una forma ciertamente vaga. Necesitas fruta para acceder a X sitio, pero estas cantidades tienden a ser irrisorias o en el caso contrario, meramente frustrantes. A medida que avanzas con la historia, desbloqueas habilidades, y los bloqueos encontrados por el mapa, anteriormente simples pagos de fruta, empezarán a sustituirse por "necesitas esta habiidad para llegar ahí", tal y como debería haber sido desde el principio. Creo que los desarrolladores son conscientes de esto, pues a partir de la mitad de mi partida, me he dado cuenta de que estos pagos empiezan a desaparecer y el diseño de mundo evoluciona. 

Esta evolución trae consigo un gran problema, al perder la única forma de gastar frutas con frecuencia, estas pierden su valor y el jugador pierde parte de su motivación. De vez en cuando, encontrarás más de estos bloqueadores desperdigados por el mapa, pero habrán pasado de ser una preocupación a una broma de mal gusto. Por otro lado, están las ya mencionadas mejoras de personaje. La mayoría traen una mejoría insignificante y casi todas se consiguen por el final de la partida, cuando no te queda casi contenido por completar y mejorar al personaje pierde el sentido por completo. Estas mejoras deberían haber fluido con la aventura y se deberían haber desbloqueado de forma progresiva. Siento que fueron implementadas en un punto del desarrollo demasiado avanzado.

Puede que no sea una obra maestra, que su historia sea superficial y su lore irrelevante, puntos a los que jugadores del género están bastante malacostumbrados. Pero expone un mundo que alegra el peor de los días, un mundo lleno de unas bromas, personajes y sobre todo una idea inocentes. ¿Qué puede ser más inocente que un híbrido nacido por el amor al Pinball y al Metroidvania? No es una entrega más, no es otro juego del montón. Es una experiencia única, satisfactoria y te va a hacer sonreír como pocos juegos han conseguido.

En definitiva, Yoku es un videojuego inocente que dejará a todo jugador con una sonrisa en la cara y a los amantes del metroidvania con ganas de más. Espero ver derivados en años próximos y una nueva producción por parte de Villa Gorilla.

Muchas gracias por esta experiencia tan inocente, el medio necesita más juegos así.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262383929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1590971915}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118719917', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1590953275}
review:
Metroidvania+Pinball is not a combination I expected to work, but it does really well.
Other than that, the game has really nice music,, visuals, and cool unique gameplay. It is a super easy and short game, and that is probably a good thing, as pinball can be super frustrating if it is hard. The only downside is that exploring the map can be cumbersome, as there are very few fast travel locations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360302420', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1590945425}
review:
7小时通关！
喜欢休闲探索的玩家一定不要错过！
游戏流程不长，但是内容饱满丰富，有很多收集要素，不停地探索解开真正的结局！
我以前很喜欢三维弹球，这个游戏可以说是完美的将三维弹球和自由探索完全的结合在了一起！不仅让人大呼过瘾！

唯一的槽点就是这个游戏没有快速旅行，玩到后期容易跑很远的地图23333
打折入的 14块不亏，原价的话建议朋友们等打折！

author: {'steamid': '76561198218487125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1590820257}
review:
アクションアドベンチャーのピンボール。
今、首をかしげたあなたは正しい。

このゲームではあなたはボールにくっついた一匹の虫"ヨク"になり、ボールを転がしたり一緒に吹っ飛んだりしながら物語の舞台である小さな島を冒険する。主に島のあちこちにしかけられた二種類のレバーを操作して、時には地底の洞窟までボールを飛ばし、時には雲の近くの山の頂きまでボールを飛ばし、時には大砲で吹っ飛び、島の住人達を助けていく事になる。つまりピンボールでアドベンチャーだ。

ピンボールというミニゲーム感あふれるゲームジャンルとは裏腹に、ボリュームはそれなりのもの。初めて全体マップを見た時は、予想外の広さにぎょっとするかも知れない。またレバー以外にも様々なギミック、寄り道要素のサブクエスト、アップグレードアイテムによる強化もあり、見た目の印象以上に楽しめるだろう。隠し要素もあるらしいが・・・。

ちなみにダメージを受ける事もあるがHPというものがなく、代わりに少し所持金が減るだけなので安心。序盤は所持金を稼ぎ難いので焦るかも知れないが、どうやら無限に手に入るようなのであまり気にしなくて良い。難易度はそれほど高くない・・・とはいえアクションゲームなので、それなりにシビアな操作を要求される部分はある。ただレバーを押してボールを飛ばすゲームではないのだ。一匹の虫が付いているという大きな違いもあるのだ。
ちなみにフンコロガシにしか見えないが、どうもフンコロガシではないらしい。では何だ？

まとめるとピンボール風のアクションアドベンチャー。値段相応と言うには少々お高いので定価ではお薦めしづらいが、セール時なら損はしないと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004372851', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1590881964}
review: Hard to quantify this pinball adventure game is certainly unique. I'm not a fan of pinball so I almost didn't recommend this but the art style, music and world are so lovingly created I have to give it a pass. Not my type of game but still worth a play

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1591910301}
review:
A brilliant game, full of charm, character and a fairly decent challenge.

A mix between platform (wuppo style), and pinball mechanics make for a refreshing new style of game.

I'm not sure how much of the "Yoshi's Island" theme is nicked, or taken influence from; but the music, presentation, tight controls and overall feel, make this feel like a game made by Nintendo. 

Easy to pick up and play, with very tight controls, but hard to master.

Loving it so far, I don't often write reviews this early, but I know that this is a game that I'll play to the end with joy !

Из минусов: я очень люблю метроидвании, но эту игру тяжело таковой назвать. Это пиндвания, метробол - управляемости не хватает КАТАСТРОФИЧЕСКИ, поскольку вся игра, собственно, завязана на пинболе, и то ли физика кривовата, то ли мои руки.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968572375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1575958061}
review:
Outstanding game; a true gem!  I've played it to completion four times now, on three platforms.  (The last two playthroughs were here on Steam.  My first playthrough on another platform was much longer, as I needed to build up my skills and learn where everything was in the world so I could 100% it.  But it can be a short game.)

It's a comfort-food kind of game, a non-threatening, charming open-world blend of platformer (metroidvania-light) and pinball, with collection/exploration elements.  It does absolutely require skill and fine judgement of timing, but it does not punish you while you develop your skills, as long as you are patient.  There's no limit to your lives, so you can just keep trying.

Download the free demo if you're intrigued but not ready to commit.

This game was obviously made with love and pride.  I want more games developed by these folks, especially if they make a sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198312310110', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1590870156}
review:
只看画风以为是给小孩子玩的游戏呢，结果没想到游戏内容还真的蛮有意思的，差点就错过了一款好游戏。关卡设计做的也很棒，游戏体验也很流畅。而且就算一开始就提示了反派可能是任何人，我居然还是没猜到到底是谁

本来只是抱着喜加一的态度买的，没想到居然觉得真的很好玩。
游戏的主要玩法是“三维弹球”这一点很让人惊喜，而且有些小关卡居然还略有难度。
游戏通关以后还是可以继续在岛上生活的，所以想要全收集的朋友不用担心，完全可以先打boss
推荐！

author: {'steamid': '76561198009334801', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1590605727}
review:
Un po’ sì e un po’ no, ma non c'è l'opzione.
Uno strano mix di gioco di esplorazione/”metroidvania” (virgolette d’obbligo, perché ci si affaccia appena) e… flipper.
Noi siamo Yoku, uno scarabeo stercorario che approda su un’isola appena in tempo per venire assunto come nuovo postino e nel frattempo aiutare un po’ gli abitanti e il Dio dell’isola, sotto attacco da una misteriosa creatura. Com’è prevedibile, la missione di Yoku è di girare in lungo e in largo per l’isola per rintracciare i Guardiani e chiedere il loro aiuto.

Procedendo nel gioco sbloccheremo alcuni potenziamenti che ci permetteranno ad esempio di nuotare sott’acqua o di agganciarci a particolari fiori per raggiungere zone nuove, ma l’elemento “metroidvania” è più o meno tutto qui. 

La particolarità del gioco, e il suo maggior limite, sta invece nel fatto di avere molte sezioni flipper da superare attivando interruttori, passando più volte negli stessi tunnel per raccogliere frutta, avete presente insomma. 
Quella che in teoria è anche un’idea simpatica, diventa però ben presto noiosa quando dovremo ripassare un sacco di volte dalle stesse sezioni cercando di imbroccare l’uscita giusta. 
C’è una specie di fast travel da sbloccare, ma non copre tutta l’isola e spesso per tornare in particolari sezioni ce la si deve fare tutta a piedi o, beh, rotolando nei flipper.

E, come chiunque abbia mai giocato a un flipper reale o virtuale sa bene, alla ventesima volta in cui vorremmo solo uscire da un certo tunnel con un colpo preciso al pixel, ma la pallina va continuamente dove non dovrebbe e magari rimbalza sui bouncer per 20 secondi o torna in un’area precedente ogni volta prima di lasciarci riprovare, diciamo che quella dello scarabeo non è l’unica palla a girare. 

Ci sono poi diversi collezionabili sparsi per tutta l’isola che sbloccano il vero finale e alcune subquest che richiedono – naturalmente – di tornare in aree precedenti, ma non è un gioco lunghissimo e in 6-8 ore si dovrebbe riuscire a fare tutto, contando anche il tempo che si perde nelle sezioni flipper.  

Graficamente è molto carino e anche come sonoro tropicaleggiante ci siamo, ma sinceramente da un gioco così pluripremiato mi aspettavo qualcosina in più. L’idea di base è molto carina, ma avrebbero dovuto rifinirla un minimo, sveltendola quel tanto che basta da non risultare noiosa all’ennesimo passaggio obbligato per i flipper. Riuscito a metà, insomma.

review: Увлекательная игра, сочетающая в себе исследования, платформер и пинболл и оформленный в замечательном стиле. Мир очень яркий, притягательный, его наполняют забавные персонажи. Отмечу и музыку, такая же легкая, "пляжная". Мне захотелось всё исследовать и всё собрать, что я и сделал. Нудновато, конечно, под конец катать шарик по опостылевшим локациям, добирая остатки, но я ни о чем не жалею!

The game is a good length, but so fun it definitely left me wanting more; I hope they make a sequel soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032067409', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1590354345}
review: Yoku's Island Express is a fantastic metroidvania wrapped up in a vibrant, breezy art style. Don't be dissuaded by the visuals, this game will demand fairly tight timing to achieve the best ending. I left a stone or two unturned, but all told it should take between 10-12 hours to 100% the game assuming an average amount of skill. The pinball mechanics work well to facilitate movement and exploration of the surprisingly large world. All in all, I would highly recommend Yoku's Island Express to Metroidvania fans of all ages, as well as anyone looking for a game that succeeds in standing out from its peers and trying something new.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991530786', 'num_games_owned': 4469, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1590266159}
review:
Concept of mixing platform and pinball sounded so weird, but demo being available I tried it and loved the gameplay so I had to buy it. They mixed pinball and platforming really nicely.

It is somewhat challenging but not "pull your hair out" challenging and it is really forgiving anyways. Art style and soundtrack are really nice and fitting to the theme of the games. 

Plot spoiler below:
[spoiler]Story starts pretty innocently of you being the the new postman just to figure out that you have to help saving the island god.
[/spoiler]

Not sure how it plays with keyboard, but it feels like I would probably recommend gamepad for it.

For 100% achievements, it took me almost 9 hours playing it casually to complete every achievement, there are speedruns for around 2h but I feel like it would require playing the game through once or twice to achieve times like that.

I would recommend this game to people who like platformers and don't absolutely hate pinball games, if you feel neutral about pinball (like I do, don't really like them but don't really hate them) you most likely will enjoy this game and have good time playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121112670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1590368685}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a fun pinball 2d platformer.  Played using a controller, beat it in about 7 hours, and the difficulty is easy-medium.  Great game for kids.

The graphics and feel of the game reminded me of something on the snes or genesis era, except you're never really in danger of losing/dying.  There's a wide variety of creative pinbally challenges throughout the map to find, and many different friendly characters to help out.  Collecting everything and 100%ing the game after beating it requires a little work and a bit more creative thinkery adding to the otherwise solid game in a pleasant way.  Be prepared to backtrack your heart out.

I got a little motion sick while playing this one, either because of the rolling motions or the way the screen waved back and forth.  It's unusual to get motion sickness on a 2d platformer.    Didn't get in the way of playing too bad.  Take frequent breaks.

Lastly, if you play, you're required to make as much noise with the party horn as humanly possible.  Crank the volume.  Antagonize the neighborhood.  You've been given your weapon, the day is YOURS to seize!  Muahahahaaa.....

author: {'steamid': '76561197970527994', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1590525127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013725760', 'num_games_owned': 874, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1588178568}
review:
[h1]Le flipper de Windows XP me manque[/h1]

C'est la première pensée que j'ai eue en découvrant ce jeu. Les Flippers se font rares, c'est passé de mode. On en voit de moins en moins dans les bars, et les salles de jeu se font également de plus en plus rares. Obligé de se rabattre sur du virtuel. Windows XP nous mettait à disposition la démo d'un excellent Flipper, que de souvenirs. Quand j'ai vu que [b]Yoku's Island[/b] était un jeu de Flipper tout mignon, je me suis dit pourquoi pas. Mais quand j'ai vu qu'il proposait en plus un gameplay de Metroidvania, j'ai su qu'il me le fallait.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2077218793

Du défilement horizontal (et vertical … enfin dans tous les sens ici) pour parcourir un monde et des capacités ou objets à obtenir afin d'accéder à des endroits auparavant inaccessibles. Rien à voir avec un flipper a priori. Pourtant, la fusion des deux genres est magnifiquement réussie ici. 
Dans ce jeu, pas de plateau unique, pas de highscore, pas de gameover quand la balle tombe. Il s'agit plutôt d'une multitude de plateaux connectés les uns aux autres par des couloirs qu'il vous faudra atteindre en utilisant les flippers et bumpeurs que vous commandez : deux boutons, rien de bien compliqué. Viennent s'ajouter à cela différentes capacités débloquables au fur et à mesure de votre avancée et permettent ainsi de progresser sur l'île en ouvrant les portes, cassant les obstacles ou en accomplissant des quêtes. Arriver à caler des combats de boss là-dedans, ça tient presque du génie.

Vous êtes dans la peau de Yoku, un petit bousier qui arrive tout juste sur cette île paradisiaque en tant que facteur. Comme tout petit bousier qui se respecte, il traîne sa boule, qui est en ivoire de base ici. Enfin, c'est à se demander qui traîne qui, parce que dans un flipper c'est avec la boule qu'on joue, et Yoku, lui, il se fait méchamment balader. Bref … livrer le courrier et les colis en retard, rendre service aux habitants et surtout, sauver la vie de la divinité protectrice de l'île, voici vos missions. C'est mignon, coloré, vivant, on aime et on en redemande. Un peu court sur la quête principale qui vous demandera 4 ou 5 heures, le jeu se rattrape en longévité grâce aux objectifs secondaires et nombreux récoltables parsemant l'île. Il va vous falloir bien des efforts pour terminer le jeu à 100%, et un bon zeste de dextérité.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2078363682

Notez également que vous ne passez pas votre temps à rouler. Yoku peut évidemment se déplacer avec ses petites pattes afin d'explorer l'île. Particularité qui permet notamment de mieux contrôler ses tirs sur les plateaux si la vitesse le permet. Recoltez des fruits qui servent de monnaie afin d'obtenir certains items et débloquer des passages vers de nouvelles zones. Sifflet, aspirateur à limaces explosives, costume de poisson pour nager et d'autres accessoires viendront compléter votre panoplie afin de vous aider dans votre progression.
Pas toujours évident à contrôler, requérant parfois un peu de chance ou un certain sens du timing, le jeu saura se montrer frustrant en cas d'erreur, ou lorsque la balle ne veut pas aller là où on le souhaite. Pas tellement punitif, heureusement, vous perdrez en général quelques secondes si vous prenez le mauvais chemin, vous obligeant à revenir en arrière. Pas de mort à proprement parler non plus : chaque chute dans les ronces entraîne la perte de quelques fruits et incrémente un compteur en lien avec une quête secondaire.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2078371158

Des graphismes peints à la main de toute beauté mettent en avant une map immense dotée de plusieurs zones bien distinctes pour des paysages différents, colorés et attrayants. Une ambiance musicale également très sympa, sauf exception. Des personnages attachants sortis tout droit de l’imagination digne d’un fumeur d’herbe professionnel (c’est un compliment !). Un gameplay original et sympathique alternant entre plateforme et flipper. Les créateurs ont eu un élan d'inspiration pour nous proposer un contenu de qualité enchaînant les bonnes idées. Foncez sur ce titre tout mignon qui vaut son pesant d'or, encore plus plaisant s'il a été pris lors d'une réduction aussi bienvenue que ce jeu dans votre bibliothèque.

Vous pouvez également consulter ce groupe pour savoir quoi ne [u]pas[/u] acheter: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/18976233/][u]La Purge[/u][/url].[/code]

review:
Ein origineller Pinball-Metroidvania mit einer netten Story und einem schönen Soundtrack.
Aus den unterschiedlichen Mistkäferklumpen hätte man meiner Meinung etwas mehr rausholen können, nichtsdestotrotz ein interessantes Spiel für Zwischendurch!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986838585', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1589512061}
review: This is a super casual MetroidVania.  There is no way to lose or die.  If you need a really easy going game, this is a good choice.  The pinball elements are minimal.  There are sections here and there that are shaped like a pinball board.  There are a few things in this game that exist on a real pinball table, but for the most part, it isn't a deep pinball experience. It mostly uses flippers as a way to traverse around the map.  Its neat, but if you are someone that actually understands how real pinball works, it might not be as satisfying as you may have hoped.  Overall I recommend if you need a really easygoing time and dont want to worry about losing.

review:
A work of art.
Pinball adventure with open-world gameplay, quests, characters, items, and fantastic physics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180856331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1590082516}
review:
This game is amazing. I brought it for 4 € without any idea of what was about (I like pinball so I decided to give it a try). What I found was much more than a pinball-like adventure. This is some kind of small, easy-going metroidvania whith items, collectibles, characters, secrets... and the atmosphere is so cute and charming, and sometimes it turns to darkness, but just a little bit, to get you fully engaged. 

I recommend this game even if you are not a total fan of pinball; this game makes it incredibly accesible and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446567209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1589383967}
review: Bought this on sale, quite happy with it. Gameplay is simple and not too difficult, but the music, cute design and pinball mechanics make this still enjoyable enough. It is quite short, but there's lots of side quests and secrets to find. Only annoyance I had were some of the voices - they try the Banjo Kazooie style, but fail by being hard to listen to and going on way too long, so I skipped through some dialogue.

review: This game is so much fun! Pinball and a story. If you love arcade games, adventures and puzzles this is the game for you. Great for a casual gamer like me. I game to decompress and the art and music in the game hot the spot. It's colorful with a little challenge. Great action.
