author: {'steamid': '76561197976580884', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1589273273}
review:
It's a pinball metroidvania.  That sounds like two random genres pulled out of a hat, or maybe an attempt to win a contest for coming up with the least likely game design idea to function.  And yet, it works.

The promise in the concept alone is worth the price of admission in my opinion, at least for anyone with an interest in unusual ideas or things games could do.

Setting that premise aside, what they've made here is a charming, if not especially challenging, little game.  Characters are cute, the scenery is beautiful, the mechanics and areas are clever, and the setting is imaginative.

None of those are pushing any boundaries, once you get past the novelty of the core mechanics, and I never really found any part of the game that challenging in my time with it.  I didn't finish a 100% run, so it's possible there is some difficulty hidden away, however what potential there that I did find in the optional things I collected seemed more frustrating than anything else.  With the mechanics as novel as they are, it's understandable that there are some kinks to work out with the controls, and the end result is usually pretty fun but has to go a little easy on the player because making it harder increases annoyance more than anything else, at least past a certain point.

Still, I would say the game is worth it even with the flaws.  It's an enjoyable experience if one can appreciate something very lighthearted, or wants to see a really simple yet incredibly unique set of mechanics for a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968807811', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1589274442}

review:
Just gonna start by saying I hate pinball and regardless of that I can say this is an amazing game. If you like metroidvanias with a lot of leniency that require pinball skills instead of combat skills then this is your game.

The only downside is doing a full run, finishing all quests and getting the final ending, takes only 7 hours and that's if you're terrible at pinball like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418239072', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1589108906}
review:
[h1]概要[/h1]
ピンボール＋メトロイドヴァニア。主人公ヨクはひょんなことから島の郵便配達人（Express＝速達便）となり、住人の手助けをしていくというストーリー。

最大の特徴は移動方法で、自らジャンプできず、左右に移動することしかできない。ヨクはボールと紐で繋がれており、島のあちこちに設置されている水色と黄色のフリッパーをLT・RTで上げ、弾き飛ばして移動する。各所にはダンジョン的に小さなピンボール台があり、ボス戦もピンボールで行う。ミスするとコイン的な役割のフルーツが減ることはあるが、ライフもゲームオーバーも無い。

[h1]言語[/h1]
日本語対応。意外と会話も登場するが、問題なく訳されている。

[h1]評価[/h1]
[b]おすすめ度：★★★★★（5点 / 5段階）[/b] 
購入価格：￥410

思った以上にピンボールでメトロイドヴァニアだった。ジャンプができないので上への移動は全てピンボールのように移動することになるが、島にはバンパーや三角形のスリングショット、クルッと1回転するレーンなど、おなじみの仕掛けも多数設置されている。これが時に高速で爽快だし、ちょっと横に移動するのにもバンパーに数回弾かれるような遊び心もある。

驚くのは、島全体がシームレスに繋がっていることで、巨大な地図が少しずつ明かされていくのはワクワクさせられる。メトロイドヴァニアに分類されるだけあって、探索や収集要素、泳げるようになるなどの成長要素も備えている。特に良かったのは、未取得の物が地図上に表示されるアイテムがあること。これによって、収集関連をかなりスムーズにコンプリートすることができた。

雰囲気は南国らしくのんびりとしていて、グラフィックも美麗。BGMが特筆すべき素晴らしさで、ウクレレやオカリナなどを用いていて、クレジットに「ミュージシャン」の項目もある。ゲームが終わっても聞いていたくなるほどで、サウンドトラックがあれば購入したかった。

惜しい点としては、下記が挙げられる。

[list]
    [*]移動
やはりフリッパーでの移動は意図通りに行かないことがあり、クリア済みのピンボール台を通るのが面倒に感じることもあった。ワープして通過できる機能などがあってもよかった。

    [*]ボールの塗装
途中でボールの模様替えが解禁されるが、詳しくは触れないとして、中途半端な仕様になっている。
[/list]

それと、エンディングが思ったよりも早くあっけなく感じた。とはいえ、残りのサブクエストや実績解除を加えれば価格とのバランスは十分だし、それだけ面白かったということだと思う。自分はピンボールが好きでも、スコアだけを目的に延々同じ台をプレイするのは苦手だったので、理想的なゲームだった。全体の完成度が非常に高いので、是非一度プレイしてほしい作品。

[h1]実績[/h1]
11時間で全実績解除。前述のようなゲーム内での補助のほか、動画付きのSteamガイドも充実しているため達成は難しくなかった。

唯一、「完璧屋さん」という実績については先に知っておいた方が良いことがある。「すべてのスカラベを有効にする」とのことだが、「スカラベ」についての説明が特に無かった。[spoiler]ピンボール台に設置されているコガネムシのような仕掛けを、バナナが出るまで2～3度作動させる必要がある。背景と同化していて見づらいので注意。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198258343372', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1589063515}
review:
If someone told me they had never played a video game before, I think this is the one I would recommend. Yoku's Island Express is a truly enjoyable experience. This game is just so much at once: it is a casual platformer with integrated pinball mechanics in a large metroidvania style world. However, it never feels overwhelming or difficult. It invites the player to relax and explore as you complete tasks and meet the island locals. 

There is an overall story which can be completed in about 5 hours, but there are also tons of additional tasks to complete, along with hidden treasures and secrets. 

In the end, Yoku's island express is a one of a kind game that offers something for everyone. Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030127591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1589051286}
review: Fun and short game where you play as a dung beetle rolling a ball around different pinball stages on an island while listening to some chill music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015238425', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1589001763}
review: This game is a pinball metroidvania. I'm not an expert on pinball physics so I can't really say how well this stacks up as a pinball game though there are a few sections I feel the physics feels a bit clunky for what you're trying to do. That being said gameplay overall functions correctly most of time and makes it a pretty fun blend of metroidvania collection, upgrading, and exploring while having a unique pinball experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157541327', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1588979532}
review:
Fantastic, charming and unique metroidvania. I've never thought about combining metroidvania with pinball (or, for that matter, combining pinball with anything) but the two work so well together! Metroidvanias / platformers, being so reliant on movement and movement related abilities, made the pinball element like it belongs.

The artstyle is adorable, and the entire game is just gorgeous. Each area feels different from the last, and the cast of characters is diverse and fun to interect with.

The game can get a little tedious to move around in large distances until you unlock the fast travel system, so I'd suggest you wait for that before exploring too deep into the world. Also, the game is not worth 100%, since the reward is small and isn't worth it at all. While getting the collectables is really fun, but I wouldn't put myself through the trouble of getting each and every one of them.

Overall, it's a great metroidvania that is definitely worth the time of any fan of the genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160091693', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1588718222}
review: Yoku's Island Express é um jogo simples em conceito e mecanica, até mesmo a história é a mais simples possível, a parte incrivel é como eles transformaram o gênero pinball em um jogo de aventura q REALMENTE FUNCIONA, o jogo é relaxante na maioria das partes, os chefes e alguns puzzles podem ser chatos até vc pegar o jeito do pinball, pra quem só quer relaxar com um jogo simples pode compra sem medo, as musicas são poucas eu senti q podia ter mais variações mas elas são muito bem ambientadas, elas combinam com o cenario, mas eu sinto q a luta final merecia uma musica com uma pega mais "final", pra um jogo q inovou no pinball mesmo sendo tão simples, a minha nota é 8,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198217647932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1589752002}
review:
TL;DR - Super recommended: Lots of fun, nice progression, generally easy-medium difficulty, slight annoyances.

This game was very fun! Although the art style is very unique and nice (kudos on that!), I would have preferred a 3D world to explore, but that would have made the pinball mechanic harder. Speaking of that, I found it fun overall, but some areas became very annoying because of the precision needed to enter a certain space. I appreciated very much that there was a story and free exploration; that was great. The map was very helpful too. The progression was nice. And overall, the game never felt either too easy or too hard. It was mostly fun in terms of difficulty, except for the pinball areas mentioned above. It's also nice that even after you complete the main story, there still seems to be a lot to do around on the island.

Some areas of improvement: Yoku is cute, but he doesn't seem to have much personality; he always seems to be smiling with no changes in his expression. It would have been nice that there was more to Yoku. More story would have been nice too. In addition, sound seems to be a bit unbalanced out of the box; for example, the party horn's sound is too loud. I know that you have settings for that, but it wasn't even clear to me which sounds would be affected by which setting, and I thought it would be a bit of a hassle to have to start adjusting and trying out the changes, so I left it like that. On this topic, I found the use of the party horn as a noise maker annoying; I used it as little as possible because the sound is very irritating. Finally, the soundtrack was a bit of a mixed bag for me. The tropical parts of it were really good and fitting for the game's environment. But there were a lot of tracks that seemed very out of place. Also, when a boss fight got longer, the music started to be a real drag because it was very repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276729704', 'num_games_owned': 1257, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1640890815}
review: If you like pinball then this is the game for you. If the thought of pinball fills you with dread then avoid this game. I loved the art style and it was just the right amount of challenging. Not so challenging that I wanted to pull my hair out, but challenging enough where I had to keep trying to beat certain portions. I also appreciate the fact that I was not only bad at pinball when I was a child and played the free version that came with my computer I am also bad at it as an adult, but that is okay. Yoku does not care how many mistakes you make because Yoku is one masochistic dung beetle who needs a raise. Seriously Yoku gets thrown around like a ragdoll and never complains (it may be because they do not know how to speak like the other animals around the island so they cannot articulate their pain). If you have a couple of extra bucks I highly recommend playing this game. ALSO, not to throw shade at other games, but I cannot put into words my love for games that allow you to keep playing after the main story is finished. As someone who likes to collect everything and get all the achievements thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027316101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1585, 'last_played': 1701441202}
review:
Ok, I have to do this first: movement between the areas can get a bit frustrating even with the beeline - it's a labyrinth! Music can get a bit repetitive at times, though it definitely fits the different worlds and sets the right atmosphere.

And now that we got the cons out of the way: GET THIS GAME!

Even if you have never played pinball before (like me) I assure you you'll pick it up fairly easily. Explore the island like a real open world adventurer,  flip your beetle onto the bumpers, suck some snails with your vacuum and kaboom those crystal balls, biff your keyboard (or your controller - which is highly recommended), nudge your monitor,  pop those bubble-fruits, and get high with the deeply satisfying sound effects! Υippyyyyy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198394487138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1708977953}
review:
My short review is that this game is a mixed bag and is more frustrating at times than I would have liked, but ultimately is endearing and well-designed, and it worth a play. I'll go into detail below.

POSITIVES:
- The games standout element is in its design. The art style is wonderful, I love the characters, and the music is underrated. I would fall asleep peacefully to the theme song.
- For the most part, the world is well designed on a technical level and there's some interesting points that make fun and fresh things happen with traversal.
- Control is pretty fluent most of the time, although I would recommend playing on a controller so you actually get the feel of the pinball bumpers as opposed to the awkward Shift keys.
- Upgrade progression keeps things interesting, a la classic platformers. My favourite thing about games like this is seeing an element of the world I can't use yet and working towards getting the upgrade to reach it. Similarly, I didn't expect customisation, and the ability to mix and match paint jobs for your ball is clever and neat.
- The story was what made it a unique idea for me - a pinball board with a narrative. My favourite part was the inclusion of bosses, which is a really interesting way to use pinball, and on a story level I didn't see the ending coming!


NEGATIVES:
- When the ball moves right, it feels very nice, but the fact that your centre of motion (Yoku the beetle) and your centre of weight/gravity (the pinball) are two separate entities tied together means that control and physics problems are inevitable. if Yoku is thrown or pulled in different directions, it means launching the ball off an exact point on the paddle multiple times can yield different results. This basically makes reacting visually to the ball impossible - no matter how good you are at pinball, or how used you think you get used to the physics, it simply works differently because of Yoku being tethered to it. Like I said in my opening, this is sometimes quite an incredible source of frustration, and I'd find myself stuck in an infinite loop within some boards, despite nailing the positioning of the ball to the paddle. It means to perfect the game, you have to visually calculate the ball's speed and position, as well as Yoku's, at the same time, which is quite an ask for something that is intended for all ages.
- Though the game isn't incredibly long, it can get repetitive in extended sessions due to the boards being the major highlight of the gameplay and them not really having much variety beyond fruit spinners and rune keys to unlock the next section of them. Some more interesting physics elements, similar to the holes that pop Yoku about, would have provided more variety. However, as it is, it's strange that the story and traversal are the most interesting mechanics when the game's USP is that it's a pinball adventure.
- Though the Beeline feature helps to get around the island quickly, a lot of time is still wasted backtracking to out-of-the-way locations where you forgot an item, and sometimes reaching them isn't about having the right tool or currency, but simply trial and error, especially when you're bouncing around in a way you don't want to. There are exploding slugs that you have to use to propel yourself to certain areas sometimes, but their centre of gravity is so unspecific, it'll take you tons of attempts to get used to where you're supposed to stand and how to position the slug. It's not impossible to get used to, but a precise indicator would have helped. Ultimately, the traversal can just be kind of a pain in the later stages.
- This game hates controllers. I could only play it in Big Picture Mode after fiddling about with a few settings, which is the only game I've had to do this with. I searched Google and it turns out it's a reoccurring problem, and it's a shame this never got fixed. It works for me now, but it'd be nice if it just worked anyway, especially considering that, as I recommended, it's better with a controller.
-The game's got a surprising length for what you'd think it is and clearly a lot of work has gone into its design - it feels incredibly polished. However, I still think £16 is a big ask. I got it on sale, but considering the limited gameplay elements, and the indie length, it's worth about £10 max, imo. It's the same price as Rayman Legends, and more than Cuphead.

Overall, I think I was hoping for something a little more relaxing with the cute premise and quaint presentation, when it really turns out in some places to be more of a slog than I would have liked, mainly due to how low a priority is put on precision for a pinball game. But the atmosphere of the world saves it, the pinball is genuinely fun to knock about, and the game doesn't overstay its welcome. As a platformer, it works in an interesting and satisfying way and in all honesty, I preferred its world and controls much more than Ori and the Blind Forest, which this game initially reminded me of. It's definitely worth playing for those that have the free time. I would just recommend getting it on sale, and don't get your hopes too high off the back of its overwhelmingly positive reception.

RATING: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983749619', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1588456049}
review:
Genial! El Dark Souls de los pinballs...

Concepto muy original y bien llevado a la práctica! Un juego de pinball en un mundo abierto súper buenrollero, colorista y desenfadado. Gráficamente muy resultón, y deja entrever que con más tiempo y/o recursos este juego sería muy muy bueno. Con una capa extra de pintura estaría empezando a acercarse a la barbaridad que es algo como Ori and the blind forest. 
A nivel de jugabilidad es muy muy divertido, integra los elementos del pinball clásico dentro de un entorno natural de una forma muy coherente y original. Y agrega conceptos nuevos, y ayudas a la jugabilidad muy agradecidas. Porque a veces se hace algo difícil. Controlar dónde va la bola en un pinball siempre ha sido complejo, y aquí no deja de serlo. Y eso es bueno, porque te da ayudas para entender cómo jugar de forma correcta, pero sin facilitarte demasiado las cosas. Y hay puntos donde resulta algo tedioso, porque te obliga a hacer varias veces una maniobra complicada, cuando quizá con una o dos ya bastaría para no llegar a ser cargante.
Fuera de eso es un juego muy muy bien cuidado en los detalles, con un mapa inteligentemente diseñado, obligando a cierto backtracking de más que te ayuda a darte cuenta de o bien montados que están los caminos, los atajos, los pasadizos secretos... Hay un montón de cosas por hacer aparte de la historia principal, que me ha llevado unas 9 horas según Steam. 
Una maravilla de juego creada por un pequeño equipo de 6 personas aproximadamente. Un tapado que a poco que te esfuerces en esos puntos difíciles que cometnaba te devuelve mucho más de lo que tú le das. Como cuando en un pinball te dan una bola extra tras el primer golpe. xD

MUY RECOMENDABLE!

Saludos!

review: 非常棒的银河城游戏，难度适中，适合新人，画面可爱，音乐还很好听，整个流程玩下来的感觉就是很舒服，挑不出什么毛病，一下午跑完全流程神清气爽，就好像看了场电影走出门呼吸到的空气一样，总之就是心旷神怡的感觉。从某种角度来说，这个游戏是我个人比较推崇的禅意游戏，满分，十分推荐。10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059041451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1619716140}
review:
Wonderful, fun game!
I love the colorful, cute art style, the music and how there is something interesting to discover around every corner. Controls are explained nicely and easy to handle, even for a noob like me ^.^ 
I thought there was a perfect speed to learning new abilities, exploring new parts of the map and tasks getting more challenging. Even after finishing the main story, there are still lots of achievements to complete and abilities to perfect. Still, I wish I could play even longer, just because I enjoyed it so much. Maybe a sequel?

author: {'steamid': '76561197977205856', 'num_games_owned': 2139, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1588125551}
review:
If the phrase "whimsical pinball Metroidvania" sounds interesting, then this game might be for you.

Yohu's Island Express isn't a terribly long or complex game. But it makes up for that with its sheer charm. The art style and soundtrack kept a grin on my face the whole time.

Eventually, the backtracking started to get annoying. Your character isn't super speedy when rolling along the ground, and there's a fair amount of rolling in this game. You can eventually unlock a speed increase via an optional side-quest, but I didn't manage to do that until after I had beaten the game. And one of the later movement powerups was a little too finnicky for my tastes.

Still, those are small annoyances. Overall, I had a great time with this game.

review: This game really wowed me. It has to be one of the best metroidvanias I've played, thanks to it's highly polished and creative level design. The graphics and music are great too, and the game controls differently from the usual metroidvanias, as you move a ball around and control paddles as if the map was a pinball table. Highly recommended, don't pass on it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198173998711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1588148932}
review:
本游戏整体来说具有新颖（融合了桌上弹球和2D横版过关）的游戏性和休闲的画面(可爱)及音乐[spoiler]（我其实全程开着其他的音乐播放器）[/spoiler]。全收集的时长应该在5~10小时左右[spoiler]（圣甲虫有点点费时间，我不知道我这是bug还是什么，我地图上面不会显示全部的未激活圣甲虫，总是激活一些之后又冒出来一些，但是整体难度不大）[/spoiler]，所以作为一款休闲和怀旧（windows桌上弹球）向的游戏，容量刚刚好。打完折入手应该是最好的选择。

游戏性上面，你所需要的按键只有shift、enter、WASD之类的极少数按键，所以完全不需要担心有什么操作难度[spoiler]（就完全没有，很多球的运行轨迹都是提前设计好的）[/spoiler]。你的本体是个瓢虫[spoiler]（屎壳郎？）[/spoiler]，然后来到一个新的岛屿来接任邮递局局长的工作。你当然会按照游戏的流程触发一系列的剧情[spoiler]（感觉整体剧情太薄弱了一些，建议可以提供不同的难度或者丰富地图，至今雪山顶下面那块迷雾区域都让我觉得怪怪的）[/spoiler]，沉浸在游戏剧情当中并完成你的局长任务就是你该做的事啦。

[spoiler]我其实一直很期待有不同的球可以选用 （比如重的可以往水里沉，轻的可以飘），结果最后只是在球上涂不同的颜色，小失望[/spoiler]

MGN整体评分 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995675287', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1620579060}
review:
So, ok...this game is a hybrid of a linear story and well pinball.  It's so much more though.  There is a slight metroidvania feel as you will do backtracking.  There are multiple upgrades you receive and boss fights.  Nothing ever gets frustrating and you're looking forward to letting the story play out.  Its nothing deep, just fun.  We need some mindless fun nowadays.  The length is pretty long with various areas and collectibles to be found.  Oh and the music is fantastic.

I paid only 4 bucks on a steam sale.  I would look for it at a lower price as when it's done, you'll probably not go back to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083787516', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1695068876}
review:
Весьма впечатлившая меня игрушка. Удивительное, необычное сочетание платформера-метроидвании, вроде "Ори и слепого леса" и... пинбола.
По сюжету жучок прибывает на остров, где собирается работать почтальоном. Но узнаёт, что хранитель острова, огромное неведомое существо, что-то вроде местного божка, подвергся нападению "богоубийцы" и страдает от нанесённых ран. Если не провести ритуал исцеления, острову и всем его жителям грозит погибель. Для ритуала нужно обойти остров и собрать всех старейшин.
Главный герой жучок повсюду катает с собой какой-то шарик. Сами по себе двигаются они довольно медленно. Но повсюду тут и там на острове полно всяких рычажков, которые могут подбрасывать жучка с его мячиком, придавая им значительное ускорение. Так же как в играх типа пинбола. 
Прошёл с большим удовольствием за 2-3 дня. Всем рекомендую. Сюжет драматичен, графика красивая, производительность отличная - системные требования невысокие.
Моё прохождение можно посмотреть тут - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR7vyJj51kqfxVRghwvJOLdvEcWfO7aIT

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1587999699}
review:
[h1] Действительно потрясающе нарисованный и один из самых мирных метроидов с элементами пинбола про букашку-почтальона [/h1]

А вообще попытки внедрения пинбола в платформер были уже давно. Ну популярная аркада с отбиванием шарика видимо прочно засела в мозгах некоторых разрабов. Вспомнить хотя бы Sonic spinball или Worms pinball от тех же Team17. Но это вроде бы не находило отклика и если кто хотел поиграть в пинбол, то обращался к специализированным играм вроде Pinball DX или была даже древняя игрушка из MS Plus для Windows 95 - Космический кадет. Так что недостатка игр в набивании шарика не было.

Но тут решили совместить игровой процесс метроида с механикой пинбола. И симбиоз получился вполне жизнеспособный. Другое дело, что по сути механика пинбола лишь как элемент игрового процесса. Такая игра могла бы существовать даже в виде обычного платформера, потому что сюжет здесь очень насыщен различными необязательными активностями. Порой механика пинбола даже слишком увеличивает время игрового процесса, потому что идеальной её сложно назвать. Но всё же сложности здесь как таковой и нет. Всё зависит по сути от прямых рук игрока. Убить букашку-почтмейстера здесь по сути невозможно даже боссам. Так что жучара бессмертный. Хотя если бы были жизни, то это увеличило бы время прохождения в разы. Так что разработчиками достигнут отличный баланс между сложностью и продолжительностью вкупе с шикарно нарисованным игровым оформлением.

В то же время целевая аудитория не слишком понятна. Вроде бы история более-менее детская, но игровой процесс требует немаленькой ловкости для получения всех достижений. Многие можно добыть лишь через видеоруководство, которое можно найти в сообществе. Это ещё один повод не брать игру на старте продаж и дождаться прохождения, чтобы не получать непроходимых или непонятных моментов без возможности их решить.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2070216199 
Но на данный момент времени игру можно назвать умеренно-сложной и вполне проходимой на идеальный результат. Так что брать можно на скидке. В остальных случаях игра не слишком обязательно, просто детская история с не очень ровным пинболом. Но удовольствие получить можно, особенно на большом экране. На маленьком всё будет очень мелко и главного персонажа порой вообще не видать, видно лишь шарик.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2071855106
 В плане стимовских плюшек также всё в порядке - есть карточки, достижения, облачное сохранение, отзывчивое управление с контроллера, но не хватает поддержки стимос.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2960, 'num_reviews': 904, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1587340086}
review:
Honestly, I didn’t know what to expect from this game. I’ve heard about it a few times as a Metroidvania, but what I found after playing is an awesome pinball game mixed with a good Metroidvania platformer.

I’m a fan of pinball and Yoku’s Island Express is a really interesting and accessible pinball game dressed up as the adventure of a dung beetle trying to be a postman. It has a great look and style to the entire game, as well as a pretty good journey. The character looks like a dung beetle while they moves around as a platfomer but watching the dung beetle flop around as he flies around the pinball sections is pretty funny.

The downside is everything that relates to the Metroidvania style. The game is really interesting with a lack of a typical jump button, but when you use this system for traversal for collectibles or backtracking, it feels a little weak. There are a lot of collectibles in Yoku’s Island Express, but that backtracking weakens the game. There is also a lack of difficulty, where the player can’t die and only gives up a minor amount of currency when they lose their “ball”.

Still, I enjoyed Yoku’s Island Express. It’s a great pinball-style and a fun adventure outside of that. If you can handle a pinball based game, you’ll probably have a lot of fun here. If you want a Metroidvania game, on the other hand, you probably will be disappointed. There’s just not enough here for that. Though, hang on, I do have a true Metroidvania game coming up.

Video Reviews: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcbYDD6ISYE&t=414s

author: {'steamid': '76561197974914175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1587952597}
review:
I don't usually write reviews, but if it leads more people to this game it's worth it.

This game is a unique concept as far as I can tell, and that's why I love it. I've been gaming for decades and have never encountered a pinball/platformer hybrid... and I was like "meh, might be fun," but it is AWESOME. 

As a platformer the progression is paced well, with ability upgrades unlocking new areas and allowing you to further explore previous areas. Backtracking isn't a chore at all, especially because it's all pinball so even rehashing old areas is still fun (did anyone else play the crap out of the windows pinball game? ) The pinball element introduces the game's challenges. Visuals are fantastic.

Seriously, this game is great. Easy to pick up and put down, challenging but not frustrating. Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993769220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1707391336}
review: My son and I are having a great time playing this game together. It is a wonderful game that even a child of 6 can have a lot of fun with and can enjoy almost independently. It is quite forgiving as you cannot really lose or die in game, it shows no violence (other than getting pricked by some thorns or something of the sort), it has tasteful art and pleasant music and the difficulty level is just right - it will not be a piece of cake, so it will test (and I believe help develop) the child's eye-hand coordination skills, but it will not be hopelessly hard either, so frustration is kept at a minimum. Highly recommended for children and adults who want to have some fun and relaxing gaming time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002134811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1587847475}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a light-hearted and deeply refreshing game, which combines two styles of game I have never seen put together into a fresh and fun title. The characters are cute and funny, the music is bouncy and tropical, and everything pops with bright colors and magical whimsy. Having had very little experience with pinball prior to this, I was pleased to see that the controls were intuitive and responsive. The bright flashes and showers of rewards as you make successful shots are dizzying and joyful. The story was nice, if relatively short, but I thought the overall length was appropriate. There are also plenty of side activities and collectibles if you're into that. 

I had a couple of little gripes. For one thing, while the pinball action is fun, it can also feel frustrating when the difference between a shot going where you want or not is so slight. You can get in a cycle of just missing your narrow shot in the same way over and over. For another, you can get a bit turned around at times and have a hard time figuring out where to go next. Add to that the size of the world and the occasional randomness of the movement, and you can end up going in circles a bit. These things did detract from the game a bit, but overall I still had a lot of fun for the vast majority of the time.

If you're looking for a friendly and novel game to sink a few hours into, this is a great choice. I've never played anything like it, and may never again. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146668836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1604475886}
review:
J'ai réalisé l'histoire du jeu en 3 à 4 heures. 
Les graphismes, la couleur, l'ambiance et les musiques font de ce jeu une réussite. 
J'avoue tout de même que j'apprécie grandement le flipper et que ces phases de jeu sont très bien réalisées. il ne manque qu'un léger secouage pour retrouver une véritable expérience. En effet, ça manque d'un bon vieux TILT.
J'ai pris beaucoup de plaisir à y jouer. La difficulté estun peu simple à mon gout mais le fait d'avancer dans l'histoire sans que la difficulté soit "hardcore" est appréciable.
La durée du mode histoire est à mon gout un peu courte. J'ai terminé 50 % du jeu en 4 h. Je vais maintenant réaliser les missions annexes.

Je vous souhaite beaucoup de plaisir à jouer à ce titre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274628304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1590573918}
review:
yoku's island express is an overall decent game. the art is very pleasing. the music/sounds effects are mostly upbeat so the game is in a happy mood throughout. i am playing for the experience so i won't go into detail about the 100% completion. if i have to compare the gameplay, it would be similar to sonic the hedgehog meets pinball. the in-game currency needed to activate bumpers and buy stuffs are plentiful. i only managed to upgrade my fruits to 250 fruits and i lasted until completion of the game.

i have a few (minor) problems with this game:
the map doesn't have place names. it has markers to show you where to actually go for all your quests, but sometimes going to the said place have many alternative routes, some of which are blocked for the first time. it did not help that the only written walkthrough about this game is mostly go here go there or some vague description of a place i am supposed to go. i also did not really have an idea about which is the actual main quest sometimes (a lot of quests going on and if i have to detour/or if i reached a certain part of the game where i am eligible to get certain tools).

secondly, the 'grappling hook' mechanism, named the sootling leash, is the most frustrating tool to use. i really vomit blood every time i have to use it. luckily, it is in the last 80%ish part of the game so i gritted my teeth and tried to play through the areas that needed it. the speed, in which the main character rotated around a flower, is super fast and not noob-friendly at all. i almost want to throw my controller on the wall when i had to use this sootling leash to swing up a tree with around 6-7 points to swing consecutively from and fell to the ground at least 30 times.

thirdly, i enjoyed most pinball stages in this game. however, the level design in the spider boss level is the most memorable for the wrong reasons for me. there are two areas to this pinball stage, after you clear the first, you go to the second area at the top to hit the spider. it is not so bad in the second area but every time i drop, i will return to the first area. and the first area pathway to the second area is next to a few other tunnels that lead elsewhere. like, there is no space between them. them being stuck together like they were glued with hot glue meant that it is extremely hard for me to get back to the second area for the spider boss sight. like, wtf? but maybe this part is just a 'me' problem, instead of the game.

review: 球球大家救救孩子，我那个猫头鹰果汁第一次的时候迷迷糊糊的就直接跟他聊天结果死活进不去了，蜜蜂衣服也拿不到，蜂后的快递我也送不过去，真心不想重新开始了，求知道解救方法的小可爱指教一下。

author: {'steamid': '76561198347845029', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1587803592}
review:
10/10，无可挑剔。我真诚向所有人大声安利，非常好玩！！！大概去年玩了DEMO之后就觉得肯定要买，前几天看到史低才14块果断入手，等等党大胜利！
类银河战士恶魔城+三维弹球的玩法，清新可爱的画风，恰到好处的配乐，满分！
不像银河城like绕不开的空洞和奥里，这款游戏非常适合手残，没有血量设定，没有GAME OVER，甚至连BOSS战都是只有你打它没有它打你，[spoiler]甚至还有一个支线必须被刺扎到50次才开启，[/spoiler]可以说是极为友好了。
当然也和其它银河城like一样有丰富的收集要素，需要反复跑图，可能有些无聊但也是这类游戏的通病了。在这款游戏里所有收集要素都会标注出来，并且没有什么是一周目错过就无法挽回的，真的是良心！
如果非要说哪里不满意...真结局最后的蚊子（？）也太丑了吧...哈哈哈~
总而言之，是一款不容错过的好游戏，建议每个人都买一份XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198061987808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1644033773}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000942469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1587319726}
review:
A Zelda game transposed from swords and shields to pinball and dung beetles. Unfortunately, exploration and backtracking tend towards the tedious and unrewarding, and the game is incredibly easy and short -- I "beat the game" (about 50% of all stuff found) in three hours of play time! I was actually shocked when the credits rolled, having assumed this was the "big twist at the halfway point." Nope! Final boss.

All in all a cute idea, executed at a good-not-great level, with way too little content to justify the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009169311', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1587641594}
review:
Неплохо, даже хорошо, но не без минусов.
Минусы. Здесь неудобный бэктрекинг, когда приходится каждый раз топать пешком в другой конец карты (а это не просто топать, но и каждый раз проходить пинбольные пазлы, которые встречаются на пути). Второе - это спорная игровая механика с полетами на цветках - просто неудобно прицеливаться, лично я из-за этого забил собирать 100%.
Но все таки в нее стоит поиграть. Пинбольная часть отличная, графоний приятный глазу, и геймплей ненапряжный и приятный — все скачет и бегает, как и должно (кроме цветов — они фрустрируют). Много допквестов и секретов, которые не сложно ищутся (не понимаю подхода "давайте спрячем секреты так, чтобы игроки без гайда никогда не нашли").
Кроме того, длится она ровно столько, сколько нужно, чтобы не надоесть, но и не прерывается на пике интереса.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993188898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1590166187}
review: This is a fun, pretty unusual little pinball Metroidvania. The art style is cool, music is good, story is minimal but fine, and gameplay is satisfying. Not very long though; took about 10 hours total to finish the game and 100% it. Still, worth picking up, I think. Sale may be better as far as the time/money equation goes. I got it as part of a (friend's) Humble Bundle, always a good option as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057326793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1587735791}
review:
Absolute Empfehlung - wenn es mal wieder im Sale ist! (Hatte es auf meiner Wunschliste und dann mit -80% erworben)
Das Spiel hat einen Haufen erfrischende Ideen: der Mistball der je nach Färbung bei verschiedenen NPCs Durchlass gewährt, die Flipper-Orgien, Explo-Schnecken die auf den Ball gesaugt werden können, Bienen-Express-Routen, Gobbel-Tröte, Rußmännchen und Schwimmfische - dabei ein durchwegs LEICHTer Schwierigkeitsgrad.
Vom Feeling her ein typisches Nintendo-Spiel (fühlte mich von Sound und Grafik-Stil an Yoshis-Island erinnert auch wenn es spielerisch damit nicht viel gemein hat).
Hab mir Zeit gelassen für all die lustigen, abstrusen und abwechslungsreichen Rätsel-Parts und war mit der Hauptstory nach 6-7 Std. fertig. Danach nochmal 2-3 Std. weiter diversen Kram gesucht (und noch etliche unendeckte Bereiche gefunden) - jetzt sagt mir das Menu ich bin bei 80%.
Wie gesagt: für unter 5€ ganz klare Kaufemfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198854636018', 'num_games_owned': 1931, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1655959743}
review:
一款很有意思的弹球游戏。
游戏的画风与音乐都很不错，适合用来休闲打磨时光，玩的时候也能回想起以前玩3维弹球的快乐。
[spoiler]但游戏也是会卡关的，当你卡在一个地方，弹球过不去时，就比较容易劝退了，这里推荐你各种角度多试试，总能过的。[/spoiler]
游戏中有叫“蜂道”的传送装置，但是”上车”地点是固定的，一旦你中途下车就得自己慢慢跑图了。游戏整体难度并不大，但是全成就还是比较麻烦的。[spoiler] 我目前还差10个柳条（地图上太分散了，真心不想跑了，有的还不知道怎么弄出来），2个宝箱没开（不知道咋开），任务做完后继续玩感觉很枯燥，所以全成就我就放弃了 。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197967214005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1587662064}
review:
推球遊戲幹嘛買?

+ 類銀河戰士惡魔城?
遊戲載短程的一本道冒險後，很快會解開束縛還你自由。關卡則是用玩家獲得的技能來區隔玩家能到達的地區。完全是銀河戰士惡魔城的遊戲。關卡驅動也讓玩家會因為進入一個新地點感到有趣，讓你想不斷探索挖掘遊戲世界還藏有什麼有趣的秘密。

+ 特殊的遊戲進行方式
這遊戲比較特別的機制就是能操作關卡的擋板把主角或推或射的送到任何角落。整體玩起來滿新鮮的，不管是移動、戰鬥、飛行還是快速通道所有東西都是建立在彈珠檯的設計上。這也跟關卡驅動有很好的契合，會不停對遊戲設計的移動軌跡桿道新奇。

以一個規則創新的冒險遊戲來說非常棒。不過不要把他當成彈珠檯遊戲買來玩，整體彈珠檯的手感還是沒有專門的彈珠檯遊戲好。
 
- 鏡頭設計需要改善
整體比較明顯的缺點是鏡頭，某些地方他們會固定鏡頭讓你真的像是在彈珠檯。但是有的地方我覺得該固定又沒固定，彈珠檯的軌道比較曲折，鏡頭有時一直鎖定主角在移動時會讓人感覺有點暈。在中後期到處找東西的時候不停的移動就會特別有感覺。

打折比便當便宜的時候可以買
推薦給喜歡輕度冒險的玩家
我到底是糞金龜還是瓢蟲我到底是糞金龜還是瓢蟲

author: {'steamid': '76561198054531127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1587741783}

author: {'steamid': '76561198982311027', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1587716730}
review: 打磨时间的好游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198145371540', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1587553883}
review:
一款融入了弹球要素的银河恶魔城类游戏。之前我对这两类游戏的接触不多，也不是很感冒。在体验之前，我并没有对这种新奇的组合抱有很大的期待。主要是看画风还不错，而且打折了也不贵[strike]（喜加一）[/strike]，就入手了。
结果上手体验之后发现真的香。无论是画面、音乐，还是手感都非常棒。我们的主角 Yoku 是一只推着球的小昆虫。[spoiler]没错，就是你想的那种生物。[/spoiler]无论是跑图，做任务，还是打 boss 都要借助弹球这个要素。除了弹球之外，随着剧情的推进还可以解锁一些道具与技能，可以说是比较丰富了。
整个游戏的流程并不算很长，我大概四小时打完剧情，九小时全成就。[spoiler]最后十分钟一直在按喇叭，说多了都是泪。（有个成就要按一千次喇叭）推荐大家平时多按按喇叭，不要像我这样。[/spoiler]游戏难度也不是很大，游戏中的主角并没有血条或者命的概念，掉到坑里的唯一惩罚就是掉一点水果（游戏里的货币）。而跑酷、解密、收集要素的难度也不是太大，后期所有可收集的内容都会在地图上标注，达成全成就还是不大难的。
接下来说说优缺点。除了美术、画面、音乐之外，整个游戏的节奏也比较不错，弹球关卡玩起来非常的爽快。部分解密内容的设计很不错，有一些地方需要用到比较特殊的操作（为了不剧透这里就不举例了）。个人觉得“蜂道”也非常有趣，既融合了弹球的要素，代替了直接传送等老套的方案，也方便了跑图。不过这游戏也存在一些缺点。首先是剧情有些单薄，支线内容少，流程比较短。其次是游戏中还存在着一些小 bug，比如卡住或者视角不切换等问题，不过发生频率不高，只遇到过一两次。最后要吐槽的也还是“蜂道”的设计，虽然蜂道比较有新意，但是除了起点与终点之外，蜂道的中间很少有可以“上车”的位置，导致后期做全成就时跑图会有些麻烦。
综上，整个游戏的设计还是很不错的，推荐体验一下弹球+银河恶魔城这个奇特的组合。原价可以观望一下，14 块就是物超所值，“等等党”的胜利。

review: Completed the game within 13 hours and feel like I got what I hoped for: stylish but fine art, engaging but not too demaning gameplay and satisfying nostalgia after early 90s game concepts involving pinball and metroidvania-style upgrade systems. If you have some free time bu do not want to spend next 50+ hours just to realise you are noting but tired of a game buy Yoku's, you will at least have something you can accomplish and be content about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068386469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1587904435}
review: This game is fuckin' great. If you liked Sonic Spinball back on the Genesis but hated how frustrating that game was, this game is for you. It's cute, it's charming, it's probably a great speedrun. There's objectives and people to find and help and a really big dude to save, but the overall goal of the game seems to be just... vibe out, explore the world, and have fun playing some pinball. If you find it frustrating you're missing the point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144107662', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1587655674}
review:
I reccommend this game to anyone who likes the mixture of a platformer and a simple pinball game. So check the gametrailer to verify if you like the graphics and the gameplay that you see there. Because that's what you get: A bug pushing around a ball -  through a large map gathering stuff and bringing it here and there. Every now and then you'll enter a small, simple pinball section. Nothing too complicated though.
 Controls are well done - I recommend a gamepad, so you can use the shoulderbuttons as pinball-paddle-triggers. But I guess playing it with the keyboard works too.
 Overall style of graphics and music, as well as the story is rather childish, but still is entertaining. There were very few minor bugs (as most physic based 2D-games have them), but for me nothing that lowered the fun in the game. Look out for sales. I bought the game for 4€ and I think it's well worth that money. Even though the game is relatively short. It took me around 7 hours to finish the mainplot and a few hours more to hunt for 100% and all achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999446932', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1587644536}
review: Quelle surprise ! Ce jeu mêle habillement l'univers des Metroidvania et des pinball ! Un pur régal. Tout fonctionne, c'est mignon, c'est entrainant, ni trop long ni trop court. Que demandez de plus ?! Si comme moi vous aimez les jeux mignons, sans prise de tête, qui dépayse alors foncez !

author: {'steamid': '76561198141585132', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1686426986}
review: This game is a pinball-platforming game with metroidvania elements. The arstyle is beautifull and combined with the music and the fluid gameplay this game is a really good experience. The main story  took me [spoiler] 6 hours [/spoiler] to complete, but those hours were hours well spent. Due to it having metroidvania elements, you get upgrades to go to places you couldn't before. Finding and unlocking these upgrades are really fun. and Using them is an absolute blast! If you find this game with a good discount I really  recommend picking it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117471431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1587577670}
review: Très addictif jeu de Pinball (flipper) / plateforme qui sort de l'ordinaire avec histoire intéressante et graphiquement extraordinaire! j'adore! Plusieurs secret partout sur l'île, et upgrade déblocable au cours de l'histoire :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983397248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1587566799}
review:
Bon petit kif avec cet excellent jeu de plate-formes / exploration que je viens de platiner. Un Ori like comme on n'en fait plus, avec une petite dose de flipper.
Avec clairement 2 niveaux de jeu : facile pour celui qui se contentera de terminer l'histoire, mais beaucoup plus tendu pour celui qui cherche à trouver tous les secrets et coffres cachés.
Je recommande !

author: {'steamid': '76561198000689314', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1630853583}
review: I enjoyed the demo, but the full game is just a chore. If you're designing a Metroidvania, it probably shouldn't take your players an hour of tedious roaming around to travel across the map. Especially if your game includes an excessive amount of backtracking. There's a very weak fast travel system, but you can only board and disembark from a handful of places. It's nearly useless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315142259', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1685874258}
review: 以弹球为基础，创意性和游戏性拉满的独立游戏，想了想，甚至不能用小游戏来形容，因为有剧情，支线任务，甚至还有收集要素，其中一些还是很有难度的。一年前在某宝买的KEY，现在想想，血赚！（打折14也血赚！）

author: {'steamid': '76561198931545359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1587961406}
review:
画风很可爱，画面是我玩所有游戏最在意的，音乐也可，boss战的萨克斯加黑嗓真的很棒，峰道的音乐村庄的音乐也很有代入感，地图上的隐藏很多，最惊喜的是认真地把弹球的元素结合进横版过关，boss战也是借助弹球的机制对我而言真的很有新意，弹球喷漆的机制也很惊喜，不小心就变成了草莓，npc都是有自己故事的小动物，有从海滩搬家到雪山的小兔子，为了享受旅途中的音乐在到达之前不说话的猫头鹰，池塘里的猫猫鱼，也有嘴臭人点醒我主角是屎壳郎不是普通甲虫，在他说之前我都觉得甲虫带个石头不是很正常吗？
要说什么缺点就是不能传送，通关后去一个地方也要疯狂m找路，而且都得走一周目时的路弹过去，游戏流程不长，7个小时就能走完主线和雕像和蘑菇的支线还点了六个虫卵，没有任何提示和攻略，我边找柳苗边找蜜蜂服找了一小时了，哦还有喷头，他们到底在哪里QAQ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198398161821', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1587527592}
review:
全成就撒花！弹珠休闲小游戏，意外的好玩，打折血赚。

优点：画风可爱；音乐好听；不断学习新能力，整个流程很有意思；地图很大，设计很巧妙，虽然没有传送，但完成一个区域后能有一些捷径快速回家，各个区域也互相链接，后期学习必要能力后能比较自由地穿梭。

缺点：关卡重复性较高，基本都是一样的弹珠机制，不过游戏更偏向探索，弹珠关卡占比不高；有迷路卡关风险，前期是线性路线还好，后面学了新能力可能需要回到之前走不了的地方，缺少指引就容易迷路；部分支线任务/全收集太难，有一些是脑洞比较大，有一些是藏的太隐蔽，不看指南真的做不出来，主线流程倒是挺简单的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198200229337', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1588316334}
review:
핀볼에 메트로배니아 요소를 결합시킨 신기한 게임.
수집요소도 많고 그래픽과 음악도 이쁘다.

그치만 맵을 돌아다니고 하는게 좀 지루할수도 있다.
그 외에는 이 게임은 정말 잘만들어졌다.

review: 非常有特色的遊戲，主角是一隻小瓢蟲郵差，帶著一顆球作交通工具，在各個場景裡，玩家可以控制場景中的彈珠檯式機關來推動主角的圓球前進與解決任務，並且在類銀河戰士惡魔城式的地圖裡收集道具和解鎖路徑，非常有創意的遊戲模式，畫風很特殊很可愛，劇情推動也很有意思

author: {'steamid': '76561197976761064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1588157312}
review:
The game is innovative and fun. My only issue is, which is a big issue initially, is that controller support and remapping, even with an xbox one controller is a pain. 

This one issue soured my first play of the game. I ordered an 8BitDo Zero 2 controller to play this game with my daughter and had many issues. I had to restart my computer to get it to recognize a controller. Then it didn't map the shoulder buttons. I had to go into big screen mode in order to map them in steam because there are no controller options in game. Even playing with an xbox controller required big picture mode. This is not what I expect from “full controller support.” After you figure out how to setup controller support the game is fun.

Playing the game in big screen mode is not a solution, it is a work around for a poorly designed menu game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448948038', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1637380120}
review: 这游戏也太好玩了吧！！！买之前看评论说是弹球的玩法。之前玩过的PC上的弹球游戏除了三维弹球和snowball就没玩过别的了。弹球游戏给我的感觉是一下子玩时间长了会很无聊。但是这款尤库的小岛速递绝不会让你感到无聊，弹球的玩法直接完美地融入到了地图和剧情中，再配上呆萌的画风和轻松地bgm，让人连着玩几个小时也不会觉得乏味~可玩性非常高~反正我是一口气玩了10多个小时剧情通关加上完成度80%多。真的是我近几个月以来最喜欢的游戏了~

author: {'steamid': '76561198074787550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1587279532}
review:
I recognize that I'm definitely in the minority here, but I find this game beyond tedious and frustrating. Movement around the map is annoying and slow. Simple backtracking and exploration are a crippling chore of exasperation. The pure pinball fields themselves are fun enough, but marrying the same control to the overworld is a misstep, in my opinion. I was on the fence until I unlocked the grappling ability, and that forced it beyond acceptability for me. 

I suppose I'm more of a metroidvania guy than a pinball guy. 

Top notch presentation, atmosphere, and sound though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062640889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1587215046}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973587088', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1593119987}
review: This is a fun, unique pinball meets metroidvania style game. Nice aesthetic style, and entertaining theme mixes well with the lighthearted casual gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128146079', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1586459899}
review:
Estamos ante un indie como nunca antes lo habíais visto. Un metroidvania cuyas bases son el pinball. Difícil de creer ¿no? Bueno pues solo con dos gatillos y un movimiento lateral iremos avanzando sobre esta isla plagada de amigos y no tan amigos.

Como he dicho antes para movernos usaremos los gatillos, uno corresponde al azul y otro al amarillo y cuando veas esos colores sabrás cual debes pulsar para avanzar.

La isla en sí es un nivel completo pero dentro encontramos niveles aislados donde podremos disfrutar de un pinball colorido y PRECIOSO. Claro está que todo esto tiene detrás una historia y somos un escarabajo pelotero que reparte correo.

Nos sitúa en frente de una tormenta y nuestro protagonista tendrá que sobrevivir hasta llegar a dicha isla, donde el anterior cartero se pira (supongo que para jubilarse, repartir correo en una isla, ¡es duro!).

Encontraremos misiones secundarias, ayudar a los diferentes habitantes y razas, encontrar caminos secretos, usar poderes que encontramos conforme avanzamos para regresar a zonas donde no llegábamos, coleccionables...

Mientras nos acompaña una música que pese a que no destaca es suficiente para meterte en este mundo de lleno. En cuanto a la duración, pasarnos la "historia" nos llevará alrededor de 5h y el 100% supongo que otras 5, nada mal para lo que ofrece. Incluidos bosses.

En mi opinión pese a que la historia pues bueno, no me apasiona solo el hecho de ver diferentes zonas y poder jugar al pinball sabiendo que no es un pinball si no que es un juego completo ya hace que merezca la pena. Siente la fantasía de ser un cartero en una isla llena de aventuras. Gracias por leer! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198028032455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1587128097}
review: When you get every single achievement in the game and still haven't had enough of it, I guess it means something.  Looks great, sounds great, plays great. 9/10 instead of 10 just because it could be longer and a little more challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252373268', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1587111253}
review:
Na początku byłem zachwycony, prosta mechanicznie gra, która w przyjemny sposób przeniosła flipery w nowy wiek z piękną kolorową oprawą. Niestety, ale wszystko poza samymi etapami fliperowymi jest rozwiązane tragicznie. Poruszanie się po niektórych częściach mapy jest proste i nie ma z tym większych problemów, ale żeby dostać się do niektórych miejsc trzeba okrążyć całą mapą i to nawet po zdobyciu części umiejętności, a część dodatkowych mechanik wymaga idealnej celności. Kręcisz się niesamowicie szybko i musisz się puścić w idealnym momencie, bo w innym przypadku przez 50 sekund będziesz wracał, bo spadłeś w przepaść.

Odnajdujesz jakiś sekret, a tu okazuje się, że do jego odblokowania potrzebujesz dodatkowych owoców lub przedmiotu z nie wiadomo skąd. Wiele zadań na mapie nie jest oznaczonych i trzeba się domyślać, gdzie trzeba się udać na podstawie dwóch linijek tekstu. Postać ma dużą bezwładność i często się ześlizgiwałem z powierzchni, na której jeszcze przed chwilą wchodziłem bez problemu.

Jednak rzeczą, która zniszczyła grę całkowicie w moich oczach był błąd, który uniemożliwił mi jej kontynuowanie. Powróciłem po jakimś czasie na most, który zbudowałem w pierwszej godzinie swojej rozgrywki, żeby kontynuować wątek fabularny po zbieraniu przedmiotów kolekcjonerskich z poprzednich lokacji. A tu niespodzianka, most nie podtrzymuje mnie przez co spadam w przepaść. Pomimo, że wygląda na naprawiony i mam wielki fragment mapy odsłonięty po jego drugiej stronie. Postać obok niego wczytuje dialog, że wymaga ode mnie przedmiotu, który już jej wcześniej dałem. Nie mam pojęcia, jak mogło się to stać.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431500820', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1710092059}
review:
J'ETAIS SCEPTIQUE... AVANT DE DEVENIR ACCRO !

Le premier truc que j'ai pensé quand j'ai découvert la page Steam de ce jeu c'est "ouais, bof, c'est juste un flipper avec des graphismes poétiques et charmeurs pour attirer le client, rien d'extraordinaire..." Mais ça c'était AVANT d'y jouer.

Au lieu d'un bête flipper enjolivé, j'ai été conquis dès la première partie par la poésie non pas juste de graphismes mais de tout un univers vraiment vraiment agréable à parcourir, avec la bande son bien relaxante qui va avec, un monde riche en détails et en poésie dans lequel le flipper est incrusté astucieusement et à ma connaissance de façon inédite. Le jeu est soigné aux petits oignons, même si je l'ai acheté en soldes à pas cher il vaut l'investissement si on considère la qualité malgré une durée de vie annoncée un peu courte, de toute façon le jeu sera toujours trop court pour moi tellement je l'aime, c'est une agréable surprise et... un vrai coup de coeur !

author: {'steamid': '76561198042973026', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1591071282}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
This game features a mix of platforming and pinball. I knew this going into the game, but I was still amazed at just how well the game integrated the two and made it smooth. The focus is largely on the pinball mechanics and Yoku’s Island Express executes it extremely well. I’m not very adept at pinball, but I was able to pick it up rather easy. You are a happy little dung beetle with a… not really a dung ball but a round ball nevertheless, and you are the new postmaster. The whole postmaster thing is kinda on the back burner for most of the game but counts towards achievements and gives you upgrades. Yoku’s Island Express uses fruit as a currency to purchase items/upgrades/or other things to help you progress. The amount of fruit you are able to get is pretty substantial given most bumpers drop fruit when you hit them and they will reset after going to a different part of the map.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
Yoku’s Island Express can be played with both keyboard and controller. The game will transition easy between the two. For the keyboard, it uses the arrow keys and the two shift keys (like pinball has done previously on the PC). For the Xbox controller, it uses the triggers and the left stick. I found that I preferred the controller. Each pinball…lever?.. has one of two colors, blue or yellow that are controlled by different keys or triggers. Some of the levers will have both colors meaning either can be used.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
As stated above, there are two colors blue and yellow. I did not see an option for colorblindness unfortunately, so bear that in mind. One thing I noticed that I was rather surprised by is that the resolution change in the menu is instant. I didn’t realize it at first as I was expecting a confirmation box or flicker of the screen. Nope. Instant. Done. That being said, I believe it defaulted to 1080p, and I run 1440p, so I had to switch to “Desktop” resolution. As for in game visuals. They are pretty good. The colors are great, the animations are fluid, and the environment looks amazing.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
I really enjoy the background music. I felt it fit the locations extremely well. However, some places, especially the starting area, you can tell the music is looping and it can get a little old. Mostly in the starting area that because you are spending a fair amount of time there learning the ropes.
As for sounds, I thought they were responsive to the task being performed. Additionally, there are minor background noises that add to the feel of the game. Your little dung beetle also makes noises as he/she gets flung all around the map. The languages used for races are different and fit characters well in my opinion.

[h1]Miscellaneous[/h1]
I found that the hardest bits were the non-storyline objectives. The difficulty for the storyline was challenging, yet forgiving. There were also quite a few funny moments for me as a result of my mistakes, usually involving me launching myself into the sky. 

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Yoku’s Island Express surprised me with how well it executed its mechanics. I found that I preferred to use the controller over the keyboard, which is great that it has the functionality. I rather enjoyed the world and was generally impressed by the game’s visuals and audio it presented in the game. Overall, I would definitely recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198087730263', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1586509820}
review:
An awesome little game, family friendly and a blast to play.

This is a great take on pinball, a pinball metroidvania. It works surprisingly well but suffers from mixing geners where the scope of the game outweighs the gameplay. It's neither a great pinball game nor the best metroidvanina but is OK in both styles.

The upgrades and progression is fun and keeps thing moving while the pinball segments add a bit of skill and luck to combat. 

The art, sound and animation is some of the best i've seen and that makes this game flow so well, mixed with a simpler gameplay this is a really good couch game. A great one to settle into on a rainy day and flick those triggers.

Highly recommended at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340847703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1585842018}
review:
Genre: 
-Metroidvania pinball hybrid

Fit for me:
-Love metroidvanias, tolerate pinball games so decent fit

Pros:
-Adorable aesthetic w/ lots of bright colors and endearing npcs 
-Really solid world building w/ tons of places to explore.  You are rewarded w/ tons of fun secrets for exploring every nook and cranny.
-Nice quality of life options like the beeline which is a creative fast travel that matches the world perfectly
-Good balance between exploration and pinball sections.  It sounds strange on paper, but works really well in practice.  
-The pinball sections are really fun, and are kind of like puzzle sections w/ a really well crafted pinball mechanic to play
-The boss fights are another highlight

Cons:
-This is on the easier side in terms of overall challenge 
-Movement feels odds at first until you get used to the mechanics
-It would be nice if it were a tad longer as it can be beaten in 6-7 hrs
-This seems obvious, but if you don't like pinball, you probably won't like this game
-Before unlocking beelines, backtracking can feel slow and tedious

Thoughts:
-Yoku's Island Express is a solid game and one that I didn't even have on my radar.  The metroidvania elements are much better than I expected, and the pinball mechanics are very responsive and user friendly.  There isn't much of a learning curve so you won't be challenged a ton in this one, and that's ok, as long as you know that going in.  It reminds me of Steamworld Dig quite a bit, w/ a tad of Ori and the Blind Forrest thrown in there. This is a fun, stressfree game that will get overlooked b/c of the pinball sections, but don't let that stop you from experiencing a really cool metroidvania pinball hybrid.

Consensus:
-Solid Game (Tier 3 and makes up 35% of my reviews).  I had a good time playing this, and I'm looking forward to more metrovania hybrids in the future.  If you like metroidvanias, and even have the slightest interest in pinball games, give this one a try.  I snagged it during a sale for $5, and this game is absolute steal at that price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005341943', 'num_games_owned': 1554, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1585726494}
review:
Creo que alguien se cayó en el caldero del ácido lisérgico destinado a eventos masivo-lúdico-festivos porque es una combinación de elementos de lo mas peculiar, desde la musica hasta los sonidos, pasando por las habilidades del personaje, como se controla e incluso el mundo en el que se desenvuelve y los seres que lo habitan.

Ahora bien, a pesar de que los primeros 5 minutos de juego no he salido de mi asombro (y estoy seguro de que mis ojos estaban tan abiertos como mi boca), no quita que tiene su encanto. Como juego casual, es de los que, ademas de presentar una jugabilidad distinta a los demás juegos, todas las peculiariadades del mismo hacen que sea algo tan extravagante como "fresco" y hace que te pida mas. Para los niños... muy "familly friendly"

No es un triple A, esta clarísimo, pero para ser el juego casual al que jugar de vez en cuando, cumple y con buena nota.

PD: Es un plataformas que no es un plataformas y es un pinball que tampoco es un pinball al 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198091989299', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1585701370}
review: So I'll start by just saying I was not expecting to really like this game and it would just be a filler to take a break from all the fps games my friends want to play. To my surprise tho I ended up finishing the game in two days over two sessions. The game includes a great colourful world with lots of charming characters that give out quests and puzzles for you to complete and explore. The music and sound design are also well done, I ended up playing through without my own music which is a rarity for me nowadays. At no point did I ever really feel stuck on a puzzle or forced to go do any one thing, you are free to explore the island however you see fit as most key items are unlocked fairly early in the story. The game play never really got dull as new mechanics are introduces at a nice pace. You'll get about 8-11 hours of game play for a 95-100% run. I do hope we see a sequel soon from the team with an even bigger world to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985077214', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1585694395}
review:
Excellent metroidvania if you like pinball mechanics. Obviously it's not a pinball simulator, but it's a great mix with 2D platforming.
It's not a difficult game, and it can be good for some people that aren't that much into games and just want to have a bit of fun, good way to introduce games to friends as well.
I never complete 100% of a game, and this one has been a blast to fully finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994465195', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1585761274}
review: Прекрасная игра, безумный микс из метроидвании и пинбола, в меру доступная, но в тоже время достаточно хардкорная. Прошел с удовольствием в это тревожное вирусное время и здорово поднимает настроение.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987271034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1585658888}
review: Seichte kurzweilige Unterhaltung, nette Musik ein Spiel zum Entspannen. Die Herausforderungen / Rätsel halten sich in Grenzen, wer Spaß an einfachen Flippern hat und auch gerne Sidescroller spielt, findet hier genau das richtig. 5- 10 EUR sind ein guter Preis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119884940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1585628318}
review:
I love metroidvanias and YIE was a delight. If I were to compare it to other games in the genre that have been released in the last few years, it is far more whimsical than Hollow Knight or even Ori and is more in-line with the relaxing gameplay of Wuppo. Very few "enemies" let's you sit back and enjoy exploring an island.

Most collectibles are easily acquired. There are a few collectibles locked behind some moderately tricky platforming mini-challenges which can be frustrating, but by no means the hardest platforming out there.

My biggest issue was that sometimes I wished I could move faster or that level layout allowed me to travel to the locations I wanted to faster, but it was already a shorter game so this was not a huge gripe.

Playtime to get 100% completion (with all achievements) was about 9-12 hours, dependent on how quickly you pick up the pinball mechanics and how used to exploratory games.

If you like metroidvanias, relaxing platformers, pinball, or just unique games, I would recommend. If you get frustrated easily or hate pinball, then I do not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982817228', 'num_games_owned': 3196, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1585497828}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is an absolute delight of a game. The visuals are bright and fun and the story is entertaining enough to keep the player engaged. Whoever came up with the idea of adding pinball mechanics into a metroidvania is quite possibly a genius. 

The only criticism I would have of the game is the music. It has a real earworm quality to it, and you may find yourself humming the tune even when you're not playing it. I for one really enjoyed the music, but others might not appreciate the earworming that goes on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057061079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1612471001}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076262186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1585485042}
review:
J'ai fini le jeu à 100% et je le conseil. Il est vraiment bien, un petit jeu d'aventure pas dur, aucune mort possible, il est donc accessible pour tous. Au début j'ai été rebuté par l'aspect flipper du jeu, mais on s'y habitue vite et ça devient vraiment fun. Je crois avoir fini l'histoire en 8h et l'intégralité des succès en 12h sans guide.

Terminé el juego al 100% y lo recomiendo. Es realmente bueno Un pequeño juego de aventuras no difícil, sin muerte posible, por lo que es accesible para todos. Al principio me desanimó el aspecto pinball del juego, pero te acostumbras rápidamente y se vuelve muy divertido. Creo que terminé la historia en 8 horas y todo el juego en 12 horas sin guía

author: {'steamid': '76561198040726040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1585779078}
review: Yoku's Island Express is a surprisingly good game: gameplay is fun, graphics are stellar, music is enjoyable, and the story is cute and teaches morals while not even attempting to preach. I finished a lot of the game in 6 hours, so it's not overly long but there's some replay valuable in completing side quests. Did I mention that this game is fast and simple pinball? Oh it's a pinball rpg adventure platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995491691', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1636148893}
