author: {'steamid': '76561197980474745', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1565660654}
review: As You probably know already, Yoku's Island Express is a mix of metroidvania and pinball. I must admit - I hadn't play pinball game in years, but I enjoyed this one more than I expected!  There's cool fast travel system and map design, catchy music (including usage of ukulele and ocarina) and rather relaxing gameplay (there are no deaths). If You enjoy metroidvanias/platformers, give Yoku a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198277422462', 'num_games_owned': 1981, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1642434379}
review: 三维弹球可爱重制版

author: {'steamid': '76561198062030119', 'num_games_owned': 1986, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1565638382}
review:
I'm in my mid-thirties, and I sometimes long for games that suck me in like I'm a child again. This game did just that. It's light-hearted, its presentation is cute and creative, it feels polished and is just outright fun to play. The game left me wanting more, but that's not to say it's too short. It simply doesn't overstay its welcome. There's a bit of back-tracking, but there are shortcuts to discover and the beeline-fast-travel takes care of most of the distances, so it didn't really became an issue for a game of this length.

On the gameplay side, I feel it leans a bit on the casual side: the pinball mechanics are relatively simple, the metroidvania aspects are lightweight, a lot of it consists of fetch quests, it's not a difficult game, etc. Yet, all of it is fused into a fun island to explore through platforming, and tied together with a good main story and a bunch of fun, optional side quests.

This game is a typical example of the quote "the whole is greater than the sum of its parts". Well done Villa Gorilla, I'm really looking forward to see what you will come up with next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017033103', 'num_games_owned': 1426, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1590131713}
review: Take metroidvania-style progress and exploration, replace platforming with flippers and bumpers and boss fights with small pinball tables - and you are up for a pleasant and chill experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964410359', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1565674299}
review:
Un jeu mignon tout plein qui apporte un peu de fraicheur dans le monde du metroidvania en y ajoutant le gameplay du flipper.

Quelques sacrifices sont fait sur la jouabilité pour réussir à marier les deux mondes, mais dans l'ensemble c'est plutôt réussi et on prend plaisir à explorer le monde de Yoku.

Pas mal de collectionite sur la fin pour les chasseurs d'achievements, compter <5H pour un playthrough rapide, et <10H pour un 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075202999', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1685036949}
review:
pinball platformer 
my only gripes are that the sound effects are obnoxious and that it can be a little slow paced because it includes all the follies of modern platformers with the backtracking and whathaveyou
for better and occasionally for worse this game is basically exactly what it promises to be
don't expect to be impressed, just expect to have some fun

also it has the greatest final boss music ever

author: {'steamid': '76561198313457683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1566088145}
review: Muy buen juego tipo metrolvania ambientado en pinball ,,juego recomendado sin dudarlo

author: {'steamid': '76561197998220526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1565648147}
review: I had a lot of fun playing this. Was a nice little unique take on a platformer. Graphics and soundtrack were charming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006795753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1565260986}
review: Interesting take on the metroidvania mechanics. Wasn't sure if I'd like the pinball game play sections, but I find it to be a unique, if somewhat frustrating experience. Lovely art style and musical score to complement a solid game experience... just wish it was a little longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086301021', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1698438446}
review:
Incredibly charming game, nice pinball movement. Clever use of pinball mechanics for gating movement and for boss fights. Highly recommend.

Only wish I could bump the table.

Works fine in Proto 4.2-9, just a bit of tearing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020754824', 'num_games_owned': 2147, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1587025665}
review: Egy játék, ami arról szól, hogy a bogár görgeti a golyóját. És flipperezik is vele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074499949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1565621311}
review: A great game! Artstyle and game remind me of Ori and the Blind Forest but with a pinball twist, some parts are annoying to go through because you need good timing. But overall a very solid game and I highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092321352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1565618842}
review:
ピンボールに失敗してボールを落としてしまうとダメージを受ける（体力兼所持金であるフルーツが少しだけ減る）要素はあるものの、すぐに取り戻せる。
全編を通してのんびり遊べる作品。
新しく行けるようになった場所や取り逃したアイテムを目指して島中を移動することも考えられており、このジャンルとしてはユーザフレンドリーと言える。
とはいえ特に上り坂での移動速度があまり速くなかったり、バンパーで弾かれ続けて待ち時間が生まれたりするのが少し気になった。
メインストーリーのクリアまで6時間程度なので我慢できるが、これは上記の待ち時間がストレスにならないぎりぎりの尺かもしれない。

author: {'steamid': '76561197964819424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1565491786}
review: Excellent for the first hour, the next several hours will be exactly, and I mean exactly the same.  Over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again in those same little areas until for some reason you move into a new set of "yes you guess it"  more over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again in those same little areas until for some reason you move into a new set of "yes you guess it" more over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again in those same little areas until for some reason you move into a new set of "yes you guess it"  more over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again in those same little areas until for some reason you move into a new set of "yes you guess it" more over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again in those same little areas until for some reason you move into another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970326908', 'num_games_owned': 1470, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1565613983}
review: Ein wunderschönes Metroidvania-Abenteuer mit interessanter Flipper-Mechanik, netter Story, liebevoll animierten Charakteren und clever gestalteter Spielwelt. Absolute Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009233716', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1565736221}
review: Beautiful artwork, fun mechanics, and a surprisingly compelling story for a pinball platformer, this game has been an enjoyable ride. The music is matched perfectly, and I don't have any complaints about this one. I would recommend this to anyone who likes platformers, and think it could even be played with kids, given the story and style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992459465', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1565611608}
review: A metroidvania pinball game!?

author: {'steamid': '76561198007479564', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1565533177}
review: The strangeness of the concept, a pinball metroidvania, made me give it a try and boy am I glad I did. What a cute gem it is with unique gameplay, I did not realize pinball could be this addicting. The metroidvania aspect of the game is quite lightly implemented, but well executed. Overall style was top notch and difficutly (for a pinball noob) was pleasing. Relaxing game to play laid-back with a controller. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970615671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1635079164}
review: Platformer meets Pinball.  Interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997880630', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1565426516}
review: If the phrase "Pinballvania" sounds like fun. Get it, it's amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971786004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1565466450}
review: Beautiful, and certainly an interesting concept. But I can't recommend it as I don't really like the pinball mechanics and the pits where you have to unlock your exit are quite annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071911974', 'num_games_owned': 1811, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1565378942}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a pinball metroidvania.
If your reaction to this is [i]how?[/i], my answer is: [b]yes[/b].
It really works.

Play as new postman Yoku as he explores the delightfully charming world of Mokumana Island, finding many secrets, helping many inhabitants and gaining new powers along the way to explore even more places.

The pinballing can get slightly annoying when a lot of precision is required, but it never got too bad. A few of the collectibles are a bit unintuitive to reach.  

Those are basically my only "complaints". The game really is a lot of fun. It has a demo as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006831238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1565327447}
review: cute explorey dungbeetle pinball simulator. pretty short. prettty. wish there was more. kinda surprised there haven't been more games like this? pinball platformer things...

author: {'steamid': '76561198051372333', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1651262172}
review: One of the best games I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966076599', 'num_games_owned': 2908, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1565389165}
review:
Nettes Spiel, für einen entspannten Abend - vorausgesetzt, dass man das Art-Design & Spielprinzip mag. Ich persönlich finde die Mischung aus Plattformer, Physik-Rätseln & Flipper (!) sehr originell und überraschend gut gelungen bzw. umgesetzt. Glaube, ich hatte während der gesamten Spielzeit ein Lächeln im Gesicht (auch wenn diese vergleichsweise kurz war / ca. 6 Stunden für die Hauptgeschichte und einige Nebenaufgaben, gefühlt ca. 80-90% des Spiels).

Wer eine Herausforderung sucht, wie z.B. bei Ori, wird hier allerdings enttäuscht, da das Spiel doch recht einfach ist (das Spiel ist ab 6 Jahren...). Mich stört das nicht - im Gegenteil. Keine Frustmomente, kein Trial & Error. etc., einfach nur ein unterhaltsames Spiel für "Zwischendurch".

Technisch gibt es ebenfalls nichts auszusetzen. Keine Bugs, gute Sounduntermalung, netter Soundtrack & zum Genre passende Grafik/Animationen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964454963', 'num_games_owned': 1453, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1657230295}
review:
Yoku's island express is short but sweet, I've only clocked 5 hours or so and finished the base game but there still seems to few more hours of extra content available for completionists. 
At full price it's a bit expensive for the game length, but i'd say it's well worth it at sale price.

My only gripe is that movement around the map can feel quite slow at times (more beeline stations please), and gating everything with ingame money but providing very few ways to farm it, feels like a bit of an artificial time pad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174542429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1630542347}
review: Lovely, just lovely game. Reminds me of Sonic and has heavily taken inspiration from Pinball. Sometimes frustrating but it's not THAT kind of frustration: you can keep your mental stability and are somewhat willing to continue, which is why this game is excellent for relaxing, especially if you want to immerse yourself into a little childish but heartwarming storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983552514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1565355087}
review: Fun twist on a pinball concept. Cute artwork and fun characters. Can be quite challenging i like it. Maybe not at 22$ CAN but get it on sale for sure if you like pînball only tho. Got it in my Humble Bundle last month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006509182', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1565905111}
review: This is the kind of game we need indie scene for. A marriage of pinball game and a metroidvania? I could never come up with something this weird. And it works so well. Fresh, fun, polished. Highly reccomended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974664172', 'num_games_owned': 1509, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1614503119}
review: how this game didnt get more press when it released baffles me. it's so charming and fun. not one complaint aside from wishing there was even more content. 100% recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198016315992', 'num_games_owned': 1765, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1565314759}
review: I got this in the humble bundle and read it's a mix of pinbal elements with metroidvania and had to try it out, because I couldn't imagine how this would even work and....it just does. It's super fun, innovative, the pinball mechanics work perfectly with the metroidvania setup, the design is nice and the music is chill. Got all achievements in 17 hours and had a good time, so it's worth the price too! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198081137858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1565743257}
review:
The best Pop Cap game that isn't from Pop Cap
Great Indie that is up there with Transistor for very different reasons
If you like the style and pinball, get it

author: {'steamid': '76561198016192337', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1565296030}
review: Ok, tak tohle sem fakt nečekal. Pinball a Metroidvania je úplně geniální kombinace. Hrozně chill hra, jestli se vám to nějakým omylem objeví v knihovně, tak doporučuju aspoň vyzkoušet. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197979102512', 'num_games_owned': 2241, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1569944281}
review:
Maybe the jolliest metroidvania out there,
If the thought of pinballing yourself around a map seems annoying to you, stay clear. 
If not this will be an interesting take on a 2D platformer and a nice progression of the adventure/pinball subgenre

author: {'steamid': '76561198071932570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1565287401}
review: I had a lot of fun during my 16 hours of gameplay. Some of the challenges made me struggle a bit, but I managed completed all achievements except the one required "activate all scarabs". I like how the game offers in-game trackers(they were not hard to obtain in end-game) which were a great help on achievement hunting. I hope scarabs tracker was available too.  The story was fun and full of surprises.  Music was alright, and I strongly recommend using a controller to play.  I would recommend this game to a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960388853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1565283040}
review:
There is pretty much nothing bad to say about this excellent adventure/arcade/puzzle game, where pinball (PINBALL!), is the main gameplay mechanism, which sounds weird but works like a charm. The music is relaxing, the puzzles are not difficult and story and side missions are simple, but still quite interesting. There is no way to die in the game, making it very easy on the nerves as there is no way you can fail.

You can perfect the game in about 8-10 hours and you really don't need any guides as things are quite simple. You will find maps for all the collectibles and once you note how the secrets work, they are quite easy to find.

Highly recommended!

PS. The Juice Master trial can be repeated if you fail it at the first attempt, just wait for the latter part of the game to unlock the paint mechanism.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960781983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1568183471}
review: Unique mix between a metroidvania and pinball. The combination works really well and has a decent amount of content, especially if you go for 100%. Great music, artwork, and gameplay. If you like metroidvanias or pinball, definitely check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088429378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1565234394}
review: This has been a very nice find. It is a cross between an adventure platform game and pinball. The graphics are nicely stylized. The game play has been straight forward and fun.   I can see my self spending some time on this game in my down time just relaxing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041702418', 'num_games_owned': 1224, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1575252140}
review: Beautiful, adorable, great soundtrack, and a combination of gameplay styles that work surprisingly well.

review: Really fresh game with platformer and pinball mechanics, all in one package - totally recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068880320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1565185593}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996717230', 'num_games_owned': 3649, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1565145017}
review: Juego preciosista por donde se lo mire, maravillosos gráficos,  música genial, una historia divertidísima y original forma de controlar a nuestro pequeño héroe. Una obra maestra de Team 17

author: {'steamid': '76561198135296159', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1565135151}
review: It's like the future of pinball.  I like it.  A lot.  Sound track is catchy too... makes for great background noise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1565125020}
review:
Yoku's Island Express ist die perfekte Mischung aus Pinball und Metrovania. Das Spiel ist recht offen gestaltet, sodass man immer das Gefühl hat selber entscheiden zu können wo man gerade weiter spielen möchte. Im Unterschied zu den meisten Spielen war Yoku's Island Express auch nicht zu lang. Gerne hätte ich noch 2-3 Stunden weiter gespielt. Aber man soll ja aufhören, wenn es am meisten Spaß macht.

Jeder der etwas mit Pinball anfangen kann, sollte sich diesen Titel einmal anschauen.

5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198011939858', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1588318627}
review:
One of the most enjoyable casual games I've ever played.
I can happily spend hours paddling away.
Recommended for people who grew up on web games and idle fun.
This is a fully fleshed out, low-story, high-puzzle chilled-ass game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167772276', 'num_games_owned': 5521, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 3146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1681955961}
review:
A brilliant game for all ages. When the credits roll it isn't over really as you've still side missions to complete and secrets to find. Can be frustrating in some sections but has lot of save points all over the map to reload and try again. If you like this genre it is a must play.

Playing with controller is recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127133011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 343, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1565102725}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990843742', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1565052305}
review:
Bardzo fajne połączenie platformówki i pinballa. Muzyka, efekty dźwiękowe i styl graficzny tworzą niesamowicie przyjemną w odbiorze całość. Naprawdę miły i odprężający tytuł :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006932908', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1565052957}
review: Fun pinball metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106686297', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1565126604}
review:
I like this game its unique gameplay (pinball + platformer) makes it quite fun.

Unfortunately in the 4 hours I played the game crashed 3 times just like that, closing itself without saving, which is quite frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108852006', 'num_games_owned': 9335, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1565280380}
review: What a pretty little gem :) Granted you have to like pinball games at least to a certain degree, but then you are in for a (rather short) ride. I was also quite unsure if the words 'Metroidvania' and 'pinball' go together and as it turns out they actually do! The presentation is really polished and there's so much to discover in this open-world pinball adventure that even after the main story is over you might want to stick around for more. Wholeheartedly recommended and way to go Team17!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077270879', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1565014587}
review: pinball on the next level

author: {'steamid': '76561198157033582', 'num_games_owned': 4149, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1565852256}
review:
Get it. YES. All ages pinball and platform mechanics, with good progression and story. Great soundtrack always brings a smile.

Update 08/19:
I have finally completed everything in this game and after seeing the wickerling ending can't wait for the flying ancient to create more islands and drop me there as the new postmaster!! 
I need a sequel....

This is a thoroughly enjoyable puzzle platformer with pinball mechanics. I found the play style of this game a little strange until I realised it was a simple 2D platformer where the jump button had been replaced by flippers in the environment. I started off pretty slow trying to complete as much of each section as I went until it became apparent that the best strategy was to quickly open up all the areas and quests because there is plenty of opportunity to revisit places; this is in fact what the story makes you do.
The game is a large 2D platforming world with various checkpoints and thankfully a quick travel system. Around this semi-seamless world are areas which taken on a pinball theme in a various locked sections that require you to complete an objective to escape or defeat a boss. It is fun and family friendly with a catchy island themed song I find myself humming hours later. Can't complain about the price and had it on my wish list when Humble made it one of their JUL/AUG19 mystery drops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328050707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1580569446}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198105445916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1564981462}
review:
As much as I want to recommend this game, there are just too many glaring issues that prevent it from being great. The main one is in its Metroidvania style. There is a lack of direction on what to do next, no clarity on how to overcome specific obstacles, and WAY TOO MUCH BACKTRACKING. 

This doesn't even include the collectables part of the game; you will be retreading on land you've already visited hundreds of times as the quests constantly send you back and forth to provide padding for the game. That's not content, it's just annoying.

Another issue is the game's repetitive nature. Yoku has you go from one place to another to... 1) talk to someone; 2) learn they want something in return for their help; 3) travel further; 4) and then play a pinball table to complete the task. Rinse and repeat. This formula is so generic.

The final issue is the fact that you can't die (or 'lose your balls') in Yoku. It's insulting in this kind of game, and it honestly makes the game too safe. There's nothing to worry about. For instance, it's impossible to lose a boss fight, no matter how long it takes.

Yoku is right down the middle in terms of score - a 5/10. While its visuals and music are fantastic, and its characters have potential, the gameplay is just too flawed to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985067247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1564975713}
review: Great game, pleasant atmosphere, killer music. Game is real easy to get a feel for and super smooth to play.  Played almost three hours and I may be more than halfway done though!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971589982', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1564971255}
review:
The game is generally lots of fun. It's like sonic spinball but better. 
I do have some qualms though. 

I couldn't collect all the wickerlings until I dropped into the boss pit. that was annoying. I had to watch the end credits of the game, go back into the game, complete the thing with the wickerlings and then watch the end credits again. that is not my idea of  reward. why they decided to punish me for playing the game, I do not know. 

Then there is the frustration of the pinball elements. for a game that is so heavily based on pinball elements, it needed to be better. there were many situations as the game moved towards the end, where the angles i had to hit seemed to happen arbitrarily. it seemed like I had to get lucky to get the right angle in order to succeed. and it was punishing when you didn't get it right too. too many times I was sent down two or three screens into the drain and I was getting very angry because it's the kind of situation where you feel like the game is unfair. if it was my fault, I'd own it, but it does not seem that way. that didn't happen all the time though so I can just about let it go. 

There is enough good stuff in the game to make it worthwhile so I'm recommending it, but be patient and expect to be short changed on a few occasions.

review: Výborný nápad, jak osvěžit žánr "metroidvania" - namíchat plošinkovku s pinballem! Hrál jsem už hodně plošinkovek a většinou mě odpudí dětinská grafika, Island Express má ale příjemný animovaný styl a letní atmosféru, kterou dobře doplňuje hudba (dostal mě padouchův splašený saxofon ve stylu Angela Badalamentiho). Doufám, že bude pokračování, mám totiž hrozně rád pinball :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040892359', 'num_games_owned': 3008, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1564897626}
review:
[h1]Not for me. Pinball designs and physics are horrible[/h1]

I have played A LOT of pinball in my time, both real and video. I love (most) tables on Pinball FX. This game has horrible pinball physics. I mean horrible. You'll hit some "manual bumpers" that are set to barely push you up, but the impact looks as if it should move you like any other one. The little pinball areas are designed so badly that I wished it would have just skipped them altogether. But if they were all you'd have is the platforming... which is just you pushing a ball around and looking for those weird bumper things.

The game is cute I guess... I mean, it has a good art style, although I think it's a little too "off" to me. I can't really explain it. I like that painted, watercolor look in something like Life is Strange but it's not as good here. The music is ok as well, and I loved when the title screen appears in the game when you get shot up through the trees. 

In the end, this is probably not a "bad game." It seems to have high production value. From a pinball perspective it's not good... not good at all.  There was another review that said, "What if pinball was less fun?" I agree with that. If I wanted to play pinball I'd load up a well designed table on Pinball FX and also get great pinball physics. This game just doesn't do pinball justice, and since so much of the game is based around the pinball gimmick it just doesn't really work.

This was on my wishlist forever and ended up getting it in a Humble Monthly. I'm glad, because I would have been pissed at myself if I actually paid money for it. I would not recommend this to anyone, as it is not fun. But check out a YouTube video, maybe it's for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979943032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1691907137}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961609630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1564794621}
review:
굉장히 쫀쫀한 맛이 느껴지는 웰메이드 핀볼게임이다.
핀볼보드의 구성자체가 매트로베니아 특유의 구성과 잘 어우러저 있는게 매력이다.
온갖 수집요소도 잔뜩 있으니 취향만 맞는다면 제작자가 전달하고자 했던 자잘한 재미들을 온전히 느낄 수 있을 것이다.
본인 취향에는 안맞아 짧게 플레이를 해봤지만 그럼에도 불구하고 정말 디테일하게 잘만들었다는 걸 느낄 수 있게 해줬다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122607176', 'num_games_owned': 8397, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1564727653}
review: 虫呐就都不知道，自己就不可以预料。一只虫的命运啊，当然要靠自我奋斗，但是也要考虑到历史的行程，我绝对不知道，我作为一个邮政局长怎么把我选到莫库玛那岛去了，所以前任局长翼龙同志同我讲话，说“三长老都决定了，你来打败弑神者拯救岛民”，我说另请高明吧。我实在我也不是谦虚，我一个屎壳郎怎么就能拯救小岛了呢？你们这样会不会有一种亲腚的感觉。但是呢，翼龙同志讲“大家已经研究决定了”，所以后来我就念了两首诗，叫“苟全性命于小岛，不求闻达于神蛋”，所以我就到了莫库玛那。

author: {'steamid': '76561198093219141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1564833349}
review:
yoku's island express is for me a innovative 2d-pinball sidescroller with nice enviroment where u slip in the role of a dung beetle. In this beautiful world u will meet a lot of strange creatures, which are giving u strange tasks !!! It makes really fun exploring the world and the game always stays fair !

great game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198048973994', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1596517124}
review:
IMPRESIONANTE!
Este es un juego que se sale de lo clásico, aquí no hay combate, ni muerte, tienes acertijos bien trabajados. El protagonista no salta, solo se puede mover a la izquierda y derecha, para "saltar" necesitas hacer uso de bumpers de pinball, así como para desplazarte a través del mundo.
Es interesante como mezclaron el clásico metroidvania con el pinball, además de la música y el arte tan impresionante. La historia encaja con el mundo que crearon y si bien  no es lo mejor del juego, logra atrapar tu atención y ver que es lo que va a suceder **LIGERO SPOILER** no esperaba que dieran un twist al final. 
Definitivamente un juego que sigo disfrutando, pues aunque terminé la historia principal, aun me falta terminar todas las quest de los demás personajes, y se que volveré a este juego.
Si te gustan de este tipo de juegos, no puedo dejar de recomendar tambien el juego Wuppo, y por supuesto la serie Trine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990103145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1563662612}
review:
I give it an A+
Definitely worth a buy if you see it on sale.
( I got it for $5, I would pay pay up to 15, 25 seems a bit steep to me)

Its not a very hard or long game, its more of an enjoyable experience. 
Its good for a change of pace or just some super casual gaming.
The pinball mechanics are fairly smooth and it has a bit of a story to go with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330300970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1631356739}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962923398', 'num_games_owned': 853, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1563143866}
review:
Un jeu original qui mélange flipper et exploration/plateforme.

9h de jeu pour finir l'histoire principale et récolter un bon nombre de trucs. J'y ai passé un excellent moment: le monde est magnifique, le gameplay vraiment chouet, notamment les phases de flipper, très réussies. On débloque de nouvelles "compétences" au fur et à mesure du jeu pour varier les plaisirs et débloquer de nouvelles zones.

Le jeu est bourré de zones secrètes et de trucs à collecter, un peu trop même, ça peut vite tourner au grind si on veut tout faire. D'autant que certaines zones sont complexes à atteindre et la navigation dans la carte peut être un peu pénible.
Heureusement ce n'est pas indispensable pour finir le jeu.

Bref, une très bonne surprise et un jeu que je conseille à tous. Convient très bien aux enfants aussi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020527553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1563136807}
review: Metroidvania terriblemente divertido y diferente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969658825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1563041632}
review:
Cute game. Maybe on the slightly easy side but if it was harder, it might have become frustrating at times.
Could do with better fast travel though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024068337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1547316211}
review:
Criminally underrated and creative take on a metroidvania meets pinball game. It may sound strange at first but this combination works surprisingly well. Plus, the atmosphere is fantastic and the idea is actually something new, which is rare today. If you are into metroidvanias and in search for a new game, why not give Yoku's Island Express a try. It's not as long as other metroidvanias (took me around 13 hours to 100% it), but it's well worth 10 bucks when on sale. 

All in all, I consider it a small, hidden gem and there's even a demo to try before buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018456808', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1562800167}
review: One of my all-time favorite Metroidvanias and completely satisfying from beginning to end. Every mechanic and design choice supports the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065291791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1562708708}
review: Absolutely fantastic, game of the year material. My only complaint is that you can't complete the game 100% if you have accidentally missed a couple things, which is a shame but only matters if you're a perfectionist. Otherwise, I recommend this game to everyone - it has its own unique style, it's sweet and artful and can be enjoyed by any generation. Give it a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986997483', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 314, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1689157067}
review: This is something of a rote metroidvania game mixed with a rather simple pinball game, but it definitely rises above the sum of its parts.  There are a lot of good ideas in both the activities and story to keep you glued to your computer until the end.  The only part I didn't care for is I think a problem of the Steam Controller rather than game, where sometimes it doesn't recognize me pressing or unpressing a trigger when I'm on the spinny things.  It makes those sections of the game very irritating, and I kind of think there are too many of them anyway.  I do wish there were more complicated pinball tables in the game too.  some of the time the pinball tables are for no more than getting your from point A to point B and I'd like a few you can spend some time on.   I particularly like the (3?) boss fights and would have loved to see more of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031934080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1546603306}
review:
Absolutely delightful, wonderful game.

Mixing the Metroidvania genre with pinball is a brilliant idea all in itself, but what really makes this game is the execution. Everything just falls into place perfectly, the artstyle, music and most importantly, the gameplay just blend together for something truly special, with fun, charming ideas and twists at every corner. I'd recommend this game for anyone who's even remotely into exploration and pinball, this game is simply a delight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198952164289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1709795209}
review: 蛮好玩的，但不知道为什么没有当初那么流畅了。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972130959', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1560098059}
review:
An open world pinball game. Very relaxing and fun, the music is nice too.
It's been a while since I liked a game this much, 100% it in a few days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994336693', 'num_games_owned': 2309, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1562353060}
review:
An utterly delightful, brilliant instance of the whole being greater than the sum of its parts. Which in this case, is one part metroidvania, one part pinball and one part dung beetle protagonist. 

A [i]dung[/i] beetle. I'm sold.

Yoku's Island Express is, quite simply, a pure joy to play. The game is unabashedly cute as hell and there is something refreshing about its sunny disposition. It's a long lost reminder that games can be happy and still be extremely well done, without sacrificing what makes a good metroidvania: satisfying exploration of a massive, engaging world.

None of this matters though. The best part is you're technically slapping and bouncing around a ball of poop.

[h1]8.5 / 10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021268098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1561709724}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996200417', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1562223512}
review:
It's a pinball metroidvania.
It's beautiful and beautifully executed.  One of the best games I've played in a long time.  I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010122759', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1683237745}
review:
Нужно было посидеть с ребенком и развлечь на некоторое время.Начал играть с ним в эту игру. Решил помогать в сложных местах игры где будет трудно. 
Прошли игру на 30%. 
Затянуло настолько, что в итоге всё прошел сам этой же ночью, но ребенок об этом не знает.
Теперь всячески уклоняюсь от предложения продолжить проходить с момента совместного прохождения, ибо стыдно, что прошел без него...

author: {'steamid': '76561198012651532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1562420451}
review:
Played the demo (one of the few games which actually have one available) and definitely wanted more after the demo ended but budget-restraints did not permit buying it at the them. Then a Steam sale came along and I jumped at the chance!

The great quirky mood and fun characters that you get in the demo, was widened on in the full game. Absolutely love the graphic style and the sound track and the combination of old-school pinball aspects with the Sonic the hedge platformer feel.

I can imagine that some gamers might find it a bit tedious or redundant but I thoroughly enjoyed the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197971048890', 'num_games_owned': 2314, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1711825177}
review:
This game is legitimately genius. To articulate all the reasons why it is amazing, would take a long thesis. But I can present some of it's facets to you in a simple way and you should be able to understand that it is a worthwhile purpose.

Even if a platforming game mixed with a pinball game doesn't sound exciting to you, trust me, there is still a high likelihood you will like this. This game mixes platforming and pinball in such a way which has the best elements of each, without any of the negative aspects of those genres. The game requires the player to go back and forth from each playstyle in a way that feels organic, and in a way where the player never gets bored. To not get bored in a game that takes roughly 7 hours to complete, that is an astounding feat of game creation.

The art and music in the game are world class, and could stand on their own in a gallery of fine art. This might seem like hyperbole, and maybe most museums wouldn't agree with my assessment, but they are stuck in the past, and anyone who doesn't appreciate the effort put into this art isn't looking hard enough.

This is an incredible game.

The game runs perfectly smooth at 4k 60fps in Linux through the Steam built in Proton.

Just try the demo. I guarantee you that if you have the money to spare, you will spend it on this game after experiencing the demo. The demo will get you roughly 5% through the game. It is enough time for the game to put hooks into the player. You will be reeled in.

I thank you for reading my review. :) I hope that you have a good day and a good night. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198140801438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1561146895}
review:
A metroidvania and pinball game in one. A must-have for fans of either genre. Even if you're a fan of neither, I still recommend it simply for being one of the most unique games I've ever played, the way the pinball mechanics are flawless integrated into the 2D metroidvania world. 

Apart from the ingenious concept, the game is also extremely well-made. Not only does it look beautiful with its HD graphics, vibrant colours and charming hand-drawn art style, but the gameplay is also innovative with tight controls during the pinball segments. As a metroidvania, it has good pacing, a decent story with plenty of interesting side-quests, nice abilities, cute non-playable characters and just enough guidance that is delivered via dialogue, but it is of course the pinball elements that make the game stand out among others of the same genre, and as a pinball game, well, you actually get more than a pinball game. Much, much more. 

This game won Best Debut Game at the BAFTA Game Awards 2019, deservedly so, in my opinion. I will definitely be paying attention to future games by Villa Gorilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198954769188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1600200340}
review: Muy divertido con la mezcla de pinball

author: {'steamid': '76561198010267364', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1561787590}
review: Sometimes you can get a great game out of a formula you never even asked for, and Yoku is one of those games. Crossing Metroidvania elements with pinball challenges makes for a fresh experience, and the pinball sequences themselves are well-designed, not too frustrating but satisfying to complete. The tropical island is also a nice change of pace from other Metroidvanias, which tend to be either straight fantasy or sci-fi. I took me about nine hours to finish, not counting all the optional stuff I'll probably go back for. I'd call it a hidden gem, but it seems like it found a lot of success, and deservingly so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315856646', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1561857751}
review:
这个是集弹球解密之长的游戏（？），没有被追着一定要在限定时间里完成的任务，手残不需练到手到废了才能过关。
只要眼力，对，就是眼力，只要对好你需要去的地方，弹弹弹的就可以去到了
也不会被背后的BGM搞得暴躁，是个很轻松的游戏~

author: {'steamid': '76561197970732035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1561780168}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018147454', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1561694267}
review: This was a unique game with a mechanic I've never seen done before(pinball + metroid) and I question why it hasn't because it works great. The controls are easy to pick up and play and the game itself is very colorful and upbeat. It reminds me of old N64 adventure games with tons of secret areas and collectibles to find and charming characters to talk to and help out. I went into this not knowing what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised and couldn't put it down.

review:

Very well done in almost all aspects. Graphics are excellent and there are lots of interesting quests to keep you interested. I think the pinball aspects could have a bit more variety but overall the game is very enjoyable and highly recommended,

author: {'steamid': '76561197970879421', 'num_games_owned': 2884, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1702, 'last_played': 1560009593}
review:
I wasn't hoping for too much when I launched Yoku's Island Express, but I was very very surprised.

This game has all of the characteristics of games I played as a kid on my Amiga and more.  A absolute time sink urging me to complete it.  Thoroughly enjoyed it and actually felt disappointed once I'd finished it (Please make followup)  Would recommend to anyone.

Lots of things to collect, lots of hidden areas.  No lives to speak of, but lots of timing challenges specifically when you get the plant spinning ability and once you have to start using the explosive slugs.

I want to find another game like this now..... Reminded me a bit of Ori and the Blind Forest

author: {'steamid': '76561198148620362', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1559922835}
review:
这款游戏将弹球机的玩法与类银河战士恶魔城的关卡设计结合起来，辅以美丽的场景美术，难忘的音乐，有特点的角色和轻松的剧情，造就了一款需要被更广大的大众发现的优秀作品（也就是英文中所说的Hidden Gem）。

玩家在游戏中扮演Yoku，一只蜣螂，也就是俗称的......屎壳郎。它随身带着一个比它还大的球，也算符合这种生物的习性吧（游戏中也自带吐槽了它喜欢推...球的习性）。不得不说这样的主角设计，和“弹球机”这样的主要玩法实在是结合紧密。

游戏的主要机制——弹球机，通常来说是一种在设定好的机器中，用左右两块弹板控制弹球，使它到达机器中的某些位置拿到得分，最后通过得分来评价水平的游戏。游戏中也保留了不少经典弹球机的影子，比如碰触（或者按照某种规律碰触）某些位置可以得到额外货币之类的。

顺带一提，游戏中最难达成的成就就是在所有这样的“弹球机”中，获得所有可能获得的额外奖励，当然我觉得这个成就难拿的原因不是奖励难得到，大多数是位置找不到......

而弹球机本身作为一种依赖物理的游戏机制，球到达板的速度、角度、位置等都有可能影响发球后弹球的去向，这也就揭示了这种机制在平台跳跃上的丰富的可能性。这款游戏的关卡设计不仅展现了这样丰富的可能性，还针对该机制做出了若干扩展，甚至还有BOSS战，特别新颖。

所以这样的机制和类银河战士恶魔城结合起来，现在看上去就没那么违和了。说到类银河战士恶魔城，这类游戏的特点通常是：连通的大地图，可以获得的能力/升级。这款游戏包含了这两个特点，主角需要在（对主角一只小虫子来说）庞大的Mokumana岛上进行冒险。更好的是，剧情的中间部分，需要在Mokumana岛的三个位置找到各自区域的首领，这个部分理论上可以按照任意顺序推进，这就相当于完全放手让玩家探索，虽然有迷路的可能性，但喜欢类银河战士恶魔城的朋友肯定不会不喜欢自由探索吧？

作为类银河战士恶魔城，除了自由的主线，丰富的支线和收集要素也是构成游戏本身的很重要的部分。比如主角一开始来到这个岛上，就是为了做岛上的邮差，邮差要做的当然就是送信了。主线是给首领们报信，也有给岛上所有信箱送信的支线任务，更是有三个特殊的过期包裹需要配送。除了这个，还有在某角色的帮助下，在岛的各处寻找一个雕塑的几个部分的任务，还有在没有具体位置，只有一些大概描述的情况下，帮助一些真菌找到一系列栖息地点的任务。这些支线任务都需要你对岛上的路径了如指掌，才能以最快的速度跨越地图。

游戏中主要的收集要素是一种叫“Wickerling”的东西，酷似曼陀罗草，是一种神秘的植物，出现在地图的各种犄角旮旯，共有80个，收集齐并激活特定的图腾柱，可以完成隐藏结局。除此之外，还有一些主线不必要的宝箱和宝物散落在岛上各地，这些东西一般是一些能力的升级，或者球的装扮。没错，在游戏中你可以装扮主角的球，该说是早该料到呢，还是......这装扮还不只是好看，个别情况下你需要特定的装扮才能完成上述的某些支线任务。

很贴心地，有时作为探索的奖励，有时需要花费货币购买，可以得到一些探测器。其中Wickerling探测器根据区域的不同共有4个，而宝箱探测器也就是一张藏宝图，会在地图某处可以买到。这些探测器会在地图上标记对应宝物的位置，很是方便。不幸的是，其他收集要素，比如装扮或支线任务，就不存在得知具体位置的方法了。虽然100%跑图的话基本上是一定可以遇到的，但最怕的就是图是跑过了，但东西因为缺能力没拿到，后面又忘了有这么个地方，就会很困惑了。Steam社区指南里只有一篇英语的，也并不那么全面，很是难受。我凭一己之力是完成了97%，最后3%还是在外网才查到了具体的位置，藏得是真的好。

游戏的情感基调是轻松明快的，从明亮的画风就可以看得出来。游戏中也没有死亡的设定，如果失足从什么地方掉落，只要再试一次即可，或者可以手动选择回到上一个存档点。前若干次“死亡”会蹦出一个奇妙的计数场景，容易让人心慌，但实际上完全没有关系，甚至你还要“死”够次数才能解锁这个场景的任务。还有一个据称只有一次机会的挑战，也会让人慌乱，但实际上利用装扮，也有办法挑战多次。所以游戏对全收集党可以说是非常友好的，难度也完全不存在，纯休闲游戏。

综上所述，我认为这款作品极具创意，再加上虽然游戏70块，但最近打折已经最低打到五折，也就是35块了，这价钱绝对值得，强烈推荐。

（看真结局的样子，留了个可做续作的悬念在这里，如果真的出了就买爆）

author: {'steamid': '76561198045380427', 'num_games_owned': 4982, 'num_reviews': 513, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1559935713}
review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are worth your time [/url][/code]

[B]Approximate amount of time to 100%:[/B] 12-15 hours
[B]Estimated achievement difficulty:[/B] 6/10
[B]Minimum number of playthroughs needed:[/B] 1
[B]Has it been in a bundle:[/B] No
[B]Is there a good guide available:[/B] Different guides all over the internet, but not really one that covers it all. IGN has some amazing maps for the collectibles
[B]How many people have completed this game at the time I'm writing this review:[/B] 62 on Astats

[B]Multiplayer achievements:[/B] No
[B]Missable achievements:[/B] No
[B]Grinding Achievements:[/B] No
[B]DLC-Only achievements:[/B] No
[B]Time-gated achievements:[/B] No
[B]RNG-achievements:[/B] No
[B]Does difficulty affect achievements:[/B] No difficulty option available
[B]Unobtainable/glitched achievements:[/B] No

Who would think to combine a metroidvania with pinball? It sounds crazy but this game is amazing! In this game you're a beetle who wants to enjoy a good life while working for the local post office. Things already change quickly while you just arrived and there is no time to just enjoy an easy life, you have to save this island! 

It is amazing how they integrated so many pinballs into a beautiful open world.  Even more intriguing are the boss battles which also consist of pinball objectives.  The artwork in this game is stunning.  Yoku's Island Express is so much fun to play that I'll add it to my list of games that I love. 

The most achievements you'll unlock while playing the story and the side-quests. There are a lot of collectibles in this game! I suggest getting as many as you can while playing the story.  Most of all, try to get all the scarabs while playing the pinball sections so you won't have to backtrack for those.  For the wickerlings there exists 4 tracking "eyes", one for each segment of the map, which makes finding those so much easier. I forgot to look for those and have searched around the island for 3 hours without those trackers, while it would have been so much easier with them. You can also buy a map to see all the treasure chests. Try to unlock the beelines as quickly as possible, as they will make traveling around the island so much faster. 

[B]Pros & Cons:[/B]
+ Amazing artwork
+ Very unique gameplay
+- A lot of collectibles, which you need for the achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561197994824233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1559758989}
review:
Aldığı her kuruşu sonuna kadar hak eden, eğlenceli, zihin açıcı ve insanı sebepsiz yere mutlu eden bir oyun. 

Demosunu oynadığımdan beri satın almak için fırsat kolluyordum. Normalde tilt oyunlarını sevmem. Sonic Spinball vs gibi yapımlara sadece birkaç dakikadan fazlasını ayırmayıp sıkılmışımdır her zaman. Ama bu oyun farklı. Çünkü tilt mekaniklerini metroidvania ve bulmaca türüyle inanılmaz başarılı bir şekilde birleştirmiş. Yani sadece topu oraya buraya atıp ışıkları yakmaya veya bir şeyleri toplamaya çalışmıyorsunuz. Bunu yapabilmek için aynı zamanda kafanızı çalıştırmanız, minik bulmacalar çözmeniz lazım. Macera boyunca yeni yetenekler kazanıp daha önce gidemediğimiz yerlere gidebilmek, ada halkıyla konuşup sorunlarını çözmek ve bu esnada postacılık yapmak nedendir bilmem, acayip keyifli.

Demosunu oynamanızı tavsiye ederim. 8/10

[quote]Daha fazla incelememe göz atmak isterseniz Steam Küratör sayfamı ziyaret edebilirsiniz: [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39265984/]Pikselatör[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971434473', 'num_games_owned': 1928, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1557834531}
review:
I have a love hate relationship with metroidvanias. They are so much fun, until you hit a wall and they come to a grinding halt. But when you come to a halt in Yoku, it is to have fun and fun alone!

The game is everything you would expect, back tracking, exploring, trying to find items or objectives to unlock previous locations. Except the whole map is one giant pinball machine! Oh the adventure and story is there with plenty of cute characters and a beautiful world to discover. But bouncing around as a beetle roped to a pinball with the duties of a mail man makes for more fun than I ever could have imagined!

You really will find nothing like it and after the main story is done, it is still loaded with content. Well worth any price, surprise smash hit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198201585762', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1557897855}
review:
+清新的画风
+轻松愉快的音乐
+逗比的角色
+3D弹球配合银河城的新颖玩法
+没有死亡机制，对新手十分友好
+特色BOSS战
+丰富的搜集解谜要素
+适中的主线流程

-令人眩晕的灰虫子操作，完全比不上银河战士旋转跳跃的爽快
-后期HDD需要加载，没有用SSD测过不清楚是否有同一个问题；集显存在爆显存问题（垃圾LENOVO笔记本），优化不足
-没有传送机制，后期搜集跑路花费大量时间
-地图对金龟子的显示不明显，这造成了最难达成的成就
-实际上就是个滚粪球的游戏

-后期水果无用

+ Fresh graphics
+ Pleasurable music
+ Teasing characters 
+ New Play Method of 3D Pinball with Metroidvania
+ No death mechanism, very friendly to novice
+ Characteristic BOSS Warfare
+ Rich collection of puzzle-solving elements
+ Moderate mainline flow


- The dizzying operation of the Grey Worm is not as cool as the Metroid'rotating jump.
-  HDD needs to be loaded, and it is not clear whether there is the same problem with SSD. There is a problem of explosive display memory (junk LENOVO notebook), which is not optimized enough.
- Without transmission mechanism, it takes a lot of time to collect runs later.
- The map does not show the Scarabs clearly .This has resulted in the most difficult achievement to achieve.
- It's actually a dung ball game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968492941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1580244187}
review: A mash-up of Sonic Spinball and a Metroidvania game.  It's got a wonderfully charming aesthetic, delightful music and enough challenge to keep you entertained.  It's not a particularly long game but there are lots of extra collectibles and objectives to complete once the main story is finished.  I thoroughly enjoyed it; and for a developer's debut title it is a very well-designed, polished product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319241796', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1557288237}
review:
A gameplay experience you will not find anywhere else. This game exudes charm and good vibes and you cannot help but get lost in the adventure.

Pros:
Amazing atmosphere
Unique combination of genres which you will not find in any other game
Tons of side quests and challenges to progress within the world
Beautiful and varied metroidvania map
Wholesome storyline which manages to even throw a twist into it's climax

Singular Con:
The gameplay can be challenging and frustrating at times but moments like these are rare and become rarer as your skill improves.

This game is excellent and guaranteed to give you an experience you will not find anywhere else. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198263685190', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1555213301}
review:
+ 以弹珠游戏为载体的类银河恶魔城风格游戏
+ 操作简捷，难度简单友好，休闲性强，全年龄段游戏
+ 可爱的画风，特点鲜明的音乐，魔性音效
+ 有趣多样而不单调的关卡设计
+ 海量搜集要素通过道具标注，全搜集难度也不大

- 传送点偏少，完成搜集时有大量重复跑路

总体评价：S
推荐指数：S

推荐人群：全年龄段全性别玩家，弹珠类非专业玩家，类银河恶魔城类非硬核玩家，萌系3D画风爱好者，追求「好玩」的玩家，休闲玩家

[h1]详评[/h1]
《优酷的小岛快递》是一部弹珠游戏。这个类型的游戏感觉蛮少的，首先是游戏场景大小有限，而且多半逃不出撞击得分的模式，再加上操作的不确定性颇高，技术区分度不大，基本上也就是个小品级的聚会游戏或休闲游戏。（赌场里不知有没有？我在几个赌场里反正没见到。）稍微玩出点花的算是Windows 2000开始自带的[url= https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Full_Tilt!_Pinball#3D_Pinball_for_Windows_%E2%80%93_Space_Cadet]三维弹球[/url]，加入了简易的任务和升级系统，当年在内嵌的扫雷和四大扑克游戏外发现了这个新天地觉得好好玩啊。只不过拜上面说的操作随机性所赐，最好战绩也就是升到三级，无数次小球二次进入紧急发射通道然后就跪了。

同样，2018年《优酷的小岛快递》刚出时我便入手，很快我的球就在游戏中果汁店处直坠坑里。然后那个骷髅店员居然告诉我太差劲了不让我再进去了。这种嘲讽就差把一个红色的汉字「菜」打在屏幕中央了啊！果断不能忍就搁置了。

当然，后面还是回坑了。没办法，可爱的画风，独特的游戏基因，加上总体上非常休闲的玩法，这个弹珠游戏还是成为了在下班疲惫期想玩的首选之一。

游戏的主角Yoku本体是个履新邮政局长的小甲虫，而它与一个圆球绑在一起随之移动，所以一定意义上球才是真主角（当然这个形象也被某NPC嘲讽成蜣螂）。游戏的操作核心就是RT/LT两键，分别对应蓝色和黄色的挡板，在标准弹珠场景下就是底部的俩门神了。不过除此了俩门神，这类标准场景中还有更多挡板用以改变运行球的轨迹。除此之外，左右方向键可以用于在相对平缓的场景下控制球的滚动，A键进行交互再加上Y查看包裹。游戏中的操作就是这么简单。

而如果详细讲解开来，左右的滚动操作主要用于跑路——是的，除了可称作「战区」的标准弹珠场景外，《优酷的小岛快递》中更多部分与横板RPG类似：拥有一个相对庞大需要逐渐探索开来的开放地图，一开始探索范围有限，随着而随着进度的推进，主角也会获得新道具并解锁一系列眼花缭乱的新能力，这时才能解开之前一些无法解开的机关，到达之前未曾到达的地方。只不过本作中没有跳跃，改而由满地的挡板/弹板完成竖直方向的移动。同时，游戏中也有水果类比于金钱，可以用于解锁挡板，开启机关和购买道具，而掉坑被刺会损失部分水果。

所以本作还有一个看起来和弹珠格格不入的标签[url= https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B1%BB%E9%93%B6%E6%B2%B3%E6%88%98%E5%A3%AB%E6%81%B6%E9%AD%94%E5%9F%8E%E6%B8%B8%E6%88%8F]「类银河战士恶魔城游戏(类银河城，Metroidvania)」[/url]，而《优酷的小岛快递》则却完成了两者精妙和谐的融合，进而带来了新鲜感。比如游戏中没有跳跃因素，而是采用了由辅助修正的预定弹射轨道，从而团结了一大批被手抖/脚滑/跳刺劝退的玩家。而一个开放又连通的地图，能够营造出景色特点迥异的各种场景，使得玩家可以在BGM声中惬意探索。而游戏中也不是纯跑路，同样有着类似于BOSS战这样的存在，能在总体休闲的节奏中适量安插略微刺激些的部分。但是不必紧张，游戏中没有死亡要素，掉坑被刺扎也就损失一点水果罢了，即使是前面所述的水果店也能在[spoiler]获得喷漆[/spoiler]后无限度挑战，而掉坑太多后游戏中甚至会有补偿道具。

而对于真正热衷于在类银河城类游戏中搜刮物品和寻找菜单的玩家，《优酷的小岛快递》也安排了大量主线通关不必要，但是集齐还是颇费一番功夫的诸多搜集元素，其中不乏需要用到包括尬聊，找暗门，大坠落，跑酷，[spoiler]利用爆炸反冲[/spoiler]等手法多次尝试才能到手的设定。

所以，这是一个拥有船新鬼点子的游戏，一个船新版本的弹珠游戏，一个船新版本的类银河城类游戏。完成了这两者的集合，也无愧于BAFTA的最佳新秀奖了。虽然剧情比较老套，不过游戏很休闲，有着可爱的画风，又没有暴力死亡要素，这款Pegi7评级的全年龄游戏值得尝试。

author: {'steamid': '76561198427272513', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1558739438}
review:
マップ全体がピンボールになった探索型アクションゲーム。ほんわかしたタッチのグラフィックを背景に、むしくんと各地に設置されたフリッパーを操作して（郵便配達のついでに）島の危機を救うのが目的です。
ピンボールなんだけどステージ制ではなく、マップ探索がメインと少し変わっています。移動もボス戦もすべてピンボール。そしてライフや制限時間が一切無いので、あまりピンボールのゲームをしない人でも詰まらず進められました。
収集要素やサブクエストも用意されていて、ストーリー以外もそれなりに充実しています。

同時に、往復するときにピンボールがじれったく思う場面もありました。狙った道になかなか通せないときは、フリッパーの光のラインを参考にタイミングをずらしながら試すと行けたりします。
もう一つ、100%クリアを狙うと場合によっては少し辛いかも。「藤の根」と呼ばれる収集アイテムの中には、残りがどこにあるのか表示されないものがあります。取り残しがあるとマップの隅々まで探す羽目になって苦労しました。

以下は知っていると攻略に役立つかもしれない情報です。（自分が迷ったので書いておきます）
・高いところにあるアイテムは、近くでボールになめくじをつけて爆発の反動で飛び上がって取得しましょう
・見た目が条件になっていて通過できない場所は、ボールの模様を変えて再度訪れましょう

易しめの難易度と想像以上に広いマップで探索とピンボールを気軽に楽しめます。お魚ねこくんとか、デザインもボイスも可愛らしいどうぶつキャラがたくさん登場しますし、南国の雰囲気も合っていて見た目の通り安心してゆったりと遊べる良い出来です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198024652126', 'num_games_owned': 4779, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1652572465}
review:
Take one VHS tape of Kevin Costner's The Postman, one PS1 Symphony of the Night CD (you can substitute the CD with a SNES Super Metroid cartridge), one well-aged Sonic Spinball cartridge and a pinch of かわいい です. Mix together vigorously in a bowl and remove any post-apocalyptic foam with a spoon. Pour it in pan and put it in the oven for a 2-3 year development cycle.
Sprinkle generously with exotic island goodness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028705366', 'num_games_owned': 3138, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1556921369}
review: Pinball and Metroid does not sound like a happy union, the gaming equivalent of sausages and milky bars. It came as something of a surprise then that not only does Yoku’s Island Express work, but it feels like it was always meant to be. Mashups are hardly a new thing in gaming, especially in the indie scene but it’s rare to see such a perfectly formed fusion of gaming genetics - Yoku is a real Kristin Kreuk of a video game, minus the links to sex trafficking cults. Rather than the pinball being a twist on the metroidvania formula, it’s absolutely a core mechanic. Flippers and bouncers are the only way to actually get anywhere in YIE, as Yoku cannot jump. The game is split into a large, typical Metroid style overworld and more discrete pinball style “tables” that essentially act as the games dungeons and bosses. You can really feel the passion poured into the project by Villa Gorilla from the moment the game is booted up – it looks and sounds wonderful, and while it’s not quite up to the standard of Ori or Rayman Legends, it’s a far cry from the low effort pixel art affairs clogging up steam. The polish extends to the game design. - progression through the game is appealingly non-linear, with large interconnected areas and fast travel opening up just as back tracking starts to get a bit unwieldy. While there aren’t a huge number of upgrades, the ones we’ve got are quirky and designed to complement the pinball (so there’s no missiles, high jump or speed booster here). YIE is a very gentle game – there’s no death or direct combat of any kind, with the punishment for falling in the gutter being a minor loss of fruit (this game’s currency). Failure is its own punishment in YIE, which works fine within the games mechanics. There’s some precision pinballing required which can be frustrating enough without a pointless health bar killing the flow as well. This does lead into the game’s biggest flaw, which is collectables. In a metroidvania, all collectables should do something, even if only in theory. You will never realistically come anywhere close to running out of missiles in Super Metroid after a point, but those extra five from every upgrade still objectively increase your power. With no combat or death, there’s less of an obvious upgrade path in YIE as you’ll never need ammo, heath or weapons. As a result the bulk of the collectables in the game basically do nothing until you get all of them, and even then it’s only a minor change to the ending. I’m sure the developers could have given a reward for every ten of these found, even if those rewards were only cosmetic. Thankfully there are also full fledged sidequests to the game, which do lead to more tangible rewards such as upgrades to tools or your fruit wallet (even if fruit wallet sounds like a horrifying prison innuendo). If you’re a fan of metroidvania, then you really owe it to yourself to check YIE out. I really hope this does the business it deserves, as this was obvious a project of passion for the team and that’s something in short supply in the games industry. I’d recommend it wholeheartedly, and I’m really interested to see where Villa Gorilla goes next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262749771', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1556027798}
review:
我以为这是一个休闲类游戏，毫无惩罚的那种……直到我见识到了“刺”……在有个叫“冲冲”的小伙伴帮我挡刺的那里，我触发了一个神秘剧情，一个大大的“9”变成了“10”，我猜这是我碰到刺的次数。不干了不干了，我真是手残到一定境界了！
当然游戏很好，很精致的感觉，画面、配乐和配音都很有趣，弹珠也是，要素很多。只是我自己现在想玩一个超级轻松的小游戏罢了（我大概得去4399看看）。

review: I don't even play games that much these days but this is definitely worth buying. I never felt that it was plodding. I never had second thoughts about wanting to complete it, the game is just genuinely enjoyable from start to finish. Even when playing a Zelda game you sometimes wonder what else you could do with your time when you get stuck, but this was always interesting. I'm even going to complete some of the side quests despite finishing the main story. 10/10 - I would definitely play a sequel if one ever came out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1659768799}
review:
I love happy games. I mean, I’ll play a dark, gritty, or depressing game and appreciate it just fine, but happy games are a singular pleasure for me. It probably comes from growing up with Nintendo systems and faithful adherence to games like Mario and Kirby, though happy games have an advantage in spreading joy by their very nature. I’ve finished Yoku’s Island Express but I miss it already, all the sunshine and quirky characters and happy toots now behind me. I also miss the clever mixing of pinball and metroidvania mechanics, because I honestly don’t know where I can find such a thing outside of another cheerful playthrough.

Happy little Yoku is a dung beetle who is thankfully tethered to a nice, clean stone ball for his work. He’s the newest postmaster of Mokumana Island, a mystical place held in balance by the great tentacled demigod Mokuma. Unfortunately, a mysterious figure called the God Slayer has wreaked havoc on the peaceful island, poisoning Mokuma and threatening to upset the balance he maintains. Since Yoku’s going to be rolling all over the island anyway, he’s been charged with contacting the three chiefs of the local factions about a ritual that will help their resident demigod recover. There’s a lot to see on Mokumana Island before that happens, though, and more than a few ancient secrets are bound to be unearthed by the time the God Slayer faces justice.

That might sound a bit grim for something so cheery-looking, and there are certainly some colorful moments of drama when the game dips into its deep lore. Mokumana Island has a fully-realized history of deities and settlers, and the results of that are found in the island’s current diverse crop of residents. You’ll be chatting with tiny bunnies, giant ferrets, fungus people, skull gangs, and ancient cultists as you deliver mail and collect delicious fruit in your quest. The writing is just as sweet and charming as the vibrant graphics, and includes some very creative twists and surprises to look forward to.

More creative than that, though, is how you get around the island. There’s finally a healthy crop of pinball games on Steam these days, but none of them are quite as inventive as Yoku’s Island Express. The entirety of Mokumana Island is essentially pinball tables linked together by fields and platforms you can roll Yoku along with the analog stick. Once he tumbles onto a table, it’s pretty much all flippers to launch him and his ball into drop targets, ramps, and chutes to collect items and progress. By exploring and doing quests, you’ll also gather tools that allow access to new parts of the island. It’s the metroidvania concept but applied to pinball, and realized through some fantastically unique powers and presentations.

The more powers you have, the more of the island’s secrets you can open up with diligent exploration. For most of the game you’ll be hoovering up fruit, the de facto currency used on the island to buy items and unlock certain gates and barriers. These can be found anywhere, as bonuses on pinball tables and tucked away into the corners of areas. Exploring can earn you upgrades to your fruit limit, collectibles like plant creatures called Wickerlings, cosmetic customization for your ball, and tools to help you track down the rest of the hidden goodies. The main game is big enough to take you 4 or 5 hours to roll through, but the exploration can easily last you twice that if you want to see everything Mokumana Island has to offer.

You really should keep at it, too, because you’re sure to have a smile plastered on your face the entire time. Every moment of Yoku’s Island Express is marked with lush, colorful graphics, an upbeat soundtrack, and the joy of wandering a fanciful locale. It’s one of those games where simply seeing new things feels like all the encouragement you need, and the pinball mechanics only make it that much more fun to do. There are no killer skill shots or stressful tables here, and really the worst that ever happens is that you fall down to a lower screen off of a flub. Tables are plenty forgiving, and there’s even a fast travel system for scooting around once you’ve seen most of the island. I can’t really find any reason this one wouldn’t inspire joy in just about anyone, so if you’re in the mood for something pleasant and upbeat this really should be your first choice.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

review:
This was my personal game of the year in 2018... and I play a LOT of games :-)

A slice of absolute beaming joy, from the art to the music to the writing, combined with a fantastically polished, compelling game that is decently challenging without ever feeling punishing.  Silly, fun, cute and lively without ever feeling saccharine or overwrought.

If you crave a ray of sunshine in your life, it's an essential purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029608438', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1631149151}
review:
Someone looked at pinball and thought: “Hey, you know what would be a good idea? Let’s make this into a metroidvania.” And it wasn’t a good idea – it was a [i]great[/i] idea! There have been lots of great metroidvanias in the past 5 years (Hollow Knight, Ori, Axiom Verge, ESA, Pharaoh Rebirth+) and Yoku ranks up there among the best.

Like any good metroidvania, it features open areas, progression gates, and items to get through those gates. The world itself, which is an island, is made up of smaller areas that come together to form a cohesive whole. Not only is it as beautiful as Ori, the level design is also as solid. Yoku the beetle can move left and right, but can’t jump, and that’s where the pinball aspects come in. It’s simple: left trigger = blue paddles, right trigger = orange paddles. Using this, the game is built around the extremely unique goal of “exploration pinball”. Some sections only require paddles for minor platforming and navigation, while other are self-contained mini pinball boards, complete with two paddles in the middle and an open space between them that you should avoid falling into. What Yoku does best, really, is in integrating these mechanics into the metroidvania design – it’s all so natural you hardly even think about it. What’s also natural is the way the game teaches you its mechanics – there are no overlong tutorials or annoying button prompts at all. Yoku has a fantastic ‘invisible hand’ overall, guiding you on where to go without forcing it.

I’m not a pinball player by any means, and I fell between paddles or off ledges plenty of times, but something about Yoku’s charm and forgivingness made it one of the [i]least[/i] frustrating games I’ve played in a while. The penalty for failure is light, and the game is pretty easy overall, but when playing it is this fun I couldn’t care less. Although the main story is simple and ends anticlimactically, there’s lots of little moments throughout that are memorable and add to the vibe of each area (ex: a giant, ancient turtle in a lake, a rat looking for his pets in a frozen winter cabin, etc.). This is all aided by the wonderful graphics, the (mostly) good music, a (limited) fast travel system, and a detailed map with markers you can unlock to track down hidden/extra items. Speaking of hidden/extra stuff, there’s plenty to find in the post game, along with side quests to finish, and none of this is permanently missable (a big plus for completionists).

By the end of my 100% playthrough (total of almost 10 hours), I wasn’t so much tired of Yoku as I was sad to see it go. I slowly rolled the ball up to the save point and just sat there for a second, knowing there was nothing left to do (but start a new playthrough). If there’s a second game in the future, count me in day one!

PROS:
-Unique pinball/metroidvania combination
-Above combination actually works, and naturally at that
-Well-connected world and area design
-Good items and upgrades
-Forgiving, but in a way that feels right
-Wonderful visuals and (usually) music
-Charming characters and world
-Just really fun overall

CONS:
-Anticlimactic and lame endings (especially the final boss music). Could’ve used more lore and characterization overall
-Some technical issues like 1 random crash, and a few camera bugs

I’m not sure how Yoku hasn’t gotten as big as Ori or Hollow Knight, but maybe one day it will. You deserve it, little pinball dung beetle.

review: Como não amar este jogo? Ele é simples, tem personagens carismáticos e a música é bem relaxante. Pode comprar sem medo, ainda mais se estiver com desconto!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975177326', 'num_games_owned': 2599, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1599775649}
review:
I was initially skeptical about this game. I have played it through twice now, to 100%.

The pinball mechanic can be daunting at times, but I was quick to get the hang of things as it is pretty straight forward.

I cannot recommend this game enough and hope there is a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024942939', 'num_games_owned': 1557, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1555005499}
review:
Took me about 9 hours to complete, with no achievements that were unreasonably difficult.

I do recommend, though, that you try to open the scarabs as you encounter them, if you plan on the 100%.

Great gameplay, wholesome story, nice soundtrack. The "Metroidvania" tag is a little dubious; there are only two or three items that actually impact your ability to traverse the environment. Still, this game ticks all of the boxes for me.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145620065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1578969465}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027625132', 'num_games_owned': 1424, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1561782316}
review:
除了还差一个钱包已经全收集 全通关了。
游戏是很好的游戏，不管是从美工的画面还是游戏的关卡设计都相当巧妙。游戏方式相当简单 就和3D弹珠一样，左挡板和右挡板操作，除此之外还可以控制左右移动小球，在小球掉进去前把角度掌控好，这很重要。游戏里的道具最重要2个一个是潜水鱼，还有一个是飞行用的毛毛虫，不少小任务要给球换皮肤才能通过。一个是骷髅皮肤 一个是 纯红色皮肤 一个是 蜜蜂皮肤 都是任务需要的。3个快递包送完以后获得徽章奔跑速度加快，魔法师的谜题做完给你游泳更快的小鱼，蘑菇任务做完给你可以一次吸2个炸弹蛙的工具。50次死亡后捉逃犯任务给你水果翻倍的金币。
游戏要素真的很多，所有柳条收集完了就是真的结局了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006653420', 'num_games_owned': 2287, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1554941256}
review:
Metroidvania masterfully blended with pinball mechanics.

Miniature pinball tables are integrated into the map very well, and non-table segments have clever ways of utilizing flippers.  Exploring the world and solving puzzles is fun. Art and music are great.

As with most metroidvanias, backtracking and pathfinding can be a bit frustrating, but the progression of movement options and shortcuts (including the most fun fast travel system I've ever experienced) help alleviate the tediousness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025300712', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1555442279}
