review: 没有看到可以改按键的地方，可能是自己没耐心找，但是按键体验真的不舒服，如果有人知道告诉我，我删评
developer_response:
Hi Old Chan,

Unfortunately, there's no option to rebind keys in Yoku's Island Express but we greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. 
We’ll be sure to make this available to the team for consideration.

If you have any more queries, or further insight, then please feel free to contact us.

Thank you for your continued support.
Team17 Support

author: {'steamid': '76561198027826544', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1554837832}
review:
Очень приятная, красочная смесь метроидвании и пинбола. От метроидвании здесь общий каркас: огромный связный мир, плавно раскрываемые навыки, квесты и сборные штученьки. Весёлыми пинбольными вставками же заменяется всё остальное, начиная с передвижения (главный герой не умеет прыгать!) и заканчивая боевой системой (здесь практически нет врагов и кровопролития, зато авторам удалось реализовать на пейнбольной механике разные многоступенчатые локации и даже несколько [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1702332736]боссов[/url]). 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1695049503

Игра не казуальная, тут полно секретов, некоторые персонажи лишь намекают на то, что они от вас хотят, в некоторых местах нужно хитро извернуться, чтобы попасть в крынку с желанной сметаной, но при этом специально нанятый "[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1707438966]директор хорошего настроения[/url]" неустанно следит своим мудрым гендальфовым взором, чтобы всегда и везде во главу угла ставился комфорт и удобство игрока: к вашим услугам и полнофункциональная [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1708164870]карта[/url] с приближением и необходимыми индикаторами, и пчелиный фуникулёр для быстрого перемещения по острову, и частые чекпоинты (при том, что у вас нет ни здоровья, ни жизней, и проиграть здесь вообще невозможно, лишь иной раз куда-нибудь неосторожно свалиться). Вишенкой на торте служит настройка внешнего вида шарика, который вы всю дорогу катаете, будучи примерной букашкой. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1708164765

В общем, если вы устали от бесконечного хардкора и дарксоулза, если вы просто хотите получать удовольствие, как в какой-нибудь [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/alpasy/recommended/571310]Steamworld Dig 2[/url], и вас не воротит от пинбола и няшных островитян, пританцовывающих под укулеле, то смело берите на заметку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262854731', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1554984563}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976262601', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1552523726}
review: Yoku's Island is a metroidvania....pinball game? Yes, it manages to be all three of those things at once. It manages to both encourage exploration and upgrade your character to backtrack and gain access to new areas. Discrete areas are sometimes more abstractly pinball, but to keep with the analogy, the dungeons are all basically clever pinball tables. You'll use flippers and bumpers to move Yoku around the stage while targeting certain bumpers, flippers or ramps to get achieve certain objectives. It's honestly some of the best video game I've ever video gamed. You owe it to yourself to check out Yoku's Island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282833758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1559035427}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975254954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1554700684}
review:
Great fun! Pinball mechanics work well, perfect length, good balance of depth for the story. I enjoyed the progression mechanics and the fast travel system kicked in at just the right times.

There were a few areas where it could have been signposted better that I should come back at a later time, or areas should've been locked off before they were necessary; I was also mildly irritated by the pinball mechanics at times, especially when revisiting an earlier area and just needing to pass through. That's more to do with my own skill level than the game, however.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035772491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1555536768}
review: This is an interesting game that implements pinball into platforming and it's well designed too doesn't feel gimmicky or forced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260841416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1573247976}
review:
我好开心我买了这款游戏。
刚开始玩就开开心心沉浸4小时，画面Q弹，音乐轻快，关卡设计有难度有挑战但是不难，尽管我手残在大忽悠那里经常卡。。。而且很多细节都非常的有新意！！满分10分我给100！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197968621225', 'num_games_owned': 1679, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1689618599}
review:
This game is just a little gem which is so fun to discover when you don't expect it.
It's definitely a metroidvania with pinball gameplay and it reminds me Sonic Spinball in some aspects.

It's not a difficult game like recent metroidvanias tend to be, it's even pretty easy - you don't have to be a pinball expert. But it's so refreshing. Graphics are really nice, characters are so cute and more importantly game design is so clever, that you just want to keep playing.

The thing is that the game feels a bit too short with less than 10 hours to finish. It's so addictive that it can be finished in a week-end. But I definitely enjoyed every moment of it.

Also even though it's not supported on Linux, it runs like a native game thanks to Proton.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013975647', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1554663956}
review: Fun and unique pinball game that combines 2d metroid exploration with traditional pinball mechanics. The controls takes a bit getting used to since you have to switch between arrow keys for moving and shift keys for the pinball segments regularly. It's a minor complaint though and if you like pinball games then this is worth trying. It's even got a demo; in 2019!

author: {'steamid': '76561198223861648', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1544664695}

author: {'steamid': '76561198437252725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1590907967}
review: 非常棒的一款冒险-动作-解密-弹球类游戏，画面精美，配乐好听，操作手感很好，动画非常精致。 想起小时候下载的《幻想游戏》系列，很高兴依然有游戏制作方明白什么是游戏，而不是做一款复杂冗长的巨型“游戏软件”然后美名其曰“硬核”。

review: Unos bichitos muy simpáticos, una adaptación del clásico pinball y un juego con historia y misiones secundarias entretenidas. Recomendado sobre todo para peques ya que no tiene gran complicación mecánica. Visualmente muy bonito y una música de lo más agradable :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198391941772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1532342606}
review:
非常好的一款游戏，是我在steam上自己看中的第一款游戏！
打弹珠+地图解谜，画面可爱，音乐轻松，打发时间，全成就会稍微有一点难度~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198004423189', 'num_games_owned': 4454, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1554048713}
review:
А вот, смотрите, очень милая и симпатичная игра. Навозного жучка Йоку кораблекрушением забросило на остров и, в результате совпадения (как раз в этот момент местный почтмейстер решил уйти), он оказывается в должности почтальона. Ну, разумеется, очень скоро оказывается, что одной почты мало, и нам опять надо спасать мир. Хоть мир этот, для разнообразия, и весьма небольшой, и сводится к одному острову.

Впрочем, небольшой он в "объективном" плане. А для навозного жучка он ого-го какой здоровый. Тут полно местных колоритных обитателей, квестов, секретов, тайных проходов, неочевидных механик и дополнительных инструментов, позволяющих доступ в новые места. Да, это, разумеется, метроидвания. Красивая, атмосферная, тщательно прорисованная метроидвания.

Есть, правда, одна интересная особенность: поскольку наш жук не расстаётся со своим навозным шариком, летать и даже прыгать у него не выйдет. Ходить - да. Падать - разумеется. Но как попадать в верхние части острова? Для этого повсюду расставлены разноцветные платформы, швыряющие шарик туда и сюда. Да, это пинбол. Метроидвания-пинбол!

В отличие от недавно пройденной Rollers of the Realm, здесь механики пинбола куда более органично вплетены в мир (ну, не считая, правда, глобального вопроса "откуда взялись все эти платформы и чисто пинбольные призы." Магия, видимо). "Шарик" здесь ровно один - твой - и он действительно шарик. Дополнительные шары порой проскакивают, но им всегда есть объяснение (так, в одном месте нужно приготавливать напиток, загоняя ингредиенты - шары). Все остальные местные жители, да и сам жук, выглядят вполне естественно. И нарисованы очень хорошо. Даже я б сказал, замечательно.

Если не делать побочные квесты - игра очень казуальна и прекрасно подойдёт для детей (при условии, что у них есть какая-никакая реакция, правда. Но вот у меня с ней плохо, и то я прекрасно справился). Смертей здесь нет, даже в сражениях с боссами, и даже если плохо играть в пинболл, потерять можно только местную валюту - фрукты, но их наваливают безумные горы, всё равно переполняя счётчик. При желании, игру можно легко и непринуждённо пройти часов за 6-7, строго следуя сюжету.

Но если отклониться в сторону, казуальность резко снижается, а порой и совсем пропадает. Нет, умереть нельзя по-прежнему, но игра набита "прыжками" с точностью до пикселя, сложными многоходовыми комбинациями и неочевидным использованием внутриигровых механик (например, шарик можно перекрашивать, и, хоть это нигде не говорится, его цвет позволяет пройти несколько квестов - их невозможно пройти, не научившись раскраске). "Настоящий" конец достигается, только если собрать все "семена" - а это невозможно, если не использовать все механики по максимуму.

Все остальные ингредиенты метроидвании тут тоже в наличии, такие, например, как бешеное количество вещей, которые надо собрать, система быстрого перемещения - и шикарная автокарта! Добавьте к этому вышеупомянутую очень хорошую графику, и вы поймёте, почему я говорю: игра рекомендуется всем. Редкий экземпляр. 9.8 из 10.

Не 10, потому что дурацкая система приближения/удаления срабатывает сильно не в ста процентах случаев. Как правило, это безвредно - ну, увидите чуть больше или чуть меньше, чем планировалось. Но пару раз она меня доставала, вплоть до уровня "неиграбельно" - приходилось уходить "на ощупь" и возвращаться обратно. Кроме того, размещение станций быстрого перемещение таково, что ближайшие станции вечно оказываются не там, где я нахожусь и куда мне надо, а в пяти (реальных) минутах ходьбы и на входе и на выходе. И, кстати, выходов у неё сильно больше, чем входов, это они зря. Но это всё - совершеннейшие мелочи, на самом деле. Ещё раз повторюсь: игру усиленно рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017189249', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1543267702}
review:
You’re a huge fan of Pinball, and played “3D Pinball Space Cadet” for hours and hours, but since Windows Vista you feel empty?
Oh, and you also love this kind of beetles that push dung balls around all day?
Wow, then, I just got THE game for you!

Yoku’s Island Express is about a bug pushing a ball around trying to save the island from a mischievous God. Although it can push the ball around, there are pinball paddles everywhere on the island, and a small tap on LT or RT will send the ball flying, dragging our small helpless Yoku through mazes. I really liked the idea of adding pinball mechanics inside a platformer game, it’s novative and creates interesting levels.

But it quickly can become boring, when some parts are too difficult and you just rage about why your ball is not going where you want to (but maybe that’s what pinball is all about?).
Nevertheless, the game can get especially boring when you have to go through an area again to find collectibles or just move to the next destination. Like in a Metroidvania, you gain different powers as you explore, but those are most of the time used to reach new zones, and don’t help much traversing old zones, so you often have to redo some parts over and over again while more shortcuts would have been appreciated.

There is a fast travel though. You can go to a beehive and be thrown from beehive to beehive until your destination, making some kind of zipline. It’s totally integrated inside the lore, and the bee music is amazing! But you can only get into these beehives from certain locations, and I feel there are too few of those spots. I spent a lot of time planning routes to the closest beehive, and ending pushing my ball longer than was really needed.

Nevertheless, this game’s really cute, the graphics are amazing, especially given the small size of the game studio. The music also adds a lot to the beautiful scenery the game offers.
(Oh, and the devs attached me to a huge boulder and put me on a big paddle, so I shouldn’t say too many bad things... Oh dung, I think they heard meeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee *)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976028334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1551787496}
review: Yoku's Island Express was a breath of fresh tropical air that is an easy recommendation. This is a fun adventure game with touches of Metroidvania and kind of reminded me of Tomba as well. The game plays like a traditional 2d sidescroller, but the hook is your character moves through areas like a pinball through the machine. Most of the challenge of the game comes from timing the right shot and figuring out how to get to that area that you can see, but can't quite reach. Yoku's rewards careful observation of the environment. There are even hidden challenges hiding in plain site that I didn't notice for a really long time. There is a lot to do in this game. It took me well over 10 hours to complete the main quest. There are still a few of the really tough challenges to finish as well that will probably double the play time if I go back to finish them all. Yoku's Island Express was such a fun time to play through. If this kind of game looks like your jam, then you really should play it asap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060835967', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1554500453}
review: Um jogo lindo que combina duas coisas completamente diferentes em algo único e coeso de se jogar. A arte é bonita juntamente com a trilha sonora. No entanto, por se tratar de pinball em basicamente 90% das partes, depender da física as vezes é um pouco cansativo, mas recompensador no fim. Vale o preço cheio mas por ser casual, espere uma promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120222580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1545529728}
review:
A refreshing take on metroidvanias, hits the mark in every aspects (Looks pretty!) and is overall a pretty fun, relaxing and lenghty pinballvania game. The pinball aspect could have used a bit more depth, but oh well. The game doesn't ever become a challenge.

Unique and pretty good, with a few minor issues that can be ignored, like the collectibles being a currency sometimes required to advance which breaks the flow of the game, but it's acquired fast and easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027364206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1552680732}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a very fun, unique take on the Metroidvania subgenre.  The pinball gameplay makes navigating the colorful world satisfying and the sense of momentum is very effective.  The pinball-table-style segments of the game add variety to the world but the pinball physics aren't exact.  They do not have the consistency of a real pinball game due to the lack of control of the speed of the paddles, which is key to any true pinball experience.  Another downside is some of the "table" segments can require aggravating levels of precision, add in RNG-based exploding slugs that can end up just about anywhere in your path disrupting the flow and some parts of Yoku are far more frustrating than they needed to be.

All that said, this is a fun game, and fans of unique experiences will find enjoyment here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347107320', 'num_games_owned': 3094, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1552562565}
review:
推荐手柄操作，键鼠基本没问题，但是在潜水操作上需要一手控制方形一手连按enter略感别扭，而手柄只需要左手摇杆右手A方便很多
本评测含有部分攻略性剧透，已使用剧透代码，请想要自行探索的朋友不要点
[spoiler]都说了别点 ←v←[/spoiler]

[h1]8/10 恶魔城风味的弹珠来一串儿[/h1]
（请自行调整：休闲爱好者+1，硬核爱好者-2）
去年玩到的平台游戏里玩得最开心的是《A Hat In Time》，今年到目前为止就是这款《Yoku's Island Express》（但并不是说它们有多少共同点，不如说某些思路刚好相反）虽然它们都能用整体上可爱休闲的氛围让玩家切实地感到放松和愉悦，但不同于淳朴、纯粹、充满沉浸感、偶尔天马行空的“任式快乐”，看似独辟蹊径地将Metroidvania和弹珠相结合的本作，倒更像是个伪装过的学院派作品，就好比一个用方罐子压成的鸡蛋，初看非常惊喜——因为你从来没吃过方形鸡蛋，但是尝了味道之后就知道，罐子还是那个罐子，鸡蛋也还是那个鸡蛋，真正使它成为一道可口菜肴的，依然是祖传调料——非线性进程、无缝大地图、丰富多彩的收集元素、饱含新能力解锁的自由探险——和精心烹制——亮眼的手绘美术、轻快的热带风情音乐、温馨可爱的角色互动以及超友好的难度设计。

[h1]简短的剧情和温馨生动的氛围[/h1]
这个游戏是没多少剧情的，一只叫Yoku的蜣螂前往Mokumana小岛担任新的邮递员，在就职时被托付了重要的任务，要将某些信息传达给另外三个地方的部落酋长，分别帮助它们解决困难，共同对抗敌人，最后小岛恢复宁静，“[strike]全村的[/strike]希望”重获新生……非常老套的剧情吧（笑
不光是主线简短，支线和路上NPC的对话也没几句，但就是这样短小的文本不时透露着令人忍不住微笑的细节，比如：
◇开始遇到一个兔子向你推销大背包，当你表示水果（通用货币）不够的时候它会说“别担心，我知道没钱的感觉，你先拿着，等有钱了再来付”，之后你再来给钱它会夸你是个诚实的好孩子；
◇开了给小球换肤功能后喷漆店的店长会对球的外观评价一番“甲虫？挺温馨，但是不够时尚”“宝石骨头？很有诗意，财富也阻止不了时光的流逝”
◇蜜蜂洞里穿着蜜蜂服的NPC会向你解释蜂道BGM“这首曲子会让蜜蜂产生很时髦的感觉”
◇做完怪威洛的一系列谜题任务后[spoiler]他发现自己被好友安巴巴耍了，觉得解开谜题也没什么开心的，安巴巴会笑着说：“不要太担心了，威洛，做个二流的人没什么不好的呀”[/spoiler]

类似细节远不止这几个，不同种族的NPC说话时会有不同的神秘语言音效，有些还有表情和肢体动作，玩的时候仿佛真的看见了这样的一个独立的迷人的小小世界。
， 
[h1]大幅简化的战斗和跳跃[/h1]
作为一款平台游戏，本作的难度像它的画面一样人畜无害（对硬核玩家来说就太无聊了）。
首先是零死亡惩罚，弹珠台里失误只是碰到荆棘减2-4个水果，而在弹珠台里的水果是随着时间再生、无限量供应的，减几个水果根本不痛不痒，失误次数多了也不会损失任何潜在奖励，可以说是很休闲了。
另一个，也是最主要的降低难度的设计：这个游戏里所有平台类常见操作都被一个动作取代了，就是弹射，回忆一下平时玩到的此类游戏，平台间跳跃要考虑时机和力度，战斗要考虑先选用什么技能，什么时候防御，什么时候跳，在使用技能时还要小心不能掉下平台，而在本作中的情况则是，跳跃？按挡板。攻击？按挡板。吃水果？按挡板。传送？到蜂道按挡板。即使是后期的吸炸弹和钩爪操作也只是长按挡板键，也就是说：

除了停下来查看地图背包外，[b]绝大部分时间玩家只需要方向键和左右两个挡板键就够了[/b]功能键的简化大大降低了游戏难度，恶魔城游戏核心之一的战斗和跳跃操作到了本作中，[b]玩家只需要掌握时机就可以了[/b]，而时机这个东西恰恰是很容易熟能生巧的，所以从成就统计里可以看到本作的主线通关率高达42.2%。

[h1]探索、能力和解谜[/h1]
核心之一的战斗和跳跃已经变得非常佛性了，剩下的大地图探索和能力成长自然格外重要，这一点上本作处理得很好，或者说很典型：结合包括道路折返、技能解锁、强化道具和探索新区域在内的简单机制，设置非线性的主线和若干支线，在地图中藏大量含有一定解谜要素的收集品和隐藏区域，使玩家可以用多种方式渐进地探索等等。
整个大地图无缝衔接，除了打开时间长了偶尔有几次小卡之外都是流畅的，地图中共有30个邮箱、80个柳条，大约40个宝箱（没具体数）和十来个支线，而这些收集品的获取方式也各不相同，除了最常见的明放在在较难到达的地点，其余的有各种各样的获取途径，比如：
◇潜水到底端发现隐藏通道
◇[spoiler]在骨髓山溶洞前有个摸鱼打瞌睡的骷髅帮看守，你在它旁边吹小喇叭他会给你一个水果让你别吵，再吹再给，最后受不了了会说求你安静会儿，这个也给你，然后给你一根柳条[/spoiler]
◇[spoiler]在高处的物品需要玩家吸附一个炸弹后背对，靠爆炸的推力冲上去获取[/spoiler]
◇[spoiler]在某个支线里要与蜂后对话，这时候NPC提示需要蜜蜂服，通过在喷漆店组合“爬行喷漆”和“甜味喷漆”获得黄蜂皮肤，然后换上皮肤才能通行[/spoiler]
……
而制作组在努力使游戏富有挑战的同时也也没有故意为难玩家，地图上直接标出的任务指引、（获得某些道具后）的收集品标记、空中的快速通道“蜂道“和大量自动存档点都给玩家的探索收集之旅带来了极大的便利。

[h1]匮乏的重玩性[/h1]
还记得开头说的方鸡蛋吗？
普通的鸡蛋是从A点向上跳跃到B点。
yoku牌方鸡蛋是：从A点弹出，经过4个球洞的传递，穿过一段8字形的轨道，在两面弹力墙之间反复横跳，最后被一块挡板弹射，向斜上方冲出，滑行落到B点。
这个弹珠取代的设计确实非常新颖有趣，但是再怎么酷炫也改变不了它的本质，就是一个从A点到B点预设好的位移动作而已，第一次看到觉得惊艳，习惯了之后并不会给游戏体验带来太大的惊喜。
尤其是战斗上，纵观本作所有的弹珠台和boss战，可以说基本上还是大同小异，作为核心机制的弹珠游戏，依然没有跳出十年前甚至几十年前弹珠的老套路，甚至我觉得还比不上经典的三维弹球……难度也丝毫无法让人生出反复挑战的欲望。
剩下的解谜和探索不用说都是一次性体验，由于主线通关可以继续自由探索，所以当全地图全收集做完之后这个游戏是没有重玩价值的，我自己通关后意犹未尽地搭着蜂线在小岛四处转悠，但要让我再开一个新档二周目，我也是拒绝的。 

话虽如此，个人还是非常喜欢这款游戏，像我这样往常只能卡在1/3流程的平台苦手，也愿意一口气爆肝15小时自己摸索着打一个100%，打完最终结局还舍不得删游戏。并不是因为弹珠有多好玩，只是这种小小世界温馨的氛围和自由探索的乐趣，会让我想起小时候玩一会沙雕游戏就能轻易获得的，纯粹的“玩”的快乐。
[quote=悄咪咪测评]
关注悄咪咪测评，每天悄咪咪的给你推荐一个好游戏<3
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34041140/]悄咪咪点一下这里关注[/url]
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024358540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1552509068}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a fantastic mashup-up of Metroidvania-style exploration and pinball -- 2 styles that have rarely, if ever, been paired in a single game. You play as Yoku, a dung beetle that's been sent to a small island to replace a retiring mailman. That's the story. You quickly learn, however, that all is not well on the island, and you are the one that's best suited to solve the major crisis as well a many other lesser tasks. Don't expect a complex story though because you won't find one, not that this game needs it. YIE is all about bright, colorful, varied environments and fun gameplay.

Yoku is tethered to a marble as he traverses the 2-D side-scrolling environment, which is divided between standard pathways & platforms and "tables," where the pinball mechanics take over. Yoku can't jump or scale steep landscape so all vertical movement is enabled by the paddles within the pinball-style segments or springboards that provide the same function in the rest of the world.

Overall the gameplay isn't difficult, though there will likely be a few puzzles that may trip you up at least for a while. As you travel and complete tasks, some optional, your rewards will allow traversal to become easier and quicker. The entire island isn't well connected to the fast travel system, but most of the time it's adequate. A 100% completion game can be accomplished at 12-14 hours depending on the player. Gameplay was so enjoyable that I went for completion and would highly recommend going for it.

Yoku's Island Express is a fun, fresh creation that has accessible gameplay and is family friendly. I rarely play games to completion, and even after I did I wanted more. Here's to hoping that we get more of this style game from Villa Gorilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989990554', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1585496289}
review:
[h1]A Wholesome Experience[/h1]

If the premise of an open, vibrant, metroidvania-esque world with pinball challenges sounds interesting to you then I wholeheartedly recommend you to buy the game. If you would like to know a bit more about the game before taking the plunge I suggest reading the whole review.

[b]Gameplay 7/10[/b]

The gameplay formula of mashing together pinball and open world exploration sounds a bit foreign at first, but it only takes a couple minutes of gameplay for it to feel completely natural. Travelling the open world without a jump button and just the ball you roll with is rewarding on its own. Traversing the world and backtracking with new unlocks opens the island more for the usual metroidvania collectible and equipment hunt. These always revolve around noticing something strange, solving a puzzle or exploring outside the normal paths. Nothing special, but if you enjoy these sort of things the will do quite nicely.

Instead of enemies the pinball "boards" on the island act as one of the game's challenges. I'm not a pinball enthusiast, but I think the pinball challenges are on the simpler side. Many of them are really easy and quite enjoyable with classic pinball klinks and klangs and offer progression and as a side challenge some extra currency. I wasn't in love of the pinball parts, but I didn't hate them either. Then there are a couple really frustrating ones. I was stuck at getting a trickshot into a narrow tunnel or trying to angle a blast through the air with exploding slugs. Either I'm bad at pinball or sometimes the slug blasts and flippers on the pinball segments aren't consistent on their physics. Most of the times I felt like I lucked out instead of achieving something with my own skill. There's only a few though so it just a minor gripe I have.

[b]Story 6/10[/b]

The game doesn't offer a lot on the story front to be honest. It delivers what it has in a sweet way and I didn't expect a pinball game to have a story, lore or characters at all so there's that. I wish I could've gotten more than a single dialogue from most of the charming characters. A hidden journal or environmental storytelling on the characters could have breathed some life into them, but again I don't think the characters were a big focus so I wont hold it against the game. Also more lore on the islands ancient gods or tribes would've been cool, but it's not like the game terribly needs it.

[b]Graphics 8/10[/b]

The game looks quite pretty with vibrant colours and fast pinball movement. The island's world design is good and feels internally consistent. Some character art and animations could be better, but yet again they aren't integral to the experience. Nothing major to complain here.

[b]Sound 8/10[/b]

The sound effects of the game are very good with the mechanical sounds of the pinball boards and ambient sounds crisp and on point. The music was pretty good, but forgettable and I don't think I will listen to the soundtrack outside the game.

[b]Conclusion[/b]

I stumbled onto the game on steam accidentally and I really enjoy metroidvanias and was happy to find one with minimal combat for a change. If you like metroidvanias, pinball and wholesome things you really can't go wrong with this one. I ended up completing the game in one sitting which tells me it didn't overstay its welcome, which is a good thing. The game is more than the sum of it's parts and leaves a smile on your face. I feel like this would be an excellent game for kids and their parents would enjoy this short and sweet experience as well. It's also cheap and well worth your money.

Thanks to Villa Gorilla for this great game!

[h1]Final Score: 8/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198142946495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1558227045}
review: Gorgeous game.  What a beautiful world, perfectly matched and expertly produced soundtrack, awesome characters, creativity and uniqueness, and most of all, buttery-smooth and fluid gameplay.  I didn't encounter a single glitch in this game, so well done for coding such a difficult concept flawlessly.  I did have probably 300ms of lag on my controller, not sure why as it's usually very good (xbox360 using Bluetooth), but it just added to the challenge I suppose!  Plenty to do in the world, lots of extra quests and tough achievements.  I'd play this game through again it was so fun.  A little short, but so fun it didn't matter.  You'd be silly, just downright silly not to play this and give it a positive review.  Looking forward to the next one Villa Gorilla!!  Oh, and everything is so ridiculously cute and funny...

author: {'steamid': '76561198040993197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1551895023}
review:
An awesome twist to the metroidvania formula. Incorporating pinball mechanics into the game world works really well, especially for the puzzles and for traversing the game quickly later on. By "puzzles", I mostly mean small  pinball "tables" that you have to overcome. In contrast to RL pinball, the movement is more predictable, which is crucial in order to minimize frustration. To top it off, I find the game to be very, very charming. A cute animal world and a happy soundtrack.

I'll probably feel a little sad when I complete this game.

EDIT: I did feel sad indeed when the game failed to load my save file and synchronized a new game with the steam cloud. All progress gone. Close to completing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036029370', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1551033081}
review:
Side Scroller mundo abierto donde manejas a un escarabajo pelotero que tiene su bolita, la gracia es que el diseño de los niveles es estilo pinball, con los flippers, de manera que vas jugando un poco pinball y otro poco con el movimiento clásico para los lados. Es una mezcla extraña que gracias a los esfuerzos de Villa Gorilla funciona muy bien.

Los controles son muy simples, 2 botones para los flippers, izquierdo y derecho, y un botón más para interactuar con el resto de las cosas. Perfecto. Creo que parte del encanto del título es justamente la simpleza de los controles.

Tiene unos cuantos items por coleccionar, vas a tener que explorar el mapa de lo lindo. Hablando de mapa, todo el juego transcurre en una isla enorme en la que te podes mover y desbloquear nuevas zonas, a lo metroidvania.
Los diálogos y las quest de los personajes son geniales, al igual que la trama en general. Un juego que se presta para acercar a niños y a jugadores casuales al mundo del vicio.

El arte es fenomenal, muy amigable a la vista, con colores vibrantes y lleno de detalles gráficos por todos lados. La música no se queda atrás, los temas grabados en vivo con toques de electrónica empastan perfectamente con la idea del juego, buen trabajo Jesse Harlin; el sonido también es una joyita, los efectos y las transiciones refuerzan la inmersión un 300%.

¿Me lo llevo?

+Si, no vale dudar. Muy recomendado.
+Por lejos, uno de los mejores juegos del 2018.
+El diseño de niveles se lleva el Nobel.
+La mezcla entre el sistema estético de los colores de las pelotitas y las quest me pareció absurdamente genial.
-Puede que llegar al 100% te sea medio embole.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981536799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1549817693}
review: Tolles entschleunigtes Abenteuer mit einem herausragenden Leveldesign. Bei diesem Spiel spürt man förmlich die Liebe und den Spaß der Entwickler. Auch die Kombination aus den Genres "Jump ’n’ Run", "Flipper" und "Adventure" fühlt sich frisch und unverbraucht an. Die Grafik ist unglaublich liebevoll produziert und animiert. Das perfekte Spiel, wenn man einfach mal die Seele baumeln lassen will z. B. nach dem Feierabend. Wer das Spiel einfach nur einmal beenden will, der wird nicht länger als zehn Stunden benötigen, allerdings gibt es danach noch genug zu tun für weitere zehn Stunden. Vielleicht ist das Spiel etwas zu leicht und die Schwierigkeit besteht in der Regel darin, dass man einen Weg von A nach B finden muss auf der Insel, wo das Abenteuer spielt. Mir fallen aber beim besten Willen keine anderen Kritikpunkte ein, sondern nur Lob und daher eine klare Kaufempfehlung von mir!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971442549', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1550342062}
review:
It's a metroidvania pinball platformer.

Yes, that's right. Pinball.

And it is the most fun I've ever had with the pinball idea. It's imaginative, fun and beautifully frustrating at times. The story is sweet and the whole thing just works so nicely. I've rolled from one surprise into the next, with a big smile on my face.

+ Beautiful painted graphics.
+ Very nice sound design.
+ Satisfying controls and physics.
+ Surprisingly helpful map system.

- Sometimes requires very precise shots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058751082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1565292695}
review:
Yeah, it's pinball. Progression feels metroidvania-esque, but it is through and through a pinball game, and most of the time you will be doing essentially the same things over and over: breaking blocks, hitting switches, and guiding your ball to where you want to go. It's relaxing for sure, and the presentation certainly tries to make you [i]feel[/i] like you're constantly discovering new ways to play, but there are very few actual mechanics that deviate from this core formula.

[b]HOWEVER,[/b] coming from someone who enjoyed the addictive gameplay loop of Peggle, I have to say...

I don't care. This is too much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030107558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1544994048}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1548820322}
review:
The words "Open-world Pinball Metroidvania" are a rare combination, so this is a pretty unique game. The combination of genres works very well. There's absolutely no combat except a couple "boss battle" pinball tables, instead it alternates between proper pinball tables and smaller, more free-flow flipper-based challenges. The abilities you gather feel very in-line with the normal movement mechanics. It does a surprisingly good job of keeping things fresh as you go despite the simple core mechanics, I never felt like it was padding.

Overall it's a pretty laid-back game, and not hugely difficult, but it is quite fun. I clocked in 6 hours when I beat the final boss with 62% completion rating, which isn't unreasonable length for a Metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010715702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1548800293}
review:
This game was a very pleasant surprise. I heard from it thanks to David Erick Ramos in youtube. A pinball metroidvania game with a cute art style and music that included a musician I love? I had to check it out.

What I got in the end was exactly as advertised, a pinball metroidvania game where most of the gameplay involves pinball mechanics. Your hero can walk and do a small amount of things not completely related to pinball, but that's only like 10% of the game and its mostly used to make things a bit more accesible. Most of the traveling, fighting, and puzzles, are done pinball. There's even some very fun concepts added like the ability to grappling hook into certain obstacles when your ball passes through them and then using the momentum to swing at certain directions.

The story is very simple but effective. The art style is what you see on the promotional material and it creates a very special and fun world. It even got quite a bit of extra content for anyone wanting to do more than just the main story.

If I'm honest, I'm not the biggest fan of pinball which is why I only finished the main story and did some small side activities as of this written review. But the game was still very charming and worth it to me with the time I played and I recommend it to anyone that is curious about it.

Its fair to say that if you absolutely hate pinball do not buy the game though lol. But otherwise I think anyone can enjoy this little game here. Great job Developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339986746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1548581138}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048001693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1671396249}
review: Pinball video games usually disappoint me. I would rather go to an arcade and play on a real machine with real physics because it is just better. Villa Gorilla found a way to make a pinball video game and add adventure elements to make it fun and worth while. I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988417915', 'num_games_owned': 1002, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1548339575}
review:
LIndo juego que mezcla metrodvian con pinball. Lo unico de lo que me puedo quejar es el movimiento de camara al usar una habilidad muy especifica, pero es algo menor.
Graficos muy lindos, historia simple, pero es uno de esos juegos que te hacen querer ganarlo al 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874824184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1520, 'last_played': 1633548091}
review: I love pinball and I love games where you can go along a story. This game has both! The story is fun (and the inhabitants of the islands are great), the pictures are stunningly beautiful, and even the music is lovely. Try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160878337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1548168805}
review: Yokus Island Express hat eine interessante Spielmechanik. Neben den klassischen Metroidvania bekommt man es in diesem Spiel mit Pinball Elementen zu tun, zudem spielt man einen Mistkäfer der Postbote werden möchte. Kling komisch? Ist es auch, aber irgendwie total genial. Das Spiel hat ein guten flow und teils auch coole Rätsel, manche eher leichter manche aber auch eher schwerer. Die Story ist simpel gehalten und hat jetzt nicht den großartigen Plot twist, aber das Gameplay überzeugt durchaus. Außerdem hat das Spiel entspannte Musik, schöne Grafik und eine übersichtliche Map. Ich habe so eine Art von Spiel noch nie gezockt, aber Yokus Island Express hat mich sofort in Begeisterung gehüllt. Von mir gibt es eine Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674497', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1547793056}
review:
I'm not sure how Villa Gorilla thought to take the traditional 2D puzzle platform and turn it into an open world adventure pinball game with cute characters and beautiful hand-drawn art, but they did it. Yoku's is a lot of fun, and one of the few games I've not only finished but 100%ed. 

I decided to check it out after hearing about its award nominations. It definately deserves them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994122551', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1657505826}
review:
I really liked this game as it reminded me for [b]Flipnic: Ultimate Pinball[/b]. Ever since then I was waiting for a good mix of pinball adventure game but there weren't any notable ones up to finding this nice game. The physics could be getting used to for a while, but that is how any pinball game are. And because this is a pinball game, don't expect every shot to go where you wanted to the first few times. The adventure aspect is good, there are a few quests that make you go back and forth but not that many times as well as some thought needed for minor puzzles, especially parts where you [i]think[/i] you would need a jump control. There is some form of quick travel incase you don't want to manually traverse the terrain again.

Overall, I think it is alright to 100% this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031595294', 'num_games_owned': 3361, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1547912587}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970222712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1548207149}
review: It's simple, really: playing this game makes me happy. The feel, the pinball-like game play, the exploration, and the music all contribute to what is just a fun, happy game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003970062', 'num_games_owned': 2038, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1547370344}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express is an open-world 2D Metroidvania Pinball game.

Yes, really.

I have played a couple of creative pinball games in recent years, but this is by far the best of them. Yoku’s Island Express makes use of pinball mechanics to navigate a large 2D island environment, collecting various upgrades that allow you to progress to new areas without fundamentally upsetting the core pinball nature of the game.

The main character of the game is Yoku, a dung beetle who has been appointed as the postmaster of Mokumana Island. Rather than rolling around a ball of dung, however, Yoku rolls around a large, smooth round stone which doubles as a pinball. Yoku can roll the ball around on relatively flat ground, allowing them to move around the island between puzzles and engage in other navigation. Yoku has no ability to jump and cannot go up steep inclines, requiring you to find other means – the numerous paddles distributed around the world – to make your way around.

This allows the game to be more than a bunch of pinball tables, instead interspersing with other forms of environmental navigation. While paddles appear quite heavily in the game, many springboards also appear, launching the player through the air. Acquired abilities like swinging off of flowers, diving underwater, and sucking up explosive slugs serve to allow the player to access new areas, as well as mixing up the core pinball game with some other pinball-esque environmental navigation.

All of this allows the game to include the secrets and exploration that is key to Metroidvania games, while simultaneously mixing up the gameplay and keeping it fresh and allowing the player to navigate the island and access what amounts to a bunch of environmental pinball tables. The variety here is reasonable – the game not only has a bunch of traditional pinball, but also has sections where the player must play with what amounts to multiple pinballs at the same time. The game even features (fairly simple) boss fights in the form of pinball tables!

The game is also quite aesthetically pleasing. The whole island is very vibrantly colored, and the 2D hand-drawn art here is quite excellent. While the characters are mostly fairly limited in their animation, they still are fun to look at, and there’s a nice variety of environments, from a dark and dreary underground to vibrant tropical beaches to overcast rainforest to snowy mountain peaks.

Yoku’s Island Express is unapologetically a family game, suitable for people of all ages, so long as they don’t find pinball too frustrating. The animal characters in the game are mostly very cutesy, but they aren’t excessively so – they’re basically the sorts of things you’d expect in a family game, generally being fairly one-dimensional, but doing their job in populating the world and giving the player hints in where to go and a small number of quests to do. There’s only a relatively small amount of cartoonish violence, and on the whole, this is a broadly acceptable game. The humor in it is fairly light, and while it never made me laugh out loud, I found myself enjoying the game for what it was.

Following on the idea of broad accessibility, there’s no way to die in this game. Where there is a drain for your ball to fall into in a number of puzzles, the penalty is at worst only a few fruit, the game’s currency that you end up with far too much of anyway, and which can easily be made up for; the player will then quickly be put back into play to continue trying to solve the physics puzzle. Thus, the challenge is not in running out of lives or anything so mundane, but in simply completing the pinball puzzles, which are of a reasonable level of difficulty – not excessive, but not so easy that it feels facile. These are definitely not the hardest pinball tables of all time, but for someone like me who only periodically plays pinball, it was fairly easy but difficult enough that I felt like I was modestly challenged by a number of the puzzles.

Yoku’s Island Express knows what it wants to be, and also knows that it only has so many tricks to show the player. Thus, the game only clocks in around 6-8 hours to beat, and perhaps 10-12 if the player wants to get everything. I felt like the game was the appropriate length; while I enjoyed my time with it, I’m not sure how much more of it I would have actually enjoyed.

And while the secrets are harder to get that just completing the game, on the whole, it isn’t too frustrating. The game includes some in-game hints, such as maps that can be purchased to show the locations of missed unlockables on the map, which helps serve to allow the player to collect everything by the end, so the player hopefully won’t be wandering around blind – but I missed one of these maps when I played through, and only figured out how to get to it at the very end of the game. There’s a couple of tricks that the game never explicitly tells you, but that also allows you feel kind of smart for figuring them out; these tricks aren’t critical to completing the game, but are the only way to get some of the secrets.

All in all, this is a game I’d recommend, especially to people who enjoy pinball mechanically but who feel like playing the same tables over and over again gets repetitive. The game makes use of pinball mechanics in a very novel way, and as a whole it was a pleasure to experience this game. There’s no grand story here, just a fairly simple and satisfying gameplay experience.

review:
solid metroidvania that revolves around pinball mechanics for movement

so if you really like pinball it's sick. if you sorta like pinball it's still fun

but i don't really see much enjoyment in 100%ing the game since the movement is so pinball-dependent - you could be stuck on some areas for longer then you want if you're not hitting your shots on point.

then again i suck at pinball.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001293080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1683363004}
review:
Possibly the best platformer I've ever played. I do say that as a filthy casual when it comes to these games so make of it what you will.

The good:
+Engaging story and interesting characters,
+Nice cartoony/paint graphics,
+Soothing music,
+Interesting, unusual gameplay,
The bad:
-There's at least one place where, if you mess up, you can never attempt to obtain the rewards (it doesn't block the main story but you will not be able to complete it 100%), no do-overs,
-Most of it can be too easy for genre veterans and the difficulty level can uneven at times, especially the final challenge is a lot easier than most that led to it,
-It's too short! I completed about 80% of the game, including the main story, and it took me only 12h :/
The ugly:
NOTHING! It's beautiful!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963942135', 'num_games_owned': 2342, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1546836922}
review:
This game deserves way more attention; it's just fantastic.  A puzzle platforming pinball adventure game is a genre string that's a little hard to conceive of, but it just absolutely clicks once you see it in action.  Brilliant execution on a superbly interesting idea; great kudos to this development team for pulling it off.  The music is pretty great too.  :)

My wife and I kinda devoured this one, and got 100% in ~16 hours (there's a fair amount of idle padding our playtime on this one due to various interruptions).

Highly recommended!  My wife really loved it, and she has no particular relationship with the component genres or pinball in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984861145', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1558727499}
review:
Not the best pinball game I've ever played, nor the best Metroidvania...

But, well, I never thought I'd see a combo of the two. 

Very charming and just plain happy feeling, but best enjoyed in small doses at a time due to... well, the pinball thing feeling so random without analog input. If you can pace yourself to avoid frustration, though, then it's a darn charming and unique experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993462177', 'num_games_owned': 1669, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1546538454}
review: The pinball mechanics are fun and you're a dung beetle who is also a postmaster. This game is incredibly charming, from the art, music, and character design to the simple act of delivering the mail to the far corners of the island. The fast travel system's access points aren't always as nearby as I would like at times, but traversing the world is enjoyable if you aren't in a hurry.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961435898', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1546524470}
review:
Bought this on a whim after seeing it mentioned as one the underlooked gems of 2018 and watching the trailer, I ended up blasting through it in a couple of days, completely engrossed to it's funny and bizarre world. Combining pinball mechanics with Metroidvania-like world structure and exploration is an unexpectedly awesome idea, and the way the developers nailed it both in concept and execution while tying it all together with beautiful visuals and a charming little story about a small dung beetle uncovering ancient secrets of a tropical island while working as its mail man is very impressive. The soundtrack - combining tropical sounds and melodies reminiscent of Donkey Kong Country with electronic downtempo/lofi beats, jazz and at times almost davidgilmouresque smooth guitar riffs is [i]quite[/i] excellent too!
 
My only gripe with the game was that maybe the fast travel points could have been a bit faster to access and use, but given that this is a pretty tight and well-paced experience regardless, it's not a huge issue at all. 

Absolutely delightful and charming game overall, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261846765', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1591385996}
review:
J'ai acheté le jeu sur un coup de tête et je ne le regrette pas.

Pour commencer le jeu est beau,très beau. Le level design est sympathique et peu répétitif et l'ile en elle même est assez grande et diversifiée avec des biomes comme la montagne en passant par la jungle et la plage.
 Des personnages attachants et bien animés et des quêtes toutes différentes et originales. D'après moi le jeu est malheuresement un peu court et mériterait un dlc ou un second opus (surtout vu qu'une grosse partie de la carte reste inutilisée).

 Maintenant qua j'ai parlé du jeu en lui même,parlons du gameplay. la physique est bien codée et les séctions de pinball possèdent des mécaniques de jeu intéressantes que je n'ai vu nulle part ailleurs. Les quêtes vous sont proposées aux quatres coins de l'ile et vous font voyager assez souvent. Je n'ai personellement été que peu ennuyé par les allez-retours mais je pense que c'est différent pour chacun. Le 100% est assez rapide mais pour les puristes les collectibles tel que les tailles da sacoches ne sont pas compris dans ce dernier et donc vous devrez continuer un peu a chercher même après avoir 
obtenu la "vraie fin".

Conclusion:
+Les mécaniques de jeu innovantes
+Les quêtes diversifiées
+Les graphismes magnifiques et colorés
-La courte durée de vie (100% en à peu près 7h)
-Toute la map n'est pas éxploitée(mériterait un dlc)

J'éspère que mon avis vous aura été utile

author: {'steamid': '76561198368793085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1637057816}
review:
2週クリアして全実績解除しての初STEAMレビューです。
そのぐらい神ゲーでした。

ジャンルはオープンワールドのメトロイドヴァニア+ピンボールです。

他のメトロイドヴァニアだとエリアが区切らているものが多いと思いますが、このゲームは完全に全エリアシームレス、かつ各々好きなルートで進められるオープンワールドとなっています。

ピンボールと言うのは、普段は主人公のフンコロガシであるヨク君を操作して進めますが、フリッパーがあるところではヨク君にくっついている玉をフリッパーで操作してピンボールで進めていくゲームとなっています。

とはいえピンボールが苦手でもデスペナルティはありません。
ミスしてもお金が多少減るぐらいで復帰できますし、そこまで難しい技術を要求されませんので誰でも楽しめる難易度だと思います。
一応落下数のカウントはされますのでやりこもうと思えば0にすることも可能ですが・・・

絵本風の可愛らしいキャラクターにトゥーンタッチのデザイン、南国風の陽気な音楽と癒し要素も満載で、女性や子どもにもお勧め。
switch版もありますのでPC以外でもプレイ可能です。

大体クリアまでの時間は初見で8～10時間ほどです。
メインストーリーだけ駆け足で進めればもっと早いと思いますが、サブクエストもそこそこあり、ついつい寄り道をしてしまうほど楽しいです。

不満点としては、回転させて進んでいくところの操作がシビアすぎるところですかね。
あとはネタバレになりますが蜘蛛の子を助けても特に何も起こらないところですね。

とにかくアクション、メトロイドヴァニア、ピンボールという単語に反応する人はもちろん、これらが苦手、興味ないよという人でも自信をもってお勧めできます。
今ならウインターセールで半額になっていますので是非！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197966550596', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1545947900}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is a super cute, super weird, super clever game. I'm all for combining pinball gameplay with other genres and this does it really well with what people think of as a 'vania. The characters, puzzles, and map is all great and it's really cool how it's all one big zone that you can zip around through really quickly with no loading or seams.

That's not to say that it's all perfect. There are a few obtuse solutions and the fast travel system can be aggravating but those quibbles shouldn't turn anyone off from this gem.

review: Who would have thought someone would make a metrovania meets pinball game? It pulls it off really well and most importantly with a metrovania, keeps you moving at a steady clip. Also, has a really beautiful art style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039870205', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1545338685}
review: Отличная игра и я бы её рекомендовал, если бы не потратил 4 часа чтобы понять как брать 4 сундука, которые ОКАЗЫВАЕТСЯ берутся непредсказуемыми взрывами слизняков с лагающей физикой. Зачем было так портить игру ума не приложу. Так и бросил, т.к. это меня просто взбесило.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072296023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1585601418}
review:
This game is an absolute delight, I couldn’t put it down. It has an adorable story and cast of characters set on a vibrant and whimsical island. The gameplay is surprisingly fun, with the right amount of things to do and collect to not be overwhelming, but always feel like you have things you can work toward or areas that you can explore and discover.

When I got to the end of the story, I wanted to keep playing to look for things I’d missed. It was a bittersweet moment once I’d found everything and I knew it was over. I didn’t even know a pinball platformer was something I wanted until I saw this game. Now I crave more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058788134', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1675246401}
review: 类似雷曼的画风，好听的BGM，可爱的虫虫，治愈系列好游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198054725871', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1545248560}
review:
A charming little adventure-platformer with a fresh take on the genre involving pinball mechanics.  Easy, casual, and can be beaten in a few hours.  That being said....I spent half my playtime backtracking, and boy is it ever tedious.  Also, the precision required on some flipper placements can really stretch one's patience, as just lining the ball back in position for another attempt can feel like a time-wasting grind.  I enjoyed my time with this game, but when the credits rolled and I was given the option to seek out the rest of island's secrets (AKA more grinding/backtracking), I was a hard pass.

7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999205801', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1540264792}
review: An excellent fusion of the Metroidvania and pinball genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970369196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1545408739}
review: A very charming, kid friendly and relaxing mix of "metroidvania" console style platform puzzler, and pinball game. It isn't very difficult to finish the main story and you can't really die (just lose the opportunity to gain some achievements if you fail too often), but if you are going to 100% complete it there are some puzzles to solve and tricky skill shots you have to perform.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053492889', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1544547187}
review:
Good little game with a great concept. Metroidvania elements felt not impactful enough to me, also fast-travel system is flawed. Still had a great time, 100% in 10 hours. 
I would have like some incentive to collect fruit after you get all the upgrades and also larger pinball areas to increase replayabiliy (some kind of point mode would be nice for this too).
Would recommend if you are looking for a relaxing game. Hopefully we will see a sequel at some point!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009646285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1544958258}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198140276079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1644780073}
review:
[h1]总体评分：9/10[/h1]
这大概是我第一次发觉原来三维弹珠可以这么有趣？？作为一款休闲游戏来说，这可以称得上是一款佳作。

[h1]剧情评分：7/10[/h1]
就剧情而言，这个游戏只能说是平平，大致讲的就是[spoiler] 一个屎壳郎拯救世界[/spoiler]的故事。不过就一款休闲游戏而言，难道要去要求人家做出世界观宏大的剧情？（滑稽）

[h1] 操作评分：10/10[/h1]
我觉得这个游戏的操作已经是简单到不能再简单了。操作容易上手，即便是手残党也能很好地适应（被hollow knight虐哭的贪刀的我必须强行发泄一下怨愤~~）

[h1] 趣味评分：10/10[/h1]
趣味性可以说是很强，你能想象一个屎壳郎四处飞舞的景象吗？问题是我觉得人家飞得还很美？言归正传，本作的趣味性十足，虽然灵感来源于三维弹珠却不完全等同，游戏本身能很好地吸引眼球。同时，里面穿插的一些小任务也十分有趣。整体地图呈现是一种开放式的，内嵌一些小的隐藏地点，对于地图探索者也有不错的小满足

[h1] 音乐评分：9/10[/h1]
BGM整体欢快轻松，符合游戏本身的休闲基调。与此同时，不同地图场景带来的音乐风格的切换能让人更好地融入剧情。

[h1] 画面评分：9/10[/h1]
画面I整体色系偏明快，让人放松，人物作画…………唔…………好吧，中规中矩，不过风格搭配音乐，再加上整体的游戏类型，这是一款可以面向所有游戏玩家的休闲游戏。

以上。

author: {'steamid': '76561198249969088', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1545310435}
review:
Un plataformas metroidvania con mucho encanto, con un microuniverso de bichitos y animalejos peculiares.
Si os gusta el 2D y los plataformas no os lo podeis perder, artísticamente es una delicia.
Una mezcla entre pinball, toques rpg y aventura plataformera fácil de jugar y sin complicaciones.
Todo dibujado a mano con toques de acuarela y hecho con mucho cariño.
Vale cada euro, a mi me salió rebajado pero merece la pena incluso a su precio normal si os gusta el género.
Recomendadísimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010492777', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1543963298}
review: Yoko's Island Express is just an entrancing, adorable pinball/open world Donkey Kong Country sort of thing, and the hero is a little beetle who is always smiling. He gets hired as the new mailman, and instead of the mailman's whistle, he finds a little party horn to blow to let people know the mail is here. It's so adorable, it just makes you feel happy to play.

review: 메트로배니아와 핀볼이 결합된 독특한 게임입니다. 귀엽고 아기자기한 비주얼과 흥미롭게 잘 구성된 레벨디자인, 잔잔하면서도 엉뚱한 스토리, 약간의 퍼즐과 도전적인 수집 요소 등이 어우러져서 매우 만족스런 게임플레이를 제공합니다. 제 기준에선 2018년 베스트 게임 중 하나입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985462742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1666470413}
review: It's like a totally relaxing Metroidvenia, complete with backtracking the map, ability upgrades and unlockable fast travel. Runs surprisingly smooth on Intel HD Graphics 620, even at 1080p. I play this everytime I need to unwind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978593149', 'num_games_owned': 1648, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1543341114}
review: Pinballing around in a light metroidvania is an interesting take on the genre. The game is a little short for its price, but I wouldn't want it to be longer, as you don't really unlock anything that makes backtracking and traversal smoother than the first run through. Get it on sale and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214244560', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1539841201}
review:
真的没想到简单的三维弹球能做出这种惊人的游戏，给制作组跪了！


同类型游戏中的神作不解释！


某些地方有些难，但是难度并不高，全成就达成也很简单，并不会逼死收集强迫症。


总之，强烈推荐！

review:
质量非常出色的一款平台解密游戏！
核心玩法类似三维弹球不过游戏增加了很多道具和交互场景要素

初入眼帘清新多彩的手绘画面很是喜欢~，快速弹射跳跃画面移动，风格各异庞大的地图，水果收集，道具使用，有趣的音效，bgm也很棒，非线性的游戏可以随心所欲探索遮盖的地图，地图关卡设计也很棒。
游戏有种感觉以前移动端玩类似的体验，不过质量真的很出色，要是有移动端或许会有更多人知道这个游戏吧：D
（感觉还是有些地方有点难度的~三维弹球的难度233）

TGA BEST DEBUT INDIE GAME投了票~

非常推荐~

review: At first the combination of pinball and jum'n'run elements seems strange, but after a few minutes it's a lot of fun! The difficulty varies in different parts of the island and the inhabitants of the small island offer exciting or funny quests and conversations. The main game can be played in a few hours, but is also very entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005463375', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1558895857}
review: The team at Villa Gorilla has made a new and fun blend of game mechanics. The world is full of varied, colourful locations and characters. There is plenty to explore and find. Very fun game, I do recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043983202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1539639814}
review:
Surprisingly fun pinball game with a dash of Metroidvania, in the sense that you have to collect certain items to unlock certain areas and there are some character upgrades around. The art style and general atmosphere are very pretty and relaxing. In terms of actual gameplay, it's not much more beyond pinball mechanics and exploration, with quite a bit of traveling around (the fast travel system could be more comprehensive). The story tries to make something of itself, but I think it's mostly there for the sake of existing, rather than impressing.

Overall, it's a fun and relaxing pinball game, with very nice atmosphere and dn the shorter side - I finished the game in roughly 4-5 hours, and 8 hours total to get in-game 100% (missing some completionist achievements otherwise).

author: {'steamid': '76561198021911416', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1542401807}
review: This is a creative title that does a nice job of mixing platforming and pinball elements together in a beautifully crafted world. There are lots of hidden items to find and does a good job adding puzzle solving elements that is geared toward new abilities like a metriodvania title to advance to new areas. It has great art style, awesome catchy music, and interesting characters to meet. I highly recommend this game. This is one of the best indies to come out this year. It has a lot of charm and is a relaxing experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112446138', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1553859063}
review:

It's so crazy and fucking cute... I bought it twice. One copy for my gilrfriends birthday and one for myself because I couldn't stand :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198040179099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1527724609}
review: My love of pinball games came from spending way too much time playing 3D pinball on windows 2000 and this game gives such a fresh spin to an old classic. I was super excited for this game, counting down the days till release and I was not let down. Graphics are superbly pleasing to the eye, mechanics are nostalgic while giving a new video game vibe with abilities; but what surprised me and blew me away was the soundtrack. Sadly I have not had time too sit down and spend alot of time playing this masterpeice of a game, but I do wholeheartedly reccomend Yoku's Island Express. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198324750927', 'num_games_owned': 1978, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1564494322}

review:
久しぶりに、ほかのゲームに浮気せず、一気にクリアまで行けたゲーム。
短時間プレイの積み重ねができ、気軽にプレイできる点がワテクシのような社畜には向いていたのかもしれない。
ピンボールが好きな人はモチノロン、メトロイドヴァニア的なアクションアドベンチャーゲームが好きな人にもお勧めできる。

author: {'steamid': '76561198375517657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1544688211}
review:
ピンボールが各ステージにあり、それらをクリアしながら進めていくゲーム。
ストーリーもキャラクターも緩やかで、のんびりとプレイできる。

気になった点は、ピンボールをうまく進めないとステージが通れず、
コースを戻ったり、行ったりするときに少しイライラを感じた。

author: {'steamid': '76561198000713888', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1677323808}
review:
Невероятно умильная и прекрасная игра, которая зацепила нас с женой на несколько вечеров. В игре мы играем за жучка почтальона, который прибывает на тропический остров в непростое время и помогает жителям. Игра - смесь платформера и механики пинболла. Это очень необычное и интересное решение, которое вам должно понравиться. Игра очень динамичная, умеренно сложная. Для любителей хардкора, можно попробовать найти все секреты и пройти игру на 100%.

Графика и музыка шикарная, как и проработка персонажей. Очень рекомендую.

P.S. Номинировал игру на премию в категории "Игра года". Кого хочу, того номинирую)

review: Surprisingly enjoyable.  I do not normally play pinball games, but this game did not require an expert pinballer to play.  As I went along, I gradually got better at the pinball mechanics and was able to improve how I got around.  The quests were decent, but the Metroidvania-style world was excellent.  Gorgrous visuals and well-selected music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024957872', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1590095411}
review: This is the game after Zelda BOTW that succeeded to pull me completely in its world. Its unique gameplay and the combination of 2 seemingly unrelated genres works just right. And for the people who love sidequests and collecting stuff, the game offers a lot of content that is really fun to dwell in. All in all, Yoku is a must-buy and experience bundle of joy of a game.

review: This game is brilliant. I cannot beleve that it took so long for a devloper to make a pinball platformer and do it well. There are people who say there is nothing new in the world. Those people can go suck a lemmon, They are not creative enough to come up with something new.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369775297', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1609574046}
review:
对于一个路痴来说这个游戏有一点点要命，经常是我是谁我在哪我要去哪我该怎走。但这有一个好处就是处处都是新地图【不是。
百分之百花了我将近11个小时，期间扣坏了我的键盘，把左shift键敲下来了。
但是太快乐了，这个游戏太快乐了，为什么这么快乐呀！
除了快乐我无话可说！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198115179421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1663439573}
review: If you like pinball and platformers, get this game. It's fun. It also has old school collectathon elements with the fruits and items you collect help you unlock new parts of the map. The map is also BIG and DENSE.  It also has the aethetic and charm of old school collectathon games except not 3D. Gameplay is totally different with the pinball elements, but the charm and aethetic gave me a nostagic feeling of playing a spyro or crash game. It's a unique little platformer. I could see this little beetle in another game. Definitely a new favorite. Beat the game now. Still love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004019081', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1542252779}
review:
Výborná kombinace metrodvania plošinkovky a pinballu na minimálně 6 hodin.
Okouzlí krásnou ručně malovanou grafikou ve stylu Ori and the Blind Forest, nadchne příjemnou oddychovou hudbou
a procvičí prsty při některých náročnějších soubojích s bossy.
Unikátní hra, podobnou jsem ještě neviděl.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197976086060', 'num_games_owned': 1948, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1561635405}
review: Fun and unique little metroidvania pinball game with a good mix of puzzles. It manages to teach you about the more subtle mechanics of pinball, beyond simple paddle spamming. The game is at a perfect length; around 5-6 hours to beat and up to 8-10 hours for completionists. Fun little soundtrack, and a small story that isn't too distracting. Highly recommend to anyone looking for something a little different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094294305', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1541622892}
review:
[h1]Yoku's Island Express[/h1]

В этой игре практически все замечательно, и классно все нарисовано, и музыка на должном уровне. Пинбол и метроидвания, как оказалось неплохо сочетаются.

Отрицательный отзыв ставлю скорей не игре, а ее разработчикам. 

Игру купил еще летом. Прошел 87% игры и так вышло, что наткнулся на баг с заданием Вилло, из за которого невозможно пройти игру полностью. О баге было сообщено разработчику, тот ответил, что исправят. Прошло 5 месяцев и ничего не исправлено. 

Помогло только прохождение игры с самого начала. А второй раз проходить игру было уже не так весело, а под конец и вовсе утомительно.
developer_response:
Hi Flamestorm,

We are sorry to hear that you've experienced the bug in Yoku's Island Express. 

Could you please tell us your email address or send us a link to your forum thread, so we can assist you further in resolving this matter?

Thank you,
Team17 Support

author: {'steamid': '76561197999090318', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1541537903}
review: I guess openworld pinball is now a genre. YIE was so much fun I took the time to get all the achievements. Vibe is chill and super upbeat. The characters, voices, music, backgrounds, sound effects, physics, and even the story were all just what they needed to be. There are side quests, and some extra mechanics that reward you for digging deeper into their potential application. Getting 100% requires you to master these systems. Would definitely purchase a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091433569', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 528, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1542041802}
review: I tried a demo of this game before buying it and the demo was short but fun and I had to buy this. In my opinion this is a great original platformer.Everything,from the beutiful and colorful artstyle to fun and engaging sundtrack feels great.Dont listen to others who say you can beat this game in 4 hours,if you take your time and exsplore the island you can easyly get to 10 houres.This is one of those rare gems and its a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053230195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1532553214}
review:
One of the most relaxing games I have ever played, perfect for short bursts in the evening after work. You're casually rolling around the island, frequently entering single screen pinball areas to clear or otherwise use paddles to jump over obstacles. There are no actual enemies and whenever you fail a section, the worst that could happen is that you fall down a level. The well designed areas in the game are varied and accompanied by catchy feel-good music fitting with the cutesy art style. Every now and then, a new ability will open up several new paths all over the map, so it would be best to memorize some dead ends. Backtracking is not really an issue since fast travel mechanisms are introduced early on.

It was a lot of fun to finish the game and find all the secrets and I'm recommending this to everyone who's looking for a fresh take on the genre and just wants to have a good time. It's definitely well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088661750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1610192392}
review:
Eine wunderbare Kombination aus Metroidvania und Pinball mit einer wunderschönen Umgebung zu erkunden, vielen tollen Characktären und einer Menge an versteckten Collectables.

Einzige kleine Beschwerde: Es fehlt manchmal etwas die Herausforderung.

Fazit: Ein gemütliches originelles Spiel mit viel Charme genau das Richtige für einen entspannten Nachmittag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041212064', 'num_games_owned': 1669, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1541364790}
review:
A very interesting combination of metroidvania and pinball, took me around 8 hours to collect nearly everything (95%~)
It controls very smoothly, though there are a few parts that are unnecessarily tricky and frustrating.
There's no lives and no game-overs, if you fall between the flippers you can continue again immediately (Except that you'll lose 3 fruit which is barely a punishment at all).
The fact that you can't die also unfortunately makes the (already quite mediocre) boss fights lose all their tension, which honestly makes them even worse.
The graphics and music in this game are wonderful and really make the world you're playing in feel alive.
There's also a plethora of bonus goodies to collect and sidequests to progress through.
I had a fun time playing through it despite the couple of flaws it has. 
7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013902679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1542536420}
review: Отличная игра. Интерсный сюжет, графика на уровне, много весёлых моментов, но есть и сложные. С ребёнком с удовольствием играем. Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800582960', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1546660479}
review:
Bought the game for the art style and the Metroidvania tag. Surprised that the pinball-mechanic blend in so well with the platforming; and I absolutely love the music of Mokumana island.

10/10 for me, and i'm aiming for 100% completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060433978', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1681048879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198254469387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1543272514}
review:
Un super Metroid-like. Très beau, bien fait et un humour sympa. De la plateforme avec un mélange de flipper dans une grande carte aux zones inter-connectées, rien à dire, j'adore ça. Je vous le conseil fortement.
P.S. : Si vous voulez finir le jeu à 100%, faites attention car il se finit à 50% si on reste sur l'histoire principale. Donc une fois que vous arrivez vers 45%, ne suivez plus l'histoire principale et faites les quêtes secondaires. Un petit conseil que je voulais vous donner car ce jeu vaut le coup !

Sir de France

author: {'steamid': '76561198002870904', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1532587853}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989742076', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1540440613}
review: I was looking for a quality PC game that was a change of pace from all the other titles I've played through these last months. Yoku's Island Express was the perfect candidate. I gave the demo a shot and instantly purchased the full game. This game is extremely optimized, I did not experience a single stutter. On top of that the graphics are quite dazzling. In terms of gameplay, the fusion between pinball and adventure has been fused superbly. The map overaly and progression is similar that of Metroid or Castlevania. I'd consider Yoku's Island Express more of a casual title but still engaging in every way. My only complaint is I wish there was more content in terms of exploration. As good as Yoku's Island Express is, there is a huge amount of potential to be had in a sequel.

review: Милый и яркий платформер, скрещенный с пинболом. Все хорошо, кроме не совсем очевидногого устройства мира - далеко не всегда понятно, как куда попасть и где еще не был. Из-за этого собирашки на 100% могут превратиться в проверку на терпеливость. Но пробежаться разок очень даже можно. Если любите платформеры, обратите внимание.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393549', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1540234585}
review:
If you, like me, have played Sonic Spinball in the long gone past you will instantly fall in love with this classic. I do not do reviews much but this little gem deserves attention.

While I am not even near the end of this game the atmosphere, pinball mechanics and general polishing made me stop playing for now and write up this small review just to praise the overall package without going into detail. The reviews of others here and some websites do it full justice and these few lines are just to add another thumbs up to the devs for a game well designed.

If they ever do a sequel it will be an instant pre-order on my side!
