author: {'steamid': '76561197989754266', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1539837651}
review: Whimsical, innovative, and adorable. Worth a play if you enjoyed the art of Ori and the Blind Forest but want a more casual metroidvania. Amazing music, lovely watercolor visuals, and a cute story with memorable characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968932079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1539742602}
review:
This game is infectiously charming.  Ithas fantastic toe tapping music and lovely art to tie together a vastly unique metroidvania. Best of all, it is a supremely creative take on pinball!

A few pieces to mention:

- Many surprises and very creative moments, especially in boss battles! 

- More animated cutscenes like the intro would vastly improve the story presentation. It starts so strongly but the rest of the experience is in game, a stiffer contrast than I hoped for.

-A higher challenge would have been enjoyable. A higher difficulty may be unnecessary with the playful tone the devs going for but it depends on ones taste. 

-The offered multiball challenges were great! Although, I would have loved to have seen more of them! 

- Ball physics: Yoku's ball blends well for gameplay, perfectly controllable, but during the main pinball sections, it has a hollow *pok* to it. Only a few of the featured table puzzles really drive home the speed and chaos of a real pinball table. Unfortunately, it quickly tones back down to its calmer momentum. Purely a personal preference.

I really hope to see a sequel! Bending the game more towards a pinball challenge that real life tables offer, but I trust the devs to make whatever they like. It has worked out wonderfully.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990144203', 'num_games_owned': 1439, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1539726884}
review:
Frais et stylé,Yoku's Island Express invente le flipoidvania et ca marche carrement !!!

Les flippers sont bien pensé,jamais frustrant et l'on se deplace avec plaisir dans toute la map en utilisant les differents flips et evolutions qui seront mis a votre disposition...

Attention a la durée de vie qui est un peu legere (6/7H),a part ca,Yoku est tres original et apporte un vrai vent de fraicheur au genre !

author: {'steamid': '76561198161113132', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1539721048}
review: It's not a super long game (full 100% clear in just under 9 hours), but it is absolutely amazing! If you are interested in the concept you should definitely give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999751276', 'num_games_owned': 2151, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1540067398}
review:
I play a lot of games. All different, all with their quirks and gameplay features and whatnot.
I'm also a pretty busy guy, and I have trouble sticking with a game for long unless it really grabs my attention.

Yoku definitely grabbed my attention. What a lovely, lovely game! It reminded me why I love video games so much and I enjoyed every single minute of it.
The artsyle is gorgeous, it's extremely fun to play and the soundtrack is quite simply excellent.

One of my favorite games of the year for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303926562', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1539955398}
review:
坐在电脑前连续肝了8个多小时，还差少部分柳条和宝箱还没拿，大部分都集齐了，腰酸背痛的写下个人评测。
画面：9/10
之所以不给满分的原因，是因为专心看风景了导致我在路上错过不少柳条，后来又得费时间返回去拿。。。
战斗：8.5/10
虽然在玩之前就知道了这款游戏融入了弹球，但是当真正玩起来，才发现弹球对我这个空间感缺失的人是多么的不友好，每个有弹球的地方都要卡好久，因为我根本无法预判按下击打后球会打到什么方向。。。试了试手柄和键盘，键盘的按键比较别扭，所以建议大家用手柄玩。
音乐：9/10
当你来到不同区域的时候，背景乐也会随之切换成符合当前区域气氛的音乐，不过当我完全沉浸游戏的时候并没有注意到音乐。。。
剧情：9/10
你作为一名初到此岛的新邮递员，说好只是来送邮递怎么就走上了拯救岛屿的道路了呢？有的地点如果你完成了隐藏任务后，会有剧情提示，比如在某个地方我无意中完成某个任务后，突然出现一位npc告诉我说boss就藏在你们之中，然而我直到最后才发现boss并不是我怀疑的那几个居民。。。（也许我比较笨吧，捂脸.jpg）
推荐：9/10
总的来说是一款很不错的休闲游戏，当你在其他游戏世界征战累了，可以来到这里受受苦（划去），来到这里看看风景，拯救一下岛屿，找找没集齐的物品，给自己的心灵放松一下，会是一个很不错的选择。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969155095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1540329032}
review: This game is so incredibly charming, I love it. Occasionally it can get a *little* annoying when you're having to yomp it back across the map, or you get stuck in a pinball bit you've done before and just need to hit that flipper at precisely the right moment to get out, but I forgive it in an instant. The art is lovely, the music is absolutely top notch, the pinball/metroidvania blend is very unique. I finished it in about 8h, doing all the side quests (I think) but I'll be going back to pick up all the secret collectibles I missed because it's just such a lovely game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992513379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1630789144}
review: Very good. though when it says "full controller support" it means "full Xbox controller support". Still need to use a SCP tool to use ps4 controllers

author: {'steamid': '76561198001180221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1541385514}
review:
GLANCE RECOMMENDATION: [u][b]83% YES[/b][/u] / 17% NO

[h1]GOOD[/h1]
[list]
[*]Cute, painterly visuals that really add to the charm.
[*]One of the most unique ideas I've seen for a game in a long time and, bonus, it's fun to play!
[*]I love the cute bug protagonist and its mail courrier job. It's an innocent setup that gets oddly dark as you're trying to cure beings poisoned by a god slayer.
[*]Progression is laid out evenly and an A+ pace. Everytime I think I'm about to run out of places to go: I either run into more hidden things or a new movement mechanic.
[/list]

[h1]NEUTRAL[/h1]
[list]
[*]While it's fun to play, it can be INFURIATING when you hit the same shot over and over with different results while trying to hit a certain angle. It feels like you're going mad at points.
[*]The fast travel system isn't terrible, but getting to them can sometimes be a chore and I really would have rathered a teleport stone system or something (considering teleport stones are also referenced in the in-game lore anyway).
[/list]

[h1]BAD[/h1]
[list]
[*]This may be because of spoiler reasons (so I won't go into exactly that here), but if it isn't: I had terrible run-ins with the thorn save system. The first support item you get is a thorn/bouncy buddy who will save you from falling into thorns, but almost every time I fell through this support buddy and got caught in the thorns instead of being saved. Again this may dive into end-game logic, so I'm mixed on this but I'm still betting I just kept falling at the worst angle possible which would suck.
[/list]

[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
There's a lot to do on this island and a great deal to see. I was on the fence about getting this, intrigued by its premise, but discounted to $12 I jumped in and I don't regret it. If you enjoy a short (7~ hours) platformer with odd pinball gameplay: try this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975388306', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1539489871}
review: A fantastic, unique Metroidvania (a la Ori and the Blind Forest, Hollow Knight, Guacamelee, etc.) with the novel addition of a pinball game mechanic. It's got beautiful art and music, and fun skills to unlock. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065877448', 'num_games_owned': 4151, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1539410404}
review:
I generally tend to be harsh with my criticisms, and while the game does have some flaws (lackluster pinball physics springs to mind), I am hard pressed to focus on them because of the emotional response I had playing this game. This game really touched me in a way few games have. I experienced a visceral connection to the environment and to Yoku, despite a lack of developed characters. The soundtrack, art direction, animation work, and level design all work together to build an incredibly uplifting experience in a world I came to wish really existed. 

I was very sad to see my time with this game come to an end, and I can easily recommend this game to just about anyone, even people who are not frequent players of video games. I want more games like this, but I'll never forget the time I spent with Yoku on his island.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140299850', 'num_games_owned': 2332, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1539476106}
review:
WOW! Just “WOW”. This reviewer rarely plays big games, and frequently doesn’t have an overwhelmingly favorable opinion of platformers. But somehow the synergy of it all (especially the incredibly successful risk of heavily integrating pinball), along with an interesting puzzle aspect created some kinda Big Magic with “Yoku’s Island Express”.

There are plenty of good reviews available, so this review will attempt to focus on what this reviewer knows best – Yoku’s Island Express’s (YIE) pinball aspect. Is this really pinball? Yes…and no. (I’ve been playing pinball off and on for over fifty years, and have served as a moderator on one of Steam’s more successful pinball game’s discussion forums, just as background.)

Where YIE isn’t pinball, is that there are never gutter balls (balls lost between the flippers.) If a ball does pass through the flippers, it’s not lost, and while there seems to be a penalty (while I’ve defeated the BIG BOSS, I haven’t completed the game), the ball can easily be returned to play. And even that only seems to happen (with very rare exceptions) because of player error. Additionally, a game character is added in the pinball sections early on to prevent even that action by catching the ball (once per character activation, which is easy to accomplish.) So, you can’t lose the ball, and each pinball game is designed to be played to victory in a single session, with no option for saving mid-pinball episode.

How IS YIE most similar to pinball? Aiming shots is critical, and sometimes not as easy as this player expected. If a YIE player has never experienced pinball, I can see this as being challenging, and in fact almost to (and even beyond) the level of rage frustration. And if you don’t go into the game with an understanding of such things as the progressive aspects (such as completing banks of lane lighting), some actions required for success may not occur simply by chance. The physics of YIE pinball is weak, but adequate. Passing off the ball to the opposite flipper really shows the lapses in physics, and “backhand” shots (aiming at a target on the same side of the table as the flipper used) can be far less responsive than IRL. And while someone reading this without benefit of having experienced YIE might wonder at the degree of focus, pinball is a really high percentage of what makes up this game. (Though players may measure each aspect differently, it seems safe to say that pinball is at least 30%, and by some measurements perhaps as high as 50% of the complete YIE experience.)

Typically, this reviewer rails against any game that can only be played (by an average player) with the benefit of outside resources. I’ve generally felt such fallbacks are the sign of a weak game, and lazy developers. (Sorry, but I started PC gaming 30 years ago, when outside resources didn’t exist. And seriously, what’s the point if someone else does much of the work?) But I would not hesitate to suggest that players new to pinball get as much outside assistance as necessary for Yoku’s Island Express. In fact, I’d suggest doing whatever it takes to be able to play and enjoy this instant classic.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025267880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1598928527}
review:
Do you like Metroidvanias? Do you like boatloads of collectibles? Do you like pinball? Do you like postal workers fighting against dark gods seeking to destroy your island? Then this is the right game for you!

Pros:
+Great art
+Chill music
+Metroidvania - you find collectibles which allow you to go back to areas you couldn't access before
+Good map - shows you where you've been for easy backtracking, can even unlock abilities that let you see where the collectibles are hidden. Also shows you what quests are currently active so you never lose track of the various things you're trying to do all at once
+Pinball w/lots of variation. You are a dung beetle pushing around a little ball, so it's literally your method of travel. Levels are like your typical pinball games, with lots of sensors to run over and light up to unlock prizes, certain areas you need to aim into, etc. There are even boss battles where you have to pummel the enemy with your ball (sometimes mutliball!) and achieve a goal. But you even use pinball to traverse the world, which is pretty big.
+Tons of collectibles! Getting to 100% is a challenge! (I didn't.) You collect money in the form of fruit, which lets you unlock powers or increased fruit capacity, abilities, quest items, and decorations for your ball that actually let you earn even more collectibles with certain characters!
+Wide variety of puzzles, so you're not just doing the same thing over and over
+Frequent save points, which is good for those tricky collectibles where you need trick jumps. You don't have to roll all the way back to the beginning of the sequence. Plus, you don't really need them for the main game, since you can't die, so it's always optional to restart from the last savepoint.

Neutral/Con:
- The game does a pretty good job of isolating you from accidentally reentering a full pinball level you've already completed, which can be very slow and boring to progress through the second time (since all of your objectives there were achieved). You have to hit "enter" in order to go back inside, so you're forewarned. HOWEVER, there are some traversal paths that are also marked by the same doors, so it's really easy to accidentally get stuck in one of the areas if you're not checking your map all the time.
-The game crashed on me a couple times, but save points are frequent.

Overall, this game is loads of fun. If you like pinball in any way, shape or fun, you will enjoy it. If you like big maps and lots of backtracking for hidden collectibles, this game is for you.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198158699025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1541306354}
review:
或许看上去觉得有点荒谬，但是银河恶魔城味儿的三维弹球的确比想象的好玩很多。Yoku 的小岛速递这个游戏就是把这二者结合起来的相当不错的尝试。连贯的地图衔接和关卡设计使游玩过程体验变得非常畅快，轻松的配乐和明快的画风也给体验加了不少分数。

尽管可能由于游戏目标受众更广一些，游戏的剧情和操作都并不复杂，不过即便如此这种很常规的剧情加上难度比常规版面还简单的 “boss 战” 也并没有带来负面的体验影响，作为休闲的畅快游戏而言，这个游戏是的确值得一玩的作品。

缺点的话，倘若不把剧情简单视为缺点的话似乎挑不出什么毛病。当然在我常规游戏流程的过程中遇到了两次游戏崩溃，不过好在游戏的存档位置非常多，影响不大。

结论：值得一试的游戏，推荐游玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993441533', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1539637432}
review:
Добротно скроенный и отлично нарисованный гибрид метроидвании и пинбола, повествующий о приключениях жука скарабея Йоку в роли почтальона на тропическом острове Мокунама. 

В наличии: открытый мир, анлоки и апгрейды способностей, секреты и скрытые локации, куча пинбольных головоломок, возможность катать навозный шар и конечно бэктрекинг (куда уж без него в жанре). 

Основного сюжета — часов на 6, сложность — максимум средняя (если, конечно, не выбивать 100%.Тогда и часы и сложность значительно подрастут), игровых механик вполне достаточно, чтобы не скучать всю игру, несмотря на то, что основная из них - пинбол, никуда не исчезает. На клавиатуре играбельно, на геймпаде – совсем хорошо.  Вылетов нет, производительность – без проблем, есть демоверсия.

Противопоказанием к ознакомлению может быть только тотальная непереносимость пинбола и платфомеров как жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993269096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1538334452}
review:
This game is just delightful and really deserves more attention than it's getting: It combines the joy of discovery from a metrodvania game with the satisfyingly immediate gameplay loop of a pinball game into something that's just plain fun to get into. Remember the bubbly fun of Rare's games for Nintendo? It's all here in spades! 

If you like your metroidvanias grimdark and punishing, this is not it. If you like just seeking out nooks and crannies without having to Dark Souls your way through murder mobs constantly (I'm looking at you, Hollow Knight) or worrying about doing everything right the first time because of permanently blocking off areas (I'm looking at you, Ori and the Blind Forest), this little gem could be your jam. 

Seriously, I love how the game invites you to just play it. Backtracking is a little slow early one, but the game doesn't require it until the fast travel system unlocks. You don't need to obsessively take notes about what you might have missed early on if you just want to finish the main plot (about half the game) because an excellent map system will track everything interesting for you to come back to later. This is one of the few games where I've felt encouraged to 100% all the achievements because it's fun.

If you're concerned about the pinball aspects of the game, rest assured that they are very forgiving: the ball speed is low, hitting the drain only costs you a couple of pieces of fruit (the collectible currency in the game), there are no side gutters, you get a kickback ability very early in game, there are very few boards with dead drops, and the few technical shots required are pretty basic (you can do most by catching the ball and making the shot as opposed to requiring looping combos). If you like realistic pinball like Pinball FX, this will probably be too slow for your liking, as many "boards" only have one or two objectives and they are linked by exploration, rather than the "teleporting" multi-board video pinball games of yore. Still, it does capture the dopamine producing experience of hitting all your loops and targets consistently with its colorful and responsive feedback (doing perfect multiloops with that fruit spawning powerup is always intensely satisfying!) It's a much less stressful way of reaching that zen-like state of being in the zone compared to most platformers these days.  

If there is a sequel (and I hope it does), I would love to see an "endless" mode where the whole island links up into a giant multiboard pinball table (i.e. you can get to the "boards" without walking or breaking out of flipper mode) with multiple objectives and infinite scoring as in a traditional pinball game. That would be a really cool reward for 100% completion of the map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026397941', 'num_games_owned': 2239, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1537588635}
review:
Yoku’s Island Express can only be described as a 2D adventure-platformer, but all of the platforming is done in pinball machines. 

For the full review, see my Youtube Review
 https://youtu.be/1KV2uTFevdQ

Some are going to liken it to a MetroidVania, and the game has exploration around an open map with gated progress locking you out of certain areas without the right abilities. As such, you definitely could describe it the way of a MetroidVania, however, there isn’t any combat in the game, save for a few boss fights, so it’s important to make sure you know what you’re getting before you try.

The game controls very well, no matter what input method you use. On keyboard, left-shift controls the blue flipper, and right-shift the yellow flipper. If you plug in a control, you’re using left trigger and right trigger instead.

In order to add some variety, all of the abilities that are unlocked add new ways to interact with the environment, which allows the player to access new areas, as mentioned above, but in addition, also add new elements to the exploring and pinball sections of the game.

Although the story of the game has a serious undertone, as the entire island is doomed to destruction, Yoku’s job title is officially just the postmaster, so I never took it too seriously, and all in all the feel of the entire adventure is very bright and positive thanks to the colorful characters that you meet along the way.

For those that are still enjoying the game after completing the main story, there are also side missions, a range of collectibles, and little mini-challenges strewn across the entire island for those completionists. These extra objectives will add a few additional hours of play, without the need for too much travel thanks to the fast travel system in the game being quite flexible, allowing you to jump out at multiple spots to get where you want to go quickly.

If you can’t tell just by looking at screenshots and videos, Yoku’s Island Express features an incredible art-style. There entire island is painted with beautiful detail. The colours are bright and the pathways are well-defined. Not only that, but the trees and bushes sway in the wind, and some areas backgrounds are animated with nice weather effects which all add to the beauty of the game. Yoku is also quite the character, although small in size, his little run and swim animations are adorable, and the way that he dangles behind the ball when in pinball sections is amusing too.

The sound design is incredible too. The soundtrack is silly and upbeat, with each area having it’s own theme. I personally didn’t find the soundtrack to get repetitive either, despite spending quite a bit of time in each section. The sound effects are great too, the flippers have a very chunky flicking sound, and the various other pinball effects all sound great too. Each individual character that you meet throughout the game has a silly Banjo-Kazooie, style sound effect voice that really adds to the overall feel of the game.

The fun pinball gameplay with simple controls, inability to die, bright colors, bubbly soundtrack and sound effects, and the silly characters make this game a great adventure for players of all ages. I can’t recommend this game highly enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203886985', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1537413152}
review: Yoku's Island Express is super charming and feels like an orphaned Nintendo release (that's a good thing). The metroidvania-pinball combination feels perfect. Give it a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988050328', 'num_games_owned': 1331, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1534557112}
review:
I very much enjoyed this game. It's basically a mashup of a metroidvania and an pinball game. You move around by rollling your ball and where there are bumpers you can trigger those to fly and bounce around. There are usually gates indicating a pinball area in which you often don't stop rolling (unless you deliberatly try to stop for some secrets).
The story is nice and the game is maybe around 6 hours long if you try to get some of the secrets along the way.

I highly recommend it, especially if you're in the mood for something happy and fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054279726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1537360571}
review:
The gameplay of Sonic Spinball taken to it's logical extreme: A metroidvania!

Fluid, if a smidge finnicky gameplay, a soundtrack you can't help but chill out to, and some of the most charming visuals I've ever seen in a video game. Yoku's Island Express is an easygoing romp with more than enough childhood-era whimsy to keep you going 'till the last Wickerling.

9/10 : Can't wait to see what this studio does next, keep it up guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137988952', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1536452661}
review:
Despite my lack of skill at pinball I’d still recommend giving Yoku’s Island Express a look if you’re into Metroidvanias. The art, music, exploration, and quests all make for a very enjoyable game, and the pinball concept is novel enough to distinguish the game from other members of the genre. The bosses and a large number of underwhelming upgrades don’t manage to overshadow what the game does well. While I found the pinball mechanics frustrating, your mileage may vary depending on your skill at pinball, and I still believe Yoku’s Island Express is worth a look in spite of this.

Full review here if you like reading: http://frostilyte.ca/2018/09/17/yokus-island-express/

author: {'steamid': '76561198006498578', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1528381342}
review:
Quel bon jeu !

    Je n'avais jamais entendu parler de Yoku's Island Express avant de tomber dessus dans la liste de recommandations "New and Trending" de steam et je l'ai acheté sur un coup de tête parce que la musique et la patte graphique du trailer me faisait penser à Donkey Kong Country Returns; il s'avère que YIE est un poil plus sombre que ce à quoi je m'attendait mais il n'en reste pas moins que le jeu m'a fait forte impression !

    On joue un genre de bousier (toujours en train de pousser une petite crotte), le nouveau facteur de l'île de Mokumana ; rapidement, on se rendra compte que cette île n'est pas le paradis auquel on s'attendait et qu'il va falloir s'activer pour changer un peu tout ça.

    Ce qui rend le jeu intéressant, c'est cette étrange combinaison d'un metroidvania avec un jeu de flipper dans lequel on se sert de "bumpers" pour envoyer la crotte à laquelle on est toujours accroché (et donc nous avec elle) sur des plateformes autrement inaccessibles. Le jeu n'est pas vraiment compliqué et je suppose que les fans hardcore de flippers n'y trouveront pas leur compte mais pour celles et ceux qui voudraient explorer un monde vraiment chouette de façon "casual", la variation de gameplay est très plaisante.

    Pas grand chose de plus à dire sinon que je ne m'attendais à rien de particulier mais que j'ai été emporté par le jeu, une très très bonne surprise qui a un doux parfum des jeux Nintendo de mon enfance !

author: {'steamid': '76561198040300374', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1682263700}
review: I have been pleasantly surprised by this game. The story, the puzzles the art style are all wonderful.  If you remotely like games like big little planet you will most certainly enjoy this game.  A complete joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967449126', 'num_games_owned': 2389, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1537191925}
review: Yoku's Island Express is a cute little Metroidvania Pinball Adventure game. The aesthetic and music is great! Everything else is pretty much what you'd expect out of a pinball game. The fact that it's in kind of an open world is a cool twist and makes it unlike any other game I've ever played. It does something unique and does it very well. If you're into pinball games or even in the mood for something different, give this nice little title a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094335495', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1528366754}
review:
[quote=苏小满][url=https://www.gimmgimm.com/game-forum/detail?id=10665]点击签到送游戏[/url]，参与活动免费Roll《古墓丽影：暗影》，把劳拉小姐姐抱回家~
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/GimmGimm]加入叽咪叽咪鉴赏家[/url]，每一种分享，都是思考的力量。
[/quote]
首先感谢叽咪提供的评测机会，叽咪叽咪用爱发电。
Villa Gorilla推出的这款游戏，直接概括的话，就是一款画风可爱、夹杂着童话故事剧情的三维弹珠游戏。游戏讲述了小甲虫Yoku成为了一座小岛Mokumana的邮递员，为了挽救小岛不被摧毁，而开始了一系列冒险的故事。

[h1]游玩整体感受[/h1]
三维弹珠可以说是我们不少人的童年回忆了，这款游戏整体画风颇偏卡通，音乐轻快，整体上给人带来了一种小时候小伙伴们结伴春游的轻松感觉。而根据小岛分成的不同板块，每个板块也有着适合自己风格的素材和背景音乐，可以看出制作组的用心。
悠闲的配乐和简单的游戏核心玩法，带来的是较为休闲的游戏体验，相比畅快的FPS游戏、操作难度大的动作游戏等各类游戏，这款游戏自然是放松休憩的不二之选。

[h1]游戏机制[/h1]
游戏的内核玩法是三维弹珠，然而玩法却并不因此而单一。游戏基于三维弹珠，操作仅需要左右的shift键和左右方向键，操作简单，也符合游戏较为休闲的定位。而虽然游戏内核、操作十分简单，但制作组为了让玩家并不度过一个枯燥的游戏过程，也将三维弹珠的系统加入到了地图元素之中，并辅以灰虫子等额外要素，增加了游戏的多样性。
游戏整体以拯救守护神的单线剧情为主，辅以各种要素的解锁，延长了游戏的游玩长度，实质上较为单一的玩法也因为画风、音乐的舒缓和偏颇简单的游戏难度，使得玩家并不会过快地对游戏失去兴趣。可以说在小满看来，制作组对游戏奖励机制的把控算是较为合理甚至优秀的。

[h1]一些缺点[/h1]
作为一款休闲小游戏，本游戏给小满带来了新的体验，虽然游戏较为出色，但也有一些问题存在。
可能是因为小满是个脑子不太好使的人，一些任务提示较为含糊其辞，比如蘑菇种子的问题，虽然这也算是一种谜题，增大了游戏的复杂性和难度，但同样一些提示涉及到地图的扩展，比如旧信件发送的任务提示，在一定程度上，也曾经给小满带来了一些困扰。（当然这其实不算什么缺点）
也就是说，在小满眼里看来，这款游戏其实只有一个简单的问题——相对而言有点大的地图使得游戏可游玩时长得到增加，但地图上具体信息的不可查看和图例解释的缺失，导致了游玩时难度的增加，带来了一些负面的反馈。

[h1]总结[/h1]
可以说这款游戏是一款不错的休闲三维弹珠类游戏，好看的画风、舒缓的音乐和并不难的游戏机制，使得谁都能有个不错的游戏体验。整体上小满是十分推荐一些想要游玩轻口游戏的玩家入手这款甲虫送信的游戏的。

原文链接：https://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info?id=13135

author: {'steamid': '76561197995361890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1621030139}
review:
[h1] The Metroidvania Review[/h1]

[url=https://metroidvaniareview.com/2018/09/15/yokus-island-express/] Scored Summary[/url] |  |                          [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30503887/] Subscribe to our Curator	[/url]

[b]How Metroidvania is it?[/b]
Medium Fit – No one expects a Pinball Game to make a good Metroidvania… But it just works. Obviously the core mechanic is going to make this a very different animal from your standard Metroidvania, but the exploration aspect is very well done.  

[url= https://steamcommunity.com/groups/MetroidvaniaReview/discussions/1/1735465524721078341/] Want to hear a different opinion, or want to share your own review? Check out our Forum here.[/url]

[h1]Full Review[/h1]
When I first heard about [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i], I had to do a double take. Never could I have imagined when I began this project to play every Metroidvania Game on steam that I would end up playing a pinball Game. Obviously if you just hate pinball games then this isn’t the Metroidvania for you. But if you like genre fusion, then I think it’s safe to say that [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/I] is the absolute best for what it is – and this is primarily because it does its Metroidvania elements so well.

Unfortunately for me the pinball aspect turns out to not be my favorite thing – and not because it’s bad. I just don’t think I’m the right audience for it. My experience with pinball consists of [i]Sonic Spinball[/i], and of course a few hours with that Space Cadet pinball game that came with Windows for a while. For me, pinball was never the type of game that I’d spend more than five or ten minutes at a time on – probably because I’ve never been amazing at it. Because of that I can’t really comment on whether [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i]  lives up to any pinball standards. I suspect  some hardcore pinball fans are going to be annoyed by the physics fudging [i]Yoku[/i] uses to get the pinball around its world, but that kind of thing is just necessary to make this weird combination work. What I can do is contrast the normal Action Platforming combat of a Metroidvania game to [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i]. Action Platformers are about timing your attacks and moving your character into position. Pinball is about timing your paddle swings and waiting for your character to fall into position. I feel like there’s a little more creativity involved with player expression in action platforming, which caters to my individual personality a little more. With that said, [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i] definitely takes a lot of skill to play well, so there’s certainly value in its mechanics. I’m just providing an excuse for any readers out there who saw the pinball premise and weren’t sold on it. 

With that said, at any given point in the game I was able to go to at least three different areas to explore, and even when you achieve the game’s normal ending you’re potentially only halfway done with its content. Like any good Metroidvania (some say it’s a requirement for the genre), there are power-ups to find that open up new areas and chipping away at the world map is just as fun as it always is. Essential power-ups are found in the main story path which are marked on the map for you, but as I said you usually have  a choice on which one you want to go first – or you can go a completely different direction and find a new objective. Most of the optional exploration rewards center around making it easier to find other rewards, unlocking the game’s other ending, and getting more currency. 

The currency is an important part of what keeps the game engaging. Your typical pinball game is entirely a score chasing affair – the object is to keep the ball aloft as long as possible while aiming for specific objectives until you’ve got the highest score on that particular cabinet. [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i] plays into that by requiring you to spend your “points” (represented by fruit) in order to unlock shortcuts or new pathways forward, meaning that you can’t simply treat each pinball section like a mere obstacle in your path. It also makes the endless loop of failure more palatable, because inevitably the longer you’re in a pinball room, the more fruit you make. They do have a cap on the amount of fruit you can carry, which can be increased, but it prevents you from making the fruit irrelevant too easily. It’s an ingenious reward system, though it didn’t keep me from getting a little annoyed from time to time when I failed to make a shot five times in a row. 

What I really find ingenious though is how the game adds tension to what is otherwise a casual punishment for falling into a pit. Normally when you fail to launch the ball again, you fall into some thorns and lose one or two fruit, which is nothing compared to losing a real-life quarter or token like you would normally in the origin genre. But the game teases with some cut scenes that there’s something more for players who don’t fall too often, which put me on my toes for a pretty long time. I mean, I didn’t get anywhere close to accomplishing something with that, but it does give players something to strive for on a second play through if they feel so inclined. 
 
Other than that the general story of the game is pretty generic. I like how it starts, and I like the general flow, but the normal ending just kind of fell flat for me. Besides being gorgeously hand painted, the characters are mostly forgettable and some of the game’s events have little to no buildup. However, the story really doesn’t matter that much. Where [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i] wins points with its theming is in the atmosphere. 

If you’re looking for a mostly relaxing experience that also offers something completely different, [i]Yoku’s Island Express[/i] is pretty much the game of the year. By no means is it the best Metroidvania game, but it’s certainly the best Pinball Metroidvania game you’re going to find currently, and probably ever will find, at least until [i]Yoku’s Island Express 2[/i] comes out. 

4 out of 5




After playing Yoku, I really want to see a Golf Metroidvania now...

author: {'steamid': '76561198016542807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1640985865}
review: So not being 100% into pinball, I kind of enjoy the Metroidvania, etc. I have to say that this game was fun and kept me wanting to come back. It's a nice relaxing game, which is nice change of pace. It's one of those games that are not really challenging, but fun to play. I beat the game around 80% complete and I'm currently at 95%. It would be nice if the game had different challenges for an end game (or even let the players create challenges), but still a fun game. Thank you for a fun and unique experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987658658', 'num_games_owned': 1431, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1546208577}
review:
En général, l'être humain n'aime pas les mélanges farfelus , quoique si, des fois, y en a qui adorent expérimenter, ça permet à ceux qui n'ont pas le courage, de voir ce que ça donne et puis de plonger ensuite.  

Et là, c'est le truc le plus loufoque que j'ai pu voir depuis des années, alors, c'est pas tant par le monde que par son gameplay qui mélange deux trucs qui ne devraient pas être ensemble : un monde ouvert et...un ....flipper......

Non mais, ne partez pas, c'est cool en fait, je vous assure, laissez-moi vous expliquer. Vous contrôlez un petit cafard qui prend la suite d'un postier cigogne qui faisait pas bien son boulot. Vous voilà dans un monde coloré, plein de vie, avec une musique entraînante.

La particularité du jeu étant que votre cafard se balade avec une boule, ne peut pas sauter et est assez lent. Comment fait-il pour se déplacer dans le vaste monde qui reprend les codes du metroidvania? Hé bien en se mettant sur des plateformes qui le font sauter dans une direction ou l'autre avec sa boule. Des fois même, le cafard se retrouve coincé dans un ensemble d'obstacles qui ressemble à un flipper, il y a même deux flipper qui sont placés en bas. A vous de faire rebondir la balle sur les flippers pour résoudre "l'énigme" dudit flipper et ainsi progresser dans le jeu. Le jeu ne vous pénalisera jamais pour vos erreurs et vous offrira toujours une porte de sortie, quitte à revenir sur certains flipper si nécessaire. Il n'y a pas de défis supérieurs, hardcore ou que sais-je, c'est du pur gameplay à la cool.

Je suppose que maintenant vous avez compris la particularité, l'étrangeté du jeu qui propose un mix entre flipper et exploration. Ainsi, il faut débloquer certains objets pour débloquer de nouveaux passages et ainsi de suite, comme dans tout bon Metroid. Le monde est d'ailleurs plutôt bien branlé avec des raccourcis et autres qui permettent de se déplacer beaucoup plus vite.

La ressource principale pour débloquer des chemins, au delà des objets débloqués dans l'aventure principale, ce sont les fruits. En dépensant un certain nombre de fruits, vous pouvez débloquer des flippers qui vous emmènent sur de nouveaux chemins, les plus chers vous emmenant sur des chemins optionnels, veillez à ne pas trop dépenser, même si le jeu est très généreux en fruits.

Un mélange hasardeux mais qui se révèle au final super sympa, d'autant que le jeu s'accompagne, comme je le dis plus haut, d'une ambiance très amicale, très zen, très positive. C'est pas vraiment drôle, c'est simplement gentil. Le style graphique est lui-même très agréable avec des tons pastels du plus bel effets. La musique est dans le ton même si je la trouve un poil discrète.

Un jeu qui ne plaira pas à tout le monde, un jeu qui se révèle un poil limité sur son concept, à part le flipper, il n'y a pas grand chose de surprenant et le monde n'est pas si vaste que cela. Mais un jeu qui vous sort de votre éternelle sphère de violence et de stress que peuvent vous imposer votre expérience de Gamer, ça fait du bien. Un jeu tout mignon à faire en famille avec votre rejeton si vous en avez, d'autant qu'il est entièrement traduit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009798031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1689618812}
review:
If I were told that my favourite game to come out this year was an [b]open-world pinball metroidvania[/b] I wouldn't believe it but here we fucking are.

What a unique concept for a game, and the core concept totally works, the gameplay is actually super fun and addicting and exploration feels rewarding and interesting. The art/animation is obviously handled with a lot of care, and is stylistically very charming and cute, which the characters and dialogue compliment very well, as does the soundtrack which bops like you wouldn't believe. As per standard metroidvania there's a ton of collectables and secrets in the game which are fun to uncover, and to top it all off, there were no bugs in my playthrough and there's no loading times once you start playing, which I appreciate.

Only negatives I can think of is that It's quite short, I 100%'d this game in about 11 hours, and the story won't blow you away or anything, but it's serviceable for what it's trying to be.

Honestly the most enjoyable game i've played this year, there's so much quality on show and it's a shame that it's getting so little recognition when it's already been out for months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024878535', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1543693923}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970149845', 'num_games_owned': 3732, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1682257128}
review:
A great, charming, atmospheric pinball-inspired action platformer with puzzle elements, great variety throughout, good guidance, great progression, semi freedom. Enjoyable throughout!

+ Great gameplay
+ Charming characters
+ Great visuals
+ Great music
+ Great, mostly bright, light atmosphere
+ Great variance throughout (in gameplay mechanics, environments, characters, …)
+ Great level design
+ Good story and secondary story elements/environment
+ Decent length (4 hours main storyline, plus additional interesting sidequests)
+ Good overview map interactivity (navigation manually through map, not through route guides or other in-play icons)
+ Sometimes/In parts humorous
* Decent guidance - semi freedom in exploration/storyline route
* Pinball mechanic is the basic idea, but not [alone] dominant. A lot of other gameplay elements and control mechanisms are added.
* Fast travel routes and shortcuts unlockable for faster exploration/backtracking

I don't really have anything bad to say. Sometimes slight frustration on specific level parts and bosses, for the challenge or because of a slight lack in intuitive visibility of task at hand. Something really noteworthy though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984505368', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1536409960}
review:
I found this game enormously enjoyable- it's simply a nice place to spend a bit of time...

My only criticisms would be 

1 - for a pinball game, travelling around the map can be slow and boring at times - more "pinball" action/movement would have been nice

2 - you can complete the main story in about 8 hours but finding all the secrets/collectibles will take WAY longer and they do feel a bit 'tacked on to make the game longer' at times - I doubt I'll bother with all of those...

Don't let those deter you tho - try the demo at the very least, not enough games focus on being 'enjoyable' these days - too much 'punishing difficulty' and 'random death' for my tastes - none of that here!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003973336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1598729446}
review: as a kid I always loved pinball games. not the real ones that steal all your quarters; the computerized ones. I played some Epic Megagames pinball game, and the Windows space-themed one, of course, and some other more-complex sci-fi pinball game I don't remember the name of, where you'd move from "table" to "table", mining resources, and eventually launching a rocket ship. oh: and even Sonic Spinball was fun! it's a pretty-niche genre, and I understand why there aren't more good pinball games, but whoa! Yoku's Island Express is so good! a wonderful fusion of pinball and metroidvania platformer. it's great when a game experiments with whacky combinations (Crypt of the Necrodancer also comes to mind), and even better when it's done so well! Yoku's Island Express has a wonderful world filled with secrets, fun challenges, beautiful graphics, delightfully-bizarre characters and situations... I never would have thought that being a dung beetle could be so much fun! :P

author: {'steamid': '76561197970734581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1535901446}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080610165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1607464483}
review: Es un juego divertidísimo y muy animado, mezcla el pinball y el plataformeo de una manera muy original y fluida, además hay más contenido del que parece y es muy fácil echarle unas cuantas horas para conseguirlo todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032934146', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1534973000}
review:
Disclaimer: After 100%-ing pirated copy I've bought this game at full price of 20 €.


In vacuum this game ranges from 6-8 / 10, depending on the mood.

However, in today's game "meta" this is a masterpiece. I believe it's because of 1 simple reason, it delivers on everything it promises.

This game is basically a collect-a-ton with some metroidvania aspects added in and, of course, pinball areas. The amazing thing is that the game never tries to be more than it is. There is no [i] GRAND SCHEME [/i] or [i] SUPER SECRET [/i] or [i] DEEPER MEANING [/i] that many devs just love adding in for no reason at all. It has a start point and a clear end point. That's it. It's easy to be [b] DONE [/b] with the game. And this is so sorely missing from many games (even movies, TV shows and books) these days.

Also the game is much more Zen because it has an ending and is fairly laid back. You look at your typical "Zen" game and see a bajilion stages or no ending at all, which quickly makes you more nervous and constantly thinking: "how am I going to beat this?".

I really enjoyed finishing this game, I haven't had that feeling in a long time. I hope devs don't make a sequel of this, but instead focus on doing what they did here: simple, yet finished concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013391340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1529982704}
review: Great take on the metrovania genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003369165', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1535555176}
review:
One of a kind experience. 
Even though the it`s pretty short in terms of different mechanics, map size and bosses, it's still fun, well made game. Hoping for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994010230', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1535449048}
review: It's pinball. With movement abilities, collectables, and aggressively cute characters. I'm pretty sure you know if you're gonna like this by how excited reading that statement is. There are a few segments where timing can be a pain, some (mostly optional) challenges that take too long to attempt again, and depending on how much you care to explore it could be a bit of a short romp; but at the end of the day it's a unique take on platforming/Metroidvania that's hard to stay mad at. This is for all those who enjoy unique movement mechanics, folks into annoyingly adorable dung beetles, and all 12 other people who loved Sonic Spinball

author: {'steamid': '76561198071532103', 'num_games_owned': 1999, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1535442395}
review: Charming, relaxing, and just an all-around pleasant adventure. The novel blend of pinball mechanics with traditional puzzle-platforming is delightfully refreshing, and I really appreciate the forgiving nature of the pinball itself (I'm not particularly great at those flippin' flippers!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960404707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1663602939}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986041864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1534963768}
review:
Отличный платформер с элементами пинбола.
Хороший сюжет с почти неожиданным поворотом.
Не безпроблемные, но выполняемые ачивки.

Из минусов:
Управление - мышь не поддерживается и геймпад Logitech не получилось эмулировать.

Хорошая расслабляющая, в моём случае, игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277504441', 'num_games_owned': 1041, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1534710238}
review: Improbable yet superbe cross over between classic metroidvania and ... pinball. Adorable hand-drawned style graphics allied to a smart level design connecting all those flippers in an incredible world. Tones and platforming, side contents and boss fight to keep you going for up to 10 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011807830', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1534764095}
review:
Cute graphics, gorgeous music, but let down by massive amounts of time wasting for very little gain.

Half the game-time was retreading old ground and recovering from mistakes. The fast-travel mechanic is under-developed and poorly integrated, often forcing players to either outright ignore the beeline or spend five to fifteen minutes trekking to one of the few access points. It's very rare there's an access point right where you are or where you want to be.

[spoiler]Swimming is tediously slow. Imagine my surprise when I found you could unlock faster swimming at the end of the ame. Why couldn't this have been the default speed? Why did we have to waste so much time staring at bleak caverns surrounded by inky blackness?[/spoiler]

Interactions have a small chance of messing up. Grapple points and exploding slugs can sometime ignore how close Yoku is until it either passes them by or the slug detonates. Kickback saved me all of two times. Every other time, I clipped through him and into the thorns.

Yoku also has a habit of getting stuck between bumpers for a long while, sometimes for nearly a whole minute. That might not sound like much, but that's several instances of sitting there, waiting to actually play the game.

As I said, the music is beautiful, but sometimes it completely misses the mark. The temple is a slog if you're not in the right mood for it, and the dull tones aren't saving you from boredom. [spoiler]And the final boss is peppy jazz. Yes, he played a tuba, I get that. This doesn't feel like a confrontation, though. It feels like a Sunday luncheon.[/spoiler]

Some secrets and solutions are asinine. [spoiler]A couple require leaps of faith where you have no control over Yoku, potentially sentencing yourself to fifteen minutes of backtracking. One secret in particular can only be found by smashing the skull of a dead NPC, with no visual cues outside of a misplaced marker on your map if you have the secret finding item.[/spoiler]

I'm so disappointed. I really wanted to enjoy Yoku's Island Express. It's obviously had a lot of love poured into it, just let down by a lack of forethought and polish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975115824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1538326282}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044422041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1534676341}
review: Очень рекомендую данную игру к приобретению и прохождению! Красивая картинка, занятные квесты, увлекательный пинбол!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973318187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1973, 'last_played': 1534659268}
review: YIE is a fun, cute, pinball/metroidvania hybrid.  The concept doesn't seem like it should work, but it DO.  Highly recommended if you dig either of those genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960429394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1544827477}
review:
Pinballvania? I suppose so.  A lovely little game however you label it. Fun gameplay, delighful art style, top notch sound and music. No rose without thorns, though. I had a lot of crashes (no progress lost thanks to how frequently the game saves), hopefully a patch will fix those before too long. The story campaign feels rather short, but there's stuff to do after you finish it. Some of the optional goals fall on the wrong side of frustrating, however, due to how long it takes to reset for another attempt. 

I bought this on sale, and I do feel I got my moneys worth. Not sure if I'd feel the same had I paid full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971580820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1534687394}
review: One of the best Metroidvanias in my recent memory. Yoku's Island Express simultaneously grasps the perfect balance of exploration, growing abilities, and increasing player skill while also demonstrating that this formula doesn't only apply to platformers and top-down action-adventures. It's well-crafted, fun, and adorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003959361', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1567340282}
review:
Obra de arte gráfica e sonora, indispensável pra quem curte pinball e plataforma =D

Única falha é não ter legenda em PT. Para jogos que só contam com textos para traduzir, chega ser inacreditável que os devs não façam questão de colocar o máximo de línguas possíveis. Certeza que tem muita gente que traduziria de graça na maior boa vontade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093726039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1534511844}
review:
앞서 다른 분들이 말했듯 핀볼+메트로베니아. 단, 핀볼이라고 하지만 누르는 길이에 따라 플리퍼 쎄기가 달라지지 않기 때문에 모든 것이 정해진대로 움직인다고 보는게 편하다. 로드란 개념이 없을 정도로 난이도는 그리 높지 않다. 

참신하긴 하지만 그래도 인디구나란 생각이 들게 만드는 제품. 


장점
- 장르의 참신함. 
- 인디인데 크게 거슬리지 않는 그래픽. 
- 수집요소들의 인게임 힌트가 충분 
- 핀볼임에도 랜덤성이 거의 없다시피해 운 때문에 쓸데없이 뺑뺑이 도는 일은 없음. 
- 한국어 지원. 

단점
- 앞서 말했듯 플리퍼 쌔기가 조작에 따라 달라지지 않기 때문에 핀볼보다는 정해진 타이밍에 눌러야 하는 리듬게임 비슷한 느낌이 들 정도. 
- 스토리는 짧으며 10시간이면 모든 업적을 다 끝낼 수 있다. 
- 자동이동은 거점이동 비스무레한 것이 있으나 제한적이고 그래도 움직이기 귀찮음. 
- 키보드로 할 경우 화살표로 이동+엔터+양쪽 쉬프트인데 키 바인딩 불가. 따라서 화살표랑 오른쪽 쉬프트를 같이 누르기 불편하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999408603', 'num_games_owned': 1719, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1542870781}
review: There is currently a bug that prevents some players from progressing further in the game, making your progress so far useless and forcing a new save to be able to overcome it. In my case after 5 hours of gameplay. The game is great, but this bug (bridge fixed but falling through it) is very frustating and it hasn't been corrected after more than two months of being reported.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001505748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1534022168}
review:
Great fun, all the way through. Most of the challenge comes from the mini pinball areas that crop up every so often, some of these are trickier than others. But most of these shouldn't take more than a few minutes to master.

Took me about 6 hours to complete the main story, but there are lots of areas and secrets on the island i haven't found yet.

I'll probably replay it from the start at some point in the future, it's a relaxing, generous, fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979913829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1534013302}
review:
По какому-то наитию купил эту игру, и был сильно и приятно удивлен.
Органичная смесь метроидвании и пинбола захватила так сильно, что отдышаться я смог только когда прошел ее до конца. 
Красивая музыка, огромный тропический остров для исследования, битком забитый секретами, радующая глаз графика, интересный фентезийный мирок с милыми и интересными персонажами - все это ставит игру на одну ступень с такими шедеврами, как Ori and the Blind Forest.
Рекомендуется к покупке любителям метроидваний и милоты.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021069616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1532619654}
review: Excellent pinball game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085463365', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1533572461}
review:
游戏风格类似Ori，不过没有跳跃要素(主角不能跳)只能左右移动，亮点是能用按键操作地图上的蓝黄色弹板弹射主角身上的球来四处移动
地图半开放式，随着能力的解锁可以回去以前的地点获取收集要素，一些机关谜底的破解以及BOSS战也让人眼前一亮，音乐大好评
主线流程我通关用了8小时，全收集+支线估计要15小时左右吧，总体上来讲非常值得一试

author: {'steamid': '76561197971921121', 'num_games_owned': 2009, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2293, 'last_played': 1563998682}
review: This game is great!  Lighthearted and fun, but challenging. As an added bonus, my kids would barely let me put it down, so it's one of the quickest metroidy adventure games I've ever beaten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019193133', 'num_games_owned': 1089, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1533474949}
review:
[h1]Доброго времени суток! [/h1]

[quote] 📌 Если вы сочтете обзор достойным, то еще больше обзоров такого уровня или лучше вы можете найти [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/YMIReS]Подписавшись на Группу[/url] и [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31787316/]Куратора[/url]. Приятного ознакомления! 📌[/quote]

🖍 Когда сталкиваешься с чем-то новым, всегда работает при восприятии на первых порах визуальный ряд, все мы в большинстве визуалы. Игра привлекает к себе внимание сразу картинкой. Рассказывая друзьям об игре, все, как один говорят – интересная игра. Спрашиваю: “Почему?”. Отвечают: “Красивая графика, все такое сочное, яркое, много движения. Есть харизма!”. 

🖍 Замечу, что плюсы у данной игры, созданной шведской студией Villa Gorilla, на этом не заканчиваются. В процессе моего повествования у вас будет шанс убедиться в этом, но я хочу подметить только одну особенность в моем вступлении – есть игры, способные отключить вас от реальности и восхитить с первых секунд. История о Йоку именно такая. Причем данная игра подходит для всех возрастов, что немаловажно в нашем мире, в мире где много вещей, зачастую не полезные и местами не нужные, поэтому не все игры можно рекомендовать, а эту можно, смело!

[h1]СЮЖЕТ[/h1]

🖍 На первых порах все кажется безоблачным, и вы, расслабленный такой, приплываете трудиться почтальоном, но вскоре понимаете, что предстоит много трудиться, как помогая окружающим, так участвуя в процессах, которые до поры до времени объяснить не сможете. Со временем вы будете погружены в увлекательную историю, которая началась еще до вашего появления, имеет глубокие корни и интригующую основу.

🖍 Вариативность процессов просто зашкаливает в данной игре, а если сказать прямо, то вы можете проходить её не линейно, разными способами. Подмечу, что после завершения основного сюжета, у вас будет пройдено только 50% игры! Вы можете себе представить, сколько всего разработчик воссоздал в этом мире, чтобы вам было не скучно? Тонкая и превосходная работа.

🖍 На протяжении всей игры вас не будет покидать ощущение масштаба сюжетной линии, ее качество и насыщенность событийного ряда. Я лично, в конце уже слегка утомился от событий и витиеватости, но закончив, стало обидно, что история больше не продолжится. Все. Занавес!


[h1]ИГРОВОЙ ПРОЦЕСС[/h1]

🖍 [b]Yoku's Island Express[/b] – это игра, которая вобрала в себя сразу несколько жанров, причем она от этого только выиграла, качественно. Например, это, по сути, приключение и ролевая игра отчасти, но на платформе пинбола. Здесь глубокий сюжет, но аркадность делает все каким-то легким, воздушным, я бы так выразился. И все из-за того, что вы большую часть времени будете в полете. Поэтому играть вам будет комфортно, если вы сторонник таких жанров. Сам процесс также улучшает моторику рук, я на своей «шкуре» это ощутил, после 6 часов к ряду, проведенных в игре.

🖍 Процесс сам по себе яркий, насыщенный, зачастую вы не заметите, куда и как вы летите, все в движении, все искрится и кругом феерия. Наслаждение для глаз, да и только. Кругом тропический рай, множество сочных фруктов, изобилие корешков и мелких деталей, которые почти всегда активны для вас. Да! Не стоит забывать о том, что ваше окружение для вас будет до конца загадкой, несмотря на успехи в освоении местности. Так, например, я не сразу понял, что коренья можно собирать и они активизируют посохи, а те в свою очередь защитный механизм. С одной стороны можно воспринять это, как недостаток, но с другой: вам предоставили мир в том виде, в котором он задуман. Вы -  исследователь, первооткрыватель, а отсюда следует, что недостаток становится хорошим подспорьем для восхищения.

🖍 Из особенностей игрового процесса стоит упомянуть еще о наличии Боссов. Их тут три, причем сложный, как мне показался, только самый первый. Второй не так прост из-за специфики подлета, а третий был крайне легкий. Самое приятно то, что никто вам не подсказывает, но и не давит. У вас нет ограничения по времени, чтобы убить Босса, но как это делается, вы должны смекнуть сами. Я говорю о том, что жанр головоломки тут явно проглядывается, хоть в легкий очертаниях.

🖍 В Yoku's Island Express есть все, что можно только придумать для такого формата игры. Помимо битв с боссами вам предстоит использовать  специальные приспособления, летать, плавать под водой, цепляться за деревья, подобно Тарзану, и главное -  у вас будет дуделка, которая, как я думаю, является самой фановой вещью во всей игре. Я минут 5 смеялся, когда она попала в руки моему персонажу. Детство из взрослого человека не выбить!

[h1]ГРАФИЧЕСКАЯ СОСТАВЛЯЮЩАЯ[/h1]

🖍 Зачем говорить долго о чем-то, если можно посмотреть. Я прикладываю для вас видео, чтобы вы могли насладиться игровым процессом, а также оценить визуальную составляющую.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1466698141
🖍 Также стоит заметить, что графика сделана на 100% от того, что требуется для такой игры. Анализируя ее, я пришел к выводу, что мельчайших деталей здесь столько, что все ваше окружение превращается в превосходную арт-коллекцию. Любого персонажа, любую финтифлюшку, найденную в игре, вы можете считать уникальным творением, т.к. во всем этом живет оригинальность, идея и душа. Попадая в мир игры, все кругом на экране у вас оживает. Все таит в себе изюминку или опасность. Поэтому работу аниматоров и художников я оцениваю, как идеальную. Иначе и быть не может.


[h1]ЗВУКОВОЕ И МУЗЫКАЛЬНОЕ НАПОЛНЕНИЕ[/h1]

🖍 Музыка, выполняющая роль фона и создателя атмосферы, здесь также на запредельном уровне. От локации к локации она изменчива. От скромного звучания до рьяного раздрая при встречи с Боссом. Это создает непревзойденную композицию между сюжетом, графикой и музыкой. Запоминающиеся мелодии здесь отсутствуют - они скорее нейтральные. Но вы знаете, иногда, когда музыка подобрана плохо, то она портит ощущение от игры. Здесь такого нет.

🖍 Звуки есть даже у второстепенных героев, которые не разговаривают. Подойдя, взаимодействуя с ними, герои могут бурчать, пыхтеть.  А заросли в тропиках, джунглях издают шелест под воздействием ветра. Все это заставляет наслаждаться озвучиванием игры. Представляете, какой уровень работы?!


[h1]ЛОКАЛИЗАЦИЯ[/h1]

🖍 В русской локализации я обратил внимание, что местами проскальзывают чисто наши выражения, это говорит о том, что над ней работали мастера, носители языка. Читать текст комфортно, он несет в себе, как явный контекст, так и скрытый, например, от цвета текста зависит значимость предмета, его посыл. Общение голосом в игре заменено на «тарабарский» язык, мычание с различной окраской. 
В общем, приятное впечатление складывается от уровня русского языка и его колоритности.

[h1]ПОСЛЕСЛОВИЕ[/h1]

🖍 В заключении, хочется еще раз подчеркнуть, что игра такого уровня должна быть замечена во всех возрастных категориях, т.к. в ней есть верный посыл. Добро побеждает зло, а чтобы его победить – надо много трудиться и стремиться к цели. Также есть и иносказательные вещи, что импонирует. Здесь нет хаоса и ужаса, нет разрушения личностного и потребительства. Есть созидательное начало у игры.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1466674977
🖍 Я бы порекомендовал к покупке данное творение (шедевр), если вы в поиске качественной игры. Гарантированно вы на 10 часов будете клацать по кнопкам, как ошалевший и наслаждаться процессом.  

[quote= YroMIR ReviewS] Сюжет игры – 8 из 10 
Игровой процесс –  9 из 10 
Графика – 10 из 10
Звук и музыка – 7 из 10 
Локализация  – 8 из 10
Суммарная оценка  -  8,4 балла.
[/quote]

[quote] 📌 Если вы дочитали обзор до конца, остались довольны моим трудом, то не соблаговолите ли вы поставить лайк? Палец вверх побуждает творить еще ярче и вознаграждает скромного писателя. Спасибо! 📌[/quote]

[h1]Спасибо за прочтение![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994927286', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1533467412}
review:
I won this Team17 - Game via a Gleam-Competition / Giveaway.

The game has really nice "cartoonish" graphic's and is a mix out of a platformer- & pinball-game, where you have to do certain tasks and solve little puzzles as well.

It has kind of an actual story, in a sense that your tasks lead you via several side-quests to a higher goal, as far I can tell yet.

I really love the game, because it looks really good and the little puzzles and quests are interesting and make you want to keep on playing or come back for more.

My first thought was, that my wife would possibly love it as well and after she had a short look at it, while I was playing it, she said that it looks alright and I will most likely buy her a copy as well, if she thinks, that she has time to play it beside D3:RoS.

So all in all I highly recommend this game to everyone, who likes that kind of games, because it's really fun to play and in my eye's well worth the money they ask for.

Good work "Villa Gorilla / Team17" !

I'm looking forward to see more from you guy's ! 

:)
