author: {'steamid': '76561198065552926', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1528006346}
review:
STEAM上第一次为游戏打出评价。因为我觉得这游戏的制作精良程度和受到的关注真的严重不匹配。
恶魔城的探索解密+奥日的清新画风+动听的音乐+动作混合弹珠的新奇玩法
这是每一个动作解密游戏爱好者都不应该错过的佳作！
IGN给了本作8分，个人认为，如果你能适应弹珠的玩法，这游戏完全可以打到9分！
希望有更多的人了解喜欢并购买这个游戏，这样游戏的游戏，这样用心的开发，真的希望开发小组有一个合理的市场回报。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026285018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1527987429}
review:
What a fantastic game both in concept and execution.  A pinballvania, open world metroidvania game based around pinball.   The game world is quite large, visually stunning, and runs super smooth with zero loading screens.  Exploring the massive world is an absolute joy, and there are tons of optional side quests and collectables to be found through secrets and puzzles.  The game never really gets that difficult considering you can't die, the main penalty is a loss of fruit which is the game currency used for unlocking paths to new areas mostly.  I was able to clear the main story in about 6-7 hours, but only with a completion score of 57%, but signs of a true ending remain that will require quite a bit more time.

This game is a sleeper hit and really deserves a lot more attention.  It's worth picking up if you like metroidvanias or open-world exploration type games.  It's not the hardest game out there, but it sure is fun as hell exploring the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258157693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1528533746}
review:
優しい世界観を感じるピンボール2Dアクション
主人公は白い玉に付いてる虫君です。

左右移動はできますが、上下移動はすべてフリッパーを操作して行います。
（黄フリッパーはRT、青フリッパーはLT)
フリッパーのどの位置で弾けばどれくらいの角度で飛ぶのかを把握できれば
難しいことはないと思います。

ストーリークリアは7時間程度で完
取りそこねアイテムのコンプもマップ表示してくれるアイテムがあるので難しくはないのでは。

メトロイドヴァニアっぽいアイテム取得による進行要素、
ファストトラベル要素あり。

特に死亡やゲームオーバーになる要素はありませんでしたが、
ピンボールマップの落球（トゲトゲに当たる）数は数えられて何か進展している様でした。

音楽は陽気な感じでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993249476', 'num_games_owned': 2498, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1528585549}
review:
I play a fair amount of pinball (mostly PC versions like Pinball FX3), and this is probably the highest-quality "pinball crossed with something else" game I've ever played. They've done a great job of making it feel right and including various pinball mechanics (spinners, roll-overs, etc.) in interesting ways.

The overall style is charming, with nice graphics and animations, and a great soundtrack. It's pretty reminiscent of the recent Rayman games.

Highly recommended, especially at a base price of only $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224284268', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1528977124}
review:
圣甲虫是41个吗？是我眼瞎吗？为什么接不了成就，就差着一个成就了


被画面吸引买了，以为啊弹珠游戏能有多好玩，泪银河战士恶魔城的弹珠游戏更是新鲜
但一玩起来根本停不下来，画面太美了，上一次被美到是奥日与黑暗森林
弹珠关卡意外的有意思，很好玩，地图很大，风格各异，各种收集品也是有意义的，比如可以解锁隐藏结局，差俩成就就圆满了，强烈推荐

review:
[h1][code][list][*] 本测评来自 [b]BABA 新游体验组 [/b]，感谢组长及各位组员的努力。[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/babagame ] 鉴赏家地址 [/url]
[*] 由于格式限制，此处为摘要版，欢迎大家前往 [url=http://www.babagame.vip/archives/6761][/url] 查看本游戏的完整测评（附玩家视频）。
[*] 感谢 [b]BABAGAME[/b] 免费提供的游戏，领取地址：
http://www.babagame.vip[/list][/code][/h1]
不得不说《Yoku's Island Express》是一款难得的佳作，清新亮丽的卡通画面宛如画卷似乎每一刻的画面都可以用来当壁纸，音乐并没太引起我的注意，不过换个角度说，这不正是说明游戏的音乐与游戏融洽结合的体现吗。通过不同时机按弹板来到达不同的位置，行云流水般的弹射过程又像一场动感十足的旅行，每一次弹射都让玩家有种期待，如果说弹珠游戏是运气与技术相结合的一种博弈，那么这款游戏就是把这种博弈变成了一场引人入胜的童话，再加上游戏中的非线性设定，各种奇怪的道具，足以让我在这个热带小岛上驻足一段时间了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198025231715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1530930214}
review: Pinball 爱好者不可错过的好游戏！画面非常漂亮，有Ori的风格。弹珠关卡丰富多样，手感很好。地图很大。感觉有点太大了，呵呵。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993679603', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1528039689}
review:
The game is not perfect. It has some slow backtracking and pinball parts can be annoying when you need to get your show amazingly precise. But those things are minor and they don't ruin the enjoyment of the game itself.
Its' style is amazing, its combination of pinball and metroidvania is brilliant, story and characters are fun and in general I've had a lot of fun.

Definitely recommend, especially at this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026431573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1527796013}
review: 我懂了……这个游戏就是在告诉我，手残连弹珠台都没资格玩……

author: {'steamid': '76561198152097673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1612217093}
review:
百度 优库的小岛速递吧 QQ群：243319138 用于玩家们全收集攻略和讨论游戏

目前游戏发售第二天，现在看评论的话我大概是肝的最厉害的了
这个游戏想通关很简单，混就完了，不像ori那么硬核，反而这个游戏非常休闲
（我推荐妹子们来尝试）
即使你不能准确的弹到你想要的位置，但是因为死亡成本极低，简单的概率学就过了

但是如果你想全收集就很难，一部分收集要素是限时关卡，这就要求你一次性通过
这游戏的全收集我感觉是比ori还要困难和繁琐的，可能和空洞骑士的全收集差不多？

游戏性非常好，有些蛮合情合理的，这游戏里拿到颜料可以改变球的颜色，甚至能影响剧情发展，实在是厉害辣！

游戏70元，我觉得是完全值这个价格的，如果喜欢这类画风和休闲类的玩法，我觉得是值得入手的

追加：第三天，98%通关，柳条全了，差了甲壳虫的成就，游戏流程不长，怎么样一周目15小时都应该全收集了，可惜前期死多了把逃犯放了，感觉不放有成就吧，在考虑要不要二周目，这游戏在休闲和硬核直接有个奇妙的平衡点……

author: {'steamid': '76561197968661571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1671362490}
review: I loved this game!! Amazing atmosphere throughout the entire game in terms of graphics, sound and gameplay. Its one of those games you need to play and will give you comfort through sickness and health :). Works surprisingly well with either keyboard or controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035338114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1528981991}
review:
很好玩！内容非常多，剧情也靠谱，值得起这个售价。画面、音乐和手感都十分不错，没有什么可挑剔的地方。
当然如果不喜欢弹球的话就不推荐了。难度不算很低，如果卡关还是会挺辛苦的。
官方中文质量一般，错误不少，有些地方会影响理解。有条件还是推荐用英语。

author: {'steamid': '76561198364336916', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 3411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1530834335}
review: I picked this up because I had never seen a game crossed with pinball and platforming, both of which I like alot! I have to say, I wasnt sure how the gameplay would work out, but I was pleasantly surprised. It feels really natural to navigate around the levels and as I said its defintely a first for this type of game. Team 17 is one of my favourite publishers going way back to the Amiga with games like ATR, Alien Breed, Assassin and Overdrive. Unless your over 30 you will propbably have no clue what those games are but they were great and even play well today. They always seem to have a level of polish associated to their games and this game is no different. Its platforming/pinball/metroidvania all of which I love and the graphics are super cute. I got it for £11 from greenman gaming which is what tipped me over into buying and not waiting for a sale. Glad I did!
developer_response: Thanks for remembering the Amiga days. That's always nice to see. Really glad you're enjoying Yoku!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045996899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1528114531}
review:
A game by Villa Gorilla :)
Je ne ferais pas mieux que mon voisin Alhysea, j'ai un paquet de jeu indé dans ma biblio et clui ci est un énorme coup de coeur.
Il m'arrive même de chanter la musique du jeu à ma femme parce qu'elle reste dans ma tête ^^
En toute honnêteté, c'est un gros vent de fraicheur, j'avais pas jouer a du flipper depuis des années et le mix avec le metroidvania est super bien amener, je ne m'ennuie pas du tout. J'ai clairement pas fini le jeu après 1 heure de jeu mais je voulais encourager les développeurs.
Je vois peu d'éval, pourtant le jeu mérite son prix. 
On a un des hits indés de l'année ici, je ne veux pas qu'il tombe dans l'oubli parce que Steam publie d'autres jeux bien moins intéressants qui se vendent a tour de bras.
Achetez le.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996715488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1555883685}
review:
An amazing pinball adventure. From the get-go this game makes an amazing design decision and makes smart rail segments. Sections with bumpers for transition or long paths guide your ball instead of just running on a physics engine and screwing you over. Also, there is no cheap deaths down the center or side in this game. There's no death at all except inconvenience or small money penalties.

Pros:
Great game design
Fun and  family friendly atmosphere and characters
Well placed collectables (with treasures that help find them all)
Good pacing

Cons:
Honestly none. I enjoyed this game through and through. Any game can be better, but it's not often they can only work to make their goods great instead of fixing their issues.

A+, in my games of the year list

author: {'steamid': '76561198079335824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1528202295}
review:
[h1]Yoku's Island Express[/h1]

[i]This is an AWESOMELY CUTE and very well designed PINBALL adventure game. Its very relaxing, pretty easy, but can get a bit challenging at times if your not very good at pinball like me. The controls work very well, I have had no issues at all with controls using Xbox 360 controller.  [/i]

[i] If you love PINBALL you will certainly enjoy maybe even love this game to, BUT dont expect leaderboards, because there are none. This game will be very easy for a pinball pro and they can easily finish the game in well under 10 hours Im sure. BUT I will take my time, and just enjoy the game, and all the art and scenery which is very well made and full of lovely surprises, and just enjoy playing this FUN PINBALL adventure. [/i]

[i] This game does NOT disapoint, and depending on the player they can play for as long as they like, or take thier time. Im not even finsihed the game yet, but Im close to half way at time of writing this review. Still continuing and enjoying my time with the game, might even start a new game when Im finished! [/i]

[b] The Team at Villa Gorilla, did a fantastic job bringing Yoku's adventure to life, all the mechanics of pinball work very well in my humble opinion, LOVE the art its just amazing. Villa Gorilla, I do hope you make a sequel and continue to develop more games like this 1. Also it would be great if you could also some how incorperate scoring and leader boards, I think it could be done. It's your game and your decision. Thank you for a truely wonderful game. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198098353911', 'num_games_owned': 9971, 'num_reviews': 895, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1557659793}
review:
[i] 感谢[url=steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly] 17173萤火虫	[/url]  提供的游戏	[/i]

[h1] 【游戏简介】	[/h1]
《尤库的小岛速递》是一款非线性平台弹珠冒险解谜游戏，故事发生在美丽的Mokumana岛上，小瓢虫Yoku成为新的邮政局长，将要接管岛上的大大小小的快递工作，帮助当地居民排忧解难，了解当地过去经历，唤醒古代神明，探索神秘的Mokumana岛屿，解开背后隐藏的秘密。
[b] 关键词：弹珠，冒险	[/b]

[h1] 【游玩体验】	[/h1]
[h1] 1.弹珠	[/h1]
该游戏结合了三维弹球的玩法，无论是剧情流程还是探索解谜，几乎所有的操作都离不开弹珠模式。
[h1] ①剧情	[/h1]
游戏内包含大量有趣的任务，因为操作非常自由，所以玩家不必拘束任务完成的先后顺序。通过完成各式各样的任务来推动剧情的发展，特别的是，任务没有采用一项一项罗列出来，而只是在地图上简单的标记出来大概内容以及方位，玩家浏览起来不仅方便，还十分形象。
[h1] ②探索	[/h1]
游戏的探索过程十分有趣，不仅结合了传统平台类游戏玩法，比如奥日与黑暗森林，索尼克大冒险等，更新颖的是它还加入了三维弹球的游戏玩法，这种经典与经典突兀的碰撞不仅表现得自然得体，还使得原本很普通的游戏玩法一下子变得与众不同起来。游戏主要货币是水果，在弹珠模式下能获得大量水果奖励，这种感觉就像玩老虎机一样。通过收集足够多的水果可以解锁更多机关区域，还能在商店购买道具，钱包等实用的道具。
[h1] 2.冒险	[/h1]
在完成快递工作的同时也要努力探索整个岛屿，发现更多的秘密，不断提高自己的能力。
[h1] ①地图	[/h1]
Mokumana岛屿非常庞大，比如热带海滩，茂密丛林，洞穴神殿，荒土地带，壮丽瀑布，寂静湖畔，皑皑雪山等。画面采用手绘美术风格，每一处风景都美妙绝伦，无论是放大细看还是浏览缩小图，都那么令人陶醉，让人大饱眼福，再配合着不同场景不同风格的美妙动听的BGM，视听感受极佳，所到之处无不是一场充满惊喜的冒险旅程。另外整个地图上的各个区域之间的无缝衔接做得非常完美，丝毫感觉不到变化场景所带来的停顿感。
[h1] ②能力	[/h1]
小瓢虫Yoku推着沉重的白色小球的形象非常可爱，但因此不能跳跃，只能通过各种机关带来的辅助弹跳才能到达各个区域，前期不能探索更多的区域，随着游戏流程进展，Yoku能学到各种新的能力，像是爆炸子弹，潜水，飞舞等，当收集完全后游戏体验也会得到极大提升。

[h1] 【有话要说】	[/h1]
游戏也不是完全的操作自由，有很多地方设置有指定轨道或者弹板弹球，一旦触发相应机关便会按照设定好的路线前进，玩家在此不能进行多余的操作，虽然会限制一定的脑洞，但不得不说场景谜题，机关处理等都是经过严谨设计的，不存在敷衍，十分用心。[spoiler] 另外吹喇叭的小瓢虫萌极了！	[/spoiler]

[h1] 【总结】	[/h1]
[b] +美妙绝伦的画面表现	[/b]
[b] +如闻天籁的音乐享受	[/b]
[b]+创新十足的游戏玩法	[/b]
[b] +丰富有趣的地图探索	[/b]
[b] -重复的弹珠解谜过程	[/b]
爽快流畅的操作，美丽无瑕的小岛，轻松有趣的故事，多重经典的结合，一款特别的让人眼前一亮的平台弹珠游戏，游戏偏休闲，带给玩家纯粹的娱乐体验。

更多游戏推荐请关注[i] [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly] 17173萤火虫鉴赏家	[/url]  	[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970313861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1553765501}
review:
Un très très très gros coup de coeur pour ce jeu !!
Ce jeu est pour moi a 2 pixels de la qualité d'un Ori the blind forest.

Vous incarnez un insecte, inséparable de sa... mie de pain? et parcourez un monde peint a la main de toute beauté !
Tout y est mignon, coloré, avec quelques biomes aux rendus impécables, vraiment félicitations aux artistes pour ce boulot magnifique !

Le jeu est vraiment original, puisque or l'aspect plateforme, il propose des phases de Flipper grace a votre mie de pain qui sert de balle. Ca peut paraitre surprenant mais c'est tellement bien intégré, bien éxécuté que ca rends les niveaux beaucoups moins linéaires, plus sinueux, plus verticaux.

Tout comme metroidvania, vous débloquerez des objets capables d'avancer dans des zones inaccessibles, retounerez dans les endroits visités pour tout débloquer. La encore une fois c'est merveilleusement amené puisqu'il y a pas mal de pnj qui vous donnerons des quêtes, parlerons de secrets a découvrir et des secrets... Il y en a partout ! Si vous aimez explorer vous allez être servi.

La bande son, idem, quel régal ! Ca mélange plusieurs genre et me fait pas mal penser aux musiques de Rayman legends.

Enfin voilà, je vous incite à découvrir cette merveille sortie de nulle part, on sent vraiment que les dévelopeurs ont fait ce jeu par passion (Surtout vu rapport qualité/prix) et y ont mis tout leur coeur et ils méritent de la reconnaissance pour ce magnifique boulot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085611667', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1528057385}
review:
Dos jogos de pinball, Yoku’s Island Express utiliza as mecânicas básicas de mover uma bola pelo cenário com o uso de palhetas, enquanto se atinge alvos e coleta pontos — em formato de frutas que servem como moeda. Dos metroidvanias, Yoku’s Island Express retira um mundo cada vez mais aberto, conforme novas ferramentas permitem a exploração de novas áreas, cheias de colecionáveis e missões paralelas, tudo isso com uma narrativa central bem escrita, apesar de simples. A união das duas coisas é inesperada em seu argumento, mas ainda mais inesperado é o fato de Yoku’s Island Express ser um jogo extremamente divertido e muito bem finalizado. Primeiro porque a movimentação é fluida, apesar de ser um jogo de plataformas sem a possibilidade de saltar, e com toda a navegação realizada a partir de um bola rebatida por palhetas. Segundo porque todo o mapa do jogo foi desenhado para garantir que as diversas áreas estejam conectadas, o que causa a impressão de um mundo aberto único, capaz de ser explorado em todas as direções possíveis. Por fim porque os gráficos coloridos, a música empolgantes e as personagens caricatas ajudam na criação de um jogo acessível para todas as idades, relaxante e capaz de prender a atenção do jogador desde seus primeiros minutos. Yoku’s Island Express saiu ontem, dia 29 de maio, para computadores, PlayStation 4, Xbox One e Nintendo Switch.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Para ler a resenha completa, acesse:
https://falange.net/resenha-yokus-island-express

Não deixe de se inscrever na curadoria da Mãe:
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30269360/

author: {'steamid': '76561197970608025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1527799867}
review:
10/10! What an awesome and cute game! I really love it, as you can lay back and play casually and just enjoy the marvelous design, art and cute story it presents. Really relaxing compared to todays online competativehysteria. Great for that downtime when you just want to chill out.

You can really tell how much time and effort the Devs have put down in to the details and art.. It all looks handmade from scratch.. And don't even get me started and the music and sound, it adds so much atmosphere and coozyness you just want to go hang out on a tropical beach. Looking forward to finding the islands eastereggs too! Absolutley love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126176433', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1528376502}
review:
[h1]前言：[/h1]

《Yoku's Island Express》是一款相当有趣的休闲闯关类游戏，游戏有着温馨可爱的画风和充满热带风情的音乐。玩法采用了类似三维弹球的设计，并融入了探索收集元素，玩家将扮演神秘小岛上的新邮政局局长，在不断的探索中见识各种有趣的事物。

感谢由[url=https://up.163.com/] UP鉴游组[/url]
提供的游戏。

[h1]游戏背景：[/h1]

玩家将扮演一只来到神秘小岛任职的新邮政局局长接管这个小岛上的各种跑腿任务。虽说听上去你已经算是一个比较高级的干部了，但是我还没见过这么苦逼的邮政局局长，虽然有手下，但是跑腿全是玩家在做[spoiler] （难怪上一代邮政局局长会辞职Σ(⊙▽⊙"a ）[/spoiler]

[h1]游戏画面：[/h1]

游戏有着优秀的艺术设计，配合上水彩油画般的色调给玩家一种如梦似幻的感觉，仿佛走入了一个神秘的童话世界。因为主角是一只瓢虫[spoiler] （我一开始还以为是一只红色的屎壳郎Σ( ° △ °|||)︴）[/spoiler]，所以采用了微观视角，四周的景物显得格外庞大，模糊化的背景和细腻的环境效果形成了鲜明的对比。可互动元素都通过艳丽的色彩提示了出来，让玩家能很好的知道自己需要做什么。


[h1]游戏音效：[/h1]

充满了热带风情的BGM，不由让人想到了沙滩和阳光。而《Yoku's Island Express》正是一款充满着热情和欢快的休闲游戏。倒上一杯鲜榨的冰镇果汁，拿着手柄躺在椅子上玩这款游戏相信会带给你一个清凉的夏日。

[h1]游戏机制：[/h1]

在大多数情况下玩家可以推着小球自由移动，但是在空中或者进入了环境关卡就多为弹球模式了，玩家需要操控挡板对小球进行击打，将玩家带入下一个场景或者吃到收集物品。玩家除了可以操作挡板外，游戏还加入了很多互动元素，无论是主动使用的纸哨还是可以观察周围环境的望远镜、喜闻乐见的大宝箱都为玩家增添了不少的乐趣。玩家在路途中所收集的水果相当于货币，除了可以解锁不少近路外还可以购买道具。游戏存档点为一个小小的紫色花蕾，一旦玩家经过便会自动保存，虽然不能手动存档，但是存档点还是挺多的。玩家所需要的就是不断的探索未知的领域。

[h1]关卡设计：[/h1]

除了无缝衔接的巨大地图外，相对于每一个接受的任务地点都会有一个圆圆的石环，一旦玩家选择进入，就会开启一个特殊的关卡，关卡设计的如同三维弹球那样，不过更简单更明了，玩家需要使小球触碰的机关都有着标识，你只需要不断的用挡板弹飞小球就行了。游戏一开始还算比较简单，但是到后面除了轻微的解密外就比较考验玩家对角度击球的技巧了。作为一个基本只会瞎比弹的随缘玩家还是有一定的难度的。个人比较推荐用手柄玩，因为其挡板键设计为LT和RT键，按上去很有体感。

[h1]总结：[/h1]

+优秀的艺术风格
+好听的背景音乐
+颇有创意的玩法
+官方中文
+无缝衔接的地图
-比较考验技巧，手残（我）卡关就很难受

~欢迎查看更多多彩游戏人生和UP鉴游组的精彩评测(～￣▽￣)～、
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ProjectUP

author: {'steamid': '76561198036898058', 'num_games_owned': 1853, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1591754673}
review:
Honestly one of the games I've been most excited for so far this year. 
I am terrible at pinball, but this is just pure fun. The art style is beautiful, the music is fantastic, the 'kind of linear but not really' map is great, showing you where to go, but giving you free reign as to what order you do things in (to a degree).
It is fantastic with a controller and just as good with keyboard.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198284147869', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1527858824}
review:
あとでまじめにレビューを書きたいけど、まだ1時間ちょっとしかプレイしてないけど、とにかく！とても楽しいメトロイドヴァニア＋ピンボールで、ヨク君めっちゃかわいいことを伝えたくて……さっさと好評を残しておきたかったんだ……ゴメンナサイ。おすすめ。みんな買おう。

……クリアしたので追記。落ち着いてきた。

エンディングにたどり着いて、進捗80%くらいで、都合10時間ほど遊んだ。プレイ時間の大半は探索する楽しみに費やした感じだ。ボス戦（当然ピンボールで）もいくらかあるけど……失敗してボールを失ってもペナルティはなく、うまくいくまで挑戦しつづければよいので、緊張感はあまりなかったなあ。難易度はかなり手加減していると思う。

アイテム/スキルを獲得して、探索の幅を広げていく、というメトロイドヴァニアの楽しみを期待する人にはオススメできる。最後まで楽しかった！　一方でピンボールを目当てにするとどれほどのものなのか、自分にはよくわからなかった。
あと、ヨク君は最後までかわいかったです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198831987466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1527639957}
review:
It's so refreshing to play a genuinely unique (and also fun!) game, and Yoku's is EXACTLY that.

Absolutely gorgeous visuals, everything is adorable, and the gameplay is both engaging and relaxing. Who knew we needed an open-world pinball game set on a tropical island? After playing Yoku's we realize we've needed this all along.

Video (gameplay + commentary): https://youtu.be/4Y6X-WZr9_E

author: {'steamid': '76561198028020795', 'num_games_owned': 6567, 'num_reviews': 502, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1546373630}
review:
[h1]Video review (including score):[/h1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y0RukuRhe_s
At first glance, Yoku's Island Express appears to be just a regular metroidvania. That is, until one notices that there is no jump and the playable character is a beetle rolling a ball around. This is because the game takes all of the elements from a metroidvania game (platforming, bosses, etc.) and combines it with pinball. The result is a unique, yet fun experience.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[b]Seamless pinball elements.[/b] Yoku's Island Express does an excellent job of incorporating pinball elements into a metroidvania game. The game world is explored using flippers scattered throughout, allowing the player to jump to higher areas, cross gaps, or drop down to lower areas. However, scattered throughout this same world is a number of actual pinball tables (or more like pinball walls in this game's case). Within these areas, the player is tasked with tackling more traditional pinball gameplay, hitting certain switches or breaking through different obstacles to open up previously locked areas. The game transitions between more traditional platforming and actual pinball so seamlessly that it just feels natural, despite the stark contrast between the two.

[b]Great aesthetic.[/b] This game gave me heavy Rayman vibes, particularly that of Rayman Legends. Everything from the art style, music, and even the design of the game's world just screamed Rayman to me. The aesthetic is so similar that it is almost criminal, but I am definitely not complaining, as it really does fit. The game world is full of fun, colorful creatures to talk to and the game's overall color scheme just radiates positivity. It is quite a joy to roll around and explore such a world.

[b]Fun exploration.[/b] The world of Yoku's Island Express is packed full of stuff to find. Secret rooms are waiting to be discovered, chests full of upgrades are scattered about, and there are a number of side quests to be completed as well. The game simply has so much stuff to do outside of the main story that I was only at 54% completion by the time the credits rolled. I even made an effort to find secrets and such during that playthrough. I have always appreciated games that filled their world to the brim with content like this and Yoku's Island Express goes above and beyond in that regard.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[b]Slow traveling.[/b] Traveling around the world of Yoku's Island Express can be quite annoyingly slow at times. Getting to and from on the map often requires the player to enter previously completed pinball areas and land precise shots to get back to the other side. The game does mitigate this problem a bit through its use of rail ducts (allowing some of these pinball areas to be bypassed if already completed) and its fast travel system (allowing long-distance travel at a price), but these additions only remedy the problem slightly. The rail ducts are only available at a few of the pinball areas, leaving the vast majority without. The fast travel system, while useful in the late-game, is not worth it in the early game because it costs so much fruit to use. That fruit is better spent on locked flippers, as many of them are required for the player to progress. Sure, the player can grind for more fruits at any of the pinball areas, but the idea of grinding in a pinball game does not sound appealing.

[b]Boring sidequests.[/b] I may have praised the amount of content packed into the game world, including the sidequests, but it does not help when the majority of the game's sidequests are simple fetch quests or something similar. One quest, for example, has the player taking up the role of a mailman tasked with delivering packages around the island in order to earn the title of postmaster. These quests just bore too quickly, especially considering how painful it can be to travel the map earlier in the game. Once the fast travel system is up and functional, it becomes less of a pain, but a pain regardless.

[h1]Overall:[/h1]
The unique blend of metroidvania and pinball is done excellently and with a great aesthetic to match. The world is also full of secrets to find, but is victim to a number of boring fetch quests and annoyingly slow travel times. Even so, the game is an easy recommendation. The genre combination alone makes it quite the refreshing experience.

Check out my [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/3215371/]Steam curator page[/url][/b] for more reviews and videos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028091020', 'num_games_owned': 5046, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1528146716}
review:
Yoku's Island Express is an incredibly unique and cute game that takes two very different genres and mixes them successfully.

[h1] Video Review [/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=375Ke1P3K7M

[h1] Written Review [/h1]
The game is a metroidvania that has you go back and forth throughout the vast world after you unlock new abilities.
It's also a pinball game. These two for the most part work very well together.
The way you control your character is limited to left and right walking. But you can move around indirectly as well, and that's through pinball flippers throughout the world. Pressing one button will cause all orange flippers to trigger, while the other button will trigger blue flippers. There are lots of things in the games to spice things up like multi-colored flippers, secret paths, skill jumps, abilities etc.

The pinball movement is a nice new take on movement, and gives me vibes from Sonic games. Moments where you can basically turn your brain off and enjoy the eye candy of nailing crazy jumps. That's not to say the game isn't hard, because it can be.

The challenge comes in trying to properly time when to launch yourself with flippers. Whether it's at the tip, or middle you will fly to a different spot. There will be sections throughout the world that are basically like a big pinball machine, where you will be rewarded for exploring the whole "board", as in bumping off of every bumper, checking every path. It's rewarding to find secret collectibles and collect the main pickups: fruit.

Speaking of fruit, it is your currency in the game. You collect it in multiple ways, and mainly use it to access new areas. Sometimes you will find flippers that are locked, and you can gain access to after you've paid the sum in fruit.

One problem I have with the game, is that sometimes you will not have enough fruit to unlock all new areas you come across. Even if you've been fully exploring. This then forces you to backtrack to older areas and to recollect respawned fruit that you've already gotten before. It doesn't happen constantly and it's not that annoying, but it happens enough to become a bit of an annoyance.

The dialogue is pretty funny, and the overall story was genuinely interesting. Characters are cute, and the aesthetic and music are very well done. It's just a very pleasant world to be in.

Overall, I loved the game and recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001507954', 'num_games_owned': 3199, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1527612542}
review:
[h1]Yoku's Island Express[/h1]

A provocative and thoughtful combination of well-known gaming mechanics as we all know can make for some seriously entertaining and popular new prospects, and Yoku's Island Express really takes the cake when it comes to a profound and creative hybrid of genres. 

A brave and unique potpourri of gameplay mechanics featuring the quick reflexive action of tight-knit and well designed pinball tables spread throughout an expansive and gorgeous platforming journey with the deep exploration of a Metroidvania, this is not only a long-overdue experiment of combined mechanics but a really well executed one!

It's a lighthearted tale of a chill little dung beetle on a big vacation, rolling his way through the sandy sunny dunes and jungles of a mysterious and thriving with life island. Its up to Yoku to bounce, roll, flip and shoot through this seemingly peaceful tropical wonderland filled with colorful characters and wildlife and awaken the sleeping mystery behind the Island.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Pinball and arcade mini-game fans looking for that fast and arcade-y hit; don't be put off by the Metroidvania moniker here! Though Yoku comes in an adventurous and progressive platforming journey format, it gets you into the fast-paced pinball bits right away and keeps it coming at you consistent and heavy. Likewise, Metroidvania purists who may be put off by the idea of an arcade-y smashup of genres tainting their beloved genre have nothing to worry about as all of the addictive explorative hooks and secrets are here and most importantly the transition between the two styles of play feels absolutely smooth and natural.

Not only that, my initial sneaking suspicions that the hybrid of gameplay would inevitably water-down the pinball elements were quickly laid to rest; this is really pinball, and its REALLY good pinball! Sure, the adrenaline pumping and palm-sweating endeavors of old school arcade score-chasing aren't here but that's replaced by a progressive journey and branching exploration that keeps you pushing harder and harder to see that next insane and clever pinball table setup for the next wild area of the game's overworld.

The actual progression of Yoku's Island Express is done in a very traditional Metroidvania style. A huge, sprawling world rife with shortcuts and alternate routes to discover and learn your way around with all kinds of obstacles and locked doors to figure your way through make up the slowly uncoverable map. Hundreds of colorful and delicious little collectable items litter the play-field on pinball sections, and different doors will require different amounts to proceed so Pinball Hard and Pinball Well! Different game changing upgrades and items like the party-appropriate Noisemaker will appear during the course of the story and, in true Metroidvania fashion, are the key to backtracking to previously impassable territories and break your way through using your noisy new tool.

When it all comes to together and your routes are fully explored, you're free to roam a gigantic interconnected world of lush natural landscapes and ludicrous pinball levels each with progressively more insane tricks and traps to beat and ultimately explore past. Its a ridiculously refreshing way to consume your pinball, and its superbly addictive for Metroidvania fans who need a breath of fresh air from the usual routine of stale hack'n'slash combat.

[h1]Visuals/Sound[/h1]

What an absolute treat for the eyes. A sunny, vibrant and bright tropical island setting that has you counting down the days 'till summer, a seriously nostalgic beach and jungle atmosphere that rivals the natural beauty of the level design in Donkey Kong Country or Rayman. Each screen transition in the game brings you even more mouth-watering landscapes of complex twisting, turning lush green foliage that make up the various 'tables' you bounce your way around and the overwhelming complexity of set-pieces and cute, colorful wildlife characters just gets wilder and wilder as you venture deeper.

Continuing the wonderfully nostalgic and authentic tropical trend of the game is the cheerful, outgoing island music. Steel drums and Hawaiian slack key guitar fill your ears with the relaxing sounds of beach days, and you'll swear you felt some sand get in-between your toes while playing. Rolling into more ominous and darker territories causes the background music to evolve and shift appropriately, such as underneath the surface and into the dark, dank caverns below or the winter-y mountaintops of snow. A more steady, slow trip-hop sort of a beat can be heard here and overall the shift in mood shows what an awesomely diverse soundtrack the game has. Ultimately though, yeah, you're going to be hearing a lot of pleasant traditional tropical island music.

[h1]Final Thought[/h1]

This is loose and fun pinball action that is going to put a ridiculous smile on the player's face no matter their age or skill level, from the most casual of casuals to the most hardcore and dire of pinball enthusiasts (the last of their breed that is left!). This has the free-wheeling accessibility as well as the tight and challenging shot set-ups to engage every level of play, and the Metroidvania elements turn exploration and discovery into one seriously unique pinballing journey.

[i]This review has been provided by ReviewExperts curator CueZero.
